comment: Amazing to find some Korean dishes just south of Ukrainian Village. Highly recommended, not only for their Korean dishes and traditional Chicago fare, but also for their hearty breakfasts.

This is a good spot, especially for breakfast. The restaurant was already busy when I went in there to grab something for breakfast. I knew that there would be a long wait, but it was not really that long because even though there was a line at the counter, it was moving pretty fast and the food was really quick. The restaurant is clean. They have a very nice selection on their menu. I just basically got their sandwich croissant. My friends also actually recommended this fast food restaurant and told me to get their sandwich croissant, so I did. I specifically got the bacon and egg sandwich croissant. It was reasonably priced. It tastes delicious. The croissant was very fresh; all of the ingredients were actually fresh. It is so simple, but it tastes delicious. The portions were also good. That was definitely a good sandwich. It is also a nice quick spot for breakfast. They have a wide selection on their menu that is quite interesting, so I will probably go back and try other foods on their menu. Their sandwich croissant tastes good, so I am hoping that the other foods on their menu taste good too.
The unsung hero of breakfast sandwiches. Best breakfast sandwich in the city. Family owned business with a true bang for your buck experience. Bacon egg and cheese on a croissant is the move.
Best omelette around! Great price! Hound team.
Nice clean lil place for breakfast & coffee very friendly service

Nothing super special about corcorans but it’s a solid establishment. went on a wednesday evening to grab drinks with friends. we sat out back on the large patio- the atmosphere was great. lots of picnic and high top tables to sit at and they were playing good music. there good deals on draft beers and appetizers. i had no idea that corcorans served food and it was really good!! we especially loved the soft pretzel with cheese sauce. definitely will return in the future for happy hour!

We visited Corcoran's for our anniversary dinner. My fiance got the Smithwick's red ale and the Chirish burger, which were very good. I got the Roarin' 20s Manhattan and the Blackened Atlantic salmon. The salmon and its sides were absolutely delicious! I highly recommend it. Good service too. What drew us in were the fabulous holiday decorations. Lovely! Would definitely visit again.

My favorite spot in Old Town over my 6 years living here. Best food on the menu is the pub grub (fried pickles and curds are my fav). Good beer selection. Mixed drinks are so-so, expect the seasonal cocktails are yummy. Atmosphere is everything at this local Irish pub. Always decked out for the holidays.

Been here a few times.  I was a little disappointed that they were out of Smithwicks.  I got my cheese curds as an appetizer and Shepard's Pie as the entree. As good as always.  Atmosphere is how you'd expect a local bar to be.  Friendly and cheerful.   I always enjoy it there.  You will too.

They're burgers and salads were blah to be nice, (they were pretty bad) and I specifically asked for no bbq sauce on my burger, but there was some on it, so I didn't eat all my burger. Then when I asked the waitress about it, they brought out the manager and she kept saying I'm sorry, but didn't offer a refund or another burger. Lastly, if you want a salad on the side for a burger, it costs an extra 3.50$.

Eating in Eataly is always a fun mental getaway. I cherish the authentic Italian sauces and cheeses. We tried a bit of everything and shared. Portions are perfect if you don’t share. Light and delicious. Didn’t leave me feeling excessively heavy like most competitors.

Some gluten free selections. Pizza and pasta. We took the crust off the pizza and dipped it in the olive oil at the table. Very good. Wine was excellent. Cool place lots of different food items. A must see place. Free to walk around and check it out.

Excellent food and unique drinks. Great dining experience within the Eataly Market, everything was fresh and very delicious. Not sure if it's a seasonal item but highly recommend the Fiore di Piselli (spring pea filled pasta) it's a dish I'll think about for a long time.

Was a variety of foods to try from. Service was extremely slow when we went. Took forever for our drink order and for us to order food. The food came out one by one about 15 mins in between eat. We had to share it family style so one wasn’t just watching while the other one was eating.

Service 1/5
Usually don’t rate this but it was just that bad.

Burrata and prosciutto 5/5
So good. Melts in your mouth

Toast and tomatoes 5/5
Good crunch and flavor.

Ravioli 3/5
This was okay to me. My friends enjoyed it tho.

Lasagna 5/5
Good portion and lots of meat. Super soft and delicious.

Spaghetti cacio e Pepe 2/5
It wasn’t my type of pasta. The noodles were thick and chewy but it prob is just me.

Spicy salami pizza 4/5
Very tasty pizza. Little salami pieces. The pizza was small and thin. Sauce was flavorful.

Mushroom pizza 4/5
Really good sauce flavor. Pizza was thin also and small.

Went here with someone that's from Italy, and he vouched for the authenticity. The food is good, and the staff is friendly. I like to get their pizzas here, personally like the capricciosa, but also like the cacio E pepe, the arugula salad, and the wines!

Placed a order for delivery costing $129.21. Terrible food. Their egg rolls are good. Their fried rice is great. Ordered here three times before. Ordered 2 large sweet& sour chicken and 1 large orange chicken at $11.50 each. The orange chicken has a strong taste of lemon. It taste like lemon pledge furniture polish. The sweet & sour chicken has strong taste of green pepper. Called to complain and won't take it back. Told them I can't eat it. Told we are running low on orange we might have used lemon. Just a little. Not too much. It's the same. Will not order here again. Wouldn't honor coupon on their menu flyer. Not sure if new management. The food does not taste the same anymore. Terrible Terrible. Today is September 2,2022

Japanese tofu with two mushrooms 🍄 was great 🌟 5 stars

Salt n pepper smelts and tofu also 5 stars ⭐️

Everything else was pretty mediocre 2.

Green beans a bit old and lacking in freshness

Eggplant 🍆 in garlic sauce has very little eggplant but plenty of onion fillers

The pineapple 🍍 fried rice used to be their signature but this last order was literally some old rice with veggies that didn’t blend in too well

Pepper beef 😞😞😞 most of the dish was bones which is not a bad thing if the meat is done ok. However the meat was stringy and after some chewing, it just won’t break. We dumped it.

I do want to support local business and hope they will reduce the number of dishes and cook great tasting food like they used to.
.

Placed an order online and it turned out they did not have one of the meals in my order so they refunded me for it, which of course is great, but they did not alert me to this in anyway, so when the food arrived, we were short one person’s whole order. I appreciate not charging, but they could have called to see if we wanted to order something else instead.
Totally poor customer service. First and last time ordering from this spot.
This has always been my family's favorite dinning spot in Rogers Park. I love it anytime and any day and it is a worthy shot for your dollars!

This place is very unprofessional I only asked the lady who was taking my order what vegetables are in the pad tai and she rolled her eyes at me and belittled me saying it’s vegetables I don’t know what they put . I asked her to ask the cook and she continued to rolled her eyes then turned her back at me . Saying things under her breath and I said to her I will take my money somewhere else . This place doesn’t deserve one star. Very rude and unprofessional!
Absolutely loved the food. I had oxtail for the first time and loved how flavorful and filling it was. I highly recommend that everyone stops by this place! You will not regret it!
Really good food, carry out only so far. Spouse and I loved it and will be back. We ordered the fried chicken meal that came with rice and peas and cabbage.

Worst place ever! I have to wait 20 min for fish and chips and they didn’t  even have clients !!! I had to yell "Hello" like 3 times and no one came out to say something to me.  At the moment another client came and also shouted for someone to come out and it was there that a boy came out to attend to him and told me that I had to wait a couple more minutes

If I could give more stars I would. I’ve had the oxtails, red beans and rice, curry goat and none have disappointed. The flavors and portions have all been great. Looking forward to my next visit and to try something new on the menu. Gonna have to say this is one of my top Jamaican restaurant choices in Rogers Park, definitely on the north side.

This past Wednesday my family and I visited this wonderful restaurant and had a great experience. The atmosphere was very warm and welcoming😊 I ordered the Mac and cheese which I finished pretty fast (I sound so greedy).  I went on to order the escovitch fish, which I accidentally left at the restaurant. The little bit of fish I was able to try, was amazing. We’re definitely planning to return.

Awesome place. It's a family ran business. They provide a friendly / welcoming atmosphere. Great food as well. I've been going there probably since 1979 / 1980. I've never had a bad experience there. No food, good people. I have no complaints. You should definitely check this restaurant out.

8/2021  Was here 4 years ago.  Ok if it is another 4 years.  Food was tasty.  That was the saving grace.  But the size of my corned beef sandwich was insane!  And no hot mustard?  Really?  Onion rings were good.  Pickle was just ok.  Not much of a pickle here either.  They should advertise that the sandwich fits in the palm of your hand!

Been coming here on and off for several years, just a great consistent location for hot dogs and burgers and chopped beef and even a fried seafood platter.  Not a lot of Bells and whistles, But that's because it doesn't need it. If you can make me a good Chicago dog in under 6 minutes, I have very few reasons to complain.

This place is INCREDIBLE. I can't say enough good about it. This is like if Five Guys added a bunch of good sides and other options besides burgers for like half the cost. Plus the folks working here were so sweet and kind.

I will absolutely be back. 👍

Good hot dog  eatery in the Edgewater neighborhood. Super nice family serving makes this one of the best and most underrated hot dog restaurants in Chicago. Right next to the Thorndale branch of the library system and a bus stop.

Great food. Quick and friendly service. They are open late night. There was a 20 minute wait but we'll worth it. The diners comprised a conspicuously diverse ethnic mix. To the extent I've never noticed in any other restaurant. In my opinion, an excellent sign!! Kudos to the management and staff!

I went at the recommendation of hotel staff while visiting Chicago. I was told the food was good and that it was one of the few places open at night. Although the latter is true, I didn’t have as good of an experience when I ate here.

My egg roll came out a little burned but I ate it anyways and it was decent. I ordered kung pao chicken and the portion was huge but the chicken was very dry and overdone. I typically don’t send food back so I tried to eat it… after having a second piece of chicken I realized it was going to be pretty difficult to eat.

The server was very kind and let me choose something else from the menu. He went back to the kitchen and told me he’d tried a piece of chicken and that he agreed it was too dry. The service is the reason that this review is 3/5 and not 2/5. I chose the Thai chili fried tofu and the few pieces that I had were delicious. However, I didn’t eat much of it because I’d eaten the (also dry) rice that came with the chicken while I waited for my food the second time. I ordered a lemon tea as well but didn’t drink it because it tasted more like hot lemonade than tea.

The other reviews here seem pretty good, so I’m not sure what happened. It was a Wednesday at 10:30 pm, but there were still a decent number of people inside. This wouldn’t be a place I’d return to if I visit Chicago again.

Top notch food and great prices. One of the best in Chinatown in my opinion, and we come here a lot. The appetizer came out after our food, which was a little annoying because we were getting full. The food was 5 stars but service was rushed and impersonal. Still, an exceptional restaurant. My walnut shrimp was particularly memorable and a generous portion.

This is usually my first stop when I visit Chicago because they’re still open when I arrive around 10pm! A must order would be the salt and pepper pork chops. Tried the abalone and chicken congee and it was a disappointment, expect to get scallops instead of abalone. The rest of the dishes were good though!
I missed Cantonese snack food so much. It was all good, but wish they'd baked my cream sauce seafood on rice. Brings me the childhood memories.

This is my absolute favorite place in the neighborhood! Been coming here for years! They recently remodeled 🤩 which looks amazing! Their prices are cheap/reasonable and the food is always fresh and delicious! Love the staff/ladies there! they know their regular so well, makes you feel like family ♥️ I always recommend George’s to my coworkers and family. Parking sometimes is hard since it’s a busy location but I usually call in prior for pick up. Quick in and out! High recommend their Italian beef, Chicago dog and chili fries 🤤

High-quality classic Greek diner, exceptional food and lovely staff. Family owned old school Chicago joint, will definitely be back.
Large roster of diner food, everything I've had there was very good. Get the "seasoned fries," their crispy thin-curly curly fries are to die for.
Everyone there is super friendly, feels like a real community space. Support places like this, it's just as inexpensive as mcdonalds or burger king and FAR better food/environment. Plus you're supporting local community members rather than a faceless international corporation.
The GYRO was literally the best I've ever had. The meat was sliced thin and I didn't choke on any of it. The sauce was amazing. Glad I got an extra cups worth. Add more tomatoes next time guys. 😉

I use to come here as a kid but then i left the neighborhood.  When I came back around I thought they had closed but they had only moved down the street as I recently found out.  I went back recently and its still as great as I remember. Same owners but I believe it's his daughters running it now and they did not disappoint while being sassy and real (true Soxsiders)but not rude. They took care of me and my son with super food And laughs . I had the Gyro which was the best I've had in a long time. We also ordered Dbl bacon cheeseburger 👌🏽👍🏼 Italian Sausage so delicious and their beefaronni soup 👌🏽😁 i plan to go back soon and make this a spot I frequent again like I did when I was a kid. Thanks George's for giving me some of my childhood back with your great food and service. Check them out . You won't be disappointed 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼

Elaine's the owner restaurant is named after her father who initially owned it she does works there with her two daughters beautiful person inside and out who is  Aawesome the food is done with love for people the sausage and beef combo is my favorite seasoning good sauces good great place to stop and eat not too expensive taking the neighborhood Bridgeport is not what it used to be I like to think it's better than before being a long line people who grew up there

Cheap and tasty Mediterranean food. I really enjoyed my classic falafel pita, and it was a good size for the price. I've also tried their chicken schwarma plate. The chicken was a little dry, but nothing a lot of tahini couldn't fix! The plates are definitely big enough to feed two people. Although Dawali does have a sizable interior, the ambiance isn't great -- probably better to do takeout!

I've had a few bad experiences at this place over the last couple years and tonight's dinner was the last straw. To give them credit and to be fair their food is usually pretty good but the portions just aren't a good enough value compared to competitors like noon-o-kabob. I paid $20 for a pick 3 combo dinner which was supposed to be a lamb, chicken and shrimp skewers. What I got was 3 pieces of each, that's it. For $20?? I can order the same exact dish from noon-o-kabob (which I'm going to do from now on), with the same quality food but would get full skewers. I feel totally ripped off and have had a couple other disappointing experiences in the past but would keep trying them from time to time in hopes that it would improve. Again, their food is usually good (I had 2 bad experiences with food quality before but not the end of the world), but the portions just aren't worth the money you pay. You will get much more food at noon-o-kabob or even semi rami down the street. Note: their online menu is not accurate as well so if you do give this place a chance make sure you ask about quantity etc. I really want to like this place but I just keep getting burned and have to break up with you dawali, goodbye.

a Vegetarian's paradise! we showed up twenty min. before closing, and they still made us welcome. the Ful combo (bean and chickpea) is tasty and filling. we spent $25, and could have fed 4 in stead of two (took the rest home--didn't want to waste a morsel). the vegetarian stew has some sort of special spice i couldn't place, but it was tasty. extra points for having a parking lot.

Absolutely fantastic service. No long wait for the food, and they still manage to make it fresh and well done. This restaurant clearly emphasizes quality and service. They are customer focused - I've been there multiple times and have always enjoyed myself and my food.
Mediterranean fast casual exceeds expectations. Hummus and chicken shawarma plate is awesome, as along as you eat-in.

Very good grilled chicken al carbon
Steak asada is ok
A very good touch is the in house hand made tortillas 😋
Try and compare
You might be surprised
And is not overpriced
Definitely a good place to eat …

First time eating from this restaurant.  Place was busy, but had very friendly staff.  Ordered to go and I was pleasantly surprised that everything was delicious. The chicken, the sides all of it was worth the drive to little village. 😋
Great place & good food too 😋 Very friendly. Pollo a la Parilla delicious 😋

Never going back to this place, they blatantly over charge their customers. The prices listed on the menu (posted above the counter) are not what is listed on the receipt. They plate a leg & thigh when they up charge as white meat or mixed for orders of 3 or more.

Nunca regreso a este lugar, cobran mas por carne blanca o mesclado y te sirven el muslo y una o dos piernas. Bola de rateros!

I often get a chicken burrito from here with chips and salsa on the side and by far it’s my favorite place for burritos. The burritos are HUGE, the chicken super tender, and overall an incredibly satisfying and filling meal. I’ve also had their family size meal during family events and I can absolutely vouch for the quality of their food. Will come here again every time I wanna treat myself and recommend you do too. :)

This place was absolutely phenomenal, really enjoyed all of the food. Cinnamon roll was great to split between 2 people. Would definitely recommend the breakfast burrito with their house made chorizo and the chilaquiles. They are larger portion so you have enough to take home and enjoy later on. Avocado’s were nice and fresh as well. I would definitely come back, very welcoming environment with beautiful one of a kind  art pieces.

Good service, and the food was fresh and well made. I had the California Benedict; was very excited about the sriracha hollandaise, however I couldn’t taste any sriracha, or any spice.. still a very nice breakfast, just basic stuff you could easily whip up at home. Coffee was great, strong and well made.
The best breakfast experience ever! Customer service was the best, they were very professional and welcoming. Food, top of the notch. Thank you Kanela for this experience.
Perfect brunch place, slight wait but we'll worth it.  Food was great, staff was helpful, and provided quick service.

Service was ok, drinks were good, but food wasn’t good at all on my last visit. French toast were stiff as hell, as if they were sitting around for a long time. Chorizo was dry and void of any flavor. Kanela is normally a solid breakfast place, but this Milwaukee address is hit or miss.

I like this McDonald's location because it's convenient being so close to my house. It's always very clean and I've always been served hot, fresh food. The only issue I have is that literally one out of every two or three times I come there, they mess something up in my order. I've learned to check before leaving because a few times now I've gotten home and either am missing something or got something completely different than what was ordered. I always order basic items too, so it's frustrating when they mess it up. (The thing they mess up the most is when I ask for a bacon, egg, and cheese bagel they keep giving me one with steak and onions. 🤢)  I've never been rude about it, I always just let them know what I need so they can fix it but they should try to pay more attention to what people are ordering and what they put in the bag.

Everytime I come here, every single table is filthy. It doesn't matter if I come in for breakfast or lunch.. they are always dirty. They are more expensive than other McDonald's locations, so I'd expect to at least sit at a clean table.

Service is good for the most part, depending on when you go, you will definetly have longish wait time and some not as friendly employees, though nothing too bad. Big issue here is that most times, your order will be wrong, either will receive the wrong thing or completely miss the item

Had a good and fast experience. Ordered my drink in the drive thru and there was only one car in front of me. They took my order and got it right. There is plenty of parking spaces. There is a playground for kids and the restaurant looks clean. On another time I came inside and the place looks nice and spacious.  Modern and plenty of seats to choose from, either stool area or tables.  You can order on large screens or wait in line. They have wifi and a sign on the wall says to use it up to 30 minutes.
I like how cool it looks.

The food is great stays fresh love how I can enjoy some good breakfast, but besides this the service needs to be improved as not sure why they have an order taker outside which slows down the line or maybe letting one car go on the speaker then she can take the next car the line gets crazy because if you are entering through Cicero you will wait for that turn as she taking each car’s order and the only ones that are going in are the cars that are coming from the side street. Improve your drive through as we got to get to work and getting some coffee should not take soo long. Should not have that order taker outside.

First time to this Restaurant for Dim Sum. The food was delicious. The items were quite authentic, to the cooking style of a true Cantonese tea house. The setting was good too. Will go again for supper.

What a pleasant surprise! I found that Chinatown's parking lot was all filled and ran into this place which has its own free parking space and dim sum. So I gave this place a try! Kaboom! Better than Minghin in terms of portion and taste. Also there's pork blood which is hard to find but is great. It may not be in the best location and it is not so visible in Chinatown but this place is worth a try!
This place is great. Friendly staff, amazing food and it's reasonably priced. I would recommend stopping by and giving this place a try. Also has plenty of space for whatever size group.

Been going to Furama for the last 20 years of my life. Before I move to the burbs. My family has known Nancy and Eddie since I was a little girl when they had karaoke back in the days 😂😂😂 That's how old I am now! Pretty decent dim sum. Friendly staff. If you pay cash, you let them know ahead of time and they will give you a 10% discount. Parking is always good there and you can stop by the Chinese grocery store beneath. We always go to Furama when we crave for dim sum. Absolutely delicious! My favorite is the Ha Gow and of course the Siu Mai! 😋😋😋
Delicious!!!! Its our yearly spot to come to. My daughter and I LOVE picking our favorites and trying new stuff too. We are going to try to go back afew times ayear, instead if once a year.

The atmosphere is awesome and the service is familial and indeed personable. It's a mix of bohemian "Beat Generation" and French sophistication. I loved everything about Bonbon Cafe, from the food to the ambiance, from the Mexican cuisine to París pastries. I recommend it highly for those looking for the best in Mexican cooking and French bakery.

Holy chocolate deliciousness! I got a mini cake with all kids of chocolate good inside and out. The price was nice too, only $5! The place may look like it's closed but check the hours on the door (oh, and make sure you know your days of the week in Spanish) first. I went on a Sunday so they didn't have their full assortment of goodies; just a few cakes and fruit tartes. I'm dairy free but I gave it up for a minute while I indulged in my little cake. The pain suffered later was well worth it.

This place offers a great variety of baked goods that you may not get to see in a ton of places. But, if you don't come for the sweets they also offer a variety of other things like torts, which are delicious. They have a sit-down area that's cozy, and the staff will get you taken care of right away.
Got some cookies and a couple of small cakes. It was fast and best of all they are delicious.
I love this place and it's sister restaurant down the street. I actually will drive all the way from Glenview just to eat here occasionally. Some of the best Mexican in the City.

Would rate this place 10 stars if I could, so far have not found a better breakfast spot on the far Northside as good as this one. I order from here once a week since I found them on Uber eats, and at first my expectations were not high since I never heard of this place but now, their breakfast is now my go to. I can’t wait to try some of their lunch items. Whoever is working in the kitchen honestly deserves a raise.

I love going to Pete's. Almost every weekend, my husband and I buy the western skillet, and the daily special. We never spend more than 20 bucks here and we are always well fed when we do. I wish they had toasted bagels though.  Also, the mushroom burger doesn't need so many toppings. Mushrooms, Swiss cheese and kinda garlic sauce. Everything else throws it off.
this beloved cash-only takeout diner has a terrific reputation for a reason: the staff and service. lightning fast, super friendly, and their food is pretty good, too.

If the rate was no stars that's would it would be. They don't wear gloves while preparing the food and also they take the dumpster out without using gloves as well..  this is unsanitary and disgusting.. I would never eat from here.

This place has an outstanding customer service. All of their staff is attentive, helpful, and nice. They doing their job perfectly, also they all know how to treat their customers so well, and even giving the things that the customers need from their kitchen such as extra water, condiments, etc. The food on their menu will absolutely make your mouth waters, everything is made to order, and all of it are incredibly delicious. They are so creative in terms of serving, the plating is so nice, and even tables are perfectly aligned. You can get your order after waiting for a few minutes. They are so quick and fast. Very great service. All of their food is affordable. Their staff is very nice. Their place is really awesome. If you are here in this area of Chicago, you must visit this place and grab a quick meal for a reasonable and fair price. Finest fast food chain. Thank you Pete’s Grill! Kudos to all of you! Thank you for awesome experience! Will visit again soon when I have some free time. Keep up the good work!

The vibe and the foods were good. The grilled cheese was fantastic, with the perfect crisp from the bacon, some sweetness from the jam and abundant cheese over the whole thing. Shepherds pie is delicious too with the melted cheese over smash potatoes. Skillet cookie and ice cream was the highlight for this meal as the cookie is just so good.  However, they require a 2.9% transaction fee if you’re using a card, so consider paying with cash.

We had reservations for a party of 14 setup weeks in advance. Upon arrival we learned they had split us up into two separate tables without telling us about it before hand. The whole point of our reservation was to celebrate the joining of two families through marriage and we were completely separate. The service was not good. We told our server we had some people who were extremely hungry. He said let me put in your drink order and I’ll come right back. At least 15 minutes later we had to flag him down after he completely disappeared from the dining area for quite some time. I will say that the food and beverages were delicious, which is a shame when all you can remember is the less than pleasant experience you had. I would personally suggest the ultimate grilled cheese with bacon on parmesan crusted sourdough, and the sangria. Yum!!

Really cute place! Love the interior, but opted to sit outside since it was such a nice day. We started off with the Artichoke Dip and I had the Shepherd's Pie. Both were really good. Our server was very helpful and you could see him running all over the place helping customers out.

This is a neighborhood "go to" place in the heart of Chicago's Andersonville neighborhood.  With an Irish flair, the space is beautiful inside and has ample outdoor seasonal seating as well.  The staff has always been friendly and attentive in my experience and the food is consistently good.  I recently went for brunch and we had wings as an appetizer and then the breakfast burger (with no bun) and the chopped salad.  All good.  And, the bloody marys were tasty as well.  This place, open for lunch and dinner daily, is consistently good.

Ambience was great but food was just okay. My friend and I got wings for a starter and they were the best thing we got. We got the drive thru burger and chicken pot pie for our main course. Definitely recommend checking it out if you're in the area but nothing to go out of your way for.

Eduardo's has a wonderful atmosphere, very warm and welcoming. The aesthetics are fantastic, it's a great place to enjoy a meal. Service was terrific, the staff was super nice and friendly. They gave me a great wine recommendation.
I ordered the Lemon poppy bucatini, it was good but not great. From the description, it sounded really good and it just wasn't what I expected. I enjoyed my meal and had a great experience nonetheless. I will definitely be back and try the pizza next time.

Fun people watching walking by outdoor dining to Gold Coast and from Rush Street. Patio is nice and dog friendly. One of few places open on Monday w 25% off wine bottles.  Salad of asparagus, snap pee and mint yogurt was excellent. Pizza was fine. Service could be more helpful.
Very decent place. I used to go Marios table(opposite from the street) a lot, but now I prefer coming here. Pizza options are sufficient. Appetizers are refreshing and tasty.

We were really disappointed. I've been to Eduardo's in the past and have always ordered takeout, but this past Friday night was enough to make me not want to come back. Homemade pasta is amazing and you can't beat their bolognese, but its not worth the absolute annoyingly horrible service we received during our last visit. After being sat and clearly waiting rest of my guests I was not offered anything to drink aside from water that was already on the table. I had to get up and ask the manager for wine. After that, my server was constantly bothering me for updates - clearly no understanding of social queues. Once my friends and I were all enjoying wine we were told we only had an hour left at the table (mind you, the restaurant was empty aside from us). But we get it, Friday night and a small restaurant so we ordered quickly. Once complete, they rushed the check and wouldn't even let us split evenly three ways (annoying). THEN, with maybe a few sips left in our wine glasses our server said we had to get up and the next party was there to sit down. It was a SHOCK when we saw only one of the next fourtop was there and could have easily waited another three minutes for us to enjoy our last sips - the restaurant was only about half full too. Our group frequents local Gold Coast restaurants monthly and this one is coming off the rotation. I'd rather go to Mario's where they treat people more like guests than a table to turn.

The manager was the BEST(I realized I never got her name). BUT She was so sweet and welcoming while giving us all of the best recommendations. It was our second time there, and will certainly not be our last! They surprised us with some strawberry gelato for our 2 year anniversary (which was absolutely delicious). Great pizza, great environment, amazing people! So happy with with our experience

Stopped in for dinner with my  coworkers a few nights ago. We did the Traditional Tasting Menu at the recommendation of our waiter. He was amazing. Very knowledgeable and knew his stuff. Best customer service I’ve ever had at a restaurant.
We also had the Aeros De Moriscos Paella’s.

The best paella’s I’ve had.  The tasting menu was great. The food comes out staggered at the perfect time. It was a fun experience. The bacon wrapped dates were awesome. The Bavette was fantastic. The salsa brava and garlic aioli with chili oil on the Patatas Beavas was delicious. The meal was very filling and everything was delicious.

The servers replaced our plates multiple times to make the experience better.  Foodies would love this place. I would do this again if I get back to Chicago.

While I’ve always enjoyed the very tasty food and small plates, the service continues to be extremely disappointing and this most recent visit was no exception. I highly recommend the garlic shrimp in the house potatoes if you choose to visit. Understand If you’re looking for top-notch service this is not the place to go. The restaurant has amazing ambience and well appointed.

What a wonderful restaurant! Yes, definitely pricey, but for the feast they laid out it was worth it. The only things I didn't like were the tuna (bland, though the crackers were a very good fit) and cheesecake (so overbaked!). Service quality was adequate.
The Traditional Tasting Menu was dynamite! Friendly, attentive, professional staff. Reasonably priced, delicious wine. Rich, smooth coffee. Beautiful space. I will be back! #churros
Spanish cuisine with great cocktail options. Must try their Cauliflower appetizers and Paello veggie...

First time here. You want good avena this is the place. I warn you about their customer service. Some staff lack the skills early in the morning. No pidas café cargado pide “extra shot of expresso”. Un aplauso a el que me hizo el café! El si me entendió.

First time here but definitely not the last.
Got a Cubano sandwich and a passion fruit lemonade. Best cubano I’ve had so far! The lemonade was also very tasty. Service was 11/10

Awesome selection of delicious pastries. Been coming here since I was a kid. The cappuccinos are phenomenal! My go to is a pastelillo de guayaba con queso, but all of the pasties are really good. I was a little disappointed with the quesito. It's a different filling than they used to do, but it was still very tasty. That sandwiches are always really good. Great place for a quick breakfast, coffee break, or lunch.

I love this lil spot. The reason i gave a 2 star is cuz HOW ARE YOU GONNA CLOSE ON A SUNDAY? It probably  would be you biggest money maker. The old owner was always open Sunday. Do you need help with staff or how about you rent it to me? Ill run it on Sundays. I make the sandwich at home. Contact me
I love this cafe, the workers are all friendly and the food is yummy! I would highly recommend checking it out.
One of my favorite spots to go to for date night. Food is delicious and the restaurant is cute.

The sushi, fried avocado, and hot entrees were all great. The outdoor patio is a great dining space. Unfortunately, the service on a Saturday night was unacceptably slow. I don't make a comment like that lightly. The servers were running around doing the best they could but it just seemed entirely understaffed for the crowd.

Hopefully it was a fluke and we'll definitely give it another try some day.

I have had 4 meals here in the last 3 weeks! The breadth of the menu made me nervous, but Anna really delivers! So far everything I've had has been delicious - Thai dishes, sushi (Fried avocado with spicy tuna,  wow!), Malaysian fried rice, and Laotian specialties.  All were great.  Price is right.  I encourage you to visit.
Fantastic sushi which is worth trying different varieties and BYOB which is a nice plus. Also the Stuffed Avocado is a must try, it is truly one of the best things on the menu!
My favorite appetizer is fried avocado but to sad they took off thai iced tea and some delish desserts from the menu

I got a regular burrito dinner for pickup and the second I went to eat it, the burrito fell apart. It was soggy and dripping grease in pools.. I couldn’t even taste the meat. The Horchata was very good but I ordered a large and got a small. I’m not sure if you can tell by the picture but my beans are almost white.

Nachos steak over cooked no lettuce,guacamole, or sour cream.  SAME with taco salad. Stuffed tacos blah. $40 nothing looked like the menu, I'm done with that franchise,  I'm sorry don't work anymore!!
This place has been here along time. And it still don't disappoint. Food is very good.

Great food cozy environment friendly accommodating staff awesome drinks im a PEPES customer for life love the deals and specials 63rd and Kedzie is the original and the BEST... HIGHLY RECOMMENDED 5 STARS

I stand outside at 9:30pm on a Thursday and they are closed.
Even though It says 11pm and the weather is great, and they're inside and just decided to say screw the customers,  and close early.

I ordered the Citrus Crispy Chicken salad, without the chicken, and had it swapped for Avocado. Also got the Autumn Squash soup with chips. The salad was alright (lettuce, avocado, crispy pieces, almonds, dressing), so nothing special or unique. The soup was amazing, however, and if I were to visit again, I would definitely get the soup.

I need to share this story of my sandwich. For SO MANY YEARS, dating back to 2003, the Mediterranean Veggie sandwich by Panera Bread was my daily delicious nourishment! Sometime around 2009, I stopped eating this sandwich cold turkey (for no specific reason) and have craved it not ever since... until recently. The free one-month unlimited coffee by Panera lured me into their bakery last month. And the little ordering touch screens lured me to see if my delicious sandwich still existed. AND YES. IT DOES. So for the past couple of days when fetching my coffee, I've been tempted to see if I can easily build my own version of the sandwich (no feta, extra peppadew, extra cucumber, extra red onions, no emerald greens, add spinach), and oh my gosh it played out perfectly! In the olden days, relying on a human for my many special requests was always risky. The little ordering tablets ensured that I could have it my way. The only difference between my old school sandwich and now is that I no longer eat dairy (that started in 2010 hence the no feta request)... and the sandwich would absolutely be incomplete without a cheeselike addendum; but Panera already resolved that issue because the sandwich now comes with hummus! So I ordered extra! AND LET ME TELL YOU THIS! It was a perfect experience from ordering to receiving to eating. My head was on cloud nine. This bakery did a phenomenal job. In fact, I have since ordered this sandwich six more times in the past week! I am in love. Thank you so much for the careful time that your bakery invests into being kind to the customers and to executing a perfect sandwich construction! THANK YOU!

I owe my life to this Panera Bread. Specifically this panera bread all other penera breads are terrible and not worth your time. This one is cool even though they don't have lime seltzer and it's only sparkling water labeled lime. But if you pretend hard enough you can almost taste the lime. Bit they have lemonade. And also make sure you ask for the bathroom code before you have to go bathroom.
My order was accurate. I ordered an iced latte, I wasn’t too fond of it. Everything was pretty standard for Panera.

I’ve never had an issue with this Panera branch; it’s actually one of my favorites for how consistent they are with their service! It could be cleaner, crumbs and misc are sometimes left on tables or seen on the floor, but the staff is super busy and often it’s the customers that don’t maintain more cleanliness. The seating, indoor and outdoor, are ample and usually have outlets for us who sometimes work there in the mornings. The bathroom is also kept pretty clean. The best part is how consistent the food is; no problems ever with my order or taste so far. Friendly staff and always quick, what with multiple ordering methods nowadays.

I'd recommend going on the first day because I think you'll find more items simply. Got a second hand evening wear for 40$ when original price was like 150$ which felt like a good deal to me, especially because it wasn't really worn. Great place for accessories and vintage sunglasses. It was raining on the final day we went so we had to rush though it, but I'd do it again. I think they'll be open around November again..

Parking was easy, nice neighborhood, the booths were fun to explore. I just found prices to be a little high for second hand, and there were too many import dealers that were nearly exactly the same. Also some items and booths that were not family friendly. 😔

Sally Schwartz runs a class act market. Absolutely the best vintage/antique market in Illinois.  You could spend the entire day at the market because there is so much to see along with listening to live music, having a bite to eat or sipping on a tasty Bloody Mary. Combine that with the fabulous atmosphere and people watching,  the small admission fee is well worth it.

Diane
Lockport , Illinois

Great Atmosphere walking around looking for treasures.  Most anything you might want can be found here from fine jewelry to vintage or recreated furniture items.  Fun place to people watch with live music and drinks while you shop.  Some deals to be found if you look closely.
This is an amazing place. I visit here very month. You can get lots of interesting things here.  Most of my home decorations are from here.

Been walking by here for years and glad we came. Large open restaurant with communal tables and really good food focused a lot on meats.

Food: 5/5
Beer: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Cocktails: 0/5

Grab yourself a mug of some of their German beers and order the prosciutto, butter the bread and put it on top, amazing way to start your meal! (Pic attached)

Also get the carrots and try some oysters, with the main being the pork belly or mussels and you'll find yourself leaving super full and satisfied.

Only thing I'd avoid is any cocktails, I had one of the worst old fashioned I've ever had, so stick to beer here.

My wife got extremely sick from the oysters, I found a worm/bug in my oyster (to be fair, it's a raw bivalve from the ocean, yeah there's going to be some funky stuff in there, but still...), and the host (manger?) spilled half of my beer on the table and did not offer to replace it.

I used to love this place; great beer selection, amazing food, cool atmosphere. Honestly, those haven't changed, but the staff is just not what it used to be, and, unfortunately, we got unlucky with the oysters this time.

I let our waiter know that my wife was extremely sick from the oysters (she was literally in the restroom; I won't go into detail), and that he should check the kitchen to make sure that everything was kosher back there. Their response was to tell us that their oysters and beef had just come in that morning so it couldn't have been them. Then they "generously" comped us a $10 burger...

Again, not trying to be a Karen; I know that we're not their only customers and that they have a lot on their plate, but we really left feeling like an afterthought for the waitstaff. There are a lot of great restaurants in Chicago. I never need to go back to this place again.

The menu does change but you will not be disappointed. The atmosphere is pretty cool with the different tables set up. We stopped by for Saturday brunch and had a hard time deciding what to eat as everything sounded great. Settled for their version of a Benedict and it hit the spot. I would suggest getting the breakfast sausage if it's still on the menu as it was not what I was expected but man was it tasty. Now I just need to get back to try all the oysters they have.

Brunch review: As a disclaimer, I have eaten at The Publican a few times over the years (mostly brunch) and remember loving it. This time was good but a notch lower than what I recall. The burger was decent - but given my expectations, it was a slight let down. The beef was a little dry (I went with the server-recommended temp) and the abundance of sauce likely served to compensate, which kinda worked but also made it really messy. The sausage dish was better, with tender meat and unique flavor overall. Crispy potatoes were delicious but some were big and not so crispy in the middle. They also make a great bloody mary. I know this reads like a 3-star review but I'm honestly just over critical bc of my expectations - the food really is good.

Went to The Publican for a brunch with friends, I liked the location of this place. We made a reservation a day before and they charge $15/person for reservations. It has a lovely ambience and awesome staff. We got their coffee which was good. The waffles were very much okay but the jam is amazing. The Publican scramble was really good with a very difficult combination of cauliflower and eggs - do try it. The market vegetable was another dish that we tried, absolutely loved the eggplant in it. My personal favorite was egg in a hole - the capicola was really good. Do try their crispy potatoes and aged cheddar and herb biscuits. Overall we almost had everything on their brunch menu but my top choice was egg in a hole.

The worst place with I've ever been. Please DO NOT COME HERE!
I live not far and went to this "cafe" 2-3 days a week to take coffee and some bread for year or more. After they turned to "Non Profit", cafe staff became the worst staff ever! They are extremely rude, impolite and inattentive. They will look at you like you are nobody here and should go away (and all this attitude you'll get for your money:) Don't wait that manager will help to solve your issues here. "New manager" is a part of the staff, he does not listen to you and look to you like you're an idiot (again for your money).
And, finally, be careful with your bags. Some weeks ago someone steal a bag from a woman with all her credit cards, IDs and cell phone. After this Panera turned to non-profit, you'll see only blacks and addicts there. Please, SAVE YOUR PERSONAL BELONGINGS AND NERVES - DO NOT COME HERE!!!

NO NO NO - PLEASE DO NOT COME TO THIS PLACE - NO NO NO
______________

I LOVE the concept of this restaurant. They give back to the community and that is what is most important in life, GIVING! The managers are always eager to assist with any needs and the cashiers are extremely friendly and accommodating to "difficult" dieters. Go for great food and wonderful service and make sure you pay it forward by leaving a donation to help the less fortunate. Sharing is caring!

This is one of the worst things that's happened to this corner.
It used to be a comfortable place to work on your laptop. Staff are bullies who harass both the "food insecure" and the overpayers alike. If they even think you'll do anything but overpay for your food they will try to harass you out of eating there.
They have a head brainwasher who attacks people at the door and explains this socialist experiment to you and makes you feel like garbage over even setting foot in there.
It has a dirty monkey stench in there.
I disagreed with the manager over a year ago and went back to look for a friend, a little fat latino guy acted like he was a bouncer and was going to assault me. There were few people in there save for the guy with the laptop looking at Yahoo! mail near the toilet, I don't know why he wants to smell poo gas and use their crappy wi-fi all day.
The guy who dreamed this up should be in a loony bin.

I love the fact that Panera Bread has turned this location into a non-profit cafe. Everyone who says that the environment has gotten worse just doesn't like seeing homeless people and people of color in Lincoln Park.

This is the original home of deep dish pizza and an absolute must eat. This is by far Chicago's best deep dish pizza I have had and I've tried all the others(no need to name them). Plus, the wings are really really good too! Dining area is small and fills up quick, but we'll worth the wait. If in downtown Chicago, make sure to eat here; can't say that enough. I'll be back for sure next time I'm in Chicago.

I came to Chicago open minded and wanting to try their famous deep dish pizza.

I first tried Giordano's stuffed pizza.  I was in for a surprise.  they use pie dough instead of real pizza dough.  A real disappointment.  I had to try another place...

So I searched for the original place, where it all started: Uno!  So instead of a stuffed pizza, they serve real deep dish pizza.  Better overall, better toppings, but...  Still that pie dough!  I will never get why Chicagoans use pie dough instead of real pizza dough.  For me, it was better reheated the next day in the microwave, really weird pizza...

You still have to try it, it's just not for me.

Came in on a chilly Thursday afternoon straight from the airport.  We were greeted by a very nice server and a bartender. The restaurant wasn't busy.

We ordered small pizza Uno ($21.99 as of January 2022) and an appetizer "shrimp and crab dip" ($12.99). They warn you that the pizza takes about 40 minutes to be made and they mean it.

Shrimp and crab dip was amazing. Very creamy and served hot.
A small pizza is divided into 4 very generous slices, and one was plenty for me. It tasted kinda homemade, which I liked.

Overall, good experience and great food!

Haven’t had deep dish pizza since probably since 2003. Too enjoyable of an experience.
Came here with a colleague and we both sincerely enjoyed our pizzas. Staff was great. Pricing was good too for what you get. Part of the Chicago experience

This is by far the best pizza I have had. The birthplace of deep dish pizza. The pizza was so delicious that I even enjoyed eating the crust. This place is a must visit when you ever visit Chicago. The staff was courteous and friendly! Cozy place… great place to rendezvous with friends and family.

We LOVED the chef's counter experience for my birthday. The entire team was incredibly attentive, friendly and informative. We had a great night with Alex and Chefs Adam, Sam, and Jimmy. (I hope I remembered everyone's names right!)

The food was absolutely delightful and we walked away without being able to pick a single favorite. We came up with a top 5 instead (in no particular order): oyster, grilled shrimp, quail, agnolotti, steak + lobster with lobster butter....so half the menu! 😅 The other half was delicious too. They even made my fiance - who hates seafood - say some of the seafood items were his favorite. They were also incredibly accommodating of our requests.

We did not do the wine pairing but Alex was super helpful in helping me pick a few glasses for the meal.

We thoroughly loved it and will be back for another meal soon. My pictures don't even do it justice - and I forgot to take pictures halfway through because I could not wait to dig in.

One tip if you're doing this: dress accordingly. It does get balmy, you're sitting 10 feet from a live burning fire after all.

tl;dr version- Amazing. Can't give more than 5 stars, but I would if I could.

My husband and I have been wanting to try a Chef's Table experience for a long time. When we knew we were coming to Chicago (and it happened to be on my birthday), I looked up options for the experience in this area and found El Che. After reading some of the reviews, I decided to go ahead and book it- and let me tell you, from what I read off those reviews, my expectations were set pretty high (despite having never tried a chef's table experience before).

All that to say- I seriously couldn't have asked for a more wonderful birthday dinner. The food was *incredible*. Delicious, complex, flavorful, comforting while simultaneously challenging and full of depth, each bite was a journey into bliss, with an Argentinian twist. I tried food that I would have never tried on my own, and I have to say I really, really enjoyed each and every item.

From the chefs to the waiters to everyone else I met, the service was friendly, personable, knowledgeable, and professional.

Watching the chefs work to create dishes for the rest of the restaurant (as well as ours!), getting to ask questions about the food, such as how or why a particular dish or item was done the way it was, was so incredible. Alex, (and everyone else I bothered) were happy to answer any questions we had- no matter how silly they might have been. I learned a lot and have a bunch of new ideas of things to try at home!

We chose not to do a wine or beverage package, but we had plenty of amazing recommendations from the drinks menu to enjoy with our meal.

We didn't get to meet John Manion that evening, but to be honest (and no offense to John, I'm sure he's lovely) we never felt the lack.

I will definitely be back and I am so grateful I chose this experience for my Chicago birthday dinner! This is truly an experience I will remember for the rest of my life.

Please note, these photos are by me, a VERY bad photographer with absolutely NO training under my belt. Please excuse any photos where bites have already been taken- I had a hard time remembering I should photograph the food first, THEN eat!

Also, when you book this experience, they aren't joking when they say it gets warm. You're right next to the fire (which I LOVED) and all the action, but dress for it! Suit coats (or even long sleeves) would be pretty hot.

Fantastic dinner for my anniversary! It wasn’t too busy when we first came in and it picked up significantly throughout the night. Our waiter Kai was fantastic and made great recommendations. Highly recommend coming in and checking it out.
Came to El Che for a happy hour and dinner. The entire experience was a perfect 5 stars. From the drinks, to the service, to the food. One of the best steaks I've ever had!

Here's what you need to know: this is a review of the 'Hearth Table' experience that's only purchasable on the restaurant reservation platform "Tock". It's a family style meal experience where the the menu is pre set by the restaurant for $100/diner + T&T. Overall, the service and ambiance make for a 5 star experience. The quality of the steaks and sausages I would rate 3 stars (quite Underwhelming) but the overall rating warrants a 5. Oh, and be ready to eat because it is SO MUCH FOOD on the hearth table.

The hearth table experience is a great way to bring in a celebratory night. The restaurant allows for seating of 6-10 and all participants must participate in the experience. If you're celebrating a special occasion and want to pair that with a nice rare Wine, they so allow BYOB with corkage ($45/bottle) for up to 2 std sized bottles of your own wine.

For the food, we started off with an outrageously delicious olive bowl with assorted Spanish style olives in warm Olive oil brine. Then we moved on to an empanada and endive salad which was a perfect combination pair. Then on the stupendously well seasoned quail (poultry) plate with delicious croutons. Next was the super indulgent warm seafood platter with oysters, prawns, and lobster tails. That was chased with the grand offering of their signature meat platter filled to the brim with sweetbreads, short ribs, blood sausage, chorizo, and massive ribeyes. Surprisingly, the red meat platter was decent but the weakest of the courses when it came to seasoning and quality. Short ribs were a little too fatty and rubbery, ribeye was average quality.

We finished with a dessert platter which had amazingly delish alfajores and ice creams.

Overall, great celebrating. Bill was $135 for food with tax and tip included, and the rest was for cocktails and bottles of wine (which varies for each party )
Compared to other Mediterranean restaurants in chitown, I felt this was an okay experience. I had a rice bowl with Tahini sauce and did not like the flavors very much. It was however not a disaster.

Love this place. Delicious food that I never get tired of. Salad box with chicken and most of the trimmings is my usual jam - though the  falafel is tempting every day.  They recently added gyros meat to the menu is which is also delicious. Staff is super friendly.
My favorite Mediterranean place in the loop for sure. Vegan options, locally owned.
Good Mediterranean, service was quick and no line.

I like this style of Mediterranean food. Roti was my old favorite and a coworker recommended this place so I gave it a try and got the steak, chicken, falafel combo box with rice and a bunch of veggies. I was absolutely blown away by the flavors I was getting from this box. No BS this place is incredible and I will be back very soon.

This place was open for Christmas so we stopped in and hands down BEST THAI we’ve eaten.  I always look at cleanliness, customer service and food quality and flavor. This place is definitely a 10 with them all. Presentation with the food was great, quality and taste is honestly something to brag about yes Instagram worthy . We ordered the vegetarian egg rolls, fried pork ribs , Grilled squid, and spring rolls in rice paper.  For dinner we had garlic chicken, pepper beef and cucumber salad. I won’t bore you with any more words, your taste buds deserve this deliciousness. You won’t regret it. Definitely was a Christmas gift for us finding this place.  Oh and I was told to mention the hot sauce . Lol my dad says it’s killer hot sauce and definitely makes ya sweat.  He says he needs to bring some home . I guess that means the hot sauce is great .

Authentic, Northeastern style Thai food - reminds me of home cooked meal back home. The Jungle Curry and grilled marinated pork are perfect together! Only 15 minutes from ORD. Staff are very warm and welcoming. I will definitely come back again and again.

We were driving through Chicago and needed some food, but it had to be something real special. Voila!! We came across this little place (not too far from where serial killer John Wayne Gacy's old house used to be). Don't let that little macabre factoid stop you from enjoying some seriously good food here.

GET THE INTESTINES!! It's probably one of the best and cleanest tasting intestine dishes I've had. And that delicious tamarind sauce that comes with it... superb! Everything was delightful. The people were friendly, food yummylicious, and you can even drive by the Killer Clown's old lot. 😃
It was my first time here. The food was delicious. I had the papaya salad and it was spicy ( I like spicy food) and delicious. I will be back.

The food is delicious. I order delivery from here too regularly now. Best thai food for the price I’ve had in Chicago. The red curry is excellent and I consider the portion size perfect. Pad Thai is also generously sized and very tasty. Always delivered hot. Thank you very much for the great food every time.  Looking forward to exploring more options on the menu but I just can’t stop ordering the red curry.

My cousins and I visited here on a Monday night and it was such a great experience. Our waiter Stepper and the manager Miguel took great care of us and we spent hours there! Wonderful vibes and amazing views, would definitely recommend and come back! We all ordered espressos martinis and truffle fries and got the chance to try a new seltzer.

Made a reservation online on a Friday night. At 8pm there was a DJ - good music. People at the bar, people having drinks/eating. Really fun atmosphere as a place to go before you go out to another club. They have a dining room area separate from a bar area. Had the mushroom pizza-very very good!! It’s definitely an upgraded pizza, not a standard greasy thing. Had a roll of shushi too, which was tasty. I’ll definitely be back for a quick bite and drinks!

I will start out by saying make sure you're on the Pavilion! I started out with my experience being placed at the inside bar, and if that's where I stayed this would be a 2-star review. The temperature setting inside is set to match the Pavilion which is open air space and I honestly was sweating through my shirt. Also as the Pavilion is busier most the staff tend to be focused on that area so service inside is slower.

Luckily Jayce, the hostess, was able to get us squeezed into the Pavilion despite not having a reservation. Thank you Jayce that definitely made the experience much nicer!

Jackie, our server, was very nice and attentive. As soon as we sat down we had water ready and our first drinks on the way. We got two drinks:
• Summer Blossom
• Old Fashioned

The Summer Blossom was very light and refreshing. An easy to drink cocktail with a nice flavor.

ROOF on the Wit is not a bad spot to stop for a cocktail, just make sure you're on the Pavilion if you want a unique experience.

There were only a few places that were open on Christmas Eve! We found this rooftop placed on 27th floor on this day and came here with my love and had some foods and drinks. We enjoyed our Christmas Eve time together.
I liked the vibe, the lighting and the decorations.

The view is pretty good. The music is great. The Cheese plate and warm olives are delicious. I can’t give it a 5 star because it’s entirely enclosed. There’s no way to step outside for fresh air. It wasn’t as good as other roofs I’ve been too.

We recently had Jeff and his Yum Dum food truck at our daughters wedding as the late night snack!! It was incredible!! The bao buns and spicy kimchi balls were a huge hit . It was also such a fun surprise for our guests when the truck pulled into the venue! Jeff was a true professional and it was a seamless and pleasant experience working all the details out with him before the big day . HIGHLY RECOMMEND!! And looking forward to dining at his restaurant in ChicAgo as well !

We recently had Yum Dum truck at a staff outing and were absolutely blown away! The food was DELICIOUS and the staff and service we received was amazing. They even prepared some specialty vegan options to make sure our team was accommodated. We will definitely be using them again!

I tried this truck today at a spot near my office- behind the Prudential building- on E Randolph. I had the $10 dumpling selection with a drink . Meal came with 6 chicken Thai dumplings  and 4 spicy cheese rice balls. Both were great but those rice balls were the favorite. Also came with this weird chop/fork so you can eat your dish either way.  it was nice for a easy lunch that is not too filling. Food service was quick despite 5 other orders before mine. I will be back to try the Bao sandwich next time!!
It's 7 am on a Friday morning and I am aggressively searching for the location of this truck today. The food is great! I love it!

Omg kimchi fries and pork belly steamed bun. This food truck is fabulous! Flavorful and the kimchi isn't overpowering. If you love kimchi in the traditional sense I would not recommend them, but if you just want to dip your toes in some kimchi I highly recommend it.
First time here today! Highly recommend! All the food was great! Chicken tacos, Philly cheesesteak, and the grilled chicken sandwich were super tasty! AND the donuts! Definitely will be back!

I originally wanted to order the wings but I couldn’t find the number to call ahead. I got a fried chicken wrap. And it was good. The chicken was fresh. There wasn’t any bad pieces

I wouldn’t recommend calling ahead to avoid lines. They make you stand in line anyway. I had a short lunch break, thinking calling ahead would be the smart idea. I repeated my order 7 times to the lady over the phone for 5 minutes, just to be told my order is ready and go stand in the slow moving line if you want it. With my lunch being cut short, I had to leave, with out a lunch.
So happy I finally tried this spot. Did not disappoint! Their ingredients were fresh and the food was tasty. No complaints here and will definitely be coming back!
Philly cheese steak is EXCELLENT, fried donuts are great!! Takes me back to Six Flags with just the right amount of sweetness. I'll be back.😉😎 Thanks guys!!! 😁

First time customer. So far, I am impressed.  The area needed a good fast food place that is actually affordable and delectable.  The service was great. Very friendly and courteous. My order was accurate and actually hot. A good value as well. But the best part is that the food was good. Very tasty and the portions were generous. Had the pepper and egg sandwich, which satisfied my craving. Good texture and seasoned perfectly. Also tried the pizza puff. It was good. Reminded me of the pizza puffs made at old school diners. Fries were crispy outside and delicate inside. Can wait to go again and try their Vienna Beef hot dogs. Hope Bigg's remains at this location for a long time.

I loved the food it's sooo good. Whether you get the grilled steak or chicken it's really tasty probably some of the best I ever had. They also have specials of 10$ dishes of rice beans and a grilled chicken or steak. The empanadas they have are some of the most delicious things I ever had and typically order 3-4 per meal. I love the food and the price but only have two single dislike which is a kind of chicken and rice with a side of fries entree which barely had any chicken and is mostly rice compared to what they claim other than that is a sort of pancake looking thing which taste kind of bland is high in grease. Other than that this place is  must try and if you crave dessert there is a churro desert restaurant is right next to it across the street. Lastly I will say the menu at the restaurant is in Spanish so maybe try looking online for the menu might be in English or just ask the waitress to explain the menu.

Who I'm assuming is the owner is always super kind and friendly. I've eaten here 3 or 4 times and everytime the food is amazing, always brings it out hot and the flavors are always good. One of my favorite colombian places ever and I would say it has the best emapandas, the filling is delicious and they're never too dry.

Try Colombian food for the first time! Empanadas are decent, not that great. But the carne asada and bandeja Paisa are delicious.
Free parking in lot next to the restaurant.
They good, I feel the teste used to be better. But for the price make sense. Plus the service its always the best.
Amazing food, great service, and prices. We'll be coming back soon. Highly recommend this place.

Eating in Chicago means eating well, and Publican Quality Meats elevates that to eating right. Shout out to Head Butcher Rob, your butcher's breakfast was eye-opening, and thanks for recommending it Leo. If I knew that is what you all get to eat for breakfast, I would've applied a long time ago!

They've crafted a unique offering, with everything from in-house pasta sauces to tiny cans of whisky.

Posting specifically about the restaurant week menu: it’s BOMB. Highly suggest you go with at least one other person and you can both order the 2 different entrees (mussels & pork belly)- the pork belly is a little dry but once you mix it with everything on the plate it’s MUAH to die for. Great selection of beer and the Serrano ham for the appetizer melts in your mouth. I feel like a little kid with my review for the dessert but it was a sad portion to share between 2 people lol. I actually asked a waiter if another portion of dessert was coming out. All is served family style if you + others are getting the restaurant week menu. All and all the space is loud and fun and rambunctious - will return

I live in the area and have frequented Publican many times- never a bad experience. I decided to go to Publican Quality Meats for a pastry for the first time today and have never been so shocked by the dismissive attitude of the girl who was at the cash register. I had asked her a simple question in regards to where the pastries were made and in response, she gave such an unhelpful and dismissive answer. Not to mention the egregious look she gave me when i was asking questions.

Not to mention the chocolate croissant was insanely stale. I thew it away after a bite. All in all, incredibly turned off by this shop. And hope that they better educate their workers.

So disappointing. I used to go to PQM numerous times a week a few years ago. Their quality used to be top notch. Now, they pulled their famous chicken parm sandwich off the menu, the bread they serve on their porchetta sandwich is dry, their beloved “marinated kale” dish is just large wet leaves of kale with zero flavor or craftsmanship, and they serve 1+ day old stale cookies at full price. It’s definitely no longer the business you know and love.

We went here during restaurant week.  The food was mediocre flavor wise, but we got norovirus poisoning from the raw oysters.  We called a day later because we were literally too sick to call same day because it was that bad.  The manager didn't return our call or confirm they pulled the bad oysters out of circulation.  Because they handled it so poorly I can't recommend this place to anyone.

Very clean place and helpful staff. The London Fog and the Iced Chai tea Latte were excellent drinks. They make their own naked goods and the peanut butter cookie sandwich was delicious. Their syrups have great flavor to them and are not overly sweet. I would take them over Starbucks any day.

The decor of this location left much of it's Viennese cousin's beauty to be desired. It is more like a typical American coffee shop, sadly. The coffee and cake I had were very good, as must be expected and the young men working were very friendly. It is also a great location geographically.

Coffee is average, selection of pastries on Sunday was meager. Would not call it authentically European..Lovely service , atmosphere was ok, hotter inside than outside and seating outside was not very cozy. Would pass the next time- just intrigued by past reviews , perhaps was an off day for this shop..
Had the coffee of the day - not bad. I would be interested to try their espresso based drinks again. Great spot to sit and have a coffee. Service was excellent.

I ordered a Drei Maderl Haus and a chocolate croissant. Both tasted good especially the Drei Maderl Haus. I will probably go back to try their latte. Service was good too. The place is a little cramped which might be a problem if it gets crowded.

Good Japanese restaurant located in Michigan Ave, but not my favorite restaurant.
We were seated by the bar since the restaurant was fully booked today. So we missed the cooking show 😂
The bartender working there was a nice behaved girl.
The food taste and quality was okay.
One of the managers told us their dressings are homemade and amazing.
I recommend check out this place at least once for just the experience.

The price for the 6 course meals is great! We came down to celebrate a birthday. It was worth it.
Sushi was great.

The chef seemed uncomfortable or shy but did his best to put on a great service at a great speed. Super sweet guy.

There was an error and delay with my drink and I had to remind the server 3x to check after 1hr of waiting. It was awkward to have to ask several times but she kindly explained and then brought it out right.

Full disclosure: the tables are shared.
We reserved a table and were ender the impression we would be seated in our own table but it was shared service. Our party and two other parties were seated with us. We didn't mind this part.

If anyone is curious about wait time.We waited a little over 1hr for the chef to come. Arrived at 7:15pm left at 10pm. Still worth it.

The garlic butter in the fried rice is delicious and really sets this hibachi apart from others I've had in the past and the sushi is good as well. But with that being said, the food is a bit overpriced. You can get as good or better hibachi at many other places for a more affordable price.

Jose our Japanese/Guatemalan Chef did a wonderful job with entertaining us and making sure The Filet Minon and Lobster were cooked to perfection… Great food and Service….. Long wait with a reservation, still waiting beyond our reservation time…. Nonetheless, food was good

I mean…I can’t front. I was disappointed. We went to celebrate my daughter’s 8th grade graduation. Our chef saved this experience because it was sub par. The floors were dirty, the bathroom floor was sticky. We were seated for about 35min before we got water, I asked for new plates but I could run my fingers across the plates and see the grease on my fingers, and the silverware had bad water stains and looked like it came from the dollar store. It was just wayyyy below what I expected for the prices. I spent 208.00, including the $35 tip. My server maybe could’ve been better, but my rating is more based on my disappointment. She responded very well to our requests and was kind. But I expected so much more. This was my first habachi experience and I was just not impressed. But our chef did a good job of entertaining the kids and it was a lot of food.

We stumbled on this place one evening on a walk.  Glad we stayed. The pizza was great and the staff was super friendly.  It was an old bar called Paddy Longs. So older reviews still talk about the bacon & the previous food. It’s now all about the pizza!! and they did an amazing job rehabbing it. The best part was the pizza chef,  came out to your table with the pizza he made and would check up on you. Very special experience from such a casual spot. They have a full bar too!
I give this 5⭐️
Jerry (the pigeon) gives it 6⭐️ He loved the crust.

Excellent thin crust pizza! Absolutely delicious. Crust was baked perfectly crisp. You can tell all of the ingredients are top quality. I just got plain cheese and I was so impressed at how good is is. Try it, you won’t be disappointed!

Super fresh ingredients makes all the difference. Great New York style pizza, got the Hot Honey Pepper pizza and the Apple Italiano pizza. It was a good sized pizza given the price point, will definitely be back when looking for that authentic NY pizza feel and experience.

Originally Paddy Longs, they've transitioned to a pizza parlor. Great service, our server was very attentive and friendly, frequently checking to make sure my guest and I were good on drinks and refills.

Lots of locally sourced beverages and materials. Had a sour beer from Niles and the lager was a collaboration with another local brewery. Great pepperoni pizza, very flavorful and juicy.

Very cute space, it's been much brightened up in the interior and the patio portion is compact but perfectly situated to have a great view of the area, making it perfect place for a drink or bite to eat on a summer afternoon

As soon as you walk in, the hostess was so warm and welcoming. But the real star of the show was the amazing Red Pizza. 10/10, sauce was delicious, crust was cooked to perfection and the sausage I ordered on it was just enough spice and seasonings to coat the tongue. Also the craft beer is such a nice option to have with the savory pie. Definitely coming back for that Red Pizza!

They moved one door down into a completely brand new space. It’s brighter and more updated. The working space also feels cleaner. Glad they’re back after a long renovation hiatus! Same great team as before.

I tried their newer location on 10/8/22 sometime in the later part of the afternoon. The place was bigger and more staff from the lasts time I visited with the older and much smaller location before. The staff was friendly and fast, the food was set up properly, cleanliness with plenty of meat to spare. Plus, I lucked out, one of the customers in line gave me a coupon for two footlong Subs for $12.99.

Subway is the healthiest and greatest deal I've had in Chicago NIH National Institute of Health recommends for one to eat 40% of their diet should be fruits and vegetables one Subway alone 6 in easily takes care of that requirement I like the deal bogo 50 buy one get one 50% off 2 ft longs for under $15 how could you beat that plus 175 points when you a amass 200 points it's $2 less at the cashier how could you beat that I'll always be a Subway fan cuz I have a voracious appetite

It was open, and I was hungry. That gets one stars. I was saved by what I realized was the manager, as she'd ask me a question, and then turn to another employee while I was answering,turn back to me and ask the same question again. She just walked away after handing me my receipt with my sandwich still on her side of the register. I reached over the register to get it and left. Another feature is the locked restroom which require a pin code to enter.

Whenever I've stopped here for food the people working here have been very rude and unhelpful to me. Every other Subway in the country that I have been to have had very friendly workers most of whom will go out of their way to strike up a conversation with me. Not this place though. The food tasted pretty good at least and the restaurant seemed clean. Something else that is not the restaurants fault was the other customers eating there had the look of hate in their eyes.

I was very impressed with the style of the service. You order at a kiosk and it spits out a buzzer to let you know when your meal is ready for pick up. The food was good for what it was but the portion size was not as proportional to the price. However, it being in downtown Chicago I can let the inflated price slide but I would like to see the savings on food servers shifted to a lower price in food. That being said the host that did greet us and explain how the system worked was very welcoming and funny. There were charging stations for your phone but you needed to download an app to use them.  All in all the quality of food and service was satisfying.

It was my first time at this restaurant! Great selection of pizza, pasta, risottoand salads. There is a lot of seating available.
