When you come into the restaurant, you will receive a card and they will charge your card and you pay right before you leave the restaurant. Your pasta is made fresh and right in front of you and you can mention any specific food preferences that you have. We had to wait in line for about 20 minutes. The food I had was delicious and I loved the desserts as well. The interior decor in the restaurant is interesting too! The staff was very friendly as well.

Really good pasta that's a cute concept.  They give you a card & menu, and then you tap the card @ each station when you order something. You then pay when you leave.  I ordered the Crema Di Funghi which was really tasty.  I recommend this place.  Really nice ambience as well.

Absolutely loved this place. We went for lunch prior to seeing Hamilton (they gave us 15% off for having Hamilton tickets). A unique way to order, but it was quick and very accurate. All of our food came out quickly. There was plenty of open seating. Atmosphere is relaxed and modern decor. Also, they have a bar if you're wanting some spirits before the show. I'll be back!

Expensive place to eat but was delicious. The chefs make what you want on the spot as you watch them. I had the bruschetta and the risotto pomodoro (too salty). They have a card system where the chef will scan your card everytime you add something to your order. An inbetween place of fast food and sit down dining.

Yum, stop by and enjoy some amazing flavors with these great pupusas. Highly recommend you order a Revuelta for my meat lovers. Are you looking for a non meat option,  go with the Loroco. The flavors coming off these are just great. Make sure you pile on that curito with the sauce of your choice. Red the traditional sauce and green non traditional for a bit of spice in your life. I recommend an Agua de Tamarindo to help refresh you pallet during your meal. Definitely coming back.

The staff were friendly and thoughtful and all the food was so delicious. I look forward to coming back and bringing friends!

Loved the artwork and decorations that made it fun to look around while we were trying to decide what to eat from all great options on the menu or waiting for food to arrive.

We got there around 5:30pm on Saturday and there was definitely a stream of families and other folks arriving after us, so glad we beat dinner rush!

Edit - I just ordered take out today and got a lot more flavors of pupusas because they are so tasty and we wanted to share with friends who were very interested after they heard about our last trip. We also enjoyed the Pepian chicken stew and more of the delicious corn drink. Though I finished mine too quickly, that's my only complaint and not their problem!

Edit x2 - came back for takeout towards the end of the day and really enjoyed the beautiful textile arts they have on display now while waiting for the order! Food was just as delicious as before and stayed hot until we got home. I left it up to the staff what pupusas to put in my order and all of them were SO delicious. My mom got the pork adobada dinner and loved it, we each have leftovers for lunch tomorrow.

I walk by all the time and crave the pupusas in the pictures outside. Went in the other day and finally had some, delicious! Also very reasonably priced. Try to come with time, pupusas can take a while

Service could have been better. We had a group of about 10 people and they could only do 2 separate cards. Sitting in Separate tables was the only they could accommodate more than 2 cards. Would have liked to order more food but staff seemed overwhelmed by our "huge" party.

Seen reviews, thought we’d try it! I’m not a fan, the food lacked flavor, wasn’t fresh, and we won’t be coming back. It was ok, the prices were high, but I rather pay a bit more and get more flavor & freshness! I’m sure there are a lot of people that won’t agree with my review, but these are my tastebuds, and I can not only smell, taste or see anything fresh. ✌️

Without many choices for places open late we headed here around 12:30 in the morning.  We were allowed entry and then huddled together to attempt moving through the masses towards the busy bar.  Unfortunately,  from the moment we stepped in, there was an air of edginess to this place.  The floor manager and host I presume were both unfriendly and rude.  They shuffle you around as they make tables available for those they know and then proceeded to lash out at anyone who didn't obey their unwritten rules.  The host snapped on a patron when he accidentally knocked over his own drink and his glass broke.  Yelling at him in a language the patron didn't understand and then proceeding to get more upset when he didn't do what he asked because of the obvious language barrier.  Our waitress must see this sort of thing often because she apologized and was quick to point out we wouldn't have to deal with them any longer.  The drinks are expensive,  small, and hardly have any alcohol.  This was by far my worst experience in Chicago and will never return.  In our hour there, we saw numerous other people have similar experiences as our own and leave.
Great food!!! Love this place!!! Great atmosphere!! Really good drinks!! Once again amazing food!!! Super cool crowd here and they close pretty late..
Decent food. Good vibes on weekend nights. Excellent service. Most importantly they serve food late night 😂

Rushed into this place after roaming around the other restaurant in gold coast. It was a polish restaurant bar with persian taste to it, and it was interesting. We heard that the owner is persian and from the menu, we could feel our guess is right.
So we tried different dishes, and they were all good.
It was a busy day, and the were short in staff.
They could serve us better, but I understand they tried their best.
Ordered Vegas Steak, Bison Burger, Lamb Shank and shrimp pasta.

This place is one of my favorite restaurants. They have the best pasta in the world- Atleast in Chicago. Fire. I get the pasta w sausage & chicken. It’s like my 8th time getting it, it truly doesn’t disappoint. Service is always great there too. Thank you Dublin’s. Aj_mba for more reviews on IG.

I live in the West Loop and Anna's is on my "speed dial" for takeout sushi. The prices are slightly higher than other neighborhoods (it is the West Loop after all) but the fish is high quality and the rolls are always excellent. My favorite is the one with yellowtail and cilantro – an interesting but tasty combination. If you're on a budget, they're BYOB and also serve Thai food and modern Asian appetizers.

One of my friends took me to Anna's and it was like a hidden gem - I had no idea that this restaurant was here - I have driven by this restaurant many times and never noticed it. The ambiance is so cute! It's very warm and cozy with a trendy feel - exposed brick, a fireplace in the back of the restaurant...great place for a date or a girls night out in the West Loop. The service was great - our waiter was very attentive, and we were in and out. I had the yellow curry chicken, which was very tasty - I will be back!

Anna's is a great hidden gem in the west loop. Tucked away under Lake Street, near Halsted, this small restaurant has a high end flair. Excellent food. make sure and try the stuffed, deep fried avocado. Sushi is very good.

Awesome place for group dining! BYOB and has a very nice looking interior, though it's easy to miss this place under the El tracks.

Definitely make a reservation as it gets packed on the weekends. My guy friends have told me they like it because there are always large groups of single girls at birthday parties, but don't shoot the messenger.

Foodwise, try the lettuce cups to start and gyoza.  The specialty rolls are great, my favorite is the Chicago.  Not sure if it still applies, but if you check in on Yelp, you get a free gyoza appetizer.

Very good asian food. They have a mix of good sushi and thai food. PRicing is alright but BYOB is definitely their advantage. Their sweet potato roll is the best dish ever for sushi. You must try it. Other rolls are also excellent. Thai food is very good. Service is very good.

Pros? Good peach cobbler, good baked pork chops, pretty good collards.
Cons? Cornbread and dressing lacked flavor. The fried corn was runny and the portions are SMALL for a 15.00 plate. The  prices too high for the neighborhood.
The food is awesome. Miss Lee is a sweetheart!! The peach cobbler reminds me of home(Mississippi)!

No doubt.  This place is where I can get the taste of the food that closely aligns with my grandmother's .  She was an awesome southern cook.
The difficult part of this review is the inside of the place.  It's just not tidy.  I wish someone would swoop and mop the inside on a regular basis.  Because this can definitely turn potential customers away.

Hopefully when I visit in another six moths, someone would have taken care of this and I can would give this establishment a 5 star review it deserves.

Pretty good food and the wait wasn't long. Ordered baked chicken, short ribs and salmon croquettes meals. My order wasn't correct and they politely made the adjustment and threw in a free dessert. Only disappointment was the "fried corn" ... it tasted  like creamed corn from a can.

If you want some really great Soul Food this is the spot! It is a take out only place but the food is really good. They have Bread Pudding, a desert that's really hard to find especially as good as my Grandmother use to make. I highly recommend this place.

This used to be the best store about seven years ago.  Now it's the worst.  It doesn't even show up in the app for ordering.  They could never scan the app in store either.  They mix their regular and decaf coffee together right in front of your eyes.  They don't care about service at all.  The manager is mean to everybody, customers and the workers.  She's got no respect for anybody.  We ordered one spicy chicken and one regular chicken sandwich combos tonight.  First we had to figure out which was which.  Big, beautiful piece of chicken in the regular sandwich, but a flat, overcooked piece of balsa wood for the spicy chicken.  It's just shameful!.

Re review, lady at the window is kind and polite ordered the number seven food was hot and fresh!

This place  has fresh food i know that because ive been coming her for years. Theres about 1 instance total of a bad food expireance but it was because they were out of something that should be included in a salad. Today i had the breakfeast number 7 and it was fresh and cant complain.

Normally I give places one chance, but since this location is close to my job, I decided to go one more time and that was the the straw that broke the camels back. 1st experience was around 12am and they gave me the wrong nuggets with no sauce and didn't give me my bacon burger just a regular one. The last time I just wanted nuggets, I came around 830pm. That's it that's all. I ended up with soggy nuggets. Who in their right mind wants soggy nuggets that I spent my hard earned money on? This store needs to get it together and get some training courses on how to make food and give out right orders. I don't recommend this place. Find another burger place that can get the orders right.

Don't buy at this Wendy's!

I'm tired, but so tired of paying for something and not getting it!  How is that possible Wendy's?  Do your employees keep the sandwiches? or Are they unable to handle orders with more than 5 items????

It's always the same with these guys (around 2pm - 8pm).  Today I ordered 3 kids meals, two sandwiches, two fries and they forget to put a sandwich. The other day they did the same thing, no sandwich, this is the third time! I would understand if you forgot to put some fries but a sandwich?? I pay like $9 for it and you don't put it in the bag?  you're scamming me!

This place has this problem, they forget to put an item that you have already paid for.

I do not recommend going to this Wendy's location.

This wendys is really clean, Staff was very  friendly. Dining room was in tip top shape even during the lunch rush. Honestly I was really impressed. This store is very well managed. 5 star was given due to friendly staff, and clean Dining room during a lunch rush.

I love coming here for wine and chocolate! I would not say this is a place for dinner, but it is perfect for happy hour, nightly recap, or casual drinks.  Quiet intimate atmosphere with great service.  I know I have said it before, but don't forget the chocolates.  Smoke salted caramel and tonka are my favorites! We have taken multiple friends and family-never disappoints.

I came here for a ladies outing and we had a good time. The wine here was tasty but the cheese, and chocolates stole the show. We had black truffle sea salt, sea salted caramel, and German chocolate. The cheese were brie and cheddar. I recommend going and viewing the menu as the website did not match the restaurant. They also have great happy hour options for wine and flat breads which were delicious.

Wine was great, meat and cheeses were well paired, and the live music was much better than a lot of places! I have been a couple of times but last time was for apps while waiting for a table at another restaurant.

Staff was great and very helpful... We got a charcuterie tray of cheeses, meats and they also threw in bread with nuts and almonds on the plate.  Had to chastise them for not having that info on menu as my companion is allergic to nuts.  They did a great thing and did not charge us for the appetizer.  We also got the sea salt chocolate sampler.  Was delicious.  Especially the Ecuadorian chocolate with internal Carmel.  Heavenly.

Relaxing place with some different wines to try. I recommend the temperanillo flight as well as the avocado and tomato hummus. I did not try the truffles, but you can get a truffle flight to pair with the wine and the different options sounded amazing.

I have been coming here for years. I always take my friends and family here when we go out. I was the second person or so to order grubhub from them when they started doing delivery. I have tried most of the menu and I keep coming back for the enchiladas. They are awesome! Overall, the staff is friendly and attentive, they give good and fast service and if they make a mistake (which they usually dont) they quickly remedy it. Check them out, you will not be disappointed.
Great! The Enchilada Trio, Garlic Tequila Shrimp, sopapillas and a banana chimichanga dessert were delicious. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. Look forward to returning!

What a hidden gem. I've have heard about this place from many people and have driven past it a handful of times...we finally were able to experience what everybody was talking about. The service was excellent and the host is super sweet. Service from everyone was great. Their homemade salsa was so good..  we even got some to go for a friend that knew we were there, that's how popular it is. Their red sangria had cherries and chopped apples..one of the best sangrias I've ever had..and their margaritas were so good!  you can tell all of the ingredients were fresh. We had the steak chimichanga and I had the chicken flautas..5 stars for sure. We will definitely be back!

Love this neighborhood spot.  Went twice in the last couple months and was blown away both times. Margaritas, fajitas, enchiladas, and mole sauce are all made perfectly. Staff is all super friendly and accommodating for our very active kids. Highly recommend!

OMG, the Grilled Salmon is killer and the Fajitas are nicely charred to perfection.  Mom's really takes such care for the flavors, the freshness, and the quality!  This place is a great value!  Can't wait for full seating again so we can enjoy the tasty Margs while munching on an app!  I've been Mexican all my life and can guarantee Mom's Old recipe is super authentic with a classy flair!

PS, I would share pics but the food looked and smelled sooooooo freakin good, I snarfed it all down before I could grab my phone!  Seriously, I lost my mind I couldn't think of anything else while eating.  Thanks Mom's!

Fast forward to March 2022 and I just had some fab braised and stewed pork called cochinito which is phenomenal slow cooked in Mexican spices, some mild, some moderate but all savory. Skirt steak cooked to perfection and mole to die for. MOR keeps us coming back for more!!

There at 10:45am:
Not a single employee wearing a mask today, when I asked if they could put them on they both turned their back on me and one walked away. I left immediately without purchasing anything. I have reported this location to the IDPH, City of Chicago health inspectors and dunkin corporate. If you don’t want to wear a mask on your time fine, but in an establishment where the food is out in the open to not wear a mask is not only violating state mandate, but violating basic human decency. There are plenty of great Dunkin Donuts near here, AVOID THIS LOCATION AT ALL COSTS.

Nasty coffee. Stopped here before 4 hour road trip to Detroit and employee wouldn’t let me use the bathroom. As a paying customer. Unreal. Get rid of chain coffee restaurants in Logan and replace them with local businesses that care and participate in the community

1 star cuz no option of 0 star
Worst dunking in chicago,  they dont even bother to mix the ice coffee lazy employees you feel the bad lazy vibes as soon u enter the place    only good emloyee was Darius
This place sucks!!!!!!!!¡¡

Ordered my coffee ahead and I got there in about 5 minutes and walked in and there must have been about 8 people ordering coffee or waiting. I walked right in and my Latte was ready, picked up and left,  they have a small shared parking lot but I was able to park right away. I did not interact with anyone but I didn't have to. will come back.
I ordered hash browns and they served me this! It’s a couple of crumbles in a bag. The woman who served us was also really rude.
Very great place! Had the pleasure to talk to the employee as I was ordering my coffee. Very positive energy and atmosphere.
Great coffee even better donuts
Just got an old tough chewy bagel from here. I guess if you get it toasted they think it will pass but this is downtown. There is no reason to be selling day old anything.
this Dunkin’ Donuts LOVES you wether you coming in at 2am or 10am they took great care of us at midnight and the same great care of us that morning after, their drinks and sandwhiches are delicious
I go to this Dunkin because Amir makes the best dunkin coffee in town. Amir is one of the coolest guys around. God bless that guy... 🙏

Wish their service was better. Our server didn't refill our drinks for the whole time we were there. At least the guy serving water was more helpful.

The calamari was not seasoned well. The only good thing about the platter was the garlic bread. Deep dish is definitely not for everyone. We didn't like how the pizza tasted. It was definitely not worth waiting for over an hour. We probably only ate a quarter of it and took the rest as leftovers. No one else has eaten the leftovers.

Busy place during lunch time. Had to wait for the Chicago style pizza around 40min, but than again it was clear that they made it properly and that it is not an easy process. We were with 2 and hungry, managed to eat only half of medium sized. Yes this pizza deserves to exist, thou it was too much mozzarella for my taste. Definitely an interesting experience. Is it the best place to get this type of pizza I do not know but I got what I wanted and happy with the result, pleasant waitress, a bit loud inside.

I’d arrived in Chicago as a brief one night stop over for a connecting flight and decided to make the most of my time there.

Instantly falling in love with this city and exploring on foot is the way to go. So much to see and experience as you wander around. And of course it is Chicago so naturally it’s good to find original pizza pie and get the real taste of the city.

Google Maps helpfully took me to Giordano’s and promised original Chicago style pizza and hospitality. It did not disappoint. Ethan who looked after me in the restaurant was great. A local guy who knows Chicago well and is great with his recommendations on what to eat from the menus. He suggested the classic which looked as good as it tasted. I’ve noticed they even sell pizzas you can take home and cook which is great if you are local or travelling elsewhere and want to share with your family and friends (if you just wanted for it all to yourself I don’t think anyone would blame you either).

For a great atmosphere, excellent pizza and really nice people, do try Giordano’s while you are in Chicago.

Stopped here for lunch on a Saturday. Takes 45 min for a pizza so don't wait until you're starving to get here (it takes time to cook those deep dish pizzas!). Had a small deep dish pizza with meatballs. Arrived hot and fresh. Very good! Plenty for two people with some to take home.

I came to Chicago open minded and wanting to try their famous deep dish pizza.

I first tried Giordano's.  Well...  For a surprise, it is a surprise.  I now understand why some place in the USA they call their pizza, "pizza pies", because that's what it is: a pie, literally.  I will never get why Chicagoans use pie dough instead of real pizza dough.  They use it for deep dish pizza, stuffed pizza, and even thin crust pizza.  Real disappointment.  Also, expensive for what you get.

You still have to try it, it's just not for me.

I go to this location every morning (it's the only one I like and I've been to many) and ever staff member from the manager down know what I come for, what's even better is they have my beverage made before I get to the counter and pay, and it's always spot on. Every one has been pleasant to me and others even you can tell the staff member is fatigued. I've been there to observe their interactions with other customers and the never falter. So if anyone said they were rude that person was being overly sensitive or was looking to complain about something and they chose them

Rude, charges for every single thing..down to the whip cream for drinks that are supposed to come with it.. then didn't give it to me after paying for it.. and had the nerve to look at my drink like it was a issue. If you don't like a job then do the customers a favor and get another job. No personality just rude.. make no sense to me..
They got my order right at 5am‼️
Sometimes the lines are long because they only have 1 person taking and making orders but the staff is nice and the food nice and hot.

Stole $5 from me.

I paid for a drink, then the person looked in the back, said they didn't have what I had ordered, and since there was no manager on staff they couldn't issue a refund.

Go to a real coffee shop instead.

Nice diner. Clean. Service is great. Timing for food preparation is normal. Taste of the food is average. Huge selection of pies. I got the European truffle pie, it was delicious.
One thing that I did not like is there was no music, thus I had to listen to other people conversations.
Would come back.

Went there for the pies. Got many people recommending their pies, and sure enough they were so good. The place is big and there was only one server to tables, but she was so nice. Loved the pumpkin pancakes as well. Gotta be going there occasionally to try all their pies.
The fresh strawberry pie was okay, but doubt the "best pie in america" sign. Maybe I had wrong pick. The staff was slightly disorientated.

We eat here frequently.  The menu is healthy,  tasty and the selections often change. The wait staff features people like Christopher who get to know the customers as well as the menu. The Manager Michael always has a ready smile. And on Wednesdays the meals include free pie.
The breakfast was great 👍🏻 and great service I had vegetarian Omelette very delicious.

I ordered a cheese pizza slice and it was huge! Thin crust baked nicely, excellent full of flavor, and nice amount of cheese. Yummy. Warning, if you want crisp, this isn't crisp, more like NY style which I like! The kitchen staff are fast in preparing the pizza.

I wanted to try a vegetarian/vegan pizza that had toppings but unfortunately the only choice was cheese pizza. I couldn't order the vegan slice pizza with toppings  due to my allergy. I wanted to order one more food and didn't want a huge pizza instead try to order a vegan sandwich so I asked about a specific ingredient in the vegan meat due to my allergy. Staff did not know and manager response repeatedly "I don't know." I was taken aback that she wouldn't try figure out or call the owner or the guy that actually made the vegan beef. She said she didn't have contact numbers and didn't know and couldn't find out. As a manager, that was not how one answer the customer. From my experience, vegan restaurants will find the answer for their customers. The cashier was apologetic and tried to be helpful.

The interior decor reflect the name opposite of exterior. It is unique and easily located on a corner.  The space is not large. It is best for order to go especially for large group/family.  There are a few high chairs seating for one or two people. Also four tables for 2 people. Parking on the street is available.

Came here for a quick bite near closing time. Ordered their vegan slice with "sausage" which was huge. I've actually never had vegan pizza so I don't have any comparisons but it was pretty good. Their pesto cheese bread was buttery and flakey. I would get it again!

I grew up in Chicago and near west burbs, and I am super picky about pizza.  I've eaten a variety of pizzas here and in Italy.  This has been our go-to pizza spot for as long as they've been open here in Logan Square, which I think is 10 or 11 years?  Anyhow, I love their unique and creative pizza combos. Their pizzas are very large.  The crust is thin, with a substantial edge that is sprinkled with oregano, which I really like. It's not the traditional style Chicago thin crust that I grew up with, but in some ways, like the herbed crust and lack of greasiness, it's better. We moved from Logan recently and this is one place I will really miss because there's no other pizza place like this.  Okay, maybe there is one sorta like it in Palermo.

I've gotten slices of the day from Dante's several times, and they are always delicious! Slice of the day today was very spicy with three different kinds of peppers! Huge slices. They were playing "What We Do in the Shadows" on the TV. Latin inscriptions and a wooden pizza paddle with goat head/ pentacle hanging on the wall give the interior a Gothic feel.

Easily one of the best pizzas in the city gotta put in back in the oven once you get it delivered and then its absolutely perfect once the bottom is nice and crisp. The pepperoni is also the size of my face the sauce is always good and the dough itself is tasty.

This location is kept clean and running on point. Have been in this neighborhood for a handful of years and gotten iced coffees and baskets of fries, OJ and fish sandwiches on quick food runs and it’s always worked out. Drive through is the quickest. Trying out curbside pickup for the first time today and I don’t recommend it.

Many things have changed in Logan Square,since I grew up here in the 80's. Happy to see McDonalds is still there! With great customer service! So far...one of the friendliest Mc Donald's I've been to!

Looks like standards on quality is starting to slip before food really good and looked here and there like the picture now it looks messy when opening the food or even food put together and not even stirred or mixed like the oatmeal water poured nit stirred so half cooked and half uncooked oatmeal. Now I had to change my rating from 2 to 1 star since my food I ordered today 9/9/2022 was not done right and missing items asked for 2 shakes no whip cream and even with stickers on cups stating that they still fill with whip cream and the 2 oreo mcflurry I ordered never received them and when calling to ask they never answer their phone.

I haven't been to McDonald's in a long time since it's usually disappointing, but I was intrigued by their current world favorites promotion where they are bringing international Mcdonald's dishes to the U.S. I grabbed one of everything which includes the Grand McExtreme bacon burger, tomato mozzarella chicken sandwich (crispy), cheesy bacon fries, and a Stroopwafel McFlurry. I also threw in a sausage, egg & cheese McGriddle because why the heck not would I miss out on that goodness?

My order was prepared pretty quick and soon I left, food in hand. How did the food taste? Meh. I already guessed the cheesy bacon fries were going to use cheap nacho cheese, but man I didn't expect it to be that bad. The cheap, salty cheese and bacon combined with the fact that McDonald's fries are already extremely salted makes for a devastatingly sea salt level dish. I felt like I was going to dry up like a snail from just the first couple of fries. The amount of cheese and bacon on a $4 menu item was also terrible. I mean you're using the cheapest cheese you can find and you only put a little dab in the middle? Not good.

The Grand McExtreme Bacon Burger was also very flat in terms of taste and surprisingly salty. The thing about onions too is that if you're using cheap, bad quality onions, cutting them into big chunks makes it all more obvious which is what happened here. Sauteed onions would've been a better option. The gouda cheese was perfectly melted and very mild so it didn't add much in terms of flavor. As I was eating it I forgot there was even sauce on it as I was mostly tasting salt.

Tomato & Mozzarella chicken sandwich was decent. It sure does look good though. There's some sauce here as well, but the theme of strange saltiness & bad thick cut onion chunks continued here. I swear it almost seemed like they cut up half 1/3 of an onion and tossed it on here. Taking away the onions made it a much better sandwich. The chicken was crisp albeit a little dry.

Ah, and finally we have dessert. How can you go wrong with added Stroopwafels to a McFlurry? You can't! This was the best of the bunch with the caramel stroopwafel chunks meshing in perfectly with the Mcflurry. They even coated the top of the cup in caramel. McDonald's gets an A+ on this one and should definitely make it a regular menu item. As a quick mention the McGriddle was good. Hard to go wrong there.

Overall the food is a mixed bag. I don't know where McDonald's went wrong that made everything so salty and it seems whoever works the onion station absolutely LOVES onions. The staples like the McGriddle & McFlurry were good, but the rest were disappointing.

3 out of 5 stars

It's my first time coming here and I want to try their food. They have a self ordering machine where I can order myself. I tried their chicken sandwich, plain burger, chicken with rice and Mcfloat. I ordered a lot since I was too hungry at that time. I'll wait a few minutes to call my order number. It took so long because there were a lot of people here. After minutes it came and I looked for a table.

I tried their burger first. Their burger was really plain. It has a thin patty and a sauce on it. The bun was good. I gave this 3 over 5. Their chicken burger was really good. The chicken was juicy and it had some lettuce and onion on it. I also like their chicken with rice. The flavor of chicken was so intense and it was juicy. Lastly, their Mac floats are also delicious. It is sweet and cold. Overall I enjoy their food except for the Plain burger.

I don't know if I've ever left a review before, but this was necessary. I ordered a tamale to go, and when I opened it they had wrapped it still in it's microwave wrapping. Not only do they serve frozen tamales, but they can't even be bothered to remove it from the prepackaged wrapper to try to hide that fact. No amount of good food can make up for that.

Decent beef. Ordered with provolone, hot and sweet peppers. It had hot peppers, no sweet and no cheese. And there was only 1 other person there, so not like mine got messed up in a rush or anything. Also quite small for the price. Overall a pretty terrible value. The food tastes good and would probably taste even better if prepared properly but I wouldn't know. Went because it's supposedly some of the best beef in Chicago, it's good but not even close to Johnnies or even Portillos. Won't be back.

This has nothing to do with service as the people there are very nice. This review is based on the quality of the product and it was bad here. Asked me if I wanted dipped, with cheese, and peppers, and I said yes of course. When I get my food, the sandwich was dryer than the Sahara, no cheese, and there was literally ONE sweet pepper in the corner for the whole sandwich. This was NOT worth 13$. Will not be coming back to this location again.

I saw a travel Chanel clip about he original Al's Beef location so I had to try it. I had the regular beef sandwich and it was disgustingly delicious!

When I opened the bag there was another plastic bag with a paper wrapper inside of it. The paper wrapper had that beautiful orange glisten to it that lets you know your taste buds are about to love you and your stomach is not going to work properly for a week. The bun is wet but not exactly soggy and the sheer volume of beef is crazy! Then there are the peppers on top that give it that beautiful color and a spicy kick when it hits your tongue.

If you're in Chicago you've got to stop here once and get the original Italian beef sandwich.

My wife got he Chicago dog and it might have been the best hotdog I've ever had so you can't go wrong there.

I live in Wicker Park and was not that excited to see another chain opening up here. As it was being built I furiously protested for hours on end. I started an ONAB(Occupy Not Al's Beef)(Get it?) movement and started a signature signing for those who promised to boycott it after it opened. But all those hours of protesting and boycotting, I got pretty hungry and after it opened the beef smelled so good I had to try it.

And I'll tell you what, the food is pretty good. Its a mess of dripping beef and gooey cheese and salty fries. Make sure you get the sandwich dipped, that is if you know whats good for you. They have a million different types of greasy fries, I would recommend the loaded fries. You will be sure to gain at least 5lbs every time you eat here... That is if you are living life the right way, and order what I described above.

This particular location has been sparse with people and I wonder if its because the prices are just a little too high for the neighborhoods taste. Clearly I am a fatty mcfatterson (if you couldn't tell by the above recommended meal) and would like to eat fast food meals for cheap. But curiously Al's Beef does lighten my wallet by about that same 5 lbs that I gain by eating there... But those could be the days when I go there and pay with my wallet full of pennies.

Best steak I’ve had in a long time!

Mastro’s provides a great atmosphere and high quality food. The steak was to the point and seasoned perfectly…absolutely delicious!

Also the staff is very friendly, attentive and courteous. The whole evening was accompanied by a piano player 😊

Ate at the bar for mother's day. Definitely get reservations. Sometimes you can dine at the bar and sometimes not so check at the desk. Things will vary as COVID goes up and down I'm sure. Great service, drinks, and food. If you're ordering dessert, get the order in so you can have it or take it to go as they're pretty popular. Live singer during dinner was great. It's pretty dark so use a light source to view the menu. Menu was recently revamped as well as the spirits menu.

I felt like a VIP from the moment I stepped into this fantastic establishment!

Our Waiter Omar Garcia was outstanding. He truly rolled out the red carpet for me and my client.  He was informative, helpful and made fantastic recommendations. He genuinely enjoys what he does and brought a very positive energy to the dining experience.

The food was excellent. The best Pork Chop I have ever eaten and the Brandy Apple Pecan Sauce took that meat to another level.  The 8 oz Filet was also delicious. It was cooked perfectly and full of flavor.  The Truffle Butter really kicked it up a notch as well.

As for dessert, Omar was very kind and treated us to two desserts on the house. The New York Style Cheesecake was really good. However the Butter Cake with the Vanilla Ice Cream was the real winner.  It was freaking awesome!

After dinner, we headed to the bar area where there was a very talented young musician performing on the piano.  We enjoyed finishing our wine listening to nice music. What a great way to end the night!

This is definitely a winner and a special place.  Worth the money.

Good food. Great service. I highly recommend the Lobster Bisque. It was the perfect consistency with nice chunks of Lobster. My NY strip was good as well, but nothing extraordinary. The service here is always impeccable.

I came here around March 2021 for an anniversary dinner. The waiter that we had was absolutely the sweetest. (I will update with his name) we had some scallops and and bacon to start and we each had a steak for entree! The steaks were cooked to the perfect temperature. Everything was well seasoned we also had an order or spinach and corn! That tied everything together. Accompanied with a bottle of rose! I cannot wait to come back here!! We also got a beautiful dessert on the house for the occasion!! Thank you!!

We did both Dine-in and Delivery. We had Taco Burrito King three times in a week during our trip to Chicago. This was the best Mexican food we've ever had! If you get the super nachos, get the chips on the side.

Will never go back to Taco Burrito King. They always get your order wrong no matter which one you go to. I noticed they reheat the meat several times whatever is left on the grill they throw back into the pot of already cooked meat.This is a serious form of food contamination. The meat is chewed and does not taste fresh. Don't even try their chicken tacos even worse than the steak. So long taco burrito king.  Adios!!!

We arrived and waited about 5 minutes before someone said anything to us. We considered walking out but my wife was hungry so we stayed. We dined in, chips and salsa were not free. The salsa was a little salty. She had enchiladas (could use more sauce) and I had 3 steak tacos (they were ok, but pricey). Tacos were $3.90 each but they didn't have everything, like sour cream, lettuce, etc. Overall, it was an ok place. Nothing spectacular but ok.

The food was banging! Steak King Burrito done right 👌 Horchatas also done very well.  TBK has their unique style and I wish I could get them beyond Illinois! Highly recommend Belmont/Harlem location. RIP Rick. Current staff could be a little friendlier.
Always Fresh n Delicious. Large portions but a bit pricey for what it is. Steak & Cheese fries are Delicious if your not craving Mexican
Quick service, great atmosphere. Got the mango green tea boba, which was yummy. Definitely will come back.

It’s a cute little spot. However, there was only one person running the entire store. That means cashiering, cleaning the lobby, making drinks, and making sandwiches. I had to wait more than 10 mins for my order and another 20 to get my drink. If staffing is an issue(and for most businesses it is)they may want to consider not serving sandwiches or time consuming items on those days.This was not worth the headache of waiting for a $7 drink.
Amazing smoothies with boba grate selection of flaver

Overcharged then after calling them they told me that they would have to refund my money and charge me again which the refund would take a couple of days to show up in my account. Such an inconvenience. Should have not overcharge me in the first place not my fault. If I don’t check my receipt I would have  not noticed. I suggested for them to just give me the credit for next time but all they told me they can do is give me one of their punched cards for a regular size drink or small coffee which was not the full amount overcharged. What a waste of time!

Ate there two days in a row. Not a ton of sandwich options, but it was fine! First day, got the cheesy sandwich, tasted good. Second day, I tried something new. The turkey provolone. It was just not good. I tried to eat half of if, but decided to ask to exchange. I went up to the counter and told him I’d like an exchange because I did not like it. He took the sandwich and threw it away. Then, he went to ring me up for another sandwich. That’s when I questioned why? Long story short, if he would’ve told me I needed to buy a whole sandwich, I would’ve suffered thru and atr the food I didn’t enjoy. Instead, he threw it away, and wanted to charge me full price for another sandwich. I was very confused and after him going back and forth, I said I don’t need a full sandwich, make me half, or I’ll even pay for some of it since I know he’s putting in work. After going back and forth, I left. He saw I ate less than 75% of the sandwich and did not mention having to buy a new one when I went to replace it. Would’ve solved all the issues.

Update: family member referred me to the place & when they went to buy food questioned my interaction. Was then refunded

The portion of the Italian beef sandwich is great, the meat however needs to simmer more (kind of tough). If you add $4.00 to your sandwich, you get fries and a can pop. The chili was very salty. The fries didn't look pleasing at all, they don't look like what they would put on a poster for advertisement.

Food is great. I absolutely love it. My only complaint is every time the guy answers the phone he screws up my order. If the female answers, it is always spot on. The delivery guy really needs to stop answering the phone. When we try to order from my office, if he answers we just hang up, and go some place else.
Great place w friendly staff. I got a cheeseburger when I ordered a hamburger but they were super chill and made me a new one right away 👍 and let me keep the cheeseburger to give to my brother

Get al your old school favorites here I was genuinely impressed by the menu and the food did not disappoint at all and the portions are on point bring a good appetite and enjoy I ordered the gyros plate I'm still eating it on the 3rd day

The helpings are flavorful, juicy and delicious.  This is not the corner side greasy! Their food is the bomb.( Go to Madison and Halsted) for better.
A light touch for us was chicken sha-kabob with rice. Soo....filling.  One order will fill two mouths. (Get an extra pita and tzaikii sauce). Get a side of rice too.
Chicago Pita, and their accessory menu will satisfy your appetite

Pros:
Food, food, food. The portions are healthy and every dish as delicious as the last. Prices are hard to beat too. Really a great spot to grab some grub!

Cons:
The dinning room / restaurant itself is very dark and dated. This would knock it down to 4 stars if not for the fact that it is BYOB!

My favorite curry shop for 5 years & counting! I see a lot of takeout business, but mostly I prefer to sit in their simple dining room with a pot of hot jasmine tea & read the zodiac place mat ... again. Menu prices are among the lowest in Chicago, & the lunch special has to be one of the best deals anywhere.

Great food, great portions at a great price. I have been coming here for years and have rarely ever been disappointed. Pad Thai and Com Suon are some of my personal faves. And no meal is complete without an order of spring rolls, shrimp prawns, and Thai iced coffee! Service is friendly and consistent. And let's not forget.... BYOB!
This place has the best vegetable soup, its hot and tasty it also has fried tofu in it as well. The food is made fresh so dont expect it to come out lighting fast, but its well worth the wait.
Family owned restaurant who knows about food! It's BYOB with no cork fee. Great for take outs and deliveries. Big menu, big portions, great prices!
This is good location the was great. I always get an black forest ham or turkey sandwich. The staff was cool and it's not that crowded. I would continue to come here the area is safe.

Stopped to get 3 footlong turkey subs for me and my family. Needless to say the tons of vegetables were good, just wish I’d tasted the turkey I asked for. It must’ve melted during my car ride back home. I’ll stick with Mr submarine ✨
They have very slow service. Waiting line was very long. They just have one server.. I don't recommend this location.

10/18/21 @ 0044 hrs, walked in and was told by employee that after he served a customer he would take a 15 minute break and the only reason he was serving the other customer was because he was “tipping” him $10 extra to make his sandwich. 8 minutes after he finished the order and small talking with “tipping” customer, he asked me how much would I give him to make my sandwich. The outgoing customer gave him $5 just to make my sandwich. Unbelievable poor manipulating service. Please do not support.
Baloney!!! That I paid $15 Dollars for a combo sandwich meal?!? Subway will likely be joing Circut City, the dinosaurs, and Elvis soon.

What a great place! I love grabbing a quick breakfast on my way through in the morning, and they're always VERY accommodating of my strange breakfast requests. And rather than upcharge me for my custom choices they charge incredibly reasonable prices. Today, the cashier charged me what I thought was a very reasonable amount! By the time I got my food she was ready with $2 and an apology for overcharging me. Holy cow. What nice folks! Buy their food; you won't regret it.

I ordered a chicken, egg, and cheese sandwich from here almost daily while working in the Mart for a summer. Since I was a repeat customer, they often had my food ready before I even finished ordering. They also offer reasonable prices compared to the other Mart vendors.

The food was AMAZING! The food was extremely fresh and came out very fast! Also great customer service! The woman who took my order was very sweet and patient. Reasonable prices. I ordered a steak n egg with swiss plus fries and cheese sauce for 11.29 including tax. :)
Excellent hamburger, what a value.  :) Good Stuff

Apparently, Billy Goats is a big deal in Chicago. I've heard of the name, but I've never been compelled to stop in until it became a connivence.  I eat here often for lunch since it's so close to work. I really like the workers in this building very friendly and they get you in and out. I'll recommend this place.

Just the perfect neighbourhood restaurant with great food and vibe. Liked that they have both vegan/vegetarian options but also “regular” food. We got the breakfast burrito and small stack of french toast. The burrito is very filling…nice size. It gets busy so the food does take awhile but service is friendly and all the patrons are also very patient. It’s cash only so bring some cash…they do have an ATM in the restaurant in case you need to get some cash 👍

Went on a Friday for brunch, no trouble getting a table. Food was delicious, but the service was a bit off.. it took quite a long time for a server to acknowledge our existence, despite the restaurant being practically empty. Sat for about 15 min before anyone came to take a drink order, and then another 10 or so more before they came back, but besides that I enjoyed it! Cool atmosphere, the coffee was great and the food was definitely comfort in a bowl.

Food was tasty but I really loved the wild berry loose leaf tea. 🙂They were skimpy on the honey.  Nice cozy diner feel. The only problem was that they only take cash 😐. They offered their in house ATM but I'm just not very trusting with the small ATM chains

Great food, great crew! Every breakfast option is tasty. We ate there literally every morning while visiting Chicago.
I definitely recommend.

I got a breakfast burrito with steak. The burrito was fine, but the it overall lacked seasoning and they didn’t have salsa so it was pretty bland. The breakfast potatoes was really good and they had the best vegan pancakes I’ve ever had! Nice and fluffy and doughy. The service was great and super fast!

Good fast food, I would never eat sushi from here.  Place needs to be DEEP CLEANED ASAP.. Been in multiple times to see sushi being made with bare hands, cross contamination!! ..  Thing's you don't see when you order food from uber.
Small place 4 tables. lots of take out business! Sushi was excellent chicken on chicken pad Tai was runbery and meh, but noodle were on point and delicious. Prices matched quality.

Small portions (the photo is of dinner sized Basil Fried Rice entree). The first time I visited the customer service left a lot to be desired, but the second time we were treated well. We enjoyed a few sushi rolls and noodle dishes. Be careful on the spice! No gluten free soy sauce.

I ordered this place from UberEats.
The sushi is so delicious and fresh even though I ordered it so late at night. Pretty cheap for the portion.
I find their sticky rice weird though, not the typical Thai. Unfortunately, it doesn't taste good.
This is what quality sushi tastes like! Anytime I'm back in town I have to come back for more!!!! And the crab rangoon are perfect!

Amazing food and fantastic service! If you are in Chicago I would highly recommend you dropping buy! Will be going again on my next visit. Pizza bread appetizer melts in the mouth, chicken Alfredo is simply devine, service is second to none, our server was friendly and helpful without being in your face but always there when needed.
Some of the best pizza in chicago! Great pizza and a fantastic sweet sauce that they are known for. Even better, great service as well!

Been coming here for over 30 years. We know the brothers mostly through business.
There good men. Dam good pizza and other dishes if you love Italian cuisine this is the place. Family owned and run for generations. 👍⭐⭐⭐⭐

What a good pizza. I was turned off at first when I went a couple times. But this time it wad totally different. The pizza was fresh. They were hot. The owner rang us up quickly. This Is and the other palermos are My favorite Chicago pizza. Thanks guys for being so good. I am so glad I gave it another chance. The sweet sauce is so good I can't explain. Something about it. Anyway seriously trry this pizza. I get the regular crust but anyway is good really. 👍

This is one of the best pizzas in the city bar none. If you haven't given Palermo's the chance, do it. You owe this pizza to yourself. 🍕 It puts other places to shame. My family gets this pizza at least once a week.

Old world family operated Italian deli.
Feel right at home in Nonas kitchen.Papa at the counter.
Sandwiches,pizza and Italian Ice.
Indoor outdoor dining.Food good.Service good.Pricing average.Decor very interesting with many Mayor Daley pictures.when in the hood stop by.parking on street easy.
AWARDED 2 YUMS ON A SCALE OF 3

Good sandwiches, even better cannoli's! I haven't tried everything on their menu, but it's a great spot for a quick and easy lunch. Not giving it 5 stars because the ambience could be a little better. When weather is nice, there's a grassy lot next door with no fuss tables and chairs. Maybe that's just what it is.

We had the Breaded Steak and Spicy Italian sub. Both were excellent and the giardiniera was perfectly crunchy which we enjoyed. Ambiance was exactly what I’d want from a small neighborhood Italian deli. Don’t miss this spot!
Their pizza is awesome the crust and sauce is like no other in Chicago great prices as well $26 for a family size cheese and sausage!

Quaint, clean neighborhoody shop with a well-stocked deli case, making great sandwiches and NOW SERVING PIZZA! The pizza is very good, cheesy, tavern cut, and reasonably priced. Anchovies are available. They also sell homemade Italian sausage by the pound. I just wish they were open a little later, but Nonna Soluri's is a Bridgeport staple.
I got the Philly steak fries. The cheese sauce was better than a lot I have tasted. The portions were nice, and the beef was seasoned well.  Pretty good overall.

Had a regular cheese steak & fries. This variety has more bread than meat, and from my experience, limited au jus. The sandwich still has a lot of integrity, but it's not like you won't get your hands greasy eating this. Though not quite visible, the taste of cheese really cuts through. Fries were great crunchy and delicious.

At peak hours service remained pretty fast-paced, so if all else fails, this is a good place to head to.

Got the bacon and ranch fries. Who puts the bacon fat and gristle on the fries?? Barely had any ranch sauce on them either. Many of the fries were undercooked. No wonder they're the only restaurant in food court that has no line! I will never eat here again.

Small bread small meat, they're not very generous with the veggies. I asked for peppers and onion and I got one tiny piece of green pepper and a couple of no its of onions. These weren't full, grilled onion slices, it was just tiny bits.
The beef is way way too salty. It takes away from the actual flavor. They could also use a better bread.
The service was nice but I should have insisted she put more peppers and onion on it.
Won't go back...
Two stars because it tastes good but these Philly steaks are SOOO SMALL! It’s the size of a hot dog!

You guys really need to do a better job of training your employees when it comes to customer service. I just had to go in there not once not twice but three times in regards to what I ordered. I ordered a chicken parmesan salad and they forgot the parmesan crisp. Once I get back to my vehicle I realize that they gave me ranch dressing and set instead of the Caesar dressing. I ordered an extra dressing with my salad and so I took back the ranch and ask for the Caesar, your employee (Sierra) gave me one dressing and then caught an attitude when I asked about the other one. Started throwing dressings back into the mini fridge and slammed the box down and handed me too many dressings talking about take it like I was getting on her nerves or something. I'm on my lunch break and I literally just wasted 12 minutes of that just trying to make sure that my order was correct. I will not patronize again at your location because it is too much going on and no one should have to deal with a person's attitude if they didn't want to be at work
I'm loving their new fries & strawberries frosties yummy.  The app is the Bomb too always good rewards.   I think they trying to keep me fat 😆
My first time eating Breakfast at Wendy's.  It was really good. Coffee was not hot at all. I prefer Hot Coffee.

This place is slow as molasses with taking and serving your orders, either drive thru or going inside. Too many children and they don't care if they are not correctly serving the customers. Yhe owner needs to do a pop up to see just how disorganized they are running this restaurant.
Horrible customer service. For some reason they can't provide a receipt and the order was completely wrong. Please do not waste your money at this location

Earth's Healing Cafe is a great option not only for vegans but for gluten-intolerant foodies. Their juices are cleansing and yummy, made with a variety of fruit, vegetables, spices and true concern.  :-) Smoothies are made with cocoanut water and a host of beautiful raw foods, so it's like going to Costa Rica for a little while!

I had a wonderful salad, but can't remember what it was called: Earth Goddess/Mother Healing something-or-other that was perfect for me that day. It features a whole avocado cut in half with a nut mixture on top, resting on a bed of greens with a garlicky sauce. I asked for olive oil to go with it and it was just fabulous.

Can't wait to return. This will be a new staple lunch place for me. I hope they're planning to expand into an actual café! Right now it's a small take-out only atmosphere.

Do you hate how most healthy drinks taste? Well this is one of the few places where I actually LOVED what I ate. I never got into health drinks simply because they tasted disgusting to me, but this store had amazing tastes that I think even the pickiest eaters might find a drink/smoothie for them. Your body will thank you for putting in premium fuel.

Great place to go, especially if you are raw vegan.  I had an amazing smoothie that was well thought out and was extremely healthy.  If you need an energy boost of a juice or smoothie, then go here.  Fair pricing, too!

Talk about HEALTHY! This counter-service juice bar offers an extensive menu of juice options, a limited food menu and pretty much every herb/spice you've ever heard of - and some you haven't. I really like what these guys are doing. Hopefully the health craze will catch on soon so we can have more Earth's Healing Cafes and fewer unhealthy options around the city!
Had a great zucchini "noodle" and pesto dish with a slice of pie. Totally satisfying meal with great flavor and richness. I need to go here more often.

FRESH INGREDIENTS! Gyros plate ordered.
For $15, I'll try it and it was delicious 😋
A sign that the take out would be good
The utensils: quality plastic & handles
Gyro could use an oz more meat
Tzatziki sauce fresh & creamy
Good ratio of feta and olives
Lettuce and onions, fresh!
Good job 👍 Thanks
Over price for an ordinary simple chicken sandwich. This here is 9.38 , I wouldn’t mind if this extra delicious but this sandwich here price shouldn’t be more that $6.50 Not worth the stop

The remodel & update made them the best gyro place in the neighborhood hands down. Extremely nice update & the new ice cream section is genius, I can't wait to bring my nieces here all the time, they love ice cream ! : ) Great Job ! I love this place. Chocolate milkshake I got was also really good quality, Love !

2 and a half stars.

Place is expensive for what you get. Brought a chicken gyro dinner,  was almost $15 with tax. Not enough chicken to fill the pita, let alone dinner worthy. Chicken was seasoned well but very dry. Also fries are weird, a sort of red seasoned kind, reminiscent of checkers but with almost no potato filling. Got a side salad and received no salad dressing.
The staff is rude, the portions are small, and the prices are HIGH, especially compared with similar places nearby. The food is pretty good, but after my 3rd try, I will not be returning. Woof.

I've been coming to Hong Kong for the past 7 and Half years and let me tell you, they do not disappoint you at all. Their portion size of food you most definitely get your money's worth. The staff is way beyond helpful and friendly. Ready to assist you in anyway possible.  Higley recommend this spot.

Hong Kong Restaurant was such a nice surprise! To be honest, I'd tried going to two other Chinese restaurants before I happened to drive past this place. Both of the other restaurants were closed, even though their posted hours said they should be open. Frustrated, I decided to just go home when I stumbled upon Hong Kong. After making *sure* they were, in fact, open, I parked my car and stepped inside.

It's fairly small with a fast food/walk up counter vibe so I wasn't sure what to expect but nothing ventured, nothing gained, so I ordered my usual: crab rangoon and szechuan chicken. Since white rice was the only option with my meal, I also requested a small order of chicken fried rice. Oh, and I had one can of coke.

Within minutes, my rangoons appeared, deliciously hot, crispy, and full of flavour. A short while later, after asking if I was ready, my main course came out. It. Was. Huge!! And really good! The sauce with the chicken was a little thicker than I like but it still tasted good. The fried rice was perfect.

I was only able to eat 1/4 of what I'd ordered! My bill came out to about $30 - a very fair price, especially considering how how much food I got. I literally have enough food for another 3 meals! I've added Hong Kong Restaurant to my list of go-to places for Chinese food in the city!

This is my go-to Chinese take out place.  Awesome food at such a great price.  Staff is always soo nice and the food comes out quick and piping hot.  My favorite dish is the salt and pepper fish, I highly recommend it!!
Quick, inexpensive and good takeout.  Lunch specials are my go to. If you're in the mood for the standard wok fried takeout this place will do you just fine. Eggrolls always crispy
Great takeout, great prices. Although double check the time it closes because on maps it told me 10pm but they actually closed at 930pm!

Wow. I had few buritos earlier in Chicago, but Chipotle was by far the best. For something like 10$ you are getting soo huge burrito. I am not sure how they can offer this burrito for that price. It is definitely worth it!

My first experience was in other chipotle and it was so bad.. The staff was so rude and unprofessional. I wasn't sure I wanted to go again.
Then I tried this one as it is not far away from my work.. the staff was so friendly and efficient !! It took less than 3 minutes to have my food ready. And it was delicious !
I recommend 100% !!
Very nice place. I had the chicken bowl and it was delicious 😋.

Hands down the GREATEST Chipotle I've ever been to in my LIFE! They never skimp you and give you a bowl so fat that you feel like you've gotten your moneys worth! They Only forgot something one time in all the times I've been there and that's totally cool considering they take care of you so good here. Other Chipotle locations compared to this one look SAD. I would go as far as to say this is the best location in downtown Chicago. Not only fat portions but CONSISTENT.
Healthy (depending on your choices), tasty food for which you don't have wait. Efficient and friendly service.

I just now tasted the world famous chicken here at the KFC restaurant, the customer service of this place are too good. Very friendly, efficient and really on point to their work. Quick service.  The food was timely cook and served hot. The chicken was really excellent taste. The quality is always consistent.  Overall I was pretty satisfied with the service I received at this location. I also like their mashed potatoes. That some of the reason why loyal customers visit their favorite restaurant because of the qualities I mentioned above. Definitely will visit this location again and will recommend to my families and friends. Their chicken is fresh and delicious!

For our family's 4th of July celebration, my folks put me in charge of the KFC so I placed an online order for a scheduled pickup and when I arrived, a kind salesperson informed me that the food had been prepared too early and she needed some time to re-do the order. She was so kind and apologetic and she even gave us extra biscuits! I am so grateful that the employees worked so hard to fix an understandable mistake- I would have been in hot water if the KFC had been cold! Thank you KFC @ 1144 S. Western staff!!!

I bought a chicken sandwich only because they said the sandwich was made to order. Not only was it not fresh, it was greasy and sauce was slopped all over. The only thing good was the ice in the lemonade.👎🏿

Please be aware of their chicken there. Check your food for quality before you leave there so when you get to your final destination to eat your food your chicken not looking nasty an triffling like this. I had to put this out there because this was just plane nasty an triffling of them.

I was scheduled for an interview with Lisa Simmons they kept sending emails and text reminding me I had an upcoming interview Saturday at 11:30 I did confirm! I got there no one knew about my interview she was not even there I waited to get interview the girl was probably the manager she took down my info and said come back Monday for a second interview i am not not returning they looked racist had only colored people working there and unprofessional the way she was writing my info the way she was Looking and asking questions!
Food was hood but the service was bad. How long does it actually take to prepare juice in a darn near empty restaurant?

Service is excellent!!!! Servers are very attentive patient and polite! The food is delicious ! You gotta try their empanadas omg so delicious! And their drinks aren't weak at all their strong! Love the atmosphere and environment. Great place to go on a date with your love one. They play relaxing live music while you eat. Then a live band plays its awesome! I enjoy coming here as often as I can :)

Arrived and there were plenty of seats and our server came around fast to take our order.  Got some food and drinks that were OK.  They have live music at night but we had a show to go to so we did not stay. Overall it was a nice visit.

Stopped in and ordered to go for myself and 2 friends since I live so close and wanted to eat at home. Ordered 2 different dishes one of them twice for 3 orders total. Two of the dishes were great tasting and decent sized. The third which just happened to be mine was grossly undersized with minimal meat portion. I was told it was to be 8oz of meat. When I arrived home I actually weighed it and found it to be just under 2oz of beef. It tasted great but unfortunately that just isn't compensation for the lack in portion size.

Is very nice place is the first time we came to sibonny Cuban cuisine in is very good. ..my husband and me & my friend loved. .for now you can bring you on drink. .beer wine tequila or whatever you like to drink I recommend

John's Place once earned an award for best burger at the Roscoe Burger Fest (sp?) and I can totally see why. The burgers are very good and have a good size, though the highlight is having a cup of gumbo as an appetizer. The staff is friendly and the laid back atmosphere makes it a pleasant experience to be there. The prices are a little too high for what John's Place offers but it is still a place worth going to every couple of weeks or so.

Solid standby for a Lincoln Park brunch, lunch or casual dinner. They make great bloody Mary's, I like their breakfast burrito and the chilaquiles when I am in the mood for brunch.  They also make great burgers - try the black jack if you want a kick otherwise you can build your own.  When it's warm outside, get there early to snag an outside table.

A little bit pricey for what it is, but the food really is good. I like this place because of their outdoor seating. I am a sucker for going to places where I can eat outside. Go there, bring a date, family, friends, or even your dog and enjoy Lincoln Park on a sunny day while eating at John's Place.

Visited Joh's during Retro on Roscoe. Stopped in with a group of 7 and they were very accomidating. The food was decent. Our group shared a chorizo quesadilla and the pulled pork nachos. Both were solid but nothing to write home about. For my entree I had the Cowboy burger. Solid, but again, nothing to write home about. Had a good time but I would attribute that to the fest rather than John's itself.

I went in no music no TV dead silence. I ordered a glass of chardonnay I did not request any type and there house was $9 a glass. Seriously a rip off. Will never go back. I ordered the chorizo stuffed dates asked for bacon well done it was like rubber- It was gross

This location is really clean and nice! The person who helped me was nice and efficient. Unfortunately I can tell she is stressed out. She was the only one working on a Saturday morning. I completely understand staff shortages but where is the manager? I was a manager at a restaurant and we were trained to be there for our employees and make sure we didn’t get backed up. It’s extremely disheartening to see a hard working employee by themself with a line to the door. You are doing a great job! But the GM needs to step up.

The worst customer service ever!
First they have no customer skills whatsoever.
Both Indian workers bullying the new girl, making her do all the drinks.
They are slow AF, I waited 20+ min for my order to be completed.
This is the thing if you see a customer waiting isn’t common sense to ask if something is missing.
They never say hello good morning. Or May I help you!.
This issue is being going on for years. Doesn’t really matter if they change personal.
Which make me think 🤔 about the owner who gives a F…k about his business.
Employees here are unhappy and overworked
But that’s not an excuse to be rude.

The woman who always works at night is very kind and works hard. However, it's best not to do a mobile order, as they don't make them until all of the orders placed in person are done. This means that if you arrive 5 to 10 minutes after placing the order and there is a line, you will still have to wait until everyone in line has ordered and their coffee has been made before they will start yours. This has been my experience at least 8 to 10 times.

Very bad location I arrived to pick up my order and the lady treated me badly the lady should not work in that place I should definitely be out of that store it gives a bad impression And I don’t understand the way she speaks

Unprofessional and rude service. The girl was was talking on the phone while taking my order and giving me attitude as if I had interrupted her conversation. Disgusting inside. People give it 5 stars but it looked nasty inside.

This is my first time ordering here I ordered chicken Pad Thai beef and broccoli and sweet and sour chicken there was not enough sauce on any of our entrees. Very  light flavor. The meat was cooked well. But We felt like it could have been better in larger  containers to allow for extra sauce. Ijs what are we supposed to put on the white rice?

I got to say this place is incredibly underrated. I've gone there a few times and have to say the quality of ingredients is amazing. I have not experonced the entirety of their menu because of how large it is. But I can say I've gotten the fried rice multiple times and it has been incredible every single time. Just tried the general TSO chicken and that was the best I've ever had. Their prices are incredibly reasonable and the service is fast and friendly.

DON’T order after 8pm, especially on the Weekends!! This place is usually very good I’ve been ordering from them the same 4 items per order for over a year and a half. I usually brag about this place to people, but there is one male employee that works there that is always extremely rude if you order within the last hour before they close (8-9pm.)

They did not include my appetizer and made the lo mien incorrectly.

When I called the restaurant to try to explain and for my item, etc was RUDELY cut off and was TOLD what I ordered even though I repeated the order originally. Then I was yelled at immediately and cut off, even after asking him to listen to me and reminding him that I’m the customer. I didn’t understand, because I’m a long-time customer! yes he has been rude and inconsiderate before, but normally it’s forgivable. Before he has told me within the last hour before they close that I couldn’t get a combination egg foo young  because it takes so long. With 1 hour left and I .5 mile away?  I ordered barbecue pork appetizer, combination egg foo yong, combination lo mien  noodles & wonton soup = 50% incorrect. My dollar has power and we have options. Plus I’m a 20 high level Hospitalities & Marketing professional as well.

One of my favorite spots for Asian food in the neighborhood. I’ve ordered there probably 4-5 times and will definitely be continuing to go there. Especially recommended the curry fried rice and moo shu beef.
I love the Jumbo shrimp fried rice and he was nice enough to make it spicy for me. Will come back again to try the Vietnamese dishes.
The manager here is very rude has very dry lips and yells at her employees in front of customers
Always wrong with the order busy or not even just asking simple things

Omg Nikki is the best ever! So sweet and bubbly! And she has the order memorized for almost everyone who steps through the door in the morning. I’ve picked up coffee for my husband a handful of times and I don’t even know what his order is. I just tell her it’s coffee for that tall guy and she knows exactly who I’m talking about, lol.  It’s such a great start to my day when she takes my order :-)
Used to be a good place... now Ghetto.. you can feel the hate when you order. They don't even talk..just stare at the register.

This is hands down the best Dunkin' Donuts! Best customer service I've ever had, Antoine is just a sunshine always cheerful and most of all pays special attention to anything he serves you!!! No matter how rough your day is always better after leaving!

BEST GREEK SALADS ! I always order from here and I’m never disappointed! I’ve never had a better Greek salad than Mr. Zee’s. Their Greek salad dressing ….. I mean I wish I had a gallon of it at home so I can put it on everything. I think they should start selling it or maybe give me the recipe ?? Either way I’d be happy 😊  The spanakopita spinach pie and also amazing. I miss their rice pudding. I don’t think they make it anymore but regardless Mr Zees is amazing !!!! Thank you for your delicious food 😁

it was ok. i fell like it use to be better along time ago. i ordered grill chicken sandwich and the chicken breast was a bit hard.
other order was half chicken dinner and was decent.
Yey!! My favorite is back!! Gotta try those rib rips its so delish!! Love the chicken too, so saucy and tasty.  Friendly people too!!! 😊😊😊

This was my favorite place to go when I lived in Chicago, now when I visit its one if the first places I go to. Great roasted chicken dinners.  Unfortunately,  their prices have gone up, so much, and smaller portions that I see fewer people than before.  Still the Best chicken, rice and potatoes..💞

Used to work at the sketchers across the street and haven't eaten here in years , the chicken was grilled to perfection and the rest was decent, ive def had better greek chicken but for the price im not complaining ,paid about $11 for this plate.

First & Foremost, This is a Beautiful Restaurant. The service is Amazing, here's a nice story especially since it was my first time here. They we're all out of Piña Colada's at the Bar but the Amazing Staff Accomodated so well that they made one Special for me. I love the hospitality & amazing service. I will definitely be coming back here many times & i would definitely recommend people to come here.... You won't be disappointed 😊😊

I’m currently at Gaylord’s Indian Cuisine. The website says they close at 2pm. I walked in at 1:40pm and no one greeted me at 1:43pm after staring at me I said to the staff that I would like to eat. He dismissively stated we close at 1:45pm. Perplexed I decided to write this review. I really enjoy Indian Cuisine and in the past have enjoyed Gaylord’s however; I will not come returning. This is treatment was rude and disrespectful and best. Zero customer service.

Highly recommended restaurant by many. Located right on north magnificent mile. Below the ground location. Plenty of space for large groups. Buffet is supposed to be awesome however we went for dinner. Excellent taste, service and pricing.

A nightmare experience. Severely understaffed, it took 10 mins to get a table in an empty dinning room. We saw many parties leaving the restaurant without ordering food, or better to say no one came to take order. It took almost an hour and a half to get our food served on the table. Take away was not good either. There were tons of online delivery partners waiting for their packet to arrive. Not recommended.

I have been here many times for the lunch buffet and also carried out for dinner. This location is better than the one in Schaumburg. There are great options for both vegetarians and non-veg in the lunch buffet. The fruit bar and mango kulfi are included in the lunch buffet. I have always been able to find parking on the street even if I have to circle around a few times -- it is always worth it.

Finally ventured outside of our west loop restaurant bubble to come here.  Really enjoyed the imperial rolls and the chicken wings.  The Brussels sprouts  were nothing special and really, shouldn’t they be special if ordering at a restaurant?  The crab rice was good, not something I’d enthusiastically order again.  The standout though was the garlic noodle with shrimp, which didn’t come out with the rest of the food and we’d forgotten we ordered; our plates were already cleared when it arrived…so we took it to go. Overall, an enjoyable meal

Mott St is located right on the corner of Noble Square in a quiet neighborhood. They have ample outdoor seating for the summer months but a very nice interior design/vibe.

This restaurant is an Asian fusion spot that has a flare of classic but innovative dishes. I ordered their Mott burger, while I really wish they served fries at this establishment it was a delicious burger. Very very tasty. Their fried rice was bland and flavorless. I added the everything sauce from the wings to the rice just to give it some flavor but even then it didn’t help the rice too much. The wings were decent, they tasted like any other wing you would get at a restaurant. Overall, I would come back to get the burger again (FYI they stop serving the burger at 7pm sharp, no exceptions) but I would have to bring my own fries.

The fusion is pretty good, many of the dishes are very creative and fascinating. However, some of the dishes are slightly sweet and too buttery, wish it was a bit lighter. The atmosphere in the restaurant is decent and enjoyable. I think it is a good restaurant that if you are around, you can visit.

I’ve come here a few times over the last few years, and this place does not disappoint. The food is always top notch, service is always amazing, and I always enjoy trying different plates every time I come here. Some of my favorites are the oyster mushrooms, pork belly, and Thai tea cheesecake. This time around, I tried the whole fish with my family, and we devoured it. So fresh and the sides it came with were delicious!!!

The staff and the food are amazing. I’m unfortunately on a really strict diet trying to figure out some digestive issues, and our waitress T was unbelievably helpful and patient with us. She went back and the chef took time to mark everything on the menu that I could have and said if things could be omitted or not. When I say strict - I mean no garlic, onions, dairy, gluten - basically anything that makes you happy. This was my first time eating out on this diet and I was a little overwhelmed and scared of doing it, but they somehow still found something to make me and were so nice about it. And it was delicious! I had the whole fish which was huge and fall off the bones good. I loved wrapping it with rice in the sesame leaves with the chili sauce and lime. My boyfriend said the wings were some of the best he ever had, and enjoyed the leeks and a massive bowl of mussels. 10/10 recommend for the food and 1000% recommend the staff. Spend your money here!

IDOF is one of my go to place. I love the falafel
Bowl but the staff at this location sucks. In a bowl they wont even give you half a bowl and if you ask anything they will make a face. Other location’s are so good and serve well

This particular location has friendly staff that will get you in and out with a quickness. The Falafel's were delicious! Moist, fresh, and bright green on the inside. This is a great quick stop for a yummy lunch with healthy options.
