Sooo delightful chicken Kebab,  juicy with the perfect body of flavor.  The wrap tastes better than a burrito and it is healthier.  Or you can get the chicken Kebab in a plate. Also the spicy level is adequate  (spicy tomato recommended). Music is so cool (indie rock) we should have some middle east music perhaps.

Oh my goodness! This is an amazing little restaurant with very friendly staff.  I ordered the chicken salad and added olives... it was simply amazing. Highly recommend stopping in for a falafel and some baklava too!

I'm not the biggest fan of Mediterranean food so the first time I came here I didn’t give it a good rating. I recently returned with a friend and got something similar to what she had and the food was delicious. It’s similar to Chipotle in that you can build your bowl. I don’t eat dairy and they had a nice of variety non-dairy foods to include in the bowl. The food was a bit salty but it may be what I put in my bowl. I recommend checking this place out.

This cozy & small Italian restaurant has a bar in the front and dining area towards the back. All of the staff was very nice but they could have been more attentive. I enjoyed the food, they have a delicious marinara sauce! For dessert I had the tiramisu for the first time and I did not enjoy it. For reference it had a very strong coffee flavor to a point where it tasted like black coffee. Also, their website states they take & accommodate special requests but when I asked for Angel hair instead of spaghetti I was denied.
Delicious food, good prices for how big the portions are! Owner treated us like family, had a very fun time and felt very welcomed. 10/10 dining experience

This place is ~15min walk from Western CTA station. We came here on a Monday night for a friend’s birthday. The restaurant is located in a residential area and the streets are quiet. There are fairy lights outside the restaurant so it shouldn’t be hard to find.

We got some Baked Clams and Fried Calamari as appetizers to start with. I got linguine al pesto and the portion was huge. I couldn’t finish everything and had a lot to take home with me. We also got the Chicken Bacchanalia. I thought it was the best dish out of all the ones we ordered (~8 dishes) because it looked and smelled the most delicious. The dark meat came off the bone easily and the white meat was really dry but the sauce made up for that. It was very strong in garlic and I loved it. The bell pepper was soft and absorbed the sauce so it tasted really good.

The dessert menu came as a photo album. It’s super cute and helped so much because I didn’t know what most of them were and would have to Google otherwise. I got the Amaretto Cheesecake; it looks plain but tastes fresh. The server brought out our desserts and with a candle on that of my birthday friend’s. She even sang the birthday song with us and helped us take photos.

The decoration inside was really photo-worthy. There are vines hanging on the walls and mini Italian flags on each table. We took a bunch of pictures there. The patio seemed closed but I imagine it would be so cute to be eating out there in the summer. The vibes of this restaurant is just so romantic.

Being generous because there were nice people and atmosphere. However… we only liked 1 dish out of 3. I am NOT picky and I basically threw away $70 worth of food(gave it away, did not waste). Including tiramisu which I usually LOVE. Maybe I came on the wrong night? Eggplant parmigiana was sooooo bad I could not eat it and I don’t like the red sauce… I’m sorry, I truly don’t know what happened based on all these reviews. It wasn’t my first time at an “authentic“ Italian place and I eat all types of food. But if this is “real” Italian as the reviews say, then I guess I don’t like Italian.
Wow! What a phenomenal experience dining in. Execptional service by staff, food is amazing and generous portions. Definitely coming back

The last few drinks I've received have been super bad, I had to take one back recently and have them make it again because it wasn't drinkable. I've also been getting drinks that aren't filled, I'm talking close to an inch and a half from the top. When I pay for a large I'd like it to be full.  I'm not a picky person by any means so it pains me to come here and drop shade but something needs to change.   I don't think I'll be going back for awhile, or at least until they get better employees.

Refused service because mint chocolate chip ice cream is too hard!
I asked a few times just to make sure & the young lady said she wouldn’t get it because the ice cream is too hard.
That’s a new one.

Store says closes at 10pm. Lights already out and employee hiding with lights out at 9:23. All I want is for a DD to actually stay open till 10pm. Just looking for my hot cup of coffee for the beginning of my shift. No 24hr DD around me.

I don't really expect much at chain places with how employment has been...but atleast TRY to do your job.

I waited at the front desk for 10 minutes while the workers were laughing and walking past me.  I guess carrying a box back and forth smiling is better than serving a customer.

Waited ten minutes for a mobile order and after asking several times (to which the workers rolled their eyes), did not see them even begin making it until my partner started prompting them to make it now. Then, once I received it 12 minutes later, it was just a terrible. Worst Dunkin’ experience.

I only have one word for this restaurant. It’s AMAZING. The food tasted really Healthy fresh and tasty. The Korean Noodle bowl was on a spicy side. Drinks were decent. Food is pricey. The waiter got us a free dessert for my friend’s birthday. It was a nice gesture. Lastly, We had dogs with us and had called few restaurants which were pet friendly but none of them allowed the dogs and the patios were closed because of the Winter. But True Food Kitchen was so kind to seat us outside. Must try place.

The food runner was nice and the cashier was helpful. Food taste lighter than it looks, I had the crunch wrap combo and chicken tenders. The oatmeal cookie pie had a tasty cream filling. Four stars for the convenience.

10 STARS⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️!!

This was my husband I first time visiting Native Foods Cafe on Clark Street and it was a treasured find!! It's not like plant based foods once served, where you will find it bland & grainy but it was well prepared & extremely pleasant to my palate. Since it was our first time, the clerk (Zari) was such a beautiful soul in assisting us with our choices and making the whole experience smooth! If you're in the Chicago area, do yourself a favor and stop by one of their three locations.. Milwaukee, Belmont or Clark Street. You will not be disappointed! N.Bailey APPROVED✅️

Good vegan restaurant with healthy food. Fast service. But the room is very empty, there is no design, it was uncomfortable for me.  It seems that this establishment is dying or getting ready for renovation. There were absolutely no people at lunchtime. It used to be popular.  Perhaps something happened. It's a pity, I wish them a speedy return and success!

We really liked this place! Yes it's a bit pricey for fast food, but given we'd paid $30 for a couple of impossible whoppers a few days earlier it seemed pretty reasonable for a city centre location!  I found the range of options pretty good and as it was only a few minutes from our hotel we went here a couple of times and really enjoyed everything we got. I'd definitely recommend it.

Was looking for something other than the standard fare. Found this small place. The food was fresh and the service was very good! The salmon salad with the lemon olive oil dressing was yummy! It came with toasted wheat rolls which were also good. The cake I had with the jam filling wasn’t too sweet but very good and satisfying. I’ll try one of the tagines next time. Sadly for me the menu was limited, the prices and portions were great! Overall I was pleasantly surprised! Thanks for the good food!
Good clean food with Very reasonable prices

This was great find. I found this place on google and I’m so glad I gave it a try. I got the chicken kabob platter. The chicken was so flavorful, the rice was was great, also their sauces were amazing too. I would go back just for the sauces. I will definitely go back.

Great food and friendly service.
Me and my wife went there last Wednesday and we really enjoyed it. Stuff is conserved about customers satisfaction, food tastes great made and has real flavors. We’re coming back!
Zebda is a small place with amazing food at a great price. I tend to stick with their sandwiches but I recently had a shrimp fettuccine special. So tasty and big portions!
I had an amazing experience the staff was friendly I'd recommend everyone to dine here

Good at the one or two fried rice dishes I get consistently. I always get takeout and it is ready pretty quick. Quality is fair, price is reasonable. I have had some mediocre meals from here, but that's rare.

I wish i can really give zero stars the lady on the phone is very rude  . I called back because they messed up my order i clearly have all vegetables when i ordered beef and broccoli . And when i asked she just said because you wanted extra mushrooms , That doesn't make any since if i order beef n broccoli it should come with beef !  and when i tried to explain she is talking over me constantly. I also asked can they just deliver the meat she said NO SO THERE FOR I WOULD NOT BE GETTING ANY FOOD FROM HERE AGAIN
Accidentally found this place on my way home.. The best Chinese in Chicago!! I’m so happy I found Peking, what a great dinner.
Great food and very friendly staff! They also have awesome lunch time deals. Love this place! We will definitely be going back again.

They’ve screwed my order up. Ordered the bbq pork ribs lunch special, gave me an all rice and vegetables order instead. Didn’t realize it until I came back and looked in the bag. They just lost a customer with me!

Never ever spend your money here.

:

We were went here many times but this time it was very bad experience.

Story:

We are 5 people the service given by mexican guy and other old guy was good. But at end when we go for bill payment at counter and the Cashier whose name was ASIF make very big bill with adding GRATUITY and he added $20  as GRATUITY, I asked what is this he said this tip you have add in bill as service. I Said I don't want to pay the tips because I don't like your service and after that he treat me like enemy. I talked him with respect but he talked like bad guy. I never pay any GRATUITY and anybudy never pay like this, but when you like you can pay as tips as you like.

But cashier say this necessary rules to pay GRUITY at last I did not pay tips beacuse of this rude old man.

Please when you go over this place please be aware of GRATUITY charges in this Restaurant especially when the 60 year old Guy again whose name is ASIF would be at cashier.

About food:
We came here 5 times in year and service and food quality were good but day by day they are manipulating people with only frozen gravy and hot it on gas stove.

Third quality service by cashier... Again please don't waste your money here….

Spend your money at good location then this which have good quality food and customer service.

Again at last Please be aware of GRATUITY Charges when you are more then 5 people at time of BILL PAYMENT.

All people were good but only the bald Guy Asif is very rude, need some learning how to treat customer.

Nice Authentic Indian food. If you are craving to have some nice spicy Indian food you have to try this place. We tried Chicken Frontier , Karahi Gosht with Rumali Roti. The goat was awesome and tender. We tried their Paan too. It was more then sufficient for 2 and we took the leftovers. Service was good too. We went there after they renovated this place. Looks more clean and spacious.
Excellent Food, great service, and very very clean!!!!!   One of the best in devon!! I highly recommend …5 stars
One of the best desi food is served here and the owner is a good man
The food was too delicious especially there paneer tikka was sooooo good ❤️ Staff was friendly 👍

I follow Slurping Turtle on the Gram and have been eating with my eyes for long enough. It is sunday evening and easily found parking right in front across the street, this might not be the norm.
They decided to keep a lot of the original concrete walls bare which gives a half way built vibe but oh well, nice booths as well as long dining tables for larger parties. The Food is Awesome. We started with Takoyaki (octopus fritter) which are especially nice with a Creamy texture and Smokey flavor. Bao Buns are ok, the pork belly is exactly what i think of when craving bao, the tempura shrimp reminded me of fish and chips… meh,  and i wish i didnt order the roasted chicken bao.. Pass on that, its dry and underwhelming.  The ramen which is the reason we came was delicious. The menu is Definitely quality and we left Full and satisfied. Few more items I want to return for but the Duck Fat Fried Chicken we couldnt pass on neither should you. Enjoy.

The wings were a little dry and on the small side (not as plump), the buns were pretty spot on; the noodles were generally good, but nothing that would make me say it should be a neighborhood favorite or preferred. Otherwise, the food looks better than it actually tastes.

Please keep in mind that this is just my review and I encourage everyone to try this spot out since I gave it 3 stars. Check it out!

I came here on a friend's recommendation. This restaurant has almost everything I'd want in a Japanese restaurant. It has a nice vibe, pretty great ramen, and sushi. I got a sashimi platter and the tan-tan ramen. The platter was well portioned, and presented very neatly. The ramen was spicy, which I love, but not so spicy that others could not enjoy it. My dad thought it was a bit too salty, but that is also how I like my food. If I were ever in Chicago again, I would definitely come here.

Ordered Spicy Miso Ramen. It wasn't so spicy but I added the powder provided with it and it was awesome! The staff were polite. The service was really quick and good ambience. Best spots for quick and amazing workday lunches.

Great food and great service. Try the Japanese mushrooms on the side, they are amazing! I've been here at least a dozen times and every dish I have tried hasn't disappointed me. Their edamame and bao are great appetizers. Their ramen dishes and bento boxes were delicious. I can't comment on dessert or the drinks.

Haven't been here in years, but I must say I'm pleased the quality of the food is still delicious 😋 The portion size matched the price. The cooks were all men and they did not disappoint me. I recommend 2 other ppl and they were pleased as well. We would just ask for a larger piece of bread but no complaints.

Yesterday was my very first visit. I ordered the garlic fettuccine pasta with Shrimp yesterday and it was AMAZING!! I ordered the same thing today and I wish I could send it back. My Shrimp are over cooked and the flavor is bland.

Maybe my LAST!! time. I always order the honey crispy chicken wrap with the spinach flour shell, well it never fails. They seem to give me what they want and this time I tested them and was parked outside waiting on my order. Asked and made sure I received the right flour shell...they didnt...told them I wanted what the pictute shows. Last time,  I order the pasta was way different this time it was the right pasta not the tri colored. Still had to correct them one had no pasta but it did, I was ok with that only because it was the pasta I liked. But they gave me the sundried tomatoe shell and I hate that one. Didn't even offer a free meal or a refund for the mistakes they kept making.

Went here once and I MUST go back. I had the Garlic Chicken & Shrimp Fettuccine, while my husband had the Grilled Chicken Caesar Wrap. Both were delicious! I could not stop eating my pasta. And there was plenty of both chicken and shrimp in it. The chef told me I'd want to come back, when I told him it was my 1st time. He was right!

Upon receiving my order of two salmon entrees, I realized my bag did not contain the extra sauce I asked and payed almost $2 for. What I did notice when I dug into my RICE was a fettuccine NOODLE. When I pulled the noodle out, I also pulled out some thin piece of metal similar to a staple. I could have eaten the object if it wasn’t for the random piece of food in my order. Also, yellow rice is being served as rice pilaf. This is so unfortunate because I have ordered from this restaurant several times and is rarely disappointed. I’m trying to be supportive but quality is a huge area of improvement for this restaurant and foreign objects in my food is unacceptable. No thank you.

This used to be the best Dunkin in the area, but now it's the worst. They need better/more people working there. The lady making the food misses half the orders that come in, and then makes them incorrectly.
The location is permanently closed. Don't go here.

Ive never been a big fan of Dunkin Doughnuts, well that was just changed. How you may ask. There is a true humanitarian by the name of Kassie. When walking by the resturant they were giving away a new product called frozen coffee. Now she helped a blind man across the street. Then i said i had to come in they have amazing flavors in their frozen coffees. This wonderful DD is managed by Mariana. The cleanliness alone will bring you in. Then the customer svc is beyond any you think you would find in Chicago. Go team Go. So you must come by and give them a shout tell them Tracy sent you.
Quick service is great and all but please, stop burning your coffee.
Best Dunkin Donuts. Friendly customer service and great coffee.

We decided to try this place on a slow (for us) Saturday evening.  We just moved to the area and still exploring… Let me tell you…this place is a hidden gem and i plan on being one of the “regulars” here. I am truly amazed how good the food was.

Our server Kyle was absolutely amazing! He attended to us for our every need; he was very flexible and informative when we asked questions on the menu. The vibe of the restaurant was a mix of comfortable and fancy, it gave it that homey feel while also being classical and modern. The restaurant was well-kept, very clean, and had delicious food! Even if we came late (9:00pm!) and the courses we wanted were sold out, the food that was provided was one of the best fresh Italian dishes I have ever had. You could definitely tell that the pasta, sauce, cheese, and meat was locally sourced and homemade from scratch. I could not get over the tiramisu either! Our server, Kyle, was telling us the story of the tiramisu and its recipe origins; which made it even more appealing and mouth watering! My family had a pleasurable experience that we will never forget! Definitely a must come for anyone in Chicago.

BarTucci Homemade Italian is quite a treat. The minute you walk in you feel like you are a part of something special. There is nothing fancy about the place but the environment and friendliness is very unique in todays world. We felt like part of the family. Beyond the experience the food is fantastic. The 3 of us ordered different dishes and were equally as happy with our meals. Highly suggest giving this place a try!

My boyfriend and I had an amazing early Valentine's Day dinner on 02/12/22. The service was great as well, thanks to our server Jason, we had a nice conversation with him about Rome. The owner came to check on us and even handed us some Baci chocolates. We definitely will be coming back!

Have been here a couple of times! Every time is better than the last one. There is not disappoint with the food!
Lovely place and atmosphere!
Great service, all the waiters are really kind.  My waiter Deuce, such as lovely and and energetic person!
My experince was enhanced by the unique dogs appointed to each state. I loved the Atlanta Dog with Chili and Cole Slaw.
Pretty good for quick hotdog place. Chicago dog was yummy. Chili was good too
crap service  and quality don't go here Co to max's across the street
Cool idea. A little pricey.
Nice decor, nice food

Cute bar spot with a 1940’s decor. They have a bike mounted in the ceiling. Interesting! During a bar crawl when I visited I had stopped in here. They serve comfort food and then some on an extended level. I thought this Fat Cat was like the one in Norwich, Connecticut and I was wrong. These are definitely two different styles of places.

Wonderful place! They were very busy with only 2 staff memeber in the front of the house and did a fantastic job serving everyone. Food was amazing and delicious. Drinks were awesome! Music was nice, restaurant was clean. Just beautiful place.

The experience is always great for me and my family. Especially my daughter she loves the straight up burger. The servers are always so courteous and nice. They are always on top of things when we are here. Today are server was Jen. She was very friendly and got are orders in when we are ready. Today we both got the straight up burger with a side of fries.  Got are order right out. Thanks Jen
Had the most fabulous drink called the Riviera. It seemed like the perfect choice before seeing a show at the theatre with my sister. Our bartender was so kind and we will definitely come back!

Good service, nice place to chill by yourself or with friends. We got an outside table to enjoy a beautiful crisp wednesday Chicago evening. For food we got roasted cauliflower and fried Mac and cheese and they were pretty good. Their drinks which were decent, could have been boozier.

This is my 2nd time ordering from Thai Lagoon. I prefer the sweetened "crisps/glaze" that coats lightly atop of the wide noodles. I really enjoy the taste.  The gyoza is crisp as they seem fried. As for the Miso soup it's a perfect comfort soup if you wish to keep it simple. The tofu isn't tough and is the perfect texture. I do plan on trying other dishes in the near future. The price isn't outstanding and the amount of food given is generous.
Delicious meal! Glad we tried this gem! Will be ordering takeout and pickup when not being able to dine in. Waitress is attentive and kind. Their crab Rangoons wont disappoint !

It’s the best Thai place in the neighborhood. We had the satay chicken, the Penang curry, and the mixed vegetables with beef. All three were good - perfectly savory with the right blend of Thai flavors. Nearby tables also ordered the pad Thai (which is popular) and the Thai iced tea. This place is BYOB so perfect for an affordable date. Just remember to tip kindly!

Basil chicken was very watery, almost like soup. Tom yum soup was very lacking, basically just mushrooms and a couple shrimp. Broccoli beef was too sweet and also somehow very soupy (like the basil chicken)

Pad Thai and paseeew was fine, but they gave me chicken instead of beef, whatever.

Great food but over the years it looks like their chef or recipes have become very simple. Used to LOVE ordering their Curry Fried Rice with family all the time.

We would ask for low or mild spice because the heat can really hide the overall flavor and they would accommodate fully. Post pandemic they can no longer accommodate a heat request. Unfortunately will be ordering from here less often, but if your taste buds can withstand the heat go for it.

Simply phenomenal. The service was good, but the food was simply sublime. I cannot put into words how good it was other than pure ecstasy. The salad was the perfect blend of mozzarella, tomato, salad, and olive oil that formed a union of flavors for a salad unlike no other. The salad was one of the simplest but best I've had in a while. Now the main course was just beyond what I expected. The perfect blend of soft pasta layers, sticky and savory meats coupled with crimson scrumptious red sauce and topped with fantastic melted cheese bring you straight to flavor town. The tastes, textures, and smells all combine to make the best Italian food I have ever eaten and the best dining experience in a few years. 10/10 would recommend to anyone wanting Italian. And for their low price tag, it's criminal how underrated the restaurant is. Delicious!

Perfect little neighborhood Italian restaurant with true flavors and ingredients. Reasonable priced with wonderful service by the owners. Nothing fancy here except the quality and comfort. FOLLOW ME for more thoughtful recommendations as I travel the world  🌎

Service was great and the food was fantastic!! We had garlic bread with cheese and a pepperoni pizza, both were delicious! We were so full but had to try their gelato and it did not disappoint. It was a tasty treat to finish off the meal. Highly recommend sitting on their patio to enjoy a beautiful evening

Family owned. Great thin crust pizza. The best in town. Located by the Trump hotel. Outdoor seating available. Rolled Eggplant appetizer is so good! Chicken Parm sandwich was just okay. The Caprese Salad is my favorite. Light and refreshing. Reasonably priced. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a quick , casual bite to eat in Chicago.

Before I get into the review, this place is located inside the River Plaza at 405 N. Wabash.  Turn at the River Plaza sign off N. Wabash and follow the sidewalk into the River Plaza building.

Stopped by during lunch while visiting Chicago.  I've had all the usual deep-dish pizzas and other well-known pizza places in Chicago, so wanted to try someplace different.  It was lunchtime during the week, but it was not too crowded.  There's about 10 tables both inside and outside, but it was a rainy day so opted for the inside.  They don't sell individual slices, but the small 10" pizza is only 4 reasonable slices.  Service was very fast and friendly.

Ordered the 10" Capricciosa pizza which took about 10-15 minutes to arrive.  Pizza was straight out the oven and looked great.  Crust was a good thickness, crispy, just the right amount of sauce, and there was a generous amount of ingredients.  They also have desserts such as gelato, tiramisu, cannolis, and cookies.  I was too full for anything big, so just ordered 2 cookies after another customer recommended them.  It was a good recommendation.

Nice hidden gem for good pizza.  Good food and service.

After years of going to same popular tourist place for Beef Sandwiches, decided to switch it up and come to Al's #1.  So glad decided to come here.  The place wasn't busy at all, was able to walk right up to the counter, not feel rushed, and place my order.  Person at the register was friendly and helpful.  The menu is very simple with the obvious focus on beef sandwiches, but also having hot dogs, sausage, burgers, and chicken.

They have the usual options with a beef sandwich of dry, wet, and dipped, cheese, and peppers.  I ordered mine wet with peppers.  Also, ordered a Chicago Dog for the side.  Service was very quick and my order was ready within 5 minutes.  The wet sandwich had the right amount of gravy  and not too close to a dipped sandwich.  The beef was amazingly juicy and flavorful.  Peppers added the right amount flavor and heat without being overwhelming.  Chicago Dog was made just right and presented nicely.  I may have found my new place to come for a Beef Sandwich when visiting Chicago again.

Having been here about 10 years ago (of course thanks to Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives), I had to give it another try when back in town in 2022. It was still pretty good but a much stronger pepper flavor than I remember and gotta eat it QUICK before the bread is too mushy but otherwise I do recommend having it dunked in the broth fully. Their fries are perfect - super crispy and salty.

Great sandwich! Friendly staff and fast service! Generous portion of beef (I recommend getting it "regular, wet"). Fries were well cooked, although they could have used a little salt (none was available that I saw). Great meal, would come back!

We had lunch here 2 x over our 4 day stay in Chicago. My husband loved their Italian beef sandwiches. Great value for your money in comparison to other places . The hubby also liked the hot dogs from here . If you love beef definitely a place you should add on your list !

Can't miss- saw this place on Netflix Which inspired me to go to Chicago in the first place! This did not disappoint! Stunning food, fantastic staff, clean establishment- the dipped Italian beef sandwich was just out of this world good!  Such amazing value too!

My order after several repeats was still incorrect not hot.  My fries with no salt was the only good thing. I wanted a classic chicken and got the jalapeño chicken with so much sauce or whatever the bun was soaked thru.  Never again

I don't usually play Karen doing bad reviews but this McDonalds deserves one. For 1 year I've been living in a 5min walk from it so, for our convenience, my husband and I order online and go pick it up. Honestly, I don't think we had ONE single order that was correct. We will arrive home, open and always something was missing, something was wrong. Then we started checking the bag before leaving, this morning I went there get 3 breakfast itens, just counted as always, went home and guess what? Correct number but wrong items of course. So officially we are not ordering in this place ever again, it doesn't matter how close it is, we will ask delivery from other one.
Let's see if making a public bad review you guys finally organise yourselves, really! I've done fast food as well and I know the challenges but Jesus Christ you can't run a business this way!

Place is pretty locked down in response to homeless and nursing home people. Bathroom needs to be unlocked with a garage door opener, they’re blasting 80s soft rock at a painful volume. No self service coke.

It was horrible, I asked for a mcdouble with Mac sauce and when I got my burger the bread was so crunchy that when I took back to the manager she gave me an attitude, some staff were nice but the rest just ATTITUDE! ESPECIALLY THE MANAGER ANA, AND BENJAMIN!!!! Need more training!!!
The girl who takes the orders is INCREDIBLY RUDE!! OMG! We need more friendly people in the world. She made my hunger went away…. TERRIBLE. Also dirty tables, now I know why that 3 rating
I had White Castle’s veggie burger made like the 1921 burger. The staff was more then willing to help me with all I needed help with ANNNND then bathroom was clean.

Ordered online. Was easy. One car in line but not long line. Burgers were finally nice and juicy with lots of onions. HOWEVER, I asked for no pickles and of course burgers had extra pickles. Receipt even showed no pickles on the order.
Tried placing a order In so I could pick up and go never came in on their end but the manager was super helpful and was able to recreate my order quickly and was very nice.
I like white castle every so often but this location was nasty... The buns were stale and hard. And the cheese wasn't even melted.. Definitely not going to this location again...
Use to like this one. Called to complain. Person on phone claims to be a manager. Very unpleasant. I will find another white castle with better customer service.

Terrible experience! Called in a simply everything salad. Asked for no egg no cheese. Get to the car open the salad no meat🙄. Call in tell them the problem she in denial. Cashier took a look then said none of the meat was put on. The owner remade the salad forgot the onions & bacon bits! Then have to pay for another dressing after I put it on the first salad🤬

A great menu with plenty of variety and this is what stands out. The salads are also well made with a variety of choices.  Parking is usually open on the street. Reasonable prices and you get more for your dollar than the other name brand 🥪 sandwich shops.  Give them a try, very delicious . Closes early at 6 and lunch specials up til 3. 😋 No complaints here.

I hate to give this restaurant such a horrible review , but man listen the women that operate this establishment have to have the worst energy you ever want to see . No smiles , you are not greeted in a welcoming manner in fact they kinda come off like they are being inconvenienced by your presence . I’ve been coming here for years because the food is good but after today i will never return , the lack of appreciation for supporting their business is through the roof !  Service is really important when running a business and their service comes with stale faces , no eye contact , dry interactions just flat out bad energy . They do not treat their customers with an ounce of appreciation!!!!!!
The sandwiches and soups are good. They have bad attitudes. It's true, black women are always mad. When a different color walk thru the door I saw the attitude change. Sad.
Yes oh yes!!!! The food taste great, they were very friendly, and I will be a repeat customer for sure!

Tried the beer, a couple of appetizers and a pizza. The pizza was by far my favorite. Wanted to try something different so we got the Flo's Polish - Polish kielbasa, sauerkraut and applewood smoked bacon. It was amazing and even good cold in the morning. The beer recommended by the bar tender was amazing and will be looking for it in Arizona. Thanks!!

Excellent spot for some food and drink, pizza is amazing and on a thinner crust which is great if you're not feeling the deep dish in Chicago. Staff are friendly, ticket times are quick and restaurant is clean. I really can't fault the restaurant, definitely worth che king out if you're in the area.

Nice tavern-style pizza spot with Polish influenced items on the menu. Pierogi Sampler Platter was delicious! Pizza ingredients are fresh and made to order. Had the Santo's Margherita - Medium 12" serves 1-2 people. A bit pricey at $21. One bartender manning the front who treats you like a regular. I suspect this place to be typically busy and patrons seem like regulars. Will be back to try their other specialty pizzas!
The outdoor patio is spectacular. Lots of seating. Kid friendly. We got the gluten free pizza crust and it was crispy and delicious - hard to find.

All of my reviews start with 3-star so this rating simply mean that this place is at average and I have no concern for returning.  Service staff was great, and ticket time was good.  Maybe polish foods are indeed salty; my food was very salty.  Pizza seems to be very popular, and I smelled like a pizza chef for the rest of the night after I left.  Probably a very good neighborhood joint for outdoor beer and pizza.
Very rude employees need to have better customer service skills
Maybe have your employees know English at least. Feels like I’m talking to a ghost.

I made 3 online orders this month. 1st one had no mustard on my sandwich. 2nd time they didn’t put oil in my sandwich & they didn’t put mustard or sweet onion sauce on my husband’s sandwich. 3rd time they didn’t toast either of our sandwiches but they got the sauces right. Can never get our online orders right.

This place not need to be open 24 hours.. the guy is always rude.  He says he doesn't have cash.. no credit card.. etc etc.. I work at a bar and this is the only time I can come.  2am.. seriously.. edited
I go there 5 times a week.. so.. I always spend 10 to 12dls.  So multiply that by 5.. well.  That's not much.. but that's what you guys will lose from me now.  I will never step 1 foot there bo more.  Until they fire that guy that doesn't even speak English..
Do not buy from here. Horrible customer service. Rude employees.

Pretty sweet brunch deal. Went this past weekend for Memorial Day, $15 bottles of champagne for mimosas is a great price. I also would recommend their corned beef hash, from their brunch menu. Though, word on the street is their regular menu is better.

This is my go-to bar in the neighborhood. Not because their beer selection is endless - they have changed up their tap though (a good move on their part). They've also been changing up their menu and have some delicious, out of the ordinary food like Venison Bratwurst. I'm a Sucker for their fries.

They regularly have tap take-overs and you can find some pretty rare craft beer here when they do.

Also, this is one of the Nebraska Bars in the city - they host the games on Saturdays. it's always a blast to hang out with the fans - especially when the team is doing well.

It's an average bar on division, which has a lot of choices, so it's tough to stand out. I came for a beer event, which was fun, and the place got packed on a Thursday night. The beer selections were underwhelming other than the special beers for the event, which were unusual and pretty tasty (some uncommon New Belgiums). There wasn't anything hoppy on tap and I think I ended up with a Fat Tire, which is just not something I really need to pay $5 or whatever for. The bartenders worked pretty quickly and were friendly, and it wasn't an awful push up to the bar and long long wait. The food selection wasn't awesome, imo, but was fine. It was basically fried pub food (people liked the potato nachos, or whatever they were called) (I compare that with a place that has tasty tacos, or George Street Pub that has things like bruschetta and roasted red pepper bisque--yum!); I don't think I'd want to eat there often, def not a full meal. There's a small amount of outdoor seating. The bathroom situation isn't great--lots of people, and only 1 bathroom for each sex. There's a good amount of street parking around, and buses nearby, so it's pretty easy to get to.

Place just closed down this weekend and will be closed for at least a month while they rebrand as a new restaurant/bar. Beer was decent, the food was pretty good, especially the Irish nachos.

Gonna be a shame to lose DAH in its current form but looking forward to what it will become.

This used to be my go to neighborhood bar, unfortunately their food has gone down hill in the last year or two and they now have a DJ on Saturday nights.  If you are a low key irish bar you should not ever have a DJ blaring terrible music.

It's still an okay place to hang out during the week or early on a Friday/Saturday.  They need to stick to their roots and focus on the food and service instead of trying to be a dance club.

It was our first time eating here and the food was delicious. I had the Buffalo “chicken” sandwich and my friend had the popping jalapeño burger. The fries and the sweet potato fries were also very yummy. Cute little spot and very friendly service! Will be back!
Got their Orange Cauliflower delivered and was delicious, photo doesn't really do it justice. The sauce on the cauliflower was great and paired well with the fried rice.
Love this location! Such good quality. I got the chicken bacon avo club and it was really good compared to the same dish at other locations.

Honestly, as a carnivore I do not understand  how their food is SO GOOD. 10/10 recommend everything on the menu, especially the oatmeal  cookie sandwich. The only reason I didn’t give 5/5 stars is because the food is hit or miss in quality. Always good, but sometimes it’s phenomenal.

I like native foods. I always try something new when I go. I also always order the nachos, that's mandatory, they're so good! I don't think I've ever felt like I wasted my money and felt cheated. In terms of flavor, some days and locations might be more consistent than others but overall I haven't had any complaints.

I have been ordering from this place for years now and unfortunately 1 incident will completely stop me from ever spending money here. A roach in my chicken dinner! I’ve been giving this business money at least once a week for 7 years now but some things comes to and end and a roach in my food is a big one.

Loved this place. Always ordered from here regardless of their issues. My last order 2 days ago came with a roach in it. Obviously that's a wrap for their business for me. I'm disgusted. They offered to give me a refund. I don't want a refund. I want them to be inspected
The Shrimp fried rice was fresh and delicious. For a not so big restaurant, this place made a big explosion when it came too my taste buds. Absolutely delicious 😋.

The dinner doesn't come with a drink. Orange chicken was the worst I've had. Definitely has potential to be good but currently "No". The price is too much for the portions. I've been to Chinese restaurants that have bigger portions and better tasting orange chicken at the same price.

They make the best eggrolls. Order extra.
And the employees are always so friendly!

Someone came up to me at a party and raved about the burgers at Lockdown. Seriously, an unsolicited food rec always gets me excited. Took me about two weeks but finally made it. My wife got the flight, included the fat Elvis, cruelty to animals and border patrol. I got a build your own burger, just the basics for me when I am trying to compare burgers from different restaurants. Kind of disappointing, the burgers we tried were just ok and nothing special. I would not venture back for them. Nice hole in the wall bar, friendly staff and the mac and cheese is a must if you like the mac and cheese you grew up with. The Nola summer, hot tea drink I think I would go back just for that drink. Not too pricey, two meals and drink about $60.

I'll start off with the good. The place has an awesome heavy metal atmosphere similar to a burger joint like Kuma's Corner. Their prison theme makes for a fun to read menu which has a ton of variety. Our waiter was really freindly and was very attentive until it got busy 30 minutes in.

I did have a few issues. I ordered a bomb pop martini which had great presentation. Unfortunately it was FAR too sweet (almost undrinkable). I ordered The Fat Elvis which is a burger topped with peanut butter and bannana. The parts with the peanut butter were good, but once I took bites with banana,  it was overpowering. I found myself drinking water to get out the after taste. The last issue was that my friend ordered boneless buffalo wings and it was covered with lime.

Aside from that they do have quality ingredients. The meat patty was juicy, the bacon was thick and crispy, and the pretzel bun was soft. Everyone else loved their burgers. If your a fan of really spicy food, take on the arson burger.

Despite this places flaws, I would give this place another shot.

Pretty damn good!  Food and service are great and the crazy heavy metal-jail theme with heavy-death metal music playing loud and proud is killer!
Didn't try any of their beer or other drinks but they do have a huge selection.
Prices on food are a bit high but the quality and quantity are definitely there.
Overall a great experience!
Will definitely be back if in the area in the future!
Absolutely AMAZING Burgers! Mac-n-cheese is the best I've ever had! Sweet potato fries are the BOMB!This place is a "must stop" every time I go to Chicago!
mac n cheese was delioucious hamburger was good too a little dry. small place a little pricey.  Tater tots crunchy but cold when came to table.

This review will fall short of the rapturous praise I actually feel about the food and team at 42 Grams. Dining here is akin to skydiving- not that it's dangerous, but unless the person you're talking to has shared the experience, they won't get it. 15 courses, 2.5 hours, artful and delicious, entertaining and welcoming. If you only get to do something like this once in your life, do it here. Oh, and don't cheat yourself on the wines you bring- they're bringing an A+ game, shop (on their guidelines) accordingly.

Chef Jake and his wife Alexa have created a transcendental food experience.  Jake creates culinary masterpieces which sometimes defy all conventional thought but consistently amaze the taste buds.  This is food preparation and creation as art and theater.  Alexa comes into play as the hostess with the mostess not only greeting guests upon arrival but also explaining each course as it is presented to you.  This is the sort of thing that could easily be way to highbrow or pretentious but the addition of Alexa as a travel guide for the evening allows your dinner to become something immediately accessible and intimate and altogether wonderful.  Quite simply the most amazing dining experience I've ever had.  Well worth your time and your dollars!

Just watched your video on Netflix and honestly you have opened my eyes to many things, not only have you had to over come many hard obstacles but have made such great success with such great loss, I watched this video today and it made me happy felt so many emontions, I felt your anger and your happiness while watching because I understand it's not easy to reach goals and dreams without blood, sweat and tears. And from an outsider and complete random who has never experienced your food or the atmosphere of 42 Grams I was amazed by your work both Jake and Alexa. But the ending of the movie is what broke my heart. I hope one-day I find the time to fly all the way to Chicago and meet you both of you.
All I can say is don't give up on your business, the food you create and present but also to not give up on each other.

- Ayla. H
(Australia) *P.S Netflix's needs to have a recommendation tab after every movie for more people to watch and enjoy*

Exec. Summary:  I bought plane tickets to fly to 42 Grams, but they canceled.  So that's $220 wasted.  Thanks. :-(

Full summary: I have read other reviews about "anger management" issues from the chef yelling at his staff, but I decided to risk the dinner.  (Now I wish I had not.)  I am not pleased that a 2-michelin star restaurant would suddenly cancel my plans.  I have eaten at Gordon Ramsay, Wolfgang Puck, Joel Robuchon, Guy Savoy, Jean Georges, etc..... all of whom are Michelin-starred chefs.  I expect the pinnacle of service from them, and I expect at-or-near the pinnacle of service from the "42 grams" Miichelin-starred chef too.

But instead he randomly canceled my 8:30 ticket that I had prepurchased two months ago.  His site says, "No cancellations or refunds," but I guess he's above his own rules.  That's approximately 220 dollars wasted on a nonrefundable California-to-Chicago plane ticket.

Clearly the 42 chef thinks his time is more important than the customers who are paying his wages.  He has forgotten the old British adage: "The customer is king."
Best meal I've ever had. You must experience what this husband and wife team has to offer. Such amazing food in a dinner-party like atmosphere.
I got the Philly steak fries. The cheese sauce was better than a lot I have tasted. The portions were nice, and the beef was seasoned well.  Pretty good overall.

Had a regular cheese steak & fries. This variety has more bread than meat, and from my experience, limited au jus. The sandwich still has a lot of integrity, but it's not like you won't get your hands greasy eating this. Though not quite visible, the taste of cheese really cuts through. Fries were great crunchy and delicious.

At peak hours service remained pretty fast-paced, so if all else fails, this is a good place to head to.

Got the bacon and ranch fries. Who puts the bacon fat and gristle on the fries?? Barely had any ranch sauce on them either. Many of the fries were undercooked. No wonder they're the only restaurant in food court that has no line! I will never eat here again.

Small bread small meat, they're not very generous with the veggies. I asked for peppers and onion and I got one tiny piece of green pepper and a couple of no its of onions. These weren't full, grilled onion slices, it was just tiny bits.
The beef is way way too salty. It takes away from the actual flavor. They could also use a better bread.
The service was nice but I should have insisted she put more peppers and onion on it.
Won't go back...
Two stars because it tastes good but these Philly steaks are SOOO SMALL! It’s the size of a hot dog!

I ordered the Spicy Udon and the Kung Pau udon. Both tasted exactly the same; barring the almost burnt peanuts on the kung pao noodles. The flavors were largely bland and inauthentic; the sauce too thick, and the protein (chicken and tofu) flavorless. On top of this, neither of them were spicy, in spite of them being marked as such on the menu! Overall, very disappointing food.

Pretty good food and excellent spot for vegetarians looking for Thai food and sushi. The service was good and the prices are quite reasonable, considering the portion size of some of the dishes. I didn’t love the presentation of the maki rolls, as they all came together on the same plate and was confusing as to which one was which... but overall, it was an enjoyable dining experience.

My favorite place to get sushi! I love that there are so many great options for vegetarian rolls. The veggie lover is really delicious! I’ve had great experiences with both take out and dine-in. Thank you!!

Everything is delicious. The fireballs are incredible, takoyaki is perfect. And they're very accommodating-- my friend had specific requests that the restaurant was able to meet. I had the Bangkok Soup and it was, first of all, much bigger than I anticipated but also incredibly good. They also have a ton of sushi options I am excited to try out! We will definitely be back.

Really loved their signature Bangkok beef noodles! I originally wanted their new spicy seafood soup but they were all sold out. I asked for this one to be spicy and they gave me a small jar of their homemade sauce so I could adjust it to my liking. The broth is fragrant and lightly sweet so I really enjoyed having it both sweet and spicy. I recommend asking for if you really like adding some heat to your meals!

I've been in this place everytime I land in Chicago. Everything is tasty. We order pancakes, crepes, and omelettes. There's a waiting line and usually it extends outside. They refill coffee and service is very quick. I don't need to mention taste because every single meal you try is perfect. I don't think you can book. So try coming here on weekdays.

These pancakes are AMAZING! The pancake house produces fluffy, soft and delicious buttermilk pancakes that are truly perfect. Their signature apple pancakes are so rich and dense so if you want a different style of pancakes they offer it too. There is a bit of a queue if you get here early but it is worth the wait

Best breakfast spot ever. We made this our breakfast spot to go to whilein chicago. I know there are many more places. But everything was amazing.

Dutch baby pancakes - awesome!
Waffles - amazing!
Omelets - even more amazing
Everything was fresh and cooked to perfection. I can’t say enough about this place.

One of the best breakfast I’ve had. Will go here again when I’m in town. We had four people order food and each meal was made to perfection. Service was quick and they got groups in and out. Highly recommend! Fresh squeezed orange juice!

Literally, The Original Pancake House is my first morning spot every day! The service is super amazing, I take coffee with cream which is always great and the same taste. Steak skillet is my go two. However, on weekends you may need to wait some time to be seated. I wish I could get 50 stars!!!

So they charged $9.09 for this crispy chicken sandwich.  It's advertised as 6.99 +$0.50 for cheese. When I called I didn't ask for cheese yet when I paid they charged for it. When I asked how $6.99 turned to $2.00 of tax I was answered  with. "Prices are high for food right now. We add 10% to the menu."

So $6 99+.50=$7.49 (10%)=$8.24(10.75%)=$9.08

Conclusion: expect to pay about 20.75% with taxes extra on ever purchase

Very disappointed and I called b/c my order was messed up and he didn’t won’t to hear it and was very rude.  They can’t fry chicken wings.  Too soft.  Don’t ate here unless you go in and order so you can check it.  Unprofessional and very disrespectful.
They cool ig, sick of getting my order messed up for all the money I pay specifically the night guys and when your food isn't satisfactory, THEY DO NOTHING... YOU'LL JUST VE OUT IF YOUR MONEY

I ordered an Italian beef combo and was blown away. This is the best I've ever had in this area. If the sandwich I just ate is their usual , then they'll have a loyal customer. They're almost there with the big dogs taste-wise, and the juicy, tender beef was heaping. My compliments.

This is no longer Golden
Hook

THIS IS ALL TOWS MATTER LOT!!!

really shady people here I do not recommend to anyone

Really unprofessional and they are scam artist avoid at all cost

Stumbled in here during the Pride Parade intending to bar hop, but never ended up leaving because of their customer service. Alex was great and made us feel so welcomed we didn't want to leave. Derno's has a low key atmosphere with good bar food and great customer service.
The best dive bar in the city. Ownership is top notch and make you feel like family when you are there. Easy to spend an entire weekend day there with how much fun you're having.
Besides great customer service, amazing food and reasonable drink prices? What more can you ask for? Tuesdays are amazing! Go Shelbylate and Jamie!

Nice little basement bar. I had 2 good margaritas, (they had no salt) oh well, they were good. It smelled a bit musty, but maybe we should have sat away from the bar. The water was running on the sink for about 15 minutes non stop  see the pictures.
Amazing spot for late night drinks and food. The kitchen is open insanely late, so if you want some food after a night of drinking this place is for you!

Art of Pizza is Chicago's best kept pizza secret and at ridiculously awesome prices. The crust is buttery without being greasy. They don't skimp out on toppings either. And I've never had a rude person at the counter - they all make you feel like they've known you for years!

I had the stuffed special pizza slice. It was good but had some areas for improvements.

It was lukewarm. It would have been so much better if it was hotter.

Pizza was also juuuust a little doughy. Probably would have been less noticeable if it the pizza was hotter.

Probably wouldn’t bother again.

Great spot to buy deep dish by the slice, or wait 30-45 minutes for a full deep dish pie (worth the wait). A Chicago-staple with awesome daily specials. What it lacks in ambiance, it makes up by being BYOB and having a Jewel across the street.

The pizza is delicious! Each slice, whether thin, stuffed, or pan, is just $4.99, and the slices are of a decent size. Great value! Also, the customer service is friendly and awesome! I highly recommend this restaurant!

I really appreciate that there is a place in Chicago where i can purchase deep dish by the slice.  These slices are delicious and filled with tasty meats and veggies!!  IMO it rivals some of the more well known tourist favorites.  Ill definitely be coming back for more.

My first try with the Chicago classic deep dish pizza! Yumm! Also my first time having pizza using silverware lol!
This place has a nice ambience. Waiting time a little on the higher side. 2 peeps struggle to finish a small one, so choose your size wisely! Do try out the chocolate chip fillet!!
Everyone can try once if new in Chicago. I like the taste and the style as well. But warning for some people might don’t find it that good. But still testing for one time is recommended.

My friend and I split the pizza with different toppings. His side was spinach and my side was seasoned ground beef. The pizza was delicious and the customer service was great. This experience was apart of my tour of the Southside of Chicago. I enjoyed every bite. We definitely got our money’s worth. The wait for the pizza was 45 minutes. It being a deep dish with great flavor we understood why it would be so long. It was worth the wait. This was my first experience of Chicago style pizza.

Food is decent but the customer service sucks. It’s my first time in Chicago and I heard this place has the best Chicago style pizza. I’m not familiar with it so I wanted to learn more before ordering. I talked to the restaurant folks but they hustled me and were annoyed I didn’t know what I want. I just wanted them to talk be through what the options are. Very disappointing. It also took forever for food to be ready and the order was wrong! Frozen pizza was better, ugh!

We went around noon during a weekday and there was no wait to be seated. There was available parking as well. This was my first time here. We ordered a medium pizza with pepperoni and sausage. It was very cheesy to my liking. I was full off the first slice alone. We really didn’t need a medium. We could have gotten a small. We had pizza from Tuesday until Friday, Lol. It does take 45 mins for their deep dish pizzas to be baked. I gave it only 4 stars because it took forever for the waitress to bring us the check.

I never come to this location because I’ve heard how hectic it gets.  I live right by it and I rather drive further. I came here on 03/20/22 around 8:00 pm and it was SO BUSY. I mean, I felt bad for the workers. It was chaos.
I waited over 5 mins just in line.  Once I ordered and got my food I noticed the right was NOT cooked all the way. It was almost raw tbh, it was the hardest rice I’ve ever had.  While I was in line a customer came up to the cashier ( a gentlemen with a big beard)  and the customer told him if he can redo his burrito because the rice was hard. The employee seemed overwhelmed and said yeah, right after we get done with the line. Mind you there’s like 10 ppl in line. The customer walked away and came back 2 mins later and said “ you know what bro it’s ok, I see you’re busy”    Employee was ok with that.      After I noticed I also got UNCOOKED rice. I couldn’t believe he let that customer eat that burrito with hard rice. That’s gross.   Seriously, I understand when you’re busy you’re busy. But this is not acceptable. People can get sick.  Get it together, manager.

It’s sad the amount of times this location has not only messed up my online orders but along with my family’s. It’s not hard to read words off a piece of paper, literally coming from a former employee.

I order online from this location and since the beginning of the year there have been issues with my orders. Either items are missing or one of the items that was ordered had missing or incorrect toppings. This last time I was missing items on my order and the delivery was 30 minutes. If something like this happens once in a great while I understand and the location or company won’t lose my business. Becaus this is happening on a regular bases and the fact that when you call the location you get put into a automated phone system and can’t talk to a person or you have to go a long drawn out process with Pepper the chat bot, the app and your browser about an issue with your order is why I’m giving them one star.

Dirty, nasty and very over priced. Staff is rude and judgemental about my order, not only that... I didn't add rice or bean and they charged me $5 for extra meat. Unreal! Black girl on staff was so rude rolling her eyes at me. I guess I'll stick to Culver they provide the best customer service. Very ghetto here.

Do not order from Chipotle's personal app for delivery.
We received someone else's order.  No one at this location or ANY location answers their phone.  You can not speak to a human.  They offer a bot named Pepper or contacting support via their form.
Our dinner was ruined.  We are out $50.  We were also charged delivery and service fees despite entering a promo code for free delivery that was sent to us via email.
Disappointing and unacceptable.

Super clean establishment super friendly service! First time dining here food was very good. Prices are a bit on the high side but good portion sizes and flavor makes up for it will be back to try different stuff from the menu!

Absolutely love this place. Really good kosher food with very reasonable prices.
The fried chicken is a must!

Definitely inconsistent
Today my Daughter had a tasty Ceasar salad with chicken

I must say somewhat pricey but overhead cost, the food was average, my first time there will I recommend it ??? No, not saying it was absolute horrible it just wasn't it , more batter than meat and that became tasteless after eating so much of it. I will say very polite staff.

I got angry at them for writing online that the Shabbat menu is only available on Friday well   obviously if they are closed on Saturday it won't be available then. As a matter of fact what I ordered on the Shabbat menu is available all week long as well.
Just be sure that if you order from the Shabbat menu during the week  to stipulate when you want it or they will have it ready for you when you are not even hungry for Shabbat yet.
Other than that I really love their food its very centrally located and have a wide range of items to choose from.

Seemed a bit expensive but pretty typical for the location/neighborhood. Food and service was pretty good - the butter paneer and naan were our favorites. We had a waiter in training and he needed some help, but that’s to be expected as well. The drinks were really nice and they had a lot of fun options.

We went later on a Tuesday night, so it wasn’t too busy.

First off, service was fantastic. Saturday night our waiter, Pacheco, was very attentive and on time for each step. Secondly if being treated like royalty is your bag take a faqing hike. Enjoy the food and who you’re with.

The food was amazing and I had to slow myself down because people started to stare. Indian food with an added flare to make it just devourable. We loaded up on appetizers and three medium entrees. Really something special out of a “top receipt award show”. Thanks for the meal, see you at the women’s chef event!

Decor was lacking but again I’m here to eat not go to Tao. I think this use to be a clothing shop. Wait until the next establishment, Michelin Star for SURE

I would stay away from this place, I feel like it’s pretty much a big scam. For $200 worth of takeout for the“ Valentine’s Day special“ (not including drinks either) the food quality or quantity did not live up to my expectations. I feel that you can get Equivalent cuisine at any other Indian restaurant without the price tag for  so called fusion.

I also felt that the service was rather chaotic as when I picked up my food, there was no one at the front for more than 5 minutes.

I can’t believe I spent close to $200 just to have a horrible experience. I was genuinely excited to try this valentines concept that the restaurant had made. The food was great although that quickly changed when we received our ribs and found hairs in it and all the waiter could say was “oh i’m sorry about that”. I overheard the couple next to us complain that they had found a hair in their food as well. Myself as well as other couples had to keep asking the waiters where our food was and even after asking them, it still took them a long time to bring out the next dish. We stayed well over an hour after the original closing time. I hate to be that person that complains but can you really blame me?

Great variety of flavors and new tastes we experienced.  The skirt steak was absolutely fantastic, filled with flavor and very tender.  The May India AAPI Celebration course was great, highlighted by the buttered chicken, and complimented by amazing pani puri and the dessert!

The food was little saltier than my preference but it was very delicious and meat were very tender. Drinks and desserts were also very tasty! Pomegranate ginger ale and chocolate fudge cake with ice cream was so tasty! The manager was very professional and apologized for the delay on our orders.

Portion sizes were great for sharing. Each dish has strong, memorable flavors. We came about 2 hours before closing on a Tuesday. The place was almost empty, but we never left unchecked or waiting at our table. The staff was very genuine, kind, and helpful.

The flavors of the food remains consistent just as the portions 😁
We love this place, the service is great & fast, food is delicious.
Ribs are amazing, do try them !
The pricing & portions are parallel, so i recommend ordering less than usual.

Restaurant was busy but we were able to snag seats at the bar. Food portion are enough to share and everything was delicious. It was Lexies first night bartending and she did phenomenal! We'll definitely be back next time we're in Chicago.

Ordered the Pad Thai with Chicken and their margarita - both were delicious! Need a reservation in the evening, or may have a 30+ min wait, but if solo or just two people, the bar is a good option - the one we went with.  Good food, nice atmosphere. Recommend!
One of the best Dunkin locations I've been to. The early morning employees are efficient and attentive, Thank you.

Cashier staff efficient excellent can't complain about them .For the past couple of weeks cups and lids are not safe secure it drips down the sides as drinking and  even holding corporate managers  and  need to fix this issue .
I tried to buy coffee between 2 am and 3 am and they always tell me that there is no system, I think that the person who is attending at that time simply does not want to provide service.
Whole new Morning crew! They move like Turtles! Wait time is always too long! Bring the old crew back please

This Is One Of my Fave Location But Today I Stop By To Make A Order But Some Reason They Were Not Taking Orders At 11 pm. They Should Of Put A Sign If The Lacation Is Closed So The  Costumers Don't Waste Time Stopping By For Some Coffee

Let's start off by saying the parking lot is horrible more holes than Swiss cheese. Now on to the service.. The service was not at all up to standards Young lady at the window with the long red nails needs to go back to school or training for customer service. And to top it all off yes got hot fries but whopper was very cold. Now why is it that I cannot get a receipt with my order, in order for me to get a receipt I have to give them my cell phone and they take a picture of it .GET YOUR SYSTEM FIXED. POOR SERVICE POOR EVERYTHING..
I wanted to try this Burger King for a Whopper not really happy with their customer service plus the Whopper was cold!
my whopper Jr. was so fresh I enjoyed it. Delicious.

ABSOLUTELY THE SLOWEST BURGER KING IN THE CITY OF CHICAGO!
If you’re trying to get a bite before work or school or even during lunch, forget about it.
You’ll be on the verge of losing your job trying to get a bite of eat from this location yes
unable to take my order system was down every time i come here its down why even stay open this place needs to be shut down already terrible customer service

I have always been a fan of Arby's! Although I don't eat there too often, it's great to know where to go for a different type of fast food menu. They have a great menu and plenty to choose form. They provide generous portions and for economical rates.  Very well organized and accessible spot. Finally, this location has always had great customer service and a clean environment. The service is always fast, efficient and consistently on point. All workers have good attitudes and super personable and explanatory. They ensure that every customer is satisfied with the service and to the food. Always had excellent tasted food. Truly, great flavor of sandwiches and consistent quality of food.

Always heard bad things about this location, but I love Arby’s food so I decided to give it a shot. Welp. Bad decision. The woman taking my order had a horrible attitude, for their to only be 2 customers being serviced during the 10 minutes it took for my order to be completed. Then, she had the nerve to act like she was frustrated with me because she didn’t have any of the menu items I inquired about. Finally, I simply asked her to add chocolate drizzle to my vanilla shake but she refused. And in her refusal, she acted as if it was humanly impossible to add some chocolate sauce to an ice cream beverage. Whomever this rude woman is that works at this location should either be retrained on customer service or replaced. There are way too many people looking for jobs that are willing to do their job correctly.

This place was absolutely terrible to me. Knowing they close at 5:30pm I walk up at 5:13pm and befor I could even place my order the lady behind the counter tells me roast beef only. When my co-worker who walked up two minutes before me ordered and received a turkey sandwich… I guess she didn’t want to make any more food. Also told me that none of the specials were available.. 11/22/21 at 5:13pm

Came up to the counter at 3:30pm on Friday 10/1 and said hello to the one person back by the cooking area. No one at the register. As I got my wallet out, she looked up but went back to doing something else. I asked politely if there was someone to take my order. She mumbled something, then went back to doing what she was doing. I stood there another 30 seconds with her ignoring me. I told her, "you've lost my business" and went to Taco Bell. Owner of this Arby's must be rich and not need my business.

I am very disappointed in this Arby's I came for lunch because I saw they had the new 6 piece Buffalo chicken wings. I stood in the line for 3 minutes no seeing anyone, even when I said hello hello. Finally a young ladies goes to the fry station saying nothing so I asked "are you the only one here"? she replies she will be open in a minute. Another 3 minutes goes by as a lined filled and customers wondered whats going on left. Finally another young lady comes out the back and said hi may I help you, I said yes I have been standing here waiting for 6 minutes and her reply was yeah we are short staffed I said well can I at least get a I am sorry for the wait? She goes on to say maam even if I could do that its not my fault we are suffering too being short staff. I said so no apology just oh well and she repeats the same thing then says may I help you? I told her no you can not and went to Mcdonalds. So unprofessional and had no empathy at all, a simple I am sorry about you wait maam may I help you. Don't go to this arby's they are not right and can care less that you are a customer.

I’ve been coming here since I was a wee lad. I left my Zorlac skateboard here sometime in the summer of 1990. I cried for days. If you were the one who found this skateboard, I’d appreciate you contacting me at this account. The hot dogs here are amazing, Chicago style dogs. Everything else is great too. Stop by if you are in the area! Thumbs way up! 👍🏻
Simple and delicious cheese dog here. Adds lots of fries so you actually get pretty full. Prices have gone up a lot, don't trust Google map menu..

Good Chicago dog and fries. When they say "do you want everything" I always say "Yes, plus hot peppers" The last few times I've gone, no hot peppers. So frustrating 😫. I love the hot peppers on a chicago hot dog. I give up asking for hot peppers.

This dog should not be considered to be in the same category as other chicago dog joints. Our hot dogs were served without sport peppers or celery salt. They were grey, soggy and unimpressive. The fries were good though!
The prices are affordable and they have free parking. Hot dog and fries is $3.50. Add a melted cheddar cheese cup for .70. And they cook the fries when you order.

Always stop here before hitting the train. And it never fails me. If you want some real good tasting food, stop here next time your in town. It is underground going to the Metra and South shore line. I got the Steak breakfast n it was great.

So tasty! We wanted something away from tourists and it was such a good affordable spot. The veggie burrito was huge and delicious. It didn't last long! Tamales were good and things were made to order.

This restaurant is downstairs where you get off of the South Shore train by Millennium Park. They have a gyro sandwich that is to die for. It's freshly made and absolutely delicious. The friend with me had a New York hot dog with all the fixings and he raved about it. The prices are reasonable. The staff is friendly and fun. The place is clean. And it's one of the rare finds in Chicago where you can get good food at a reasonable price. I highly recommend it.
These guys are pretty good.  Good food and good service. Give them some time. Located in the did court at the train station, they're the only ones busy.  Be patient and enjoy.
Authentic gyros & Mexican food right across from Millennium Park. Don't pass it up due to the location -- food is terrific! And you can get take out and head to the park to eat. Great find!

I’ve been coming here for YEARS and they have never disappointed. Last time I visited was in 2019, moved back to the city this year 2022 and made Luella my first outting! I may have had a different experience than others because I arrived during the early morning hour (11:30am), there was no line, no excessive wait time for food, and everyone was pleasant.

You do have to order on an app but that just means that their tip gets smaller. I refuse to order multiple times and be forced to pay a fee and tip each time 🤷🏿‍♀️. All in all, the food is great, the portion sizes are decent (I almost always have left overs), and the staff is pleasant. I recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to try southern food!

Absolutely phenomenal you must eat here! It’s definitely worth the wait you will not be disappointed ❤️‍🔥 went on a weekend date was pleasantly surprised we love soul food ..this is the true definition of it. Travis was a wonderful server always recommending good stuff & such a good sense of humor he has! The beignets are chefs kiss, I will continue to come back &eventually try everything on the menu. They also have a lovely vintage record player playing music 🎶

Food was super delicious. The restaurant has a real southern feel. There were nice size portions...I had another meal from leftovers. Can't wait to go back and try their Shrimp & Grits and Chicken Gumbo.

Luella’s knocks it out of the park. Best fried chicken and waffles I’ve had (A+) - recommend getting the Nashville Hot. Took about 30 min to get my meal, but it was worth the wait. Luella’s service was attentive and kind. Would absolutely come back!

It started off okay as we were able to get seated right away. We arrived at the end of the brunch, around 2pm. The restaurant is intimate but not claustrophobic. It is a different feel as you order from the QR code on the table and the food is brought to you as it is prepared. There was a layer of confusion when my husband ordered. I ordered the appetizer (fried green tomatoes, no pic) and O thought he ordered out food. He only ordered 1 shrimp & grits, not 2. The waitress saw his discontent and my confusion/sympathy. I requested a container so that we could leave. As I was putting my food in the container, the waitress comes over with a piping hot plate of Shrimp & grits…on the house! She expressed that she felt bad for the miscommunication. I greatly appreciated that. The cook time is lengthy. Also, if you order your appetizer first, it shouldn’t appear with your main entree.

The fried green were good but with add more sauce on the plate or provide some as a dipping sauce. The breading needs a touch more flavor.

The Shrimp & Grits…the tails are still on the shrimp. That’s disappointing.

I will follow the recommendations of ordering first but you run the risk of having nowhere to sit if you plan to dine in. You have to put your table number in the order when dining in.

Although a lackluster 1st impression, I do plan to return for dinner in the future!

Chicago Black Restaurant week runs from Feb 6-20, 2022!

Had an amazing time in this traditional Peruvian restaurant! Every meal was well made and truly delicious. The atmosphere and the waiters also contributed to a fresh peruvian experience. Highly recommend if you don't know peruvian cuisine but you are curious to get to know it!

The service was friendly, fast, and attentive. The food was delicious. We had the Tiger’s Milk appetizer, which is a type of ceviche served in a cup. It was simply delicious! We also had a beef empanada, which was sprinkled with powder sugar bay first, I didn’t know what to make of it. But once I tasted it, it was amazing. For main entrees, we had the rice with seafood and the churrasco with a side of plantains and a side of spicy potatoes. The Peruvian paella was perfect! For dessert, we had arroz con leche - a perfect way to end our first visit to Machu Picchu.

Overall: Solid Peruvian joint if you're looking for something authentic and different. Don't be fooled by the aging outdoor sign, this place is great!

The good: The food overall is very good. The rice dishes are fantastic and all of the fish dishes that I've had are awesome. The apps are all very tasty. It seems pretty authentic. The portion sizes are good sized and the menu is varied. BYOB and no corkage.

The not-so-good: One night was very busy, but the service was pretty limited. Took forever to get the order. The lomo saltado was a little too salty. Not a super fancy restaurant or anything, could be a little cleaner.

Atmosphere: 8/10
Service: 8/10
Food: 8/10

Fresh ingredients, friendly and attentive staff, and delicious Peruvian food! BYOB too! The food was super flavourful, every single thing we ordered was really good. Loved the staff who knew a lot about the food and culture, definitely recommend this place!
Beautiful Restaurant and a special thank you to our waiter Mr. Angel for his kindness. Totally delicious and fresh food 🇵🇪
Very good customer service, my favorite subway to visit ! Food is always fresh!
It's ok ! But don't like that they don't Clean the tables and the soda fountain ! The two time I have gone in this year it's filthy
It’s a great idea to have some friends and have something to eat

Food is awesome and fresh.  Short guy who work in morning is really nice and sandwich artist. He always smile and happy all the time. I love to go this place every day.  Even my son like to go every day . Store is very clean and nice .

The employees are very friendly and the food is good & just what you'd expect from Subway. There are some menu items that only seem to be available in store that you can't order online like a personal pizza or broccoli cheddar soup. My go-to is typically the Italian BMT or sweet onion chicken teriyaki 💜
Pay with the subway app for discounts
Entertainment was good. Outdoor atmosphere very nice. Awesome views of Lake Michigan.
We had an amazing time relaxing on our last day of summer. The kids enjoyed the games available and the band Anika was a great vibe
Great hangout spot. Great way to spend a few hours
Lots of beer. Live music. Awesome scenery.
Great place in the summer to listen to live music 🎶 eat food and have a beer 🍺

8 piece wing salt and pepper, as well as lemon pepper with mild sauce on everything!
1st time, perspective chicken was still hot and crispy even with the sauce on em.  You can't be cute enjoying this meal but it's worth the sauce covered fingers!

I ordered a 6pc dark and a 1/2 white. I asked for lemon pepper seasoning on my white meat. Cashier said she couldn’t give it on the side so not only did I not get it on the side but she didn’t even put it on the chicken at all. My son asked me to bring home some of this hole in the wall, mediocre, expensive chicken. We definitely have better chicken in NC. SO NOT WORTH IT . Will not come here again.
Customer service was perfect, food  was hot and fresh, ordered wings and livers fried Xtra crispy with extra mild sauce, and 1/4 dark with mild sauce
