Heard about this place, decided to give it a chance.. The parking was ok. There is NO dine-in. It is a REAL whole in the wall with horrible a/c issues. The line moved super slow. There were NO PRICES posted anywhere. The staff was not especially welcoming. But, the wings were good. I purchased 4 lemon pepper wings for $12, when my order was ready, I asked for a little of the house sauce. She asked to see my receipt before she squeezed a little on my wings. I had to say, I tried the house sauce.... The wings were fresh, lightly battered, a great crisp and seasoned well, however for $12 I could've purchased 2 whole chickens and a 10 pound bag of potatoes. 😃

Now that I visited Harold's  Fried Chicken in Chicago,  I can say, I tried it. Thanks for the one time experience.  I am honored to say I supported your establishment.

Chicken wasn’t drained from the grease, and it showed throughout the entire meal. The chicken tasted soggy, the bread turned yellow because it was a sponge to the chicken grease. The fries were drenched in grease too. As you can presume everything was salty due to what class? Any guess? THE GREASE! Correct! The 1 star is for the decent service and because Google wouldn’t allow No stars.

Wow what a great first impression! Considering how recently this restaurant opened, I am absolutely astounded by the service, menu, cocktails, and ambiance. I am confident this place will only get better with age. I've visited twice so far and enjoyed everything I ate and drank. My favorite dishes are the bacon wrapped dates, fried chicken, duck empanadas, and cheese fondue with pretzel breadsticks. We also had the pot pie and deviled eggs which were also delicious. The drinks are fantastic. Offering 5 draft cocktails and endless shaken/stirred, there's really no way someone could not find something they loved.

Really really disappointed by this experience. Had a wonderful Yelp event here with phenomenal food. Either ownership changed or it was a sorely, sorely off day.

Would not come back again.

I got the Gilt city offer but Tippling Hall was not serving lunch anymore... well alright. Then they ran out of strawberry/kale salad.... then I finally chose something else and they put in almonds instead of hazelnuts without telling me. I find this extremely unprofessional because if I had a food allergy... well there goes that.

The salad portions were also paltry. Not exceptional in the least.

It's so disappointing because I LOVED Tippling Hall during their Yelp Elite event, and the manager was super nice.

I just think the quality is so lacking now.

I finally ordered the Seven Grain Thai Bowl. It was decent but was it worth $15?! No... I could have made it at home.

This space has huge potential but it's menu needs revamping.

GREAT , Food and Ambiance  All in one place.  The pretzels were a big hit, The Prime Rib And Steak  and Fried Chicken were Awesome.  Cocktails Menu GREAT   Great Music  and a rare find  Great for Late night 3:AM Good Food  now open for Brunch , Reasonable prices  GREAT TIME

Came here for brunch, amazing bloody marys and brunch entrees. Plus the have music too! That made me come into for late night, since they are open until 4 am. The whole menu is available until close. So for late night dining in Chicago they are a must!!! Cocktails are amazing, try the alice fay and BBQ daisy.

Great new spot in River North. The deviled eggs are pretty darn good! The torta is all right--- the pork carnitas tasted kind of funny and dry to me, even though at the same time, they weren't that dry-- it made me think that beans were smashed in there too. It doesn't make sense, I know. I had the quinoa salad too, not too bad--- the brie doesn't really seem like it mixes with the rest of the salad though.

I got the BBQ Daisy, which was good, the Booty Collins, which I really enjoyed, the Good Juju, which was alright,and the Little Market, which I really didn't like, but that's because I don't enjoy drinks with too much pineapple juice. Bruno the Donkey is really simply and really girly-- but I like the touch of absinthe in it.

Great service overall, we really liked our server. Decor of the place and ambiance is great too. The bathrooms are freezing though-- I was shivering each time I walked in there.

Close and convenient to the Chicago brown line stop.

I mess with this spot. Chinese food how I like it greasy and good. Shrimp fried rice comes filled to the top, they staple it to keep it closed yes sirrr. Two Egg rolls, and Crab Rangoon both crunchy hit it with sweet n sour sauce. Been here a few time consistently ive haven't had a miss yet.

Great food as well as wonderful customer service.  Very great food portions and great prices. Have been a neighborhood customer for many years and highly recommend to anyone whose in the area to check out 🙂

I loved this place. The food is good and pricing is reasonable. Just recently they messed up my order three separate time that's why I gave them 3 stars instead of 5. Also they did correct my order with no problem. Very nice and polite. Don't like the hassle of going back to store.
Second time here and experiencing very strange flavor profiles. Mongo beef was so sugary and sweet I couldn't finish it.
I've lived by and have been going here for 8 years. It used to be good, but has gotten steadily worse to the point the last 2 times it was inedible, had to throw it out. Never again

I cannot tell you enough how happy I was to come across this place. We meant to go across the street but kitchen was close. We drove here and I asked the guy helping the front “is it too late to come in” we were celebrating an unexpected job offer. He said. Come in. Order quickly. We did. Amazing  food. Amazing service. Portions are so good. We all have left overs for lunch tomorrow. Prices are affordable! Food taste good. Great presentation. I mean. We were all so happy that we landed there. Will be back!

The food is fantastic! This is my third time going with my family and I love it. I think the prices is reasonable. They got their own parking lot across the street from the restaurant. The atmosphere is cozy and romantic. It's great to have families, group of friends, and dates.

Calo is perfect for date night. Prosciutto appetizer was very straight forward. The free bread (two kinds) was a nice touch. Lasagna was hearty and yummy tiramisu finished our meal. I would come back and try the seafood next time.

I went with a friend on Saturday night, and that place was crowded. It's a very traditional Italian cuisine, the entrées, appetizers, pastas, pizzas, to dye for,  authentic comfort food, and the wines list🍷 are amazing. I totally recommend this place to impress a date or family's 👪  gathering. The server was very knowledgeable about the menu and wine selection. I had a great time at Calo's restaurant.

Food was amazing.  Great menu.  Tons of choices.  Everything was delicious.  Service was slow and seems way more disorganized than the last time we were there. We will try again as the food is worth it to give another try.  The rotolo was so good and the chicken vesuvius was generous in portion size and delicious.  We were sat immediately bit there was slowness to take the order,  bussing was almost non existent.  We were rarely asked for a drink fill or follow up order.  Service was disappointing.

When I call in my orders, the staff is always kind. Food is fresh. When I arrive to pickup my food, the order is accurate and ready. The parking lot is small. Park on the street unless you want your door dented. Hopefully, Red Snapper Fish Chicken can move across the street in the old KFC.

I went into the facility they only had one customer ahead of me I was told it would take 12 minutes from my freshly fried chicken wings In less than 6 minutes I was told my order was ready I did not see the person dropping in the grease at all I said is that my order  The young lady replied yes I said what do you guys pre fry your food. You said no we fried him fresh you didn't see it. I asked for my money back and they gave it to me and I will never going there again.

I ordered a pick up order and when I went to pick my order up they told me they gave my order away to a driver… 🤔 it’s a pick up order not a delivery order… but anyways the “lady” behind the counter gave me an attitude even though they gave my food away she had an attitude 🤯 she asked me if I wanted my food order cooked again… of course I do… it’s 8 at night and I would like the food I ordered… then she finds my order but had a problem giving me forks and napkins… not going here again. When I emailed the store about her incompetence to have hospitality in a hospitality industry… crickets. Bye Red Snapper. I will not eat at any location ever again.
Seafood was nasty. We got an order of perch and catfish it was disgusting. It was barley done fries was old. This was my first and last time visiting this place. The bread was nasty and tasted old.
The cashier with the red hair is very nice better then others she needs to only cashier I think her name is zamria she’s very nice

Loved this restaurant! We came in an hour before they closed and despite the temperature in the building the employees were very pleasant and helpful to us. Our food was done quickly and there was a LOT of it (we got the rice bowls). The only reason I took off a star was for the price! We had 3 people and for a bowl and a smoothie each, we spent $50. We're not from here, so that could just be normal fare (especially since I think smoothies were the most expensive drink option) but we were a little shocked. At least the food was good and we had a lot of it!

Edit: we came back for breakfast another day and the omlette, crepes, and Greek yogurt are delicious as well!
It's a hidden gem. I really like the atmosphere here and the food options are great. I came here for a tuna salad and enjoyed it. Hope to come again for a smoothie.

Good food but unfortunately, I got back to the hotel and my order was wrong for my $14 rice bowl. The toppings I requested were not all on my plate. Somehow chickpeas were added, which I didn't request. I would've gone back today but I'm flying out soon. Really would've loved the full flavor I was hoping for. But, the chicken was flavorful!!! Maybe I'll give it another try in the future. This was my first visit.
Excellent selections and everything looks great. I had the double burger classic. Great food and very clean facility. Deceptively good  - building doesn't match inside and out. Give it a try!
First time going here and I will definitely go back. Very reasonable price for a downtown resturant and they serve delish food.
Absolutely fantastic breakfast and not expensive! If it's early and you're near millennium park, I recommend it. I got the baci bowl and my sister got the waffles. Both were wonderful!

Came here for lunch with my boyfriend since he works DT.  It was quick, fast, and inexpensive.  I had the fettuccine pasta.  It was just MEH.  Nothing special, no meat but it was filling and I liked the basil.  Then I ordered the pistachio gelato.  I savored every lick and bite of that. I'll come back for the gelato but not the pasta.
This is a great place for lunch! I really like their sandwich with Prosciutto and Mozzarella . Their gelato is also good for a snack during the day!
Good service: they took the time to explain us the different plate combinations. Relaxed spot on a busy street to rest after a walk in Millenium Park.
Food was very under-cooked and it lacked flavor, I understand it's a lunch rush but if your going to skip important steps just to get customers then that's a real shame.

Absolutely the place you should go to if you like old-fashioned, home-style, and just straight up good eating. You will enjoy comfort food without feeling bloated and sick — which is sadly what happens so often in America. But not here! My partner is Czech, and she said the food is just like food her mother would make her. In fact, the website homepage says it’s just like grandma would make — and they’re right! Please support local businesses like these. They’re so important, and they deserve our business.

I really enjoyed this place. It was a completely serendipitous that I ended up here and I am very glad we did. The original byo that we planned on going to was closed. Planned on going to a different place nearby but saw this place and decided to try it. Glad we did. The food was fantastic and all homemade. Not byo, but corkage was fair. Tried a variety of dishes including many staples. All of them were excellent. Definitely try this place.

Just touched down in the Chi and this gem was our 1st stop. Wife being from Poland she wanted a taste of home as soon as we landed. Everything was delicious and we got the personal treatment. Food is a little pricey, (in our opinion) but the food left us very satisfied.
My first time here. Potato pancakes and meatballs in dill  sauce... The side of beets were also @! ~ Delicious!

My family just went to Smakosz for my birthday. The food was outstanding!!!! You can tell it was made with love and everything was so fresh! We each had 2 dishes plus dessert and wanted to lick our plates! We will definitely be coming back! So happy to have stumbled upon this gem!

We were in Chicago for a marathon event and stopped by Pequod's Pizza for dinner. We ordered a large deep dish pizza with Italian sausage, meatballs, and onion. Our server advised us that our pizza would take about 45 minutes to prepare, but it was worth the wait!

The sauce on our pizza was full of flavor and delicious, the toppings tasted fresh and high quality, and the cheese was gooey and creamy. These fantastic ingredients topped the tasty breading that made up the crust of the pizza. This was the deepest deep dish pizza I have ever eaten! After two slices, I felt full and satisfied.

The service is a bit slow, but the staff is friendly and they have a lot of customers to attend to. But all things considered, if you have a little patience it will be rewarded with a truly superior Chicago-style deep dish pizza.

Legendary pizza. Unless you get there right at open, there will probably be a wait, but it is definitely worth it. Both the deep dish and thin crust are excellent. If you’re with a group, order both and the thin crust might come out prior to the deep dish and it’s like a pizza appetizer for your pizza main course. Friendly service and a very good beer list as well.

Quite an interesting place to say the least. I'm sure dining in would've an even wonderful experience. I got a 14 inch large pan with cheese, a 7 inch pizza with sausage, and mozzarella sticks all for $50. I thought the pizza was good. A little doughy to my liking but good. The sausage was my favorite with the flavor and compact fullness of it. Would love to come back here for an experience.

It’s been said, “When in Rome, do as the Romans do.” In turn, when visiting Chicago, you try the deep dish pizza! 💕

Everyone knows that Giordano’s is iconic, but before I give them a try I figure it would be good to try all the other deep dish pizzerias in the game, right? I’m a New Yorker to my core and know many a well loved pizzeria in NYC for that coveted slice of NY Style perfection. But I’m in Chicago and word on the street is that Pequod’s Pizza rivals Giordano’s any day. Okay…challenge accepted.

I’ve enjoyed pizza in Rome, Tuscany, Florence, & New York City. Pequod’s pizza is so dang delicious that I will be returning for another medium size pie with garlic, basil, and pepperoni. I will thoroughly enjoy it on my own instead of sharing it. It was quintessential Chicago deep dish and the cheese pull on this pizza is like watching a perfectly edited pizza commercial but it’s happening in real life.

The feel of the restaurant is like a cozy dive bar with exceptional food and very okay cocktails. I ordered a margarita and could barely taste the  tequila because it was drowned in Roses Sweetened Lime juice. As a bartender for a solid 5 years in NYC, I’m boogie about my cocktails. Sorry, not sorry. Overall I enjoyed the vibe and looking forward to one more visit to eat some deep dish pizza before I return to NYC.

🙏🏾💛

I liked the pan pizza a lot. More than enough in portions. The only problem was that my wife who is gluten free had a tough time finding anything to eat. They were out of gluten free crust is what the waiter said.  The quality and taste were spot on.  Wings could have been better and need to have an option were they aren't breaded.

This used to be the best Dunkin in the area, but now it's the worst. They need better/more people working there. The lady making the food misses half the orders that come in, and then makes them incorrectly.
The location is permanently closed. Don't go here.

Ive never been a big fan of Dunkin Doughnuts, well that was just changed. How you may ask. There is a true humanitarian by the name of Kassie. When walking by the resturant they were giving away a new product called frozen coffee. Now she helped a blind man across the street. Then i said i had to come in they have amazing flavors in their frozen coffees. This wonderful DD is managed by Mariana. The cleanliness alone will bring you in. Then the customer svc is beyond any you think you would find in Chicago. Go team Go. So you must come by and give them a shout tell them Tracy sent you.
Quick service is great and all but please, stop burning your coffee.
Best Dunkin Donuts. Friendly customer service and great coffee.
Nice, small restaurant. We went to celebrate a friend's birthday. All the staff was great and so does the food. First time there I loved it.
Food was delicious.  First time visit.  Ready to go again.  BYOB

I really enjoyed my first visit, and will come back again. The complimentary shrimp consome is delicious, full flavored, spiced but not spicy, and carries wonderful flavors of the ocean with a light touch. The Camarón Vaquero plate was mildly spiced, but had lots of garlic and butter flavors. Very doable for those who don't like a lot of heat. With the crab salad and avocado provided, along with some hot sauce and their creamy seafood sauce, these shrimp make great tacos. Jamaica was good; not too sweet like some places make it. I was excited that they had Guayaba, but it was on the sweeter side and I couldn't drink it. I wasn't going to let my preference for the less sweet dictate the loss of a star.

Food is always delicious!! I didn’t want to rave about this place because it’s small and I hate to wait when I wanna eat so I’ve tried keeping this place to myself! But,  I’ll give the credit where it’s due! If you love shrimp you’ll love this place
I was mislead it because when I ordered they told me my fish would be Nayarit style, it wasn't good . Customer service nice but fake!
I mean ya gotta love Domino's - they never let us down on a busy weekday night 🍕

It’s tasty, fast, and cheap.  I love what they’ve done with the sandwiches and pastas and bread.  But it is, at it’s roots, Dominos, so don’t expect something that it’s not.  There’s plenty of artisan, expensive pizza places nearby.
I ordered 2 medium $5,99 each,they said it takes 15 minutes, but it took 30 m,but they are nice people

Pizza was great delicious tasting but, the cashier needs to be trained more professionally. There was old man in front of me and couldn't hear very well, she act to him with no respect and me as well. Please be happy 3:30pm 01/23/19. Thank you
amazing pizza every time. always delivered quickly. 10/10
Great stuff. Don't like the fact there isn't individual combo, but the food was satisfying. Would go again.
Excellent!! Huge menu and equally huge portions! Very professional and friendly staff! I walk in and the owner always remembers my favorite order...awesome!
Had Szechuan beef, it was flavorful. Take out is best here, as the room isn’t fancy at all. But the plates they serve are better than what you’ll find at most Chinese restaurants.
we didnt eat because they didnt understand what gluten free was.
I love Tasty Asian! (We eat here quite frequently)

Hands down the best Thai food in Chicago. We got the farmers market roll as well as the Godzilla roll and I’m pretty sure my wife died and went to Heaven after tasting it. The owners and their family are the sweetest people you will ever talk to! Constantly asking if you need anything, best recommendations, and super helpful when it came to diet restrictions. I could keep going on and on but seriously come and try it yourself.

This was my first time ever having sushi and it was fantastic! I got the Hot Sea sushi roll. The wait time was short, the plating was fantastic, the cross section was beautiful! Such a great first time experience having sushi. If you’re new to sushi, the Hot Sea roll at Talay is where it is at. I can’t wait to go back.

This was a pleasant find for an evening dinner. The sushi rolls were amazing!  Would definitely recommend the Talay Crunch roll. We loved the presentation and artwork they did with the sauces on the serving board too!

When I asked the waiter about the red curry, he said there was no fish sauce, so I ordered it. However when the plate arrived, it had a very strong fish odor. I gave the dish back because I can't eat fish, and ordered a basil fried rice instead. Was still charged for the red curry even though I didn't eat it and had even tried to clarify my no-fish requirement before ordering.

I’ve never had a bad experience at Talay. Whether it’s take out, delivery, or dining in, the food is 100% perfect every time. It has quickly become my fiancé and I’s favorite place for sushi or Thai food in all of Chicago! Fully recommend dining in so you can experience the wonderful wait staff as well.
The food and service is great. They offer great meal deals every day except Sunday. Prices are really fair and menu is classic Chicago selections.  Only flaw is the delivery hours vary.

Was there on March 14, I ordered the steak quesadillas and a small fry.  The food was good, but what I didn't like was the cashier was working with her child behind the counter.  She was on the phone, chasing the child, letting him talk on the phone and even going in the cooking area.  I seldom go to this place, but I felt uncomfortable with a four year old running around in a potentially dangerous area.  Hopefully it was a one time thing.

This place is now SeaShells and the food was amazing and Grubhub delivery was fast for me. The price for my 5pc Catfish Fillet was $10 which was a nice price and tastes THE BOMB!!! It was fresh tasting. I look forward to ordering there again.

The food is good BUT the orders are ALWAYS wrong. I ordered a 3 piece chicken dinner with extra mild sauce last night, chicken was good, no mild sauce in sight! Maybe it's the cashiers, I won't order again.

They put an imitation Italian sausage on my  Italian beef Italian sausage combination and they also use a dirty lids to make my friends milkshake and complain when she asks for money back.  The cook/owner is very rude....

Indian/Pakistani version of Chipotle - have a bowl or have a roll. I went in to get Indian dinner with friends so we opted to just get a bunch of the 'toppers' and 'bases' (naan, rice, etc.) to have family style dinner. Things were tasty. My criticism is around the limited vegetarian options (paneer and tofu were both delicious though).

Just like the 2 restaurants in this location before Ali's, ambiance sucks. Recommend take-out or delivery (which they are rolling out in April 2014).
Unexpected find. Contemporary tasty Indian food without having to go to Devon.  With Parking. Friendly service. The children loved the chalkboard!

Oh-My-God!!!! I haven't been here in such a long time, not since I was a kid. Everyone I know misses Quiznos everywhere! Their toasting STILL can't be beat and the food tastes as authentic and as marvelous as it always did!!! I can't say enough how extrodinary my visit was as far as service and excitement. This hits the spot, Quiznos fans, this  hits the spot.
I got the steak cheese chipotle sandwich and it was really good I was surprised by how soft the bread was and how not messy it was. 10/10.
Only Quiznos left in the city.  They make a great peppercorn steak. Staff is always nice. Sammies are great too. Always a good meal here!!

I have come serval times and never have problems with the making of my sandwich BUT every time the STORE OWNER is there It’s a PROBLEM for condiment substitutes. I could tell he is more focus on making gourmet sandwiches that come as-is, so after today and charging me for mayo(not extra mayo) I
WONT be coming back that’s bad for business and I will never suggestion this location to my clients going forward. It’s upsetting because I tip the workers and is a familiar face and I couldn’t add a condiment(not extra condiments) to my sandwich without being charged. It’s a sandwich shop for Gods sake. I

Best subs out of all the Sub shop chains, no question about it! This location is always clean, and the staff is quite helpful and polite. I just don't understand why anybody would go into a Subway with Quiznos being an option. Love the side pickles, and the amazing sauces. Thumbs up !

Love the brisket and pulled pork here. I recommend the combos sandwiches because they come with a side of fries and a side half pound protein. For our first time we ordered everything separately 1 pound of each protein and tried all the sauces the sauces were all good. And for dessert we had the peach cob and the pecan Carmel bread pudding they were both to die for. I did feel that the sides should be a bit bigger if there was 1 con but overall everything was tasty I will be back.

Had the Pulled Pork, Brisket and the Ribs that were recommended by the staff. Came from a recommendation and it sure did not fall on my expectation for the food.

Brisket and pulled pork under the option to choose between Lean or Juicy, it was very much juicy when i chose that. There's a subtle flavor from the BBQ and the sauce further enhances it. It was delicious and worthy of my visit across the globe.

Ribs were tender and meaty, not overly greasy and definitely not dry from the BBQ.

However, do note that it can get crowded and be very hot waiting just to place your order which is in the air conditioned indoors. Tentage waiting area has no air circulation and it was very hot just waiting out for your turn. So be prepared to be "BBQ" before your order if you're making a visit during the summer.

Other than that, i think the food's great.

I enjoyed the brisket,flavor was on point meat was so tender a nice portion was given with the sandwich. The Mac and cheese was awesome the crumble on top made it extra tasty. I'm not a big fan of cole slaw but this one was good. The cornbread was on the dry side not the best. I would have like for the sides to have been a little larger. There are three sauces you can choose from I choose a sweet one it was good but too sweet for my liking so next time I'll try a different one. The dining area was clean and the staff was friendly especially the lady who took my order. This is a BYOB establishment. A must try if you like BBQ

Great bbq spot on the north side. Our lean brisket was delicious, ribs were flavorful and the side were generous in size especially the fries. Cornbread was not as moist as I like but was still yummy.
The dinning area is fairly small but they do have a decent size outdoor patio. Parking is a bit of an issue since this place doesn’t have its own parking lot but we had no problem finding a spot just a block away during dinner time. Everyone in the restaurant area is very friendly and quickly assisted us with any requests.

This place was awesome. A small menu but done really well. The pulled pork sandwich was one of the best I’ve had. They do NOT skimp on the meat. They say it’s 6oz for a sandwich but it sounds way smaller than what you really get. Both the Carolina and spicy mesquite were really good sauces, and they give you quite a bit. I really like that they give you a full side of sauce to drizzle over the sandwich, allows you to put on as much as you want.

The brisket was also good, but not nearly as good as the pulled pork. They also give you a generous amount and it was very soft and fatty.

The mac and cheese was good, but not worth $3.50. You’re only given about two or 3 spoonfuls. The fries, however, are very worth it. They give you a lot for your money.

I just used the delivery service.I found them on Grubhub. I have to say, I was happy with what I got. I spent $25 and got 2 chicken BLTs with 2 orders of large fries. One for me and my daughter and a kids grilled cheese meal for my 19 month old granddaughter. I never used them before so I didn't know how they came so I didn't give them any instructions. But next time I will ask them to make the beacon crispy. It comes with soft beacon. I don't like that. But that wasn't their fault, I didn't know how it came. But I know for next time. I did appreciate the way they made the grilled cheese. They must be baby conscience, because they really didn't toast it. It was soft for little mouths and I liked that they didn't use white bread. Kudos to them for not using pasty white bread. They used rye.  Other than the beacon, the sandwich was really good. I scarfed it down. My daughter loved it. She came home after a long hard day at school, and was met by that delicious sandwich. Put her in a good mood THANK YOU! LOL!!! Oh yes and the fries were awesome. The baby loved them. She is a fussy eater, even with fries, lol The delivery guy was a quiet man, but very personable. Very Nice. Very close to  my house. Five stars from me. Thanks again. I kept the menu, you will be hearing from us again.

Awesome food. I went with a group of 8 people and ordered two large pizzas 4 large fries and 8 drink cups and it came out to $42. The food was
made fresh fast and delicious and for the price per person, i saved money.
I made this my spot. Its close to home and the food is so good!!!! The chkn kabobs are delish.......i tried alot on the menu And never was disappointed. And the wait staff is great!!!!!!! :)
Excellent polish dogs at a really weird location, with strange interesting characters serving you!
Best Ceaser salad! great service!

One of the best Italian restaurants in Chicago!

Went on a busy Saturday night, dinner for two.  I put in a reservation ahead of time using Open Table, I recommend this as the place fills up for a reason.  The service was great, very personable.  Our waitress, Nadi N, was hilarious and recommended items that she personally enjoyed. She didn't give the whole "I really like [insert most expensive thing here]" routine.  The food was delicious and the wine selection even better.  If you are vacillating between this place and somewhere else your search is over.  Go. Here!
Love Love Love!! Amazing atmosphere, amazing food. My favorite River North go to. Great for everyone, especially the fact that they have a gluten free menu. Kids eat free on Sunday's.

Can't believe I hadn't been to Scoozi sooner, since it was so great, so reasonably prices and so Lettuce Entertain You!  We had a great double date night and found the menu to be vast along with the wine list!  Great meal, and fun night out with friends.

The bread, the pizza, the pasta, the veal meatballs...the $5 take-out only red wine. This River North neighborhood spot always serves up a great meal. Their thin crust pizza is tasty & crispy. Their pasta is al dente & yum. And their bread...oh man, it's unreal.

You know what they say...a place with good bread is a good indicator of the rest of its food.

Tip: If you order take-out, get the $5 bottle of red wine - only available for take-out. Oh & ask for extra bread.

This is my neighborhood go to. It is a great restaurant to eat a light meal as they have plenty of small plates and appetizers or to have a big Italian meal. It is a big restaurant so there is hardly ever a wait even if it is crowded. It is also a family friendly restaurant.

Solid mex restaurant. Prices are super fair to start. Get a ton of chips when you order them, plenty for 2 or even 3 people. The steak burrito was very high quality and meat had great flavor. I would say it's medium sized. The avocado and cheese had very good flavor and ripeness. Could have maybe used a bit more cilantro/lime/onion? The rice was good albielt a little dry but good flavor, average maybe. Chips were very crispy and no salt...but they include salt packets.

By far the only con I can think of is the salsas. Both were about the same spicy. The green tasted close to what you'd expect but made with tasteless jalapenos. The red tastes like it was legit missing ingredients. No smokey flavor, no chili flavor, I just have zero idea what the red is trying to do. Can't wait to try the tacos next and focus more on the meat. I Will be back soon.

Been here several times as I live in East Village, and it is exceptional. The dinner is great value, the free chips and salsa are fantastic, and their rojo and verde salsas go well with everything. Only thing is the vibe could be a little better/cleaner, put more seating outside, otherwise it's great.

Great, friendly, and honest service! I got the asada (steak) burrito and chips and pico. All were delicious! The burrito had refried beans on it which I’m normally not a fan of but they had a good mix of beans and meat so the beans weren’t super overpowering.
The pico was fresh and the chips were crisp- all just the way I like. They thought my meal was to go so they charged me for the chips, when they realized I was eating in they tried to give me my money back for the chips and pico bc you get those free when you dine in.
The tables were all super clean and the staff were all friendly. Great spot with swings you can sit on and eat outside. So fun!

Pretty decent tacos, work near here and we head here every taco Tuesday,  the young  gentleman is always welcome and the waiter probably see us as regular. Steaks pretty decent and also consistently decent. I've tried others in the area and Natys has the best. Their red sauce is super spicy!! Price is decent, burritos are good. Give the french fry burrito a try on your cheat day

I’m about to leave West Town and it wouldn’t be right without leaving this review. My partner and I love eating at this place. It’s tasty, friendly, and reasonably priced. She loves the pina drink so we were semi-regulars.
Tastey and great price
GREAT PLACE

Since they changed management this place has gone down the drain. Their food sucks, ordered the 1950 traditional which used to be my favorite, now it's totally not. Their buffalo wings and even their mozzarella sticks are super low quality. To top off the bad food, service has been horrible. Walked in and they had about 3 tables that were not clean. The waitress took like 15 minutes just to greet us. We placed an order and she only came to drop off the food and we didn't see her back again until we went looking for her to bring the check. So disappointed, had been coming here for years and it's sad to see how much it's changed, and not for the better!!! Save your money and don't go there.

I know this location has taken a lot of flack with the reviews, and I think they've noticed, because they have REALLY stepped it up at this location.

The service was great!  They even came by to give us free samples of different types of pizzas.

The food was amaaazing. The portions are HUGE, so you can be sure you'll never leave hungry.

Everyone was very nice.  They're obviously going out of their way to improve the image of this particular location.  I suggest everyone give them another chance.  I will DEFINITELY be back! :)

Came in tonight and the food and service sucked. They have seriously fell off. They used to be good. Not anymore. This location sucks. I'm gonna start going to the one on Morse st. We came in on a Sunday night. No other customers are here. We walk in and had to seat ourselves because the waitress is too busy watching the mtv awards. The pizza tasted like some cheap crap I could buy at jewel. We ordered bbq chicken tenders that cost $9 and it only came with 3. I asked for no salt on the fries and they put salt on them anyway. This location will no longer be patronized by me.

I love Leona's. It's solid, good food, very consistent. You need to know what to order. Any variation of the Romano Crusted Chicken is gonna be great. The lasagna is also awesome. You can get better pizza elsewhere, and there are a couple other duds on the menu. But what they do well is very good. Service is also very friendly and cool.

Since they changed owners everything is different. I thought by them shortening the menu that they would really improve on some of the items.. I am still hung up on the nightmare of the chicken sandwich I ordered over a month ago. It couldn't be pulled apart.. it was like it was made out of plastic. When I called and asked about it, they said they "changed the recipe" How do you change a recipe of Chicken???? Change is not always good... in this case... very disappointing as I use to love their food.

Vicki

I visited The Metropolitan during Chicago Restaurant week and was very pleased. They offered a 3-course menu for $55. I ordered the Caesar salad, Amish Chicken, and Brownie Sundae. My brother ordered the Lobster Bisque, Grilled Salmon, and Brownie Sundae. All were very good. The restaurant is located inside the Willis Tower on the 67th floor. We were sat at the window which provided beautiful views of the city. We had a nice time. I would return again.

Very cool and current atmosphere. The views are unparalleled especially at Sunset. Most of the staff I've met are nice, upbeat, and positive. The menu is very eclectic, I have a few select favorites, the lobster mac n cheese as well as the lobster bisque. They have an oxtail dish that is SO good. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Ok, to be honest, we didn't go there for food but for the skyline view! The sky-deck was closed because of COVID and we didn't get tickets for 360 Chicago. That's why we went here to get the skyline view. I felt this cafe is  a better option because the regular sky deck at willis tower allows you for only 2 minutes or so and you have to pay ~$30 for that. But in the cafe you can order a simple dessert as cheap as $11 and enjoy the meal + the view for unlimited (but reasonable) time. Anyone looking for avoiding the high price for sky deck can follow this strategy!

Excellent staff and views of downtown Chicago. Catalina the lead Membership director has always been extremely helpful with any of my needs and questions. The best part of the Metropolitan Club is the monthly "Beer Club" events. The place epitomizes fine dining and will appease any diner who is looking for food that matches the views. The 5pm free appetizers is the icing on the cake and it's always great to see what Chef will create.

Thoroughly enjoyed dinner Friday night. Recently remodeled club classy and comfortable. Views are spectacular. Food preparation and freshness is delicious. Memorable place. Staff are helpful and pleasant. Highly recommend

I never come to this location because I’ve heard how hectic it gets.  I live right by it and I rather drive further. I came here on 03/20/22 around 8:00 pm and it was SO BUSY. I mean, I felt bad for the workers. It was chaos.
I waited over 5 mins just in line.  Once I ordered and got my food I noticed the right was NOT cooked all the way. It was almost raw tbh, it was the hardest rice I’ve ever had.  While I was in line a customer came up to the cashier ( a gentlemen with a big beard)  and the customer told him if he can redo his burrito because the rice was hard. The employee seemed overwhelmed and said yeah, right after we get done with the line. Mind you there’s like 10 ppl in line. The customer walked away and came back 2 mins later and said “ you know what bro it’s ok, I see you’re busy”    Employee was ok with that.      After I noticed I also got UNCOOKED rice. I couldn’t believe he let that customer eat that burrito with hard rice. That’s gross.   Seriously, I understand when you’re busy you’re busy. But this is not acceptable. People can get sick.  Get it together, manager.

It’s sad the amount of times this location has not only messed up my online orders but along with my family’s. It’s not hard to read words off a piece of paper, literally coming from a former employee.

I order online from this location and since the beginning of the year there have been issues with my orders. Either items are missing or one of the items that was ordered had missing or incorrect toppings. This last time I was missing items on my order and the delivery was 30 minutes. If something like this happens once in a great while I understand and the location or company won’t lose my business. Becaus this is happening on a regular bases and the fact that when you call the location you get put into a automated phone system and can’t talk to a person or you have to go a long drawn out process with Pepper the chat bot, the app and your browser about an issue with your order is why I’m giving them one star.

Dirty, nasty and very over priced. Staff is rude and judgemental about my order, not only that... I didn't add rice or bean and they charged me $5 for extra meat. Unreal! Black girl on staff was so rude rolling her eyes at me. I guess I'll stick to Culver they provide the best customer service. Very ghetto here.

Do not order from Chipotle's personal app for delivery.
We received someone else's order.  No one at this location or ANY location answers their phone.  You can not speak to a human.  They offer a bot named Pepper or contacting support via their form.
Our dinner was ruined.  We are out $50.  We were also charged delivery and service fees despite entering a promo code for free delivery that was sent to us via email.
Disappointing and unacceptable.

The place looks great, it is well decorated and nice vibe. we came in a Sunday and it was busy but we were able to get a table.  The service was a bit slow because of the amount of people and it is understandable.  The drinks Large Mango and Pineapple drinks were good.  as for the grilled octopus and the pork belly were ok.  Perhaps since they were busy the food was not done to their standards, not sure.  There is paid parking on the main street.  They have a front space and there is additional space in the back.

It was my first time returning to this restaurant after it was renewed. ☺️ My friend and I ordered smoke-grilled octopus, papas bravas (crispy potatoes), and cochinita pibil taco platter to share! The flavors were right on point, especially the potatoes and marinated pork, but the taste and texture of the octopus were not too memorable for me this time. We definitely enjoyed our drinks, not too strong or sweet, and beautifully presented as you can see in the photo!🍸❤️ I will definitely try this place again during its happy hours so I can explore the menu more at an affordable price.

Came to Taquizo for dinner late Saturday evening and had a great time! The food was delicious, and so were the drinks. My friend and I didn’t know that Taquizo had a brunch special and came back the next day for brunch and it was also amazing! The service is wonderful and their staff is super friendly and make you feel right at home. Check them out for a late night drink, or dinner or brunch. Heck, come back for it all!!

I have had a very pleasant experience at Taquizo, after an unpleasant one at Dorian’s down the road. One of the cocktails in particular, the Autumn spice, was quite possibly the best cocktail I’ve ever had, well balanced and smoky and a bit spicy. I also had a Dirty Bear Bubble bath - not as complex but very cute, with a bear-shaped ice cube that gradually appears as you drink the “bath water”.

The food was also quite good, we had fish tacos which were very good, with a coriander-spiced crust, a spicy mayo and apple slaw. The tacos could have used a bit more salt, but they were good nonetheless. The mariscos a la plancha were also very tasty, tender and well seasoned this time. We closed with the lamb shank, with a great vinegary vegetable escabeche.

Some negatives: the music was a bit too loud and very generic modern Latino, and we were told that we needed a reservation for the back room or patio, although it was quite empty and much quieter.

Overall, a very good experience even if a bit pricy. Definitely try the cocktails.

New menu, decor and music. Indoor atrium and outdoor seating.  Chips and guac awesome.  Lots of small plates to select from we had the grilled octopus that's was grilled to perfection.  We also had excellent mole. Same great owners as the previous Las Palmas.

This is the place to stop for quality breakfast. Menu choices very a lot of good and different options. Not your normal menu items here. Food is prepared fresh and the presentation is delivered looks really really tasty. Food quality was outstanding service a little slow on the coffee refills but outside of that it was great.

I think the food was delicious and reasonably priced for the area. Great place for brunch before the Pride parade!

...but so help me God if they give us one more free bowl of fruit I might die.

Edit: Had a friend go there last week. The cook walked out and they waited over an hour for their food. While the food was good it took forever. The place seems to be chaotic.

The service was friendly, if not a bit rushed even whilst they were not busy. The cinnamon roll that I had was absolutely delicious, and really had me looking forward to my main meal of buttermilk coated chicken sandwich. Unfortunately, I didn't enjoy the main dish. The chicken sandwich was so salty and the chicken so dry that I struggled to get through it. The potatoes were underdone and a bit bland for my taste. A big pity, given all the amazing reviews I had seen. The other patrons seemed happy, so perhaps my dish was a wildcard.

Stopped by for brunch and this place is awesome. Fresh juices were great, drinks were strong and tasty. The Irish coffee was a great wake me up but very strong.

Chorizo and eggs were good. Spicy and a really good portion. The potatos were really well seasoned and cooked.

Chicken and waffles were killer! Chicken was crispy and very flavorful. Waffle was perfectly done and it was a perfect combo. Loved it and definitely recommend it!

One of my favorite brunch spots.

Love this place. Monkey bread appetizer is a must! I usually get biscuits and gravy but they have delicious sweet options too! They serve la Colombe coffee which is delicious and bottomless. Also like that they have almondmilk instead of creamer. Not usually longer than 25 min or so wait.

I ordered double Italian sausage with red sauce and an order of cheese fries. Normally, the food is excellent but this time not so much. I ended up with food poisoning, I was sicker than a dog. The fries was good but the sausage or the red sauce was bad. The sauce seemed to be burnt and dark like it’s been reheated many times

Wow! Great food I'm glad I found this place on Doordash! not from the area so I only order when I'm at work! But unfortunately I got my delivery one! time out of three!!! as far as the delivery driver FOLLOWING THE INSTRUCTIONS  FOR DELIVERY instead of totally relying on a GPS!! sorry I can't order from here for deliveries, I'll try to come in MYSELF! so that I can get my food on time and hot!!
Way better than any fastfood chain. We're from out of town & stopped after a Red Stars game. Huge menu & all cooked to order w/fair prices.
Absolute classic. Must stop if in the area. Favorite gyros in the Chicagoland area and the fries are always perfect. Gravy beef is also delicious

Usually this place is decent, this last time there was no spinach for my pizza , no crush peppers, no parm cheese. On top of that the Mexican guy that answered was being rude, and rushing me. When I placed the order online, I put EXTRA sauce, and it came out as No sauce on their end. They made it the way they saw it, but by the demeanor I didn't bother to take it back because I could tell they weren't gonna do anything to fix it. A few months prior, (same Mexican guy that answered the phone in his early 40s) I ordered a pizza, then called back literally a min later to tell him to not make it, he answered by saying "Welllll Its already made and in the oven" In other words I still have to come it, I told him that's why I called back in hopes that it wasn't. He answered "Yeh we already made it". I proceeded to tell him why I was canceling (my wife already got food) he straight up hung up on me. 😡

Honestly was very surprised about this place. Was in the area with some friends and was pleasantly surprised how great this place was. We sat in the back and tried to use the order system but to no avail. Everyone there that tried to run their cc with a visa was having problems but Mastercard seemed to work for whatever reason. Only negative on the food id say the vegan milkshake is more of just a smoothie. Don’t expect it to be milky, basically smoothie with some oat milk. Really enjoyed our time here and the vibes were great!

I visited this place looking for rib-tips, what I found was pig wings.  They are bone-in, sized just right pieces of pork, served with a salad and fries.  The pork has a thin, slightly crispy, smoked surface.  Once I started eating, I was pleasantly surprised to find the meat was very tender.  I truly enjoyed the meal.  I enjoyed it so much that I returned the next day to make sure that this wasn't a hit or miss meal.  I was just as pleased the next day.  For you pork fans, I highly recommend this meal.  This will be my go to meal for a long time to come.

I can't believe it took me this long to stop in the new place. They did a REALLY amazing job! The food is even better than I remember, man you guys are fantastic - so many vegan options!!

Parking is a bit of a bear... 😭

While not a 100% vegan restaurant they do a good job offering plenty of vegan options.

Ordered the Vegan Shrimp Po’Boy, Vegan Jerk Chick’n on a Pita, Vegan Nachos, Fries and their Vegan Handspun Shake.

Vegan Shrimp Po’Boy - this sandwich was actually pretty good, I did knock off some of the lettuce and pickles as it was too much and then was able to enjoy.

Vegan Jerk Chick’n on a Pita was super messy and a bit too wet for my liking. With that said I’d order it again and ask for sauce on the side or 50% reduction. Flavor is more on the sweet side that spice for “jerk”.

Vegan Nachos -Hands down stole the show! These nachos were SOOO good I almost placed a second order even though I still had plenty of food in front of me. These I recommend trying 💯

Vegan Handspun Shake - Another REALLY good option here, went with the pineapple with strawberry shake and was pleasantly surprised how good it was.

Pretty much if you’re around this area by chance with your animal eating friends I’d recommend checking them out. Portion sizes are good, not super expensive, good atmosphere and libations for those need a drink.

Had the Vegan Big Baby on Gluten Free Bun and sweet potato fries. Ended up eating the Burger without the bun (didn’t like the taste of the bun hence the 4 stars). The sweet potato fries were soooo good and filling! The customer service and atmosphere were great! Will come back!

I think I found my new spot! I had the Grilled chicken sandwich. The chicken took me back to my childhood with the flavor. It tasted like the  pinchos i used to eat when i was in P.R. Very well seasoned and cooked. The waiter was polite and friendly. It wasn't long b4 we got our order and they had some good music plying in the background. You can sit inside or in the patio in back. Overall it was a great dining experience.

The restaurant is in a hip part of the city. Upon Entering the restaurant, you’re quickly greeted and seated.

Our host was prompt and responsive to get us the menu, water, as well as ask for any drinks. The menu is varied with lots of food options. Interestingly, the breakfast menu, is Latin inspired which is amazing!

After placing the order, the food arrived shortly and was hot, fresh, and delicious. Our host was always responsive to any requests and offered to get us various sauces.

My only drawback is the food doesn’t seem to have vegan options.

I would highly recommend this place and come here again.

We were in Chicago for a little four-day vacation. Hungry for breakfast on a Wednesday afternoon, we popped into Cafe Con Leche for some grub.

It was packed inside, but we got a table quickly. Our waiter was wearing a mask, but most employees were not. It’s May 2022, though, so not mandatory.

I ordered the Veggie Burrito. My partner ordered the Croissant Sandwich (minus cheese). Both dishes came out quickly and very hot. The potatoes came with both and were a very generous portion—as was the whole meal. Flavorful and not greasy. We loved them. The burrito and sandwich were both tasty. Good portions, well constructed, very fresh. The price matched the value.

The only downside was how hot it was inside. It was a cool, breezy day, and it had to be 80 degrees in there. I am a cold person, so I was fine. I just took off my hoodie. It may have been a fluke that day? Not sure.

All in all, we’d eat there again!

Definitely a place where I can go to and I know the food and service will be great! It’s comfort for me and there is a variety of food to choose from no matter what time of day you are going! Family friendly or for a date night! They even had happy hour specials starting at 3 pm!

Highly recommend Cafe Con Leche if you're in the Logan Square of Chicago. Great portions, very filling, friendly service. The breakfast is delicious, the prices were fair and the service was fantastic. Enjoy!

Terrific and delicious!!!!  It's a little pricey, but totally worth it. Try the specials, you will never be disappointed.  If you want a deal, go for lunch. The food is just as wonderful.:)

They have such a variety to choose from and every cut of meat is perfection.  I haven't had seafood or steak in Chicago that topped theirs.
The food is just as wonderful.:)

The service is awesome as well.

We booked over 60 people for a party on Wednesday evening. Deb and the crew were fantastic and the food was outstanding. Our entire experience was wonderful!

We do this once a year in the different cities our conferences are held. We have been in Washington, DC, San Antonio, Austin, Nashville and Charleston, and have had very good experiences in all but the buzz last night was that this, by far, was the best of all.

Thank you again Deb and the wonderful staff at Phil Stefani's 437 Rush.

Not as famous as other steakhouses in Chicago, but regulars love it.  I live in the area and can see why it's a great option for quality steak (and other dishes) and warm service - without the distractions of tourists!

Randomly stumbled upon their  5 for $5 happy hour menu.  From 4:37pm-9:47pm they have $5 bar bites and Mon-Fri drink specials of $6 smirnoff martini, $4 red or white house wine, and $4 bud or miller light. Great place to  wind down after work or shopping on Michigan Ave. Hidden gem I don't think many people know about it.

The food at Phill's is just perfect here. Very nice set and they give you just enough to get fullfor a great price. The service is very good in this place. Very respectful and give great advice on what to eat if you need it. When it comes to decoration it is simple, but neat. My experience here was great. I recommend people to go, specially if you are looking for a place to get served quick and still good.

The staff was so friendly! I ordered the Korean chicken wings medium and didn’t find them too spicy. They were perfectly crunchy! I have no idea how they make them gluten free and as crispy as they were but it was pretty good. The only reason it’s 4 and not 5 stars is because the broccoli didn’t seem as fresh or seasoned to me as it had claimed to be. The wings made up for it though. Affordable and good quality for the price! I’m excited to try the other dishes here!

Very reasonable prices for good food! Portions were good size as well. My friend and I split a bibimbop and a large order of chicken ‘wangs’ and it filled us up. Beef was tender in the bibimbop and the chicken wings were crispy and flavorful. Food came out pretty quick. For the two dishes including tip it came out to about $26.
the wings were great! very crispy and the sauce is a ten. we also got the pork bowl with zesty cucumber and loved that too. will definitely be back! prices were great too

I ordered catering for an office lunch and it was a hit! Different than our normal sandwiches and salads and there was enough food for people to come back for seconds. Everything was delicious but the spicy cabbage slaw and the pad thai stole the show.
I ordered a Pork Bowl, it tasted very nice! You can choose it’s spicy or not. I love it came with a veggie side, it was so fresh and delicious!

The worst McDonalds ever. The people who work there don’t care about their customers. They were supposed to give me a double quarter pounder and they ended up giving me the single. The quarter pounder was terrible and they hardly gave me any fries. Not worth it and this will be my last time coming here. They call this a medium fries.

came to buy food but my toddler needed to pee so i wanted to take her before i ordered so my food could be fresh. he refused to let my 4 YEAR OLD DAUGHTER in the bathrooms cause we didnt have a receipt . i told him im buyin food i jus need to let her pee first . he told me no and turned his bac . VERY INHUMANE ! wouldnt give me corporate number or his name, said he didnt have to ! I WANT TO SPEAK TO CORPORATE ! we are humans and deserve simple human decency ! a child should not be denied a restroom simply cause i wanted to her to pee first then order ! he does not deserve to be in customer service if this is how he would treat a 4 Year Old Child !

Awesome service àt this particular McDonald's store location! Staff were very courteous and professional! The food is very fresh and tasty! The items listed on the Dollar menu are excellent! This McDonald's location deserves more than Just 5 stars! Highly recommended! 🌞

I'm giving this place 5 stars, because I'm comparing it to other McDonald's restaurants. Relative to other McDonald's restaurants this one is very clean, the staff are friendly and helpful and the washrooms are always clean and well stocked. Also the staff are very accommodating when you ask for something to be made in another way other than what is typically on the menu.  Both efficient and friendly.

My friends and I finished a movie. Before coming to this McDonald’s we confirmed the hours were open until midnight for both drive through and dine in. We walked out of our way to get there and when we arrived the doors were locked. We also tried to order curbside pick up but it said it was closed online as well. Overall disappointing and a horrible experience. Why do you have those hours posted if you aren’t going to commit to them? It seems like they not interested in satisfying their customers.

Seemed a bit expensive but pretty typical for the location/neighborhood. Food and service was pretty good - the butter paneer and naan were our favorites. We had a waiter in training and he needed some help, but that’s to be expected as well. The drinks were really nice and they had a lot of fun options.

We went later on a Tuesday night, so it wasn’t too busy.

First off, service was fantastic. Saturday night our waiter, Pacheco, was very attentive and on time for each step. Secondly if being treated like royalty is your bag take a faqing hike. Enjoy the food and who you’re with.

The food was amazing and I had to slow myself down because people started to stare. Indian food with an added flare to make it just devourable. We loaded up on appetizers and three medium entrees. Really something special out of a “top receipt award show”. Thanks for the meal, see you at the women’s chef event!

Decor was lacking but again I’m here to eat not go to Tao. I think this use to be a clothing shop. Wait until the next establishment, Michelin Star for SURE

I would stay away from this place, I feel like it’s pretty much a big scam. For $200 worth of takeout for the“ Valentine’s Day special“ (not including drinks either) the food quality or quantity did not live up to my expectations. I feel that you can get Equivalent cuisine at any other Indian restaurant without the price tag for  so called fusion.

I also felt that the service was rather chaotic as when I picked up my food, there was no one at the front for more than 5 minutes.

I can’t believe I spent close to $200 just to have a horrible experience. I was genuinely excited to try this valentines concept that the restaurant had made. The food was great although that quickly changed when we received our ribs and found hairs in it and all the waiter could say was “oh i’m sorry about that”. I overheard the couple next to us complain that they had found a hair in their food as well. Myself as well as other couples had to keep asking the waiters where our food was and even after asking them, it still took them a long time to bring out the next dish. We stayed well over an hour after the original closing time. I hate to be that person that complains but can you really blame me?

Great variety of flavors and new tastes we experienced.  The skirt steak was absolutely fantastic, filled with flavor and very tender.  The May India AAPI Celebration course was great, highlighted by the buttered chicken, and complimented by amazing pani puri and the dessert!

The day I went (Saturday before mother's day) they had an all you can eat buffet for $20! 🤯 And BOY.. Everything was delicious!!! The macaroni and cheese was AMAZING and the BREAD PUDDING with RUM SAUCE was literally the best thing I have ever put in my mouth! Not kidding! 🤯🤤😅 I wanted to go back again the next day. Lol My only complaint would be that the decor is a little dated but this place has been here forever and a lot of older people dine here so it makes sense. I cant wait to visit Chicago again so I can go back to Pearl's Place.

I stopped in hoping for a late breakfast and discovered a new favorite restaurant on the near south side. I tried their breakfast buffet and was treated to a homemade omelette, potatoes, bacon, sausage and fresh biscuits. Everything was delicious, hot and fresh. I’ll definitely be back to try out the lunch and dinner menu.

What Lunch!! Looked forward to eating here from the reviews. I was pleased beyond ny expectations.  The food was great!! Down home southern cooking!! But what makes it great is the staff. From my greeter, to the server, to the chef at the buffet.  Plenty of southern selections.  Also you can order from the menu.  Also white table linen, and a homie feel in the dining room.  A must visit.  Do not let the outside area or oarking put you off. Must visit.  Thank Pearl for a wonderful lunch!!

The service was friendly and the food was really good. Almost every menu item was on the buffet. Pancakes, waffles, grits, eggs, build your own omelettes, potatoes, ham, bacon, turkey sausage, salmon croquettes, fried chicken, Mac n cheese, catfish nuggets and I'm sure I'm forgetting something. And that was just breakfast!

Wow, the service was impeccable! Our waiter was one of the best I've had in any fine dining restaurant! Although I can't recall his name, I can remember he was the only waiter with green stitching in his chef coat. If your looking for a nice family feel restaurant this is the place.
The food was nice portion, affordable and good. I had rattle snake tall & the turkey dinner.  My wife had shrimp & grits.

This joint is about 2 miles west of my mom’s townhouse. We love to stop by on Saturday for a quick lunch. The food are reasonable priced and tasty. I am saying this only because of my extensive visits to many similar local eateries. My favorite is their grilled chicken on pita bread garnished with grilled onions. Unlike many other places they marinate their chicken with paprika to give that extra kick/flavor. I took the clue and replicate it at home 😋
Hot dog special is a good value . Enjoyed the fries, nice and hot and crispy .
Drove 150 miles for a Big Baby and fries and was not disappointed!

Great food. It would be nice if the line sinage was better went in the door thought I was in line but the line forms at the other door like 3 people walked in got infront of us and we had to get behind them.

You Want A Taste of a Neighborhood American Faire Food, You've just entered Nicky's, I e been on this Earth for 42years now by God's Grace and Nicky's been around since I can remember. Great Burger,I recommend the Fatboy Always, or a good triplecheeseburger, However you choose, I doubt you'll be disappointed. The Malts are delicious too. Give em try if your on the SouthWestSide aka Garfield Ridge. These guys are Awesome. Keep up the outstanding service Nicky's!!! Food always hits the spot and ,Well, Eat up and Smile, you'll be glad ya did.

I just used the delivery service.I found them on Grubhub. I have to say, I was happy with what I got. I spent $25 and got 2 chicken BLTs with 2 orders of large fries. One for me and my daughter and a kids grilled cheese meal for my 19 month old granddaughter. I never used them before so I didn't know how they came so I didn't give them any instructions. But next time I will ask them to make the beacon crispy. It comes with soft beacon. I don't like that. But that wasn't their fault, I didn't know how it came. But I know for next time. I did appreciate the way they made the grilled cheese. They must be baby conscience, because they really didn't toast it. It was soft for little mouths and I liked that they didn't use white bread. Kudos to them for not using pasty white bread. They used rye.  Other than the beacon, the sandwich was really good. I scarfed it down. My daughter loved it. She came home after a long hard day at school, and was met by that delicious sandwich. Put her in a good mood THANK YOU! LOL!!! Oh yes and the fries were awesome. The baby loved them. She is a fussy eater, even with fries, lol The delivery guy was a quiet man, but very personable. Very Nice. Very close to  my house. Five stars from me. Thanks again. I kept the menu, you will be hearing from us again.

Awesome food. I went with a group of 8 people and ordered two large pizzas 4 large fries and 8 drink cups and it came out to $42. The food was
made fresh fast and delicious and for the price per person, i saved money.
I made this my spot. Its close to home and the food is so good!!!! The chkn kabobs are delish.......i tried alot on the menu And never was disappointed. And the wait staff is great!!!!!!! :)
Excellent polish dogs at a really weird location, with strange interesting characters serving you!
Best Ceaser salad! great service!

The crust was good. For what it was worth; pretty expensive pizza. I got the Lous pizza in a medium Size and it cost $28. The pizza is very filling, though.

I had to transport this back, so it got really soggy. This is best eaten fresh at the restaurant, but there is no where to dine in inside. Service was meh. I can see the appeal, but not my favorite style of pizza.

First time getting deep dish in Chicago and was told to give this place a go even though it was a chain. It wasn’t bad but nothing that blew my socks off. Staff was very friendly. One thing that was odd, was that they ran out of pepperoni. Probably the most popular ingredient and they ran out of it. Supply chain issues I guess.
Wow worst pizza ever. You come from out of town to get a Chicago deep dish and this is what you get. No cheese just garbage!! Thanks for wasting my money appreciate it!!

This wicker park location not only crossed up my order with someone else’s in my same building, the manager was by far the rudest person I’ve ever dealt with in my life. He was trying to tell me that my delivery was on time but he mixed it up with my neighbors order. However instead of investigating the situation, he placed the blame on me and treated me horribly. He said he was too busy doing his job. Buddy …this is your job! I used to order 2-3x /week. I will never again order from this location. They don’t take accountability and are just bad people. What a shame!

Pizza took over an hour to be done for pick up. They had told us 40 minutes so I went after 45 minutes and then they told me it would take another 20 minutes. I returned then and it took another 15 minutes. Pizza was good but they need to be better with timing.

This is the Best Asain food I've ever tasted. I prefer I suggest you must try the lamb plov, it is the most unique and tastes perfect. And hot tea, this is so good! As a chinese, I said that I have never had such a good tea, probably because of the honey in it, which is very good at helping digestion.
Highly recommend their kuurdak lamb. Get a side of noodle with the kuurdak! Start with the tasty samsy beef and you're all set! Definitely would come back to try other items in the menu.

Always fresh and extremely full of flavor dishes. The hand pulled noodles are so fun to eat.  The texture is so silky with a great bite. Sauces are delicious.  Everything there is delicious in a very nice atmosphere.
I love the atmosphere, food and service. Prices are also reasonable. They know what they are doing and they do it very well. I will definitely come again!
We had a nice dinner here! The hand pulled noodles and the lamb plov were the highlights. The staff were happy to tell us more about the traditional dishes and make recommendations. We'll be back!
Went to this place a few times and never had issues with what I ordered. The employees are also very nice. Don’t see any reason to give them a score of less than 5.

Went in the other night and ordered a 6" turkey.  The employee put 2 pieces of meat on the bread then spread them out to make it look as full as possible.  He then asked me if I wanted cheese.  I asked him why there were only 2 pieces of turkey instead of the standard 4 pieces that you will find at any Subway.  He told me that's what his boss instructed him to do.  When I objected he said "okay, I can give you 3 pieces".  I said the store is ripping off the customer charging what every other Subway charges but providing less meat.

I understand that in the current state of the economy with supply chain issues and soaring costs businesses are looking for ways to cut expenses. The thing I find concerning is that if this store is willing to gyp the customer in a fairly blatant way by short changing them on the meat products what else are they doing behind the scenes to cut corners?  For instance, are the ingredients really fresh?

Be careful.

The staff at this Subway were extremely unprofessional during my last visit.  The young lady behind the counter making the sandwiches had a very bad attitude, acted as if she didn't want to be there, and felt as if she could speak to anyone any kind of way.

When I asked her how long a particular protein had been out (when she said it wasn't hot but "warm", her answer was "since I've been here".  Uh....like I know how long you've been working there today!

When I asked her to put light seasoning on my sandwiches, she dumped a ton of it on there anyway, not listening to what I asked her.

I definitely will not be coming back to this Subway.

Obviously needs more than 1 employee after 10 o clock...I wanted a six inch but was told that I had to wait 10 minutes for her to do a large online order. Ummmm maybe do the customers in front of you before orders that are not being picked up yet. Plus she said she had no time to prep lettuce for the people in front of me so all in all she lost 3 customers due to poor time management skills.

What a worst veggie subway. Today i went to this subway around 9:15pm, i was there around 30mins. The guy was working alone another staff and as busy with her phone. I gave order to make veggie subway and he put little bit stuff in burger. When i told him to put proper stuff in subway that time he told me something in his own language. Please you guys have camera on top of the counter. So please check it out properly. And also provide a stuff as per the price.
Thanks for your service.

We were pleasantly surprised to have the experience we did here today.  The burgers were fantastic and the beer selection was on point.  I had a hatch pepper burger with an egg and my wife had a veggie burger with some amazing and delicious blueberry BBQ sauce.  The food with the beers were amazing.  I had tater tots with mine and my wife opted for the Parmesan truffle fries.  The fries were megh but the tator tots were great. Our server was fantastic and we will go back again!

Very cool burger place. I tried the tap beer here. Big 👍👍 the BLT was yum and so was the fish n chips. They served us a taco which we dint like app much but the kalamari and chicken tenders were great.
The service is really nice. I asked the person at the bar about commuting options to Millennium palm from there n she very nicely wrote the bus numbers down for me. Such a sweet gesture that was. Overall great place to eat and have drinks at. 👍
Stopped in for a beer on a hot Sunday.  Drew the bartender was awesome!  Made great suggestions.  Really enjoyed the clam chowder and the Parmesan fries!!
Excellent food and a place to share a nice afternoon

Ordered a number 4 burger was good. But after the wait staff did not make contact with us for 30 minutes I understand why we waited 45 minutes for a table when it was not that busy. Turnaround time on a busy Saturday should be faster. Then after dinner waited another 30 minutes for a check. I don't know if I would go back. Many better restaurants to choose from.

My first time here. The food is ok for me. But who prefers not spicy, it should be perfect. A dumpling with ponzu sauce is delicious. The table is clean, and the service is above and beyond. I will be back.

This was our very first visit & we loved it!! The vibe was chill, the music was dope and the food was off the chain!!!! We ordered “The Furious” & it was Amazing the dumplings, with the combos of flavors & the egg on top was so yummy it hit the spot! Definitely coming back with my crew!!! You gotta try the dessert I want more!! The Nutella inside the fried dough was yum, yum!!

This ramen made miso happy, not furious
@furiousspoonramen has an incredible menu of ramen options, apps, and drinks. I tried the perfectly spicy dynamo shrimp ramen: chili infused handmade in-house noodles, veggie shoyu broth, sweet chili shrimp, miso, fried green beans, Fresno chilis, chili marinated cabbage, and garlic relish. A perfectly spicy combination that even had my nose running a little. I also tried the addictive spicy marinated cucumbers and kobra karaage (Japanese fried chicken). Plus they have some amazing cocktails - meet Becky with the Good Hair: bourbon, hibiscus liqueur, and and lemonade. @grabbdapp collab

Really enjoyed our time here. Kathi, our waitress, was awesome. The appetizers were decent. The drinks were really good, we got fishbowls which were reasonably strong and an old fashioned which had just the right amount of sweetness. The ramen was okay at best, I really wasn’t a fan. We got both infused and regular noodles but I found the regular to be a little better. The furious ramen had dumplings in it though and I thought that was a great addition. Everything was reasonably priced though.

Honestly some of the worst Ramen I have ever had on this last go around ordering from Furious. I’m glad to see others have noticed this place had gone WAY downhill since the pandemic! Normally I have another go to place just down Milwaukee that rhyme as with Zasabi, but decided to give furious a try again on a night when my #1 wasn’t taking pickup orders. What a mistake indeed- O was left with a Ramen size craving and empty stomach because half of our party LITERALLY threw away their food, it was so bland!

The pros here I guess are that they are right around the corner from me and pretty fast with orders… but like so is Taco Bell, and at least their food doesn’t taste like gruel. We all ordered some variation of the furious classic, with extra spice / noodles. First off, the staff was pretty rude to my friend who picked up, and told her the app was wrong/ food wasn’t ready … and then realized 10 min later it had been sitting out on a stool the whole time. Annoying, but it was a Sat so maybe that got lost in the shuffle on a busy night… except for the fact that another group of friends ordered to go THAT SAME NIGHT and had the exact same experience (and was missing items from their order)! Big sad for cold ramen.

Once we all settled in and reheated the broth, we opened our bowls to find the noodles were literally congealed together as one big brick- the extra noodles on the side literally wouldn’t come apart, they had all merged into super noodle brick (see pics). After trying to unstick with a bit of broth, then oil, those all went right into the trash. The noodles with toppings (aka standard noodles for your order) were a little more forgiving, but literally needed to be soaked in hot broth and picked apart to separate. On top of it, the pork belly was all fatty over cooked nastiness… the dumplings were cold, and the broth tasted like vegetable broth. Not even as flavorful as chicken brother, just straight up unsalted bean juice. A bit of eel sauce, soy sauce, siracha, umami powder and real chicken broth got mine to be edible ish, but half of my friends in on the order just gave up and made an oven pizza that night.

Beyond disappointing experience for everyone except my dog, who did rejoice in the fact that we all fed her the nasty pork belly that came floating in our sad soup (see pics for manic happy dog post pork belly).

The food here is really kind of the star of the shelf for somebody that's not in Ohio buckeye fan anyway... The southern fried chicken sandwich ( not original) is definitely top five in the city hop for the spicy mayo on the side.  The cheese curds are absolutely top two in the city.  The chicken tenders looked amazing I would say probably definitely top five in the city... This is some pretty high numbers for a bar with a ton of taps good selections of beer and actually pretty comfortable atmosphere. Will definitely be back. The service was great too, I have to say just not all around top 10 bar in Chicago

Okay, SO pleasantly surprised. We wandered in here after being turned away from a few of the “trendy” Southport spots on a Monday night. The patio was open and we grabbed a couple beers. Our server was actually awesome, giving us recommendations and somehow having a sixth sense as to when we needed him. I *think* from the receipt that his name was Alejandro?

After round 2, we realized it was $4 all drafts. What?!?!?!?! I didn’t think this existed in Chicago anymore. We of course ordered a third round and some tenders and fries. Again, surprised as the food was delicious!!! Perfect bar food. HUGE selection of drafts, great patio, great food, great service. We will definitely be back!
Happy they were opened for a weekday lunch during “off season”. Not trendy…. In a great way. Large out door seating. Get the fries - great seasoning!
Was a little disappointed they don't have bottomless mimosas anymore. Food and service was good. Clean environment. They have two floors for seating. Overall good experience.
