Old school bar with a great selection of tap beers and drink specials.  We sampled the Southport burger paired with the 18th St draft .. quite good ))

Definitely need a reservation for this place. That said I came on a Friday night without one and waited 15 minutes for a spot at the bar which I think was a cooler experience because we got to see the chefs roll the sushi. The restaurant itself is smaller than that I expected with tables placed incredibly close to one another. But the vibe is very lively and a great late night dinner spot right next to soho house.

The rolls itself were good — nothing absolutely amazing about them. The seafood was fresh but the rolls itself were lacking flavor other than the freshness of the fish. There is a crispy rice on their secret menu that I want to try that did look amazing. Otherwise I’d rather go to my local sushi spot than come here.

absolutely loved this place!! we were downstairs and it had such a cool, hip vibe. great music. loved all the sushi l ordered and we all had a few cocktails that were 👌 great. staff was super nice and helpful as well especially with my allergies. would go back for sure. seems like a good date spot too

Had a reservation at Booze Box. Their cocktail list was excellent. Decided to try some of their dishes and we were not disappointed. We were thoroughly impressed with their dishes and even tried some drinks that were off the menu. The staff (Jennifer) went beyond our expectations and had us excited to visit again. Very recommended, would want to make another visit.

Drinks were OK, nothing bad but wasn't impressed with the cocktails.
The okonomiyaki was a nice shared starter.
Unfortunately though, some of the worst sushi I've had including that from a Kroger in Kentucky.
Would be perfect for someone who's looking to taste nothing but added flavors used to mask low quality fish.

Underground, off the alley, dark!  Japanese flair, great cocktail list, sushi!  Why would you not try this place? Why?  What’s your problem?  Oh, good Japanese Whiskey selection also!  DJ spinning old school deep house, I may never leave. Look for the arrow.

Mr. Submarine, right below the L, was a fantastic find. Probably the best food value in the inner city. The 12” subs are massive. The type you only need to buy 1 and share it.

We got the Mr. Submarine and a Gyro sub. Both were delicious. Fast service on a Saturday at lunch time. Clean. Places to eat in, but there were many take out orders while we were there.

If you’re really hungry and have a few minutes to eat, stop by Mr. Submarine. I don’t get to Chicago often, but the next time I’m in town I’d certainly stop by again.

Ordered to go. Got all the way home with my food and there was a giant black hair curled into my sandwich. I threw it out immediately after almost puking. 🤢🤮 what a waste of time/money.

This was not my first bad sandwich here... the deli meat is always slimy, and they're always completely soaked with wet mayo and oil. Not even vinegar/seasonings... just oil and mayo. Gross. 🤢 My late father loved Mr. Submarine, so I really wanted to like them and give them one more chance, but the hair did it for me. Never again!!
Place is very clean go over there all the time they have the best subs people are so nice thank you guys for serving me and forever stay open 💪

Went there today nd they had meat jus sitting on counter 🤮waiting for u to order a sandwich  I’m like don’t that needs to b n a cooler I was told it’s for sandwiches  🤢but it’s no customer n here but me🤦🏽‍♀️its Sitting out n the opening wen cold cuts NEEDS TO B STORED N THE REFRIGERATOR
uugghhh I walked out
I posted pictures
I come here for lunch when I’m working from my Chicago office.  Good deal for the amount of food you get. And the subs are always good.

Loved this restaurant! We came in an hour before they closed and despite the temperature in the building the employees were very pleasant and helpful to us. Our food was done quickly and there was a LOT of it (we got the rice bowls). The only reason I took off a star was for the price! We had 3 people and for a bowl and a smoothie each, we spent $50. We're not from here, so that could just be normal fare (especially since I think smoothies were the most expensive drink option) but we were a little shocked. At least the food was good and we had a lot of it!

Edit: we came back for breakfast another day and the omlette, crepes, and Greek yogurt are delicious as well!
It's a hidden gem. I really like the atmosphere here and the food options are great. I came here for a tuna salad and enjoyed it. Hope to come again for a smoothie.

Good food but unfortunately, I got back to the hotel and my order was wrong for my $14 rice bowl. The toppings I requested were not all on my plate. Somehow chickpeas were added, which I didn't request. I would've gone back today but I'm flying out soon. Really would've loved the full flavor I was hoping for. But, the chicken was flavorful!!! Maybe I'll give it another try in the future. This was my first visit.
Excellent selections and everything looks great. I had the double burger classic. Great food and very clean facility. Deceptively good  - building doesn't match inside and out. Give it a try!
First time going here and I will definitely go back. Very reasonable price for a downtown resturant and they serve delish food.

Great outdoor space. Decent beer list, the food is totally...fine.
I'd definitely come back here to enjoy the outdoor patio after this year's polar vortex has passed. Hopefully I will survive.

The patio is totally enclosed with large shady trees above the space. I can imagine how amazing it would be during the summer. We went during a warm fall day.

The best beer garden in Chicago. I use to love it when it was the Cafe Fresco, and the update has only made it better. This place can be enjoyed whether you're sipping wine in the garden out back or chowing down on their fantastic menu. The staff is very personable and out going.

I do miss the shuffle board bowling game tho.

Despite the name, it took me a few trips in to realize that there was outdoor seating in the back. Once I learned that though, the place went from alright to great. For the most part a pretty standard bar. The food is decent and the staff is friendly. But the back patio during the summer is what makes this place stand out from anything else in the area.

A great neighborhood joint. Many people do not know about the outdoor patio in back. It is like a hidden gem plus you do not have to worry about a car running over you because the building will protect you. So if you're looking for a nice local place to grab some delicious food or a beer, then this is it.

This place is pretty groovy. They make you feel at home and offer a great selection of beers and food. The boulanese fries are just nom nom nom. My coworkers and I went there after volunteering. The owner dsvvered this and ended up buying our first round for our efforts. The trivia dudes are awesome and I'm pretty much in love with this bar.
This is the most flavorful beef ever! Fresh! Made on the spot! 🤤

Ordered from Uber eats the food was gross we had two Philly cheese steaks it had no meat in it at all just a bunch of green peppers and onions. I’m waiting on my refund now I will never order from them again

I had ordered the wings combo with hot sauce. The fries were fine, but the wings were incredibly disappointing. They were tiny; they are the smallest wings I've ever had. Some flats were even smaller than my thumb. Not only that, but there was hardly any meat on them, and they were slightly overcooked. With the price of wings going through the roof, I wanted something a little less pricey. That was the wrong choice. I can't even get a refund thru Uber Eats, because there was technically nothing wrong with them. Firehouse Grill,  please source better wings.
Usually don’t eat fast food but this place was fresh and fire 🔥🔥🔥 had a Philly and a 6 pc wing was on point great service ask for Zu I heard the lemonade is good to!
Awesome food! Great customer service! What more can you ask for?! Fast! Food was hot fresh! Very affordable you get a lot for what you pay for

Recently this place has gone downhill. New employees are terrible. Every 3/5 visits something is wrong. The quality of food is abysmal. Had to write a review after my final straw. Burnt, soggy, and and raw at the same time. Drinks have absolutely zero flavor. Such a shame. Avoid if possible.

2am visit and no hot items available so while we were disappointed because then what's the point for being open late... Tashun was very friendly and welcoming, offered to warm up a muffin, made our coffee order and greeted us at the window. Excellent customer service that deserves recognition despite reading reviews that staff is not great at this location.
Nasty 🤮, this morning I bought a croissant and look what I found inside.
They put the donuts upside down. So when you get your donut it has no chocolate because it's stuck in the bag , specially the drive thru orders ...

This place is far from the same. The staff is so unfriendly. Some of the woman are nice, but the guys are so cold, and rude through the Drive thru. They never ever say hello, or even a thank you. They give you this dirty look, like they don't want to be there. This particular Dunkin Donuts has the worst Customer Service than any other establishment in the city of Chicago, or suburbs.
I stopped going. I'm a regular every day customer that belongs to their reward programs. This kind of Customer Service, and their high prices, it's not worth this kind of behavior.

So i finally made it out to this iconic seafood stand in the South area near Chinatown.  The place was very modern for being established 7 decades ago.  If you really luv fried seafood, this is for you.  Everything I ordered was very good, but my palette got “bored” with the mono-chromatic taste of breading.  Having said that though, I would urge to add other non-fried textures when you take it to-go.  One other thing, read carefully on the menu fish chips.  Its fish nuggets and there are NO FRIES.  My quick glance read it as “fish & chips”; but the “&” is missing.  Its ok but I felt bamboozled!

This is a great place to get fresh seafood in Chicago. This place is a good balance of price and food quality. On one extreme other restaurants charge you an arm and leg for fresh oysters and you can't even afford rent after going home. Other extreme restaurants fry fish for cheap but are takeout and cash only and make you wait forever. This seems like a good balance. There is ample seating, decently clean bathrooms, and quick cooking. Fried oysters feel like melted butter. Their sauces are all pretty good as well.

First time being here and my experience was horrible, the guy at the front seemed so uninterested about his job. When i asked him if half a pound shrimp would be enough for two, he said “i don’t wanna answer that, i don’t feel like answering.” Then the FOOD TASTED HORRIBLE, i wasn’t expecting the fish to taste fresh but jesus, the taste of this thing was far from tasting good. it tasted like it’s been in and out the freezer and it tasted like a week old fish. and i was tasting cleaning products when i took a bite into the shrimp and the taste of cleaning product was HEAVY, like someone mixed it in with the batter. Couldn’t get the taste out of my mouth for hours and felt sick. If it was possible to rate a restaurant 0 stars, this would be my first recommendation, i don’t know if the night time crew just don’t do their job properly but this was a HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE and i would not be returning or recommending this restaurant to anyone. DO BETTER so you don’t give your customers food poisoning

For a great seafood experience dine in or take out, if you are in re area be sure to satisfy your craving for seafood at Lawrence’s. My personal favorites are their shrimp 🍤 with their house made hot sauce. They have so much to offer the seafood 🦞 lover and much more! Call in your order in advance as they may be busy at any given moment. The view dining outside is n awesome site of Chicago’s 🌃 to say the less. Stop by and enjoy yourself, tell em Mr. Brown sent cha! Enjoy! #googleexpertreview #googleexpertphotographer #mrbrownsaid #enjoy

Love this place been coming here for 30 years, usially get the jumbo shrimp, but the wing zings (chicken wings) are FIRE, their homemade cocktail sauce and hot sauce are some of the best sauces I've ever had, I will continue to go to this place,
Amazing to find some Korean dishes just south of Ukrainian Village. Highly recommended, not only for their Korean dishes and traditional Chicago fare, but also for their hearty breakfasts.

This is a good spot, especially for breakfast. The restaurant was already busy when I went in there to grab something for breakfast. I knew that there would be a long wait, but it was not really that long because even though there was a line at the counter, it was moving pretty fast and the food was really quick. The restaurant is clean. They have a very nice selection on their menu. I just basically got their sandwich croissant. My friends also actually recommended this fast food restaurant and told me to get their sandwich croissant, so I did. I specifically got the bacon and egg sandwich croissant. It was reasonably priced. It tastes delicious. The croissant was very fresh; all of the ingredients were actually fresh. It is so simple, but it tastes delicious. The portions were also good. That was definitely a good sandwich. It is also a nice quick spot for breakfast. They have a wide selection on their menu that is quite interesting, so I will probably go back and try other foods on their menu. Their sandwich croissant tastes good, so I am hoping that the other foods on their menu taste good too.
The unsung hero of breakfast sandwiches. Best breakfast sandwich in the city. Family owned business with a true bang for your buck experience. Bacon egg and cheese on a croissant is the move.
Best omelette around! Great price! Hound team.
Nice clean lil place for breakfast & coffee very friendly service

I was lucky enough to sit in the private dining area with an entrance through the kitchen.  L2O was fabulous! We tried a trio of canapes, including foie gras!   The wine was incredible and the service didn't miss a beat.  I would highly recommend L2O for anyone looking for an elegant dining experience!!

This is definitely one of those restaurants where dining is truly an experience. I was there on a quiet night and the service was exceptional as to be expected. But I truly have to salute our sommelier, who happened to overhear me mention how I had always wanted to try a particular dessert wine that isn't in my budget (Chateu d'Yquem). Having no idea she heard me, I was floored when at the end of the meal she brought me a glass  on the house so I could finally sample it. I was able to check something out of my reach at the time off my bucket list simply due to her amazing kindness.

The atmosphere was quiet and about what I expected.  The service was very attentive and the sommelier was not stuffy or snobby.

My date and I each did the four course option.  Was it jaw dropping?  Kinda...  Damn expensive, though.

The amuse bouche was a wonderful clam with citrus and some other goodies.

The bread selection was great.  There was a small roll with cubed bacon inside.  Awesome!

I had a pasta dish with uni and caviar.  The warm caviar was intensley flavored and the thinner-than-angelhair pasta was cooked perfectly.

The butter poached lobster mitts came out looking gorgeous, but they were very tough and flavor wise, pretty alright...

Her Scottish Salmon was a beautiful looking plate, but for some reason the salmon tasted "off."

I opted for the $40 upcharge for the A11 Waygu with a truffle pan sauce.  It was beautiful, properly cooked and extremely underwhelming.  The sauce was nice, but a 3-4 ounce piece of Waygu should be able to stand on it's own.

A Cointreau/orange Souffle was a little too sweet. The cheeses and accompaniments were very nice, however.

Two four course meals, two half bottles of Northern Rhone (a nice Condrieu and Cote Roti) plus tip came out to about $600.  We left full, but it was not worth the coin...

Our dinner at L2O was certainly a Michelin 3 star experience: from the warm welcome, the delicious food, the beautiful presentation of the plates to the excellent service. Every plate was a new discovery, and we welcomed them with the necessary "ooh" en "aah"'s. Even the aftershock of the bill couldn't ruin our evening, money well spent!

The second stop on the Google Chicago Keepin' It Classy Crawl beyond exceeded expectations.  At L2O we had the privilege of sitting in the private dining area with an exclusive kitchen tour entrance. Situated inside one of my favorite Chicago buildings, the historic Belden-Stratford, L2O is top notch, first class all the way! Two fab foie gras bites - the first was inside a cantaloupe canape and the second was a scallop, with foie gras and hon-shimeji paired with Riesling Kabinett.  It was extra special to have the wine director, Richard explain the pairing and present L2O backstory to the group. This was a swanky experience and would definitely consider coming back for celebratory dinner or very special occasion.

If you have not tried the gyro pizza from here you are truly missing out! Best gyro pizza I’ve had in Chicago and I can’t wait to come back for more. The pizza was served fresh and the owner ensured we had everything we needed and more! Amazing food + good service, couldn’t ask for a better experience
Number 1 pizza in Chicago. They have combinations you can’t find anywhere else. I came all the way from Canada and I haven’t tasted pizza like this. Great pizza and great vibes

We ordered the Vegetarian Mediterranean pizza one night, and I have to say that was one delicious pie. Every ingredient down to the last vegetable tasted fresh. The staff is also quite friendly and efficient with their service. Highly recommend this establishment.

First time I went I had nothing but amazing things to say. Late night as advertised, great costs. Next time I went at 2am, they said they didn't have any pizza because it was 2am..mind you, they close at 4:30am and are advertised as having pizza..sidewalk sign outside the door and everything. Not cool. Just get pizza from the grocery store..
The food was very nice. We got the cheese burger and chicken pizza. Very delicious. The owner and workers were very kind. Amazing food with amazing people. 100% recommend!

Very good bar / restaurant with awesome outdoor seating in their rooftop. They've got quite an extensive beer selection that you can order in a tasting if you'd like. There's also a giant menu of food. During my visit I had the fried cauliflower and the fried green beans which were both excellent. Heads up that that chipotle mayo is quite spicy. My wife ordered the Mad Hatter which she said was very good. It can get quite packed during game days, so show up early to make sure you get a seat.

9/2022 5*  Food was fantastic.  Our server Zoe was amazing.  She did awesome!  Mac & Cheese Empanadas were great.  My Build a Burger was crazy good.  And the Fiesta Fields Salad was tremendous.  The spice on the chicken was a little much for our taste.  But overall we would order it again.  Almost tried the Fried Oreos, but we were just too full!  We will be back again for sure!

Absolutely loved it!
We ordered our drinks which were decent. The food was better than we expected. We ordered shrimp starters and we loved it so much that we ordered the same shrimp but as a sandwich for our entree. Spicy chipotle chicken salad was too good. It was hot but then was going so well with the margarita. Price wise it was a good deal spl the drinks. P.S. the photos were clicked after eating half of it. So the portion size for entrees is big :). They have a terrace sitting which elevates the food and the good drinks combo.

I go here often and their food is always good, their Fiesta salad is my favorite. I never crave salad but this one I do! Their burgers and sandwiches are really good too. Friendly laid-back atmosphere.

Great place to visit and get some good tasting food.
I don't recommend the elote, it is not the typical street corn served at Mexican food carts.  Good drink selection, service was friendly and polite.
Restaurant windows were wide open for fresh air.

Tables were pretty sticky, might be the coating mixed with cleaner spray.

Rooftop wait was about an hour and packed towards 6pm.

I will put this 2 start for their interior. Inside it looks really nice, and you expect food with the same quality. But unfortunately

We ordered 5 different plates
Just crab Rangoon was fine and tasty.
No soy sauce in Chinese restaurant. You have to ask for this I believe how I did.

Tom yum was awful. Spicy water with mushrooms, not even tasty.
We didn’t even eat more than 1 spoon.

After we ordered 2 different noodle soup
(On the photo shrimp noodle soup)
In their menu they don’t have mushrooms on recipe, I can’t eat mushrooms. But unfortunately no one told me, even menu.

Noodle was uncooked (if you visited a lot of Chinese places you will understand me clearly)

And noodle was like from dollar store.

From these 5 dishes we enjoyed only crab Rangoon.

We thought we will come back for sure, but after food I won’t even recommend to my friend.
Better to spend 10 more minutes and go to China town

I had a wonderful time at Little Wok! My friend and I came to eat and it was very understandably busy as it was a holiday but the hostesses were very welcoming and let us know ahead of time that there would be some delays. Our server had wonderful recommendations, the ambiance was lovely with beautiful decor and great music. Drinks were tasty, notably the pineapple margarita and lychee martini. We saw a couple people yelling loudly at some poor hostesses who had been working very hard all night (probably nothing he same people who left two bad reviews before me). What does yelling at restaurant workers do for you? Does one need an ego boost that bad? Restaurants are still understaffed and just because tables are open does not mean they are able to accommodate. It seems to me that they care about the quality of their service more than the quantity. We will be back for more!

I have been here two times now, and I plan on going back. The inside decor is just beautiful and such a great place for a date, family, friends, etc.  just think, versatile modern. The food can be amazing or disappointing depending. From my experience, their breaded chicken is not good. Very dry. My boyfriend felt the same. Now as for their pad see eu omggggg PHENOMENAL. I dream about that dish. I mean it was so good I had to sit there and relish in the moment lol. Their eggrolls are next level, and their hot and sour soup is the best I’ve ever had. Because of all those other positives, I still give this place five stars! The service has been about average but again the food has persuaded me to overlook some things. Always very friendly. Must go!

A new pan Asian cuisine sit down restaurant with full bar in the wicker park area on division.  Prices are very competitive yet you get a high end ambiance.  Plenty of street parking around the area as well as other attractions like Elitea nearby
Extremely fragrant and tastes just as good. Ordered dumplings and the Fatty Beef Vegetables. Dumplings were large and juicy while the Beef paried well with the choice of mushrooms and veggies.

Disappointed with the meal we got last night. First the ramen bowl did not look like it’s worth $13 it was filled with salty and oily soup that gave me upset stomach after eating,the ramen bowl wasn’t filling at all too little ingredients. Also order soft shell crab which was ridiculous for $8 we got 1 tiny budget crab unbelievable and their miso soup was tasteless as well as their side salad servings.. Too expensive with very little to offer.

Lunch special was good. Wait staff are nice, although they were confused when I came in. It was a slow afternoon and had fried rice. It has good flavor, nothing life changing. But maybe that's okay for a Wednesday afternoon.

The woman who waited on us was extremely friendly and provided great service! The miso soup was probably some of the best I’ve ever had. I do think the rolls had a little too much sauce on top, but i would still order them again (with less sauce). The Crunchy spicy tuna ($6) and red rocks maki ($8) were the favorites! Relatively reasonable as well.
GREAT customer service! Loved the pricing and the amount of food was perfect!

The sushi is decent, specifically for the price! The atmosphere is quiet and relaxing. It's BYOB without a bottle charge. And most importantly: we've been there twice and the staff already treats us like family!

This is the place to stop for quality breakfast. Menu choices very a lot of good and different options. Not your normal menu items here. Food is prepared fresh and the presentation is delivered looks really really tasty. Food quality was outstanding service a little slow on the coffee refills but outside of that it was great.

I think the food was delicious and reasonably priced for the area. Great place for brunch before the Pride parade!

...but so help me God if they give us one more free bowl of fruit I might die.

Edit: Had a friend go there last week. The cook walked out and they waited over an hour for their food. While the food was good it took forever. The place seems to be chaotic.

The service was friendly, if not a bit rushed even whilst they were not busy. The cinnamon roll that I had was absolutely delicious, and really had me looking forward to my main meal of buttermilk coated chicken sandwich. Unfortunately, I didn't enjoy the main dish. The chicken sandwich was so salty and the chicken so dry that I struggled to get through it. The potatoes were underdone and a bit bland for my taste. A big pity, given all the amazing reviews I had seen. The other patrons seemed happy, so perhaps my dish was a wildcard.

Stopped by for brunch and this place is awesome. Fresh juices were great, drinks were strong and tasty. The Irish coffee was a great wake me up but very strong.

Chorizo and eggs were good. Spicy and a really good portion. The potatos were really well seasoned and cooked.

Chicken and waffles were killer! Chicken was crispy and very flavorful. Waffle was perfectly done and it was a perfect combo. Loved it and definitely recommend it!

One of my favorite brunch spots.

Love this place. Monkey bread appetizer is a must! I usually get biscuits and gravy but they have delicious sweet options too! They serve la Colombe coffee which is delicious and bottomless. Also like that they have almondmilk instead of creamer. Not usually longer than 25 min or so wait.

I got Carry out. The kid checking me out dropped the box on the counter. I thought nothing of it, no big deal. The box felt very light. I got home and opened the box. The pieces were very thin and the the tobiko sashimi had broken and was all over the place. I called and I spoke to the owner who started making excuses about this that and the other thing. I didn’t wanna argue. I ate my food but  of the pieces smelled fishy, not fresh. Not happy. Kimura down the street is a bit more but 10x better. Never again Hana. Sorry

Ordered a spicy salmon roll and a spicy tuna roll, both came with tiny bits of fish with bright red food coloring on them, half the roll was sliced cucumber. I hate cucumber, nobody puts that on a spicy salmon or tuna roll. I called the restaurant to complain and got attitude. Go anywhere, the grocery store has better sushi for less. Place is a trap.

Owner would not honor a voucher purchased online, stating that the voucher could only be used for dine in. This restriction wasn’t on the voucher and the owner argued with me and I had to explain the voucher to him multiple times. He eventually caved but was visibly upset that he had to honor a coupon that I had bought specifically for his business. He was very rude and I would not come back here for food due to his confrontational attitude. Additionally, food was not as good compared to other nearby restaurants.

I've been in Detroit for the last 2 years and seriously missed Chicago, IL Thai food. the Thai scene in Michigan is so awful I actually started making it myself at home!
after being back in Chicago, IL one day, I came here. best decision ever. get the ka prao with the egg. you're welcome.

Bad customer service the guy seems to not be very friendly and 40 minutes on a order he originally said 25 minutes on. Just not a friendly or inviting place so why bother coming back. Support a business that enjoys being in business
Very few places make their own gyros. This place takes it to a whole new level. Dino has been setting the standard for years. Be sure to try the Greek potatoes with your gyros.

I've only been here for take out but the inside has a unique layout and seemed to be populated with old friends (the CPD).  The gyros found here aren't your typical greased over diner style.  This place seems to have their own unique recipe made in house.  Kudos to that!

I will say that because it's not your typical gyros you'll find the flavors of lamb more pronounced.  If that's not your thing, that's ok, they offer all kinds of other Greek and Mediterranean food.  The fries are tasty.  The wait staff is incredibly friendly.  Prices are reasonable.

Easily the best spot for Gyros in town! The home made gyro meat is very tasty and it's nicely complimented by a tasty home made tzatziki sauce. The location is very clean and has friendly staff. It has an outdoor patio area for dining and it has a parking lot as well. The only downside to this place is that once you have a gyro from here no other place will come close to satisfying your gryo craving.

Tastiest Freshest Gyros in Chicago! Not as salty as other Gyros places. Authentic Chicago Greek Home cooking! Everything is made to order. This place friendly, full of locals and is addictive! So Good!

Dino is doing a great job following in his father's foot steps. The food was amazing. I was flying home the next day and my family were excited that I was bring some of Dino gyros back. I was scared about wasting money buying the gyro and the airline not let me bring it on the plane. I spike to Dino and he placed the meat in a plastic bag and vacuumed sealed it. The restaurant it's self was clean and the staff were friendly. Definitely can't wait to eat there again next time I'm visiting.

Casual and comfortable atmosphere. Friendly service. I had the fish and chips and they were crispy, fresh, batter-fried and so tasty. I wasted no time digging in then realized I didn't get a photo of the beautiful presentation.

Authentic!  Beautiful Irish pub with great menu.
Had the shepherd’s pie…. Absolutely delicious.  Too bad I’m Chicago for less than 24hrs otherwise I’d be back for another dinner here!  On my list for my next time here!!

this is a family place tied with a bit of a party!  You can watch games at the Bar and from the tables as well.  The food is spectacular!!!  Drinks to continue the party or just to accompany the food!  the attention is very good!  100% recommended

D4 is a great authentic Irish bar. The food is excellent the atmosphere is very inviting. The smaller room in the back with the fire place and books on the wall reminded me of pubs I have been to in cork or Dublin. They also pour a great Guinness, which as anyone who drinks Guiness knows, makes it that much better. I can only assume it gets packed as it is a very large place.

Two different experiences…been there around Halloween of 2021 and remembered this place as the best place I’ve visited in Chicago! August of 2022 wasn’t nearly this great! The menu changed and food didn’t taste very good, eggs weren’t salted at all and just didn’t look good. They didn’t have any mocha or lates!! And the worst part was the server that spoke to us like we owe him something! Was unpleasant and not helpful at all. After this time I don’t think I’m coming back, unfortunately!!:(

Terrible experience! Called in a simply everything salad. Asked for no egg no cheese. Get to the car open the salad no meat🙄. Call in tell them the problem she in denial. Cashier took a look then said none of the meat was put on. The owner remade the salad forgot the onions & bacon bits! Then have to pay for another dressing after I put it on the first salad🤬

A great menu with plenty of variety and this is what stands out. The salads are also well made with a variety of choices.  Parking is usually open on the street. Reasonable prices and you get more for your dollar than the other name brand 🥪 sandwich shops.  Give them a try, very delicious . Closes early at 6 and lunch specials up til 3. 😋 No complaints here.

I hate to give this restaurant such a horrible review , but man listen the women that operate this establishment have to have the worst energy you ever want to see . No smiles , you are not greeted in a welcoming manner in fact they kinda come off like they are being inconvenienced by your presence . I’ve been coming here for years because the food is good but after today i will never return , the lack of appreciation for supporting their business is through the roof !  Service is really important when running a business and their service comes with stale faces , no eye contact , dry interactions just flat out bad energy . They do not treat their customers with an ounce of appreciation!!!!!!
The sandwiches and soups are good. They have bad attitudes. It's true, black women are always mad. When a different color walk thru the door I saw the attitude change. Sad.
Yes oh yes!!!! The food taste great, they were very friendly, and I will be a repeat customer for sure!

The food was alright, the inside was a bit dirty... the fries felt like they were a bit old and they had like no salt. The inside wasnt the best looking, it felt like they haven't cleaned it in a while.

Is it the best food ever? No. But is it open late, is the food pretty decent, and are the owners super nice? Absolutely. This isn’t a place for gourmet cuisine, but everything tastes good, it is prepared fresh, and the staff could not be nicer.
The shrimp I had was good. They have good fries too. They just need a TV for customers to watch while they dine in.
They’re open late late. The gyro is decent for the price. Their burger and chicken is incredibly low quality threw it away
Chicken gyro was amazing for a 12am sandwich, but fries were cold and gyro was old. It was late anyway, 4 starts.

I have ordered the deep dish special pizza multiple times over the course of a year at different times of the day and it's always been excellent! Highly recommend this pizza. The manager is also pleasant and friendly!

Really good pizzas, you can make your own pizza choosing the ingredients you want! It's a bit expensive though.

We ordered two small deep dish pizzas for three and we were so full we couldn't finish them! They are very tasty, we will come back.
Both the thin crust and deep dish pizza’s are awesome varying on what I’ve got a taste for they’ve never disappointed on a really good pizza with fresh ingredients.
Soooo fat but sooo goood and tasty pizza! 🥰

Delicious and authentic deep dish pizza. Ingredients were fresh and top quality - we particularly liked the eggplant. A frequent eater of deep dish said it was excellent and even our Italian guest thoroughly enjoyed it. Staff were very nice.

The Wendy's franchise has vastly improved there Menu. This location on Garfield boulevard stays busy but at the same time they move at a very consistent pace. Every time I come to this location the food has been on point. That is the reason they stay so busy. "Security" in the house and on point 👌.

Unbelievable experience! It was easy to count at least nine people at the register and beyond doing a variety of things. I would approximately three other people waited in an area to place orders for 6 minutes. Someone shouted from somewhere the line starts on the other side. We all move to the other side it is 10 minutes before I place an order. I noticed not one order has been given to a customer and the line is getting longer. A female employee comes from the bathroom and reports a catastrophic scene of filth. It is a full 13 minutes before I see one bag given to a customer as I listen to a customer in the drive-thru asking about the wait. I was really hungry and waited 26 minutes for a burger ( yes, one single burger). This gave me time to notice that all of the tables in the restaurant were soiled with leftover ketchup Mayo etc. During this entire episode I witnessed three customers served. In the distance there was a basket of cooked fries it was still there when I left. Will not return to this place.

Very long line at the takeout window. We only stopped there because it was the closest to the airport when we were leaving. When we got our order it was completely wrong. There was only enough Coke syrup to flavor the water light brown but it was mostly soda water. There was no way we could go back to get it corrected because it was a 45 minute wait in line. Thank goodness I will never have to go to this Wendy's again.

Food usually taste pretty good most times but the service is horrible. Past few times I’ve been there it’s always a problem. I ordered through the Wendy’s app mobile order so that my food would be ready when the person I had get it arrived. Not only was the inside closed way before 10pm but of course the drive thru was long and abnormally slow. Then he gets to the window and they take forever to come back to the window just to say they “don’t have that order in the system” despite me calling about it an hour prior. This was the worst experience and I wouldn’t recommend you coming here.

Did a mobile order to speed things up in drive thru. When I got to the windows the order was all taped up but was missing things. Luckily I wasn’t too much in a hurry to check. Was missing a salad. Sauce for nuggets. And spoon for frosty. Other than that it was Wendy’s
Ordered the country breakfast along with waffle and smoked sausage with fried potatoes.  Everything was delicious only draw back was that plates arrived a little later than everyone else.

I ordered 3 meals today. Meat lovers skillet, burrito supreme and a French toast combo. The French toast combo came with hash browns. I asked if my hash browns can be a little crispy and this is what I got. It was a takeout order so I saw this once my food arrived. Besides my whole order being almost $60 this was the worst, zero cares given how my food was thrown together! My hash browns were burnt, dripping grease, and looked horrible! Do not waste your time and money! Go somewhere else!!

the cream of chicken and rice soup was absolutely banging and busted all over my mouth. the burger i got there was extremely mid and bland.

great service from the staff though !!
Breakfast is OK not the best. Lunch here was terrible they add too much salt. They need more experienced cooks the food needs alot work.

Service was great! Food not so much. We tried the Mexican style chilaquiles and huevos rancheros and everything was canned food. Wouldn’t order that again. Not sure I would come back to try something else. 😔

I honestly don't know what an authentic Napoli pizza would be like, but I'd like to believe this place does a great job in providing that authenticity! It definitely is different from the typical pizza you'd get, with very soft and chewy dough and the entire thing baked inside the stone oven! The pizza itself is also not so salty so you can eat as many slices as you'd like! I also really enjoyed their bruschetta appetizer - the creamy cheese went wonderfully with their bread. I'd love to visit again to try their other dishes!

A Truly Amazing authentic Italian Neapolitan pizzeria.  The dough is airy and light, the sauce is bright, mozzarella so fresh, and ample quality toppings.  We drove 30 min from downtown even though there’s plenty of options down here, Spacca Napoli knocks it out of the park both times we’ve been there.  Try the octopus, it was served hot out of the oven and perfectly cooked.

Just the Margherita pizza itself might deserve the entire 5 stars! It changed my perspective of pizzas for ever ! I have been reviewing pizza stores and restaurants for long time, even tried the top 5 pizza places in Chicago, but this just changed my view just like that! What a wonderful quality of pizza they offer, the cheese feels so fresh and tasty, it’s brilliant ! The next best thing this place offers is the Burrata. The best I ever had ! Only disappointment for me was the desserts, it’s not that they are bad but they are not as great as the pizza are ! Panna cotta and the ice cream are the “not up to the standard” desserts this place has got to offer ! Do yourself a favor, try this pizza place if you are around !

Really great spot. Had the burrata, margherita and pistachio pizzas, and the peach dessert. Everything was excellent. We walked in without a reservation and we were seated immediately which was awesome.
Food comes out really fast also. Will definitely be back!

THIS PLACE HAS MADE ME LOVE PIZZA AGAIN!

Best pizza that won’t make you feel gross — i usually hate when pizza is greasy and it just makes you feel awful..do you know that feeling?

The crust is amazing 😭🙌🏽 And it’s chewy and the way everything just blends is amazing. It didn’t feel like I had a food baby after 3 pizzas 😅

I went to this restaurant on 7/22/2022. This restaurant has the perfect vibe and employees for any time of the day. I went for lunch and had the chicken curry with sweet tea. Entrées automatically come with sides that was awesome as well. It was really good and I enjoyed the man who was serving me. Definitely coming back!!

Dined here during the Christmas holiday with my husband and father, and we were all happy with our choice to eat at this restaurant. The waitstaff was friendly and welcoming, the food was delicious and the overall ambiance was wonderful! Would gladly dine here again.

Food was good, drinks was ok  I like how they’re presented. We got a jerk chicken dinner and a red snapper fish (my girl said it wasn’t no meat on the fish it was all sticking to the skin, customer service was good until the lunch crowd really started coming in they seemed under staffed cause it was only one waitress and it took forever to get his attention to get the check

The jerk lamb is a MUST have. I ordered the appetizer. It was seasoned to perfection and cooked just right. I recommend medium. Tip: Get the jerk sauce on the side if you're unsure about your spice tolerance.
The jerk chicken entrée (pictured) was amazing. And finally the rum cake (pictured) with a shot of rum for a little extra mmph! There are no words. Chef's kiss. I would definitely recommend.
All around great experience. The service was excellent. The drinks... heavy pour. This place is a gem.
Great portions and the food was amazing! Stephanie the bartender was amazing and really made the dining experience awesome! They have really stepped it up here! Truly will recommend to everyone!

The salsas come out in a cute 4 container serving dish with carrots/jalapeños and pico de gallo. The chips were fresh. The service was friendly but the food did not come out really quickly - there was only one cook working. The restaurant itself is really clean and vibrant with cool artwork on the bright colored walls. The steak burrito was excellent. I recommend the horchata.
This place is around the corner of my house and it’s so convenient when I don’t wanna cook. I normally get the taco dinner and the kids will get either a torta or sopes. Delicious and quick!

This spot is my little Chicago secret! It saves me and my Mom all the miles we'd need to travel to Little Village.
The Carne Asada is our go to order, it comes with a hotdog! It was unusual at first but now we ask for it to double check if we are ordering the right plate as an essential/imprtant item!
You can't go wrong with that dinner, you can make about 3 full Steak tacos a forth if you stretch your steak.
This is the North side best of show for sure.
Plus great art work in restaurant.
Super tasty food. Their chorizo tacos and guac are great. Fantastic place with pickup, delivery, and dine in. Fast service and nice people.
This place is a hidden gem there burrito is awesome and the people there are friendly. I look forward to try other food on there menu...😃

I love this place!!!!! ❤️. It’s so cute! They have a small, family owned feel and the food is out of this world good. Large portions and a great price. It gets busy so I try to go on off times. Check it out if you live in the neighborhood or are visiting Chicago.
I give it a 5⭐️
Jerry (the pigeon) gives in a 4.8 ⭐️

This place is super cozy - the food and service are phenomenal. My pictures aren’t great bc the light at the restaurant is pretty dim. We ordered the Oaxaca sopes appetizer, the plantain mole enchiladas and a sampler. Everything was scrumptious!

Love this small restaurant. They have different types of salsa and amazing Enchiladas. The ground beef is good quality unlike some mex spots. I normally go through a few bowls of the salsa. My only complaint is that it opens at 4pm.

Hit or miss.
This is a place to come when you're hungry. The food isn't anything special. There are better- tasting, cheaper take out options in the neighborhood.
It's the service that makes this place "2 stars".  One of the bartenders I met here was an absolute pleasure. On another night however, a decidedly surly bartender pretty much ruined my meal. Maybe he was just having a bad day. Unfortunately I won't be back to find out..

Quickly becoming a new favorite! El Mariachi is such a gem. The food is great but the service is truly top notch! Ana is so friendly and makes everyone feel welcome. It really has a nice cozy ambiance, with candles after dark. Can’t wait to be back!

Discovered this place a week back. Now I'm going there almost daily. Their Falafel is the best! The staff is so friendly. Its clean and cozy. Shish Kabab and humus are amazing. If you want to try out Middle Eastern Restaurant then better not miss this one.

The outside looks like it’s closed, but it’s open and very cozy. Bar seating is first come first serve, but reservations were readily available when we checked in the afternoon. I would definitely add this to a good food date night list because the food is delicious, drinks were unique and the staff was friendly and quick. We got the meat small plate (dunno how to pronounce it) and steak with brioche dessert.

Service and atmosphere was great, we sat at the bar and the bartender was friendly and helpful! Drinks were delicious, we had the old fashion and the daisy which both tasted fresh and we were left wanting more. We had the potato latkes and brie & pea toast as an app and the potato latkes definitely stole the show where the pea toast wasn’t on par. We both had the burgers which were very good but didn’t blow us away, you definitely need to be a huge fan of the pretzel bun. Would definitely come back and sit at the bar for a cocktail.

Fantastic wine program. Delicious house made charcuterie items. The stars of the show were the entrees or "large plates" as they call them. We had the Arctic Char and the pork schnitzel. The Arctic Char was one of the best balanced dishes I've ever had the pleasure to taste, each ingredient on the plate added layers of complexity and texture. The pork schnitzel was crispy and the capers and arugula wonderfully cut through the richness of the dish without being overpowering. We can't wait to go back!

Very unique place for me, I loved the drink menu, it was super well put together. The highball I had was made with sage in it, very delicious. The star of the show was dessert. That sweet potato pie with toasted marshmallow was out of this world! I also had the pork schnitzel, it was made so well, perfectly crispy on the outside and very juicy/tender on the inside. The whole meal was just wonderful as was the staff.

The  charcuterie and cheese board was great and I liked the steak tartare, while my wife did not. However, the seafood stew was a complete miss other than the presentation. The shrimp and mussles were good but the broth was awful to the point I could not eat any of it. The dessert was also a miss in my eyes. The servers were extremely friendly and on Tuesday they have a great wine/champagne deal. Further the ambience is nice.

Last night we picked up an order from Great Sea Restaurant and it was really good!
Lollipop Chicken: 5/5 - these were AMAZING. We got a half tray since we had a good amount of people to feed. They were still warm after the 20 minute drive!
Mongolian Beef: 3/5 - this wasn’t horrible, but it was very salty. The noodles on the inside were also soggy, however, that is probably due to pickup.
Sweet and spicy shrimp: 4/5 - honestly, this probably would be a 5/5 if it was fresh and the shrimps coat wasn’t soggy by the time we got home. However, was still really good.

All of this food costed around $95, which wasn’t horrible. The pickup service was alright, will definitely come again!

I know times have changed and supply is limited, but ever since the new owners took over, the food has not been the same. As everyone knows they are popular for their lollipop wings. It's definitely a must try for first timers, but being a frequent customer of maybe 10 to 15 years--the quality and quantity has declined which does not match the heavy increase in price. Their Mongolian beef used to have this spectacular crispness and flavor to the dish that you couldn't find anywhere else, but now it's quite soggy and bland. The wings do not taste as fresh, but dry and fried multiple times. The sauce is definitely something to buy by the bottle, delicious. The black sauce noodle dish came pretty watered down the last few times we ordered, which is completely different from the past. I just miss the old great seas...

Got takeout lunch specials (orange chicken and sweet & sour pork) the other day. Friendly service. Good portions and sauce, but the chicken was dry and the pork was very tough. Significantly more expensive than other local Chinese places, which have higher-quality food. Probably won't go back.

The food is amazing!! I have been looking for wings like these ever since Take Me Out in Pilsen closed. The wings are juicy and the skin crispy. The rice is also very good. My only regret is not buying a bottle of their sauce.

This place has awesome chicken wings. You should get the spicy version (not that hot), but there is also non spicy.
The hot and spicy shrimp has a nice slightly crispy texture. The sauce on there is also a bit sweet. I kept eating them even after I was full.
The service was really friendly today! (it didn't used to be).

The young man that was taking our orders was extremely nice and did everything with a smile. Which is rare these days. He completed our 5 orders relatively fast. They also have a large table inside that has charging imbedded into the table. Convenient.

HORRIBLE service! I’m a regular here, or was for that matter. I just left there on Wednesday 8/10 at 4:15pm without my order due to how rude the girl was there. No cars in front of me at the drive thru. I had been waiting for 10 min at the speaker for someone to take my order. Within those 10 min I said hello 3x to ensure the speaker wasn’t broken as I wasn’t getting a response. I had no response all 3x so I drove up to the window to place my order. I didn’t get her name but the short hispanic female with darker complexion was extremely rude and stated I needed to order at the speaker. I only say this so the owner can identify her. I told her no one responded when I asked 3x. She rolled her eyes and refused to take my order stating they were busy and that’s why. Okay, I completely understand this, although it’s not difficult to say one moment please. She wanted me to reverse my car to go to order at the speaker again. I tried to, but the car behind me pulled up so I couldn’t. I told her this. I gave her my coffee order and she didn’t put the order in or take my money and rolled her eyes and said to meet her in the parking lot. I waited for 20 minutes and she never showed. I guess she just tells everyone this so that they can leave. She could have just taken my order at the window. I’m not one to complain, but the blatant rudeness and lack of service was uncalled for. Frankly, she needs to get a new job as this hood rat should not be dealing with anything customer service related. I will be forwarding this complaint to corporate. Looks like I’ll be going to the new Starbucks they are building on Montrose for my daily coffee.

Went there today ordered a coffee with cream, sugar and nutty pumpkin at the drive thru. After receiving the coffee and looked at the label I realized it just said regular coffee with cream and sugar but not the nutty pumpkin. Drove back around at the drive thru and asked the lady about it, she said oh I am sorry I added pumpkin instead of the nutty pumpkin in it. I said ok, started driving for about 10 minutes and tasted the coffee and had no pumpkin flavor at at all. I had my husband taste it also and he said that was a regular coffee only with no pumpkin at all, so they literally lied to me in my face ! Bad customer service, lies and rude!

I live right down the block and they never get the order correct.....terrible traffic and please put someone at the cashier that understands and is not ready to argue. Girls in the back lookin at customers instead of getting the order correct Spending 30 dollars and not getting the order correct anyone would be upset.  All that moeny to improve the property and customers still come out flying from the drive thru.cross the street with your kids..... #boycottingdunkindonut

Wow talk about bad customer service.  Waited for about 5 minutes without any acknowledgment from the service team.  The Hispanic girl that with the straight brown colored hair that finally decided to take our order was rude. Doesn’t check if something is in stock and just says no… threw the change instead of handing it over… if you have a problem with your job maybe you should find another place to work.  Maybe the staff needs to be retrained in customer service skills. Yes everyone can have a bad day, but having manners doesn’t hurt anyone. Maybe she should learn to have some.

I have gone here on a number of occasions, I have gotten Meat Assortment Plate and this last time I decided on the Shrimp Kabob, in all cases the main part of the plate was pretty tasty, the "house salad" in all plates was rather sad though not necessarily bad, and in all instances "grilled pita" was more of a cracker consistency than bread or toast, not bad though just a little different than I would have expected.  In general the experience for the food was alright, don't expect too much from salads though.
I will forever order from here! The falafel platter is my favorite thing with feta hummus and red hummus 😭🙌🏽 SOOOOO GOOOD! The falafel is not tooo dry it’s just right; basmati rice always hits too!

Wowza! Warm fresh bread to adjoin my babaganoush! Look at this price of art 🖼 that they call the Mediterranean salad 🥗. Lovely chopped pieces of feta on ALL of the salad w a gorgeous array of green and red peppers. Taste the rainbow 🌈

Delicious food. This Mediterranean place is in Wicker Park.
I ordered the food online. Everything was well packed. The portion size is good and great quality food.
I ordered Chicken Shawarma, Falafel Platter and Pita with extra sauce. Everything was great. Falafel was nice and crispy.
Definitely recommended.

Google said this would be a great match, so we tried. And goes what! It was a perfect match! Loved the falafel burritos, their hummus and egg c been the great selection of soft-drinks. We will be back!

I’ve been to multiple Leonidas shops in Belgium and was so happy to see this in Chicago.  Had to buy some chocolate to see if it was exactly the same and it is. You can select one of their chocolate boxes or ask for a bag and select a some pieces which will be charged by the pound.

We also had a Caramel Frappe and Cappuccino to go and both were excellent.  The drinks were surprisingly reasonably priced, you can zoom up on the picture with pricing to see all the drink prices.

We got an extreme dark hot chocolate drink and a java milk hot chocolate drink. They were both very rich in chocolate and creamy / thick in consistency. I thought the extreme dark chocolate would be very bitter but it was not at all. I used to drink chocolate very often in the past but I hadn’t drunk it in years since I like foods & drinks with less and less sweetness as I grew up. The java milk hot chocolate wasn’t too sweet like I thought it would be but after a while we both needed some water.

The almond croissant was soft and crunchy. There are thin almond slices and powdered sugar on top, frangipane (almond cream filling) spread between the croissant slice, and chocolate between the layers of the croissant. The chocolate was a nice surprise. The Quiche Lorraine was probably pre-made and re-heated since it’s a small coffee shop. The crust is crunchy / hard and soft on the inside with onion and bacon. It’s a nice little savory pastry for the morning enough to fill you up for a couple of hours without being hungry.

Most customers came in to get drinks to go. You can also get chocolate / chocolate boxes here. The crêpes are made to order and I really want to try it, maybe next time.

The sweetness of apples and the saltiness of Brie made the Brie & Apple Crepes outstanding.

I liked the small shop with the great servers that made my order fresh and exceeding expectations.
The mango macron was delicious 😋. The hazelnut left something to be desired. The organetta were very good.

Charming little jewel of a cafe! Not only do they have delicious coffee selections, but wonderful food. Yes, you see the tempting display of yummy chocolate items and pastries,  but their menu has so many delicious meals. I highly recommend this cafe!

Came in for dinner with a group of guys on a Friday night. The restaurant was mostly empty, but the food was still better than I had anticipated. The food was classic Mediterranean-style dishes at a decent price - nothing terribly innovative or impressive, but all solid flavors and textures. My favorite item was the scallops and parsnip puree. There were plenty of options for the vegetarian and gluten-free members of our party. I walked away both full and satisfied with the meal. If you're hungry and struggling to get a last minute table in West Loop, I'd recommend Nia.

My husband and I got the wonderful opportunity to dine at Nia last night after a wonderful massage from the Mirror Mirror Salon and Spa next door. We were the first guest of the evening and was greeted with open arms. The staff was nice and accommodating. The ambiance was lovely and inviting. The cuisine was delicious as well! We had the charcuterie board with delicious meats and cheeses. The Nia salad was delicious and refreshing. Our main courses were the Lamb Chops w/mushroom risotto and the Amish Chicken w/Potatoes and Broccoli. Everything was delicious and cooked to perfection. We couldn’t wait to dig in. We will definitely return to dine here, especially after learning they have a patio set up during the summer months. Thanks Nia for a lovely date night.

I had such a wonderful time at Nia this evening! Incredible service from all of the staff. Beautiful ambiance in a decadent and intimate setting. And the carbonara; fantastic. You can really tell when someone has their heart and soul put into a place and Nia is an excellent example of that! Make them your next stop!

One of the most welcoming quality restaurants in the city. I enjoyed the lamb which was finger licking good! The drink selection was amongst the top in the city. I will definitely be back again and have suggested it to many friends. Ask for the espresso martini it’s exquisite.

I cant speak to a normal experience but I and some friends participated in Resturant week with Nia this year and it was great! Had and 8 course, tapas style tasting menu and I was impressed! With so many heavy hitters in the west loop Nia could be overlooked but if your looking for a romantic setting and shared plates this is a gem.

Went here for their Sunday brunch and the food was delicious and their service was absolutely phenomenal. I got the Duck Sope, the Rotisserie Hash and the Sticky Bun. The sope was by far the best of the three, but the sticky bun was like a more delicious cinnamon roll with candied pecans, and the rotisserie is good if you like a good vegetable medley. The service is what took this restaurant to 5 stars for me. By far some of the kindest servers/hosts that I’ve encountered in Chicago. The prices are also reasonable so I’d recommend you check it out if you haven’t yet. A diamond in the rough, I’m surprised that there isn’t a line out the door.

The food was fantastic as was the service! I will likely be back again next week because there's still more I want to try. The wings are incredible. We also had the duck sope, the smoked salmon toast, and their special. The biscuits and gravy on the special were fiiiire!
The Duck Inn was amazing. The food was delightful and the service was exceptional.  I ordered the peaches and cream French toast and I was not disappointed. The sticky buns are also to die for.

My fiancé and I love going to this restaurant. We come here  when celebrating an anniversary or have a random date night and get fantastic service. On this particular day, Bernard served us. He got to us after 15 minutes to get our drink order but was very unfriendly and bland. His personality with the tables around us was very kind and friendly. We got our drinks and finished them and waited a very long time before he came to get our app order and we ordered a second round of drinks. We tried to order our main course but he said he would be back. We got our drinks and app and finished them and again waited a long time for him to come back. We ordered our food and not once did he check in on us. At this point seeing how extra friendly  he was with everyone and not us we got uncomfortable and just decided to pay and get dessert at the bar. The bartenders and bar back were great and treated us well. We still tipped Bernard 20% cause we’re in the industry but his service towards us was horrible.

Heard this place had an underated Italian Beef sandwich so I had to try it out. Sat outside on their patio on a Saturday evening and enjoyed the sandwich accompanied by the fries fried in duck fat.  Delicious.

Pretty disappointing for a lot of reasons. First off, the floor was covered in water as there seemed to be some sort of leak. As someone prone to falls, that’s something to at least stay on top of and mop up or at least have a warning sign. I could tell the server was super stressed because he was kind of talking to multiple tables at once and instructing another server. That’s understandable, but the service was slow overall. When it came to the food, we had to add salt to everything because it had virtually no flavor. We tried the kadai chicken and chilli ghobi, and thought they weren’t terrible, they certainly weren’t worth the prices at this restaurant. This may have just been an off day, but it’s not somewhere I’d return based on this experience.

Loved the murgh makhini.The service was slow, but the food was delicious so I cannot complain. The owner was very generous and gave me a complementary Gajar ka Halwa.I am planning to go there more often.
I really enjoyed Hema’s breakfast. I cannot have enough the Masala Dosa, Idly and Vada. A good starting points for authentic South Indian food. Will come back soon.

our food took 2 hours to get out. the food was good and very hot, but this was a terrible experience for us. we kept watching people who ordered takeout get their order within 5 minutes and sat baffled as to why it would take so long.

The food is absolutely delicious. By far one of the best Indian restaurants I’ve been to. This is a family owned business and you can definitely feel the hospitality, their service is impeccable. I am definitely going to be a regular at this place!
Hands down one of the best customer experiences I’ve ever had. The owner Andy is a peach, the food is fantastic and the atmosphere is homey.
We had such a lovely experience. The food was delicious. Small intimate setting but very well worth trying.

I have ordered from La Gondola for years. Tonight I ordered a pizza from a third party as we have moved too far for delivery service. When I opened the pizza not only was the pizza undercooked but there was hair all over the inside of the pizza box and on the pizza. When I called La Gondola I was told there was nothing they could do for me since I ordered from a third party and that next time I should order directly from them. Extremely disappointing and I will not be ordering again.

You cannot beat the BOGO Lasagna on Mondays. For the price, it’s well worth it, although I do wish it was a bit more flavorful. I wouldn’t let that stop you from trying it though! Plenty of sauce and the meal comes with bread and soup or salad. We also ordered the fried calamari which was good, not too fried or heavy. Tasted fresh and good texture. Alejandra was our server. She was great very attentive and checked in frequently. The restaurant is smaller than expected but seems clean. Looked like there were a lot of takeout orders so I bet their delivery is good too! Might make this a regular Monday outing

La Gondola catered the holiday party for my condo building and everyone raved about the food!  We had so many compliments about it all night. We ordered the Rigatoni alla Boscaiola, Sausage & Peppers, Gnocchi al Pesto, Chicken Parmigiana, Caesar Salad, and the Mini Cannoli and Brownie Bites. The Sausage & Peppers was the first to go, followed by the Chicken Parm. My personal favorite was the Rigatoni alla Boscaiola. I've tried a lot of entrees on their menu, but never this, and I'm so glad I did. I have to order that again! The gnocchi was amazing too. You'll want some Italian bread to clean all the sauce from your plate. The salad was so fresh, and one guest told me he doesn't eat salad, but he ate that salad because it was so good. And the dessert?! People were loading plates with cannoli and smuggling brownie bites out in napkins to take home with them. There was more than enough food for the headcount we gave them, and delivery was on-time and easy. The driver even called ahead to tell me they were on their way. I highly recommend La Gondola for your catering needs. You will not be disappointed!
Very great place! Had the pleasure to talk to the employee as I was ordering my coffee. Very positive energy and atmosphere.
Great coffee even better donuts
Just got an old tough chewy bagel from here. I guess if you get it toasted they think it will pass but this is downtown. There is no reason to be selling day old anything.
this Dunkin’ Donuts LOVES you wether you coming in at 2am or 10am they took great care of us at midnight and the same great care of us that morning after, their drinks and sandwhiches are delicious
I go to this Dunkin because Amir makes the best dunkin coffee in town. Amir is one of the coolest guys around. God bless that guy... 🙏

I'm in town on business, and had to stop in and try this place. Reviews were solid. This place DID NOT disappoint. Although the place is smaller, shaped like a rectangle with you entering on the short side, it had a lot of cool seating. Booths, picnic tables, normal tables, and some street window seats. My double bacon, egg, and cheese burger was delicious! Fries were solid, potato style like 5 guys...but better. Chocolate malt was good. Sharing pics. Staff was cool. Music was great. Their music system played Tom Petty, Marshall Tucker Band, The Black Keys, Spoon, and off-hit Johnny Cash. I'd go here again and again!

The food was really good. There's no question that they have some of the best burgers that I've ever tasted. Their wings were pretty good and the February special with the mole sauce was really good. Will definitely be back

Burgers were pretty good but not quite as good as they looked, or quite as good as some of our favorites others in the price range. At $15-20 for burgers it was disappointing they didn't come with fries. Service was good, bit of an expensive beer list. Enjoyed our lunch watching March Madness, probably wouldn't go out of our way to go again.

Great friendly staff.
They are short staffed so you the burgers will take some time to get to your table.
For taste I was content with but was not my favorite burger. My boyfriend really enjoyed and he just didn’t really appreciate the fries.
I’d come back :)
Amazing burgers and great selection of draft beer including gluten free options. The server was great at making sure we received the correct gluten free options. The wings were delicious!!

Simply put the corn beef is great here! All of the sandwich options were lovely and the homemade chips were to die for. We got it to go in by the time we got back to our house the food was still warm and ready to eat. The old-school traditional corn beef you dream of is exactly what they serve up here! We will be back sometime soon to indulge again. The staff was super friendly!

The Tom & Jerry is half cornbeef half pastrami, which was excellent.  It tastes as good as some of the older more established delis.  But at a bang for your buck!! Most of these delis charge extra for swiss cheese and chips.  This is already included in the price!! And imo, the sandwich is a good size for 1/3 less costs (and some places even more).  Try it out, and service is quick and friendly!
If you love Reuben or corned beef sandwich this is the place! Stuff was really fresh, corned beef, kraut and thousand island dressing were outstanding! Thumbs up 👍

I usually love the Reubens here. I went today about 10:30. Instead of the amazing sandwich I usually receive. The sandwich was almost devoid of ant thousand island dressing or sauerkraut....barely a teaspoon full. Disappointed...and not happy.
I absolutely Loved it..the sandwiches are very Good I had the Tom and Jerry,,the Corned Beef was perfect..I highly recommend this place..😃
Very few places make their own gyros. This place takes it to a whole new level. Dino has been setting the standard for years. Be sure to try the Greek potatoes with your gyros.

I've only been here for take out but the inside has a unique layout and seemed to be populated with old friends (the CPD).  The gyros found here aren't your typical greased over diner style.  This place seems to have their own unique recipe made in house.  Kudos to that!

I will say that because it's not your typical gyros you'll find the flavors of lamb more pronounced.  If that's not your thing, that's ok, they offer all kinds of other Greek and Mediterranean food.  The fries are tasty.  The wait staff is incredibly friendly.  Prices are reasonable.

Easily the best spot for Gyros in town! The home made gyro meat is very tasty and it's nicely complimented by a tasty home made tzatziki sauce. The location is very clean and has friendly staff. It has an outdoor patio area for dining and it has a parking lot as well. The only downside to this place is that once you have a gyro from here no other place will come close to satisfying your gryo craving.

Tastiest Freshest Gyros in Chicago! Not as salty as other Gyros places. Authentic Chicago Greek Home cooking! Everything is made to order. This place friendly, full of locals and is addictive! So Good!

Dino is doing a great job following in his father's foot steps. The food was amazing. I was flying home the next day and my family were excited that I was bring some of Dino gyros back. I was scared about wasting money buying the gyro and the airline not let me bring it on the plane. I spike to Dino and he placed the meat in a plastic bag and vacuumed sealed it. The restaurant it's self was clean and the staff were friendly. Definitely can't wait to eat there again next time I'm visiting.

So I ordered some food for my family on 12-31-21 at 7:01pm my food was delivered at7:26 crazy right that fast as we open up are food the boxes are soak and wet as we open up the pizza boxes there stuck all the cheese was stuck to the top of the box the pizza so it was just all sauce on that pizza and it was soggy and not cooked all the way through next two pizza has only sauce barley any cheese on the pepperoni was burnt but again it pizza was not fully cooked so I called the store that night I got no answer I paid 79.21 for my food and was not even able to eat what I purchased I had to order from somewhere else I called the store the following morning to inform them about my order she apologize and said she will refund me my money I called on Saturday 1-1-22 still have not gotten my refund yet still have yet to speak to anyone after that day I called domino’s the said this is a franchise so I guess I was robbed cause my bank said I can’t dispute it off my account guess it cost me 250 dollars just to eat that night next restaurant was very expensive I was told there will be someone to reach out to me nobody has reached out to me yet

The staff was very nice and they gave us 20% off for picking up which was nice. They are also open until midnight during the week.  Having said that, it's a Dominos, certainly not a great pizza. The cheese is weird but really wanted pizza after coming home around 11:30 pm for an event, it scratched the itch but this is not a go to for pizza in this city.
I’ve been ordering from this Domino’s for over 20 years. My pizzas are always gone right, on time, and served with a smile. Ernesto is the best!

Domino's must have went corporate. The changes in prices firstly have changed to higher prices. Tried to place a order in which the price came out to be doubled within the past week. Plus, on top of that, Something they do not tell you right away, Any order over 25 dollars you must pay a deposit with a debit or credit if your paying with cash. After ordering from them for years, and they were great pizza before, never ordering from them again.

Usually our goto pizza place
Pretty (good) standard most of the time! In terms of quality
Awesome food. Really enjoyed the fact that they made my food exactly how I asked them to. Great job guys.....
Best fried rice hands down! Chicken also delicious!

Went here for my birthday with my parents and siblings and the ambiance was gorgeous. Seems like a smaller place so we sat outside which was lovely. A little bit all over the place as we helped ourselves to silverware and wiping down our table but everyone was so nice and the food was so so good. Definitely will come back!
Tasty tostones and Crab cakes were spot on. The drinks were cool and spot on. The tortilla soup was surprising. Great service and nice outdoor atmosphere for plenty of people watching

We ordered Roasted pork, shrimps and mojitos, all of which are very delicious. We sat in the patio and enjoyed the atmosphere. With the pleasant weather in Chicago, I feel like back to Miami. It would be five stars if the service was faster. It was a very busy Satisfied night.

Delightful Latin restaurant with flavorful food and refreshing cocktails. We had pitchers of Caipirinha's and they were delicious. The yucca was nice and crispy, the guacamole sublime, and the habanero hot sauce a little on the mild side but delicious. Had a chicken dish that was not heavy at all and so yummy.

I have been here twice on visits from out of town and will definitely go back. Lively atmosphere and friendly staff.

After having some awesome Cuban food out in Miami we decided to check out a Cuban spot here in Chicago. Food was good, very authentic taste. The mojito flight was very delicious and refreshing especially the Mango and Peach flavors. The Trio empanadas were crispy and juicy. I went with the Ropa Vieja and it’s very similar to a plate I had in Miami which I loved. Not quite the same but a good second. The Cuban sandwich could use some work but overall food was tasty. Service was fair not be most enthusiastic but got the job done. I will say the exterior of the restaurant looked very culturally accurate!

They make the best food the cook is a delight. The service is horrid. They always 10 minutes getting the food ready. They mess up every order whether you call in or not. They be on the phone all during work so no one is paying attention. They skip over people. Their unorganized. The younger cashiers can’t take criticism. They wouldn’t hire anyone with experience. The restaurant is always clean and food is good, but I won’t be visiting them anymore. They do not have to worry about I may or may not order.

My order was not complete.  Seashell said it was the fault of Doordash and the driver said it was Seashells fault.

Seashell said they would give me a $5.00 gift card . . . I am still waiting for it!
I love this place the food the food is good and is always hot at a reasonable price

I just ordered from them, for the last time. The food is good, but the ppl are horrible. No matter what you ask for, their gonna do something else. I asked for the Mild Sauce to be ON the Chicken and the young lady had every excuse on why they CAN'T do it. Then, I find out she's charged me for the order, without making sure I wanted anything else. I was going to leave this at 2 stars, but after taking 1.5 hours to deliver & I'm only 5 mins away, I'll leave it at 1.
Good food and friendly staff.
Delicious!! Fruit juice, pinchos, empanadas and fruit salad 🤤 yummy

I came here for a quick coffee. I agree that the waitress was super nice and she tried to make my coffee taste better but it really didn't. I got the cafe leche and it really wasn't all that sweet or leche tasting sadly. They were also out of the obleas when I came. Since all the reviews are for the dogs I might come back and try that.

Never got the chance to taste their food since the "lazy" young lady with glasses (she will recognize herself) completely ignored us today (June 23)
We were the only customers there, waited a couple of minutes, but the lady was still sitting on her chair behind the counter looking at her cell phone and pretended not to see us.
We tried to catch her attention, but I'm sure she was too busy checking her FB page. : )
To the owner(s): you'd better find someone else before your employee ruins your business.
All the best! Will never come back...

The Rapidito dog was fantastic. I don't even like pineapple or ketchup but wanted to try the traditional dog so got everything. Somehow they all worked together, it was excellent. The arepizza was delicious and the bean soup, phenomenal. I can't wait to bring the whole family back here.

We live a few blocks away but never went to Rapidito until tonight. I'm sorry we didn't go sooner! Everything was absolutely delicious! We have a difficult to feed family with one picky child and a vegetarian child. The corn flat breads were fabulous. The empanadas, both chicken and veg, were outstanding (and our vegetarian loved the veg one). I loved the salchipoppas and the steak skewers. We all loved the smoothies (especially mango!).
