I finished off my meal with a con panna, a scrumptious espresso shot with whipped condensed milk. The service was extremely fast and friendly. Needless to say, I highly recommend Rapidito!

Been meaning to try to come here for awhile now, so glad we finally made the choice to come in. The food was above and beyond. Super kind staff and cozy atmosphere. Great German beer. And to top it all off, I highly recommend getting the cherry strudel for dessert. We will come back again to try the oven baked pizza and live music on the week days.
Great neighborhood place! Celebrated our 8th grade class.  Staff was very accommodating. Good food! Homemade bread was delish!
Wow, this place has such an amazing homey feel, with fantastic fresh baked bread and awesome German beers on tap. Food is great and service is so friendly and authentic . Best neighborhood place

This is a unique idea. They are pairing the experiences and cuisine of both Italian and German food. While they are not usually parrot in the same dish it is a nice variety. They even have pizza, but it is on the wine menu, so don't forget to look for it. Prices are a bit high but portions are huge.
Great local spot. Excellent German food and pizza. Staff is very friendly and we loved the accordion player
I got the chicken lemongrass bahn mi and it is DELICIOUS. The bread is perfectly crusty just like you want it to be. The produce is fresh & delicious

Not a very good tofu bowl - it all seems old and mostly comprised of rice. Pretty much no flavour. Looks like their other items might be passable - but don't bother with a rice bowl. $15 plus tip down the drain 😔
Wife is vietnamese. We eat a lot of pho. I love good pho but this place is bad. Absolutely tiny portions. Not authentic. Just not good value.

Ridiculous bowl composition  - 90% rice, 2 pieces of tofu, 2 pieces of cucumber, 4 strands of carrot, a few strands of radish and some cilantro leaves with 2 pieces of jalapeño. Wanted to like them but this was just shocking.

I like the Baum mi of this shop the best amongst other Baum mi shop in Chicago.
A bit pricy but huge volume and filling was much enough.They put cilantro and Daikon a lot which give nice flavor.And baguette is airy and crispy,light,which is important,I think.
Shop staffs are nice,too.

Cafe Society isn't too far from us and we've frequented often due to its good location, food and nice patio seating in the south loop.  These gems are hard to come by in our neighborhood.  The prices seem a little pricey however for what it is and their dining room needs an upgrade to match that price level I think.  Often times when we order, they don't give you the full menu item as listed and charge you more, so be on the look out for that.  Also, they seem to have a problem with language translation and don't always understand english too well.  I wish they had better coffee as well, then coming back would be no question.

Had a great vege and chorizo scramble. I uses the breakfast bar seating, but there is plenty outside.  Great patio/plaza area!  Got to practice my Spanish a bit, too!  But their English was just fine.  Would definitely be a regular if I was a local.
Awesome food, seating is in the other side of building, great service
This place has a huge and diverse menu, but when it comes to the sushi it's always good! The chef left some bones in my fish but it was otherwise good. The smoothies and drinks are great!

I love the Sit Down. Their sushi is SOO delicious and the spread is just amazing. Everything is so fresh, they do a great job of keeping it clean and the service is always great, super friendly. Love love, love it.. yummy! Just thinking about it makes me want to go back and I was just there yesterday! 😋 keep up the great work! Spent about $80 for 2 people, ordered 4 types of rolls, the cucumber salad and a bottle of wine (which was on sale for half off! Can't beat that).

Took family to celebrate daughter's birthday. Service was a let down. Was really looking forward to it after reading good reviews. No attention to our table whatsoever. Food was eh... this place definitely did not live up to the hype.
The sit down has great sushi, my favorite is the 53rd and amazing martinis! The seasonal flavors are great but my go to is the basil.
I've been going to this place since they first opened. Food has been consistently  delicious  and fresh. All of the specially  rolls are delicious  as  well. This is a hyde park staple

Food tasted very good. I love their Kofta Nihari. One of their signature dishes. Their chai is also good. If you order mixed grill with another curry, it would be enough for 4-5 people. Though once found their naans were a little bit over burnt. However that’s can be an outlier. But service a little bit slow, can be improved.

I can't single out one item, everything they serve is super delicious. This restaurant is mainly famous for its Chicken Chargha which has never been inconsistent in its taste. Every thing's always perfect from preparation to the presentation. We come here very often and have never been disappointed so far.

Fantastic experience. The woman working at the front desk was exceptional in her delivery of customer care and ensured every aspect of our needs were addressed, accounted for, and fulfilled. It is so rare to have such quality delivery of service these days. We actually came here after experiencing subpar customer service approximately 400 feet eastward on the same side of the street.

Our waiter, Tanveer Iqbal, personally brewed a pot of piping hot Chai that our party enjoyed with vigor and ferocity.

The Gulab Jamuun we’re clearly prepared fresh and refrigerated for no longer than eight hours as per instructions.

10 out of 10 recommend biryani and chai, ideally together.

If you want Chicken Chargha that is made with Chaat Masala and not traditional spices then this is the place to go. Be ready for heartburn and blood pressure spike. Also, please make sure you take your own silverware and plates because they serve their food in paper plates, plastic spoons, and their food is warmed up in microwave especially the tawa qeema and tawa rice.

Worst chargha I ever had. They give out burnt and dry chargha for to go’s order and don’t bother to pickup the call when they are aware of it that they messed up. Also, the fat guy on register not willing to listen or take any complaints other than that, he will suggest you to buy food elsewhere because it’s gonna be the way it is burnt and dry charghas at lahori chargha for to go orders because mostly people don’t check their food till they reach home and this guy have the audacity to not pickup the call and if he end up picking up the call he will suggest you better places. Unsure what kind of business they are running

A very dynamic atmosphere with great food. It was difficult to decide what I wanted because everything sounded amazing. The drink menu was well rounded and offered many options for all palates. I settled on the southern dandy w/ old bay fries and it was everything i thought it would be. I will definitely be going back to try the rest of the menu.

We each picked out a beer from their decent tap  selection and then we shared two burgers between the four of us. Both of them were amazing. The Fig is in burger is very different but good. You can sub a delicious salad in for the fries if you want. Fun atmosphere in the place with eclectic decor. We would highly recommend this place!
Very friendly staff. Like the drink options, and we all loved the cheese curds! My friends really liked the burgers, but I thought they were ok.

Bad apple is such a great place to get a burger! They have such wonderful though out burger creations that are delicious! The meat is fantastic as well so even a plain bad apple burger is delicious. The drink creations are fantastic too and their beer list is good.

Had a good time at The Bad Apple. I tried their Poutine and it was pretty good, not something so easy to find around this area. The burgers were all very interesting, with creative toppings and names to go with it. We had "The figs is in" and "Jake and Elwood" and absolutely enjoyed it. Will come back to try some of the other burgers!

I’m tired of my food being microwaved!
Each time I go here, whether dine in or take out, (I haven’t been here since May of 2017 bc of bad food and service), they just have to put it in the microwave. From what I order it’s mainly beans, rice, and the suizo burrito. Apparently cheese can melt on its own so they have to microwave it... no it does, you’re just serving cold and/or expired food, if it’s made fresh and kept warm through the day it wouldn’t be a problem. The food comes out hard, dry, burnt to the styrofoam, or swimming in oil. If I wanted microwaved food I could just get a TV dinner and I wouldn’t even do that, I’d go to Taco Bell, at least they don’t have microwaves.

I love this restaurant. The food is delicious and quick. The cost is more than reasonable. The horchata is sweet but not instantly-cavity-inducing like a lot of places. The grilled fish tacos are awesome. Service might be brusque sometimes, but never rude.

Pros: Clean, nice server, food tasty, margaritas the best. Cons: parking is not available, steak in burrito could have been bigger pieces, very small like ground beef. Server didn't ask if I wanted green or red salsa just assumed I wanted green and didn't offer red though she made sure other patrons had both. I guess because I'm not Hispanic. Had to ask for sour cream and pay $1 for small cup though menu states burrito has sour cream.

Great place .. quiet relaxing without having to sacrifice great tasting food. We're respectable service. One of the very few Mexican restaurants I can go to. And not get treated differently due to my white skin and blue eyes. Waitresses every time I bring one of my girlfriends are never mean to her. Most restaurants I go to there Mexican food very when I come in there with a white woman they treat her kind of mean. Some kind of way for her being with Latin man. But in this place they're not like that. That means a lot to me...

Love the food, but service has really gone from good to horrible. Waitress needs some serious trainnig..rather than walking to a table and introducing herself. She asked "can I help you?" Really! It's a restaurant so I most likely may want some food. This used to be our favorite place to go to.

My first time eating here. The customer service was good.  The guy was pleasant and even made small talk while I placed my order. I ordered a small shrimp and broccoli,  egg rolls,  and a small shrimp lo mein
Tasty and large portions. Recommend the General TSo chicken! The large combination chow mien is HUGE!!! My husband and I barely made a dent. Definitely for a family.

Food is consistently good, short wait time tax included in pricing. Ordering ahead makes getting Chinese food a cinch. The neighborhood is a Lil sketch but literally one block over from a police station so it's not terrible. Overall good value for price. Great service And safe enough.
Idk what this was. I order Chicken Lo Mein and Orange Chicken smh the best thing was the Eggroll and that wasn’t appetizing either. $20 down the drain. Go somewhere else please.

We have been eating from here since I was a child.
This place food is so authentic. The staff are always respectful and generous! They know their customers ok? 10 stars for me if I could. God bless Ho Ho's!

A pizza pie, whats not to love. I have a huge hunger and my appetite was satisfied. I was warned that this is too much food for one person and they were right. Great service, bottomless drinks, no queues and pizza to live by.

Walked to Giordianos from Andersonville. Ordered ahead of time so I just picked it up. No one was there so it was a quick and easy pick up. I ordered  a 6 inch personal pan pizza with Sausage and Giardiniera. Pizza was really good but I rank Genos East higher.
I had the meat and more deep dish pizza. Pepperoni, sausage , salami  & bacon. My First time having deep dish in Chicago.  It was delicious

Delicious, like always! My only complaint is the restaurant was small, not many tables so we had to wait a little over 10 minutes for 6 of us to be seated. It wasn't crowded, just a small restaurant. Our waitress was AMAZING and the pizzas, Chicago Classic and Meat and more meat, were just as amazing!

We stopped here for their deep dish Chicago special. We have been to other Giordanos in Chicago as well as Indianapolis.  Still the same great taste. It is a much much  smaller restaurant, sit down in booths. Not like the downtown Chicago one or the Indy one, but it was still awesome. Waitress was super friendly. Great neighborhood too. Go visit them. They also deliver and have take out. We will return as family lives in this neighborhood and we can walk over easily.

Wow this place has gone completely down hill.  The location at north used to have quality ingredients but I'm pretty sure they've changed all of that.  Chicken was awfully dry, hummus terrible, rice barely tolerable.  I'm in shock how bad this place is now.  Do not come here for Mediterranean food please.

I tried Sultan’s Market for the first time last week when we ordered take-out for my friend’s birthday picnic. The food was generally quite good, with a couple exceptions. The pita was the best item we ordered - light, fresh, and fluffy. The rice was great too. I enjoyed the falafel and the hummus as well. However, the vegan cookies were dry and flavorless. We ordered both types of vegan cookies, and they were both disappointing. My friend and I also wanted to order dolmas, but when we looked at the ones at the salad bar, they looked crushed and unappetizing. We decided not to order them. Overall, the food was satisfying, and it would’ve been exceptional if it weren’t for the dolmas and vegan cookies.

Amazing food! I got the meat combo dinner.
Can’t make up your mind, then get this. Lamb Shawarma, chicken shawarma, and kefta kabob on top of your choice of curry rice or lentil & rice. Served with sides of hummus, tabuli and hand made pita. Yummmy!!! I also got their Baklava that is delicious!! Highly recommended!

Always 5 stars always the best because this is the original spot. I have seen it grow from when ur first opened to blend and I am super stoked with the consistency. I love that they employ young people who see from the neighborhood too! Today the Xavier was so amazing. He was the cutie with the beard, an older gentleman. He was super attentive and made sure my order was right. So grateful for the great atmosphere and food. Keep doing a great job guys.

I do love a good Mediterranean meal, and this place never disappoints. I’ve been several times over the years and I’ve never left unhappy. I don’t love the decoration of the place - looks a bit cheap, and could easily be spruced up a bit, but in the end, it’s the food that counts, and it’s always been a solid venue in my experience.

This was maybe my 2nd time patronizing this business and my wife's 1st time and we were pleased with the freshness and overall delicious food at Home Run Inn Pizza. We order some crispy hot wings, cheese sticks and obvious a pizza topped with sausage and mushroom. The staff was friendly and the store was very well maintained. LTS recommended 👌🏿

I ordered a 16 inch half pepperoni/half sausage garlic crust pizza along with a gluten free pizza. My son picked it up and when he arrived home, the middle of the regular pizza is not cooked all the way. As you can see in the picture attached. We love Home Run Inn and choose you over local pizza places due to the gluten free option for my son. I am very disappointed that for $50 we get a pizza where the middle pieces cannot be eaten due to the dough not being fully cooked.
HRI really got me with this deal! What more can one ask for? A large pizza, wings and fries for less than 40$ I’ll take it over and over again! Thank you for having this superb deal.

I ordered an extra large sausage and cheese pizza as take out but as I’m eating my pizza i taste bbq sauce. Knowing i have nothing in my order that pertains bbq, i look under my pizza and saw bbq sauce there. I am highly upset. It’s obvious that they are not sanitary there

Hadn't been here since the pandemic began. I understand all prices are rising but the price point to value and quality just isn't there right now. The cheesey garlic bread was just a loaf of bread with cheese across the top of two pieces. Not butter, no garlic. I always get the same salad, which apparently is now only on their catering menu? So I got a salad which they said is for two but definitely is in a normal deli salad bar container for an individual. So for $55, and what you get it just wasn't what I'd expect.

Its a cool little spot downtown. We went I'm specifically for the Chicago style dog. Service was great. They took our order at the counter, made the order in a matter of minutes and called our number when it was ready. The dog was nothing special. It was a hotdog on a soggy bun with all the fixins on top. I had no complaints about the taste. It was okay. We probably won't be back because it's not something that really wowed us but then again we live 2000 miles from this place. It is what it is.

Jimmy himself greeted us at the door and welcomed us in. I enjoy supporting small business and it is a plus to meet the owners as well. I've been craving a gyro all month and finally caved in. (Sliding scale "vegan" here) My gyro was filled with delicious meat. Yummy yummy. Every bite was full of flavor. The meat was tender and not dry. I also tried the fries, cheese sticks, and brownie.

The staff was friendly and I recommend leaving them a honorable tip for their hard work. Best gyros downtown!

1st time in Chicago and was determined to eat my 1st Chicago hot dog, while visiting.

I saw Jimmy’s from across the street as we were headed to Willis Tower.

We stopped in after our visit and we just missed a food tour, we ended up having the whole place to ourselves.

It was delicious as expected. Staff was friendly and seemed to get a kick out of my enthusiasm for my first Chicago dog.

It was a great find in the city and I felt it was just as authentic as you could get anywhere.

This place is small, and can easily get overlooked, so keep your eyes peeled for small restaurant that is big on Chicago taste.

Hole-in-the-wall restaurant close to many popular tourist attractions in the city. Inside area is quite narrow with stools around the perimeter for indoor dining. Menu is simple and features classic grill and gyro favorites. Food is quickly served after being freshly made on the grill. Prices are a bit high due to location but this spot always pulls through when in need of some late night grub.

Really good very small local gyro and sandwich shop. Got the lamb gyro and the wet beef sandwich and ate them there. Not a lot of counter space not really a dine in experience, probably more of a take-out joint. Definitely a great place to stop and try the local ethnic foods.
The catfish is always on point I would have liked my gizzards a little bit harder but other than that it's some good tasting food

Wings and fries with lemon pepper 🔥🥵 also I've had the catfish nuggets with fries from here it's super good and it's opened late 🔥 y'all never disappoint me
Edit: I also tried the shrimp and fries with extra lemon pepper 🔥🔥🔥 one of my favorites
They were very professional & service was quick. They are open late which is a bonus after a hard night of partying
Chicken too expensive but other than that , food is good. Just call before you pull up.
Food is great
Meat and rice weren’t cooked properly. The lettuce was brown and the guacamole was grey. Friendly staff but terrible food.
Great staff. Very clean. Was fast and efficient. Only complaint is my rice was a little undercooked and hard. Might have just been a bad batch? Other than that, awesome!
This location sucks! Super rude staff and they wait until there's almost out of something before they refill the pans, in turn barely putting any toppings on your order.
This might be my favorite Chipotle location. They keep the food fresh and hot, there’s always a seat, and it’s very clean. Plus, the staff is some of the friendliest I’ve ever interacted with. :)
Clean and nice staff. I have been able to get in and out fast. They once ran out of the tops for the bowls but figured out how to make it work. Good problem solving!

Went to this place and ordered the combination plate. There was barely any meat there. The whole plate was full of plain bland white rice. The lady at the counter also made my order Togo after I specifically told her it is to stay. Then I asked her for some sauce for my plain rice and she said they are out. Do not recommend this place and also will not go back there myself. Just like the prior review said this place is perfect for those single cab drivers.

Limited options for vegans. As others have said, it's a very good value for the money. The chana masala I had was basic, but it was served up almost immediately and was a HUGE pile of food. It could easily have been 4 cups of rice with 3 cups of chickpeas and sauce. I hate to leave food on my plate, but eating it all would've been something out of an episode of man vs. food.

Cheap food!  And you get A LOT for your money.   Nicer (and it's relative here) than Flaming Wok n Grill.  Open late.  Typically taxi drivers' stop for food.  At least it's convenient and did I say cheap?
Food is great. They have booth Indian as well as Pakistani cousine. Praying facilities inside. good and cool service. Pool tables available.

Food was good, Portions were generous, price was right. Service was a little slow, but guy behind the counter was friendly. I wasn't I a rush so it was everything I hoped it would be. I would definitely go back.

The atmosphere says it all! Walking into the shop you'll get your classic Chicago style hotdog station vibes, and the food does not disappoint.

I walked in there 20 minutes before they were about to close without knowing and they let me eat inside as they were closing. They weren't as** about it.

This is definitely a good restaurant, and I would say that it is like Portillo’s because they both have various comfort foods that are both really delicious. I've been regularly going here for the past few months, and I've noticed a lot of things about this restaurant. The whole place is always clean and bright. The ambiance is definitely just something comfy and casual. What I like about this place is the fact that they have great customer service. The staff here are really polite and friendly and will gladly help with anything I could ask for. The food is also served fast, and not only fast because the food is also served fresh and hot. The flavors were definitely amazing, and it is exactly the type of food that I would want to order if I was disappointed or something, because it is indeed a comfort food. The food is really nice and somehow huge. The prices are reasonable and definitely just the regular price for every food item they have. This restaurant is just basically a good one, and there are really a lot of foods to try, and one thing is for sure, everything is delicious.
Great local spot for hot dogs, burgers, gyros and more. Service is quick and friendly. Pricing is super reasonable

I do some work for a local management company and stop here for a bite every time I'm around.  The place has the vintage Chicago pictures with Agean and Greek scenery that give it a fun Chicago vibe without being corny.  The guys that work there are fun and again, have a bit if old school Chicago charm.  I always get the hot Italian beef because, I'll be honest, it's just the best.  It's piled with spicy peppers, cheese and beef that just tastes special.  I do request extra juice on the side because I like ny sandwich soaking.  The fries are crispy and delicious.  My coworker today go the cheeseburger and kept saying how good it was at work.  My boss got the gyro which he orders about twice a week because he says its 'da bomb.'  I'm a native Chicagoean so Italian beefs and polish sausages have been part of my life since birth... However this place is special.  Check it out and tell them Mike sent you...  That won't get you anything but tell them anyway.
Meat had decent flavor, otherwise worst gyro I've ever had, there was no lettuce or tomato on it, and no spicy sauce besides wings hot sauce. Overall mids quality.

I really wanted to like this place, especially based on some decent reviews by some of our friends.

I pass by almost every day and only recently checked it out. It was one of those freezing cold Chicago evenings and the place was nearly empty but for a few staff and another couple. the atmosphere could have felt pretty cool, but it just felt a bit empty.

The staff was friendly and the service was prompt. The Menu is a little odd - it makes me think of the little papers that came with the Clue board game. Regardless, we were able to agree on several rolls.
The first roll that came out was not appetizing - something in it tasted like it had been in the fridge too long. The other two rolls were just Ok.
In the end, the experience was a bit abysmal and the prices were too high.

Fine sushi and quality service, makes for a great dining experience. I usually go for the pick up, they're quick to provide, or for the evening sushi date. Unassuming exterior but  go on in for a unique Pan-Asian experience.

I've been here twice, and really enjoyed the food both times. I had never had good sushi before and just thought I didn't like it; Usagi Ya changed my mind! Things I'd easily order again: beef tataki (every time -- this stuff is incredible), godzilla maki, fireball maki, snowball maki. The gyoza was super warm and tasty, but not mind blowing. I wasn't a fan of the peking duck -- it  just was not what I was expecting (little pancake rolls filled with duck). Anything else I've had there (a couple rolls I can't recall) was good, just not memorable.

Positives:
- Nice contemporary funky decor
- $20 for $40 worth of food via Amazon Local

Negatives:
- Sub-par food even for a "second tier" restaurant.  My steak was grey (frozen prior to cooking?) and sushi was only marginally better than that from Walgreens.
- Poor service, as the manager refused to let us and our friends sit at one table, because our friends had a different coupon from Groupon.  The manager still seated us close to each other, but at separate tables - a solution which did not prevent us from sitting virtually together, but showed poor customer service and bad decision-making on behalf of the staff.

Conclusion: There are other higher quality and cheaper sushi restaurants to go to (e.g. Wasabi Cafe - $20 buffet includes sashimi).

Usagi ya is great!  Delicious food, fresh sushi, and a cool, laid-back atmosphere. I've been here only twice, each experience has been wonderful.  I was introduced by my friend to the beef tataki appetizer, which is marinated beef, pretty much served rare.  OMG, I fell in love with it.  I find myself having cravings for beef tataki....it's so tasty and has a spicy kick.  I will definitely have to come back to try more of their dishes and sushi!
Hands down one of the best customer experiences I’ve ever had. The owner Andy is a peach, the food is fantastic and the atmosphere is homey.
We had such a lovely experience. The food was delicious. Small intimate setting but very well worth trying.

I have ordered from La Gondola for years. Tonight I ordered a pizza from a third party as we have moved too far for delivery service. When I opened the pizza not only was the pizza undercooked but there was hair all over the inside of the pizza box and on the pizza. When I called La Gondola I was told there was nothing they could do for me since I ordered from a third party and that next time I should order directly from them. Extremely disappointing and I will not be ordering again.

You cannot beat the BOGO Lasagna on Mondays. For the price, it’s well worth it, although I do wish it was a bit more flavorful. I wouldn’t let that stop you from trying it though! Plenty of sauce and the meal comes with bread and soup or salad. We also ordered the fried calamari which was good, not too fried or heavy. Tasted fresh and good texture. Alejandra was our server. She was great very attentive and checked in frequently. The restaurant is smaller than expected but seems clean. Looked like there were a lot of takeout orders so I bet their delivery is good too! Might make this a regular Monday outing

La Gondola catered the holiday party for my condo building and everyone raved about the food!  We had so many compliments about it all night. We ordered the Rigatoni alla Boscaiola, Sausage & Peppers, Gnocchi al Pesto, Chicken Parmigiana, Caesar Salad, and the Mini Cannoli and Brownie Bites. The Sausage & Peppers was the first to go, followed by the Chicken Parm. My personal favorite was the Rigatoni alla Boscaiola. I've tried a lot of entrees on their menu, but never this, and I'm so glad I did. I have to order that again! The gnocchi was amazing too. You'll want some Italian bread to clean all the sauce from your plate. The salad was so fresh, and one guest told me he doesn't eat salad, but he ate that salad because it was so good. And the dessert?! People were loading plates with cannoli and smuggling brownie bites out in napkins to take home with them. There was more than enough food for the headcount we gave them, and delivery was on-time and easy. The driver even called ahead to tell me they were on their way. I highly recommend La Gondola for your catering needs. You will not be disappointed!
The manager here is very rude has very dry lips and yells at her employees in front of customers
Always wrong with the order busy or not even just asking simple things

Omg Nikki is the best ever! So sweet and bubbly! And she has the order memorized for almost everyone who steps through the door in the morning. I’ve picked up coffee for my husband a handful of times and I don’t even know what his order is. I just tell her it’s coffee for that tall guy and she knows exactly who I’m talking about, lol.  It’s such a great start to my day when she takes my order :-)
Used to be a good place... now Ghetto.. you can feel the hate when you order. They don't even talk..just stare at the register.

This is hands down the best Dunkin' Donuts! Best customer service I've ever had, Antoine is just a sunshine always cheerful and most of all pays special attention to anything he serves you!!! No matter how rough your day is always better after leaving!

Great place with delicious food. The prices for the drinks are a little steep but you’re paying for the location. The food is extremely flavoured and well cooked. The staff are nice and the venue is clean and curated

Food is good, and staff are friendly. I like taco Tuesdays bc you can mix and match any tacos for $3 per taco. The steak taco is good but greasy the last time I ordered it. I also like the Brisket and cauliflower tacos.

I came here for dinner with a couple friends and it was really nice. We sat outside but the inside seemed to have a good ambience, nothing too fancy. I got the mezcal cocktail, it was great. And I also got the steak, which we agreed was the best out of the dishes we ordered. The salsa is mole style and was not my favorite, but preference. Also the queso fun dido with tortillas and chips is the way to go!William was our server and he did a great job with everything. Easily split our bills, which can be a not so easy process at some places in the city. Definitely will be going back!

Sat at the bar and had the watermelon margarita and the pork belly tacos. The tacos were alright, nothing incredible, and the margarita was good. Overpriced given the portion size, but this is also a more expensive restaurant area so keep that in mind.

Biggest flaw for me was that the bar was so insanely loud that you can barely hear yourself think, and I couldn't stay longer than 20-25 minutes. Luckily the bar service was quite fast!

The service was understandably slow for a busy Friday night and the food was almost perfect. My tacos were a little dry but nothing some of the chefs homemade salsa couldn’t fix. The outdoor seating was great on a warmer night and the ambience and declarative patio were a delight. The food was timely and well portioned and overall a great night. I recommend the roasted potatoes as a filling side.

Very bad service! Tables unclean and didn't care to hand us menus. We got water with no cups and after 10 min decided this place needs a lot of help. You can always tell when waitstaff is overwhelmed. You could see in her eyes she was past overwhelmed and now was at the point of stop Caring as she slowly walked to remake coffee and looked in our direction.  I would have empathy if there had been more than five tables that have people.

Never written a Google + review, but every aspect of this experience was terrible. Very average brunch food took over an hour (with one other party in the joint) and the waitress gave a half-assed apology while taking even longer for the check, needless to say there was no discount offered of any sort.

Don't be fooled by its scrubby below-sidewalk appearance. Their Mexican-influenced brunch dishes are plentiful and well put together, and the service is not too badgery. Perfect for a long brunch with your friends. Sit out on the patio before it gets too cold!

Extremely long wait time for food, and some sketchy characters in there. The area behind the counter was very messy and while we were in there, the staff asked two patrons (they must have known) to run to the store and buy bread, rolls, and prosciutto. So the groceries our food was cooked with were purchased by some random people who could have done anything to it. Overall, it was not a clean or organized place.

Terrible service, inattentive waitstaff, inedible food. Worst breakfast I've had in my life, I didn't even think it was possible to screw breakfasts up so bad. After a lack of being asked about my meal, I called the waiter over to tell him my chilaquiles were inedible, and my mom's pancakes rubbery and difficult to cut. We got charged full price and were provided with coupons for free sandwiches, as if I'm going to come back.
I can currently only speak to the breakfast burritos, but they are phenomenal. Can't wait to try more of the menu ASAP!!
Amazing food! The tacos are incredible and the Gordita is delicious. I highly recommend anyone in Chicago come here.

As of Nov 27 2021, they are totally CLOSED on Sat & Sun.
Very good food and super friendly staff...
but this place closes early almost every night.
The business hours on Google are wrong. The business hours listed on the front door are not adhered to. Call before you go so you're not left standing outside a locked door like I have been multiple times.

I am usually not a breakfast person. Had a bacon breakfast burrito that was excellent. The food was hot when we got it, tasted delicious and the sauces were spot on. Francisco and his team did a stellar job with their product. Will be revisiting soon.

The food is just okay, I was hungry and already paid. The cheeses offered were shredded mozzarella and cheddar...at a Mexican spot. (shrug)  I got the veggie tacos, and the cooked veggies were not seasoned at all and slightly under cooked. Not al dente. The rice and beans were the best part of the meal.
the food isnt as bad as the outside of the restaurant looks

I ordered the spider roll there several weeks ago. Taste good comparing with other sushi restaurants. I am sure that they improved their quality of food and services after they read the comments from years ago. Will go there again and try their buffet. Honestly, I think the price for lunch buffet is still very reasonable as an economist point of view.

They have great "all you can eat" sushi options for lunch and dinner reasonably priced.  Sushi isnt awesome but it isn't terrible.  I love that they offer noodles, salad, and side options included in the "all you can eat".  BYOB is most definatly the highlight!

The only negatives are that they charge you $1 for every piece of sushi you do not eat.  They  also pack their rolls with rice making you more full then usual so keep this in mind.

Mine and my daughters favorite spot. Love the all you can eat menu, my 3 year old loves all of the appetizers included in the all you can eat menu. So many great choices.
So sad :( they have been close for some time now. I hope they will be coming back!

All you can eat sushi for twenty bucks is pretty legit. You have to pay for what you don't eat, i think it's like a buck. They are strict on it as long as they see you tried. The best thing here is the Ichiban roll, it's a must try.

I LOOOOOOOOOVE this place! I make all of my non-sushi eating friends a believer with this establishment! Large variety, affordable and can definitely compete and surpass the top sushi spots in Chicago. All -You - Can - Eat menu is awesome. I can't go anywhere else after trying this place!
Truly a fan! Thanks!
Their wings are usually on point. Got a beef the other day, wanted one so bad, but their meet was so pale. I never seen that anywhere before. I didn't eat.

They have the best Beefs in Chicago... honestly speaking. I'd travel just for a beef and fries. I love their mild sauce. If you want food that's considered "Chicago food", go there and get a beef and fries.

Before I could complete my order they hung up on me while I was giving them my order & when I called back went to Vm mail my first and last ordering at this location & I heard the food is good when certain cook is there.
They use to be nice back in the days I bought a steak sandwich in which was dry as hell
Good food. Customer service is great
Ordered the 10 piece wings for 18.99 and all I got was wings from a Cornish hen. A newborn baby can eat these . Should have followed my first mind and went next door!
I love the grilled chicken salad. I order one about 3 days per week. The garlic chicken salad is to die for also. The entire menu looks delightful. Take my word for it! 👍🏽❤💯

The Cashier Are Very Welcoming And Also The Security Officer Name Sgt. Lewis The Homemade Lemonades Are To Die For And The Chicken Is Cooked To Perfection With Fresh Oil By The Cook Name George,The Restaurant Is Clean And Spacious They Stay Open Late For My Connivence Which Is A Plus. And Accepts All Forms Of Payments.😃
Turkey Burger was dry and didn't have any flavor. A waste of money. Food was cold upon delivery. My first and last time ordering from this restaurant. HORRIBLE  !!
Hello,It's nice too see some of the Food courts still Open on the South Side!and the take out was made just like you Ordered!

Should have read the reviews saying the chicken is good EXCEPT for the chicken sandwich which I got and almost got sick.
But the one star review is for them letting a homeless person come in and shake me down for food.
That should fly IN THE RESTAURANT. They want to ask me for food or cash outside that's fine but don't let them block the entrance and demand food

I visited this location Monday.   The food was excellent. The chicken was beautiful,  fresh and delicious 😋.   Well, I wish this was the end of my story.  I returned Tuesday expecting another wonderful meal.  Omg, I couldn't belive this was the same restaurant.   I had to check the sign on the door to be sure I was in the right place.   The food was poorly prepared and the size and look of the chicken was atrocious.  Then I remethat Tuesday's are their special day.  If thus is the reason for bad service and food we will gladly forgo the cheap chicken Tuesday.
Best spicy chicken tenders to date. We were in Chicago and just wanted some chicken. As I was eating I realized I was NOT getting spicy chicken I should be getting in my home state. Great job!
Southern crispy fried chicken with a spicy option, jalapeños, tasty mashed potatoes and gravy, cole slaw, tasty mini fried shrimp to go. Always efficient and fast.

Highly priced fast food place - based on what I ate here. I mean I know this is just another fast food place and I’m not supposed to expect healthy etc stuff but it could be a bit tastier for what I paid I think. The mashed potato was good. The chicken was a bit too dry. Wish it was a lil juicier. The place was alright to be a fast food place. KFC is cheaper and in my opinion - way better because It’s juicy atleast.

I went and placed my order at the drive thru one of my item was a bacon egg and cheese croissant WITHOUT CHEESE…. I get home and the sandwiches is not what I ordered ( picture ) i called and spoke to a girl who i informed of this error she told me i was able to pick up a brand new sandwich  however i told her i was unable right away because i had to go i to work if later on that day was ok. She responded with yes “ILL LEAVE A NOTE WITH YOUR NAME ON IT FOR THEN TO MAKE IT WHEN YOU COME BACK “.  I went back later that night and told them  of the situation and was told they had no note or knew anything of it , yesenia was very polite about telling me this information,  at this point its not about the 5$ the sandwich cost. Its about the time  wasted with employees who dont take responsibility of their mistakes.  Def not coming here again and this is “supposed to be the best dunkin for midway airport “

They spend to much time on the drive thru customers. Meanwhile there I was with three other people behind me waiting inside. One girl was cleaning around the coffee dispensers righting front of us without even acknowledging that we were there. I had to say something about them taking our orders to get us out of there. You guys need to do better with customer service for your inside customers. Don't just have us standing there while there is applicable employees that can take our orders.

Went through the drive thru and got a latte with whipped cream. To my defense I am a regular ol iced coffee or hot coffee but wanted to try something different. The associate was very polite and patient. There was no wait..I was in and out. DD for the win!

Goofy girls in the morning were running low on iced coffee. So instead of changing it out they tried putting decaf in my iced coffee that I ordered with 2 shots of espresso in it. Kinda defeats the purpose of paying for espresso shots. They remade it but ended up giving me no ice when I asked for light ice. It's not rocket science girls. Fet it together! 7-23-22 5:10am
Very slow express lane. Express lane was very dirty and full of debris. I asked for the senior discount, did not get it. No straw for my iced tea. No napkin for my sticky donut.

If I could give zero stars I would . I Went here today and bought 10pc crispy chicken and OMG it was DISGUSTING  . Worst chicken I have ever tried !!! It tasted rotten I literally couldn’t take another bite after the first 🤮🤮🤮🤮🤮 waste of my hard earned money ! Tried calling and speaking to a responsible worker bt they kept hanging up on me ! People buy your chicken else where !
My bucket order with sides was not cooked fresh. It literally came from a microwave
The chicken is good. Go for the family combos they are worth the price. I especially like the chicken pot pies when they actually have it in stock.

Very  clean and friendly  staff
Food was hot and good
On the border KFC was pretty good, we were the only ones there but food was over all satisfying and service was decent.

Very good bar / restaurant with awesome outdoor seating in their rooftop. They've got quite an extensive beer selection that you can order in a tasting if you'd like. There's also a giant menu of food. During my visit I had the fried cauliflower and the fried green beans which were both excellent. Heads up that that chipotle mayo is quite spicy. My wife ordered the Mad Hatter which she said was very good. It can get quite packed during game days, so show up early to make sure you get a seat.

9/2022 5*  Food was fantastic.  Our server Zoe was amazing.  She did awesome!  Mac & Cheese Empanadas were great.  My Build a Burger was crazy good.  And the Fiesta Fields Salad was tremendous.  The spice on the chicken was a little much for our taste.  But overall we would order it again.  Almost tried the Fried Oreos, but we were just too full!  We will be back again for sure!

Absolutely loved it!
We ordered our drinks which were decent. The food was better than we expected. We ordered shrimp starters and we loved it so much that we ordered the same shrimp but as a sandwich for our entree. Spicy chipotle chicken salad was too good. It was hot but then was going so well with the margarita. Price wise it was a good deal spl the drinks. P.S. the photos were clicked after eating half of it. So the portion size for entrees is big :). They have a terrace sitting which elevates the food and the good drinks combo.

I go here often and their food is always good, their Fiesta salad is my favorite. I never crave salad but this one I do! Their burgers and sandwiches are really good too. Friendly laid-back atmosphere.

Great place to visit and get some good tasting food.
I don't recommend the elote, it is not the typical street corn served at Mexican food carts.  Good drink selection, service was friendly and polite.
Restaurant windows were wide open for fresh air.

Tables were pretty sticky, might be the coating mixed with cleaner spray.

Rooftop wait was about an hour and packed towards 6pm.

This place is a hidden gem. The food was so good I came back for seconds. The tacos were delicious, and the Al pastor was easily the best. We also got one with cheese and pepper and it was also very good. Our meal came with a soup which was a nice touch. The staff was also extremely friendly.

Very authentic. Fresh ingredients. Service is consistently out of this world. Worth every penny.

Try the burrito dinner.
Solid local Mexican food joint.  Burrito has great flavor, but was not filled all the way. Rice had good flavor and sauce a fair bit of kick. Will be back.  Bring cash!

I wish I had taken a picture but we ate everything in such a hurry that you’ll have to take our word for it. My partner got four tacos of different varieties all of which he said were phenomenal. I got the steak chimichanga burrito and as someone who never eats burritos I can’t believe I’ve been missing out if this is what the standard is. Crunchy flavorful combined with the guacamole was just great.
The guacamole and chips were delicious but could use a little seasoning other than that no complaints and will 100% be back. Oh! Their verde is delicious :)

Really great prices and open up late.  I really enjoyed the al pastor tacos.  The pozole comes in a HUGE size with a bunch of condiments, and once it cools down, is absolutely delicious.  The restaurant is cash only but they have an ATM

Spacious and interesting place. They accommodated us as a group of 6 plus 2 kids. Fast service, good Irish coffee. Few vegan options ( we needed it at that time) and I can freely say that vegan burger was great! The others from the group looked satisfied too. Prices were ok.
Tip: it looks like a library so if you like to take some interesting photos- try this place out

Large Irish neighborhood pub serving up all of the traditional dishes but also new American fare with a lot of great cocktails to choose from.

Came here on a Friday and it was completely slammed, but our server Grace was super friendly and everything came out quick.

Food:
Definitely order the artichoke dip,(pic) it was amazing and I would've eaten a gallon of it.

We also ordered the burger and Ruben and both were so good and would order again. We paired them with two spicy margs a piece.

The food was really good and the portions were massive (you could split any of the entrees and still have plenty of food). Classic American fare. The server was really timely and professional. The sweet potato fries were suuuuper good — really crispy.
It was very dark inside, difficult to read the QR code menu sign, difficult to even see your food. So I personally prefer a place with nicer lighting.
There is bar seating but it fills up quickly at night! This place is always packed every time I walk by.

Huge restaurant with great service! We all enjoyed our dishes and would like to come back to try more- especially desserts. I got the blackened chicken club and would recommend! Plus would definitely recommend switching to sweet potato fries if that’s your jam!

Stopped by during our Chicago trip while visiting Lakeview.  I remember when this place opened 12 plus years ago when I used to live down the street it was good then and still good today.  It's a big restaurant and bar and has outside seating.  I was happy to remember it and happy it was still around.  I had the ruben with fries and both were good and enjoyed how the fries were cooked.  Spouse had the burger and friend had the curry.   You probably can't go wrong with any dish.

Super nice service and huge menu featuring all your favorite Cantonese dishes!  I was pleased to see they had a lunch menu with 30+ items that cost less than $10 after tax.  I got the beef with rice noodles “gan chao niu he” and it was cooked accordingly- plenty of beef with thick rice noodles stir fried with veggies.
We ordered salt and pepper,  shrimp, pork chops,  soft shell crabs along with pork fried rice with pineapple. Everything was delicious!

Worst Chinese  food I’ve ever had and I’ve had food poisoning before in college from egg Fu young . We ordered $80 worth of take out. Duck included it was dry and gross. The chow fun was wet and weird eggplant super sweet and done all wrong no garlic was even attempted to be chopped  very disappointing.
This is a hidden gem for Chinese foods in the northside of Chicago. Definitely order the salt and pepper smelt fish, very crispy.

I have always liked this place.
Crispy smelt, fish fillet with bitter melon and pork chop are my favorites...The staff are nice
Crew is nice. Jessica is Great to the staff and others as wells. Lots of smiles whenever I go. Just very busy at various parts of the day

Consistently terrible. Never get my order right. They don’t even know about their own seasonal drinks. Always feel rushed to order even when there is no line. All employees sound like they have an attitude when you order.

I went through the drive thru This morning and when I was paying with my card the young lady was on her phone texting.  This made me uncomfortable because I don't know if they are taking a picture of my card or just texting with someone but that card is my personal info.  They shouldn't be on their phones anyway when working.  It was extremely busy and there was a long line behind me.  I'll be watching my account for any discrepancies.  If any I'll know from where.   They use to have awesome staff there but now it's lousy.  Not the same at all.   Is it still the same owner?  Whoever is in charge needs to start hiring competent people.

I hate to have to do this, but is this place actually open 24hrs like it says online? I come here from 2:30-45am to get my coffee right before I start work, and I just stand there waiting for a response soon to realize nobody is here, and this is not the first time its happened. I could use some coffee throughout my shift since this is the only Dunkin closer to my job, but this place should follow up on its time schedule depending on what it says online.

Try your best to avoid this one specific dunkin it sometimes would say it's open but the workers inside say it's closed while still having mobile order enabled.

This place also does not know how to make espresso drinks so if that's what you're looking for don't expect it here they won't tell you but they'll make it look like what you wanted but it's not expresso just straight coffee

Lastly the last three different times I've came to this dunkin I would order something as simple as a blueberry doughnut and instead I would end up with something different. I wasn't even asked if I wanted a different choice of doughnut and the manager just told them to give me a random doughnut.

So please do not go here it's not worth the hassle or the money

A whole in the wall Cuban coffee + sandwich shop located right off of the busy street of Ida B. Wells tucked inside of a hostel. If you don’t know about this place you will miss this hidden gem that is frequented by college students and travelers alike. Equipped with wifi and Cuban coffee for a perfect place to get work done and eat if you’re hungry. I ordered the Ropa Vieja sandwich that has marinated steak and plantains inside of it and let me tell you — it’s 10/10 perfectly savory and sweet. Also ordered the jerk sandwich that had the perfect amount of spice to it.

This place place does not disappoint and is incredibly inexpensive. Each sandwich is under $10 and huge portion sizes. I can’t wait to come back here again!
Good Cuban food in Chicago. It is a drop in and drop out kind of place. Fast service with a welcoming staff. The restaurant could use some croquetas to compliment the selections.

Seriously, yum!

The restaurant is located inside of a hostel and is on the smaller side but the food is GREAT. I went for breakfast in the morning since it was close to my hotel. I ordered the huevos habaneros. SO tasty! Be sure to ask for the hot sauce. Very cost efficient and a great way to start the morning 😊

Noticed I was right by Cafecito around lunchtime and decided to stop by; I have been to their other location but not this one. Both are hole-in-the-wall style as they are connected to other buildings. Their menu boasts a variety of cuban eats as well as classic cafe staples. Their chivito sandwich is one of the best sandwiches I’ve ever eaten and the caldo gallego is delicious. Unassuming ambiance but staff are super friendly at both locations and the food rivals much more expensive restaurants. Great to grab a bite for lunch or a chill spot to get some work done.

This was the BEST cafecito I’ve ever had. That being said the food definitely fell short. The meat just seemed a little subpar. Cubans and Palomilla were the meat offenders, didn’t really enjoy either one. The cafecito is responsible for 2 of the 3 stars and the other one is because the service was good.

Ordered for the first time yesterday. Order total was 36.47. Fried ravioli arrived burnt with marinara sauce covering everything. Fried Mozz arrived soggy and soaked in sauce. Cheeseburgers arrived without cheese and were not "medium rare". They were dry and burnt throughout. Tasted like day-old dry food. (I added photos). Garlic bread was stale and had barely any butter OR garlic flavor. After contacting the restaurant the owner said he would approve a refund if I called Grubhub. When I called Grubhub the representative called the manager and at that point he only agreed to a 50% refund. He misinformed me and was clearly just trying to avoid making up for his business' mistake. That is bad business.

I tried this restaurant  twice now it its quite a special place, perhaps not the best managed place but still very tasty. I have tried their brick oven pizza and its very good the wood gives the bread, cheese, meats a different flavor. I have also not had 2 of their double cheeseburgers with everything and they are delicious. They use fresh beef, with onion, lettuce, tomato, mustard, ketchup, mayo; the meat is cooked medium well super juicy...so the ingredients atop the burger including the cheese mix and blend in together with the beef drippings making it a damn good burger. I recommend this place. Next I will try the steak sandwich.

Delicious large portions at a great price. The wood oven pizza is on par with the more trendy restaurants at a fraction of the price. We've also ordered from their catering menu and the food was well prepared and packaged and ready on time. Don't forget to try their canolis.

A simple Italian restaurant that offers a good assortment of pastas, brick-over pizzas, salads, paninis, sandwiches, and even breakfast!  We decided to stop by for dinner and ordered the lasagna, margherita pizza, and soups (chicken rice with lemon and a ravioli soup).  Even though I was expecting the lasagna to have meat, it was still very good and filling.  It would be great if an option with meat was offered.  The margherita pizza was delicious with a slightly-burnt and toasty crust.  The soups were a bit on the salty side.  Overall, it was a satisfying dinner and I would visit again, maybe build my own pasta.

Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken and mozzarella cheese baked on top! I'm very picky when it comes with alfredo sauce, I usually make it fresh, this is a close second. I've tried other things on their menu and am never disappointed

First visit, celebrating our wedding anniversary. Loved it, great food, prices, friendly staff and plenty of street parking. Eclectic background music and great drink assortment. My wife is of Scottish background so we’re somewhat familiar with British meals. Can’t wait to return for the Friday fish n’ chips!

When we walked through the door and could hear a British accent coming from a customer in the corner, I knew I was in an authentic British pub. It was my Mothers Day outing with my son. The drinks were excellent. Our appetizer, the Deluxe Gravy Chips, was to die for. We had royal pies with perfectly flaky crusts and delicious fillings. Mine was the Mushroom & Kale and his was the Chicken Balti. We both loved our selections! I would go back and bring others along!

The house burger is great. Two smash patties, cheddar, and some special stuff going on. I like to keep it pure on this one--no ketchup or mustard. And the chips (fries) are perfectly crispy on the outside and soft and delicious on the inside. Order with a side of mayo and definitely malt vinegar. Feeling like I'm in London.

Staff is easy going. Quiet atmosphere. I've enjoyed a book or two year once or twice here.

One bike stand out front. Ditch the car, burn off those dinner calories!

We went in on a Sunday during brunch and absolutely loved the vibe. They were busy, but the wait time was minimal even though we didn't have a reservation.

We started with a scotch egg to share and it was absolutely perfectly crispy on the outside and soft in the inside. The stone ground mustard paired really nicely with it. We both ordered the chicken sandwich and MAN was it good. The curry sauce on the side for dipping our fries in was also a stellar addition.

To drink, I ordered the royal milk tea. I absolutely loved it and wish more restaurants and coffee shops made their tea like this because if I could have this every day, I absolutely would.

Had a wonderful brunch experience. There are two rooms, each with its unique character with sunny, big windows. We ordered the steak and ale pie and fried chicken sandwich, which came with pickled zucchini! The chai latte was so fragrant from the spices they used.

Highly recommend.

I hate to review a place that I've only been to once, but the service here was horrendous. Went here on a Sunday night before a concert and when I went in the place only had 3 or 4 people. I knew something was off when the greeter pointed to the back and said "sit over there". Then I had to wait for a menu... 5 minutes goes by and a group of 3 comes in and gets a menu and water right away. So I flag down the waitress and had to ask. I had to flag her down again when I wanted to order since she just kept walking by me. I got the food relatively quickly but the order was wrong, and I never got options for side salad dressing. I was in a rush so I didn't bother taking it back, and to their credit it was very tasty.

Had to wait and wait long after someone else took my plates before flagging the waitress again for the check.. only to wait some more when they apparently forgot to get it. Finally got it (after the group of 3 had finished and walked out) but she forgot the pen. I might give them another chance since it seems like the staff were just completely new to the business, but other reviews here say otherwise. Given that I enjoyed the food I might give this place a second chance, but I don't know when that will be.

We stumbled upon this place while looking for something to eat near the Green Mill. The food was really good and fresh. The service was really nice and the serve was very friendly. I highly recommend this place. The appetizers ranged from $4-$8 and the traditional entrées ranged from $12-$17, but they did have a few steaks in the $25 range. I had the app sampler and it was fantastic. I also had the lamb kabobs and they were super tender, cooked perfectly, and more than I could eat.

Ask for Nick, the bartender. Order any old-school cocktail you want. It will be one of the best you've ever had. Also a terrific NEW menu with tons of vegetarian options. New pool table! Great for watching sports. Great for small and medium parties. A hidden gem!

Went for a special event during the day (I understand regular hours do NOT include lunch). Buffet included salads beautifully presented, hummus and pitas, stuffed grape leaves, chicken nuggets (roasted), and two types of rice. Owners were welcoming.

Unfortunately, I cannot give this place 5 stars. The service was really, really slow the night we were there. It took 15 minutes just to get a drink order in. They may have been short staffed this night, but the restaurant was not even half-full when we were there. Would I try again? Yes. Everything else was good. The food was delicious. Everything tasted fresh and was seasoned well. The drinks were also good. They have a full bar and several specialty cocktails to choose from.They also have a patio and the windows slide open, so there is several seating options if you want to enjoy a nice summer evening.

This is our go-to place for tamales on the northwest side. The food is good, the prices are cheap, and the staff is friendly. They have different tamales every day, but when you go you always leave with something. Their chicken quesadillas are very good, too. Tamales Garibay has tamales like chicken mole, broccoli and cheese, etc. I would recommend this as a great place for tamales in Chicago!

They have the best tamales I have had anywhere at a really good price--no more than $3 for one, and I think you can get two for 5. They're also really big, well worth the money. The decor is nothing fancy but once you taste the food you'll be glad you went!

Sometimes you have to go all the way to the southside to find good tamales. I am glad i found this spot. great meat and veggy options!!. They are extra big tamales compare to the regular, When you pass by the storefront you may think it may not be a good place but their tamales are great!!
Garibay has the freshest Tamales and Burritos around. Not a very glamorous location but  this family owned business makes it all worthwhile.

This place WAS an awesome tamale stand, but sadly they are no longer there.
THIS LOCATION IS CLOSED.

The food is soooooo good!!! We only ordered off the appetizer list and were full to contentment. They are extremely accommodating and take into account all food sensitivity and allergies.  We had the seadoned Tofu ( I don't usually like but delish), the cauliflower, the crispy potatoes, the avocado hummus, and the beignets. Everything was heavenly. To top it off, my friend is dairy free gluten free and they had a special dessert not on the menu that was reserved solely for her peeps 😁😁😁. Highly recommended!!!

I like Gideon Sweet. I've gone a couple times now for appetizers and cocktails which are great. They seem to have a good bar program here. My plan is to return this summer to experience the outside patio and dinner!

I honest hate to give low reviews,  but the food just isn't there. The waitor suggested 6-8 plates to share for my date and I, but how do you share a 3in tostada? Or a single meatball and a 1/4 papadum? Food was pretty bland and we ended up getting pizza around the corner.
Now closed for renovations and a relaunch under a new name but was a great place for some food and drinks. Great service from the staff.

Great food.  Great atmosphere. Great times. My wife and I dined here and split 3 "plates."  The sweet pea risotto, the rabbit schnitzel, and the filet stroganoff. We also had dessert. She got the root beer float, I got the banana split.  We also had cocktails.  Everything was cooked to perfection.  And our night was made perfect with Graham Elliot visiting our table and taking pictures!  When it was all said and done, we spent $110.  A little steep for some perhaps, but well worth a great night on the town.

Great experience all around! My wife and I had dinner here to celebrate our 18yr anniversary. We had our wedding at the South Shore Cultural Center so this was the perfect place to have dinner and celebrate. I requested the best table in the house and when we walked in they had placed a reserve sign on our table. The food was good and the waiter went out of her way to ensure we were having a good time. They brought out complimentary sparkling apple cider in tall champagne glasses for us and really dressed up the desert especially for us. It was quiet with a small crowd, good background music, the ambiance was romantic and the view was fantastic. Quality cuisine at affordable prices. Thank you for a making our evening special!

This is a nice restaurant in South Shore Cultural Center. The aesthetic is grand, the view to outside landscape is relaxing. I had salmon and spinach, which I very much enjoyed. Went with a few buddies to celebrate the anniversary of our fraternity crossing ceremony.
Nice place to enjoy with friends.
Food is just ok, but the place is beautiful, right on the lake. Definitely worth going

I went there about 2 weeks ago with my wife and son and the food was amazing. The decor was so romantic. We went on a Friday night and had a 7:45 pm reservation (which the last reservation is at 8). The place had just the right amount of people in it. I think there are less people toward closing hours which makes it more romantic. It seemed as though we were transported back to the 50's I should have had on a tux and she a lovely night gown. Unfortunatley we were unable to see the lake due to it being night. The service was bad at best but the food made us make a reservation again for tonight!

We came here for Father’s day brunch and it was absolutely perfect. The buffet options were tasty and the service was impeccable. Definitely recommend. But remember that it’s BYOB- so bring your own libations.

I went to this restaurant on 7/22/2022. This restaurant has the perfect vibe and employees for any time of the day. I went for lunch and had the chicken curry with sweet tea. Entrées automatically come with sides that was awesome as well. It was really good and I enjoyed the man who was serving me. Definitely coming back!!

Dined here during the Christmas holiday with my husband and father, and we were all happy with our choice to eat at this restaurant. The waitstaff was friendly and welcoming, the food was delicious and the overall ambiance was wonderful! Would gladly dine here again.

Food was good, drinks was ok  I like how they’re presented. We got a jerk chicken dinner and a red snapper fish (my girl said it wasn’t no meat on the fish it was all sticking to the skin, customer service was good until the lunch crowd really started coming in they seemed under staffed cause it was only one waitress and it took forever to get his attention to get the check

The jerk lamb is a MUST have. I ordered the appetizer. It was seasoned to perfection and cooked just right. I recommend medium. Tip: Get the jerk sauce on the side if you're unsure about your spice tolerance.
The jerk chicken entrée (pictured) was amazing. And finally the rum cake (pictured) with a shot of rum for a little extra mmph! There are no words. Chef's kiss. I would definitely recommend.
All around great experience. The service was excellent. The drinks... heavy pour. This place is a gem.
Great portions and the food was amazing! Stephanie the bartender was amazing and really made the dining experience awesome! They have really stepped it up here! Truly will recommend to everyone!

10 years and counting. That's how long I remember coming here on a weekly basis if not more. The owner is amazing, really knows his food and how to make us customers feel welcome. Crispy chicken sandwich, the gyros cheese burger, and of course all of the amazing wraps. I could eat here every day of the week, and not get tired of it. I've used their delivery service regularly or gone in to dine in. You'll love it either way.

To anyone ordering, they are re-modeling for the next 30 days!

This place is great. If you’re looking for a good burger and wing joint, this is the spot. Great halal food burgers and wings. Other great food as well, but that’s always what I enjoy from there.

Ordered wings, fries and burger, later in the afternoon, the guy who took my order was super rude. Food was okay but, his behaviour absolutely spoiled the mood and the environment.

To sum it up in one line: Run away and run fast!

This place made my entire meal for two to order in less than 10 minutes. The hummus wasn't quite to my taste but it was fresh and the pita was amazing. Even better, I got out under $20. I don't live around here anymore, but I will go back if I'm in town.
Been going here since it opened. The owner is one of the nicest guys you'll ever meet and is always very welcoming. The food is consistently great Chicago style fast food.

Never had Slice Factory pizza before. I’m very picky when it comes to pizza. I got the margherita pizza and one with the chicken, cilantro, red onions, habanero sauce and pineapple Sooooo good. Great Customer service, very friendly and nice. Will definitely come back! My husband got the supreme pizza and cheese fries. If I knew they have waffle fries I would get some too. He really liked the pizza and fries.

Late quick bite/dinner for my 7 yr old after a long afternoon. We ordered a slice of cheese pizza and he couldn't of been happier! He's a picky eater and he gave it 4 stars. The friendly staff was nice enough to cut it up in small pieces. Great for on the go, once in a while, quick bite!
This was our first visit. We got veggie and supreme slices. The slices are HUGE. We spent $14 for two slices. It’s a bang for the buck. It’s NY style and reminded us of Costco pizza which we love.
Ants in my drink. Don’t go here. Closed before I could get a refund.

Terrible food is not made fresh, the tenders are a chicken patty sliced into 7 pieces their boneless wings are small pieces of popcorn chicken, I don't even want the free slice they're offering. Save yourself some time and get anything else.

Have you ever had one of those days where you know you're not cooking all day? That's my day. So I figured I'd order some takeout that would last for lunch and dinner. I found this place on Grubhub and so glad I did. Super cheap. I ordered a gyro for lunch which comes with fries. Mozzarella sticks just to try them and a small pizza. No I'm not pregnant but as I started going I wanted to try EVERYTHING. It's perfect. That'll be lunch and maybe dinner tomorrow too ha! All of that only cost $20!! I tried a sliver or piece of everything for lunch and it was all delicious. Pizza crust was so soft and yummy. Great sauce very sweet. Gyro very tasty. It was delivered and quickly AND all still warm. I literally had a sliver of everything and am now full ha. I hope I'm not the only one who orders mass takeout to plan several meals. LAZY me ;)

In town for basketball tournament.  Came across this place. My wife and I tried a piece sausage pizza! It was amazing!! Also had the best pizza puff we ever had!! Finally had a great cheeseburger!! Great prices!!
I live quite close and order a two gyro special and chicken tenders, both are quite great! Their french fries are also really good, they also have pizza and burgers.
Friendly staff! And good junk food! I love the cheeseburger and the gyros! Pretty convenient location to me!
Gyro is frozen meat cold it only took 5 mins to make i see why not going there never my first and last time.

Nice brewery! I loved the fact that they had limited edition brews that you could only get at the brew house - it’s a nice touch and a definite bonus to beer tourists like me. Had a couple of different 6oz pours, so I could try a bunch of beers and not leave fuzzy headed - also nice when you’re a beer tourist.

They have a bunch of the bourbon county in bottles - a lot more than I realized they had even done. Well worth a visit.

I love all of the varieties of beers available here, it’s so fun to try all the ones you can only get at this location. The food they have is good too, but I wish they had more appetizer/small plate options. We got the cheese curds which were very good, perfectly crispy. I have yet to try a Goose Island beer I don’t like. I’m not usually a darker beer fan, but the bourbon barrel beers here are so good if you like a stronger beer.

I mostly visited to try the local variants of Bourbon County. Was not disappointed and left with some BCBS! Just the standard bourbon county stouts were available on tap, but there were plenty of other great options too (if you visit close to St Patrick's day, they do an amazing mint imperial stout). Great food options availbale too. I went for the triple patty burger, with side of fried chicken! Kitchen closes relatively early so be mindful before making the journey.

Could not have been more impressed with Goose Island! Our server was friendly and made us feel welcome, and even important. The menu had an unexpectedly large selection, including several bourbon county stout variants from current and recent years.

The food menu is what I'd describe as creative bar food, that's exceptionally well done. Everything was delicious!

The icing on the proverbial cake was the Beer-to-go selection. We procured some impossible-to-get-in-Michigan BCBS variants, making me a very happy camper!

Exceeded all expectations! Good variety of draft beers, ciders, and hard seltzer’s! Friendly staff (always keeping an eye if you need another drink). We skipped the food, but it everything being served around us looked awesome! Separate to-go menu so make sure to check before you decide what you want to bring home!

P.S. if you’re looking to take home the cider variety pack, make sure they have it available. Bartender was nice enough to make us a personal to-go pack with what was available - but just a heads up so all my cider lovers are not disappointed

Oldest Italian restaurant in Chicago. Liked the ambiance and restaurant theme/decor. The staff was friendly and very accommodating the entire dinner. Food was good but nothing that would knock your socks off. Between the 4 of us we ordered the following:
Lasagna, chicken Alfredo, and chicken parmesean. Everything was good, but nothing spectacular. Alfredo was kinda bland. I make a much better Alfredo and the family would agree.

This is the kind of Italian restaurant your parents went to: waiters wearing a pressed white shirt under their vest with a red tie, a water person, a bread person, framed black and white photos of celebrities on the wall. It seems like the place hasn't changed in 30 years, but it doesn't have to... Every menu item is a classic.
The dining room is a mix of dimly lit nooks that create an intimate dining experience for close friends and four-tops the run down the center of the space.

Be aware: the dining room is up a long flight of stairs.

Wow this place was amazing! The decor is beautiful, the lasagna was absolutely incredible! We sat in a nice booth tucked which seems to have been cut out a closet of some sort. It was very private. It even had a switch inside to flip to let the server know we needed something. We'll worth the wait to get seated. Will definitely return on next trip to Chicago!

Ordered lasagna and tiramisu for dinner. The portion was pretty large, and the flavor was standard but not very impressive. Wish the bread was warm when they served it. The service was okay. The interior design was interesting to make you feel like going into a totally different space. Good for a casual dinner but might not be the top choice for Italian food in Chicago.

Good food and atmosphere. Tasty dishes and drinks. On the menu The seafood linguine includes scallops & shrimp, but none were included in the dish. Manager offered to have it remade with some and we said sure.

Good fast food, I would never eat sushi from here.  Place needs to be DEEP CLEANED ASAP.. Been in multiple times to see sushi being made with bare hands, cross contamination!! ..  Thing's you don't see when you order food from uber.
Small place 4 tables. lots of take out business! Sushi was excellent chicken on chicken pad Tai was runbery and meh, but noodle were on point and delicious. Prices matched quality.

Small portions (the photo is of dinner sized Basil Fried Rice entree). The first time I visited the customer service left a lot to be desired, but the second time we were treated well. We enjoyed a few sushi rolls and noodle dishes. Be careful on the spice! No gluten free soy sauce.

I ordered this place from UberEats.
The sushi is so delicious and fresh even though I ordered it so late at night. Pretty cheap for the portion.
I find their sticky rice weird though, not the typical Thai. Unfortunately, it doesn't taste good.
This is what quality sushi tastes like! Anytime I'm back in town I have to come back for more!!!! And the crab rangoon are perfect!

Quick and fast service for some very delicious and tasty ramen.  The service was great and waiter was very attentive.  The decor was nice but if you like your space, might want to take this to go. It's pretty crammed and really tight seating but i didn't mind it. The only disturbing thing was the timer they have in the kitchen going off every couple minutes.

A nicely decorated, chill ramen shop in the Chicago Chinatown area that serves just alright ramen. I wasn't too impressed by the broth and the noodles were alright.

Food
Coming to Chicago for the first time and trying all kinds of burgers amd steaks left me craving some asian food. And ramen is one of my favorite. Compared to other ramen that I've had, Strings was a below average spot for me. I wanted to go all out and got the Super Premium tonkotsu ramen. The Super Premium has kamp while the Premium does not. The noodles were okay, but the broth was not very good. The broth wasn't as rich as I expected for a tonkotsu and watered down.

Atmosphere
Casual and a great spot for just hanging out! The inside looks very Asian with the lanterns hanging from the ceiling and the wooden tables and chairs are a nice touch.

Pricing
Pretty expensive for average to below average ramen (mine Super Premium was about $21), but not sure if this is standard ramen prices in Chicago... I've had better ramen for $5 less per bowl in the Seattle area.

Service
Service was good and the server was very nice. We had the option to either sit indoors or outdoors but given that it was a sunny day we went for outdoors!

Other
Looks like mostly street parking around here

My favorite part of traveling to a big city is the fact that they have so many culinary options!  My home in Central KY doesn't have any authentic ramen shops. This tiny shop was just what I imagine you would find walking down an alley in Tokyo.
