The menu had several options to choose from and everything sounded delicious. The service was efficient and though it was a tight space, there was room to eat without sitting on top of your neighbor.

Three of us ate for under $50, all with water to drink. The large portions of steaming ramen were perfect for lunch on a crisp, fall day.

It was good but not the best rated spot in China town. The lady said a 2 spice was going to be hot and it wasn’t :/ I should’ve got the 4 but oh well. The meat was good though. A bit hot in the restaurant unfortunately. Need better AC or some fans. They were also wearing masks and it’s September 2022! COVID is over people. Oh well that’s just life. For me I couldn’t hear a single word she was saying. Very irritating 🤷‍♂️

If you are a person that is a larger than a size medium, you are going to have issues sitting inside. ** (read below)

For our 7 year anniversary we decided to try out strings. This restaurant was completely new to us as we have only been to very few in Chinatown. The chicken dumplings were really good. I definitely recommend those if you do decide to give this place a try.  Both my husband and I originally planned on trying out Ramen as neither of us have had authentic Ramen. However I ended up going with the meat lovers Rice Bowl as it was the only menu item that I could justify paying the price for. The chicharrones, or pork skins, are definitely from a bag. I like fried pork skins. I just thought they would be fresh. The meats were all flavored nicely. My husband ended up getting to the Hell Ramen Level 1. There was no heat (spice) for either of us. He also didnt like the texture of the baby oysters in the ramen. So if you go here to try this for heat, I would reccomend a different level. Even after adding the red pepper flakes in oil that is provided on the table, there was no heat.

Service is ok. We got water & a pitcher. So it was nice to be able to refill ourselves without asking. There's a QR code on the table to pull up the menu. We opted out of dessert.

** there are a couple booths to accommodate larger people however when we visited this location, we were offered a tiny corner table surrounded by a bunch of strangers. The table we were offered would not have sat us comfortably. We were sat at the opposite end of the tables. However we took up two full tables that were set to seat 6. If we sat in the orginal corner we were offered, me and a stranger would have been sitting uncomfortably and touching. The people at the booths did not rotate out at all while we were there (1.5hr).

Late restaurant choice as our regular local sushi place was closed on Monday. Nano Sushi was a great surprise. Street paid parking easy to find. Environment is on the darker side with a constant trance Electronica music in the background. We ordered appetizers and Entrées and we were so surprised how fast and delicious every choice came out. I had the Spicy Miso Ramen and it was awesome from the first dip. Tons of spicy flavor and just enough pork and noodles to complement it all. Definately trying again for another great experience.

One of the best sushi places in Buena Park. Irving Park and Broadway area.
We ordered 2 appetizers and a heat sushi entree which was the highlight.

Service was quick. Ambiance is great and it’s BYOB.
There’s a liquor shop next door too.

Enjoy your time here.

The service was GREAT. And the food was hot and fresh. I got the vegetarian ramen and I loved it! Perfect flavor and not too salty. The waitress was so sweet and even got me a pen and paper to do my homework while I waited for my food.

Listen. I've been going to Nano Sushi for years. The location I went to is on Western. However they closed and I started coming to the one on Broadway. Literally the best customer service, the best sushi, and the BEST Ramen noodles! I want this place to last many many years!  You guys are amazing and everyone around Broadway should come support this business! Thank you so much Linda! You are beyond a warm welcoming soul! Your energy is magnetic and you deserve all the abundance! I can't wait to come back.

Love this place! Quick service, kind people, and the food never disappoints. Easy to order, recognizes regulars, and always has the freshest ingredients. I mostly stick to the vegetarian items, but my partner loves tons of options with meat. Definitely recommend this place!

I did not realize this is a restaurant with Michelin Guide rated in 2021. Do not hold an expectation of a typical Indian restaurant that near where you live which serve spicy and spicy and spicy curry. The curry they served is kind of like the sauce that you' ll only taste in French restaurant. It is so smooth that you did not even notice that is curry. The good thing about this restaurant is that they constantly change their menu, the bad thing about the restaurant is also they constantly change the menu which you hope you can order the food in pictures while you are searching for the restaurant. Overall, I will say it should be a great restaurant. I guess I did not order their best dishes yet, as some of the dishes did not meet my expectation for their price.

ROOH was a fantastic experience and the best Indian food I believe in Chicago. Service was standard, quick, and accommodating. The food was delicious, and the best dish I believe was the Bengali Lamb Shank. Nice cocktails and in a busy neighborhood. Highly recommend this spot, and do the chef’s tasting menu which is 4 courses, $65 per person.

Truly an upscale Indian dining experience.
Food, cocktails, ambiance, service everything was on point. Perfect spot for Indian cuisine lovers and a date night.
We got the chef’s 4 course menu’s and it was perfect.

Located in the bustling Fulton Market neighborhood of Chicago, ROOH is a restaurant you do not want to miss. The ambiance is quiet with subdued lighting and earthy color choices contributing to the laid back vibe. The food is top tier, all three of our dishes came in rich, creamy sauces with herbs sprinkled on top. All three (Grilled Prawn, Butter Chicken, Paneer Pasanda) were some of the best dishes we had our whole trip and were excellently prepared. The cocktails were also exceptional and paired well with our meal. I would highly recommend checking out this spot, I know I will be back next time I am in town!

My family and I went to Rooh for dinner last night and it was absolutely exceptional. I savored literally every bite. Our entire table ordered the 4 Course Chef’s Tasting Menu, so I was able to try a wide array of Rooh’s offerings. My favorite dishes that I ate were the Grilled Prawn Small Plate and the Sea Bass (with basmati rice or saffron rice). The sauce on the grilled prawns was particularly outstanding for its incredible flavor, a touch spicy with fantastic Indian spices. Excellent all around: service, food, atmosphere, and meal pacing– I highly recommend!

First and last time getting food from this location. I ordered the hot honey chicken plate and when I got home what I had was 1/2 cup of quinoa, 1/2 cup of Kale slaw, 1/2 cup of sweet potatoes and NO chicken. Take a look at the picture, there was almost no food in my order for $14. Can't recommend this place.

The meal was nice, but they rely too much on spiciness without making the dish actually delicious first. They should learn from the Grilled Chicken Salad they have at the Jibarito Stop... The chicken is the star and everything else in the salad is a compliment to the well made chicken.
BTW does that guy in the photo remind anyone of a certain Apple Store Monkey boy?

We love this place, but today we had quite an experience with Marbin, he seems not the type of person you want to have serving, he was rude and not quite friendly, we asked for 2 slices of bread and he literally just drop it in one of the bowls. And slam the utensils like he was upset with life or something.
We have been here before and the other employees there ask how much dressing we want and if we want the salad to be mixed, really really good service. But Marbin didn’t got the training right.

We placed a carryout order online.  I wanted to love this place and healthy food option.  Our salads were ready ontime.  They were prepared with mostly greens and sparse on everything else.  They lacked favor and protein.  The bread was dry.  I probably would not go back.

The kale salad is delicious. Service could be better. The staff aren’t unfriendly, they just take a while to acknowledge you and take your order.  The table tops could be cleaner. Other than that, everything is great.

Finally found authentic pizza that has homemade sausage, the freshest cheese and great sauce & perfect crust.  Had many pizzas and so called Italian food, this is far the best. Italian beef melts in your mouth , and the bread its served on, I can eat just plain, not to mention the appetizers, mmmm. The best hospitality from Dennis , we love your place. Thank you for all your hard work.

We moved to the neighborhood a few months after the initial shutdown of 2020. The first time I drove by, the sign caught my eye and I knew it was a place I had to try. We ordered delivery not long after and it immediately became our main source of pizza. Tonight, instead of delivery, I stopped in to pick it up. The old school charm is real. I think the owner was who greeted us and he was a super friendly guy. I can’t wait to dine in with my whole family.

Old school charm when dining in. Was taken care of by the owner, Dennis who was great to have a conversation with. Had the thin crust pizza, which was excellent. Everything is made fresh and worth every penny. It’s no wonder they’ve been in business for 70 years.

Such a cozy spot! My girlfriend and I came by Frank’s for a low key date night and left very happy with our decision. The thin crust was terrific and our waitress Sharon was incredibly sweet. We loved the old school vibe and enclosed booths. As we’re now locals, we’ll definitely be back.

The definitive Chicago style thin crust pizza. Speedy delivery. Still has the original neon sign with a phone number that includes letters. As good now as it undoubtedly was during my granddad's time when it first opened because it has been around this long for good reason. Get yourself a cannoli for dessert.

Solid Mexican food. Eaten here a couple times now - it’s a small spot and everything is made fresh to order (including the guac) so takes awhile to prepare but worth it. The steak has good flavor but a little gristly, the chicken was surprisingly tasty and tender. Salsas had a good amount of heat and great flavor, worked well on everything. The guacamole was great. Veggie burrito was almost a little sweet, great for kids who don’t want a quesadilla. Prices and availability have been updated during the pandemic thanks to supply chain issues, still pretty reasonable in my opinion.
Great tacos and great prices. Staff is extremely nice and fast to get your order ready. I usually call in to order and it only takes 10-15 minutes usually. Definitely recommend
Inexpensive, tasty and friendly person working there. He was the cook, the cashier, and he even served the food. He's amazing!
Authentic Mexican Restaurant for sure... the burrito was small but with flavor. Def. A place I will go back for just work lunch but not take anyone on a date lol.

I cannot be objective about Mr. Salsa. I’ve been coming here for 20 years, and the tacos are as awesome now as they ever were. It’s small, probably more perfect for take out, but if you stay at one of the few tables they will make you feel welcome!!
Reasonably priced, wait times are ok during the day and if called in but the chicken is the best part- freshly cooked and seasoned very well no matter what time of day. Pleasantly surprised!

I just opened my order to eat and discovered that the shrimp was raw uncooked and taste bad. That’s the first shrimp i ate that call my attention to check and everything was raw. The lady are always good and I gave them good tip sometimes but this time the food was raw.

The cashier was pleasant, but my shrimp were terrible, the breading was falling off & they were not large as I ordered + they  chicken wings were very small & they were only 5. For what I was charged for the dinner I would think because of the small size your store would've at least given at least six. 🧐 I was once a loyal customer before the pandemic the food & device were Great, but not on my last visit😑 I will not be doing business at that location in the future☹️

I started going here when they first opened many years ago.  Over time they have really gone down hill.  I ordered the (two) 3 piece specials and the cashier rang it up as a 2 piece. She did apologize and said if I wanted the 3 piece it would  be $2 extra. Np.  Paid the extra $2.... Got home and both order was missing the 3rd piece. Called to notify them and was told to come back to pick up pieces that were missing. Went back to restaurant and the cook or whoever he was argued and said he included the pieces. After adamantly, telling him that they were missing, they finally gave it to me.  Long story short, order at your own risk and check your purchase before you leave. As for me, I'm never going back.  BTW, I should have listened to the customer who was leaving before I ordered when she said I'm never coming back here.

I was a hungry after work. The grill was down, but the lady waiting on me took care of me. I ordered the two fish sandwiches. She made them for me. Sandwiches were great. Nice pieces of fish, tender! Mine you, this was 7am!!

Great place to grab’n’go some really tasty Pakistani food. The lady who cooks here is professional and very talented. The Hispanic lady who serves is also super sweet. If you get a chance, grab some chicken biryani on Saturday/ Sunday or their grilled kababs. I also tried their dal and korma, both delish.
Chai is also authentic tasting. The interior space is very humble and simple, probably not the best if you are with family. The price is more than fair for such good food.

So bad place, he forced us to order a specific things which we don't want,  then he tock the food out of the kitchen and put it on the microwave.

You will hate the restaurant atmosphere, most of the people there is the owner guys so they're just sitting there for chatting or talking.

The service is terrible,  he told us the ETA is about 8 min but it took more than 20 min.

There is no written menu you can see it by your self, he told us we will find it online but it doesn't even exist. My meal was supposed to cost 9$ but he charged me 14$, when I asked him he told me that it is written behind him with too light marker , you pairly can see it.

Believe me you won't go again🤬

The uncle who serviced us was rude to my North African husband. I should’ve spoken up, I feel he would’ve been more receptive to a fellow desi person but the way the uncle ignored our patronage was gross. Literally the man went to the back to eat instead of answering our question. Went at 2am after NYE because they said they’re open until 6am on the phone but they didn’t have any food to sell? Got 2 cups of chai (no travel cups, no care about the messy pour), and 4 potato samosas. The first samosa had an egg in it… it was an egg samosa. I’ve never had samosas like this so maybe I’m ignorant about this dish but all the samosas were cold. This place just does not care about service. Disappointed and do not recommend.

Actually terrible. All the food was sitting out at room temperature, when we ordered the guy asked if we wanted it heated up at the restaurant or at home. We should have left then. He microwaved our order and we went on our way, but the meal was genuinely inedible and we threw it away. They really need a health inspection. The pieces of Tandoori chicken we did try tasted like a rawhide chew. The other chicken was... Soft? Like mushy and gritty at the same time. No good.

I want to give them the benefit of the doubt, because we were there at 1am. Maybe during the day the food isn't a health department nightmare. Their samosas we're alright (but still not in the temperature safe zone). But if they can't manage to make something edible at night, they shouldn't be 24 hour. Also pretty overpriced for the quantity.

They don't have online orders so please call them instead. Don't look at the menu. Call them to ask what they have for the day. We had a mutton briyani, and it was good. The most important thing for me about Indian food is flavor, and fulfilled that.

I truly recommend this place if you are looking for tasty and affordable chinese food! I have been coming to this restaurant for years now that I thought I would introduce it to my job's celebration. Everybody loved the food! Not only is the food amazing but also the staff! Everyone is always welcoming, professional in all aspects and willing to help you. If you are looking for a restaurant for catering they are amazing to work with.

You know Chinese food can be hit or miss but this place was definitely a hit. It was my first time trying it. It was the 4th of July and so many places were closed so we decided to give them a try. I was not disappointed. The food was good, fresh, and tasty. Definitely my new go-to spot for Chinese food.

My favorite Chinese restaurant! My family has been coming here for years and we will continue to come back. This place brings amazing memories and the service is always great. Food is always amazing and I definitely always recommend the hot and sour soup.

First time here and it was not good, at all. I got simple food, chicken&vegetables, combo fried rice and some crab ragoons. I will NOT be returning. The chicken and veggies taste old and have a weird flavor, the fried rice has NO flavor and the ragoons are just not it. I'm sad I wasted my money here but my other spot was closed.

Omg! This place deserves higher ratings than what it has!! My favorite Chinese restaurant by far!! Our waiter is so catering and the food is delicious! I strongly recommend this place, you won't regret

Loved this restaurant.  My husband suggested it as a way to get me out of the house.  Mexican is an easy way to do that.  We walked a few blocks to El Pulpo Loco in quite cold weather.  It was well worth it.  I am not  crazy about having drinks during the week, but after tasting my husband’s margarita, I had to have one, but with a salted rim.  It was the perfect compliment to our meal, which consisted of Shrimp Empanadas, Steak Burrito (for me), and Steak and Shrimp fajitas for my husband.  Of course, we had the guacamole.  It was really good.  I like my guacamole a little chunky, as opposed to looking like something akin to mashed potatoes, and El Pulpo’s guacamole was perfect.

One thing I loved about the burrito is that I could eat it with my hands, as opposed to a fork.  It was stuffed with steak, beans, cheese, sour cream, onions, and cilantro, but I could pick it up and eat it without a fork.  It was huge, so much so, that the other half will be my lunch tomorrow.  I tasted the veggies in my husband’s fajita and liked them.  Nicely seasoned and the vegetables were not overly cooked; they still had a nice crunch.

The service was great as well.  The server was working constantly taking care of us and other patrons and fulfilling delivery orders.  There was a pleasant cadence to our meal thanks to her.

The food here is delicious !
The salsa is amazing especially the green one tastes like my moms mole. It’s hard to find authentic Mexican food and this place definitely meets those expectations. I would recommend the corrundas so tasty and the empanadas 😱❤️🥰
Was craving octopus & mussels so I found this little gym & decided to give it a try.  It was delicious & the service was great.  I'll definitely be back!  Gracias Pulpo Loco
This place has excelente food! Tried the al pastor, asada, and asada with rajas tacos and all were great. Also had an amazing michelada and a seafood tostada! All pretty good and recommended
AMAZING FOOD!!!! I had the Shrimp house special and it had such a unique flavor. Great environment. Definitely coming back!

Big and full of light

One of the few McDonald's that has dine-in open. Unfortunately, I forgot my vaccination card and had to make my order for take-out. The restaurant was quite busy in the afternoon, and some families occupied the separated from the main area indoor playground where kids could run and laugh to their heart's content.
Recently renovated, this restaurant looks inviting and stylish. The quality of the food and friendliness of the employees is on top as always.
I enjoy their deal "Get any size McCafe beverage with the $3+ order" because McDonald's coffee is so much more to my liking than any other major chain's. Cappuccino is always my go-to drink. Also, the new menu hacks look interesting. I've never had Filet O Fish, and I was not going to find out how it tastes combined with the beef patties. But Crunchy double is fine (Double Cheeseburger + 6 nuggets). However, I fitted only three on my burger to eat it more or less comfortably.

Their system is always mysteriously down in the early hours of the day. “Cash only”?
They never get your order right.
The franchise owner is instructing his/her employees to do something shady or out of corporate guidelines.

I went to order my kids and I a slushy it was a hot day just wanted a cool drink. I was told the machine was down,then I over heard one of the employees ask for one and the manager said it's working we just tell the customer that when they order too many so we don't have to make them. I ordered 4 so that was too many for them to be bothered to make. That's just crazy.

A perfect storm of a huge 16 wheeler delivering merchandise to the franchise, blocking half of the drive thru at (10pm), the WiFi not working properly, not being able to retrieve my online order, all taking a half hour to resolve the issue. Finally, the manager gave me a tutorial on how to properly place an  online order. Having placed many, many online orders in the past, I found this to be quite ludicrous, especially since his tutorial didn't go particularly smoothly. Normally the store runs smoothly but not yesterday night. BTW, the manager gave me a small fry for my disatisfaction (he didn't offer it, I suggested it).
Yet another location that offers the adult happy meal but do not actually have the happy meal. Keep just finding less and less of a reason to go to McDonald's anymore

I’m disgusted I was enjoying my crispy chicken sandwich after a long day at work I didn’t even bother checking out my food. As I was taking the last few bits I noticed something green on my top bun and it’s mole mold the camera won’t pick it up as good but I checked it and it is. I’ve always bought from this place but after this experience I’m never giving McDonald’s another pennie from my pocket. Watch your food before you eat it these people don’t care about the public

This location use to be great but it’s in desperate need of new management the manager taking the orders in the drive thru is extremely hard to understand and very rude and the food is extra greasy so greasy it goes through the bag !! Won’t be stopping here until management is changed !!

Bathroom had toilet paper all over floor but the lady was going to clean the mens but still dirty.. My ice-cream was watery kinda gross. Service was taken and delivered fast. I would try it again but I wouldn't rush back

This location can back up the queue  sometimes at night but they do a pretty good job . Pretty consistent quality if you are trying to order Ubereats one gripe I have is twice I ordered 20 - 40 piece mc nuggets here and twice they shorted me two nuggets . I wouldn't have noticed if my girlfriend didn't point it out

My medium fries had so little in them It look like it was an extra small fries🤦‍♂️🤦‍♂️also had NO NAPKIS.. Really? This was done tru the side curve because I had to be at work. By the time I got to the parking lot at work wich is 5 minutes away is I Notice this.

My partner and I just tried brunch from here for the first time and we were not disappointed! The staff was super friendly on the phone and the contact-less pickup process was seamless.

We ordered breakfast sandwich on a bagel with breakfast potatoes, viking nachos, the southwest chicken salad, and the cinnamon sugar fall donuts.

The breakfast sandwich had a perfectly over-medium egg, delicious thick-cut bacon, and nicely melted cheddar. The breakfast potatoes were beautifully well-done, just how I like them (don't give me those raw-looking breakfast potatoes). Viking nachos had a salsa that my partner was obsessed with. Salad was great with homemade dressing and homemade tortilla chips. But truly, the star of the show was the donuts. Warm, fresh, drenched in cinnamon sugar, and endlessly flaky.

This may have been our first time visiting, but it most definitely will not be our last!

Sorry, we ate all of the amazing food before we had a chance to take any pictures.
A great iced chai latte and made-to-order homemade donuts! Fast service and a very pleasant and friendly customer service. Please support our local coffee shop! ❤️🌈🌸☕️
Delicious cold brew, awesome doughnuts, great people! Virginia is kind, generous and welcoming. Can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu. Highly recommend ordering enough to share.

The chef is very friendly and gracious. The food is excellent and a better value than the “expensive egg” place down the street. You are more likely to get seated here quickly and often the chef or sous chef will bring you your meal, herself.  Donuts are phenomenal, as is every breakfast entree. Coffee is good and the decor feels rustic in the best sense of the word.

I'm so happy this place opened up in the neighborhood. It's as home-style authentic as it gets. While this place is delivering 5-stars across the board - ambiance, food, and service.

Ambiance
It's perfect. The rustic home-style feel of SVK is not just imitated, but authentic. Every item seems to have a backstory around it - from the tung oil rubbed wooden fixtures to the chachkies on the wall. You can even read about the history of many of them by paging through the beautifully designed 'newspaper' which sites on each table. The light fixtures are cleverly converted antique kitchen gadgets and pans. It's a cozy, beautiful space. The tables are quite close together, so getting in and out of the seats along the wall might take a little bit of a shuffle. Music was a comfortable level. The seats along the front window have several outlets, making it a great place to plug in if you plan to sit and do some work. Wi-Fi is also available.

Food
I have been waiting to try SVK's food and, even on opening day, they did not disappoint. I stopped by for both breakfast and lunch. Expect to spend $10-$20 for a meal with a side and a drink.
- Cold brew - SVK uses Metropolis coffee and I'm happy to report that they didn't skimp on the cold brew. It's strong and bold and you can taste the coffee. Exactly what you hope for in a cold brew. Size (16 oz) was very reasonable as well
- Winnemac Bagel - What a fresh experience! It is open face, bagel with some really amazing ingredients. The tomato, lettuce, and seasoning really came together. Not a grab a go sandwich, but if you can spare a few moments I'd recommend it
- Salsa w/ house made chips - The crunch on these was notable before I even tasted the salsa. SNAP! Salted, but not overly so. The salsa was delicious as it was surprisingly, but pleasantly, sweet before the heat from the medium salsa kicks in
- Shrimp Taco w/ citrus slaw - 3 tacos packed w/ shrimp, which is nice. They don't shortchange you. The citrus slaw also delivers big flavor. They serve it with salsa, but I think there would almost be too much going on, so I opted to keep it on the side. Tacos are of modest size, especially if you didn't get anything else. [Update: now served with 3 tacos, up from 2, which makes it more of a meal]
- Rice pudding - Just-right level of sweetness and cinnamon served in a convenient personal sized tin. This with a scoop of ice cream would be an amazing dessert to split [Update: no longer available]
- Bobtail ice cream - I had one scoop of the cookie dough and it was a very rich treat. I have not had Bobtail before. It's quite a soft ice cream. More like a custard than traditional ice cream. The cookie dough was a little limited on cookie dough and was more like vanilla w/ chocolate chunks. However, the flavor was good and with eight flavors to pick from, I'm sure there is something you'll enjoy. [Update: Bobtail sold to Johnson's Real Ice Cream; I've tried several flavors and they are quite good].
- Rest of offering - The menu is rounded out with a mixture of pastries, fresh meals, soups, sides, and beverage options. A few bagged sweets are also on offer but they are tucked away on side of register.

Service
A local place run by locals, so service is super friendly and the owners are very involved in both front and back of house. When I sat down for lunch, the food was brought out quickly and they offered to clear the spot when I was done eating. Water is self-serve from a cooler, by the well-stocked coffee bar. Tables were quickly cleaned and reset for the next customers. There are railroad spikes on the walls to hang bags and coats. If you want to use the restroom, you'll need to ask as it requires a walk through the kitchen to get to it. Food is made to order - plan for at least 10 minutes to get your food or call ahead to order for grab-and-go.

Overall, I really enjoyed my experiences at SVK and wish them the best of luck. They are a great addition to the neighborhood and I look forward to spending more here in the future!

[Updated Jan 2020 to reflect my many visits since SVK opened]

An amazing comprehensive Italian experience with a wide selection of Italian food, wine, cheese, meat and other culinary elements. The Neapolitan pizza is a must try. The cheeses are amazing. They also do an Olive oil tasting! Many options in pasta, antipasta, pizza and desserts.

Overall a solid experience and dive into the Italian culinary culture. Worth a visit for eating and shopping.

We had multiple amazing meals here and great shopping too. I ordered a cream paste with prosciutto. It was amazing! I'm lactose intolerant and knew I would pay for it but it was worth it (TMI. . .) it was amazing. My daughter ordered a very simple pasta with red sauce but was delicious. The pasta was fresh and delicious.

I love going to Eataly any chance I get! From the good food, to all of the wonderful imported items you can get, everything is absolutely fantastic. There are usually samples of meats and cheeses, as well as things like wine and all kinds of goodies from Italy! There's validated parking at the Parking Garage across the street, but it's only good for about an hour, so be sure to keep track of the time.

Had a delicious dinner at Eataly! Now, the upstairs is one giant pizza/pasta eatery instead of a bunch of smaller eateries (they used to have a seafood place & a little beer bar). We enjoyed everything we ordered & all the dishes were freish & executed well. Service from Joel was excellent. We got the fried calamari & shrimp (delish), the fried chicken & the veal stuffed pasta. I also got a couple of desserts to go from the first floor cafe. Such a fun place to shop & eat!

WOW JUST WOW! 🤩
This place is the real Italy..
Food was amazing, it’s confusing walking in but just know it’s sorta like an Italian grocery store  and also a bunch of restaurants combine. So many wine choosing. And kid friendly too! Such a fun environment and staff were so helpful and kind. We loved eating at the Vino Restaurant the food was 10/10!! 🤍🇮🇹🍝
By far one of the best gems of a breakfast restaurant in the area and don’t forget to try the crispy bacon probably the best in the city!
Great food and large portions. Their pancakes were amazing. The kids breakfast pancake and blueberry pancakes are pictured. Staff was friendly. We would definitely go back.

Had a Denver Omelet that was full of flavor and just big enough to keep me full, not stuffed. Along with that was a side of breakfast potatoes that hit the spot. You won't be cheated on the serving sizes. And just to treat myself I added a side of bacon, that was just perfection. Needless to say I will be going back

Great "hole-in-the-wall" location serving breakfast, brunch, and lunch. Two cozy indoor seating areas and a sidewalk dining area. Staff were all energetic and helpful. The Reuben was delicious with homemade corned beef.

Been here a few times and every time I am so pleased. Fair priced and walking distance from home. Also the staff is very nice and take care of ya. One of mine and my partners favorite breakfast places.

Nice bar and restaurant! And friendly staff
The view is so AMAZING!

This might be one of the best views in the city! I'm typically the guy that takes my tourist friends to the Johnny Hank for the view and drinks but I'm changing that now.

All of the tables in the bar have amazing views but my favorite table is right at the corner of the bar. You get views of both river and the three major skyscrapers: Trump Tower, John Hancock and the Sears Tower (there was never a name change for us locals). I must tell you that it is so beautiful to look at.  In fact, I'm trying to get the bar to put my name on that table but that is not going well. Ha!

The other day I saw a business traveler sitting by himself working at my table on a laptop and he was missing the view. I wanted to tell the guy that he was sitting in the best table and that it was a "NO WORK ZONE". Look at the view and work later!

There are also daily specials during the week from Sunday to Thursday. Give them a call to find out exactly. I believe that Thursday is $6 flavored vodka night with any mixer night. There's a special Bloody Mary on Sundays.

So if you're in the mood for a different view and not your typical tourist trap, then this is the place. The drinks are reasonable and the staff is friendly. This is one of the best hotel bars in the city for relaxing and enjoying the river and city view.

The view at night is nice, but the food isn't very good. I gave it a 2nd chance and went with the burger and fries, thinking they couldn't mess it up. Both lacked flavor, except the undertone of being burnt. Also, $7 for a domestic beer.

The view from this bar is truly breathtaking.  My friends and I were there on a Thursday evening and surprisingly, it was pretty crowded (mostly due to a private party they were hosting).  At first, it was a bit chaotic because we couldn't find a table and when we asked the waitress/hostess, she simply said to sit at any table.  So, we walked around in search of an available table and found one..woohoo.  Drink prices are pretty reasonable considering the location.  We all ordered martinis and it was pretty delicious.  Our waitress was pretty accommodating when we requested to move tables so that we would  be closer to the river view.  And she was okay with us paying the tab with 4 different credit cards.  In overall, it was a very nice experience and I would go back just for the view itself!

Pros: tiny restaurant that doesn't get crowded.  Beautiful views (even if they're not the best). Convenient location if you're already in the area.

Cons: if you're not in the area,  parking is outrageous ($40 for a couple of hours). Limited and overpriced menu.  The food was mediocre and the drinks were watered down.

Overall, it was ok.  If you're staying at the holiday inn, check it out.  Otherwise,  I wouldn't recommend.

Great recently reopened Italian restaurant hiding near the convention center!  We were a bit late for dinner but the staff were really accommodating and gave us food without rushing us out of the restaurant, and the portions were huge!  Classic Italian cuisine and refreshing beverages with a nice bar for those looking to enjoy some sports while eating a great meal!  Highly recommended!
EXCELLENT food! The BEST Italian in the area, hands-down! Pasta was on-point (vodka sauce so yummy)! We actually have quality Italian dishes + salads now that Cafe Bionda is BACK in the South loop.

Good luck, trying to choose a salad, they are all great and very generous in portion. The brick chicken is perfect, and could feed a small family. If you make it to dessert, the tiramisu is out of this world, and in my humble opinion, the best in the city!

I don’t leave many reviews but this is worth a moment to say 5 stars for Cafe Bionda. The stuffed mushroom appetizer was savory, creamy, and balanced. The main course homemade pasta dishes of short rib ravioli and penne romano were near perfect with only the peas in the penne dish being slightly green my only note to the chef, however with the perfect amount of texture and bounce of the homemade pasta, good portion size, and the flavors being balanced in every other regard, plus the service, attitude, and ambiance of the venue such an enjoyable experience, there is not even a consideration of less than 5 stars. If I was a local I would be a regular customer, as it is I will be recommending Cafe Bionda to family and friends, and also of course to whomever is reading this review.
Everything was more than delicious! I was very happy with the service and atmosphere too. Definitely worth a visit!

Five stars for excellent service! I'm surprised anyone had a bad service experience there. The missing star is actually for the food. Everyone we encountered was on their A game, and I'm one who appreciates stellar service. We were there at 1pm on Tuesday, December 24th, before Phantom of the Opera. We ordered 2 meals from the $33 3 course menu, 2 glasses of wine, tea, and sparkling water. Both desserts were disappointing, the main was okay, but we both enjoyed the soup. Good portion sizes, but felt overpriced as the food was underwhelming overall. I chalked it up to paying for the service. It's a place I'd pop into again for wine and an appetizer. (review from 2019)

Great service, good location and an original menu for an Italian restaurant. The only problem that we encountered is that some of their dishes that were not listed as spicy very quite spicy. Other than that, a good place for a special dinner, very close to most theaters that are downtown.

I really enjoyed my main dinner here. The appetizer was average but the entree blew my socks off. I had the Linguini Nere which is Squid Ink pasta with scallops and shrimp. The sauce was creamy without being overly fishy. Delish! The kids menu was overpriced for what they got and neither items were especially appetizing for my kids. The drinks were also a little of the mark. The first martini was great but the second was very boozy and unbalanced. However the bathrooms were very clean and nice and the restaurant itself was very pleasant to the eye.

Dubbed the most romantic restaurant in Chicago. Amazing service by an Italian staff. We were served by Marko, who had a good sense of humor. I had my drink paid for because it was my graduation day.

Highly recommended if you can afford it.

Good Italian downtown. Not cheap, but the quality of the dishes is definitely above average. Squash tortellini and calamari were very good. Service is decent, they took away my salad before I had a chance to finish.

What a great place for a quick lunch or dinner. They have turkey prime rib s meatloaf is entrees tons of sides. They even have chicken noodle soup. They're cornbread is great. They have desserts which would include cookies and cakes and pies. The service is fast and friendly. One sad note they do not serve him anymore. It was reasonably priced and very tasty.p

I was here on Christmas day.....And it was the absolute worst experience ever!! I mean if you didn't want to serve people than why would you even open.....They had people waiting in the cold for over 30 minutes...Then once the finally opened Everyone had an attitude. And for the food to be priced higher this day..... They sure did give you some nasty, bland food. That was all sloppily thrown together. Smh terrible!

I ordered from here through Grubhub and I’m in Heaven!! I had the 3 piece chicken dinner with mashed potatoes/ gravy, creamed spinach and cornbread. Awesome!! Also ordered a crispy chicken sandwich which will be for tomorrow. I got the food delivered around a half hour after placing order. Thanks for the great service all around.

My friend is addicted to mashed potatoes and corn!! All I could think of to order was the combo so I did it on Uber for him the chicken was a little dry to be honest little bland with the mashed potatoes and corn are the bomb!!!! Will definitely figure out how to order mashed potatoes and corn once a week from here on in one of my favorite meals!!

Ordered grub hub tonight. Idk why my expectations were higher but I ordered a sandwich that looked good enough .. they just didn’t give me my sandwich. Ordered chicken soup which dropped in the bag & soaked everything in the bag. Even the Apple fritter dessert was dry and just ew - everything was a bad .. will never order from them again 😩

Art of Pizza is Chicago's best kept pizza secret and at ridiculously awesome prices. The crust is buttery without being greasy. They don't skimp out on toppings either. And I've never had a rude person at the counter - they all make you feel like they've known you for years!

I had the stuffed special pizza slice. It was good but had some areas for improvements.

It was lukewarm. It would have been so much better if it was hotter.

Pizza was also juuuust a little doughy. Probably would have been less noticeable if it the pizza was hotter.

Probably wouldn’t bother again.

Great spot to buy deep dish by the slice, or wait 30-45 minutes for a full deep dish pie (worth the wait). A Chicago-staple with awesome daily specials. What it lacks in ambiance, it makes up by being BYOB and having a Jewel across the street.

The pizza is delicious! Each slice, whether thin, stuffed, or pan, is just $4.99, and the slices are of a decent size. Great value! Also, the customer service is friendly and awesome! I highly recommend this restaurant!

I really appreciate that there is a place in Chicago where i can purchase deep dish by the slice.  These slices are delicious and filled with tasty meats and veggies!!  IMO it rivals some of the more well known tourist favorites.  Ill definitely be coming back for more.

This is how my ordered was sent out after ordering through Door Dash. It arrived in a simple plastic bag with chips, cookie(stale), and brown paper bag. When I tried to lift the paper bag, it split from the side. I finished splitting the bag and it revealed my sandwich tossed around with the ingredients coming out.  Picture speaks for itself. Never ordering from here again!
Stingy on the veggies (3 slices of cucumber for a foot long) Not helping the overall subway brand. Other locations are much better, friendly and welcoming.

Got a Veggi Delit rap and the servant was skimpy on the ingredients. She saved their ingredients but lost a repeating customer. I don't like to be cheated when paying your full price of $9. Please don't support them and their treatment of customers. Let them save their ingredients!

Skimpy portions, more expensive than others, bathroom out of order, no hot water for the employees to wash their hands 😖
Go elsewhere
Expensive and small portions compared to the other subways near that area on top of it asking for the tips.

Very disappointing. It looks like they might be under new management. The food tastes completely different. The rice doesn't look washed, and the meat quality is clearly below average. I understand the hike of food prices, but at least if should taste like Thai? The flavors are weird and no longer authentic.

Not really sure why they call it spicy crazy noodle. It's never spicy, just sweet. In fact I don't think I've ever seen hot peppers in this dish like the menu description suggests. I add spicy chili paste every time. I regret adding extra beef this time. The beef was so tough, dry and chewy. FYI they increased their menu prices during the last few months. $2 more for all the main dishes, ie spicy crazy noodles went from $8.95 to $10.95.

Delicious food at a reasonable price. Our party ordered the Cashew dinner with chicken and the Pad Thai with shrimp. The vegetables were fresh and plentiful with each meal. Extra hot peppers were provided upon request, but the food is not very spicy. I'd stop by here again to try other items on the menu. Yummy was yummy.

Friendly service. Unrushed. Relaxed environment. No forced service charge unlike some of the Thai restaurant on Taylor.

The vegetarian dumplings were hot and filled with some kind of spinach. Tasted good with the sauce.

The hot pot noodles had equally good volume of noodles and generous portions of tofu and veggies. Will eat again

I recently visited Yummy Thai for the first time and have to say I was disappointed. I ordered a standard chicken Pad Thai with medium spice and received a bland dish with next to no flavor. Meat, noodles and vegetables had almost no taste and there was no hint of spice that would accompany a medium dish. This was incredibly disappointing for a dish that cost over $10. There was also no water available for the table, and the only option was to purchase bottled water. In addition to the disappointing food, the restaurant itself is far from charming. Largely blank brick walls, lots of empty floor space, aggressive lighting, and low ceilings don't do anything to help create a nice dining atmosphere. There was also no music or other ambient noise aside from the 3 other people who happened to be there, which made speaking uncomfortable as it was easy to hear everything going on at the next table over. If the food itself wasn't ready as quickly as it was, I would give Yummy Thai just one star and I debated doing it anyway given the poor value for money on display here. I hope this place can pick itself up and start making some quality food, but I can't say I plan to return to find out.

This is the best Persian restaurant in the city, definitely a hidden gem.
I love the food here, good portion and reasonable prices. They have the most tasteful Iranian tea and also, they have the traditional home made Saffron ice cream which is amazing.
Make sure to call every weekend to know their weekend specials.
Employees are very nice and patient. We also got to see the owner, very kind and welcoming gentlemen.
I love the interior design, very cozy and warm with great music.

Superb. Great service, even better food. Traditional and authentic Persian food (my father-in-law grew up in Iran so we went together). The portions were great, the food was cooked to perfection.

We got the Kabob platter which was more than filling. Started off with the hummus (highly recommend, even if just for the bread alone).

A surprising favorite was the falafel and the salad. So fresh, so well flavored. We will be back!

Nice design, delicious food, and kind staff. There is no doubt that this is the best Persian restaurant I’ve tried in Chicago (among 3 that I know).
We ordered Soltani and lamb kabob with Sabzi Polo and Zereshk Polo, both dishes were well cooked. They also brought us Tahdig and mint leaves for free. I truly recommend this restaurant over the other Mediterranean foods in the area.

One of the hidden gems in Chicago! Their Soltani Kabob was super delicious and authentic. Persian ice cream, Dough and Tea are must haves!

Interior of the restaurant is very beutiful and authentic, with multiple persian crafts, pictures, and persian music. It reminded us of home!

Last but not least, the owner is very frendly and nice. Overall it was a fantastic dining experience. We'll be back soon to try their seafoods and Dizi!
The best Persian restaurant in the city. Warm and traditional ambience and great food. The saffron ice cream and dough are a must try! The staff are super nice and friendly.

Most flavorful fried rice I’ve had in Chicago… extremely tasty…

Strong value, too! after tax a large serving of fried comes to ~$16 and I felt like it could feed four hungry people! Felt a pint of tightly packed fried rice. Would certainly stop by again with a big appetite (or just order a small haha)

Hands down the best fried rice we tasted in Chicago(or Illinois)!! Can't believe we stayed in the uptown area for more than an year and didn't come across this place. It's really word of mouth marketing or if you happen to cross that place by chance, which is how we discovered it. It's right next to Wilson red line cta stop. Also, if you like spicy, the spicier version is much better than regular version. Guess our hunt for the best fried rice in town is finally over!!!
Best fried rice in town and they always fill it up!
Their shrimp fried rice it the best I've ever tasted in my life! The smoothies are as equally great! 😋 my goodness! Well done guys!

Crab Rangoon was fantastic. Shrimp fried rice was plentiful. Nice cook on the shrimp. Each ingredient added to the fried rice.

Well done

Found this diner while put for an early tour. Traditional diner in a vintage building lobby. The decorative lobby does add to the dining experience. Really nice, big menu. They seem pretty busy, but the staff are bustling and taking care of people quickly and pleasantly. The food was great. Highly recommended for breakfast.

Definitely consider stopping here if you are walking around the loop during breakfast time. It is a wonderful little Cafe in a beautiful building which has a tall ceiling and nice little tables. I got the eggs benedict and also a screwdriver. The screwdriver had the right kick to it to help me get through the soreness of walking over a dozen miles the day before, and the eggs Benedict were extremely flavorful. The staff were also helpful and friendly.

I had a wonderful omelette, called "veggie lovers" with onions, mushroom, spinach. I don't like bell peppers so I had them replaced with avocado. They don't accept substitutions and charged me for the avocado but it's fair enough as the omelette was simply lovely.
Courteous staff and spectacular location inside the liberty-style Pittsfield building. I'll come back!

Cool place off the beaten path a bit. True diner style where they have a bit of everything which is equally good. Definitely worth the stop. Pictures are of the French toast and one of their skillets, but you honestly can't go wrong with anything here. I personally had the Santa Fe breakfast burrito. Would do again. Also conveniently located near memorial park so you freely visit the bean after.

The staff was super friendly and welcoming! However, the cafe was pretty busy. My party and I arrived before 11AM, but by the time a waiter was able to attend to us, it was only minutes past the 11AM cut off for the specialty breakfast items. The food was good but not amazing. I noticed my avocado was a little spotty, but that's just me nitpicking. Overall, not a bad spot to eat at if you happen to be nearby!

Just a side note to anyone who is sensitive to loud noises - the staff cleaning and dumping the plates is near the seating areas, which means you can hear the dishes clattering quite often.

Stumbled onto this place with a few friends after catching a show at Concord Music Hall. It had an upscale, lounge-like vibe in line with the gentrification of Wicker Park. There was a DJ spinning with visualizations done by projection screen in the background. The Wednesday crowd was small, friendly and varied making for some interesting conversation. Drinks were priced similar to most places in Wicker Park. All in all, this is a great place to wind down after a long night out.

Great Asian fusion food...definitely try their chicken wings -- I got the Thai chili wings and the Rodan chicken wings...SOOOOOO GOOD!!! They sure present their plates so beautifully, sometimes you don't want to eat it. Staff is very friendly and helps you make choices when asked. It has a lounge feel yet it is a restaurant...they also have a humongous TV as their backdrop. I definitely recommend this place. It is very near the 3 way intersections of Milwaukee, North Ave, and Damen.

We stopped in here when we were walking around Chicago during craft beer week.  We had planned on going to a tap takeover at the Emporium Arcade but the place was far to packed so we opted out of that idea.  That aside It was a decent place to stop by.  It was a Saturday afternoon so it wasn't crowded at all.  I also liked the fact that they had lots of vegan and vegetarian options.  We ended up getting the vegan fritters and they were pretty good, though just slightly oversalted.  It seemed like t hey had a lot of interesting options on the menu though.  If I lived in the area, I would definitely make a stop back but being as I'm a suburbanite always looking for new places, I don't think I'll be back unless I happen to be strolling through the neighborhood with nothing to do.

I was there on a Saturday and my party had a great time.  Loved the food and the drinks.  I recommend the wasabi fries and i could eat them all day.  We stayed and chilled for a while after.  The ambience was  great and I liked the music.

Rodan is a great place to hang out at, drink a few drinks at, or bust a move at in the rear near the dj booth!  This place is part lounge, restaurant, and dance club (but definitely not near to being clubby at all! Thank goodness!).  The atmosphere feels very much like a NYC lounge where the hip and artsy types are to be seen. It has a very clean and minimalist interior, which was actually designed by my architect friend.  I highly recommend the lychee martini, and definitely don't forget to eat the lychee fruit in the glass!  The food is also phenomenal!

My friend and I ordered only non-meat meals. Japanese alt and pepper tofu was more eggy, soft but with a strong garlic flavor the basil vegetable tofu tasted like it sounded. The fresh tofu spring rolls were amazing

The food and drinks were good. Everything came out hot! SERVICE ON THE OTHER HAND HORRIBLE. it was 4 adults 1 child. The host was not friendly at all. I asked how long the wait, all he said was "we will call you". It got worst from there. The waitress we had, had no sort of customer service. I asked her how her day was She completely ignored me, just said are you ready or not. Never came to check on us if we needed anything or how the food was. We had to ask others for what we needed. I saw her tend to other tables way better. Mind you, they were Caucasian  and WE ARE Hispanics. Seem like she assumed we weren't going to tip from the beginning. Coming from a waitress I hate assuming, you work for tips and if your attentiveness is on the low end then yes, your tips SHOULD SUFFER. Like I said, it was only 4 adults and a child. Gratuity was automatically added which I usually don't mind. But it hurt me tipping her. To top everything off she threw the cashed out check on the table as she walk by. Never stopping to say anything else. I mean LITERALLY THREW IT. If you don't mind having the worst service of your life, then I say go for it.
We visited here on a recommendation from a tour we took. The food was delicious! The portions are big, you can definitely share them and the price was perfect. A must visit in Chinatown!

Joy yee has made a name for itself in Chinatown for sure.  I remember when it used to be a tiny little restaurant.  They have a huge menu for food and boba tea.  I was a little disappointed by the food maybe because I was expecting more authentic tasting food and not just something I can whip up at home.  The bubble tea cup portion was way too big.  The rose bubble tea was okay.  Not much tea taste but I could taste some kind of syrup.

Tried their pineapple coconut freeze, mango guava freeze and avocado freeze. The avocado freeze stood out from the rest! Definitely worth visiting if you're in Chinatown. The quantity of their shakes is too much that it can almost be a meal alternative. Service was too quick despite the crowd.

Cipriani's or "Cip's" is a great little pizza place. I always order the breaded steak sandwich with mozzarella, and a side of hot giardiniera. The stuffed pizza is always excellent no matter if we dine in or carry out. The service is great, the owners are great and we always leave extremely satisfied. Two thumbs way up !!! 👍👍

Our new favorite place for pizza. Love the sauce on stuffed pizza.. it doesn't taste like they poured thick spaghetti sauce. It's light has great flavor. The prices are good, best part the crust is light and crispy.  We made the switch from chain restaurant because pizza was always under cooked. Not the case here theirs has been perfect everytime. We order normally once a week and they don't disappoint. This is a small family owned business,  you'll be thankful you made the switch. Delicious and great service.....

Just had 12” Thin crust  Cipriani's Special.
Excellent pizza and actually all my favorite ingredients ( Sausage, mushroom, green pepper, onion).
Excellent crust with thick layer of fresh ingredients, under the layer of high quality cheese...
Great flavors, REAL Pizza, cooked to perfection.
Nice place to sit down and eat.
Great service, also from wonderful owners that are always there.  RECOMMENDED.

Pizza was great.  However we really wanted deep dish, but were informed that that would be around a 45 minute wait.  It was getting late and we had a rowdy toddler who needed a nap so we got a thin crust which was a 20 ish minute wait.  You should totally go here, but call your order in so you don’t have to wait a long time for deep dish pizza.  We got a pepperoni onion and garlic pizza.  Double the garlic for next time.

I order a medium sausage pizza. And order of bread mushrooms and zucchini and fries. Food was cold the fries were recooked you can tell by all the burn one's I took a picture if you would like to see it. Just because I ordered my food at 815pm. You throw all the leftover fries from the day. And pass them on to your next customer my bill was $33. +tip. Bad food then your suppose to eat your family that mess

First time at Smoke Daddy and we enjoyed it. The pulled pork Carolina style was huge! I’m generally not a fan of vinegar based coleslaw but this paired perfectly with the pork. The beans. THE BEANS!!! They stole the show! Smoked beans with pulled pork and brisket with an incredibly delicious sauce! Outstanding! Good service and reasonably priced for the portions.

Drinks: the bloody Mary is seriously one of the best I've ever had. It comes with a rib and a little mini beer.

The pull meat nachos (w/ pork) is a 10/10! Absolutely delicious. Also the wings are 🔥.

I'm 100% returning to this restaurant for more bbq!

I have frequented this place many times but finally wanted to leave a review.  Best burnt ends in all the city and the half order of nachos is a perfect snack with a cold pour!! Gona keep on coming in until they stop serving burnt ends!

Easily the second best bbq in the city. Very simple straight forward menu.

Half and full racks of ribs. St Louis style, baby back ribs, rib tips. I personally liked the St Louis style more than baby back. Both were very good.

I also tried the brisket. Really my favorite thing there.

I got colered greens, baked beans, coslaw, and sweet potato fries.all were good the backed beans definitely took the win.

Got the mezcal margarita with a jalapeno in it. Very tasty and smoky. Not that study which is good. I took the jalapeno out. It added a subtle flavor to it.

Had an amazing experience here for a group of five.  Literally everything was perfect.  We got the giant meat platter, I forgot what it was called, but you should get that!  Our waitress gave us plenty of white bread and napkins and was very attentive!
Amazing neighborhood pub with great food and an awesome UK heavy beer list. Two fireplaces, no tvs, no frills, and always a good time! Wednesdays and Fridays it’s all you can eat fish n chips!

I tried Belhaven Twisted Thistle & Belhaven Scottish Ale. Both was the best beer I’ve ever had.
It taste fresh, smooth & homemade & was told one of them was a 300 yr old recipe, just top-notch.
Zoey was nice, beer knowledgeable & attentive.
Friday all you can eat fish was ok, it could’ve been thicker and less on the greasy side. The peas was cooked perfectly. I would definitely return for the beers. They also are scotch friendly.

Wentnon a Wednesday, only one server and one cook, so service was slow, but the food was delicious. Everyone really liked the fish and chips, the haggis burger was delicious and the veggie sandwich came with more fresh veggies than any sandwich any of us had ever seen! Great value. Pretty nice beer garden as well

Disappointed at a weeknight, 928pm "sorry our kitchen is closed" walkin experience. The last time I was in I sat at the bar and was kinda ignored. Despite these sins, I have been coming here for over 30 years. It has been one of my favorite pubs in the city. Amazing fish and chips, duke salad, and sticky pudding. Great endless scotch list, and the servers are generally very attentive, even if the bartenders can be a little arrogant. Their food quality is extremely consistent and delicious.

Best Scotch selection I've found in Chicago. Also really good food. Can't believe that I've lived in this neighborhood for a few years without coming here... if you live nearby, don't make the same mistake. I'll definitely be back.

Great local bar with friendly staff and a pet friendly patio. I think they have some of the best wings in the city (top 5). Their bangers and burgers are great as well. Love the beer rotation on tap and sports on the tv’s if that’s your thing. Always have a good time and great meal here.

Ordered delivery from this place and the food arrived in great condition! The duck grinder was absolutely amazing. So incredibly tasty. Kind of like a duck sausage deconstructed, but better because it tasted less heavy and more well balanced. Definitely going to order again!

Great local Fulton Market neighborhood tavern. Quick service, friendly staff, good beers, typical bar food, friends enjoyed mixed drinks. Buffalo Cauliflower is spicy hot! In & outside seating. Accessible with a little help.

This is my favorite neighborhood bar. Their food is amazing and their service is great. GrubHub messed up my order and they were incredibly kind and quick to make it right for me. I've been coming for a while since I moved to the neighborhood and every experience has been awesome. This one in particular was the cherry on top. And of course, my meal was delicious as always. They are responsible for converting me from a steak fry hater to a believer.

Just went there with our baby who was very well behaved. They told us we had to wait for a table and then gave away open tables to 20 something  year olds that came well after us. When we approached them they told us we still had to wait. Shouldn’t treat customers differently because they have children and just want a night out. Staff was SO rude and inconsiderate. Maybe also because I’m a person of color and white customers were given tables before me? No idea.

❣️ BYOB.  Excellent Menu.  Now that I have $7.50 from Rewards based from ONE visit, I will be back for more. 😋 ❤️❤️ The Menu with photos.

I ordered the SALMON FANS SET for amusement that is met with excitement (probably the only minty Perilla leaf I know that is served with sushi.  It shows Chef's sophisticated taste and flavor).  Perilla Leaf is not necessarily t.h.a.t expensive but, it's hard to find (HMart).

LARGE SASHIMI PLATTER is a better value when you order a side dish of sushi rice, b.u.t ... I can't eat raw fish that much as it's an acquired taste, not brought up with it.  So, I happily settled with LARGE SUSHI PLATTER.  Note, the spec of herb or sesame on sushi matters as it enhances flavor a bit.  You may omit 😮 soy sauce if you wish as there is a wasabi dot in between rice and fish. 🥰

Excellent thoughtful service. 👍👍

The sushi was good, you can bring your own alcohol!
The problem is the service, way too slow.
I don’t recommend the vegetables with peanut butter it’s gross.

service was amazing and prices are right. We ordered the midnight sundae specialty roll which was like nothing I’ve ever had at a sushi place. So imaginative and playful and the flavors just hit! Great neighborhood spot I’ll definitely be frequenting.

Did the dine in and the delivery.
Both times sushi were very good! Fresh and delicious. The two things I dislike are that there is really VERY little rice on sushi ( I love little rice but it’s really like super little 😄) and that there is not enough  variety of rolls ( like no rolls with mango and sweet sauces, or poor choices for really spicy ones).

My boyfriend and I went for a quick bite and had a great dinner experience! The BYOB was awesome and they had tons of vegan/vegetarian options for me. Service was good, vegetable gyoza was delicious, and the plant based tuna was unique. We ordered the fresh wasabi too which was something we had never tried before. We will definitely be back!

All of the clinicians have truly helped me gain all of the tools I need to get through the hard obstacles of life. Instead of using drugs. After a short time here, about 2 months, I feel amazing!!!  I, with the help of their staff, have found myself again and it feels great. Thank you, thank you, thank you for all of the help. It changed my life.

This place is great.  I've had the shawarma several times and it never disappoints.  The new owners made a good decision to do use their wall space to display local artists, they have a lot of cool canvases for sale in there.  Good location and good hours.

Never disappointed when I go here. I don't regularly eat burgers from fast-food chains or very often. But Five Guys is one of two go-tos in the city. My favorite is the Little Cheeseburger - "All the Way." Food is always consistently well prepared and staff members are always friendly and fun. Glad to be able to dine in and enjoy the peanuts again!

It's five guys, good burgers that always meet your expectations. Always order the small fries as they'll throw in a lot of extra fries in your bag. It's not the best burger shop but it's consistent among its different locations. Much better than McDonald's, burger king, Carl's jr or any other big chain.

Ordered a small bacon cheeseburger “all the way toppings” today, a banana chocolate shake, and small Cajun fry.

I got my milkshake, and burger. And left for home and checked my bag and saw that I never got my fries that I ordered! So basically I got ripped off, and payed for a full on meal with an item missing. Literally the fries are right next to the pick up booth, and it says in big letters on my food ticket “one small Cajun fry”. How hard can it be to remember to put it in my bag?

Was too upset to go back for them to finally put fries in my bag, and ended up just forgetting about that and eating my burger at home! And today the bun was kinda dry/toasted like which they never do. Weird????

The people working there were friendly yet not paying proper attention to the orders. I clearly said I wanted fries with my burger, and never got no fries.
The lady that handed me my bag was friendly and complemented my vans shoes(which is nice) but at least you could’ve put fries with my burger???

Very unprofessional and rude! The first young lady that took my order was very rude for no reason. After I made my first order I got back in line to order something else and the second lady that took my order was rude to me as well! Never going back. The food and service is NOT worth it.

A little bacon burger and fry will run you about $13. The menu is a la carte so you can order a burger, shake, or fries. The burger was messy  and deliciously satisfying. The fries were equally good, not greasy and salted to perfection. The staff were friendly and moved the orders quickly. This is a burger spot you want to stumble across.

Extremely friendly service and speedy orders and food delivery. There's often a very fine line between bothering the people eating and being nowhere to be seen as a waiter. This place perfectly rode that line for wonderful customer experience. The drinks were served in beautiful containers and glasses and the food was delicious.
Fun place. Great food and drink selection. The staff is friendly and helpful. Looking forward to trying out the large outdoor space when the weather gets better.

The food was ok. I had the skillet and my friend had the boneless wings (half buffalo and half sweet and sour). The wings were fried nicely. The coating was crunchy. The sauce, however, was another thing. I despise anything spicy but the buffalo sauce was not spicy, which is bad if you want spicy wings. Secondly the sweet-and-sour wings were not sweet or sour. They had a weird taste that I can’t necessarily describe. The skillet was fine. I hate beans but the black beans inside of the skillet were refreshing, more  cheese and eggs could’ve been used. Additionally, shredded hash browns or roasted potatoes would’ve been a better option instead of smashed tater tots as the potato. My service was great.

I would say 4.5 stars.  The outside patio was lovely.  The staff from the time you walk in until done with your dinner was a pleasure.  I loved my kale salad, as did my wife her pear and Brie salad; I would have liked a smaller salad as our’s were a bit too large.  My pork belly and her elk meatloaf were very enjoyable.  They have a good wine list and very reasonable corkage fee.  We would eat there again. I probably would give it a 5 star rating if the dishes were just some how a little stepped up, I don’t know what I am looking for other than missing the Wow factor.  Nevertheless, I would return without reservation over and over again for really a first class meal and absolutely great people from the greeter to the person bringing the bill, and everyone in between.
Delicious food and great service at a wonderful neighborhood bar... amazing cheese curds

Local Root is great sustainable delicious dining. Everything is locally sourced and they tell you the farms the animals and produce are from.  They recycle and have a zero waste kitchen! I recently went here for brunch. The ham feta and spinach omelette is delicious. I will definitely be back. The atmosphere is great-- it feels very cozy and homey. The only reason it's 4 stars instead of 5 is the prices are a bit high for breakfast, but it's understandable with everything being super fresh and local. They also have gluten free bread options FYI! Check it out!

I absolutely loved being at Local Root! I was visiting the city to see an opera, and had heard about how great this restaurant is. I went with my mother, and we were both very impressed by the delightful service and the quality of the food. I'm positive that everything on the menu is fantastic! The menu was creative and very appealing, which made choosing what to order a little difficult, and I ended up getting a fruity eggplant sandwich and a bowl of delicious chicken noodle + vegetable soup. My favorite tastes there were ginger ale and the amazing blueberry ice cream. Local Root is wonderful not only because of the food and atmosphere, but because of how Earth-friendly they are. They are extremely responsible and efficient with waste, and recycle more than any business I know of. I have been recommending this place to my friends traveling to Chicago ever since.

Best Chicken and Waffles I've had in the city, add a stellar bloody mary to the mix and you have my favorite low key brunch spot. I love the idea behind this place too, locally sourced, zero waste. You can feel good while eating a delicious meal.

The Yolk was packed so we came here for brunch. Pineapple and Jalapeno Margarita sounded a little weird at first, but it was a great choice to nurse a hangover. The pulled pork Benedict was amazing, I didn't even think pork would go well with that. A great restaurant, I will be back next time I'm in Chicago.

Pretty cool atmosphere.

Food was not worth the listed price.  Paid 14$ for a burger that I had asked for medium rare, but came back as medium well-done.  The fries that came with, half was in bits and pieces.  Significant other ordered the Parmesan Tower which used the same goat cheese filling as their Stuffed Portobello. Also, 6$ dollars for a can of Fat Tire.

New favorite ! All you can eat and BYOB sushi place with an extensive menu. The eel and salmon nigiri are amazing! (The tuna one is not good) We ordered different rolls, dumplings, gyozas, tempura an seaweed salad. I will definitely come again (and again).

We $35 each with %18 service fee (they include it if you’re five or more people)
Sushi was great and came in a timely manner. Had a nice window view and very affordable! Make sure you’re eyes aren’t too big for your stomach because you gotta eat all you order 😋🍣

Delicious all you can eat sushi with amazing service. The location is super convenient and the close location to the park provides your party ample opportunity to talk off all you eat..

The sashimi and nigiri are exceptionally fresh and we had great results with classic rolls including eel, soft shell crab, tuna, and salmon.

Great place for all you can eat sushi! Try their salmon, white tuna, eel and grilled squid. The fish is fresh and the rice to fish ratio is good as well.

The fish is fresh and flavorful, the cuts are thick and rice is the right amount. There is also an appetizer, the grilled squid that is great.  Perfect octopus, char and lemon combination.

The atmosphere is a bit old but I don't mind. The service is pretty quick and friendly. Coastal cities have better sushi but this is still pretty good for AYCE sushi in Chicago.

If you're in the area definitely try them out!
Amazing fresh sushi 🍣 all you can eat! Great service as well. Wish to have this restaurant closer 🤪

I didn’t expect to have the best Alfredo sauce of my life at the historical home of a major sweets chain.

The ratio of pasta to sauce, and of ingredients within the sauce itself, was perfect.
Just enough bread provided to mop up all the remaining sauce, and a side salad to serve as intermission for the heavy taste showed just how thoughtful the folks here are with their menu design. 5/5.

Their espresso is rather expensive, but par for course with many other places in Chicago.

Real Italian pastries and cakes. Had my wife's birthday cake ordered and the flavor and quality were astonishing, this place is now my first go-to place for cake orders. Had also some italian pastry, coffee and some sandwiches that were highly appreciated. They have a selection of main courses too that I haven't  tried yes, but by the look and smell I watched from the tables nearby, I would try next time I will be there.

This Italian bakery is worth the price. This is a neighborhood staple. I see more people for their food rather than their sweets. Its a great place to eat and feel like home. Their chicken sandwiches and salads are great. In addition, I believe you can guy their marinara sauce, meat balls and etc.

This is one of the most authentic and delicious Italian bakery style restaurant in the country. The gnocchi are phenomenal, the sandwiches are fresh, big and fantastic. The food salads are incredible. From lunch to catering, this is a great Italian restaurant
I really love this place, but today I ordered a beef & sausage sandwich to go, but I didn't get the sausage,

I get lunch from here fairly frequently while at work and haven't been let down yet. My orders are consistently well prepared, on time, and delicious and I have no complaints about the restaurant. I would say that the restaurant's storefront and entry are a little strange, but that matters little compared to the good food.
This place has amazing seafood.  Estilo "costa de Guerrero México " The coast of Mexico near Acapulco.  Their Caldos are amazing. Service is very good.  It is BYOB.
Food was good. And its BYOB so even better. Camarones aguachiles were awsome. A good place to bring your family or just chill with friends

If you are looking for some authentic ethnic food around Chicago, at an affordable price; this place is perfect!

Also its BYOB.
Food is great.

Melt in your mouth rib tips, premium ingredients and generous portions add up to a great experience at Muchies Gyros & Pizza.  Nice folks behind the counter will make certain you are happy with your order.  Go Muchies !!
I love their food it's sooo good..very delicious!! 5 forks up very clean in the restaurant!! Smells so clean great service!!

Accommodated my request for 1/2 chicken 1/2 regular gyro plate. Very welcoming and clean establishment with fast courteous service.
Visited after work today and got a giant gyro sandwich, ate half and was full. Looks like a have lunch tomorrow. Awesome service and portions, worth the money for sure.
Solid munchies! Well priced, quality service, good food.
I sometimes come here for gyros after climbing at Avondale. If you're hungry looking for a cheap and heavy hit of carbs / fat / salt, then I highly recommend.

The food was good. Not as good as Rosco's in LA but good. But the service wasn't that great. We we're waiting for the other half of our party to arrive so they didn't seat us right away. They eventually seated us because my mom wanted some coffee but they did not refill her coffee and they didn't have hot tea, not even hot water. It seemed liked they were rushing us out. Sorry, I didn't get a chance to take pictures of our food.

Food is so amazing! I ordered the Monique with a side order of home fries. Best home fries I’ve had in my life! Waffle batter was flavorful and thick, so yummy. Employees are attentive, great service. Told my friends we need to come for dinner! I’d love to try their mac and cheese, corn bread and so much more. Recommend, 10/10

Vacation in Chicago, had to stop at Chicago's Home of the Chicken & Waffles. It's a soul food spot owned by a Black Man. Food tastes as if his Momma or Grandmother taught this man how to cook. 💣 food. Cool atmosphere. No complaints. For Dessert try the peach cobbler a la mode. 🔥🔥🔥🔥.

We had a pleasant experience at the restaurant. There were some downfalls on the service side, cause it was very slow, and we waited 50 minutes till the server realized that she messed up our order, and it didn’t reach the kitchen. And in the meantime, no refill of coffee or other interactions. Against that the food was quite good. I liked the greens the most, as they were heavily and good seasoned. The Chicken was perfectly fried, just the waffle could have had some more flavor - it fell flat against the other dishes. Also the cornbread was extremely dry, some little moisture would soften it up and be more pleasant to eat, then just picking up dry crumbs. If the service and minor food issues are fixed, the restaurant is definitely up for a five star rating.

The food used to be great here but my chicken, grits and waffle didn't come out hot which makes me think the plate was sitting for awhile and then they added the eggs with cheese which was good.  The chicken didn't have that great seasoned taste it used to.

Decided to try this spot out on a whim. This is a nice cozy place that serves a solid breakfast.  The server was very friendly and very attentive.
