There is a homemade sauce that was brought out with the food, which is pretty good. Tried the country fried steak, which was pretty tasty.  Most importantly it wasn't overly expensive. The meal filled me up for the rest of the day, so you do get more bang for your buck.

Just discovered this spot a few weeks ago.. Visited 3 times that first week.. lol Already my new favorite breakfast spot..! 15min walk from my house.. This is my new go to when I want great comfortable food in a relaxing local diner feel.. Excellent service each n every time.! Food comes out prompt! Can't go wrong w/ the Steak skillet or the Smokey Mountains(a pile of B&G w/ bacon & eggs right on top..!!) The Chicken sandwich.. 🔥🔥
*pictured* Country fried steak, pancakes & Portobello skillet..

The waitress suggested the portobello skillet and it was so delicious!! I will definitely come back for that. The service was great, it's a diner, so nothing fancy, but food was good. My son had simple eggs, sausage and hash browns and he ate everything, quite a shocker!! Only thing was the coffee was a bit too acidic for me. Not sure what kind they serve.
Luckily Whisk was cash only, so we got to try this delicious place and skillet. Will be back.
Great food and specials. We had a 12 person party and they were able to seat us all right away. Fantastic service and speed.

My wife and I have been in the neighborhood for a few years now, and we only regret we didn't try this place sooner! Family run, incredible food, and outstanding service - it has amazing little dinner atmosphere but the food is 10/10. The steak skillet was fantastic but Celine + the service were even better.
Food was very fresh and tasty. We went at Iftaar time and the restaurant was full packed. It took a while for the food to be served due to low staff but everything was fresh..
Absolutely amazing food. Service wasn’t amazing but the food made up for it. I think our waiter was just inexperienced but he was nice and corrected any mistakes. Everything we had was good.
First time trying Yemenite food.We went for dinner and ordered Adeni tea and Haneeth. Both foods are delicious and tasty. loved the tea.

Ordered a pickup, the bread was burnt with a big whole in it🤷🏻‍♂️! Only got half the bread with my order. Rest of the items were ok. This location is nothing like original spot, so be careful and do check your order when picking up. Had to write this review just for bad customer service. Take a look at the naan I got in my order. Really Bad experience

The Fahsa is amazing! I had it at a Yemeni restaurant in Jordan once and it was one of my favorite dishes I’ve ever eaten. I was so happy to find it again! It was absolutely perfectly delicious at Sheeba Mandi House! Plus the take out was a big portion :D

Served chicken raw in inside It was still blood in the hot wings I took them back to get a refund. Drive thru cashier said your money will be back in a couple of day depending on your bank. I replied that's it he said Yes. I said wow no apologies no aim sorry would u like something else  then the cashier next to him said people only going to be more irritating on Monday since it's the holiday no one cooks anymore!! How am I irritating when y'all sold me raw chicken. These ppl need serious lesson in customer service!!!

The cashier is very rude and disrespectful. See looks to old to be having a attitude with a paying customer I just wanted to look at my food before she closed the box because my chicken doesn’t always be right and when I seen it I ask her did anything come up off the frier fresh . She had a nasty attitude and tell me that I have to stand there for awhile which was unnecessary because I know there is a wait. This is not the first time I had problems with this KFC PLUS THE FOOD WAS  TERRIBLE.

This location was very fast and efficient. Nicole was GREAT!!! She even spoke to my baby who was in the backseat yelling HIIIII to her! She really made me change the way I look at KFC in a positive way
Mistaken my order. Replace my thighs with drumsticks. Everything is too salty; it’s like drinking seawater. The chicken seems old and preserved.
I like chicken and mashed potatoes so I usually go there on Sundays.  Today food was overcooked.  Also had an incident of fraudulent activity after going through drive through

Now it's hard to take a good photos of an Al's beef sandwich bit the flavours are just amazing!! I had it dipped in gravy with fries on the side and was one of the best sandwiches I have ever eaten! My mouth is watering even now just thinking about it!
If you are in Chicago, you gotta have an Al's beef sandwich!

Founded 1938….
Italian beef is delicious.melt in your mouth tender,beautifully seasoned,maybe a little salty Fries are delicious.Fizzy coke perfection.Outdoor seating perfect for people watching.
Decor outdated and a bit of a turnoff.Off street parking for only -5 minutes makes the place a bit rushed.
Service good.Pricing expensive,almost $17 for a beef,fries and a coke.
AWARDED 2 YUMS ON A SCALE OF 3

It was closing time and the Italian Beef didn’t taste like it was fresh. It was ok, but will definitely go back earlier in the day. Customer Service was great and friendly. My only options to order was Italian beef and polish. Fries were not an option as it was to late.

I was so mezmorized by this beef Sammy. Not a word was spoken during the ingestion. Next time I'd do without the pepper. A lot of fries were given. Got a sausage as well and it was great. Definately a stop next time I'm in town

First time at this location, was greeted right a way with a friendly hello, the vibrant smell of fries and the  grill cooking was fabulous.
Ordered the hot dog and fries, combo with a graveyard bread.
Hot dog was cooked  perfecly with just the right amount of mustered and onions.
Fries were piping hot with a  hint of salt.
Ordered the gravy bread juicy and was very happy with the overall experience.

Definitely pricey, like what everyone else has been saying.  However, the lunch specials aren't bad, with most items under $9.  I really enjoyed the empanadas, they had a very buttery crust with well seasoned stuffings.  I was unimpressed with the Cuban sandwich, but liked the crispiness of the bread.  I'll go back but probably will try some of the main dishes rather than the sandwiches.

Food was excellent and for the area I thought the price was just right. I've never had fried yucca before and it turns out to be a great french fry replacement. I highly recommend the cubano sandwich with an iced coffee!

This place has scrumptious empanadas.
I also tried the papa rellena and ropa vieja sándwich, which were both full of flavor.

I saved the best for last, a delicious guava and cheese empanada. 🤤 (sry no picture of that one)

It's brightly decorated, almost like if you were outside. It's also brightly lit. It was empty except a group of four people when I visited. Lots of choices, not being super hungry I went for empanadas and yucca fries. Chicken empanadas were great, the cheese and guava one was weird which I knew but still wanted to try. The yucca fries, meh. My friend said her steak was really good. No drinks though so that's a bummer.
Excellent Cuban food.  The best cafe con leche ever.

I had the garlic shrimp and I have to say, it was one of the best sandwiches I have had in a while. The flavors are more of an Asian fusion. I could taste sesame in the dips and the fries as well. The fries are ok, better than many other places with good seasoning. The only issue I had was it leaves a sweet taste in the mouth like fries from any other place. Five guys Cajun style is the best fries hands down

Their Korean beef (bulgogi) Philly style cheese steak was really good. Amazing sauces with the fries though expensive (4.50 for the fries). Their sandwiches come with chips but I don't think I saw that on the menu, happy surprise. Very good chips, had a sweet taste.

I first heard about Zenwich from my coworker who insisted that I try the spicy garlic shrimp sandwich that he got from there-- it definitely was more delicious than I was expecting, given that it was 1.) just a sandwich and 2.) seafood in the Midwest. Went back to try the Mu Ping and was slightly disappointed since my first experience was so good. There was just too much going on in the Mu Ping-- too many veggies and the pork was too fatty for my liking. I ordered the calamari strips too-- the calamari wasn't of the best quality-- I wouldn't know it was calamari unless you told me! Also, it was too breaded and oily for my liking. But yes, I know I ordered those deep fried, so I should have expected, but I still didn't like it.

Homemade, seasoned chips come with every sandwich order, which is pretty darn good.

I'll probably come back and try the pork katsu or crab cake next. My friend got the Korean cheesesteak, which was pretty damn good!

I used to patronize their original location often when I worked in Elmhurst. It takes a deft culinary hand to pull off fusion, but Zenwich does it over and over again with their delicious sandwiches, homemade sides, and soups. Try the Mu Ping (spicy breaded pork) or the Joesplosion (chicken satay) sandwiches and ask for homemade potato chips on the side! These guys love what they do and it shows in both the food and the service.

I am really getting annoyed with this place closing early then the regular scheduled time. I work right around the corner. I take my lunch at 2p. They are suppose close at 2:30 pm. But when I get there at approximately 2:05 they're already closing. This has happened the last few times I have attempted to eat there.

Not a good experience. The person taking the order was on her phone while taking the order. Waited 15 minutes for my drink to get severed, and ask twice about my breakfast sandwich before getting it 30 minutes later. People after me got their orders before me. They need to work on their teamwork and costumer services skills.

This location on Lake between State and Wabash. Is nice, good coffee, when you ask for extra, extra,extra,extra cream they do provide it. Would be nice if they could carry some milk in their pop/soda fridge. It's all juice, pop/soda maybe just one row would do.
I'm very grateful for this Dunkin donuts the food Is great. By the way you guys have beautiful female employees. I truly just want to say thank you for the service.
The coffee is water down. It doesn't have a strong coffee taste. They do not asks how many sugars or creams you want in the coffee. They automatically only put one of each. This coffee tasted awful.

Very bad customer service. Not clean. Limited food/
Limited coffee items. Coffee mechanic is down all the time

Overall mid experience. Server forgot about us for awhile (understaffed) eventually our food came, cheesy garlic bread was good but my medium steak was very close to well done. I wouldn’t rush back, guess I m should’ve tried the pizza instead. Ribs were good

First time visiting here! Excellent customer service from entrance to our waiter. Ordered a small build your own deep dish pizza: mushrooms, spinach, pepperoni. This was the best tasting pizza I’ve had in a while. It’s sooooo filling. My BF and I shared a small and I could barely finish the second slice. A personal deep dish is probably enough for two to eat off of. Thanks to the kind and knowledgeable transit driver for the recommendation.

We had a decent experience overall. The staff was friendly and kept us informed.  We had to wait a bit for the food because there was full and the pizza takes time. The decor takes you back to an era where you had to hide to drink.  If you have some time feel free to move on in.
Nice well-known local establishment, dates back to Al Capone's Chicago. Great memorabilia on the walls. Stopped for a takeout pizza, that was helpful, price was okay, service good.

Back in Chicago from Ireland. I think I grew gills from all the fried fish I ate! It was great but I needed pizza!!  The deep dish pizza here is so damn good!  I had never tried it here until my partner introduced it to me about 4 months ago.  I was wowed!  So so good!  I burned my tongue last night, of course.  Can't wait to go back with my honey, but until then, I have the other half of last night's pizza waiting for me in the fridge!!

We got the perch basket. The fish was flavorful and crispy! The dinner basket I think includes coleslaw, which ours did not. The fries were crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside with so much flavor! I would definitely recommend this place and come here again. The service was friendly and very quick!

Love the food here but something always goes wrong with online orders. Today, they only started making it when I walked in, and there was only two people in there before me. They also left sizable bones in my boneless chicken, and it was supposed to just to be lemon pepper but I got this instead.

Still, a good warm meal; Just wrong, and DRENCHED in this sauce.

Every time I have a large event I come to this JJ, owner and staff are reliable and the food is amazing. One time I had an event when this store was closed and the owner and his wife came in to ensure my event was successful. 10/10 I recommend!
I feel bad for small business during this hard time. The  food is so nice and warm and the price is affordable. People working here really friendly as well.
Love me some JJs but they forgot my coleslaw (sad face) and i live far other thn that awesome place!

The employees might have kept some money for themselves.
I was charged $10 more.
I bought the special combo without the soda.
It would have been cheaper to buy things separately.
They gave me to receipts.
But my bank account showed I was charged the bigger amount..
Makes me wonder if there's a way for them to keep the money to themselves. Where they report in the system the lesser amount but charge the customer the bigger amount?
Either way they stole $10 from me.

Don't go through the drive thru, went today and I wasn't able to look at the menu. The cashier kept on rushing me and I kept telling her to give me a minute and still was rushing me. We left I called to speak to the manager and told me she was the manager. Don't believe she was she sounded uneducated, rude, also ghetto. Never again!
Good service food was good we were speaking Spanish before ordering and the cashiers heard us and when we where ready to order she spoke to us on Spanish thank you.

I was Coming In And Sat At My Favorite Spot Not It's Block One Worker That Block From Sitting There Said was Going To Clean it But They Never Clean It Since l Sat In My Favorite Spot !  I am Not Coming In Thete any More !

I ordered two crispy jrs, not rubber jrs, jeez almost broke a tooth. I don’t know how old these patties are but I know they’re disgusting, not to mention Burger King stole a value fry from me without giving me a receipt!
This place is employed by lazy thieves.

I am from Taiwan, aka seafood paradise. I didn't expect to get good quality sushi with reasonable price in the US. I have tried a lot and they are all rather disappointing. But this sushi restaurant is absolutely excellent! Their butter scallops are amazing and their rolls are fantastic. I particularly love the roll that is salmon with lemon slice (forgot the name). So fresh, sooooooo good!

However, I prefer their rolls rather than their nigiri. Ordered some shrimp nigiri before, not as good as their rolls. But their rolls...Every single one is awesome!

Food: 4
Decor: 3
Service: 4

3.5 stars, rounding up.

Our group of 4 decided to come here for dinner since the Toro Sushi wait was an hour, and I had to catch a flight.

1. Crazy eel, 11
Fresh Water Eel, Cilantro, Avocado, Cucumber, Spicy Mayo, Scallions Topped w. Mango & eel sauce.
~Not bad, although it wasn't as good as Toro. Mango was a nice addition.

I used to live around the corner, and Ponzu is so good that even though I moved away I still come back. Their best dish is the smokey tataki roll. It has seared salmon on top and is absolutely amazing. They took it off the menu at one point, but made it upon our request. Also, it's BYOB! :)

I wasn't all that impressed. I'm not a big fan of sushi in general, but my friends got me to try it. Seemed like we waited quite a while, but I can't be a great judge considering I'm not a sushi person :)
Had a great sushi selection. It has one of the greatest philly roels in the city. I definitely recommend trying this place!

We Love Moes. We been going there for about 6 yrs love the space, the music, the food and the drinks. We been here since our 20's  and still is our # 1place to go for night out for my wife and I and friends. In the summer the rooftop is the best. The people that work there are nice, never had a problem. I can say that it gets busy but never over pack. 10 🌟

Great food and beverages,music, sport screens, great servers bartenders, managers Nice. We were very satisfied with our visit weekends are very busy thumbs up 👍.
Good experience to me I don't use to go often outside, now I want to dabble more to know the city of Chicago and make more friends  to know and have good time again.

The ambient is great. But you have to pay 20 to only get inside, it doesn't include any drink with your payment.  Also good music, however it closes super early! How can you stop the music at 1 am on a Friday night and start to kick all people out rudely? It supposedly closes at 2 am on Fridays... I feel scammed and also I was forced to drink very fast before I leave (was either that or throw away the drink I have just bought). I won't come back to this place anymore

I enjoyed going there for an event. It was a nice Rooftop & good ambiance. The bartenders could of done a better job. It's one of the better bars on Clark Ave. in my opinion. I would definitely come back.

We all paid $20 to get in we had one friend that is really loud by nature and they wouldn’t let him in cuz he was too drunk even though he was babysitting all of us. When we talked to the manager he said we could all go in but the lady at the front that was charging everyone one said we all had to pay again cuz she only remembered the birthday girls so we all left and it was a waste of our money. I used to love this place because of the music but they really screwed us over this time. Never going back again.

Let’s start by the facts !
First is this house in between two sky scrapers about less the a ft apart , have you seen the movie up! ? Well kinda like that I think that’s pretty cool.

The atmosphere is very cozy and elegant , I almost felt like a general walking inside  a military building well organized and respectful.

We were taken to the upstairs room a bit mor private and we went because it was my wife’s birthday ,
The menu is simple is a 4-5 course menu and you get to pick out of 2-3 choices  for each section .
Appetizer
Soup or salad
Main entree
Desert

I would suggest to order the oysters  or the foie gras!
Absolutely amazing !
The Foie Gras is a sweeter dish. With a  good balance of sweet , sour an salty !

Next I would get the  the mushroom soup if fenomenal ! Almost feels like a crea of mushroom but with out any cream the texture is soft and snappy!

Then I suggest get the lamb ! Omg it actually brought a tear or two  while eating it was expertly cooked I got mine medium rare and was on point ! Also the fish comes with a red wine sauce which out of this world ! Make sure you order enough bread to  help you clean the plate out of that sauce !

Also to my knowledge the chef is well known for his sauces so I highly recommend any dish with a sauce.

Overall it was a great experience very private and cozy ! Excellent for a romantic getaway or even just for a relaxed night.
The food is amazing  and very unique . I have eaten in many places in France including Eiffel Tower tour  54 restaurants and this is by far one of the best French restaurants I have attended .

100% recommended well worth every dollar

Some high end restaurants leave you wondering “was it worth it?”  Not Los Nomades.  The building is elegant.  The staff, from the friendly greeting and all through, are pitch-perfect in being sensitive to not interrupt conversations, but still attentive.  And the food is outstanding, every dish.  The bill was indeed high, but seems a bargain for a restaurant that does everything excellently.  For a special event, or if you can afford it more often, Les Nomades is definitely worth it.
Perfect service of superb French food in an upscale townhouse off North Michigan Avenue.

Disappointed,  my husband made reservations a couple of weeks ago with the owner for a wine pairing/tasting menu, however,  when we got there we were told they didn't do a tasting menu???  We did the prix fix menu which was mostly tasty except for the overcooked lobster, the souffle was fantastic!  Our server Josie was lovely and did an amazing job.   Stuffy atmosphere.   We cannot recommend this restaurant.

My favorite restaurant in all Chicago. A must for anyone who appreciates truly gourmet food, professional service and quiet, relaxed atmosphere. Great place to enjoy exquisite menu over conversation friends or colleagues, or a romantic dinner.  Every year I come to Chicago since 2014 - Les Nomades is my number 1 choice for dinner.

Firstly, this is a no-frills diner and at my visit did not allow any dine-in option though there is room for counter service.  But besides that, their famous corn-beef sandwich rivals some of the best deli spots in Chicago.  Dont overlook their breakfast sandwiches, their fried egg sandwich with bacon is really well made and they dont skimp on that bacon.  This diner is not in your upscale neighborhood, but its really quite a hidden gem in the city.  Just have to understand this long-standing diner was here well before the nearby gentrification by The United Center.

Always loved their breakfast. Best out west but the female workers attitude is ridiculous. They are extremely slow and even when placing order over phone you still wait beyond 20 minutes for food. The phone stay ringing and sometimes give that disconnection message. And tbh they should be in better location by now can’t park around there and can’t eat inside. Definitely in need of updating. The owner3/white guy always nice and I been coming here for over 20 years.

This place is so outdated and unsanitary. I have never seen so many workers that was allowed to sit around and do nothing, they where making cocktails on the low and giving free food to their friends. The staff is made up of street/Hood/Hustle people. The cornbeef sandwich is no longer the same, it has small amount of meat and not fresh - definitely not worth $12. The meatloaf dinner was awful, the meat was frozen and heated in slices with bland box mash potatoes and unflavored can corn. Shame on the Owner for selling awful food to the community, Do not waste your money and go across the street to get fresh food from Pete's Hot Bar
Love this place. It's been a hole in the wall type of restaurant probably longer than I've been alive and the food is always amazing. They close early but are open early. Definitely recommend.

You guys PLEASE don’t waste your money. Honestly trying to figure out how they’re even open. First && last time here. Ordered at 11:48 was told 20-25mins. Didn’t get food til 12:39 && IT WAS COLD🤦🏽‍♀️

The place is cozy and you’re seated quickly. The food comes outs fast and is delicious! The portions are massive! We got the platter for 2 people but couldn’t finish it. This is one of my favourite Ethiopian dinners! I would highly recommend this gem.

Yes! Yes! Yes! Some of the best Ethiopian food I've had. Chill atmosphere and good people too. I had the vegetarian sample platter (I'm not vegetarian) and I didn't miss the meat! All of it was so flavorful, well seasoned and just enough.

I worked in Ethiopia off and on for two years, and in between, I would bring people to Ethiopian Diamond to share the experience with friends in Chicago. The food here is great, the atmosphere is laid back, and the large dining room feels inviting to me. This visit we started off with a small coffee pot, which they served with small cups and some sugar. We ordered some sambusa savory pastries, two filled with meats and one with veggies and one with lentils as an appetizer. Then we had the meat sampler plate, which came with 3 meats and 3 vegetarian offerings in a platter of the injera bread, and a platter of four more rolled injera. There was some salad in the middle of the platter too. Everything tasted great, the service was quiet and prompt, with frequent water fills since we stayed a long time given they weren't busy. Overall, a great choice for Ethiopian dining.

incredible food, welcoming atmosphere!! I’m gluten free and didn’t have any issues finding dishes to eat on the menu. Great price for large portions and food that feels (and tastes) home cooked. Will definitely be back again!!

That’s nice!
Food for everyone
Veggie, seafood, chicken etc
“Bread” is delicious and honey wine 🤍
I can drink from alcohol just this taj
Something really different in Chicago
Dessert is also nice
Servers was great both times!

I enjoyed the hospitality of our host Lola! She was incredibly attentive to the guest, engaging, and knowledgeable of menu specials. I often walk a facility before dining and this day was no different. I was happy to find clean bathrooms and main dining hall. The sidewalk was properly cleared of snow and no trash was visible. This Lincoln Park location proved to be a hidden gem and one I plan the frequent more often.

I often come here to eat and watch games(basketball,football,UFC) with my friends. Place is amazing and always busy. Staff is great and provides excellent service. Service is slow at a time considering the place is really huge. Great place for sports lovers to have some cold ones with their friends. I love their BOGO boneless wings offer on Thursdays with wide variety of flavours. Usually it is easy to get a table but on Thursday and on weekends, i would suggest to reserve table in advance.

I ordered online to pickup and it took about 25 minutes for it to be ready and when I arrived it was ready.  The lady in front was ok, not friendly but was able to find my order right away and gave it to me.
The order was correct, on the the hand it was barely warm.  Will try again.
Came back and the staff didn't have face mask on,

When we arrived we waited for 5 minutes before we finally sat ourselves and then the hostess came and said “yes it’s good sit anywhere” then we waited even longer to get service and finally got up to get help.  When the food came we didn’t have silverware or our waters and realized it so again, had to get it ourselves and asked another waiter we never got our waters if we could please have some.  We ordered two Mac and cheese as well and they served it in soda cup sizes??? Overall the service was terrible for a place that wasn’t busy at all and there was no reason to wait so long for service.  The table to was never cleaned off.

Friendly waitstaff. It was super dead so we sat ourselves. The peppy music was strange because everyone eating in that restaurant honestly seemed depressed. But hey… We enjoyed it!

Listed happy hour on their digital menu but didn’t say what drinks so we ended up ordering two that didn’t qualify and paying $22 when we thought it’d be $12.

Food and service excellent. Our waitress Jasmine was warm and friendly. The café was fairly quiet when we visited on a Monday night. We tried to visit the day before but it was closed for a private  event. You can’t really go wrong with Hard Rock Cafe for good food, a nice atmosphere and a cool gift shop with locally-themed clothing and accessories. I got a souvenir glass for my cocktail which was Chicago-specific. A nice touch.

This place has all good things to offer. We had an amazing time dining here. The food was very good, the service was excellent and the cherry on top of the cake is overall vibe and good music.
Although it took an hour for us to get seated due to the wait times, we still enjoyed being there with the music.
The food was fresh, tasty and good portion sizes. Kids enjoyed it a lot with the live band playing some of the favourites.Overall a pretty good experience.
Just feel that parking was bit too much, have visited other downtown restaurants, usually all restaurants validate parking tickets if you dine with them but this one didn't although the parking is in the same lot.

Food and waitstaff were pretty good but the gift store was less than ideal.    Ambience and environment in the restaurant were pleasant and relaxed with very enjoyable music.  We enjoyed looking at the memorabilia.  After making over $150 in purchases, we decided we would rather have a shirt rather than one of the hats we selected.  The lady behind the counter on 6/19 rolled her eyes and appeared put out at the request.  A non-starter in terms of reviews for me.

I love the food! Our server (maria i guess her name) she's so nice and friendly staff and so everyone!

Sorry did not take pictures on the food i forget to took picture on it! But I ordered Chicken wings with fries and hamburger toy husban ( forgot what kind of hamburger he ordered 😁)

Today was our first time ever in Chicago, and at a Hard Rock Cafe. Staff from the moment we entered was friendly, let us know where to find stuff and our Server Dan, was amazing! I got a mini Oreo milkshake (to die for) and my drink was a mango berry drink also (to die for). My wife ordered a country burger which was a little too well done, but outside of that was great. Their fries were amazing. I ordered the chick Mac n cheese pasta, which my first dish came out and there was a hair in it. But Dan and the manager corrected it right away, brought me a new dish and even comped it off our ticket even though I never even asked them too. It was honestly a genuinely great experience and I would highly recommend this location!

One of the underrated thin crust pizzas around. Their pasta dishes are also great, as is toasted ravioli as an appetizer. Convenient location from Uptown, Edgewater and Andersonville. If you go in the evening, the parking lot next door is available. Great ownership that does many good things for the community. Highly recommended.

Very arguable place. Clean, which is good. Some food is good (pasta alfredo), and the other is just horrible. Chicken wrap was so bad, it’s bitter!!! And didn’t smell well. Lettuce is not fresh, chicken is literally burnt and black! and sauce…what kind a sause is that? The menu says it’s Cesar, but it’s oil bitter stuff…:( never thought it can be so bad.

The Gnocchi Heaven was exactly that.  The absolute best cream sauce I have ever had.  Ever.  My starter salad was fresh, crisp and surprisingly flavorful.  My wife had the Italian Wedding Soup to start and it was scrumptious. Her spaghetti was delicious as well, and I don't like spaghetti.  We had the the Sausage and Peppers to start, again, delicious.  We will be repeat customers.
Delicious food.  Really great and attentive service.  Calm clean bright and welcoming atmosphere.  Great experience overall.  Definitely recommend Eggplant Parmesan!

Get this pizza ASAP! Lol

I've ordered delivery from grubhub twice and picked up once. The food is always spot on!

I have ordered their white pizza, which is absolutely delicious!

We got their Aroma special pizza and added sausage, olives, spinach and tomatoes. OMG! Thee best pizza ever! I tend to eat with my eyes first and presentation is always an A+ with them. Fresh ingredients and they're always offering some sort of discount!

Overall the best pizza in town hands down, we plan on trying more items of their menu.

Oh, and the carrot cake is to die for! But you didn't hear that from me.. 😌

I went with their spicy chicken sandwich and ate in the shop. It's been almost 20 years since I was last here but the food still tastes wonderful. It is a hidden gem but worth trying good food cooked good!

I don't know, this just wasn't for me. The food smelled burnt but I couldn't taste that it was burnt. The spaghetti really had no flavor except strong tomato, and the bread had no garlic or salt. Plus I paid $17 for this. I am just not super happy. I even got high and it still didn't taste any better. Very sad:(

BEST GYROS AND CHICKEN ALFREDO!! It's amazing that I found Chipmunks. A place with an eclectic menu and perfecting each item on it! This is a the place to visit if you're looking for delicious food and upstanding hospitality!

I wanted to like this place, but unfortunately I was put off after seeing a roach while I was ordering inside. The gyro was also not good at all and the only decent part of our order were the fries. The guy behind the counter was friendly though

I’ve been going to this place for about 8 years since I’ve lived in the neighborhood. With that said, it’s a shame that their prices are not competitive anymore. I know inflation is a thing but now they’ve lost their appeal  because now they charge inflated grubhub prices for in person orders. Now that they cost the same as every other mid level fast food, they lost the charm

Stopped by for lunch during the weekend and was very happy we made the choice! Easy walking distance from the science & industry museum, and the nearby bus stop. It’s a cute little diner with a lovely atmosphere. Staff is friendly and service is fast. Food is reasonably priced and generously sized. Everything you could ask for in casual Greek fare. Has a huge menu for breakfast and brunch items too! We tried Nick’s Delight and Souvlaki. Meat was tender and flavorful. They have soup specials each day of the week and the egg lemon soup was fabulous. Definitely check it out if you’re nearby!
We had the fried shrimp,  gyro plate and fried chicken dinner.  We normally come for breakfast,  but the dinner was not bad.

Small breakfast diner atmosphere great service and fantastic food! We ordered breakfast! The orange juice was squeezed right from an orange the waffles and pancakes were great our waitress was on top of her job today with friendly and fast service glad we tried this place! Everything was cooked perfectly and served quick as well!

The restaurant was nice. Honestly the only good thing that was good was their pancakes, I really didn't like their turkey sausage like that and I definitely didn't like their orange juice 🤢 I'd say this is one of those type of restaurants where you would meet an old friend and buy a cup of coffee. Other than that, its an eh for me.

Great Food and service! I loved the chocolate chip pancakes and hash browns. The server was also very polite and accommodating. Great place to break for lunch when visiting the Museum of Science nearby (10 min walk)

Poor food quality. They used to serve this delicious fried potatoe slices with your dish, which now is gone.  Had some melted cheese shrimps along, which was tasteless. This seafood place used to be great...

Delicious passion fruit margaritas ($30/pitcher that served 5-6 pours). Shrimp tacos and al pastor tacos (which were fish) were both bland, wouldn’t order again. Not a ton of flavor for the price. Great restaurant ambience, fast and friendly service, and super spicy bottled hot sauce. The hot sauce was the highlight of the meal, minus the margaritas! Would come for drinks but not food next time.
Haven't been here in a while but food is great! Service was good but felt a little like we had to chase them down a little. Where else can you get a whole deep fried red snapper!
Good Mexican seafood. Drinks have a good kick to it. Nice ambient. Best with a group of friends.

The El Barco website is never updated for days and times. Went a few days in the same week and it was closed for different reasons. 1st time it was some undisclosed event that occurred and they closed right before we arrived around 5pm. The next few days it was closed due to kitchen repairs with only a sign posted on the door. Then when we finally got to go and the Red Snapper was over cooked, ugh! The drinks are amazing however. The food is delicious as long as instructions are provided so your food turns out right. The salas served with the chips are tasty too. Great place if you can catch them when they are actually open.

The place looks great, it is well decorated and nice vibe. we came in a Sunday and it was busy but we were able to get a table.  The service was a bit slow because of the amount of people and it is understandable.  The drinks Large Mango and Pineapple drinks were good.  as for the grilled octopus and the pork belly were ok.  Perhaps since they were busy the food was not done to their standards, not sure.  There is paid parking on the main street.  They have a front space and there is additional space in the back.

It was my first time returning to this restaurant after it was renewed. ☺️ My friend and I ordered smoke-grilled octopus, papas bravas (crispy potatoes), and cochinita pibil taco platter to share! The flavors were right on point, especially the potatoes and marinated pork, but the taste and texture of the octopus were not too memorable for me this time. We definitely enjoyed our drinks, not too strong or sweet, and beautifully presented as you can see in the photo!🍸❤️ I will definitely try this place again during its happy hours so I can explore the menu more at an affordable price.

Came to Taquizo for dinner late Saturday evening and had a great time! The food was delicious, and so were the drinks. My friend and I didn’t know that Taquizo had a brunch special and came back the next day for brunch and it was also amazing! The service is wonderful and their staff is super friendly and make you feel right at home. Check them out for a late night drink, or dinner or brunch. Heck, come back for it all!!

I have had a very pleasant experience at Taquizo, after an unpleasant one at Dorian’s down the road. One of the cocktails in particular, the Autumn spice, was quite possibly the best cocktail I’ve ever had, well balanced and smoky and a bit spicy. I also had a Dirty Bear Bubble bath - not as complex but very cute, with a bear-shaped ice cube that gradually appears as you drink the “bath water”.

The food was also quite good, we had fish tacos which were very good, with a coriander-spiced crust, a spicy mayo and apple slaw. The tacos could have used a bit more salt, but they were good nonetheless. The mariscos a la plancha were also very tasty, tender and well seasoned this time. We closed with the lamb shank, with a great vinegary vegetable escabeche.

Some negatives: the music was a bit too loud and very generic modern Latino, and we were told that we needed a reservation for the back room or patio, although it was quite empty and much quieter.

Overall, a very good experience even if a bit pricy. Definitely try the cocktails.

New menu, decor and music. Indoor atrium and outdoor seating.  Chips and guac awesome.  Lots of small plates to select from we had the grilled octopus that's was grilled to perfection.  We also had excellent mole. Same great owners as the previous Las Palmas.

I’ve been waiting for my food and they closed early. I’m knocking on the window so I can speak with someone and they’re ignoring me. I ordered online and they won’t give me my number. I would appreciate someone from corporate call me now. This is ridiculous. They could’ve simply given my food, but instead they wanted to ignore me. I need someone to call me asap tomorrow or there will be a major problem. This is unacceptable and I want my money back. I’m

Great kitchen staff!! Always quick and accurate service!
Love this location ❤️

Food quality is just like any other chipotle. Employees don’t regulate how the line works. Their line system is confusing - can take the shorter route when not busy and longer route when busy. Lots of people were cutting the line during a busy time by taking the shorter route. Customers shouldn’t have to confront other customers.

Was extremely impressed with the quantity of food they gave me.  Some Chipotle employees spoon out the smallest amount of each item, here I got heaping spoonfuls! I am not sure if he just appreciated the concise way I ordered - chicken bowl, white, black, fajita veggies - (most people ignore my order and make me repeat each item two or three times) but this guy was impressed, which may have been why I got a mountain of food :D Either way, I'll be coming here again for a quick bite.

Chipotle is one of my favorite go-to spots for a quick, tasty lunch when I forgot to make one at home. I can pick up a Burrito bowl or salad and customize it for my diet and taste. The generous portions are filling and the pricing is very affordable. I really enjoy all of the protein options (including the Sofritos) The cafeteria style service is quick and efficient and I can usually get in, get my food and pay in about 2 minutes flat, providing it's not too busy.  Chipotle is a great choice for the entire Family.

Great atmosphere, good selections of food and beverage! We had 5 dishes with rice shared between the three of us, it was the perfect amount of food and absolutely delicious (especially the salt and pepper prawns, and Mongolian beef)! On top of a delicious meal and company, the service was also amazing! Our waiter was friendly, knowledgeable and fast on drink/food delivery! Great experience! We will be back!

The dynamite shrimp is to die for. Requested a window seat during reservations and they delivered even on a busy Chicago summer evening! Our waiter was awesome very personable and able to recommend dishes and drinks! Paid just the right amount of attention to the table to where we did not feel neglected nor smothered! Also, was blessed to find street parking right across from the restaurant and monitor parking time with Chicago parking app.

The restaurant is very close to the most central part of the down town. Our table, at the first floor close to the wondow, was a bit cold because of the air conditioning. The service have been kind and professional. The food have been good. The cocktails have been perfect (moscow mule). Good also for more then 2 persons with groups.

Average food in a very nice location. The food was bland and lacked spices.

The staff was pretty nice and the restaurant is very well decorated. The food is very similar, if not worse, than any fast Asian food chain at a much higher price.

This is one of our favorite restaurants
We’ve been to many P.F. Chang’s before in Jeddah Dubai and New York I can say this one is up to the standard
The food is very tasty and the portions were good
I liked the shrimp dynamite though the presentation is different here but the same delicious taste
The atmosphere was great
The only thing I found annoying is the wait time outside despite empty tables otherwise the experience was great

Man it should be a crime for Manny's Cafeteria and Deli to taste so damn good! Look here, I've been to a higher number than most people when it comes to going to restaurants throughout the entire Chicago land in Northwest Indiana areas but Manny's Cafe & Deli is one of the Best places to eat in the Chicagoland Area hands down. The food is always fresh and hot and ready to be eating like you've never ate before. When you go inside and look at the menu and all the food they have available, you're gonna be taken back to a time when food was food for real. This place is the spot when you want great food. Whether you get the turkey pastrami the regular pastrami the corned beef the roast beef the chicken you simply cannot lose ever with anything you order from this location. I can't make this up, you have to go here once in a lifetime if you haven't ever been. This is one of the Best restaurants in the Chicago area!

Manny’s Deli is recommended in every list of must-go places and lives out to that expectation. A real deli as you would expect. I tried the Corned Beef and Pastrami, meats were out of this world. There are many dishes that seem worth trying. Service was attentive and kind. Definitely another must stop when in town.

This is not for vegetarians. One sandwich has enough meat for a uk Sunday lunch for a family of four. I loved it, had half a Reuben the other half saved for later.  Turkey pastrami very spicy. It’s a place only found in the USA.  The decor is all American, presidents Obama and Clinton and Secretary Clinton all have been there.  Fabulous.  30 us for sandwich and bottomless ice tea.

An interesting place with interesting foods. The Reuben sandwich is good. Loads of flavor and crunch but it is pricey. Just over $24 for the sandwich alone is asking a lot. Spent just over $34 altogether for the sandwich, beverage, and cookie is a bit pricey. Lots of space here to find a  table. Also they have a bakery in the back with merchandise available to purchase. I'd say come and visit. It's quite an experience

Can't say enough a out how great Manny's is. I got a roast beef sandwich and my mom got the reuben. We could have feasted for a week off those two sandwiches, there was so much meat! Th e caramel cake.was.exacrly what the doctor ordered and was just as sweet as every employee working there. I had a nice time just ordering my takeout.

We went to Hopleaf for a quick bite to eat. We ate outside on the patio. It was a beautiful day and it is a really nice space. Our server was great and our food was good. Great selection of beers and ciders. I would definitely go back again.

Have loved this place for years, from the steak frites to the enormous beer selection and everywhere in between. Michael and Louise have a great thing going!! I recently got to go for Super Stout Sunday and had many of the beer offerings, and the outstanding chili with cornbread, it’s a don’t miss event!

Best Belgian beer selection in the city, on top of an already impressive selection, and in my experience and opinion, the best frites and mussels. First time being on the patio which was perfect and reminiscent of a cafe or brasserie overseas.

Had the fried chicken sandwich and a draft cider and both were really good! The service was friendly and really quick for being moderately busy and I liked the decor in the restaurant as well. Will come back!
If you want an amazing selection of beer this is the place to go. They have beers from all over the world and knowledgeable staff that can help you decide or explore tasting different beers.
Food was great. Restrooms were a little run down. One time it had no toilet paper.  Luckily my wife was in the restroom

The worth subway ever. They closed 30 minutes before actual time mentioned on the entrance. I asked jigar why he said his manager 'sam' told him to do that. Friday 12th of July. You can see in the photo the person and the clock at the same time. I hop someone from subway do something about it.
Eating a egg and cheese sandwich, and it is good.
They should offer a subway cup not a small plastic cup when you ask for ice. Let me promote your company by walking around with your cup,just saying.  Oh and don't rush people
Will not support a chain that sides with coward robbers over its own employees. Subway is permanently blacklisted from my business and others should do the same.

I went and placed my order at the drive thru one of my item was a bacon egg and cheese croissant WITHOUT CHEESE…. I get home and the sandwiches is not what I ordered ( picture ) i called and spoke to a girl who i informed of this error she told me i was able to pick up a brand new sandwich  however i told her i was unable right away because i had to go i to work if later on that day was ok. She responded with yes “ILL LEAVE A NOTE WITH YOUR NAME ON IT FOR THEN TO MAKE IT WHEN YOU COME BACK “.  I went back later that night and told them  of the situation and was told they had no note or knew anything of it , yesenia was very polite about telling me this information,  at this point its not about the 5$ the sandwich cost. Its about the time  wasted with employees who dont take responsibility of their mistakes.  Def not coming here again and this is “supposed to be the best dunkin for midway airport “

They spend to much time on the drive thru customers. Meanwhile there I was with three other people behind me waiting inside. One girl was cleaning around the coffee dispensers righting front of us without even acknowledging that we were there. I had to say something about them taking our orders to get us out of there. You guys need to do better with customer service for your inside customers. Don't just have us standing there while there is applicable employees that can take our orders.

Went through the drive thru and got a latte with whipped cream. To my defense I am a regular ol iced coffee or hot coffee but wanted to try something different. The associate was very polite and patient. There was no wait..I was in and out. DD for the win!

Goofy girls in the morning were running low on iced coffee. So instead of changing it out they tried putting decaf in my iced coffee that I ordered with 2 shots of espresso in it. Kinda defeats the purpose of paying for espresso shots. They remade it but ended up giving me no ice when I asked for light ice. It's not rocket science girls. Fet it together! 7-23-22 5:10am
Very slow express lane. Express lane was very dirty and full of debris. I asked for the senior discount, did not get it. No straw for my iced tea. No napkin for my sticky donut.

Eduardo's has a wonderful atmosphere, very warm and welcoming. The aesthetics are fantastic, it's a great place to enjoy a meal. Service was terrific, the staff was super nice and friendly. They gave me a great wine recommendation.
I ordered the Lemon poppy bucatini, it was good but not great. From the description, it sounded really good and it just wasn't what I expected. I enjoyed my meal and had a great experience nonetheless. I will definitely be back and try the pizza next time.

Fun people watching walking by outdoor dining to Gold Coast and from Rush Street. Patio is nice and dog friendly. One of few places open on Monday w 25% off wine bottles.  Salad of asparagus, snap pee and mint yogurt was excellent. Pizza was fine. Service could be more helpful.
Very decent place. I used to go Marios table(opposite from the street) a lot, but now I prefer coming here. Pizza options are sufficient. Appetizers are refreshing and tasty.

We were really disappointed. I've been to Eduardo's in the past and have always ordered takeout, but this past Friday night was enough to make me not want to come back. Homemade pasta is amazing and you can't beat their bolognese, but its not worth the absolute annoyingly horrible service we received during our last visit. After being sat and clearly waiting rest of my guests I was not offered anything to drink aside from water that was already on the table. I had to get up and ask the manager for wine. After that, my server was constantly bothering me for updates - clearly no understanding of social queues. Once my friends and I were all enjoying wine we were told we only had an hour left at the table (mind you, the restaurant was empty aside from us). But we get it, Friday night and a small restaurant so we ordered quickly. Once complete, they rushed the check and wouldn't even let us split evenly three ways (annoying). THEN, with maybe a few sips left in our wine glasses our server said we had to get up and the next party was there to sit down. It was a SHOCK when we saw only one of the next fourtop was there and could have easily waited another three minutes for us to enjoy our last sips - the restaurant was only about half full too. Our group frequents local Gold Coast restaurants monthly and this one is coming off the rotation. I'd rather go to Mario's where they treat people more like guests than a table to turn.

The manager was the BEST(I realized I never got her name). BUT She was so sweet and welcoming while giving us all of the best recommendations. It was our second time there, and will certainly not be our last! They surprised us with some strawberry gelato for our 2 year anniversary (which was absolutely delicious). Great pizza, great environment, amazing people! So happy with with our experience

Hand's down one of the best if not THEY BEST Vietnamese inspired restaurants I have been to.  The level of execution in the plating, flavors, and service are top notch.  The ambiance is beautiful.  The mussels are out of this world and so were many other dishes!  The drink program is also insane, I had some delicious cocktails at the bar and I'm usually conservative with ordering drinks.  I can't wait to come again when I am visiting Chicago!

My boss ended up taking us out for a client meet up and as the local steak place he wanted to take us to was closed early for a holiday weekend we ended up at Embeya.

We walked in right as they were opening and there was already a few tables taken up and the place filled up pretty quickly. Clearly people enjoyed coming here for lunch.

The waiter was very friendly and, most importantly, kept our drinks constantly refilled. I had an even split between water and one of their house made sodas which was decent though a little sweet.

Onto the appetizer I tried their Green Papaya salad which was pretty good and most of the rest of the table tried the smokes scallop and loved it. For the meal I went straight with the ribs. My wife makes a pretty amazing hoisin short rib so I wanted to try it here. Honestly I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed it as it tasted almost the same. While I loved eating it the downside was I could have had that at home and now wish I had tried the pork which also looked amazing.

For desert we had a round of the fried banana that everyone enjoyed.

All in all a delicious lunch and a relaxing atmosphere. Honestly, the atmosphere is impressive that it managed to be relaxed with how busy they were! I'd absolutely eat here again if I had a hankering for Vietnamese while in the west loop!

We've been to Embeya multiple times since their opening, and each visit has been absolutely fantastic. The major standout is their cocktail menu - every specialty cocktail I've had has been unique, and incredibly well done. The Tendron and Lime is a astoundingly refreshing lighter drink, and the Belgian Relic will please both beer and whiskey lovers with its full and powerful flavor. The food is largely tapas-style small plates, with a few delicious larger plate options. The Katsu style Steak has an excellent texture and flavor, and the hot or cold spring rolls are a fantastic lead-in.

Went there last night. As with other reviewers, the service was superb. Greeted by many friendly faces, one of which showed us to our seats while another took our jackets for us. Our server was wonderful and knowledgeable. The decor of the place is great. Had the 4 course dinner and a drank. The smoke n' barrel was a scotch drink that was really good. The presentation of it all was excellent, and the food was very good. Highlights were the lamb shank and the green tea cream puff.

From start to finish everything about this experience was perfect.
We had lunch 3 course menu for $25 and it worth every penny.
FOOD: Thai themed, tasty, creative, interesting and healthy.
SERVICE: very nice, attentive and professional.
AMBIANCE: Asian themed modern, beautiful and cozy.
VALUE: Great for experience received.
Don't miss it if visiting Chicago.

Unreliable service/hour, rude staff, doesn’t not operate at the hours it promised.
This location suppose to open from 7am-10pm during the week. That’s what it says on google maps and their door. I stopped by at 8:30am and it’s still closed. When I call the store. The clerk said “it opens when I open the door” and hung up on me. He should’ve come to me and said “I’m sorry we are running a little late. Please come back in # of minutes”. He didn’t realize his response is rude and unprofessional. I waited for 10 more minutes and left. If you come at the beginning and the end of the day, be prepared to be locked out.
comically bad service, like sitcom level, on basic cable from the 90’s. except for this one guy who should run the place
Staff are consistent and remember the regulars. Food is as expected and fairly priced

Great service. They need to pay attention to detail when ordering online. If you do order online you should also call and confirm ur order. I order online 85% of the time and lately they forget to put cheese or toast the sandwich. I try to go to the store as much as I can and order, but I only get 1/2 hour for lunch. The app is very convenient for me.

Subway is Subway - always 3 or 4. The reason that I gave this place a 5 is that the employees don’t hesitate to put a generous amount of what you want in your sandwich. They should keep it this way ...

When I went for counterserve with my family it was a relatively quick and good option. The panini was done well and chips and drinks offered are fantastic. I would say the Cafe was 75% full on a late lunch on Friday.

On other occasions my office has gotten delivery from here, and the salads on those occasions were not impressive, with few menu options. This location seems good, but I'm not sure if the chain is consistent.

The food here is consistently good! I come here for the pizza, salads and most of all the pasta! Quick and efficient.  I love their toffee cookies - don't see those anywhere else that I know of! Seating area can be quite loud, but otherwise no complaints! Great value for what you get. The focaccia rolls!

I went here for a quick bite to eat when I was busy in the city. At first I thought it was a simple deli,  but when I entered I was pleasently surprised by the variety and amount of food. Between three of us we had a slada, chicken, and pasta. All three entrees were very good. The service was also great, they were very prompt to making our food when we ordered at the counter. I would suggest for a quick bite to eat.
They have salads, sandwiches, pasta and pizza. The service is fast and friendly. The food is good enough. Nothing amazing, but a popular lunch spot.

Staff are attentive and work fast to get the huge lunch crowd served. Don't bother paying for the over priced drinks. So far I have tried the pizza, mostaccioli, and tuna. Everything was great except the pizza which just wasn't my thing.

Simply phenomenal. The service was good, but the food was simply sublime. I cannot put into words how good it was other than pure ecstasy. The salad was the perfect blend of mozzarella, tomato, salad, and olive oil that formed a union of flavors for a salad unlike no other. The salad was one of the simplest but best I've had in a while. Now the main course was just beyond what I expected. The perfect blend of soft pasta layers, sticky and savory meats coupled with crimson scrumptious red sauce and topped with fantastic melted cheese bring you straight to flavor town. The tastes, textures, and smells all combine to make the best Italian food I have ever eaten and the best dining experience in a few years. 10/10 would recommend to anyone wanting Italian. And for their low price tag, it's criminal how underrated the restaurant is. Delicious!

Perfect little neighborhood Italian restaurant with true flavors and ingredients. Reasonable priced with wonderful service by the owners. Nothing fancy here except the quality and comfort. FOLLOW ME for more thoughtful recommendations as I travel the world  🌎

Service was great and the food was fantastic!! We had garlic bread with cheese and a pepperoni pizza, both were delicious! We were so full but had to try their gelato and it did not disappoint. It was a tasty treat to finish off the meal. Highly recommend sitting on their patio to enjoy a beautiful evening

Family owned. Great thin crust pizza. The best in town. Located by the Trump hotel. Outdoor seating available. Rolled Eggplant appetizer is so good! Chicken Parm sandwich was just okay. The Caprese Salad is my favorite. Light and refreshing. Reasonably priced. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a quick , casual bite to eat in Chicago.

Before I get into the review, this place is located inside the River Plaza at 405 N. Wabash.  Turn at the River Plaza sign off N. Wabash and follow the sidewalk into the River Plaza building.

Stopped by during lunch while visiting Chicago.  I've had all the usual deep-dish pizzas and other well-known pizza places in Chicago, so wanted to try someplace different.  It was lunchtime during the week, but it was not too crowded.  There's about 10 tables both inside and outside, but it was a rainy day so opted for the inside.  They don't sell individual slices, but the small 10" pizza is only 4 reasonable slices.  Service was very fast and friendly.

Ordered the 10" Capricciosa pizza which took about 10-15 minutes to arrive.  Pizza was straight out the oven and looked great.  Crust was a good thickness, crispy, just the right amount of sauce, and there was a generous amount of ingredients.  They also have desserts such as gelato, tiramisu, cannolis, and cookies.  I was too full for anything big, so just ordered 2 cookies after another customer recommended them.  It was a good recommendation.

Nice hidden gem for good pizza.  Good food and service.
Some of the best Indian food we've had. Each curry the group got was delicious, from the chicken to lamb to chickpea dishes. Mango Lassi was fantastic with a rich creamy fruit flavor.

Surprisingly quiet for a Michelin Bib Gourmand, but well worthy of their recognition. The vegetable samosa was fine, but the butter chicken and lamb biryani were flavorful and delicious. Service was very kind and fun!
Delicious Nepalese and Indian cuisine that’s well deserving of its Michelin rating. Our favorite was the creamy coconut chicken madras and the spicy tomato-based pokhareli kukhura.
Service was excellent. Food was on point and location wasn’t busy whatsoever. Ambiance was relaxing and quiet, good setting to have a date and conversation. Drinks - Pinot Grigio $9, Stella Artois $7

I purchased lunch there for the 1st and last time today. I'm trying out numerous restaurants in the neighborhood since I am new to it. I ordered to samosas and goat biryani. The samosas were good. Nice pastry. The biryani was literally full of rice and bones. I would guess if I scraped all of the bits of meat together off of those bones I might come up with one tablespoon of actual meat.  I spent $30 on lunch and my stomach was literally still rumbling as I finished. Never again.

Golden Bull is one of my favorite restaurants for Chinese food.  I ordered take-out and the food was cooked by the promised time and was an appropriate temperature.  The dishes that I ordered were: Walnut Shrimp, Eggplant in Special Garlic Sauce, Tenderloin Steak cooked with Black Pepper Sauce, Mandarin Pork Chop, Stir Fried Lotus Root and Mixed Vegetables, Farmer’s Chicken, and an order of Egg Rolls.  Everything that I ordered, I would recommend.  The food was hot, except for the Farmer’s Chicken which was served cold.  Rice is included with the dishes and is a perfect vehicle for absorbing the saucy dishes.  A good thing about this restaurant is that they offer both a small and large option, which gives you flexibility to order specific portions.  If you’re ever looking for a good place to eat in Chinatown, consider eating here at Golden Bull.

Not only is the food served HOT, but the service and atmosphere match. As soon as we walked in the place was semi packed but we were able to get in fast. The server was welcoming and knowledgeable about the menu on the spot. Which helps a ton if this is your first time dining,  I am not. The portions are fantastic and the flavors….WOW! The prices are reasonable for the sizes they dish out. Let’s just say Sharing is Caring and it can be fun, which here you definitely can. Get ready to eat and feel full but in the right way since everything served is FRESH!!!!!!! Let’s just say they make it Nice.

Finally made it back for in person dining at  Golden Bull with a feast of farmer’s chicken claypot rice, steamed garlic surf clams, tofu and string beans. All delicious, really authentic and service was top notch.

Loved that they remembered what we used to order even though the last time we visited was 2 years ago! 💗

This is my go to place for family styled Chinese dinner. They have always delivered quality food and service. The manager there is extremely nice and welcoming. She remembers us every time we go in for a quick dinner. Their free desserts (sweet soups) are always a treat at the end of the delicious dinner.

Great place to eat if you want authentic Chinese food.  They are always busy for dinner because the food is great. Service is wonderful.  Large menu to choose from.  Have been going there for 20 plus years.

This Wendy's used to be a good place to go. Like other reviews I seen, the employees are really not interested in providing good customer service. Granted I was the only person in the restaurant at that time other than security and the cashier who took my order felt it was more important to continue to talk to her co-workers instead of letting me know that   the first soda machine I walked up to wasn't working. The french fries were definitely not hot and crispy, not to mention that the rest of the food was cold as well.

The food is decent, but the workers have a bit of an attitude. I get that they probably deal with a lot from the general public everyday, but they don't need to be rude to the people that are nice to them. I tried the new strawberry Frosty here and it was really good. The food was hot and fresh, no issues there.

Just don’t go here is you want anything other than a burger. They are all out of potatoes, salads, chili, vanilla frosties. I get it, it’s a burger place.  However , if you are going to put it on the menu, have the item to sell until closing. Check your inventory. Check the trends of what you sell. If you are constantly running out of food. It means you aren’t ordering enough. Just as they know the peak times of service, you should know what foods and how much you are selling. Just a suggestion. Management/Inventory 101. Not going to buy what I don’t want.

Only rated one star to leave a review. The drive thru was full. Indoors was empty and one of the cashiers inside refused to take our orders. She did so with a very rude approach after she was called out. I would suggest not working in the food industry if it becomes overwhelming.

Everything just all wrong the Workers Had Bad attitudes the sandwich I got looked nasty then they didn't won't to give me my Money back they told me they can make a new one for me but not with the attitudes they had already..... Just All Bad Same Sandwich in both pictures Now You tell me What it Look Like🤦🏼‍♂️

Nobody delivers faster (under 10 minutes is routine) but you gotta make sure that the staff reads your order back to you before they hang up the phone.  The sandwiches on in house made bread are always good but the teenage staff members have a tendency to screw up your order if you don't make micromanage them.  They do get here quick and for dinner under $10 it's hard to go wrong.

Everyone is nice here!! A young lady named Cyntea made me the best Jimmy John's sandwich ever! I would recommend adding the peppers to the sandwiches!!! It gives it that extra flavor which is very tasty. Grab a chocolate chip cookie on your way out!

This is right by the Second City. I mean, if you want something that isn't going to be pricey like the bar at the place, you can go down here and get a tuna sandwich. I only mess with the tuna sandwich, so I can only say that it is good if you want that. I am sure the other sandwiches are as good, but not going to delve into it. Staff was friendly and quick which is always a plus so a good thing to have.

Really great sandwich.  I'm sure I ate more than I should have,  but it tasted SO GOOD!
The place was very clean,  and the staff were friendly.
Definitely one of the best Jimmy Johns locations in the entire city. Great staff and customer service CONSISTENTLY! Produce always fresh no matter what time of day. Love this location!

What's not to like? The sandwiches are delicious, the prices are great for the area, and staff is fantastic.

I have been to this place about 5 times and every single visit the food quality is up to snuff.  On my last visit, I was walking home from Jewel with a bunch of groceries right at closing time for BB Bun Mi - figured it was worth a shot to see if I could grab a sandwich last minute. The woman working (who I assume is the owner) was all too happy to stop shutting down and make one last sandwich. Before leaving, she politely asked if I was a vegetarian then gave me a free shrimp roll with peanut sauce out of the fridge.

Sure, she probably had to toss it that night anyways, but it was the simple gesture that sums up my feelings for this sub shop. And frankly, it probably does them good because the roll was delicious and I may need to order it in the future.

My go-to sandwich here is the Lemongrass Tofu, can't beat it.

If you're looking for a high quality, quick, cheap dinner or lunch, definitely check this joint out.

Great place. Love the sandwiches, especially the shredded chicken. Been up and down Broadway, this is one of the few places where you can get  an appetizing meal for an excellent price. The PHO is great as well as the other soups. Staff is excellent, they remember my name and my standard order. Comfortable atmosphere with some unique art work on the walls.

I love coming here for their Phó! I honestly haven't had anything else, since the Phó is so good I can't make myself not get it. The lady at the counter is always super nice and asks whether I want extra noodles or garnishments. She really seems to care. The beef is good, not the best I've had, but still really good.

I feel in love with this spot when it first opened in my neighborhood for several reasons. First and foremost I was absolutely blown away by the service and the generosity of the owner who unfortunately is no longer with the company. He made me feel right at home and made sure I had an excellent and positively memorable experience. On my initial visit I tried the Vietnamese Coffee, the original tofu Bahn Mi sandwich, and a shrimp spring roll. It was YUM all around.

I absolutely LOVED the tofu sandwich. Everything about it was perfect. All of the ingredients were perfectly balanced with each other and everything was so fresh. The bread was the perfect consistency of soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. The jalapenos gave it the right amount of spice and of course I love that there is a plethora of Sriracha sauce always available.... my favorite hot sauce. You can actually purchase at the shop.

I've since tried almost every menu item there and have loved everything. I even enjoy the ramen and they offer a vegetarian option.

Note that this restaurant blew up so fast and was so well received by Chicagoans that several more locations have popped up ALL over the city in Lakeview, downtown, south loop, northside, etc.
Best pho in the neighborhood. Very flavorful, lots of fresh herbs, and veggies. Very good quality, affordable, healthy, and you can tell it's cooked with love and care!
The country Fried Steak was delicious, big portions. My gf had the denver omelet. The pancakes were scrumptious. Great local breakfast spot.
CLASSIC DINER SPOT FOR ALL AGES!!! The place has breakfast, lunch, and dinner, at all times you can't go wrong! The staff is fast and friendly I love it 💗💗💗

Came in with my partner and son on a busy early Sunday afternoon. The wait to be seated was 15 minutes, but luckily three seats opened at the bar, so the wait wasn't long. The food was very average tasting, but the service was great, and the prices were reasonable. I really liked the selection of doughnuts. I had a Denver omelette, which was decent, my son had a short stack of pancakes and turkey bacon, which he loved, and my partner had a tuna "melt". Melt in quotes because the cheese wasn't melted at all, and the sandwich was lukewarm. It's her favorite restaurant, so I'll probably come here again, but you can easily find much better tasting food in the city.

Can't get any more Chicago than this place!
Always great food, always best Sweets, and cool servers

I go here all the time. I love the place, and I hope the wait staff and management knows how much I appreciate them. They have great food and if they make a mistake, they always take care of it. I wish their air-conditioning wasn't so cold, but that's the only problem I ever had in the last 30+ years. 😃 😊 😀

Absolutely delicious food but extremely slow service. It took over an hour for us to get our food once we ordered and the waitress completely forgot my tea. I think they ran out of an ingredient because everyone was waiting on food and then the staff was scrambling to serve everyone and trying to figure out which order was for which table.
The house salad was fresh and delicious. The three headed gorilla roll was insane. I could taste every individual flavor, including the fresh crispy tempura. Usually the flavors all meld together in a roll. The wakamono roll was also savory. All the fish was buttery and fresh. Truly melted in your mouth. The matcha creme brulee they had one special was gigantic. It wasn't super sweet, which I appreciate. It was almost like a cheesecake though.

Didn't have a good experience here. Service was pretty bad despite that there were only a few people dining. Our drinks came out late, we got our food first. When I would ask the waitress about the drinks she would just mumble and wouldn't really give a status. Then there was the food, I had the Baja sur roll and it was not good. I've had better rolls from the supermarket. My boyfriend had ordered noodles and he said they tasted like they were dipped in Ketchup sauce. Pretty disappointed in this place, had been looking forward to it since we always walked by and the ambiance appeared nice.

Had a wonderful time. Phenomenal drinks. I got the Apple bourbon mule and it was delightful. Gyoza were tender and delicious. Sushi was out of this world—particularly loved the wakamono roll. Miso ramen was great, as was the mochi dessert. Be sure to enjoy the wall art in the bathrooms. Will be back!
Exceptional service with interesting specials. Overall outstanding food with a pleasant ambiance and minimalist environment
Some of the best rolls I've ever had. Drinks can take *forever* and be super sticky (reducing a star), which is a definite turn off for a nice sit-down. But I've enjoyed my food every visit.

Sesame chicken is not sesame chicken. There is no flavor. I’m really hoping that the cooks messed up my order. I tried eating it but there is absolutely no flavor, I can’t even explain.

Crab Rangoon not worth $8. Gelatinous cream cheese. Arrived hot and somehow the “cream cheese” is not melted.

I've been a customer there for about 3 years. Generally I order over the phone. So far I have no complaints about the food& service. I thought I'd deal with Golden Dragon because they are very courteous, and the orders I've purchased are always hot& fresh. " Five Stars!".
Food is fine on time and piping hot. Plus you get a hearty portion. The combination plates could easily feed 2 people who have moderate appetites.

I ordered the bourbon chicken, crab rangoon, and potstickers. And the shrimp fried rice is pretty good and so is the crab Rangoon. The potstickers are very doughy, so not great. The bourbon chicken is disgusting. I ended up getting sick. There’s better Chinese food in the city. Go elsewhere.
Chicken wings are so big like Turkey leg big, lo mein noodles doughy and teriyaki chicken needs more sauce NEVER AGAIN don’t eat here

First time here
My Son is a long time fan
We had the cream of chicken soup to start,
It was good and thick, it came not as hot as I would prefer and was a bit bland (I added pepper)
I enjoyed the chicken kabob sandwich
The chicken was fresh grilled and tasty, the pita was perfectly warm and slightly toasty, the veggies were fresh and tasty if the tomatoes were a bit thickly cut and awkward fit in the pita
The gyros sandwich was pretty tasty too

I’ve been coming here since I was a teenager. The food is always delicious and fresh. Try the gyros, the steak sandwich, or the chicken souvlaki. The avgo lemeno soup is fantastic! Great atmosphere, clean restaurant. Plenty of parking. The only complaint I have is, ever since the old man died, the quality of the food went down a few notches. Not sure if his son is getting lower quality meats and other things but it’s not as tasty as it used to be. Other than that I would highly recommend you stop by and eat! Thumbs up! 👍🏻
“You lika da juice?” Eh?
Had a French burger plate & my friend had a chicken kabob plate, both was really good!
Dining experience was not so great but the chicken was good for the very affordable price.

Went with the yiros plate. First I must say it was a generous serving. We ate in but it was not hot, parts were actually cold, and as a result the flavor was not there. For the price I guess I expected more and I didn't get that. I hadn't been to Hubs in years and I likely won't be going back anytime soon. Sorry.

We stumbled on this place one evening on a walk.  Glad we stayed. The pizza was great and the staff was super friendly.  It was an old bar called Paddy Longs. So older reviews still talk about the bacon & the previous food. It’s now all about the pizza!! and they did an amazing job rehabbing it. The best part was the pizza chef,  came out to your table with the pizza he made and would check up on you. Very special experience from such a casual spot. They have a full bar too!
I give this 5⭐️
Jerry (the pigeon) gives it 6⭐️ He loved the crust.

Excellent thin crust pizza! Absolutely delicious. Crust was baked perfectly crisp. You can tell all of the ingredients are top quality. I just got plain cheese and I was so impressed at how good is is. Try it, you won’t be disappointed!

Super fresh ingredients makes all the difference. Great New York style pizza, got the Hot Honey Pepper pizza and the Apple Italiano pizza. It was a good sized pizza given the price point, will definitely be back when looking for that authentic NY pizza feel and experience.

Originally Paddy Longs, they've transitioned to a pizza parlor. Great service, our server was very attentive and friendly, frequently checking to make sure my guest and I were good on drinks and refills.

Lots of locally sourced beverages and materials. Had a sour beer from Niles and the lager was a collaboration with another local brewery. Great pepperoni pizza, very flavorful and juicy.

Very cute space, it's been much brightened up in the interior and the patio portion is compact but perfectly situated to have a great view of the area, making it perfect place for a drink or bite to eat on a summer afternoon

As soon as you walk in, the hostess was so warm and welcoming. But the real star of the show was the amazing Red Pizza. 10/10, sauce was delicious, crust was cooked to perfection and the sausage I ordered on it was just enough spice and seasonings to coat the tongue. Also the craft beer is such a nice option to have with the savory pie. Definitely coming back for that Red Pizza!

Gross.
I've been there a couple times and i thought that it was actually not bad.

Today, I had a nice surprise in my salad.
I started eating my salad when suddenly something felt wrong in my mouth.
Something was not right, really crunchy for a salad.
