I spit it out and there was lying on my salad a 2 inches long grasshopper.
Grossssss.

I took it back, did not make a scene, and before the guy gave me my money back, he asked me if i wanted another salad instead.....

H3LL no!!!!!!!

Ain't going back over there

Ordered a salad on Grubhub. Came with iceburg instead of romain. The tomatoes were slop(not good anymore), and they didn't even bring me the correct beverage. The salad was questionable, so I tossed it.

A friend of mine at work introduced this place to me for dinner. I ordered a pesto chicken Panini sandwich and to be honest, it was the best Panini sandwiches I have ever had. I would love to order more if they can deliver down in Des Plaines.
Tasty, healthy food. Clean crisp veggies and well cooked meat. Great pricing too. The occasional winter soups are very good.
Great healthy food.  I’ve only been once but they made an impression!

From the location to the exceptionally friendly staff, to the lovely layout and small-hotel vibe, my three night stay at Ivy was outstanding, and I'd love to stay again sometime. If what you're looking for is a comfortable, well-decorated space from which to base your Chicago trip, this could be it - lovely huge windows, a comfortable, large bed, and a very nicely sized bathroom were all quite lovely.

Upsides:
+ Location is outstanding. Two blocks to the Magnificent Mile, four or so blocks to the Lake. All the museums are walkable.
+ Nicely decorated, well appointed.
+ Large spaces, large bathroom.
+ Super kind staff.

Downsides:
- No fitness center on site. I'm told there is one somewhere, but I didn't explore it.
- The television in the bathroom didn't work. Which is probably fine, but still.
- No microwave in the room. There's a mini fridge with the mini bar stuff.

Stayed here two separate nights bookending family visits in the suburbs, and both nights we had a wonderful time.  The rooms are lovely - clean and tastefully decorated (we stayed in king suites both times). The suites at least are extremely spacious and comfortable for the price. The hotel is in a great location within easy walking distance of so many cool spots and restaurants. We didn't order any room service but had very positive interactions with staff each time we were here - Sarah and Chase in particular were helpful, friendly, and professional.

I enjoyed this hotel.  The room was beautiful and the location was perfect. Walking distance to the magnificent mile and great restaurants. I would advise that you bring your own wash cloths as the single one that they provided daily had long since been past its glory days.

The staff was warm and very welcoming. Kavita was especially great. The room was very clean and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom had branded towels and an amazing waterfall shower. Stayed for three nights and would definitely come again. Wish they had a new york location!!

Hotel is AMAZING. One of the best hotel experiences Ive had. Room was beautiful, comfortable, and spacious. It's right downtown next to a ton of amazing stuff, bus lines, and a quick walk from navy pier. The front desk staff that checked us in on Saturday the 14th were incredible and friendly- those two had previously helped us make sure our reservation was in (we called the day before and found capital one hadn't sent the reservation properly, but they got it all squared away). Rooftop terrace is a great way to end a day, highly recommend the Jalapeño Mule cocktail.

Best sushi anywhere! Chef Katsu uses outstanding ingredients and turns them into stars. You won't find fancy sauces here, but everything is beautifully displayed, and you taste every ingredient and the masterful combinations of flavors. It is quite expensive, but you expect to pay high prices for the highest quality. If you want to taste pure and authentic Japanese cuisine at its best and aren't afraid of the bill you'll rack up, Katsu is a must. As far as I am concerned, it's the best restaurant in Chicago!

Best sushi I have had in this country, Katsu is master Sushi chef.
If you want the finest, freshest, most elegant presentation, you found your place.  Even better than the crazy NY sushi place my investment broker took me too a couple years ago, and that was about 1K per person.

Went on a Saturday night without a reservation and we were surprised to be seated right away. However, they did warn us that the Sushi would take about an hour and a half to make but good company always makes that a non-issue. I liked the authenticity of this place but was really shocked when they denied our request for wasabi. I totally get the chef's justification for this but it seemed a little hypocritical since they were still allowing us soy sauce, which in my opinion would overpower the quality or freshness of any sushi grade fish. Can't complain about the taste or the atmosphere but straight out denying a paying customer wasabi was a little off beat for us.

Excellent fresh sushi, blue tuna, salmon and scallops very fresh, taste perfect. Also had a great saki Goriki perfect blend with the food ordered. Everyone at the table enjoyed the dishes ordered. Nothing bad at this restaurant. It is the best sushi place in Chicago.

Service 2.0/5, atmosphere 3.0/5, food 4.3/5, value 3.0/5.  Went to check this place out before they close their doors for good.  Staff was friendly, but it took 2 hours before we got our nigiri.  The fish itself is fresh, tasty, and nicely presented however the pieces are so large it is almost impossible to eat the nigiri in a single bite.  The rolls we tried contained too much wasabi making it difficult to eat.  The atmosphere wasn't anything special and it was half empty when we were there (even though we needed to make reservations 2 weeks in advance).  The four course tasting menu is a decent portion size for many (not quite enough for me though) but the food is overpriced.  Don't expect to pay less than $150 per head.  I found that I can get similar fish quality and better overall experience at Ora sushi.  Glad we tried this place (otherwise I would have always wondered) but will not return.  Still need to try are arami and Juno.

I had an excellent experience here.  This restaurant opened recently on Irving Park near 6 corners, and I was excited to try it. Tank’s pho and fried rice are the best I have ever had. Both were flavorful and well-seasoned. Nice, big portions.  I ordered the extra large bowl of pho, and that included all of the protein options.  The fried rice was fluffy and had big, fresh pieces of shrimp, chicken and pork. The entire staff was very friendly and engaging, and everything we ordered was delicious. They offer boba drinks as well as tropical drinks, which were both extremely well made. I haven’t had a tropical drink that good since my last vacation. Their drink options are extensive.  Well-priced, convenient location and excellent, authentic dishes and friendly service! I will be back!

There's a reason why we eat at Tank Noodles every time we come to Vietnamese Town in Chicago. Food is great. Our waiter brought out our appetizers well before our pho noodles and rice dishes, which is awesome, because not a lot of Asian restaurants do this. The food not only looked good, but it tasted great. Was also our first time trying the Vietnamese crepe, it will not be the last time either.

Very good food quiet atmosphere even when packed ample indoor/outdoor seating.

However, most staff can barley speak english very thick accents make explanations hard to understand.

The drink menu is very generic and is the only think remotely lacking on the menu.

Stay for the food, live for the atmosphere.

Been here dozens of times and it's the go-to for fantastic pho. My all-time favorite is the Vietnamese Beef Stew & Egg Noodle Soup. Everytime we were sick or needed warm comfort food in the winter, this bowl of soup cured anything. The combination of beef, anise, cinnamon, basil, carrot, onion, and cilantro with lime juice is just mouth-watering. Highly recommend!

Great food! It's the second time in my life I eat Vietnamese food and I loved it. The soup has a special flavor that made it soft, aromatic and delicious. The fried rice was good, it was very greasy though, but I had to eat it since it was fenomenal. The passion fruit tea was very good too

I had a taste of their crispy salted fish & chicken and it was delicious! Pleasantly surprised. Also tried their BBQ pork fried rice which was simple yet tasty. I'd definitely come here again, especially when it opens at 10-ish and the food is fresh! Pictured below is the fish on the left and sweet and sour chicken on the right with BBQ pork fried rice.

I used to grab lunch here all the time before the name change. My go-to entrées were the Garlic Eggplant Chicken and the Salt & Pepper Chicken. They were hard to find elsewhere and perfectly prepared at Chinese 65.

Today was my first time back in a year or two and I was shocked that the dining room wasn't packed at noon  like before. That should have been my first sign to turn around. I ordered my usual and they only had the bottom of the pan bits left. She plated the dry looking Eggplant Chicken and said I could wait for more Salt & Pepper Chicken if I wanted since I turned down the other available items on the line. Everything looked dry and old. A couple minutes later the lady at the register walked over with my food after paying $13.

I'm really disappointed by what I found in the container when I reached my desk. The portions are much smaller, which I'm fine with. The cost has gone up since I've been here last and clearly the quality doesn't match the price. I won't be back. I'll let the photo speak for me. I also have video of me throwing the entire container in the trash.

I ordered a medium Mongolian beef with a side entree of orange chicken on white rice. I also tried the egg roll and crab rangoon. It came to just under $16. Nice portion sizes. Felt very full probably could have gotten a smaller order and still been full but wanted to try a couple things as my first time. The orange chicken had a nice kick to it. Mongolian beef was okay. The sauce was a bit runnier than I would like. It tastes fine but I preferred the orange chicken. Both the egg roll and crab rangoon had a lot of filling and great flavor. I added spicy mustard to the egg roll because that's my favorite. For downtown location it's reasonably priced, good portions, and great flavor. I recommend if in the area
An fast food restaurant… truly fast food. I was in and out within 15 minutes. If you are really hungry and can’t wait in-line. This is the place. Average quality of food.

I love this place so hard!   All the ladies (!!!) that run this place are so sweet, the dishes are tasty and reasonably-priced, and the fact that you can choose from multiple sides is so clutch.

I generally order multiple medium entrees, with different sides, then eat off all of it for days.

Place is spotless, organised, and they've got a great selection of add-on beverages.

A staple for me.

This place has got to be falling off because they served over cooked calamari under seasoned chicken sandwich’s the lettuce was beyond brown  and pesto spaghetti no flavor. So I called manager Isaac his reply was we never received a call like this in 30 years and we served 300 people no complaints he didn’t resolve anything. thanks this was our Mother’s Day dinner

Fantastic bread rolls! So warm buttery and soft! We had pasta with some chicken which was delicious! We also had the different desserts at the end. Best cannolis I've ever had. The chocolate dessert was great too, super rich! But the cannolis were impeccable.

Stumbled across this place on accident for a date night a was blown away. The scene is perfect for a date and the server/bartender Issac was awesome and made some great drinks. Food was so fresh and delicious. Will definitely come back.

I don’t typically take the time to write reviews, however the food here is too good to not share! Family owned, by Chicago natives, this place is a true gem. A must try if you’re looking to for authentic Italian food with a small business homey feel.
The bread is amazing! As is the caprese salad and the Hawaiian pizza. Fresh, delicious and a great value for the price. Will definitely be back.

Amazing restaurant!!!
Delicious food, delicious drinks, romantic atmosphere, and had gluten free options available for my wife who has celiac

Our experience was fine until it was time to pay. We paid the tab with cash and asked for an extra 20 to be split into ten dollar bills, but our change was 20 dollars short. My boyfriend asked our waiter about the issue and explained that he was sure he had given five 20s. We figured it was a simple mistake. Our waiter immediately said that nothing like this had ever happened at the restaurant before, that his manager had done the transaction, and that he didn’t steal any money. He then took out his wallet and threw a 20 dollar bill of his own at the table for us to keep. Our waiter was talking rudely to the other staff members in Spanish about us thinking we didn’t understand, but I am Cuban. We left, and on our way out, we saw the 20 dollar bill on the ground and pointed it out to the staff. The manager did apologize from a distance as we walked out. It was a very strange experience and I would not be surprised if things like this have happened before considering how defensive our waiter was, and frankly angry he was with us. The food was fine.
Delicious food, beautiful ambience and lovely waitstaff!

Very tasty food! The meatballs as an app were excellent. It was like a little meatball salad. They brought complimentary bread and olive oil (of very high quality). We shared a pizza and carbonara pasta for our lunch. Both were excellent and generous portions. Very attentive service.

Stopped in with my family for dinner and the food was good. They can make VEGAN options upon request. I ordered the spaghetti "AOP" and it was delicious. I did notice spiderwebs/dust on the lighting directly above the table.

Some of the best chicken I've ever had. Such a variety to choose from besides chicken also. Gizzards were great and the hushpuppies were cooked to perfection. It must also be a local favorite because we asked someone at the gas station a good place to eat and she even had us follow here there. Very clean establishment and super awesome employees. Will definitely be back when we are in the area. If you're looking for great chicken and a friendly environment you need to go to Harold's.

Good fried chicken is hard to come by living in WI if you're not cooking your own. My husband is even more particular about which chicken restaurants he will eat at. This was our 3rd time visiting this location while in the city. We've tried 2 or 3 other locations in error due to not remembering which street this location was on. This is by far our favorite location and will NEVER try another location. Labor Day weekend we were in town for the Jazz Festival and stopped in before going to our room. The owner assisted us and went out of her way to welcome us. We remembered her from our 2nd visit. The chicken was fresh and so tasty(NO Sauce). The owner cracked a joke on us for not wanting sauce. To each their own but I will be a returning customer. Food has been BOMB all 3 visits!!

The food was good. I ordered lemon chicken wings and fries. I didn’t get the coleslaw that came with my food but I did get the extra piece of chicken I ordered. These are full wings, not broken down wings like wing stop.

My food was ready pretty quick about 10 mins from when I ordered from the car u til picking it up.

Good to come back home to some good ol' Harold's Chicken! Not all Harold's are created equal, but this one did not disappoint. I got the chicken and catfish combo, made to order of course. Sorry no pics. By the time I realized I should review, everything was gone. Lol Also know this is a good sized location to dine in, but I did take out.

I was visiting chicago for 2 days and honestly that was some of the best fired chicken I've had in a while. There is no reason that chicken should be that good. People there are also very nice I saw them helping some random drunken teenager on the street by giving him free food and taking him in while finding his parents for him. They are some great people there. The only complaint I had was I went Back for more chicken the next day but I went too late at night and they where closed which was my fault but now I will be for ever craving some of harolds chicken.

Decent AYCE sushi, reasonably priced. Cozy dining area, you can see the chefs preparing everything to-order. Personally I loved the simple menu, and not having to ingest cream cheese and mayo every other roll.
Wished the bean curd nigiri had seaweed salad. Heck, wish seaweed salad was an option.
Tried the squid nigiri and didn't care for the rough and chewy texture. Rock N Roll was rather massive despite being only 5 pieces.
Highlights included the Pop-up Roll and Chicago Roll. Would recommend anything that doesn't have fried stuff.
Great casual sushi spot.

Sushi enthusiast here!

It's currently $20 for an all-you-can-eat lunch/dinner experience, and it's totally worth it! Any sushi place will cost more than $20 after the first specialty roll, and I got four specialty rolls and ten pieces of sushi (meat and rice only). You have to eat all of it, though, or you're charged for what you don't eat.

The food itself is delicious! I will say the tuna has a slightly metallic taste, and the eel came real chewy (though I'm sure this is an authentic taste). No rolls were shorted their fair share of meat, they were good and big specialty rolls.

I did have to ask for the check and for refills, the wait staff is the only thing I believe the place could improve upon. Also, if you care, the sodas come out in a can and a glass of ice, no fountain drinks.

Overall great experience, will go every time I visit Chicago!

If you will be hungry at 2pm and crave for sushi this is the place to go. All you can eat sushi. But it will only start at 2pm. You can order ala carte too during the regular hours. The sushi here was okay. Don't get me wrong. We love sushi and we've had better. Quieter than other lunch places. Service was good.

All you can eat was the best thing I have found in Chicago.
The portions are huge and there is a bunch of options to choose.
Service is good and tasty is ok. It's a good place to try different kind of sushi paying fair price.

It was average quality and service. The waiter treated us as we were dummy tourists who didn’t understand English well. At first it was funny, then he was like all over the place. He came to our table too often giving advices where to go, though we just wanted to eat. So we had all you can eat sushi. And we had one piece of roll left on the plate. One of the waiters told us we should finish it otherwise we’d have to pay for this leftover😂

the food is not great.ive never had a place serve me such unripe and bitter avocados. i’ve been here on 3 occasions and each time surprisingly more disappointing than the last. there’s much better sushi places out there
Best AYCE sushi I've ever had
Closed, though all the signage was on but locked up tight

Not deserve any star at all, I ordered food to go thinking to have good meal today. Turn out it is absolutely terrible kind of food I ever have in my life. Crab rangoon, I cannot even eat them because they are so chewy. Yellow curry with chicken, it is like testeless soup with yellow color broth. The curry comes with white rice which is undercooked. All I can say it is not recommended. Don't do it! When I was there, I looked at dishes they have, Thai dishes? Well, I don't think they can make Thai dishes because I know Thai dishes very well. This is abosolutely terrible. You know how much I paid...$17.06. I even got charge for extra spicy on my curry and it is not even spicy at all. There is another fee on the receipt too..."CC fee = $0.50" No answer for this one. I just was robbed by this place.

Not deserve any star at all, I ordered food to go thinking to have good meal today. Turn out it is absolutely terrible kind of food I ever have in my life. Crab rangoon, I cannot even eat them because they are so chewy. Yellow curry with chicken, it is like testeless soup with yellow color broth. The curry comes with white rice which is undercooked. All I can say it is not recommended. Don't do it! When I was there, I looked at dishes they have, Thai dishes? Well, I don't think they can make Thai dishes because I know Thai dishes very well. This is abosolutely terrible. You know how much I paid...$17.06. I even got charge for extra spicy on my curry and it is not even spicy at all. There is another fee on the receipt too..."CC fee = $0.50" No answer for this one. I just was robbed by this place. Terrible!

The Banh Mi is one of my favorites in the city! The selection of drinks and teas are a great compliment to the delicious food. I was pleasantly surprised that they were able to turn their iced teas into a hot tea on a chilly day. I can't wait to go back!

We ordered takeout- got the fried noodles w/ chicken, crab rangoons, and pho. It was all super solid, definitely cured my craving. Next time I’d do extra spicy on the noodles. I also wish the rangoons was a set of 6 (which I feel is more typical), not 4 but oh well.
Love all of their food!! Especially the street noodles, pho, classic banh mi, and egg rolls ❤️ can’t believe I don’t have to go to argyle or Chinatown for food asian food again! Super recommend 🤩
Great pizza good service awesome price.
Closed as of May 2016

Came in for dinner with a group of guys on a Friday night. The restaurant was mostly empty, but the food was still better than I had anticipated. The food was classic Mediterranean-style dishes at a decent price - nothing terribly innovative or impressive, but all solid flavors and textures. My favorite item was the scallops and parsnip puree. There were plenty of options for the vegetarian and gluten-free members of our party. I walked away both full and satisfied with the meal. If you're hungry and struggling to get a last minute table in West Loop, I'd recommend Nia.

My husband and I got the wonderful opportunity to dine at Nia last night after a wonderful massage from the Mirror Mirror Salon and Spa next door. We were the first guest of the evening and was greeted with open arms. The staff was nice and accommodating. The ambiance was lovely and inviting. The cuisine was delicious as well! We had the charcuterie board with delicious meats and cheeses. The Nia salad was delicious and refreshing. Our main courses were the Lamb Chops w/mushroom risotto and the Amish Chicken w/Potatoes and Broccoli. Everything was delicious and cooked to perfection. We couldn’t wait to dig in. We will definitely return to dine here, especially after learning they have a patio set up during the summer months. Thanks Nia for a lovely date night.

I had such a wonderful time at Nia this evening! Incredible service from all of the staff. Beautiful ambiance in a decadent and intimate setting. And the carbonara; fantastic. You can really tell when someone has their heart and soul put into a place and Nia is an excellent example of that! Make them your next stop!

One of the most welcoming quality restaurants in the city. I enjoyed the lamb which was finger licking good! The drink selection was amongst the top in the city. I will definitely be back again and have suggested it to many friends. Ask for the espresso martini it’s exquisite.

I cant speak to a normal experience but I and some friends participated in Resturant week with Nia this year and it was great! Had and 8 course, tapas style tasting menu and I was impressed! With so many heavy hitters in the west loop Nia could be overlooked but if your looking for a romantic setting and shared plates this is a gem.

Beautifully designed autumn tasting menu. Very good explanations with wine pairings. Each course had many ingredients that harmonized together very well. Can't wait to come back and try the winter menu.

An overall solid set dinner, with an especially good value (8 courses for only $125). My favorites of the savory dishes were the scallops and the duck breast - both were perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious. The highlight of the meal, however, was dessert, which was an eclectic mix of flavors.
I loved the Bristol. The menu was curated correctly and the service was great. I think the price point is rather high and I'd have liked more menu options but it's a solid place.

Fantastic experience! We were a group of 5 on a girls’ night out and we all got the tasting menu. The service was great and we even got to meet the chef who came by to say hi! My favorite dish was definitely the fazzoletto pasta - so light and with a a subdued fragrance too, it was heavenly - not at all creamy/heavy at all. Our server (Murphy) was fantastic, he worked with the kitchen to help make sure we each had the duck cooked to the level of our satisfaction (as we all had different preferences when it came to how well done we liked our duck), and even helped customize our dessert experience which allowed us to try a sampling of 3-4 different desserts. Loved the desserts so much… the panna cotta was heavenly. Needlessly to say, all of us were nearing a happy food coma at the end.

It's a SPECIAL DAY AT @bristolchicago 📍 Bucktown, Chicago IL  @midwestmunching on instagram 🧧

We've wanted to try this spot for a while, especially because it's so close to us. The laid-back setting and energetic vibe + brick x leather gave us such a cozy and fun time! They have an awesome seasonal 8 course tasting menu that featured fall flavors. I would love to try next time we are back, given they update their menu seasonally

We weren't too hungry so we just went for the tasting menu. Plus I bet Ben didn't want me to pay too much 🤣

🍝Biggest highlight was the Maldafine pasta, filled with Cantonese XO sauce, shrimp, and turnip. Perfect to celebrate the Lunar New Year. Curls of the pasta hugged every bit of the sauce. It was perfectly chewy , slurpable with sweet, umami, and savory tastes of heaven.

🥖We also got the contemplantary Milk Bread  which I didn't think much of but WOW look at my face. The caviar compound butter + crispy g light bread was to die for.

Other items include:
🍖Short ribs with truffle and sunchoke (not enough flavor) . 🥔With potatoes that were to die for. They literally were so crispy on the outside then melted into your mouth
🐷Pork shoulder & belly with blue corn polenta (a bit dry)

Desserts and cocktails were 💣 BOMB though;
🍏Basque cake - they've made for 20 years, made with. Apple and served with sherbet
🍮Rice Panna Cotta - super smooth and light, the way that the Japanese would make it. Served with plum, raisin and a super crispy layer of cinnamon. Just WOW
🍸 nesting dolls - vodka, elderflower, rhinehall la nomande,. Versus
🥃Warmth hearth-. Bourbon & persimmon chamomile vermouth

highly highly recommend the pasta, milk bub,, basque cake, and rice Panna Cotta

Delicious pizza — it really does taste CLEANER!
Fantastically fresh ingredients served up with personality and finesse.

We had a cracker-thin crust (the Skinny) topped with red sauce, mozzarella, sun-dried tomatoes and artichoke hearts. Just lovely!

I do like to be able to eat in once in a while, especially in a cafe that's as light and airy as Naked's location just off the Diversey Brown Line. Maybe they'll add a table or two once it gets too cold to dine at the two lil' guys al fresco?
Excellent pizzas with great options including gluten free. The staff is courteous and the pizza is always ready on time. Recommend it highly.
Surprisingly good pizza & cheesy bread. A little slow on the delivery but it was a rainy cold Tuesday. Would definitely order from here again.
Best Gluten-Free pizza I've ever had!!!! Love this place! Quick delivery makes this place my new go-to pizza place!
I don't think this place is open anymore. Nobody will answer the phone and they didn't deliver a pizza I ordered last night. Weird, right?

Very nice atmosphere, with pleasent and fast service. The food was very nice with good portions for the average appetite. The only 'gripe' I could have was that they were a bit previous with the bill, it arriving before we'd all even finished the main course, let alone discussed desert. They did apologise though.
We arrived just after 1pm and had around a 40 minute wait  which wasn't too much of a problem with their text updates.

A good place to visit here @navy pier. Ordered some of the best items we ordered from our previous trips.
The quality of shrimps has been declining since our last visit. It doesn't taste the same.
The rest of the items were great this time around though. Drinks are very refreshing as well.

This was an interesting stop! It was our first time there. The service was good. The food was good. The atmosphere was fun for Forrest Gump fans! We loved the trivia questions at the end! Double plus: they make a really good Bloody Mary!

This place do not only serve food, but an entire experience inspired to the famous Forrest Gump movie. Everything recalls the movie, from the furniture to the pictures on the wall. It mostly serves shrimps, prepared in all the possible ways, but you can also find some fish dishes. We got shrimp dishes, of course, and they were all tasty, balanced and delicious. Staff kind and friendly. Quite expensive, but worth the price.

Enjoyed my experience here. Service was nice and quick while food was still good. Unfortunately no one at our table saw Forrest Gump so the trivia was too difficult 😂 Wish there was a location in Toronto....

Uncommon Ground (the Central Perk of Chicago??) has good food and great service, but I wasn't down with the horrible 80's music and vibe (Michael Jackson-- three freaking songs, no less-- and "The Boss" can die horrible musical deaths for all I care).

Food: vegan hash and the chilaquiles were both tasty and with a kick to them.

Coffee was decent as well.

The seats were uncomfortable though.

Visited the lake view location before a Cubs game a week ago. Outstanding service. Excellent food - such a fresh selection and super cool art vibe. Don’t miss the roasted cauliflower- Chicken sandwich was soooo good. Will definitely return!

We happened to pass this gem on our way to a sushi restaurant. My wife read organic brewery on the window and we decided to stop on our way  back to the train after dinner.
We had the best experience here!
It started with the host greeting us and making us feel welcome. It seemed that he was slightly confused because we were asking some fairly odd (odd because they probably should have been obvious!) questions, such as “Is this a coffee shop? Can we sit down?” He took it in stride and realized we didn’t know what we actually walked into. Turns out this place is a brewery AND a roaster of fine coffee!
My wife had the chai, our friend had a slightly(!) adult beverage, and I had a stout. We also ordered the bread pudding. I highly recommend the stout. Absolutely delicious! I enjoyed the bread pudding and the chai as well, but, damn! I’m going to go back for that stout!

If you happen to be wondering around Wrigleyville and you need coffee and beer and bread pudding and a great time, stop by Uncommon Ground. You will not regret it.

We sure as hell didn’t.
Felt a little average. Outdoor seating / service / drinks were great. Food was just OK. Folks around us did not seem to be enjoying their meals either.  Eggs Benedict were dry.

Super good place! Was looking to try something new and this place is a nice gem!
Good food options (brunch specials)
Great service 👌👌
Nice outdoor seating🙌
Pleasant experience overall on a lovely saturday afternoon

Prices higher, pieces got smaller.
$3.29  for a chicken leg that is slightly longer than the width of receipt.

My chicken was fresh,  piping hot and simply delicious! However,  I  was craving the Nashville hot chicken. I asked if I could pay to have it on my chicken. The manager told me they only offer it on the tenders and if I wanted it on my chicken, I would be charged ann additional $5...FOR SOME SAUCE!!? I  know that food prices have gone up but that is absolutely ridiculous. I feel like it was terrible customer service to even say this to me. A simple We don't offer it would have been enough. I would have been disappointed but I would have understood and moved on. Also, the Mac n cheese tasted like it came straight from a can... All of it. I don't understand why KFC can't seem to get the sides right. They changed the cole slaw a long time ago and I still haven't forgiven them. My chicken and drink were really good though. KFC is an ok once-in-a-while spot for some tasty chicken.

Their attitudes are horrible. The way they greet you at drive though and talk to you like a criminal. They don't even sound interested in taking your order. If they mess up your order they will argue with you about it.

I’m a delivery driver. They ran out of the free beverage buckets included in the order. I asked for some drinks instead for the customer since it was implied they would get it. They refused and got mad at me for asking stating “it’s not even for you why do you care?” …. I get reviews for my job and it looks bad if I don’t deliver something they were expecting to get. Ridiculous.

As a new employee I was charged $25.00 for my uniform shirt and hat. I don't know whether or not this is kfc's policy. I've called other locations and the corp phone number, and no one can agree that I was to be charged at all.

We ordered quite a variety of delicious meal bagels for takeout and I might have overdone the amount of roast beef and chives I crammed into one bagel sandwich (if that is even possible). We also tremendously enjoyed the  salmon bagel and will strongly recommend both of these to anyone.

I was a regular (2-3 time a week, $30-$40 per order) tipping customer, but the same cashier messed up the order for the third time. Does the attached image look like there’s bacon, avocado and cream cheese in it.

When asked to be refunded, the manager is dumb enough to get in argument over if the terminology of asking to be refunded for the order is equivalent to getting refunded for the bagel when the whole order is just one bagel. On top of that he blamed me for not checking the order before I leave - yeah, I should unwrap the aluminum foil of the bagel and open it up in the shop to peek inside and see if you guys got it right. I can’t even trust you guys to get this simple thing correct?

Needless to say, good way to lose a customer when a simple “Sorry, we messed up. Let us make it up to you.” would have done.

Non-Descript building…. The menu and layout is actually confusing. Can’t tell who’s wait or who ordered but also menus everywhere. Bagel does have a great bite to it! And no need to say “extra cheese” cause they smear it in on! 👍🏼

Cool little spot within walking distance of Mag Mile. Great breakfast sandwich selections. One of the spices threw me off and left a weird taste but that’s just me and it didn’t stop me from going back.

IF YOU ARE FROM NY/NJ THESE BAGELS ARE SOOOOOO TRASH. False advertising, much closer to a Dunkin’ Donuts bagel than anything you’d get in New York. This is their everything bagel with scallion CC. Sad.

Lumes is FANTASTIC! Delicious food, hearty portions and service with a smile, all at wallet friendly price! CLEAN; the only smells in the air are coffee and food! Mini waffles and raisin toast options. FRESH fruit, too! The server was super attentive even AFTER giving us the check! Now THAT'S good service!

Service was great and so was the food. Fast service and the coffee compared to Starbucks. My 1st visit.

If I'm ever in the area again,  I'd come here to eat.

Celebrating with classmate that we passed our Mortuary Science exams. Now on to graduation!

I even helped to save a life in the restaurant. God placed me in the right place at the right time!

God is Good!

Went here today and I was enjoying myself until the lady with 2 girls were at the table next to me saw roaches in her booth. She called the waiter over and pointed it out. He act like he didn’t see the roach  and she told him that he just killed it. This was my first and last time. Definitely won’t be back! Disgusted! Lumes on Western!
So so good! I had the Mayan skillet (with chicken sausage instead of chorizo) and mm mm mm!! So fresh and tasty!! I will be back for sure! 😋😋

Wife and I got breakfast here. Great service even though it was a bit busy. Food came quickly, sorry didn't think to take pics. Place was clean, atmosphere family friendly. Wife ordered California Sunrise breakfast she said was very well presented, perfectly prepared, very delicious. I ordered my standard breakfast fare, waffle, eggs and bacon - all ok, not perfect but good enough. Would definitely eat here again when in the area.

These guys stand out in the whole of Chicago for authentic  Hyderabadi cuisine. Must haves:
1. Weekend  Mutton Biryani on  Saturday’s and Sundays
2. Kabab rolls - chicken boti kabab
3. Chicken malai kabab and boti kabab
4. Apollo Fish (appetizer)
5. Desserts - Fruit salad and kheer

The above are my favorites.

If kings of good times was supposed to be rewritten it must be written as “king of good grill food” place in Chicago. Br Moiz and his back-end team serve the best Hyderabadi traditional food. Be their platter, Haleem or custom ordered Mandi Platter. The wait for good food is well deserved.
The Best Indian food I had in Chicago. The flavours and taste are on top level.

Updated Review August 20, 2022: We visited recently with my in-laws after speaking so highly about this place. They have expanded but the service has declined tremendously. The man working seemed like he would much rather be any where else. Customer service skills lacked tremendously. We were told the mutton kadhai could not be ordered. Isn’t this a Pakistani restaurant? Mutton kadhai is a staple dish. Anyway. We miss this spot when the owner was actually present running it…

My husband and I have been coming to eat here since April 2021 every time we are in town. This is a must visit spot for us for at least a meal on our random weekend Chicago trips. We live 4.5 hours away. The food is phenomenal, fresh, and so flavorful! The owner is attentive and kind. We typically order the mixed platter and butter chicken. The chapati is perfectly made. The bihari kebab is a must try and I can never leave without getting the falooda for dessert. So yummy!
Restaurant is clean and service is good too..mostly hyderabadi cuisine and taste.Dum biryani and Bbq platters is good but karahi isn’t authentic

The servers here provide the best service!!! I know they’ve been hit hard by supply chain issues during the pandemic, including a national chicken wing shortage. But I PROMISE the wings are worth it!! Shoutout to Jasmine and Jordan, I love them :)
Very good wings!!! Nice crispy edges on the drums!! The house sauce is amazing!!! Sat on the outside made it more fun!! Highly recommended if your a wing person!!
Phenomenal wings. Plenty of TV's. Great service (even when busy). And they had an awesome Collab with local Spiteful brewing for their house lager.

Stopped in on a Sunday afternoon for a change of pace and it was well worth it. Brought my softball and everyone was very accommodating to our group and everyone was friendly and patient. Plenty of televisions playing all of the sports with no one being rowdy and loud. Very nice atmosphere.

The food is pretty good. I say that to say it’s mostly bar food with some specialty stuff. I’d go for the special stuff since you can get bar food anywhere.

Very nice staff and prompt service. The crown was very chill and everyone seemed to have been there before which was really cool to see. During our visit, someone called to say they believed they lost something and two of the staff actually took the time to root around the tables to try and locate the persons lost item. My fiends and I appreciated seeing that.

Give Bird’s Nest a shot if you live in the neighborhood or are just passing through.

The. Best. Wings. In Chicago. End of story. Great dive bar with good prices, good environment, and has a great range of people from locals who have been coming for decades to young professionals wanting to hang out with some wings and a bucket of beers. Outdoor patio space is good and dog friendly as well. Favorite neighborhood bar in Chicago by far!

Had a fantastic time at Clutch Chicago for their happy hour! The drinks were all fantastic (that dehydrated lime on the mule and margs is so beautiful and such a nice touch!!), the ambiance is spectacular, and the food was also amazing. The chef came out to tell us about the latest specials added to the menu, and all of the staff treated us so kindly. Our server Bianca was super cute and sweet. :) as a vegan, i was so happy to have a veg option on the menu with the Beyond Burger, and it just so happens that the Caesar Salad’s dressing is automatically vegan! Highly recommend Clutch for a fun summer outing with friends.

LOVE Blüm! It so cute inside with all the flowers! Great place to hangout with friends or have a party. We went for brunch and the food there was absolutely delicious. I usually don’t like oysters but these were the BEST oysters I’ve ever had. We also ordered the breakfast croissant, biscuits & gravy and the Cesar salad. Drink menu was so fun and creative. My favorite would be the margarita tower! highly recommend checking them out!

Beautiful restaurant/bar! The staff was lovely, provided an outstanding service. The manager is a really nice person! Our drinks were strong and worth the money, and the pretzel we ordered was really good, not to mention it could possibly feed 4 people. We are definitely coming back. Big thanks! The only thing to keep in mind is the restaurant charges a venue fee and a service fee.
I really enjoyed this place. It's so pretty, airy and feels like a girl's ethereal dream. The food and drinks were soooo good! Good staff. I will definitely be back.

Loved ladies night here!

This is definitely a standout spot in River North with the beautiful decor, happy hour/ladies nights deals, and attention to quality in the food. Usually with the done-up spots in the city there’s usually a piece of the puzzle lacking, but I felt that service, food quality, atmosphere, and music were all great!

The drinks during ladies night were $8 each, with shots being $5 each which was an awesome deal in the city. The food was definitely more upscale than the normal bar food you’d expect, the chef even presented the food and told us how he only sources top grade tuna for the ahi-ahi, and that a lot of thought goes into the quality of the ingredients which I appreciated. Stand out menu items were the $5 chicken skewers on ladies night that come with hummus, the lobster Mac, and crab Rangoons! The $10 ladies night sliders were also delicious.

The spot gives off too Miami vibes and I learned it was designed after “Kiki on the river” which they definitely nailed with a lot of beauty throughout. This is the perfect spot to bring your girlfriends in the city!

1st time there. Reserved a table easily. Great service, atmosphere, MUSIC, various sports playing, & food. Peanut butter jelly shot was awesome! Definitely making this a spot to visit throughout the summer!
Went on a Sunday afternoon. Staff was very kind drink specials were great and food was delicious with huge portions. It’s right off the train station. 10/10 would recommend
I love the vibe of this place and I found that they had excellent food at low prices. I sat outside and enjoyed a football game on the outdoor TV. Super nice staff and overall great place!
$5 burger night at Waterhouse is a must on Mondays. Rob and Molly are a fantastic duo. Great service and delicious food. If you haven’t been here yet for a Monday night you’re missing out!

Wife and I went in on a Saturday afternoon, and we're pleasantly surprised. There were tons of vegetarian options and the drinks were fantastic. Definitely would go back to visit, but the only downside is that it is a Purdue bar. Go Hoosiers!

Came in rather late in the evening after a botched reservation on the pier. Was a bit turned off by the fusion element in the name but must admit, we were truly surprised. Our server was nice and efficient, didn't try to oversell anything or work us. Ordered two shrimp dumplings, crab rangoon, and several pieces of nigiri. Everything was absolutely amazing and fresh, with depths of flavor. Ambience and atmosphere was nice: dark and brooding and was almost like being in Tokyo. Highly recommend especially for those from out of town looking to impress clients.

It was fine. Not the best but not the worst. Sushi was good. They didn’t have a few of the menu items available - not sure why — but the menu is large enough for you to be able to find something else.

Service: Menu is straightforward and easy to order from. Waiter was very Attentive and helpful in making accommodations to our halal diet

Food: Ordered : Lotus Bowl, 2 Sushi Rolls, and Two ramen bowls. Our total was around $96, it is a bit pricy coming from Michigan for me but it’s in Chicago downtown so I get it. I also got a green tea ice cream-don’t recommend it unless you like the rusty feeling of green tea.

Highlight for me: The restaurants vibe and Ramen. My two favourite things is the actual seating at the restaurant because it felt like a really upscale but chill at the same time. The ramen was also delicious and definitely felt like I was eating bougie ramen. It is great for cold days with the soup basses that it comes in.

Phenomenal food, beautiful ambience, and one of the best service I've ever received from a restaurant. It was busy and packed. But we got our food quickly and the server always seemed to come at the right time.  Couldn't ask for a better dinner.

Second time at Niu Lounge and I am impressed! Centrally located in River north it’s a great place to come for dinner and movie with the AMC right next door. The food is great — I enjoyed two sushi rolls with a noodle dish that was unlike anything I’ve had before. Packed with so much flavor and perfect combination of savory/sweet. We sat at the bar and was serviced by Michael who gave great recommendations that added to our experience. Great food, good drinks, and great customer service.

The restaurant is consistently busy so make a reservation if you can and if you are trying to social distance here you won’t be able to.

Today I ordered off Grubhub and I’m impressed- food was fresh, hot and PREPARED exactly how I requested and TASTES GREAT- the food was amazing whereas I’m actually writing a review to complement them - thank you I will order again from
First time.. Too much mustard.. Polish was rushed/ thrown together. No sport peppers included with my everything.. Fries pretty good.

Placed order with specific instructions, order was wrong. Cashier answering phone was who I placed order with told her it was wrong she said well we have alot of orders I'll give 10% off next order. I TOLD HER THAT'S NOT EVEN TAX I WILL NEVER ORDER AGAIN!!! My lunch was ruined and she didn't care.....................and I was so excited to order from the because I heard good things about their tacos....NOT!!!!!!
So the Italian beef polish combo sandwich was fabulous! Chili cheese fries were average place was clean and exactly what I was looking for.

If you're looking for a good beef sandwich, look elsewhere. Compressed, tough, and flavorless.  Needless to say it's not made in-house. The hot giardinera is bad too. How can that be?

Ordered 2 hot dogs and buns were hard even. Smh.

If a place sells Mexican food and Beef sandwiches,  don't eat there.

Decided to stop by this place for a light breakfast. Wife got the beet juice, yogurt and I went with the salmon Benedict with hash. This was delicious! I tried some of my wife’s yogurt and it was delicious as well. Definitely recommend you stop by this place to eat.

The restaurant owner was surprisingly terrible. We came with a party of 3 and we stated we had 3 more coming. The owner said he would combine tables once the people were at the restaurant. After 5 min, our party arrived (all minorities) and then the owner said he couldn't combine tables. I pointed out that several other parties had combined tables and he told me he knows how to do his job. I asked if he was the owner and he said yes. I told him I intend to write a review about our experience today and he said good.

He had no intentions of trying to make it right or court our future service. It's clear that he had animosity towards us.

In addition, the food was terrible and we had several overripe strawberries in our fruit cup and on our pancakes (see picture).

The waitress was very nice, but that was the only good part about this place.

It goes without saying, but I will not be returning and I hope that my honest experience keeps other people from visiting the restaurant with an owner that  seems not to care about providing acceptable service.

We haven't eaten here in a while but always had good experiences before and this latest visit reminded us of how good their food is.  My wife said they make cheese grits the way she does and she really liked them for that. My farmers bowl was delicious with nice cuts of meat and fresh veggies.  Two thumbs up!
Just a regular breakfast place, but they did have vegan/gluten free options which is nice. Ordered biscuits and gravy with grits and french toast. All of it was good and service was friendly.
Simply not good at all. I order the tofu scramble with veggies, tasteless and not how a todu scramble should be at all. Very expensive aswell. Would not recommend.
worst yogurt of my life. The granola tasted horrible and the yogurt was sour, like expired. Wouldn’t recommend this place to eat.
Really loved this place! Very healthy options! Protein Shakes are on point!  👌🏿

A really interesting concept in my opinion - a blend of fast food (think Chipotle) and super health food. As someone who's usually not much of a health nut, it was both surprisingly good tasting and surprisingly good for me!

I gave this place a second chance.  First time tried the Mexicali burrito and it was terrible, very bland.  Tried the Korean Bibi Q burrito the second time and was excellent.  Very nice flavor combination between the steak/cucumbers/pickled carrots + sweet spicy sauce.    I would eat here more often if it was not on the expensive side.   At least 20% too expensive compared to other competition for a meal.  And at least 30% less food for the price.

I went there this morning, ordered a smoothie through ritual because I didn't want to wait and i was trying to make a healthier choice. Service as usual was fast; however, the choice I made today was not a good one.  I tried the hippie smoothie efore leaving out the door and I just could not stomach it.  Turned around and told the manager i didn't like it and wanted to order something else. I was willing to pay yet he was more concerned with me being satisfied with my choice.  He immediately made me a new smoothie, no charge and it was yummy.  So thanks Protein Bar and Kitchen for real deal customer service. ❤ I will be back soon!😉
We had apple pie A la  mode 4 $3.58. A bargain. The richness of the ice cream complemented the cinnamon in the pie. So d-lish.

Great Price for Quality Food. The staff is Very friendly and Inviting. Kids love the Cheese fries. Adults Enjoy their breakfast all day. And I personaly Enjoy the Columbian Coffee with a Pecan Roll. I Keep coming back for more.
Nice neighborhood place to go and hang out and eat!

They never answer the phone to take a order , its covid season so the cook who is the only one in their now sits in their but when you go to make or pickup a order he will not let you in only takes your money while he locks the door and leaves you standing their waiting for your food and change back, Now this would be fine since i guess safety precautions and all but Like i stated They Never Answer The Phone to take a order and if you walk pass this little place you will see the cook judt sitting their not answering orders

OMG! So, I have to say that their Tacos and Burrito Al Pastor are fantastic. I pretty much stop by once a week to get either of them. The staff is super friendly and they treat you like you are at home. Always with a smile and ready to help. Love watching the Telenovelas while waiting for my order.
Small little shop but filled with lots of deliciousness. 100% recommend to anyone looking for great Mexican fast food.
Long wait due to shortage of staff but the food was good. The skillet queso was my fave

Well the cheese fries was cooked hard so more then likely cooked to long. Where I my food first and had to wait almost an hour for my friend food to come out. I totally understand they had only one oven working but to bring one dinner out then almost an hour later the person food. . Waiter and manager was great  them for the kindness .

The food was good and the drinks were better! They are short staffed so you have to be patient with them.  We had the queso dip, triple dipper with chicken, fried pickles & honey Chipotle chicken,  baked seafood pasta, trio fajitas (chicken, steak, shrimp) and cheeseburger.  Everything tasted good and our server/bartender Frenchie was great!

Food was super good and hot. The bartender drinks are off the chain she does a great job. The Manager was down to earth and hilarious. Even though they only have one section open and we had to wait a while the staff made it better with the great services.

My son grandson and I decided to have some late night food The service was Awesome!! The restaurant was crowded there was a guy at the bar who had one adult beverage to many the police came escorted him away the food was cold the waiter took it back brought back piping hot food! Much better ! Then I saw it the bugs crawling up the wall 😳Check please and a to go box! Told the waiter and the manager 🤷🏽‍♀️ Yeah I’ll continue cooking at home……..

The worst McDonalds ever. The people who work there don’t care about their customers. They were supposed to give me a double quarter pounder and they ended up giving me the single. The quarter pounder was terrible and they hardly gave me any fries. Not worth it and this will be my last time coming here. They call this a medium fries.

came to buy food but my toddler needed to pee so i wanted to take her before i ordered so my food could be fresh. he refused to let my 4 YEAR OLD DAUGHTER in the bathrooms cause we didnt have a receipt . i told him im buyin food i jus need to let her pee first . he told me no and turned his bac . VERY INHUMANE ! wouldnt give me corporate number or his name, said he didnt have to ! I WANT TO SPEAK TO CORPORATE ! we are humans and deserve simple human decency ! a child should not be denied a restroom simply cause i wanted to her to pee first then order ! he does not deserve to be in customer service if this is how he would treat a 4 Year Old Child !

Awesome service àt this particular McDonald's store location! Staff were very courteous and professional! The food is very fresh and tasty! The items listed on the Dollar menu are excellent! This McDonald's location deserves more than Just 5 stars! Highly recommended! 🌞

I'm giving this place 5 stars, because I'm comparing it to other McDonald's restaurants. Relative to other McDonald's restaurants this one is very clean, the staff are friendly and helpful and the washrooms are always clean and well stocked. Also the staff are very accommodating when you ask for something to be made in another way other than what is typically on the menu.  Both efficient and friendly.

My friends and I finished a movie. Before coming to this McDonald’s we confirmed the hours were open until midnight for both drive through and dine in. We walked out of our way to get there and when we arrived the doors were locked. We also tried to order curbside pick up but it said it was closed online as well. Overall disappointing and a horrible experience. Why do you have those hours posted if you aren’t going to commit to them? It seems like they not interested in satisfying their customers.
We had a shrimp cocktail, and an assortment of vegetarian quesadillas. The food was delicious. The service was fast and friendly.

The shrimp empanadas are amazing!!! I love them along with the cocktail and dip in Valentina sauce. The whole delicious portion is only $11. So yummy and cheap for its quality. I keep coming back for more.

Good Mexican food. It taste authentic food that you will get in Mexico. The seafood like shrimp its really good here very fresh. But the best here is the Taco al Pastor. One of the best I had in Chicago

This little restaurant provides a neat cultural atmosphere and delicious food. Huge servings well worth the price. Very nice staff, who are helpful and polite. I’m a big fan of the quesadillas and my girlfriend is a big fan of the steak burritos. I’ve always ordered too much here because I get used to the small portion sizes of other Mexican places. NO NEED!

Found a hair in my salsa so it was off to a pretty bad start. I ordered chicken enchiladas and they were mediocre taste wise but they made me sick. I asked when the food came out for a water and they brought it well after i was done with my food. Took them forever to bring my check and there were only 2 other guests. Save your money and avoid this place.

Decent local store, friendly staff, fair prices.

Butcher counter is large, good variety.  They have some hot food for take away.

Avocados can be very good here, tomatoes as well.

Fruit is pretty good, hit some days and missing fresh products on some days.

Overall good and improving.

Some cashier's are very respectful, but the baggers are not empathetic with some of us who are disable and can not move fast. The quality of your meat department is good. The prices are equally to others or even higher.
Overall you are a clean store but just for me to purchase there only in emergencies
It's a cool place. There's a restaurant inside the market and the market has many products to buy not food in other markets
The store was well stocked and clean. There's a small parking lot west to the store. Inside the store there's a small restaurant.
Food delicious, awesome food prices.....

I'd recommend going on the first day because I think you'll find more items simply. Got a second hand evening wear for 40$ when original price was like 150$ which felt like a good deal to me, especially because it wasn't really worn. Great place for accessories and vintage sunglasses. It was raining on the final day we went so we had to rush though it, but I'd do it again. I think they'll be open around November again..

Parking was easy, nice neighborhood, the booths were fun to explore. I just found prices to be a little high for second hand, and there were too many import dealers that were nearly exactly the same. Also some items and booths that were not family friendly. 😔

Sally Schwartz runs a class act market. Absolutely the best vintage/antique market in Illinois.  You could spend the entire day at the market because there is so much to see along with listening to live music, having a bite to eat or sipping on a tasty Bloody Mary. Combine that with the fabulous atmosphere and people watching,  the small admission fee is well worth it.

Diane
Lockport , Illinois

Great Atmosphere walking around looking for treasures.  Most anything you might want can be found here from fine jewelry to vintage or recreated furniture items.  Fun place to people watch with live music and drinks while you shop.  Some deals to be found if you look closely.
This is an amazing place. I visit here very month. You can get lots of interesting things here.  Most of my home decorations are from here.

I was in the area & thought I would stop in to get a catfish perch combo for my Mother & I. But they were out of perch. Decided on catfish chicken combo & small liver. The Service was very friendly, patient & quite helpful. Wait was not too long. But after getting home the fish chicken combo had a strange & peculiar smell. I don’t know if it was the cooking oil used but it was not an inviting smell. The small liver did not have the smell but I couldn’t get the smell from the fish & chicken combo out of my nose. I can’t give this to my Mother as she is also sensitive to strange smells. This was supposed to be a special treat & splurge for us since my Mom had been having a taste for fish. The Harold’s we use to always go to on 87th & Dan Ryan was sadly replaced by another chicken restaurant. $25 is truly splurging as that’s much more than we used to pay but prices are going up everywhere. But it would have been all worth it if food was pleasant to smell & taste. Perhaps this was an off night / old cooking oil .. But I won’t be able to go back & chance losing $25 again.

This is the smallest 6 wing I’ve ever had from a Harolds barely got any fries and was put in the smallest tray they possibly had for this to be $14 it definitely wasn’t worth it should’ve went to one on 87th & Sangamon like I started to high prices but get low food portions

I don't eat out at fast food places very often.  The prices have gone up at this place. I always got a 6 piece wings and the price was around $7.35.  Now they are $11 to $13 wow.  For that price the wings could have been from adult chickens instead of  the toddler size I got with barely no meat. I guess prices are going up everywhere. Lobby was clean and the lady behind the counter was polite and pleasant. It didn't take long for my order to come up.

Definitely a Harold's fan. 1st time at this one and their food tasted great. It was fresh and the sauce had that kick to it. Will make sure this the one I stop at from here on out when in the city. I forgot to take my pic before eating, lol

Exceptional, fresh ever time I have ordered food from here. (6 -total).   Staff are very nice.  Establishment is clean also. They have items on the menu that you wont find everywhere fresh like this Harold's chicken.  Good job!

Went to Natalino's on a recommendation from a friend.  Excellent food, good service.  We had two bottles of wine, both of which were outstanding.  The cheesey posters of random, awful romantic comedies that adorn the walls are a nice touch.

Food was good, not great.  The service was terrible.  Asked our waiter three times before finally getting a drink.  They would come back time and time again asking what we wanted and still didn't get the orders right.  During our bad dining experience the valet actually came up to us and asked if he could give us our keys because he wanted to leave and the car was parked up front.  We said OK.  When we left the valet was sitting at the bar drinking.  I guess he had to leave to the bar.  Bad experience and would never go back because of the service.

Possibly the best scallops that I've had in Chicago. We ordered the dark pasta seafood with shrimp and scallops and it was simply great! The waitress was really nice and the staff was very friendly. The outdoor patio is my favorite. It is heated in the winter and I recommend it as one of the nicest outdoor seating areas in the city. The prices were a little expensive but definitely worth the taste. This is a great place for a date, special event or just good food, enjoy.

Ridiculously fantastic gluten free menu! Their gluten free gnocchi and ravioli were out of this world! The staff is so nice and attentive. The cozy atmosphere is very relaxed and welcoming. I definitely cannot wait to return!

Excellent service! When I was here, I spent awhile perusing the extensive menu of delcious Italian cuisine, and when asked for a suggestion, the server suggested a delicious option! I had scallops with a light angel hair pasta dish, and the scallops were cooked perfectly- so good! Their house Pinot Noir was great too.
As you leave, make sure to enjoy a mint chocolate.
YUM! Their tomato cream sauce is spot on. We really enjoyed the stuffed gnocchi - it's so soft it melts in your mouth. Definitely a neighborhood gem and going back soon.

The food here is GREAT!! Took my boyfriend for a nice dinner, and it was an amazing night. The house specials are always top notch. The service is great and the pricing is very reasonable. Definitely check this place out.
Food is delicious and authentic. Great spot for Polish and Slavic soups, meats, and specialties. Tasty kompot too!
The food is excellent. The pork cutlet and the Polish plate are great options.  The decore and styling of the restaurant is very welcoming.  Will definitely be back.

Terrible place! So sad to see this place go down. The owner lady is so racist and rude! She needs to focus more on the food and not talking bad about her customers. Don’t go here if you want to be discriminated against.

Very good tasty and fresh polish food. Good portions for the price. Crowdy at lunch time tells it's popular. Their strongest point is food, not interior design, which is not bad compared to similar joints in the hood. They have nice private room for parties. Recommended.
Great tasting Polish food. The roasted duck is excellent!

I just ordered from this restaurant for the first time. This place blows away all the other Chinese take out restaurants in the area. I ordered the General Tso's chicken (Hong Sue chicken). The food quality is top notch. The service is excellent. I got a large order. They gave me enough food to feed 5 people. The chicken was delicious and overflowed from the box (also, with the vegetables). I got an order from another Chinese restaurant in the area and they did not give me 1/2 the food I got from this place. This was all for under $16.
Will not be going to any other place for Chinese take out (other than/then this place) from now on.
I’ve been coming here for years. Excellent food at a great price, prepared quickly and fresh. Try the spicy shrimp, or any of the staples. Highly recommend.
The best see thru! I love this place and have been going for years. Still my favorite Chinese food restaurant on the north side.
The food here is consistently good and not greasy. Pick up and GrubHub delivery have been great so far.
We live closer to two other Jimmy John's but always take the extra few minutes to come here because they are the best. Everything has always been perfect and they are very nice and efficient.

Sandwich was fine, and as fast as advertised. But, $18 with drink and chips is a bit ridiculous for what you're getting. Though the amount of mustard they put on there is probably factored into the cost.
This is a great location. I always use them deliver to Belmont harbor when boating, and the orders are always on time and accurate.

I have been going to this place for years and have ordered many times. This place has professionalism written all over it. Food is always spot on and deliveries have never been an issue. The quickest and easiest place to order from everytime. Just want to say thank you to the staff for always keeping it consistent.

Walked into a very clean Jimmy John's. Staff members were very friendly and very helpful ordering and making my delicious 9-in turkey sandwich. Along with the usual lettuce tomato onions, please remember to add some Jimmy mustard and some Jimmy peppers. Truly sucks them apart from Oliver sub sandwich places. Make it a combo and add some chips and a soft drink. They also have cookies. It was all very quick and relatively inexpensive I suggest you go there

My favorite place in the entire world. I have celebrated every birthday and anniversary here since the 90s. Spinach ravioli will have you dreaming of having it again for days. Rigatoni napoleatona is my favorite second but I have had everything on the menu and loved it all. The service is fast and always willing to please the customer. Makes me think of my aunt's cooking. Some great stuff here!!

If price was not a concern, I would say this place has above average food, which is slightly better in quality than at other Italian restaurants. However, considering the price, one could find better Italian food elsewhere. I had the salmon ravioli and thought it was too salty, but everything else we ordered (cheese board, lasagna, and ensalata tricolore) was good. The restaurant has a cute and cozy atmosphere that is not particularly suitable for a date. Nothing special here, but nothing too bad either.

Excellent Italian with a warm and welcoming atmosphere. A fantastic date night with cycling artwork filling the walls. If the lamb is ever a special it is a must order; the most tender and delicious lamb!

The BEST italian restaurant in Chicago!! An appetizer of grilled octopus, grilled calamari, and grilled shrimp was simply delicious. Pumpkin gnocchi with a tomato and basil sauce were a dream - soft and airy, every morsel a delight. Fettucini with assorted mushrooms was an amazing blend of flavors. Generous portions, food served precisely al dente, friendly service, no noisy music, a not too expensive very nice bottle of Dolcetto d'Alba, recommended by our knowledgeable waiter. A great dinner. Strongly recommended.

Filippo's is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. They have excellent pasta dishes, and their bread pudding is my favorite dessert in the City. It is usually not crowded, and I believe it is family-owned.

OMGGGGGG I was introduced to this slot years ago before I became VEGAN and it was really delicious then. Now that I’m back I know WHY I kept the name stored in my mental Rolodex!! It’s fantastic the service is outstanding and I’m eating now but can’t wait to return again and again. If you’re in Chicago or near Hype Park VEGAN or not…you must taste this deliciousness!!

My Favorite Birthday taste at the Peir location BUT THIS IS the Hub block!! Excellent Service and Nice Public People and customers. VVVVvery Delicious food fresh experience 💯
My Mom LOVED her first experience today!

Finally went after wanting to try them for so long( unfortunately closing July 1)... But anyhow I ordered a Plant based chicken, bacon avocado sandwich with seasoned fries!!! Deliciousness overload!!! Seasoned very well...Staff was sitting outside BUT became very attentive &courteous upon my arrival, her name was Shana, like me...she let me know what items were unavailable, I was slightly heartbroken because I really wanted to try the cauliflower wings lol.. But the sandwich made up for it! If they weren't closing permanently I would've definitely go again!!!

I am giving this location 5 stars because of the service provided by the manager Marquette and He provided awesome service, was positive and said he was going to keep pushing through even though he was short staffed. I have seen this location go wayyyyyy downhill since it first came to Hyde Park both food and service wise, but Marquette was wonderful! The new menu item is only available thru May—I will return for it because of Marquette. Get him some staff support so that you retain good talent. Also keep new menu items ON the menu.
The food was very bland and it just wasn’t satisfactory. Definitely a trash place to eat.

The hostess Judy was obviously having a bad day, and took it out on her customers - neither welcoming nor pleasant.  Not the face of a very good restaurant one wants to see on their first experience.   If it hadn't been for my partner, I would have missed out on the great lunch I had just for that, as I would have just left.

Despite that ....what a great experience.   Fun and delicious all at once!  Our server Nina was prompt and helpful and quite friendly.  Generous portions without being heavy and the meats were all tasty.  And hey - you get to cook your own food and even S'mores for dessert!

Definitely recommend.

We could not get a reservation between 6pm-8pm because they were fully booked.  They only had a reservation for two of us at 5pm so we took it.  We had never eaten here before but happy that we tried it. This place is known for being an all you can eat Japanese BBQ but there are other options and you can order different packages and also add a la carte options. We both decided on the Premium All you can eat option which allows you to select from 37 different items (see pic). Keep in mind if you are dining with a group of people and one person wants an all you can eat option, the rest of the people at the table must also have that option. Everything we ordered from the Premium option was great.  Our favorites were the Kalbi Chuck Rib and Pork Belly. There were three sauces on the table but we didn’t use any of them because everything was marinated and already delicious.  The staff was very friendly and helpful and answered all our questions.

Keep in mind that you will be cooking all of the food you order using the grill on your table.

I recommend this place and we will be back again to try something different.

Authentic experience, that's what I guess. I like their food so much and the way they served and treated the customer was really good. We had their meat lover bbq and Sake, loved both. No wonder they have such a good rating among other fellow customers.

Amazing place to experience! If you like cooking your own food...this is the place! We did the "4 person" meal (there is a Japanese name associated with it!). First course was 5 different varieties of beef, second was shrimp, beef, chicken, pork. A smore to top it off! It's pricey, but isn't everything these days! The quality and amount of food for the 5 of us was perfect!
Our waitress was a sweetheart, so helpful and on top of everything we needed!
We'll be back the next time we're in Chicago!

Allen was our waiter and he was great with us! He was very kind and always checked if everything was good👍🏼 my favorite food was the garlic chicken noodles 😋 the chef prepared amazing food so we will definitely be coming back again 🥰

I just now tasted the world famous chicken here at the KFC restaurant, the customer service of this place are too good. Very friendly, efficient and really on point to their work. Quick service.  The food was timely cook and served hot. The chicken was really excellent taste. The quality is always consistent.  Overall I was pretty satisfied with the service I received at this location. I also like their mashed potatoes. That some of the reason why loyal customers visit their favorite restaurant because of the qualities I mentioned above. Definitely will visit this location again and will recommend to my families and friends. Their chicken is fresh and delicious!

For our family's 4th of July celebration, my folks put me in charge of the KFC so I placed an online order for a scheduled pickup and when I arrived, a kind salesperson informed me that the food had been prepared too early and she needed some time to re-do the order. She was so kind and apologetic and she even gave us extra biscuits! I am so grateful that the employees worked so hard to fix an understandable mistake- I would have been in hot water if the KFC had been cold! Thank you KFC @ 1144 S. Western staff!!!

I bought a chicken sandwich only because they said the sandwich was made to order. Not only was it not fresh, it was greasy and sauce was slopped all over. The only thing good was the ice in the lemonade.👎🏿

Please be aware of their chicken there. Check your food for quality before you leave there so when you get to your final destination to eat your food your chicken not looking nasty an triffling like this. I had to put this out there because this was just plane nasty an triffling of them.

I was scheduled for an interview with Lisa Simmons they kept sending emails and text reminding me I had an upcoming interview Saturday at 11:30 I did confirm! I got there no one knew about my interview she was not even there I waited to get interview the girl was probably the manager she took down my info and said come back Monday for a second interview i am not not returning they looked racist had only colored people working there and unprofessional the way she was writing my info the way she was Looking and asking questions!

Tried the beer, a couple of appetizers and a pizza. The pizza was by far my favorite. Wanted to try something different so we got the Flo's Polish - Polish kielbasa, sauerkraut and applewood smoked bacon. It was amazing and even good cold in the morning. The beer recommended by the bar tender was amazing and will be looking for it in Arizona. Thanks!!

Excellent spot for some food and drink, pizza is amazing and on a thinner crust which is great if you're not feeling the deep dish in Chicago. Staff are friendly, ticket times are quick and restaurant is clean. I really can't fault the restaurant, definitely worth che king out if you're in the area.

Nice tavern-style pizza spot with Polish influenced items on the menu. Pierogi Sampler Platter was delicious! Pizza ingredients are fresh and made to order. Had the Santo's Margherita - Medium 12" serves 1-2 people. A bit pricey at $21. One bartender manning the front who treats you like a regular. I suspect this place to be typically busy and patrons seem like regulars. Will be back to try their other specialty pizzas!
The outdoor patio is spectacular. Lots of seating. Kid friendly. We got the gluten free pizza crust and it was crispy and delicious - hard to find.

All of my reviews start with 3-star so this rating simply mean that this place is at average and I have no concern for returning.  Service staff was great, and ticket time was good.  Maybe polish foods are indeed salty; my food was very salty.  Pizza seems to be very popular, and I smelled like a pizza chef for the rest of the night after I left.  Probably a very good neighborhood joint for outdoor beer and pizza.

Nice place for a quick bite to eat & a drink, however nothing super special. It seems like a good neighborhood bar to meet up at. Service was good. Appetizers were average, and a bit small in portion size. Fish tacos were small for $3.50 each. Took quite a while to get the devil egg appetizer.
Ok place if I'm the neighborhood but I wouldn't go out of my way.
Did the bus trip for the Notre Dame game, had a blast!

I went here with some friends for a Sunday Brunch. It took quite a while before we even got to put in a drink order. They were out of a couple things our group tried to order and then the waitress told us we had old menus and got us new ones. It took over an hour to get food, despite the place not being packed. By the time it got out, everyone was hangry. Some of the food came out cold, our coffee was never refilled, and overall it was disappointing. On the high side, my burger was tasty. It took quite a while after we asked for the check, and there were items that we didn’t order on it. We got that fixed and the waitress gave us some extra money off, which was nice. Definitely won’t return, despite some pretty good (albeit expensive) dinners there before.

Chicago Dining Pass brought my boyfriend and I in for a BOGO burger / sandwich. Friday evening around 7 and the place was crowded with regulars - families of all ages and young couples.  I found it a very cozy atmosphere for a more classy sports bar / neighborhood go-to.  Our server Melissa was friendly, knowledgeable, and totally on the ball with recommendations and efficient service.
