The burgers were super satisfying (two single patties, cooked just right at medium rare I believe) and the housemade tortilla chips were phenomenally addictive!

If I lived nearby,  I would definitely come again, and take advantage of the "neighbor discount" I heard tell about.  Overall, recommend.

Service 5/5
Food 4/5
Ambiance 4.5/5

P.S.: the free dessert with yelp check-in is a  lie - there's no dessert!  But the experience is pretty sweet as it is, so...

Definitely not my kind of place. The back bar was really hot and they had a blower as their A/C at least for that section. It was also very loud. That all said they had a great drink selection. It also seemed like a good local spot if that was your vibe, just not mine.

I usually don’t come at this place around this time(5:30pm) but I had a taste for donuts. There was nothing left for donuts, so I grab the only donuts they had available, the donuts were so nasty and cold and it look like they’ve been sitting there forever. I don’t think I’ll be returning☹️

Still forcing mask 9-11-21
They need some training by mcdonalds on making a iced caramel macchiato
If you’re a people watcher, great place!

Your order is never consistent. 85% of the time my things are burnt and I usually just let it be... but when I spoke up and asked for it to be remade, I was met with attitude. Without Rosie working here, this place falls apart.

I don't get any donuts from Dunkin so not qualified to say anything about them, but I do got for the coffee and in my opinion it's pretty good.
I would say go and try the coffee and hopefully you'll enjoy it as much as I do.

The person who was working as customer service at 6 pm on 5/27/2021 is the worst person for such position. He told me and my partner there is no bathroom without even bothering to ask why we were there. I don’t want to go into speculation as to why he thought we were there just for bathroom not for a coffee or donuts. To say the least, that was very rude.

Happy Hour sushi mon-sun 7 days a week! Can not beat it!! They have really good rolls and drinks that are super tasty and unique. The decor is really trendy and fun with great music. The sushi bar is the place to sit at - you can watch them make all the sushi and talk to the chefs! Check out the patio too, great views of the gold coast!

Delicious Food! And if you go during their happy hour, you'd get the delicious food for discounted prices! We had 4 plates and left completely full and satisfied without having to spend too much. We had the Ra-king shrimp which had a kicking sauce, the short-ribs, the Las Vegas (best roll ever! with shrimp tempura) and a calamari roll. It didn't automatically come out with wasabi, which i found weird for a sushi place, but aside from that service was great. There are plenty of tables, and sitting at  the bar is also a good option.

The sushi was very good but they were out of some ingredients for the drink cocktails that they offer. In total I had to choose four different drinks before I finally got to one in which they could make. That one, a mango martini, was good but it wasn't my first choice (or second). I would definitely return for the sushi!

Great sushi, Fun and enthusiastic waiters, and beautiful ambiance. I had a lot of fun celebrating my close friends birthday here. We tried many different sushi's from the menu and all were delicious. The only drawback of the experience was that it was not filling enough.

Very good Sushi.  Cool environment love going here with friends.  I get several dishes and split with everyone at the table.  THe sushi is always fresh and delicious I highly recommend this to any sushi lover.  I do have to admit it is on the pricey side but if you are a sushi lover well worth it!

My friend and I ordered only non-meat meals. Japanese alt and pepper tofu was more eggy, soft but with a strong garlic flavor the basil vegetable tofu tasted like it sounded. The fresh tofu spring rolls were amazing

The food and drinks were good. Everything came out hot! SERVICE ON THE OTHER HAND HORRIBLE. it was 4 adults 1 child. The host was not friendly at all. I asked how long the wait, all he said was "we will call you". It got worst from there. The waitress we had, had no sort of customer service. I asked her how her day was She completely ignored me, just said are you ready or not. Never came to check on us if we needed anything or how the food was. We had to ask others for what we needed. I saw her tend to other tables way better. Mind you, they were Caucasian  and WE ARE Hispanics. Seem like she assumed we weren't going to tip from the beginning. Coming from a waitress I hate assuming, you work for tips and if your attentiveness is on the low end then yes, your tips SHOULD SUFFER. Like I said, it was only 4 adults and a child. Gratuity was automatically added which I usually don't mind. But it hurt me tipping her. To top everything off she threw the cashed out check on the table as she walk by. Never stopping to say anything else. I mean LITERALLY THREW IT. If you don't mind having the worst service of your life, then I say go for it.
We visited here on a recommendation from a tour we took. The food was delicious! The portions are big, you can definitely share them and the price was perfect. A must visit in Chinatown!

Joy yee has made a name for itself in Chinatown for sure.  I remember when it used to be a tiny little restaurant.  They have a huge menu for food and boba tea.  I was a little disappointed by the food maybe because I was expecting more authentic tasting food and not just something I can whip up at home.  The bubble tea cup portion was way too big.  The rose bubble tea was okay.  Not much tea taste but I could taste some kind of syrup.

Tried their pineapple coconut freeze, mango guava freeze and avocado freeze. The avocado freeze stood out from the rest! Definitely worth visiting if you're in Chinatown. The quantity of their shakes is too much that it can almost be a meal alternative. Service was too quick despite the crowd.
Popular Mexican restaurant located in the Little Village. Great service, even when busy. Host was very warm and accomodating as I did not know how to go about ordering.
Wonderful staff. The food options were plentiful and so delicious! Great vegan food, well priced. We'll be back!
Came here with my family to celebrate special events, in two different occasions, the food is so delicious. I recommend it to anyone that is looking to try a new restaurant in this area.
Paquette Familiar excellente sorry everyone at wrk was so hungry 4got to take pics 🤷‍♀️They need menus to go!

Ordered two Family packs chickens also a guacamole with chips. They would always send it in a similar container as the beans and this is what we got. Called and complained about the amount and the lady said that both container are exactly the same, not true. Then she says that the price on the avocado is very expressive. Had been ordering from them way back when it was once called EL CHISME not anymore!!
Came here for an early Saturday breakfast. The staff was quick and friendly, everything tasted amazing, and they worked around dietary restrictions extremely well.

On first walking in and checking the menu I was a little worried it would be standard diner fare. Once the dishes came out I was happily proven wrong. The service was excellent and our food was great. The staff was friendly and chatted with us about a few things while we enjoyed our meal. The crepes are great, a little sturdier than usual in a very good way. Would recommend!
One of our favorite breakfast stops! Regular menu is great, but the seasonal specials are spectacular! Great ambiance, great staff, reasonable prices.

Went here for brunch on a Saturday and loved it! My wife and I had the french toast flight (which was three different melt-in-you mouth variations of fruity and sweet french toasts) and a scramble, which was flavorful, filling, and had fresh veggies in it. Even their coffee is good! (Metropolis beans always help) A tad expensive (~$15 per entree), but given the location and quality of food, that's expected. Oh, and it's BYOB, so we'll bring champagne and OJ next time.

the brunch here was really delicious and the menu is pretty extensive so there's definitely something to suit anybody's palette! I went on a Sunday morning and it was pretty busy but there was definitely a place to sit and I didn't have to wait at all. the portion sizes are pretty big and I definitely had enough food for lunch as well!

I’m vegetarian and very picky with sushi since many places have subpar veggie rolls, but this place was amazing! Had the fried tofu appetizer and sweet potato roll and my friend had the Route 66. Everything was delicious. Also the mochi dessert is very good. I do agree with the comments about service being a bit slow but the food exceeded my expectations. Will definitely be back!

i dont know how this place has 4 stars. its overpriced garbage with terrible service. the teriyaki chicken was so dry it look a full minute to chew a small piece. like eating hay. the teriyaki sauce was super underwhelming and not tasty. they gave us old rice, super disappointed they had bogus rice. no sticky rice, not even hot. the sushi wasn’t fresh. based on the sogginess it was probably made in the morning in batches and the sushi was covered in a huge amount of a crunchy topping to try and hide the super mushy texture of it. the spicy miso soup was flavorless, just tasted like hot chili water, barley any tofu or substance, it was literally 99% poorly made broth. for a super tiny tiny piece of mochi was $3 probably worth $1 because of how overly frozen and little it was. the prices in general are outrageous for the quality of the food. i couldve went to china buffet and had better food there. and on top of everything the service is terrible, because there was none. the servers are some of the most oblivious and inattentive servers ive seen in a long time. all their attention being consumed by to-go orders we ended up with horrible service. its a shame and not worth your money. never going back until chef Ramsey himself turns that place around

I walked in around 4 on a weekday and the service was slow and confusing. I understand this is not peak time, I was the only patron there, but it was aggravating as I had somewhere to be at 5.  I tried to draw attention from the server, couldn’t until I walked over, and I eventually asked them to just make it a takeout order. Even that was slow.

That being said, the food was delicious. The shrimp rolls were novel and delightful, and the Zoku fried rice was excellent. They really hit the spot just before I was going to get a tattoo nearby.
My bf and I ate here late at night and it was so good and satisfying . 😋 Definitely  try the Mexican dragon sushi if you like spicy food!🤤 OH, also the shrimp nest is a must!!!

My to go to late place! I love their pad Thai and spicy crunchy shrimp sushi. My boyfriend says he doesn’t like their pad Thai but he always eats half of it when I get it!😒 Super nice people and always easy to order.

Azul 18 is a fun and relaxing restaurant for great Latin food. They have nice outdoor seating as well as plenty of indoor comfortable seating too. A lot of free parking is available on the street. We went for breakfast and it was delicious. They have a great variety of items to choose from and there is something for everyone. I ordered the Chilaquiles which was excellent! Red and green sauces were freshly made and eggs were perfectly cooked. They make it with turkey chorizo which is a really nice change of pace. My niece ordered the Mole Crepes which had a wonderful authentic flavor. We ordered beignets that were fresh and hot with Nutella and strawberry sauces to dip. They give you really generous portions. The coffee tastes fresh ground gourmet and has a nice robust flavor. The staff is super friendly and attend to your every need. We really love this place. I’ll be back!

Ended up here on accident for breakfast when the place we were heading was closed. Very glad it worked on this way! The breakfast burrito was so good. The ingredients tasted fresh and blended very well together. Hope to come back and get some tacos and drinks!

Got a quick brunch on a Friday. The ambiance is open and family friendly.

Ordered Beignets and pork belly hash.

Beignets were a bit overcooked, but the ones that were not overcooked had a soft texture on the inside. Beignets are served with a chocolate sauce that was nice.

Pork Belly Hash was delicious. Pork belly was soft and flavorful, I just wish there were more pork belly in the dish!

Azul 18 was a great place to grab breakfast. The next time I’m in Chicago, I’ll definitely be back again. The house pancakes were on point! I didn’t even have to use syrup. Hash browns and bacon were A1 as well! I also recommend their Tequila Sunrise !

I had the beignets and chilaquiles the server was speedy and attentive without being pushy. A welcoming diner like atmosphere.

The food was great although I would have enjoyed it as little spicier. There is something on the menu to please everyone from pancakes and French toast, to steal and eggs.

When I walked in I was imidietly greeted by the cook and cashier. They were very friendly. The place is clean and it has a good vibe. I wonder if it's family owned.

The food was amazing. Let's start with the chicken. It was the Grilled chicken breast. Unlike other ones I had, this was not dry at all. The flavor had a hint of BBQ. The best way I can describe it is if you ever been to Humble Park and had some pinchos then you know this flavor. Sweet but not too sweet where it over powers the flavor of the grill. A hint of what I think it's BBQ. But just a hint to let you know it's there but not to much where it just taste like BBQ chicken. And juicy! Idk how they did it but usually Grilled chicken breast are dry cause of the grilling.

The rice was OK. It was precooked rice. I don't mean like they cooked it and then reheat it. I mean it was the type you outsource... like instant rice type of deal. This is not to say it was bad or it tasted bad. The rice was seasoned well but it's not something I'll ordered of the menu. Mine came with the special.

The fries were so good. The were seasoned great. Crunchy on the outside and soft in the inside. They went perfect with the 🐔.

The salad was good. Nothing out of the ordinary. I was just glad it was fresh

I miss this place so much. One of the best people I've ever met. The food is amazing. Massacre baby. The shakes. Dam ever since i moved to oak lawn i haven t found that spot. Outdoor grill was my home away from home. All i gotta say is you treat them good they treat you better 100%

National Gyro Day!
This was my first time going here and it was not a disappointment.
As soon as I walked in I was greeted very nicely by the cashier.
Cooks also very friendly.
We have some picky eaters in our family. I ordered some gyros for them and they all loved it.
Gyros were loaded with meat, fries were nice and crispy.  If any little critic is that it could have used a bit more Tzatziki but that is just a personal preference.

Will definitely will be back!
Been coming here for the past 4yrs and can't go wrong with their food. Maria is really nice and was even willing to do curbside pick up. Love places with good service.
Very good food, good variety of choices and fair prices. We like their gyros, hamburgers, and chicken Sammy sandwich! But we like everything we've tried there!
Place was kinda okay, not the cleanest. The service was fine for the drinks, but they forgot to give us our food. Sister had to remind them we're still waiting on our donuts.

Good morning, this is the third time that the orders that I ask for pick up is not what I expected, this time I ordered a sweet black pepper bacon croissant and a coffee where the cold foam is not even a bit, I place my orders every morning Because I used to like how they attended and made my orders but now every day the service is very bad.

The night shift employee with the pink hair was very nice and was very professional. There was a long line for just ice cream about 1-2 weeks ago and she still managed to get my order right even when it was stressful. I had my best refresher ever. Strawberry with green tea. Thank you!

Staying at my aunt’s condo unit nearby and this is the nearest dunkin branch. The service is fast but the lady serving the donuts is unprofessional and a bit rude and unhygienic. If you’re in Michigan ave, st clair or ohio street and craving for some dunkin, look elsewhere.
i come almost every night and the girl on who’s night shift most of the time with the red/pink hair is so sweet and helpful.  she is the only reason why i come to this store 💖💜

Ordered takeout from Cafeteria Marcela's over the weekend and was not disappointed. I ordered a 2 breakfast steak sandwich with egg and shared maduros on the side and it was so delicious! The pricing is really good for the big portions they serve you.

The inside is nice; there are booths along the wall and on the opposite side is the kitchen area. There is also outside seating out front in a really cute gated area. Masks were worn inside by everyone not eating.
one of the best taste. ever.  you got to try them   all most recomended.  JIBARITO.  BEAF AND BABANA BREADED TYPE... sooo dam you you all nee to come n try it out..love all thier foods

One of the best steak sandwich places in chicago i can honestly say there #1 hands down if you want good service and good quality food this is the spot for you and  if u haven't tried them I promise once u do every other steak sandwich place will be trash to you after tasting there food here they cook with there heart and soul flavors be on point.

First time coming here and it was absolutely great! The food is amazing! I tried the cubano sándwich and it was so flavorful, also tried the iced coffee and it was soo good, best iced coffee I’ve ever tried. Will definitely come here again!
Don’t sleep on Marcelas cafe.The tostones and cafe con leche 😋 my favorite here. Customer service is great! Anything they make is fresh and sooo delicious! The restaurant is neat and very clean

I was a regular here and the employee I picked up my online order from even knew and recognized me. I ordered an online deal, but somehow my Philly '6 sub that was part of the deal didn't go through. I showed the employee the online deal and he refused to honor the deal or offer a solution. On top of that I went out of my way on a rainy night to go there. Needless say his purposeful choice to not honor a clearly verifiable online promotion has left me upset and I won't be returning to this location. Avoid it if you can. They aren't reasonable when it comes to honoring an advertised deal if you inadvertently order wrong or something goes wrong with your online order.
Always on top of things, especially with all the students and teachers coming in due to the school nearby

When I walked in, none of the customers were wearing mask. The sign said masks required. The employee took the orders and never told the customer a mask was required! When people shout over the counter lettuce,  tomato, etc. Their vocal droplets are in an enclosed area with the door closed. Coronavirus risk. Eew.
It's a pretty solid Subway. The staff is nice. Clean. Been several times, and never had a negative experience.  The upstairs adds extra seating for those with time to dine in.

The nicest thing to say about this place is that it's clean. Wanted a soup, didn't have it. Wanted a pizza, didn't have it. Wanted napkins, didn't have them. This place under-buys the things Subway is supposed to have so they can pocket more money. F em.

Good bar.  Service was good.  I sat at the bar.  Talkative and friendly bar tenders.  A fun place to watch the Bears game....even though the Bears got killed! :(.  Drinks are standard.  I had a beer and a Bloody Mary.  Their Bloody Mary is OK...nothing to rave about.  I ordered a Salmon Caesar Salad with anchovies.  Solid dish on their part.  I've had bad versions of these salads...this was not one of them.  Lettuce was crisp, anchovies were good, and salmon was cooked well (I like mine medium rareish).  Overall a good place to visit if you're at McCormick Place for a convention and want to catch a sports game.

Terrible dinning experience on multiple occasions.
The food is mediocre at best, and over priced as you would expect for a conference center restaurant.
As someone who attends multiple conferences annually at McCormick, I would highly recommend you avoid this place at all costs.
The last time I dined there with my wife and a few friends, the waitress not only got the order wrong three times, she never came back to the table to check on us or the quality of the food.
The second time she got the order incorrect, my wife had to walk the floor to find her.
Considering the awful experience, we left zero tip.
This is the best part. Upon a submitting the credit card receipt for expense reimbursement we discovered that the waitress had added a "2" to the zero tip to try and steal $20 from us.
Needless to say this behavior is completely unacceptable. Not only do they employ incompetent wait staff, the evidently also hire thieves.

ZERO STARS ---- AVOID THIS PLACE!!!!
The appetizers are so tasty here that my family always orders a bunch of them and shares. The atmosphere and design of the bar is also very upscale and an awesome experience.
The food there is ok, but they don't have a lot of options on the menu. Pizza is good but kind of weird, sends like they use sliced tomatoes instead of sauce.

Terrible service. Overwhelmed. Management incapable of scheduling apparently. Bartender would not serve me since I already had a table...  Just pure lost opportunity.  This just in...  30 minutes to get a beer...

The first time here with family an it was amazing.. food was delicious.. place was presentable neat,clean great atmosphere... my nephews never finish their food an here we had to order seconds for them an they had an amazing time ...they even danced a little... I recommend this place for sure ... I do wish their servings was a bit bigger like the rice an bean but overall great tasting...

BryAnna's restaurant is sooo good! Some of the best chuchitos I've ever had and definitely the Hilachas do not disappoint! This place was amazing. Coming back for sure. My to mention the service was impeccable. Great food. Great service 10/10 for me!
Tasty food, portion size is large, good price

Very tasteful Central American food. Great atmosphere, clean environment. Service was a bit slow, food did take some time to arrive at the table but fresh. Would definitely come back here again for some good comfort food.

The food was excellent.  My family always gets tamales from this place during Christmas time.  The food was excellent, they were really busy on a Sunday afternoon and service could have been better, but they were very nice anyways.  I would absolutely go back,  that mollete is EXCELLENT!

One of my favorite restaurants of all time. I've been coming here since I was a child. Kim, the owner, is so friendly and you'll always get excellent customer service. Food is delicious and always fresh. Love going here on Sunday mornings for breakfast!

Mike provides decent diner food and yummy breakfasts though I would say this is not the highest quality breakfast joint around. It is still fun to go there. The restaurant is small so sometimes seating may be rough, but you do get your money’s worth.

It's been at least three times that I've gone there in the past two years where they have forgotten my order. The food is good it's nice to go out with friends and have breakfast there last Sunday we had to prove that we paid for our meal.

Glad to have something new in the neighborhood, just wish it was something decent. I was excited when I saw the menu and it's various countries represented. However, to find that their Peruvian specialty was in essence sliced beef and french fries with extremely salty gravy over it.....perhaps you can appreciate my disappointment. Maybe there will be another chance, but unlikely.

A very nice place to have breakfast good food with very reasonable price..!! Ibrahim knows how cook everyday and the same consistency & kim is a very nice lady she is very welcoming.!! I will definitely recommend the place to my friends & family.
As a local realtor; it’s only fair that the open house guests have a taste of what’s down the block from their future home 🤤 the canned soda and pizza table were the bonus’ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Got the pizza out quick but the dough tasted off. I don’t blame them because it was a very hot day but clearly it was not refrigerated properly. Makes me wonder about meat safety there.

My favorite Go 2 pizza I understand theirs times they are bussy but half the time the delivery time frame be 30 min quick delivery and i love their pizza decent prize and you can get half and half ingredients their sauce is sweat i love their tomatoe sauce & their fried shrimp básquet
The pizza was REALLY good! Friendly staff.
Walked in everyone was so happy. At got me joyful! Good night and great service today!

Meat, meat, and more meat! A delicious dinner all around.

Normally I enjoy ZED451 for brunch, but occasionally do dinner her.

Bottom sirloin is my favorite, followed closely by the top sirloin and the Kahlua barbecue chicken (not made with it's namesake liquor).

Amuse Bouche of ceviche was excellent.

Had dinner late on a Monday, space was very empty. Music was an interesting choice of selections. Would have rather had some Brazilian Jazz (in keeping with the theme).

Service was enthusiastic and attentive, if a bit hard to understand at times due ti a heavy accent.

Bonus, it was Presidents Day,, so 25% off the entree price. AN outstanding deal!

love this spot because they cook all of their meats in delicious ways! Also if you are expecting/pregnant, this place will serve you well. The exclusive Chef Andrea (@awills_fl ) is a mom of a 6 month old adorable girl so she understands what are the pregnancy food restrictions. I told the staff and I didn’t have to worry about temperatures of meat. They served me a special plate with meats cooked well done and all the cheese at the bar is pasteurized. . .
.
For more good food spots follow me Via instagram @nattyspantry

One of my favorite places to eat in Chicago. My coworkers and I have been going here for years. I love the style a variety of food. The duck with apricot is mouthwatering, the venison is not gamey at all which is wonderful, and the swordfish is great. Beyond the rounds and rounds of meat, they have a well-stocked charcuterie area that does not disappoint, soups, salads, and numerous sides ranging from vegetables to pastries. They also bring around little cornbread bites that have been cooked in a cast iron that is smashing.

The atmospheres works well for a date night, friends relaxing or business meal. It is not too loud which I like so you can hear the people you are with. If you are just looking for drinks after work, there is a rooftop bar and a bar near the restaurant. While both are comfortable, I prefer the rooftop bar because of the fresh air and lounging area. Wondering what to drink and like whiskey, you cannot go wrong with the Bourbon lemonade. Especially during the summer, this drink offers a refreshing start to a fun evening.

So, it goes without saying, I really recommend ZED451 for any occasion.

Unbelievably friendly staff and unusually well timed Brazilian steakhouse. The servers were fantastic and had a great attitude, with a bonus of great senses of humor. All of the preparation and cutting to order was Immaculate. Save room for desert and keep the craft cocktails flowing, it was quite a treat.

Had a great time at this place. Ended up being a part of Brunch Bites event where got to sample their Chicken and Waffles!!! Freaking amazing! Great vibes and rooftop deck that is great good weather . Check out my post on Instagram @T_Lovesfood

Came to this place out of nostalgia
.. used to come here when we lived in Chicago 12+ years ago. Still the same great food.  The only down side was that we came here on Sunday, Father's Day and it was packed!  That wouldn't necessarily be a problem except they had only one waitress basically doing everything.  Consequently the service suffered but I was amazed that she kept up as well as she did.  Glad we came and will come back again.

A 60-yr-old institution in Edgewater, a classic diner with comfy booths and counter seating. I had the corned beef on rye with fries and a salad. The sandwich was rather dry but perked up with some thousand dressing. Fries were crunchy and tasty and salad with Italian dressing was very generous. My companion tried out the chicken Philly sandwich mashed potatoes with gravy and the lentil soup. He gave everything a thumbs up. I sampled his lentil soup and I thought it was a bit too tomatoey and thick for my taste. I might have given this restaurant only three stars for this particular visit but the service earned it a fourth Star as the staff is very attentive to your needs. I'll be back.
a great value small diner with charm and flavors that keep on giving 😉

So, I've been going to this restaurant since I was 5 or 7 yrs of age...Well, I am a helluva a lot older now ...This was the spot for all of our momma's to hit on a Friday night or after work...As time has gone on there aren't many of them left, but as for me, I was in the area and figured why not...

It did not disappoint...My server, Nikki was great...She really did a good of job of serving my food as well as listening to my stories of going there as a kid...

I ordered the Turkey Club sandwich...It was damn tasty...Just the right mixture of textures and flavors combining for a perfect sandwich...Yummy french fries and Coleslaw...In addition, I also had the Rose marina soup and it was incredible...The only knock would be that the bread they gave me with the soup could have been a bit more fresh...

The place was very clean, that I could see and the rest of the staff was very friendly...Pricing was in line with most restaurants of this type as well...

They updated the inside since I had been here last and it looked very cozy...It was a nice decor...

The previous owner I had remembered has since passed away, but I was told the cook had now purchased the business...From the looks of it he's doing a great job...

It's been years if not decades since I was here last and I'll try and not let that happen again...The nostalgia was nice to experience as well as great service and great food...

I'll be back and thanks for it all...

Great 1st visit in this old school city diner. Small location with some counter seating and tight booths. Very clean and redesigned restaurant. All our food arranged hot and larger portions than expected at very good price. Definately  coming back to try other plates. Wish it was also open for dinner however breakfast and lunch works. There is some behind building free parking however it was full. Great job guys, wish you were located closer to our neighborhood.

Outstanding food, and a wonderful staff. We went on a busy Saturday night. Had a drink at the bar, then the head chef came out to take care of us personally since we were waiting for a while. We did not mind hanging out at the bar, or waiting for our table, however he still wanted my make sure we had a great experience. The food was some of the best Italian we’ve had in Chicago. Definitely recommend trying!

Wanted some home made pasta and paid a visit to D'Arte! Came in for lunch and it was very quiet with nobody in, so we had extra peace. Service was proffessional and helpful, server who could be manager or even owner was great guy, helped us thru menu and made us comfortable. I was debating between ravioli with lobster or rigatoni vodka, but went with vodka. Dishes looked fancy and portions were huge. Vodka had great tomato garlic sauce and it had a great kick because of prosciutto! The special pasta we ordered was with prosciutto, goat cheese, pepper, spinach and dry fig! What a crazy combination, something I never tried before, bit sweet, but such an great experience! Can't wait to go back and try out some other home made pasta!
This place is amazing! Been coming here for years. The food, the service, and the atmosphere are all top notch! In my 10+ years of dining here I have never had a bad experience!

Everything we ordered was great.
Wait staff knowledgeable and friendly! Can't wait to go back

Yummmm! It was a great place for a group to dine-in. We were outside on the patio under a small tent. Sevice was great! Place was very clean and it was semi crowded for a Tuesday Night. The food portions were big and awesome. Deserts and drinks were great also. I would come back to try other pasta!

Loved their sandwiches. The fish sandwich was delicious, and I am not even a fish person. Chicken sandwich was also great. Overall great experience. Had the Cuban coffee for first time and it’s really strong coffee shot but it taste sweet enough.
The Cubano sandwich was good. The salad felt lacking. The pricing feels a little high for portions/quality but I look forward to trying them again. Beautiful outdoor patio.

If you’re looking for a good Cuban sandwich in Chicago, this is your spot. I got the sandwich w/plantains and the cuban coffee. This is the original Chicago location and has a cute patio you can sit out at if it’s a nice day.

This is one of the best spots in Chicago, period.

The Cuban sandwich is one of the best I've ever had. One of the best SANDWICHES mind you. It is absolutely the best Cuban in the city.

The mariquitas are warm and wonderful.

They have these random imported sodas that are fire.

I have yet to try anything from this place that isn't great, even the yellow rice is amazing.

Small bar style area to eat inside (not during Covid) and a small outdoor patio area for seating
Always trying to find Cuban Food. Nice little place. Foods good & nice atmosphere

I’ve ordered from this location for over 10 years now, always great customer service and my orders have mostly all been good. I’ve recently been ordering from local dominoes just to try it out but have had truly horrible and rudest customer service there. Have never been treated that way when I’ve ordered from little Caesar’s in all these years. I will honestly switch back over to Little Caesar’s because it is sooo much more affordable and great service all the time.

I have loved Little Caesars ever since I was a little boy and I'm so glad there are some locations in the city. Every once and a while the pizza might have different toppings but usually there is no problem. Sad to see that the pizzas aren't $5 anymore as well. No fault of their own though.

This really bad service is order a Hawaiian Pizza and the cashier took my order she told me wait 20 m to and pass 35 mnts I ask and she never put the order and aguy came over said ho something happened your order never show up but he not even apologized or offered a free pizza or say something to just a least for wating for a long time and not even get what I want so bad service I field bad for all the bad service they have here in this place I hate never coming back again here.

A lot of people come on here to hate... But they all keep coming back. I'm a working guy and when I need a big meal fast, I know I can rely on the hardworking folks at this lil C's. People come in rude, impatient, refusing to wear masks and what do they do? Keep on going. Keep on cranking out those $5 pizzas. Keep on remembering my dipping sauces. Keep on keeping on. Shouts out to the hardworking folks on Addison and to all the haters... Seriously just order ahead if you don't want to wait like it takes 3 minutes and it's ready by the time you get there.

There are a million great pizza places in Chicago.  Competition is fierce.  Still, Little Caesars has carved out their niche:  low, low prices and nearly immediate product availability.  Given that, their pizza really isn't bad.

Visited Staropolska for some quality Polish cuisine and was very disappointed.  Decor is very nice, but that’s about the only compliment I could give this restaurant.

Service is terrible. Not sure if they are understaffed or what the deal was but it was nearly impossible to get any service.  And the waiter that I was eventually able to flag down had no idea what she’s doing.

Food was a big disappointed. Bread was stale.  Carbonated drinks were flat.  Actual entrees were big in size but poor in quality, reheated and not made fresh.  Soup was descent.

Was watching travel shows with my girlfriend trying to plan our next adventure and was watching a show on Polish cuisine.  It made us hungry, so I did a quick Google search and found this restaurant.  The food was incredible.  Great portion sizes.Good list of Polish beer.  It was packed on a Saturday night with a lively vibe.  We got lucky and there happened to be a celebration in the back where the entire table started singing in Polish.
We came here to try polish food for the first time. We were not disappointed. Very good food and great service!

Update:
We came back for the rest of the menu, and I must say, nothing disappointed.  The veal meat ball is to die for.  My first bite was like a party in my mouth.   This is a must try.  The pierogi is also quite good.  I wish they offer the pan fried version that would be awesome!
—————————————————————————
We haven’t had Polish food for quite sometime, watching DDD the other day reminded us the goodness of potato pancakes, pierogi and stuffed cabbage.  So we stopped by on a Sunday night to get our fix.
We have had Polish food both in the states and in Europe, to us, this place represents the true meaning of Polish comfort food.  It is far from gourmet because it is not meant to be, simple ingredients and simple taste with great value.  And yes some of the dishes can be made easily with a microwave, but that is not the point of eating out no?
The food came quickly given it wasn’t busy, the sausages with onions were great and the potato pancakes were simply exceptional, I would have to say it is probably the best that I have ever tasted.  The beef stew was ok, tender beef, especially love the dumplings.  The stuffed cabbage was great, the rice and meat was cooked just right, and the sauce compliments. The schnitzel was the most tender I have tried and it was fried to perfection.  However I was hoping there is a bit more flavor in the meat.
Over all, great place, good service, great value will surely come back for the pierogi and the duck!

The Food especially the Valentines Meal with the Duck was really delicious! But the attitude from the service wasn’t great at all. Not even a Goodbye at the end. Wouldn’t go there again. Because I think the atmosphere matters too.

What can I say. This is one of my hidden gems when I was growing up and still is now. Let’s start with the flame broiled burgers. Very solid burger and did I mention they have a quad burger that is not for the weak. Let’s move on to the shakes. Flawless flavors and a great variety. Ask for the dj edlo secret menu and see what happens.

We have driven past here on sooo many occasions we finally decided to stop in and try their burgers. My boyfriend ordered a triple cheeseburger with fries and I decided to indulge in a double cheeseburger with cheese fries. We also sprang for a milkshake. So we took advantage of the fact that you can mix and match flavors so we went with a strawberry and apple pie combination and folks let me tell you this was probably the absolute best milkshake we have ever had. Hands down one of the best burger joints in Chicago, it’s a beautifully themed diner so it looks like it’s from the 1950’s which was aesthetically pleasing. The woman who took our order was so kind and patient as it took us forever to decide what to even try.  My only complaint was the ranch, it was disgusting but the cheese for the fries was delicious so we dipped our burgers in it! Absolutely highly recommend this establishment if you’re ever in the city, specifically the north side check out this delicious hidden gem and give them all of your money!

Benny's famous triple burger straight up with fries and Sierra mist. Was I hungry yes, was the food delicious, yes. Well I be back, yes. The burger was so juicy and delicious. Gotta trust any burger joint that got checkerboard tile on the wall.

The guy who took our order was friendly. Service was pretty quick. I think we waited less than 15 min for our food. I had a 20 min ride home and by the time I got home the food was still a good temp.

My son and I got the Choppak. It was a decent size and I was prepared to be wowed. Unfortunately, I wasn't. The burger tasted like any other double cheeseburger from a hood spot. If you're familiar with the westside I'd compare it to a Star Gyro burger. I'm not a big fan of steak fries but they were ok. The Lettuce on my burger looked a little old. I couldn't tell if it was from sitting on the burger while driving home or if it was old to begin with. The burger came with a cole slaw.. it was not good at all. My son and I both hated it. I also got onion rings. They were probably the best part of my meal. My son said the burger was good but also nothing special.

My daughter got the Chicago dog. She liked it.

We also got Strawberry and Oreo shakes. The Oreo shake was really good! The Strawberry was good. I'd go back for the Oreo shake and onion rings. I'd like to try the Italian beef I've seen mentioned in a few reviews. Pricing wasn't too bad without the shakes.. The shakes drove it up.

So I did a thing. I'm not a burger person, but someone recommended this place. I ordered a quad burger with everything,  fries & oreo shake.  It was a 20 minute ride to get home so I was nervous about what condition my fries were in. Once home, the fry box was soft so I started to panic. I absolutely hate cold, soggy fries! To my surprise, the fries were still very warm and tasty. I'm not a fan of steak cut fries but I almost ate the entire box lol. Now to my burger. It was intimidating to look at, and of course I shared a little piece lol, but it was soooo good! The flavor was there, it was cooked 🥰 I was literally almost in heaven until I realized they forgot my bacon. I know...I know who needs bacon on a quad burger with everything and my answer is judge yourself because I do! 😂 To be honest the bacon is the ONLY reason I gave a 4. The guy who took my order was very nice and suggested the medium oreo shake instead of a large because he knows I want to be ready for summer. People of you haven't been to Choppers, you're lost! I will be back and checking for my lost bacon!😂😂😂
Wouldn’t suggest eating here found a bug in my food and the guy serving tried to rub it off like it was nothing

Excellent service, welcoming and friendly atmosphere. You can tell by the quality of food and service, the people working there take pride in whay they do! Will definitely return, 100% recommended if you're looking for a quick bite befkre the train ride home 🙃
They treat me great and they had my food ready right away
They wouldn't take my coupon for a free slice.

To much jerk seasoning, chicken was dry, Mac and cheese was really just mac, cornbread was hard...... cabbage and caramel pound cake was good at least. I ordered from them again to give them a second chance and my opinion remains the same.

I gave 5 stars just so I could leave a comment.  The food is terrible. They give old cabbage.The corn muffins were under cooked. I posted my own picture of the food and it does not look like the pictures they have posted. Save your time and money and find a different restaurant. There are MUCH BETTER ONES OUT HERE. Thry deserve no stars and had yhe nerve to talk about Maxine's and their food is horrible

I ordered from this place on UberEATS and it was delicious so much so that I wanted seconds. So today after I got off work I checked google for their hours which says that they close at 9pm, so I leave work drive across town make it there at 6:45 and the sing in the window says closed. I'm confused and it would have been nice if the young lady that was looking  out the window at me would have explained why they were closed 2 hours early. Waste of trip

Too much Jerk seasoning.  It was packed on thick and I had to scrap it off.  The food was not good at all.  I am being honest, it was was horrible and the muffin was mushy and half cooked. Jerk taco man and Ja grill are good places to go to.

I was highly disappointed!  Save your money and wait in line @The Jerk man. If you want REAL jerk chicken you will be highly disappointed with this restaurant. I don't anticipate this restaurant lasting long. I only have it a star because I needed to write a review. Wasted $25.00 !!!

The food was decent but the server was rude. First she refused our request to sit by the window, even though we were the only customer at that time. We were fine as we respected the restaurant’s arrangement.

Then when it comes to ordering food, she asked if we wanted to share food with each other. My friend was confused so i explained what it meant for her. The server became impatient and frustrated at us. This made us so uncomfortable that we finished ordering as soon as possible to not further upset her.

Finally, after we paid, she came to check the tip amount we left on the receipt and complained that the tip was too little and directly demanded we tipped more.  I was shocked. Not sure i will come back after this experience.

First and foremost the server is very impressive. With that said, there is/was only one.

This did not impact the experience at all

The food:
Crab Rangoon: at first I thought that maybe this isn’t good, then I had more. This was very good and filling.

Udon soup shrimp/vegetable : flavorful soup and perfectly fried vegetables and shrimp

Pad see eiw: this was good as well, could use more flavor/spice

California roll and Godzilla roll: filling and good

Price was reasonable as well

Soup and crab pictured below

Food was good, service was okay and fast but not at all engaging.

We ordered pad thai, chicken curry and duck curry, were delicious. Spring rolls were not good, sweetness was overpowering. Maki was good.

Owner looked in a hurry with everything, with ordering, wrapping up etc. No WiFi.
Would recommend this place for food if you're in the area!

I had a reservation and was able to be seated immediately. The service and food were really good; our wait time was reasonable and our server was quick to take our used dishes and refill our water. They also have a nice variety of food options so most can find something appealing.

Wonderful place! I’ve had the spicy basil and beef, beef curry, and Pad Thai many times. Portions are generous, and the quality is consistent. The wait staff is super courteous and attentive; my water is never left empty.

If you are looking for great views and drinks, South Branch is the place.
We ordered the Brussels Sprouts and the Tuna Nachos, both are delicious. For dessert we got the chocolate chip cookie with ice cream, would definitely come back for it on cold winter nights.

It’s crowded with upbeat vibes especially after work hours, perfect spot for happy hour.

I gave 4 stars because the service was very slow.
The outdoor seating is so nice and overlooks the river.

This is a good lunch spot if you're working in the south loop. The restaurant is located by the river which offers a really nice view. There's also a lot of seating available and they can accommodate large groups as well which is perfect for team lunches. For the food, they offer a variety of choices and cuisines. They have burgers, seafood options, salads , wraps and there's also a full bar for drinks. Their appetizers are also very good. Must try are buffalo rolls and cheese curds.

Went here with my team for lunch on a weekday, and it’s a great corporate lunch spot with outdoor seating. We ordered a bunch of starters, and the best were by far the bang bang shrimp and the cheese curds (of course going for the fried goodies)! But if you want to be on the healthier side, the hummus is HUGE and very yummy. We also got the burrata, which was just alright.

For the main, I got the southwest chicken salad with a side of sweet potato fries. Both are huge portions, and the fries are great for sharing. The salad is a decent healthy option with on point flavors.

Lunch took more than an hour for us, so make sure you have enough time!

Great place for a private event/company happy hour. The charcuterie board was simple. The drinks were pretty standard. I liked the location right on the river, it had a nice view from inside and from the patio. The patio was also larger than most places on the river have so there were a lot of seats available.

I had lunch here on a beautiful October day. I forgot take a picture of my food, but I have a picture of the view from the patio. I had the burger - the medium rare came out a bit more rare than I like but it was a good burger. The sweet potato fries were great. It’s nice to eat Al fresco by the river on such a beautiful sunny day. The place was packed with the business lunch crowd - indoor gets loud in peak hours.

LET ME TELL YOU ALL ABOUT THIS MANAGER AT THIS LOCATION SKINNY GUY WITH GLASSES DO YOU ALL KNOW HE TOLD ME IT WAS OK FOR HIS WORKERS TO MAKE THE BURGERS WITHOUT GLOVES ALSO HE LET ONE OF HIS WORKERS DISRESPECT ME AND SAY HE WAS GOING TO TALK TO HER AND DID NOT ALSO HE THOUGHT IT WAS COOL TO BRAKE A WHOLE DOLLAR OF MINES FOR A PENNY AND GOT THE NERVES TO SHORT ME 4 CENT BUT TOOK 1 CENT OUT OF MY DOLLAR BECAUSE I DID NOT HAVE A PENNY AND I WOULD LIKE TO SAY THIS LOCATION NEED TO BE CLOSED DOWN THEY ARE SO UNPROFESSIONAL AND DON’T SHOW NO RESPECT TO NO ONE THEY TERRIBLE AT THIS LOCATION GIVE YOU ATTITUDE WHEN YOU ASK FOR YOUR FOOD TO BE FRESH AND HOT TOUCHING SOME OF EVERYTHING WITH THE SAME GLOVES THEY MAKING YOUR FOOD WITH IT’S UNSANITARY AND SOMETHING NEED TO BE DONE

Totally disappointed. I was tired and didn't check my food. I order a 10piece spicy & a 6 piece spicy. BUT I WAS GIVEN a mixture of regular & spicy, luke warm nuggets & my fries were not fresh. Had I gotten a receipt TODAY it would have went back..only ate the maybe 6 spicy and went to bed. Guess because they gave me extra sauce I'd be happy😭😭🥺 Won't happen again NO MATTER HOW TIRED I am. $8.83 down the drain.. @Wendy's night shift Be ASHAMED of yourselves!

I went to have my lunch at this restaurant. It’s been a while since I last visited this place, and it has not changed a lot. I was able to order quickly, and the service was also fast, so I was able to get my order just after a couple minutes of waiting, and I am glad that I did not wait longer since the place was not really that busy or packed on that particular day. The staff behind the counter are also nice and friendly. My order was just their spicy chicken sandwich combo, which includes one spicy chicken sandwich, fries, and a drink. I like the spicy chicken sandwich. The chicken was crispy and juicy. Aside from that, it was fresh and hot, and the veggies in it were fresh as well. I have a little complaint about the fries. It was fresh and hot too, but it tasted a little bland for me, and it definitely needed some salt to it. Despite that, I liked the meal I had because it was still a good one and the price was so cheap. The food is not really that bad, and in fact, I like the spicy chicken sandwich, and for its price, I think it is still a pretty good deal.

Food was good, fresh, hot, clean, and delivered in a very timely manner, and servers presented it with a smile. Only turn off was a bunch of very loud, annoying, and disrespectful High School student's making the dining experience less enjoyable.

My wife and I usually get some burgers from there. Dave double is my favorite or that salad with avocado and chicken. Today my wife was getting a burger. it was 11 AM the breakfast was just over . She then noticed that the employee doing the burgers in the back did not have gloves on. She asked him why he was not wearing gloves? The employee replied " to avoid bacteria touching every where" which to me is completely false. Having myself been  in the food industry I know for a fact that employees have to wear gloves when dealing with food .
My wife then asked to talk to a manager and the alleged "manager" repeated the same thing that the employee said. I told my wife not to order anymore. I was disgusted that employees who supposedly have taking the city of Chicago food handling and sanitation classes are still handling burgers with no gloves.
If you stay in the Wicker Park neighborhood, please pay attention to who is making your burger in the back. These people don't have a clue what their doing.

This Cuban restaurant is way better than 50 mile! They don't just have the typical things you expect to see, like Cubano sandwich, but all sorts of truly authentic things, like Cubano on plantain instead of bread. Game changer! The mojito is absolutely the best I've had in the city and the pina colada was the best​ we've had outside of Central or South America. We had a fantastic appetizer, called stuffed little boat borcito relleno, which was a plantain stuffed with seasoned Cuban beef. Completely authentic and fantastic. I've never had anything like it before. Come here for real Cuban food and service for sure!
Good cuban food with lots of flavor and moderately priced. Worth a visit if you're in the neighborhood or want to try cuban cusine.

I came here for brunch with J. the place was totally quiet, but it was winter, after a particularly brutal week. The host and hostess were eating at a table as well, but I was welcomed as soon as I walked in and was seated quickly. Service was attentive and quick. When I had a problem with my coffee mug, the change was made immediately. I had the steak and eggs for breakfast- the portions are HUGE. There was lots to take home and the food was really well made. I had the cafe con leche, which for me, was pretty strong and well made, but I am not a daily coffee drinker. Total bill was 35 for 2 entrees and 2 coffees, with plenty of food left over.

I'll be back to check out dinner. Thanks Cohiba!

My server was very nice, but the Cuban sandwich lacked flavor. I ordered fried yuca and I had to ask for garlic sauce. not really a big deal, but that's the BEST part! if people don't get that they are really missing out!

The only reason it's not a 5 star is because service was a bit slow due to one young lady being the only person sitting people, taking orders and serving. But even with that she did an amazing job! She truly was doing great but definitely needed the help. Other than that the food was AMAZING! Everything was delicious, I would definitely recommend Cohiba to anyone!

I never knew that sushi can be so filling. This place got a great all-you-can-eat sushi  for $20.

The service is slow, though the food makes the wait worthwhile.
I like this place.  It's all you can eat sushi and it's made fresh and service is quick.  It's byob so bring a bottle of wine and enjoy great sushi and other items.

For a place called Sushi Parody I didn't have huge expectations but this place was no joke. I actual really liked pretty much everything I ate (I think they had one called the Angel Roll which was my favorite). The staff was quick to fill my water and take my order (I'm not very chatty so this was perfect). I'm not a sushi expert and probably haven't had much high class sushi but I really liked what I tasted. Definitely recommend, especially for all you can eat.

Ordered take out from them and it was amazing. They were quick and friendly. Will definitely order again. Inexpensive but tasted high end. The only thing that bummed me out was that they didn't have Uni available even though their menu offers it.

I even noticed they have all you can eat deals when I went to pick up my food. There was a young casual crowd there. Definitely a good option for college kids and young adults who may be looking for a good but cheaper sushi experience.

I went here for my birthday and although it was crowded (I don't blame them) they had an all you can eat sushi for $20! Delicious!! Loved it! Only catch is they will charge you for any left over sushi so my friends and i literally forced ourselves to eat the extras lol..other than that it's awesome!

Roast Beef w/ Provolone (Original size) with lettuce, tomato, and mayo. The other is A Wreck (salami, roast beef, turkey, and ham w/ Swiss, original size) flatbread with spicy mustard, pickles, and tomato. Must say it is slightly expensive, ~$13 for 2 sandwiches. However the quality of the sandwiches is worth it.
Currently standing outside the door at 10:05 am. Doors are still not unlocked as people are just looking at us. If you say your store opens at 10am then open the doors at 10am. Ridiculous.

I decided to come in to eat something to kill time while waiting on the bus (around 7pm). I ordered the “Wreck” sandwich and let me tell you, my 12 yo niece can make better sandwiches!! They got my order wrong, forgot to add cheese and turkey breast. My order was remade and this time loaded with lettuce more than anything. I asked for Mayo and Italian seasoning and it was bland. Skimpy on the meat. Driest sandwich I’ve EVER had. Subway is better and I don’t even like subway like that LOL! Lastly, 2 employees were rude. Don’t come to this location!!!!!
I was visiting this location a lot, but today was my last time. Worst customer service ever.
TASTY sandwich and soup. Wonderfully scrumptious. Wish I had one in my town.
Awesome Italian style Americanized eatery. Salad was great. I'm sure everything else is good here just based on presentation alone
Always as great experience!!  Great food and great service!!

The food here is what I would consider average. The advantages to this place are it's quick and convenient to grab lunch. I come here a lot out because it's easy and efficient to get in and out. They serve cafeteria style, so you come in and there are different stations for whatever you want.... soup, salad, pasta, sandwiches, etc. I have tried all sorts of food here, would suggest the sandwiches but not the pasta (overcooked). They have a large selection of desserts, but stay away from their chocolate chip cookies -- too crunchy for my taste. One thing I don't like is it's very hard to tell where the line is for the station you're at, people are standing around everywhere waiting for their food, so it seems a bit chaotic. I think they should do something about it. Seating is usually at a premium during the busy lunch hour, so I usually try to come a little early to beat the rush or take it to go.

The menu is the draw here - different stations offer pizza, salads, antipasti, etc. with daily specials at each. There's a surprising number of options available in a relatively small space, and the lines keep moving even when busy. Even though there's plenty of tables, seating is a bonus and not a guarantee during lunch rush.

They have salads, panini, pizza, and soup, and you can do a combo, too, for under $8. plus tax. I had a salad and half a panini, and both were excellent. And though it was packed during lunch, service was quite speedy. A great spot for breakfast. The food is great and the prices are low. The staff are very friendly and helpful. A great place to have a quiet breakfast before starting your day.

Finally found authentic pizza that has homemade sausage, the freshest cheese and great sauce & perfect crust.  Had many pizzas and so called Italian food, this is far the best. Italian beef melts in your mouth , and the bread its served on, I can eat just plain, not to mention the appetizers, mmmm. The best hospitality from Dennis , we love your place. Thank you for all your hard work.

We moved to the neighborhood a few months after the initial shutdown of 2020. The first time I drove by, the sign caught my eye and I knew it was a place I had to try. We ordered delivery not long after and it immediately became our main source of pizza. Tonight, instead of delivery, I stopped in to pick it up. The old school charm is real. I think the owner was who greeted us and he was a super friendly guy. I can’t wait to dine in with my whole family.

Old school charm when dining in. Was taken care of by the owner, Dennis who was great to have a conversation with. Had the thin crust pizza, which was excellent. Everything is made fresh and worth every penny. It’s no wonder they’ve been in business for 70 years.

Such a cozy spot! My girlfriend and I came by Frank’s for a low key date night and left very happy with our decision. The thin crust was terrific and our waitress Sharon was incredibly sweet. We loved the old school vibe and enclosed booths. As we’re now locals, we’ll definitely be back.

The definitive Chicago style thin crust pizza. Speedy delivery. Still has the original neon sign with a phone number that includes letters. As good now as it undoubtedly was during my granddad's time when it first opened because it has been around this long for good reason. Get yourself a cannoli for dessert.

Really skillful, relaxing and tasty place! The iced Thai bubble tea was an excellent caramel flavor and appreciated the soft tapioca balls. The beef skewer appetizer was savory with a great crispy edge. My friend and I shared the lemon grass beef ban mi and the cubed filet mignon which was juicy and very flavorful, every bite was great. Had the flan for dessert and loved the texture and presentation.

The restaurant is well designed with a calm and laid back atmosphere, music (smooth jazz) is at a perfect volume for enjoying without  overwhelming, tables and chairs were very comfortable as well.

Great service, the staff are very friendly and polite, they made us feel very welcome and appreciated. Can't wait to be back to try more!

You know you are in a good Vietnamese restaurant when there are Vietnamese customers, the nice aroma of fish sauce lingering and a young kid sitting in a booth behind a pile of plates and napkins studying and playing games on his phone. The service was quick and too the point. The food came out promptly with a generous portion of sides. Everything tasted perfect, full of flavour and texture.

Hands down the best Bo La Lot (Hawaiian leaf beef sausage) in town. This is my go to place when I crave for Bo La Lot. The service is always amazing and fast. If you haven’t tried this Vietnamese dish yet, please do yourself a favor and try it. It requires some wrapping so be prepared to get your hands dirty. I promise you it will be worth it.

Some of my favourite Vietamese-Chinese dishes!

If you come here these are the dishes I recommend!  And come here to do family-style dining rather than individual dishes per person.

Hawaiian Leaf Beef Sausage Rolls, Steam Seabass with ginger-scallion, or the whole Red Snapper with pickled veggies sauce!  I also always get the Water Spinach stir fried with garlic...a simple dish, but hard to find a place that does it as flavourful as this place does!

Don't get me wrong, they also have on the menu ala carte dishes like Pho noodle soup, rice dishes, and Vermicelli Noodle Bowls. And they are good.  But I think these dishes are what makes this place stand out!

This place is well known for their bò lá lốt and you definitely would order so that you roll it your self and make to add bánh hỏi to your order. Their dipping sauce for each dish is unique authentic and delicious. We ordered:
- grilled beef skewer with lemongrass (fragrant and yummy, perfect to use in wraps too)
- grilled beef wrapped in grape leaf seed (smoky and delicious, def wrap your own and add bánh hỏi)
- bánh bèo (average but the sauce that comes with is addictive)
- bánh bột lọc(good and filling, love the sauce)
- vietnamese ice coffee
- sugar cane juice (refreshing, must get!)
They were busy and it took a bit long to get our orders in but would come back again!

I got a turkey Polish sausage. Although the sandwich was a little small overall, the sausage was thick, flavorful, and well grilled. Soft bun. The toppings were fine, though the peppers and relish weren't the most authentic for Chicago-style dogs. $3.50 for the Polish, which was a decent snack. The staff was friendly, preparation was neither fast nor slow, there's a dining room with a very loud TV. Considering this is technically gas station fare, I'd come back.

I've heard the turkey burgers and legs are good.  I had the sausage and wasn't impressed.   They put barbecue sauce on everything.   If it's good to start with, you don't need sauce.  The order to food time was also a bit much for a largely takeout lunch place.

First timer!! The turkey ribs tips were excellent. Placed additional orders for turkey taco & turkey burger special. The family enjoyed our meals and the friendly aervice. Will return for more menu selections. Cant wait to try lasagna it looks so good!

Great food at great prices with friendly service.  Their lunch special is the best deal in the area, also try their chili or Turkey Polish with Fries.  Only reason they do not get a 5 star rating is while they have great customer service that makes you feel they really appreciate your business, food preparation can be rather slow.

So, not good for a day when you are in a rush, but great food and great for your budget.

Lady was rude as can be to me. Had my skateboard and that was the first thing she saw and started giving me attitude. Didn't know I couldn't sit here without buying anything which I can understand but she raised her voice and very rudely insisted on me buying something. I bought a small fry to shut her up. Gave her a three dollar tip in the tip jar and she gave me the dirtiest look ever. Good fries though. The cook is a really nice guy. But man that lady needs to chill. So I'm editing this because I have been sitting her charging my devices and another young man walks in and sits and she says he has to buy something. He says this place is too expensive and she lets him enjoy his seat....what is it about me that made her so adamant to make me buy something?

We hosted our wedding here and Reza's couldn't have been more flexible and accommodating. Sam, one of the managers, is awesome. We were able to bring our own decorations and anything else we wanted. They gave us ample time to set it up the morning of the wedding, and let us come the next day to pick everything up. The food was delicious and the entire staff was incredible. The whole experience was smooth from start to finish and we couldn't be happier with how everything turned out. I highly recommend Reza's for your next party!

Kabob Combination Dish #1
An extremely charming place with friendly service. The moment you walk in you will feel a warm ambience, service with a smile and calming sense when you sit. Not only does this restaurant make a great social gathering but as well outside the restaurant, there are many opportunities to shop at many locations that are in a short amount of time of walking distance !what they lack in drinks they make up for in service and quality, a memorable experience that I recommended to anyone with a mouth and a brain.

My wife and I had such a bad experience at Reza's at Andersonville. We ordered Baba Ghanoush as a starter, lentil soup and a combination platter. A bus boy brought large fried tortilla with Baba Ghanoush. When asked to bring Pita bread, he said sure and came back in few minutes and said no Pita bread. A few minutes later, the waiter walked up to us and said sorry we don't have pita bread. I asked if it's just today or they normally don't have pita bread. He said we sometimes have pita bread and sometimes we don't.
How is it possible for a Persian restaurant to not have pita bread.
Our lentil soup was basically tomato soup with some barley in it. For salad, they practically sliced a single radish in to several pieces and two very small pieces of feta cheese. Chicken and beef kabob was not very tasty either.
I am not surprised the restaurant was practically empty on Navroz (Persian New Year).
We are sticking with Kabobi Grill or Noon-o-Kabob. And if we really want something authentic, we go to Sarra Grill in Skokie.

If you want to eat some really bad and tasteless food, visit Reza’s. But if you’re looking to not screw your mood after a meal on a date, then please go anywhere than Reza’s. You can just order McDonald’s at home maybe. That’d still be worth every penny.

The place is very good and the food is regular for me. I order lemoned drink i was awful it the same the non alcoholic drink. The service i was good. It’s posible the one dish eat two because it too much food. If they improve the drinks I will come back and give them 5 stars.

I love their homemade Italian Sausage. We have shopped there for decades.  The people that own & work there are terrific. The premade Italian dinners & the fresh sandwiches made there are delicious.  They also have a great deli that sell lunch meats cheaper than big grocery stores.  Delicious Italian pastries & cookies also!

Pretty great Italian deli/restaurant. My friends and I stayed in an Airbnb above this and on our last day of our stayed picked up food. The sub I got was delicious, the combo of spice with the bread and cheese and herbs was perfect. I also got a small cup of the seafood salad and that was fantastic! My fiancee got some cannoli and loved it. Definitely recommend if you have time to stop by, the prices were great too!

I've been wanting to check out this place for so long but always forget about it. They usually close at 4pm.  Luckily,  last Saturday I drove past craving a good sub for lunch, so I pulled in. I got a normal cold beef and provolone sub. I also noticed they had homemade dinners to take home and microwave in their fridge so a grabbed a container of ravioli.  The sub was beyond delicious!  Excellent tasting meat and a very flavorful provolone. Best sub I've had in a long time.  For dinner, I decided to hear up the ravioli. I couldn't wait to eat it so I had an early dinner. Absolutely to die for.  As far as the store,  they have various Italian grocery items,  packaged, fresh, and frozen.

I went back again yesterday and got their hot beef, a homemade piece of Tiramisu, and another dinner. This time I chose the Chicken Marsala which was amazing.   The tiramisu didn't stand a chance once I dug into it.

You must check this place out!
Last hour stopped. Sadly out of eggplant Parmigian sandwich but have GREAT Italian beefs! With sweet and provolone.. (could have had more cheese).
Local, Family owns Italian Deli I am going to for years. Delicious prosciutto from Sicilii truly the best in town !!! Delicious sandwiches, tiramisu, soups and everything you deserve to taste !

Really good burgers, love all the nostalgic stuff they have inside. They were cash only but the other day, 7/28/2022 I heard the worker say they take credit card/debit cards now. Everything comes with fries an fyi, chili cheese dog is good, feel like the burger is better. Smaller patties so get a double if you're hungry

This was my first time ordering to this place. I will buy some burgers to take out to eat while I'm driving since I haven't eaten lunch. After I ordered a burger it came really quick. The staff are efficient and have a quick skill in making orders. They are professional and know what they are doing. They do a good job. When I open my burger in my car it looks presentable and not messy compared to the burger that I ate last week. They have a little amount of sauce inside that can be one of the reasons why it's not getting messy when I open it.  It's a little bit oily but when I bite it it is so good. The meat was juicy and flavorful.
This is the best fast food restaurant everything is made to order and fresh my all time favorite is their delicious chicken sandwich it's amazing
The burger was 🔥..one f the best burgers I've had in Chicago. The price was amazing too.

This place is the best for a Chicago style hot dog and their cheeseburgers are delicious 🤤. I’ve been going to this place since I was a kid when the owner and his daughter use to be in there serving customers (god bless his soul) hands down the best dogs around…
First time coming back since Covid and this place looks great after the renovation, food is still delicious, service is great too.
Very welcoming Staff . Very fast service and the food was amazing we had 7 mares cal do and agua chilis . 10/10 the micheldas where really good .
Delicious sea food, Exelent service, definitely we cameback soon, my family enjoy a lot
One of my favorite places to go although I noticed I was given less octopus this time.
Amazing food! We had an order of Langostinos Charola, and it was delicious!

This was one of my go-to lunch places, with a great value on healthy quick food.  They were never busy, and their customer service was lacking, but the price and food made it worth my weekly visits.  I'm sad they're gone, there's not as many healthy options in the neighborhood.

This was pretty good for the price. The steak was a little chewy but chicken was good. Falafel was also very good..light on the inside and not just a brick of grease. The garlic sauce was decent...not quite toum but closest I've found here.

If the young guy working wasn't such a jerk it would've been a better experience. Treating your customers like they're inconveniencing you is not a method of earning return business. Too bad, the place would be a diamond in the rough otherwise.

Petite Pita is my favorite local Mediterranean place. It's right by the Sheridan Red stop (and it's helpful that I walk by it on my way home). They have some very authentic tasting tajine, and I really like their chicken couscous plate. Their plates often come with hummus or baba ganoush included. Their hummus is also very, very good. They make their falafels when you order them, so they're always hot and fresh. Also, SUPER CHEAP. Love it.

Came here for lunch. Service was terrible. They did not know their menu and I asked them questions and they shrugged.

Food was bad. Under-Seasoned and not very flavorful.

I would not return.

Amazing dishes for really reasonable prices. I had the BEST sandwich in my life - the Spicy Chicken Churro Sandwich. It’s the perfect balance of salty and sweet and I would do anything to be able to taste the sandwich for the first time again.

Everything else including the guacamole, tacos, and tortas were all amazing! Nothing was a miss.

The margarita options are great - I got the mango habanero and it is delicious. The tacos are also pretty good, not the best ever but decent. I obviously didn’t get a ton, but from what I can tell the prices are really good. The tacos came with 4 tacos. I liked the salsa that came with it a lot.

Went here for brunch, ended up getting lunch. Great looking and tasting tortas. Good place when all other places have a wait 😆.

The churro was great but had a little more sugar then expected.

This is a really nice restaurant with really good and tasty food. Note that it might get pretty busy around noon and afternoon. The staff is nice and attentive.

We ordered the almost naked nachos with spicy poblanos and queso fresco, and then a set of beef tacos and another one of vegetarian tacos. Everything tasted really good and it was very flavorful. For drinks, we tried the XOCO margarita and the americola.

The portions are bigger than you might get from similar restaurants, so make sure you keep some room for dessert.

Great place! We enjoyed everything we ordered from the margarita to the churros! Their seasonal special pork sandwich was so good! The sauce was great and enough! Their chicken sandwich was very delicious, too! The prices are very reasonable and their service is very good, too! Our waiter was very nice and kind. We enjoyed our time at XOCO and I highly recommend this place to all of you! Especially if you are visiting Chicago!
For a place called Zoup, their soup is pretty mediocre. I’ve made much better tomato soup at home. It’s fairly cheap tho for the loop

great choices of soups and really tasty sandwiches

Update 4 years later: still really good soups, didn't have a sandwich this time so I can't speak to those

Placed order online for delivery, they gave me a est time for delivery of 11:50, they partnered up with doordash to deliver my food, a whole hour later and nothing, doordash was literally 2mins away and then it changed to 12 mins away...I called the store n the girl on the phone was really ignorant and didn't help at all.. . Never place a order unless you want to be eating a cold lunch

The soup was delicious and the staff reasonably helpful.  The seating area was not well kept, though.  Discarded items lay on the floor and a stained carpet made it less than appealing.   I may return when I'm next in the area, but will likely get my meal to go.

Was on my way to Union Station and noticed Zoup. Went in just as they opened at 11:00. Got a sample of their Seafood Soup and liked it and ordered it. I was able to get whole wheat bread with it. The Seafood soup was excellent. What I liked was the variety of soups to choose from. Staff were friendly even though they were very busy putting up on line orders. Will definitely stop again.

I placed an order to-go. I got the bbq plater ($25), burger & fried chicken sandwich. Bbq plater was good, big portions. Burger was okay (2 small mcdonalds-like patties). Chicken sandwich was bad. It was basically a giant, thin, soggy schnitzel. The patty was 2x bigger than the buns but not in a good way. Sweet potato fries were very very good!
I came for the champagne pair dessert and stayed for the salad 😆 both were an absolutely AWESOME experience.
one of the best burgers I have had , and the fries were really good as well! Only thing is we wanted a fried egg and got a sunny side up.

Walked into Randolph tavern around 11:00 am for my first meal of the day. Ordered one Modelo and an order of fish and chips. It’s now 2:50 pm and I have not eaten or drank anything else since the fish and chips. I am now violently vomiting and have been stuck in the bathroom for half an hour. I tried calling the restaurant to let them know I got sick, and was put on hold and then disconnected. Anyways. Since they don’t want to talk to me, here’s a google review. Save your health. Don’t eat here.

Good bar in the Loop that's open late! Some friends and I were having trouble finding somewhere to go before a show and stumbled on Randolph. The staff was very kind and sat us quickly.

They have a very large menu which includes a whole BBQ section. The food was decent and it was a good place to chill for a bit. They had lots of fun drinks as well.

I ordered the Citrus Crispy Chicken salad, without the chicken, and had it swapped for Avocado. Also got the Autumn Squash soup with chips. The salad was alright (lettuce, avocado, crispy pieces, almonds, dressing), so nothing special or unique. The soup was amazing, however, and if I were to visit again, I would definitely get the soup.

I need to share this story of my sandwich. For SO MANY YEARS, dating back to 2003, the Mediterranean Veggie sandwich by Panera Bread was my daily delicious nourishment! Sometime around 2009, I stopped eating this sandwich cold turkey (for no specific reason) and have craved it not ever since... until recently.
