The free one-month unlimited coffee by Panera lured me into their bakery last month. And the little ordering touch screens lured me to see if my delicious sandwich still existed. AND YES. IT DOES. So for the past couple of days when fetching my coffee, I've been tempted to see if I can easily build my own version of the sandwich (no feta, extra peppadew, extra cucumber, extra red onions, no emerald greens, add spinach), and oh my gosh it played out perfectly! In the olden days, relying on a human for my many special requests was always risky. The little ordering tablets ensured that I could have it my way. The only difference between my old school sandwich and now is that I no longer eat dairy (that started in 2010 hence the no feta request)... and the sandwich would absolutely be incomplete without a cheeselike addendum; but Panera already resolved that issue because the sandwich now comes with hummus! So I ordered extra! AND LET ME TELL YOU THIS! It was a perfect experience from ordering to receiving to eating. My head was on cloud nine. This bakery did a phenomenal job. In fact, I have since ordered this sandwich six more times in the past week! I am in love. Thank you so much for the careful time that your bakery invests into being kind to the customers and to executing a perfect sandwich construction! THANK YOU!

I owe my life to this Panera Bread. Specifically this panera bread all other penera breads are terrible and not worth your time. This one is cool even though they don't have lime seltzer and it's only sparkling water labeled lime. But if you pretend hard enough you can almost taste the lime. Bit they have lemonade. And also make sure you ask for the bathroom code before you have to go bathroom.
My order was accurate. I ordered an iced latte, I wasn’t too fond of it. Everything was pretty standard for Panera.

I’ve never had an issue with this Panera branch; it’s actually one of my favorites for how consistent they are with their service! It could be cleaner, crumbs and misc are sometimes left on tables or seen on the floor, but the staff is super busy and often it’s the customers that don’t maintain more cleanliness. The seating, indoor and outdoor, are ample and usually have outlets for us who sometimes work there in the mornings. The bathroom is also kept pretty clean. The best part is how consistent the food is; no problems ever with my order or taste so far. Friendly staff and always quick, what with multiple ordering methods nowadays.

It's been a long time since I've been to avec so it was wonderful getting to go again this month. The food is as delicious as ever and I really love the atmosphere of the space. The service is wonderful too.

I adore their hummus & pita, and they served us a mushroom flatbread that was divine. Everyone loves the bacon wrapped dates but they are a bit spicy for me. Still, I don't think you can miss trying them if you come. Drinks were lovely too.

Absolutely delicious! Bacon wrapped dates were a must get! All the dishes turned out yummy and were great for sharing. Nice selection of wine to pair with the proteins. Food in photos fed 3 hungry people to the brim. Our party sat at a table on the second floor, which I highly recommend if you want a private table in a quieter space.

Been to Avec for dinner but first time for brunch. So happy to give it a try. Their brunch food was delicious! It was nice that they also had some half portions on certain items so we ordered a variety of food. The service was also fantastic. We sat at the counter and had the best conversation with the host and our server. Can’t wait to go back again!

Would give it 6 stars if I could.
A flawless experience with exceptional food, impeccable service, and great vibe in a great space.
Food was really some of the best I’ve had - it is remarkably difficult to put together dishes with such elegance, flavour and complexity in a way that seems so effortless and makes the food seem so approachable.
Shout out to Damien for taking care of us so nicely.

My friend and I ordered their grilled market fish, focaccia, and a shrimp and another fish dish. Was a completely fulfilling meal. The grilled market fish with feta cheese and preserved banana peppers is probably the best fish I had so far. Absolute treat to taste buds. Should definitely try out the place when you are in downtown. The waiter guided us well in picking dishes for our palette.

Spectacular food! This place is a hidden gem. I tried the pot stickers (steamed) pad Thai and beef salad and all dishes were a 10/10
Can’t wait to come back again! Also the atmosphere were very delightful too

Love this spot! Great service, quaint and clean! The food is always good and fresh. Volcano and dragon rolls are bomb. Miso soup is tasty. Love the Thai dishes. Reasonably priced with good portions and BYOB to boot. What more could you ask for? Highly recommend! Pictured is my Shrimp Sukiyaki dish. Yum!

Stumbled on this place after getting off at the Addison train station. The sushi was so good the first time we stopped in that we decided we wanted to go back the next day instead of eating anywhere else. Great place for a quiet and relaxing dinner with great food and friendly staff. We will be coming back next time we are in Chicago.
The woman who helped us was so sweet! Prices are super reasonable, portions are very fair, and the food tasted great!

Yindee is a fantastic BYOB sit down or take out Thai experience that is just good food, good atmosphere, and an overall good time.

My first date with my girl was here and we go back every year because its just somewhere we always feel connected to. Can't recommend these good people enough.

Overall: Great option for larger parties and 'safe bet' Italian cuisine, Davanti delivers a quality experience overall.

The good: Tons of seating and a really fascinating atmosphere. Very rustic vibes. The menu varies well and isn't too overwhelming, with options for everyone. The portion sizes are just right. The prosciutto pizza is fantastic, and the pasta is fresh and perfect texture-wise.

The not-so-good: The music was, unfortunately, 80s rockish. Sitting there dining, I was craving more appropriate Italian-esque music. The waiter was slow to conclude the checkout process. The chicken sole mio was disappointing in terms of taste.

Atmosphere: 8/10
Service: 8/10
Food: 8/10
The San Diego location is better, but I still enjoyed the focaccia from here. Definitely share it with people because it's huge.
Good cocktails and a cozy atmosphere.  Great service.  Food looks good but not sure as we didnt eat this time...just cocktails.
Hands down, the best breakfast/brunch I have had in years! Still sitting at our table and can't wait to come back!

Food was great, but service was terrible! I had a group of 8 with me after running a half-marathon and we were very hungry! We sat down & ordered coffee. It didn't come after 15 to 20 minutes so I informed the hostess. Then coffee finally came. We then ordered & continued to wait a long time. Coffee was never topped off during our wait. Meanwhile the table next to us had a similar party size and received service from 2 people along with multiple coffee refills. I informed the manager & food finally arrived after that. Not all the food though. A few minutes later other orders came. But of course my daughter's meal was never put in & she had to wait longer! I informed the waiter how disappointed we were & he offered to not charge us for my daughter's meal along with a box of donuts. Not the best offer for extremely bad service.  Too many good restaurants in Chicago to ever return here.

We love their customer service, everyone there is very pleasant. The pizza is amazing they listen to every detail and the pizza comes out perfect. Close to our home.Wish they stayed open later and had more coupons.

While the food was pretty good, my delivery took an HOUR and FIFTY minutes. I ordered online at 3:46pm on a Sunday, and by 5:15 I still didn't have my food so I called the store. While the person who I called was very nice and apologetic, it doesn't change the fact that their delivery took nearly 2 hours, and not a single person from the restaurant reached out to me to apologize or to offer a refund/store credit. Finally at 5:36pm my order had arrived.
I ordered a half pepperoni half cheese pizza, cheese curds, and French fries. The pizza was pretty good, although I felt as though it could've benefitted from more sauce. The cheese curds were surprisingly good. Coming from someone who lived in Wisconsin for 5 years, my standards for any kind of cheese is very high, and these were up to my standard. The fries were very cold by the time I got them and were very crunchy (not in a good way).
Best pizza 🍕 ever when it's warm.  Also they give out a free slice on a specific day.

I ordered 2 breaded steak sandwiches. First of all, the price on Google is wrong, the prices is 8.99 and about 13 for the meal so I paid almost $30, they couldn't even offer a discount.

Second, the sandwiches were overloaded with cheese and marinara sauce. So much that you can't even taste the steak. They were disgusting, I couldn't pick it up and I ended up gagging and couldn't finish it. But they deserve the one star for the fries, which were pretty good. Wont be going back.

The family and I have been ordering from here every pizza night we have for years! We love it, great flavor good quality, they’re fast. If it’s ever going to take longer than the norm they let us know up front. Staff is always friendly and personable, I’ve never had any issues. The wings and fries are good too!
If your order online you can get rewards and discounts too. Definitely recommend this spot!

I was here today and waited at cashier to give my order but God I waited for 36 minutes and yet the girl saw me 10 times and avoided me even when I called for her3 times. She didn’t even asked me to wait or apologies. I would not say anything if she asked me to wait but purposely avoiding you it’s so disrespectful. Maybe because I was Asian but looks like she wasn’t that busy when she was taking orders from others. I have no complaints about Food. Food is good if you like Korean cuisine.

This review is for the food stall out front, which I'm not sure goes by the same name as the food court / restaurant inside the grocery store. I'm posting a picture that includes their current hours and safety measures for the outside location.

Pretty sure some of the items at the booth outside are prepped by the same folks who cook for the restaurant inside. I've never been disappointed by anything that I picked up, though I know some days they run out of popular items.

The big steam buns are delicious, as are the smaller dumplings and the Kimbap "Korean Rolls". Their "sets" are a great deal if you want a variety of options.

Tonight I was really happy to pick up some Korean fried chicken on my way home from work and happy that they take credit cards now too.

Enjoyed some great food here and ate in the socially distanced food court. My wife and i had some leftovers at the end and to my suprise they charged me a $1.50 for to-go containers... It felt like a cheap move on there part. Food is good though.
This place is savage af. Good so good you’ll slap your mama. Huge fan of the spicy ramen with kimchi. The kimchi stew, bulgogi and mandoo. Tbh ive never had a bad meal here
Incredible Korean food, cozy environment, in a fantastic grocery store.

My boyfriend and I have been here many times, and the food is always fresh, delicious, and made with love. The people are super nice as well; easily one of our favorite spots and we stop here off the lake trail all the time. Hope it stays here for a very long time.

Literal hidden gem! I like to give out 5 star ratings but DO NOT take this one lightly. Employees are friendly, food is fresh & comes out instantly. Great value and fills you up. If you're having trouble finding it, yes it's in the back of a JEWELRY STORE
Food is amazing! Definitely delicious and fresh. Falafel is soso good and the spinach pie is out of this world
The mixed combo is excellent. Food was ready before I even had the chance to sit down. Ask for their house made hot sauce. This place is a hidden gem.

Oasis offers a rare thing in the loop: solid reliable lunch spot with good value. It seems loop mostly has fancy hotel restaurants and chains. I have came to appreciate its reliability and its homeyness. Best of all, it offers 2 daily soups, as well as rotating lunch menu. You will often see other workers eating lunch here.

They have a ton of variety, just check out their menu! Food is delicious! Speedy service and quality meals for a good price. Only thing that sucks is that this place use to be 24 hrs and now they close as early as 4pm. Also kids use to eat free. But it’s all good, will definitely keep coming back 🤤

Soooo...... the inside was nothing special ( nothing wrong with that ) !!!

Service was fine.   Let's get down to the nitty gritty !!

I ordered  a steak skillet with pancakes and a side of grits.
- the grits were runny and looked like oatmeal
-  the pancakes tasted like baking soda 🤔😔
-  the steak tasted like dry hamburger meat
- I only took two bites 😤
- orange juice tasted like a watered down diet substitute
- the lemonade hate a funny after taste !!!.

This place is (((a  pass))).
Not worth my time or money
My husband was craving for pancakes and ended up ordering omeletts. Very huge servings! Wasn't able to finish everything. My husband ate some of the hash browns, got a bit of my son's 🥞 too.
Excellent place to stop for breakfast with convenient parking. Friendly staff. Nice local place.

Stopped by around 3pm on a Monday and beat the lunch rush. Was greeted very warmly as I walked in and took a seat of my choice at the diner. My Ham & Cheese club sandwich was delicious and filling; well-cooked fries and yummy chicken noodle soup was included. You won't lack for food portions! Will definitely stop in again soon.

We love eating out. Last night we arrived in this superb place which we didn’t know before. We passed a delightful time there with delicious meal and an efficient stuff and a great cook. We  added this fine restaurant in our phone list  and we shall definitely return very soon. We deeply recommend.

I sent my friends to this restaurant with my warmest recommendations. I visit this restaurant often. This recommendation is always successful. The the food there is appetizing and the crew is efficient and cooperative. always when we visit this place we have a splendid evening.  I recommend this place with pleasure.
Fantastic food, super nice staff members, consistently  awesome mood. They charge convenient rates and the food quality is good. 5 stars.
The service isn't the fastest, but it is well worth it. Go on a day when you have time to spare, and go by their recommendations. You get to have excellent food and dine with the family.

Absolutely delicious Pad Thai and Fried rice! The food here is always fresh and the portion is massive for the price you pay…definitely one of the best pad thai in Chicago. The restaurant is small but it is very clean and cozy. Owner is always friendly and offer great costumer service. Never disappoints 😊

This small Thai restaurant is my favorite in chicago! My husband and I enjoy their dumplings, salads, and variety of soups. The food is fresh and not greasy as some restaurants we have found. Get the vegetarian dumplings with your next order!
My new favorite place!! Everything I’ve had here is seriously so good! You absolutely have to get the chive dumplings along with your order - it will change your life!

Small little Thai restaurant on Thorndale. The place is tiny (only 4 tables) and very green, but offers delicious food at very reasonable prices. This is a great spot to check out when you are craving Thai. They also do great take out!

I’m so thrilled I found Ms. Lek and Rice Thai Kitchen and hope to order take-out for years to come. The quality of the food and its execution is surprisingly superb- the egg rolls are flakey and crispy and the tofu is delicious!  Yes, tofu!! So far, everything I’ve ordered has been piping hot and exactly how I’d like.  I wouldn’t dare change anything.  They are quick and treat you with respect and gratitude.  Please support🙏🏼.  Diamond in the rough. 💎
The best pizza in Chicago my wife don't think so
Great pizza I been going there for 40 yrs
I called for a delivery at 5:00pm and never got it, so I called the place they told me they forgot to place my order, the worst will never order from this place
Love that pizza  nice n hot
The food taste stale not good flavor

Loved it here, went with my girlfriend for happy hour,  we had the vino verde on the patio. Love the New Orleans music and feel. We also had oysters and cheese plate both were very good.  The service was prompt and courteous. Didn't stay for live business but will return.

Front Room was a very cute and cozy restaurant in the heart of West Loop.  It had a strong New Orleans influence that really made it a unique spot.

The food was all quite tasty, again it was their take on New Orleans cuisine  I did wish there was a little bit more of a Cajun oomf to it, but it was all quite delightful.

Their cocktails were well balanced and strong, but I did feel they were overpriced for the neighborhood while the food was very fairly priced for the amount of food you received.

Finally, there was live music which is both a delight and a drawback. The group we saw while there was great, but the space was small so when they really kicked it up it got extremely loud and you couldn't hear the person you were dining with at all.

Would I go back? Yes absolutely, but I think I'd do things a bit different next time I do just learning from the first visit.

Great place with live music and nice atmosphere.
Old style interior makes this place very cozy. Author’s cocktails were very delicious.
Service is perfect. Thanks to hard-working waitresses and administration.
Love the food and drinks here. Plus, the live music is always great. The vibe is so cute and really feels very New Orleans.

Came for Mardi Gras celebration and was not disappointed with the options of southern bites and cocktails. Great drinks, great food, and exceptional service. Definitely a welcome addition to the Randolph/West Loop corridor, especially if you're looking for a change of pace.

Nightwood is simply wonderful. I went here for dinner during the summer with my wife and sat out on the patio. It was a great atmosphere, and the spit-roasted pork loin I had was among the best pork I've eaten. The drink list is also interesting and features some great options. We also went inside to take a look at the kitchen, which is basically open for diners to view. As as silly as this sounds, I even like that the toilet there is black. You just don't see that a lot of places. And, of course, sealing the deal is that the service was great, very helpful.

I had been wanting to try Nightwood for a while, since I had heard that it was the same owners at Lula's. Lula's is my ultimate favorite in the city & I had high expectations for Nightwood. I love the decor here & dark-ish atmosphere. The food was pretty good, but definitely didn't top my love affair with it's counterpart.

What to order: Deep Fried Michigan Smelts, Pumpkin Seed Ravioli

The service at this place is amazing! We loved the focaccia bread, and they only brought one for the table initially but were super quick to bring more when we requested it. The waiter joked we might get full before our main courses but the bread really is pretty small.

The appetizer I got (agnolotti) was smaller than what I would have expected for the price but apparently someone comes in every day at 8am to hand make the pasta. The main course wood-grilled duck was tasty but also a little pricey. The restaurant is known for the wood-grilled dishes in particular.

My current favorite brunch spot!  Menu changes frequently, but there is always a new standout dish that ends up being delicious and satisfying.  The staff is absolutely lovely, and works together well.  Decor is a perfectly-done urban rustic, and there is a beautiful atrium/garden space which extends "outdoor" seating into all but the coldest Chicago weather.

I've likened this to Lula Cafe grown up, but that's not really fair to either place. The decor here is great, both inside and out. The food on their rotating menu is always interesting, and mostly great (but there have been some misses.) I enjoy the cocktails here as well. Here's a tip: if you're a party of 2, don't be afraid to sit in back, next to the kitchen. It's fascinating to see the chef/cooks at work. They may even surprise you with a taste of something.
Amazing deep dish pizza! The flavors were truly explosive! The calamari was delicious too, especially with the little banana peppers fried in the mix.

I just hate when I place an order for a pizza and get home and it's not right.  If I am charged for double sausage,  I expect to get it,  or don't charge me for it.  Unfortunately with pizza,  you can't just lift up the pizza box lid and check that they cooked it correctly.
Definitely recommend calling your order for pick up. Wait is a little less than one hour. Worth the wait for me. Pizza was delicious!

i would give less if i could... Visiting from Cali had never had Chicago pizza wanted to try...waa warned not to go to this location but i went anyway nearly 2 hours later and our order given away..the pizza was good the waitress apologetic..but i will NEVER GO BACK. never got my wings...mixed up one of the pizzas..never got my lemonade... feces flies on the window indicating a a plumbing issue... just all bad...pizza was ok

Pizza was delicious I got the meat and more meat deep dish pizza I asked to add jalapeños and mushrooms and instead of them just charging for the two extra veggies they wanted to charge me as create your own and charge for every single topping which was going to come out to almost another $20 extra! Yeah forget about it.

I had a great experience here. The owner and staff were very kind and made sure I was enjoying everything. The food was delicious and the falafel, which the owner said was made using a family recipe, was probably the best I've ever had. Unlike the sandy-ness of other recipes, these were perfect. The hummus was also excellently smooth and wonderful for a cool Chicago day. Although it's not as trendy as some of its neighbors, I'd overall highly recommend stopping here.

I've had a lot of Arabic food in my life and Hala In is by far the best Arabic food in Lincoln Park/Lakeview. Tabbouli, Hummus and Chicken Shawarma are my favorites. The shawarma has the right seasoning and isn't the oily fried "fake" shawarma you find at some establishments.

On a busy stretch of Clark, during the height of lunch hour, not one single table was occupied. This should have been a clue. The overcooked rice which was probably left out for days were clumped up underneath the Kifta which was dry as dog food, the beef Shish Kabab was chewy. Haven't been to their location on the North West side, not holding my breath, but they need to shut down this location.
1 hr delivery. Lamb was ice cold and even worse was over cooked. Pita bread was quite hard and crunchy, not enjoyable. Hummus was decent but really nothing extraordinary.
Have run Groupon deals before. You get a lot of food for what you pay for! A little empty - probably makes more money on deliveries and carry out than dine in.

I got a regular burrito dinner for pickup and the second I went to eat it, the burrito fell apart. It was soggy and dripping grease in pools.. I couldn’t even taste the meat. The Horchata was very good but I ordered a large and got a small. I’m not sure if you can tell by the picture but my beans are almost white.

Nachos steak over cooked no lettuce,guacamole, or sour cream.  SAME with taco salad. Stuffed tacos blah. $40 nothing looked like the menu, I'm done with that franchise,  I'm sorry don't work anymore!!
This place has been here along time. And it still don't disappoint. Food is very good.

Great food cozy environment friendly accommodating staff awesome drinks im a PEPES customer for life love the deals and specials 63rd and Kedzie is the original and the BEST... HIGHLY RECOMMENDED 5 STARS

I stand outside at 9:30pm on a Thursday and they are closed.
Even though It says 11pm and the weather is great, and they're inside and just decided to say screw the customers,  and close early.

We were looking for a halal place around and ended up here! Food was very good! The flavors were great, and portion size was big. We ordered 2 entrees both came with salad and soup. The lentil soup is such a comfort food! Loved it!
Also the guy who served us was very nice to us. Will definitely visit again!

Not the prettiest place relatively bare-bones as far as the interior goes but the food is wonderful and I’ve been going there for years and I keep going back. If your a fan of middle eastern food I recommend. This is Syrian version. Flat bread if very thin food is tasty.

Soup and salad was amazing. The combination plate was amazing, the rice and garlic sauce was delicious. I wasn't a fan of the chicken but that's just my opinion. Will definitely be back for lunch again

Was hoping for a simple, tasty shawarma / pita spot, but after first go, this ain't it.

Website says $7.50 for a shawarma, counter rung me up for $10.97. When I asked why the website says something different, the young behind the counter said "we don't run the website. We've asked them to change it and they haven't". When I asked who "they" are, she said to me "I don't know".

If the shawarma was good, I'd be more okay with it. But it was small, 1/3 gristle, and had no sauce (so pretty dry). Honestly I would have been better off with making a frozen burrito at home.

Might try them again with the chicken instead of the beef, but currently no high hopes.
Very best especially the hummus with beef shawarma 😋 😍

Grabbed a quick bite here for brunch/lunch.  It was a weird time of day we got hungry on our stop thru Chicago.  This was one of the few places that stayed open open during the awkward hrs between 10-11:30.  I like that we could at least grab a Bloody Mary while we waited the half hour for the kitchen to open up again at 11.  Our waiter, JDJ, was on the ball and took our order exactly at 11.  We had the small plates.  They were all excellent.  The arugula salad was not as sweet as I was expecting which was a good thingI’m .  The garlic fries amazing!  JDJ brought us a few samples of beer before my fiancé decided on one and did it happily.  Granted it was not busy there but I thought the service and food were wonderful!

I came here last week with my family for my birthday dinner! It was a truly unforgettable evening thank you to the excellent service we received from our server Amir! Amir was delightful and well educated on the menu. He made some great recommendations, and we had such a great time thank you to the ambiance he created. Of course, we must also tip our hats to the kitchen that created an incredible meal for us. A must visit!
A creative menu in a casual setting near the  theater district.  Great cocktail options.

I ate lunch here with co-workers and we all really enjoyed our meals.  I had the grilled chicken sandwich which had black pepper aioli and that was delicious!  The fries were very good too.  The pulled pork sandwich was also enjoyed by others at lunch.  Since this is the Hotel Monaco restaurant, it was a little fancier and the price points were a little higher, but worth it.  I feel like this place probably doesn't get the attention it deserves since is sunk below ground a bit, but it's a gem.

Pretty uninspired food. Smoked salmon was decent. Hamburger was okay but I asked for no tomatoes and they brought tomatoes.  Quinoa bowl was flavourless and again asked for no tomatoes and got tomatoes mixed in and chopped up. When I mentioned it I was told it was the kitchens fault... well that's great but doesn't help me.
Not awful but many much better choices.

Came in for dinner with a group of guys on a Friday night. The restaurant was mostly empty, but the food was still better than I had anticipated. The food was classic Mediterranean-style dishes at a decent price - nothing terribly innovative or impressive, but all solid flavors and textures. My favorite item was the scallops and parsnip puree. There were plenty of options for the vegetarian and gluten-free members of our party. I walked away both full and satisfied with the meal. If you're hungry and struggling to get a last minute table in West Loop, I'd recommend Nia.

My husband and I got the wonderful opportunity to dine at Nia last night after a wonderful massage from the Mirror Mirror Salon and Spa next door. We were the first guest of the evening and was greeted with open arms. The staff was nice and accommodating. The ambiance was lovely and inviting. The cuisine was delicious as well! We had the charcuterie board with delicious meats and cheeses. The Nia salad was delicious and refreshing. Our main courses were the Lamb Chops w/mushroom risotto and the Amish Chicken w/Potatoes and Broccoli. Everything was delicious and cooked to perfection. We couldn’t wait to dig in. We will definitely return to dine here, especially after learning they have a patio set up during the summer months. Thanks Nia for a lovely date night.

I had such a wonderful time at Nia this evening! Incredible service from all of the staff. Beautiful ambiance in a decadent and intimate setting. And the carbonara; fantastic. You can really tell when someone has their heart and soul put into a place and Nia is an excellent example of that! Make them your next stop!

One of the most welcoming quality restaurants in the city. I enjoyed the lamb which was finger licking good! The drink selection was amongst the top in the city. I will definitely be back again and have suggested it to many friends. Ask for the espresso martini it’s exquisite.

I cant speak to a normal experience but I and some friends participated in Resturant week with Nia this year and it was great! Had and 8 course, tapas style tasting menu and I was impressed! With so many heavy hitters in the west loop Nia could be overlooked but if your looking for a romantic setting and shared plates this is a gem.

We get the crisp fried chicken wings with sassy seoul sauce and Seoul Steak bowl! Chicken wings are huge! All the sauce navigates to the bottom and the fries just soaks it up. It’s Heaven! Don’t worry they give extra sauce on the side to dip. The Seoul steak bowl is flavorful and the atomic hot sauce gives it a nice kick!! I love me a Chicago dog but the wings and the bowl are the way to go at Budacki’s!!

PRO TIP — bring wipes to clean up after yourselves if you plan on eating outside on the picnic tables! The wings get messy, but are 100% worth it.

If you are a fan of McDonald's fries you will love these. The only difference is these are better. Overall the Italian beef and beef bowl were great. Kinda unusual to have a $11 minimum to use your credit card, only reason this isn't a 5 star.

Tasty food, grabbed some food from this staple Chicago fast food place. My friend used to go here nearly 50 years ago and has a lot of fond memories of Budackis.

Glad I got to eat a piece of Chicago history.

After just one burger and fry meal w a can of Coke and a bottle of warm water( which I ordered that way) for a solid ten bucks, Budackis instantly became a part of my daily routine. I enjoy it waiting for the Metra for work. It’s worth mentioning there is an 11.00 dollar minimum for card payments. The other is I order with light onion yet there is always far too much onion. I’ve included pictures of how it come and what I’d like to see as light onion. I think they should share their secrets of this next attribute to almost everywhere else… YOU WILL NOT BE HARASSED FOR SPARE CHANGE!!! I don’t know how they did it but it’s fantastic! Especially when eating outdoors! If I have to trade onions for that well load up those onions! I have yet to try their signature chicken pita but maybe tomorrow
Loved their veggie dog and fries. Can’t beat their prices. Also their staff was so friendly and the picnic area is great!

Great venue with some character. Everyone on the staff that we interacted with was awesome, friendly and clearly cared about providing great service. I had the mainstage burger with fries. It was served hot, fresh and cooked exactly how I ordered it. It tasted delicious too! This was in the music joint/bar area. There is a small stage there where I have enjoyed a couple great shows in the past and a bass guitar clinic this time. Headed to the rooftop to hang out in the open air, listening to some heavy music playing through the speakers, people watching, enjoying a few drinks and the passing El Trains. There's a pool table, bar with more great food and a basketball shooting area. Then we headed back down to the street to go next door to the rock joint to watch the concert we came to see, the band Living Colour. Great sound, easy views of the stage. There's a balcony area with some seating as well. I really dig all of the band and other random stickers that are all over almost every available surface in the joint and the rock club, especially the bathrooms. Very rock n' roll! Along with the great food offerings, there is a pretty extensive drink & beer menu...I believe there were 5 pages in the menu to choose from. I will definitely be back again to see another show, eat a meal, drink some drinks, soak up the atmosphere and have a memorable time. Great place!

Place is very nice! Especially to hang out with friends. The outdoor patio is great in the summer, and it is worth to check out the rooftop too! Live music happens periodically, so make sure you are not missing out on the events. Had a lot of shareables and several different drinks among the table. Portions were generous and drinks were great! Cozy athmosphere and easy drinks: nothing more you may want to expect from a pub. The service was also great, I was offered to try a beer before purchasing it and the selection is wide! One time is surely not enough to complete the experence! I will be back for sure!

Reggie's is one of the best intimate music venues in Chicago. It's wide range of groups with perfect size, Reggie's will allow you to get up close and personal with the artists you want to hear and see. The offer a good beer and liquor selection and do have an attached restaurant if you need a bite before a concert.

That's a nice venue with a punk character. It seems to be loved by its patrons. The inside bar and the patio are equally cool places to be. The staff was polite and the beer was cheap, what's not to like?! Ah,  the surrounding streets are a bit shady if you mind.

Decent little spot. Our waitress was very polite and attentive. Good food.. especially the wings.. best I've had in a while. I would go there just to get em! Seen a show and the venue was very small but nice. No complaints. It was great not having to deal w a big crowd. Bathrooms are awesome!!

This was a random choice and a great one. Small but worth the wait if you have to. Great variety of traditional dishes and more American Americanized dishes. Service was fast and food was freshly prepared and very good. Don't let the size or simplicity of the building fool you. This is a treat.

I had a little bit of time so I stopped in and had a nice dinner.  The hosts, waiters, waitresses were friendly,, informative of the menu and even suggested a few entrees which I will try next time I visit. The food was fresh hot and served in a timely manner. My favorite dish was the Egg Drop soup. This restaurant is reasonably priced. I was satisfied I stopped in.

The meal was amazing. When we entered the resteraunt were we nicely greeted and then seated. The lunch spel came with the main course, choice of rice and soup, and also an egg or spring roll. The food came out hot and ready to eat!

Had a group of 12 (2 toddlers, 2 elementary school, 2 high school, 1 college, grandmother, and 4 adults/ parents of the kids). Ordered several dishes everything couldn't fit on the table but everything was so delicious and everyone enjoyed all the different food (reason why I listed our group of 12).

Food came out quickly and our waitress and staff did such an awesome job with service with such a big group that we tipped more even though the tip of 18% was already added on the bill.

Came here before a few years ago and the food and staff never disappoint.

The staff was amazingly fast and food was decent. I got the emperor's chicken and it was delicious! Also tried the fish with vegetables and it was ok. Overall worth a visit if you order the right items.

Yum, stop by and enjoy some amazing flavors with these great pupusas. Highly recommend you order a Revuelta for my meat lovers. Are you looking for a non meat option,  go with the Loroco. The flavors coming off these are just great. Make sure you pile on that curito with the sauce of your choice. Red the traditional sauce and green non traditional for a bit of spice in your life. I recommend an Agua de Tamarindo to help refresh you pallet during your meal. Definitely coming back.

The staff were friendly and thoughtful and all the food was so delicious. I look forward to coming back and bringing friends!

Loved the artwork and decorations that made it fun to look around while we were trying to decide what to eat from all great options on the menu or waiting for food to arrive.

We got there around 5:30pm on Saturday and there was definitely a stream of families and other folks arriving after us, so glad we beat dinner rush!

Edit - I just ordered take out today and got a lot more flavors of pupusas because they are so tasty and we wanted to share with friends who were very interested after they heard about our last trip. We also enjoyed the Pepian chicken stew and more of the delicious corn drink. Though I finished mine too quickly, that's my only complaint and not their problem!

Edit x2 - came back for takeout towards the end of the day and really enjoyed the beautiful textile arts they have on display now while waiting for the order! Food was just as delicious as before and stayed hot until we got home. I left it up to the staff what pupusas to put in my order and all of them were SO delicious. My mom got the pork adobada dinner and loved it, we each have leftovers for lunch tomorrow.

I walk by all the time and crave the pupusas in the pictures outside. Went in the other day and finally had some, delicious! Also very reasonably priced. Try to come with time, pupusas can take a while

Service could have been better. We had a group of about 10 people and they could only do 2 separate cards. Sitting in Separate tables was the only they could accommodate more than 2 cards. Would have liked to order more food but staff seemed overwhelmed by our "huge" party.

Seen reviews, thought we’d try it! I’m not a fan, the food lacked flavor, wasn’t fresh, and we won’t be coming back. It was ok, the prices were high, but I rather pay a bit more and get more flavor & freshness! I’m sure there are a lot of people that won’t agree with my review, but these are my tastebuds, and I can not only smell, taste or see anything fresh. ✌️

Never had Slice Factory pizza before. I’m very picky when it comes to pizza. I got the margherita pizza and one with the chicken, cilantro, red onions, habanero sauce and pineapple Sooooo good. Great Customer service, very friendly and nice. Will definitely come back! My husband got the supreme pizza and cheese fries. If I knew they have waffle fries I would get some too. He really liked the pizza and fries.

Late quick bite/dinner for my 7 yr old after a long afternoon. We ordered a slice of cheese pizza and he couldn't of been happier! He's a picky eater and he gave it 4 stars. The friendly staff was nice enough to cut it up in small pieces. Great for on the go, once in a while, quick bite!
This was our first visit. We got veggie and supreme slices. The slices are HUGE. We spent $14 for two slices. It’s a bang for the buck. It’s NY style and reminded us of Costco pizza which we love.
Ants in my drink. Don’t go here. Closed before I could get a refund.

Terrible food is not made fresh, the tenders are a chicken patty sliced into 7 pieces their boneless wings are small pieces of popcorn chicken, I don't even want the free slice they're offering. Save yourself some time and get anything else.

Excellent Nepalese (and Indian) food in South Loop! The owner even gave us a bonus mango lassi and carrot walnut dessert free of charge. Amazing! They seem to also have a thriving takeout business so we look forward to trying that out in the future.

I had dinner here just today and was overwhelmed by the nostalgia of the flavors the food had. The restaurant is a unique representation of what Nepali food and Nepali culture actually is. The servers were so friendly, the food was amazing and, most importantly, authentic. For anybody looking to have genuine South-Asian taste, do give this a try!

I love Indian food. Back home, I get it multiple times a month. If this restaurant was in my city, I would never need to go anywhere else and I would have no money. I got way too much food for one person to eat because there was just so much I wanted to try and absolutely everything was spectacular. The samosas were rich, crispy and absolutely stuffed with lamb. The green sauce paired so well to balance it out! I have never had momos and it was recommended by my Nepalese friends. Again, so crunchy and full of flavor. The sauce that came with it had a hint of spice. Their korma was smooth and rich and the chicken was juicy and thick. The garlic naan was genuinely the best I have had. It is exactly what I want when I say garlic. They were busy with orders but never forgot about me and were checking in on me. I will say that the spice was a little lacking for me at medium but I am from Louisiana so the spice scale might be different. I will definitely be returning even if it takes me a few years to fly back up. Maybe I can get their recipes next time... lol. Thank you guys for an amazing meal!

I had a great time at Nepal House ! The host was so very nice and gave us a mango lassi even though we were ordering take out. A delicious treat while we waited on our even more delicious meal ! A clean, calm environment that I will definitely be back too. It's very nice to be in a calm place when it's been the opposite of calm everywhere else.

I was in the neighborhood when I came across Nepal House and I decided to go in as I have been craving biryani for a long time. So that is what I ordered. The service was excellent. Staff was warm and welcoming. The food came out in a timely manner and the space was clean, making it an enjoyable dine-in experience. The food satisfied my cravings too! The chicken biryani was well seasoned with a mild savory taste that I enjoyed. I had a mango lassi too which tasted really good!
Superbowl Sunday so it was very busy. Nothing was hot and ready! I waited about 30 mins for 2 pizzas, bread and wings.

People at this location don't know what manners means.
Giving an attitude like if it is my fault that they be working on a Saturday.
Specifically Someone called Gladys V.
Looks like is hard for them to say at least HI.
You ever buy a pizza off a food truck and it falls on your own your cars floor and you kick it under your seat and forget it's there for 9 months? That would be better than little Caesars.

Accurate and fast for those who walk in to the place. No clue about deliveries, though.

Expect long lines, though. Every time I have been in here, there's at least 5-6 people inside the room.

Edit: Lowering to 4 stars... I'm not a fan of a bum hanging out by the door.... They need to take care of that issue.

Edit (Nov 17): I'm in here again and this place gets worse and worse each time... Today, the wait is "10-15 minutes"... For a pepperoni pizza... Heh.

Plus, sad to say, the bum is still there. The bum is very creepy, especially at night, asking for money. Really???? In THIS neighborhood? Try the burbs, buddy.

Knocking down to 3 stars.

Edit (April 11): While the bum is gone, there's always someone by the door on the outside. The place is literally that small.

As of today, Little Caesar's is getting renovated. There's literally no virtual menu above the cashiers like before, and the wait is still around 20 minutes for pizzas. That's only because there was at least 10 people in the room at the time.

The place is looking like a fire hazard now with an even smaller opening for employees to leave the building, not to mention the place being so small that the customers can barely fit. I hope they fix that, but I doubt it. They need their money, and blocking the entryway with an oven is the "best" way to market to customers. *sigh*

The sad part is the parking lot. While Cermak Market next door is being renovated, I noticed that more than half the lot was full at the time also. As good as the pizza is, I'd be a bit worried about fighting for a parking space.

Dropping to two stars. The pizza being tasty aside, this place is a fire hazard. Very dangerous if your taking any kids with you.
Just got my burnt & dry pizza.
Great bar with great beer selection.
Great food with a neighborhood, family feel. Perfect place to share small plates while enjoying the Greek wine and cocktails. Rooftop during the summer is a must!

Amazing food with an equally incredible rooftop terrace. We ordered the tzatziki, giant beans, wild mushroom flatbread, and the octopus to share. The octopus was especially delicious and had a great flavor and texture!

We feasted well during our visit. We ordered the saganaki, eggplant spread, lamb and mushroom Politiki flatbreads, and the pork shoulder skewers.

The politiki style lamb flatbread is my absolute favourite but everything we had was delicious.

Perfect patio with great vibes and staff. Definitely get the lemon chicken entree, it’s super juicy and flavorful. Everything I’ve tried is always consistently good. They’re open on Mondays which seems rare nowadays

They were able to accommodate us for a large table the same day! The food and drinks were delicious, good selection of Greek wine and beers.

The pita that came with the dips were delicious and the tzatiki was perfection. Great menu with selection that could accommodate many dietary restrictions. We ordered lots of items to share and the veggie options I tried were delicious. Tried the hummus, beans, the okra and the vegetarian main (squash and eggplant) — everything was amazing. Good service and had a really wonderful evening with friends

This is a neighborhood favorite. Forget Al's, this is the real deal. The location has ample parking and a "can't miss" storefront. The Italian Beef sandwiches are engulfed in flavor and tenderness. It is one of the best I've ever had. My daughter had one for the first time since she graduated college and came home...she lost her mind and remembered how much she had missed Joe's.

That also sell a wonderful pepper and egg sandwich on Fridays. This is a must visit restaurant.
Fast service, great beef, and amazing fresh fries!

First time there was 10/12/16. Driving by, and it looked like an original, small, Italian Beef style place.  Certainly was that! Reminded me of the old style Beef Joint from years ago. (I remember years ago, Beef Joints would wrap your sandwich, with the fries in a plain brown paper wrapper! Yum!!!

The WORST Italian Sausage I have ever had.  Looked like it was cooked for 2 or 3 days.  Completely Flat in shape, dried out, hard to chew.  Absolutely nothing left to resemble a piece of Italian Sausage!

I live in tennessee now , but born and raised on the near west side of Chicago. I use to play baseball at Humboldt park , but before the game I always  stopped at  Bostons. They had and still have the best beefs  and fries in Chicago.

What a great buzzing atmosphere. The place is deceiving up front, the restaurant is huge. The service and attentiveness of the staff is first rate. The Sangria is excellent and has many flavor choices. The Tapas is well served and fresh. The food is fun and tasty. Did not try to Paella but it is a popular dish. Reservations are a must, the place was packed even with an late afternoon reservation.

It’s a great place for family, friends, co worker n date night. it’s tapas spanish food. Served in small portion that perfect for trying many dishes. we tried many dishes. they all are good. There is variety choices of sangria drinks, check with the server for sangria of the day. it’s busy on the weekends so recommended to try.

One of the best tapas places I’ve ever tried.   The service was fantastic.  the food was excellent. I couldn’t  take pictures of all our plates since every time a new plate came we devoured  it. The food was so so good. Highly recommend the bacon wrapped dates and Spanish octopus!   come hungry.

This is easily one of the best Spanish themed restaurants in all the Chicago. The staff is always helpful but we went with the clear favorites of the meatballs, the potatoes, the chicken, ham croquettes, the meat and cheese board, olives and the like. The peach sangria was to die for. We went for a happy hour special and was very pleased of all the food we got for a cheap price.

The Tapas menu was super cool. Definitely definitely try the Omelette, the Beef Empanada and the Butterscotch Custard - amazing! The Passion Fruit Sangria didn’t feel worth $20 for half a pitcher. The Margarita was super strong!

I came here with a friend a few days ago and wow was I pleased! The lighting is fantastic for a date night or a family gathering. The portions may look small but it's so worth the price. Even if you eat on an empty stomach, I bet you'll be full. Also, the bread they gave out before the main dish was on fire! It's the best bread I've had so far!

Love this place, is in my own neighborhood, clean, good service, good food, good price what else you can ask? You have to try the pizzas (I already try all the pizzas on the menu) and the cannoli is a perfect place to enjoy a good date or a good dinner with friends without throwing all your money.

Idk what happened to this place but the pasta is horrible now. I used to order from here a lot about a year ago. Now it doesn’t taste the same. My stuffed shells were drowning in marinara sauce. The baked mostocholi is horrible now. Used to be so good. Now it tastes awful. Not sure what happened.

its not hard to change your hours on google, why does google say 12am when you guys are closed, wasted 30 minutes of my life, you guys owe me a free dinner. honestly, poor management if you cant change the hours, like cmon, its business 101.
Been going for years.  Never had a bad experience.   Best ribs around and fresh pasta

A friend from out of town chose this restaurant. We received a warm greeting when we arrived and we were immediately seated.  Our waitress was absolutely wonderful and quite personable.  I ordered the corned beef hash, upgraded specialty berries pancakes without the vanilla sauce, and a side of fresh fruit.  I also ordered a hot caramel latte.  I must say the food was absolutely phenomenal.  My friend enjoyed her food as well.  Also, the prices are quite reasonable.  I will definitely be making this my go-to breakfast spot.

My colleague insisted on eating here during a recent trip to Chicago. I have NO regrets about that!   The latte was hot fresh and made to order. My brisket hash delectable! The side of berry pancakes was a sweet treat to balance the savory flavor of the hash. Our server was helpful as well as the other wait staff. The decor was simple but Elegant. Definitely will keep it on my list of good Chicago eats.

I would give this more than five stars if I could!! This is hands down the best breakfast I’ve ever had. I’m a pancake fanatic, and the texture and flavor of their pancakes is unbeatable. Every food item is of a special twist, and is some of the highest quality I’ve ever had. Atmosphere is very bright and cheerful, and selection is great! There’s nothing you might crave for breakfast that you can’t get here.

Arrive early (before 7) to avoid a wait on weekends or holidays. Outdoor seating is available, weather permitting. Food options are plentiful, with many gluten free and veggie friendly options. They have a cauliflower hash that is very tasty. Real maple syrup can be requested for about $3 at the time of this review (the bottle it comes in is very cute). The staff are always friendly and considerate.

Went here for girls brunch and it was fantastic. It was very busy, but the food came out surprisingly quick. I ordered the rutherford omelette upon our server (Andrew)’s suggestion and it was honestly the best omelette I have ever had in my life. My friends got the key lime pie pancakes, BLT with chips, and chocolate-strawberry waffle - all of which were delicious. Also, their strawberry-vanilla smoothie rocks!

Went to Dove’s off advice from a bartender, it was great! We stopped for a late breakfast/lunch. The spot is like an old dinner that’s turning out some fantastic food. We got the chicken fried chicken and the burnt ends hash. Both were really good and we ended up splitting both. Also had some cocktails..cause why not!

Their social media page is curated very well. I was pleasantly surprised by the diner appeal. I enjoy ordering the Dove’s Deluxe; the potatoes have a perfect crunch and the Texas toast tastes like it’s made with freshly churned butter. The drinks are well crafted and are recommended for an acquired taste as they are not your standard brunch drinks.

Dove’s is an experience; beautiful windows, charmingly decorated, always bustling, warm and cozy. The food may surprise you with its classic fare but with unique and flavorful taste. You may read a dish and feel it familiar, then taste it and find it’s better than what you had. Don’t fear the basic and enjoy all they have to offer; avocado toast (anything with their thick slices is a win) or chilaquiles, all are hearty! If you don’t want as much at once, try asking for them as sides or small plates. The service is always kind and though seating can feel tight, it doesn’t feel stuffy. Best place to people watch!

Came here for breakfast and ate out on their quaint patio. I ordered the Dove’s Deluxe with sunny side up eggs and it was just right. The potatoes are absolutely wonderful 🤤 and they’ve got a nice and thick cut bacon.

They serve La Colombe coffee so that’s also a plus!

Bathrooms are clean and gender neutral which is always nice and inviting to see.

Looking forward to coming back for dinner sometime soon!

So happy that Doves is re-open and local restaurants like Doves was able to make it thru the pandemic. I’ve never had a bad meal so my 5 star rating is based on multiple visits. I was super happy that they had available their “back to life cocktail”…basically a very tasty ceviche. If you have never been, the restaurant is a small space with mostly counter seating a a few communal tables.

The Gold Coaster pizza we got was decent. I was not thrilled by it, but it was decent. The crust was a bit to hard for my taste. I had a better period fired pizza just a few weeks ago. The atmosphere seemed nice and the staff was pleasant. It took a bit of neck stretching and waving to get the bill as we were in a hurry.

Delicious Italian-style thin crust pizza, available with an array of fresh toppings. We loved our artisan pepperoni pizza, and will definitely return. The friendly bartenders serve up a great selection of draft beer and wine, as well.

I love the atmosphere here & service was really good.

The Fried Cheese for Grown ups was pretty good, although it wouldn't have hurt to have a little marinara sauce for dipping. Parts of the breading had a hint of more flavor, which would've been really good had it been consistent throughout the entire plate.

The Calabrese pizza was very good. I could smell truffle oil on the pizzas around us, which made me want to order more than I could've eaten. I'd definitely go back to try different appetizers & pizza!

One of Chicago's greatest chefs makes his food a little more accessible.  This is a great thing.  The prices here seem fair but the location is a bit touristy and hard to get to if you aren't already on the Mag Mile.

My review is based solely on a visit to try one of the highest rated cups of hot chocolate in the city.  This isn't your typical hot cocoa.  Imagine the exact opposite of a Swiss Miss made with water (not milk).  An Italian style hot chocolate is thick enough to eat with a spoon, sweet enough to remind you that you're overdue to see your dentist, and rich enough to warrant a pinky high in the air while you sip this sweet treat.  I can tell you it's good... very good.  This is a perfect reward for braving the cold to get some shopping done.  You'll be warmed from the inside out and leave with a significant sugar high.

I'll have to come back to try the pizza.  From what I saw, smelled, and read, it is fantastic (even if it is the anti-deep dish).

We had a great lunch on Sunday.  We shared the pizza special: caramelized onions, shaved Parmesan, and some very small meat bites with a bit of a kick.

Our waiter made the lunch very special and brought us a birthday treat with a candle.

It is a great place for lunch.

I want to love this place since it’s convenient.  Three times I’ve ordered a hot latte and picked it up and it’s mostly foam.  I don’t expect the world, but clearly someone needs additional training.  All other drinks purchased were acceptable and good.

The type of food and service you receive; is dependent on the time of day. I went during the early afternoon and was disgusted! The woman cleaning the lobby used the broom to dust off some of the tables. The same broom that she had just swept the floor with! It's best to go after 6 pm, the guy who works at this time; is clean and friendly

I ordered a matcha latte in the morning, they handed me my drink and I ran to my bus to get to work. I did not check because it was handed to me plus there was no customer before me. I get to work and it’s a regular latte “which I can’t drink because I’m pregnant” I saved it so they can give me the one I asked and paid for. A old Indian women yelled at me in front of other customers that next time I need my receipt  ! I explained I WAS NOT GIVEN ONE! Do I need to pull my transaction on my bank statement to prove to her!!  So I was yelled at in front of customers for there mistake! Are you serious! You gave me the wrong the drink! You didn’t give me a receipt! This women should not be working with customers if she has not 1 percent of good customer service! She also did not greet in a nice way! A hello I’ll be with you soon would of been nice! I got a “wait” Im
Having a bad day myself and I don’t treat other people as if Im being bothered. You’r being paid for what you do and you don’t like it then quit!! I’m a paying customer! Last time I ever go to that Dunkin! So many in the downtown area and never again will I step a foot in this one! RUDE and so unprofessional!

This Location Price Gouge... It's Always more Expensive than other Locations.... Snacking Bacon at this Location used to $2.49 now it's $3.99....Donut used to be $1.29 now it's $1.59 etc Everything at this Location has went up Tremendously,I'm Very Disappointed...They are Taken Advantage that the are Open 24 hrs they are Very Convenient, Descent Service and Food.....But the Prices have become Disappointing.  .Other DD Locations I go to the Prices are Lower and the Snacking Bacon is Always Way Below $3.00.

I went to another Dunkin and after walking away from the initial Dunkin, with my iced coffee, a couple sips in, it tasted like bitter coffee, and something that belonged in the trash. I kept walking assuming I could go to another Dunkin and have another drink remade. I arrived at THIS Dunkin and when I explained my situation, they brushed me off and told me to go to the original Dunkin where my coffee was purchased. They were about to close so to go back in that direction, did not make any sense. The employees there kept saying for me to go back to the other place….. which was not something feasible. Either way, to not keep rambling, Dunkin customer service is TRASH, Starbucks would never…. I might consider not coming back to Dunkin again if this is the type of service I’m going to get.
Good pizza if you like the thick Chicago style one. I liked it for a try. Come on over its good place to hang out.
Our family of five had a great lunch. Service was great, food was even better.

It was my first time here over the weekend and I really enjoyed it! Waitress was very funny and accommodating, and the food was very delicious! The overall layout of the spot was very spacious, with plenty of TVs around to keep you and your party entertained. Enjoy!

Awful service from our waitress. Not only did she mess up multiple orders, many of them had to be redone a third time. She was unapologetic and so was the management. Never did they offer to discount dinner and wouldn't split the bill among people in the beginning, making us waste time trying to figure out who owed what and what actually needed to be paid for that wasn't screwed up. On top of it all, the food made some of us ill layer that night. Just an awful mess.

First day in Chicago
We're freezing and this place is the nearest
We wait 30' or more for a Pizza Hut sytle
Very desapointed with our first deep dish "pizza?" experience
Please dont go

The bagels are great but the cashier should go back to school and get a personality. Nowhere in “Retail101” does it say it’s appropriate to eat something while ringing in a customers order. Handling my food order while she is eating just doesn’t seem right!!! Again, my Nova Lox was very tasty.

It was my 1st time at Einstein's, and I liked it a lot. I had a Texan Brisket with Garlic Beagle, the location has an excellent location (conveniently close to my chooses hotel 😏) and a lot of inside space, it was barely crowded and device was as quick as you could expect. Restorooms were clean and staff was very attentive. In my opinion, the combination I chooses was a bit too dry 😅 but very tasty 🤤.
Ordered baked hash browns from here which turned out to be too oily and undercooked. Very disappointed. This is a take away only store.

WOW!! I exist in a bagel coma after this morning's amazing experience at Dearborn and Kinzie! I ordered using the app and arrived a few minutes early. A nice woman confirmed that my order was next to be fulfilled. And a super nice woman carefully packaged my bagels and spread, walking my bagels and super divinely hot coffee to me with zest and kindness. I felt like she appreciated my business. I surely appreciated her, and I hope that she knows it. And the bagels! Oh the bagels were DIVINE. My beautiful puppies also enjoyed licking the cream cheese from my fingers, lol. Their picture of this activity is attached. Thank you so much to your team of workers. I am grateful.

This place is terrible. You wait so long.  All the food is fake like subway. The Chorizo on my breakfast burrito was a broken up patty. Looked like cat food. Tasted nothing like Chorizo. Idk what it was.

I’ve been to multiple Leonidas shops in Belgium and was so happy to see this in Chicago.  Had to buy some chocolate to see if it was exactly the same and it is. You can select one of their chocolate boxes or ask for a bag and select a some pieces which will be charged by the pound.

We also had a Caramel Frappe and Cappuccino to go and both were excellent.  The drinks were surprisingly reasonably priced, you can zoom up on the picture with pricing to see all the drink prices.

We got an extreme dark hot chocolate drink and a java milk hot chocolate drink. They were both very rich in chocolate and creamy / thick in consistency. I thought the extreme dark chocolate would be very bitter but it was not at all. I used to drink chocolate very often in the past but I hadn’t drunk it in years since I like foods & drinks with less and less sweetness as I grew up. The java milk hot chocolate wasn’t too sweet like I thought it would be but after a while we both needed some water.

The almond croissant was soft and crunchy. There are thin almond slices and powdered sugar on top, frangipane (almond cream filling) spread between the croissant slice, and chocolate between the layers of the croissant. The chocolate was a nice surprise. The Quiche Lorraine was probably pre-made and re-heated since it’s a small coffee shop. The crust is crunchy / hard and soft on the inside with onion and bacon. It’s a nice little savory pastry for the morning enough to fill you up for a couple of hours without being hungry.

Most customers came in to get drinks to go. You can also get chocolate / chocolate boxes here. The crêpes are made to order and I really want to try it, maybe next time.

The sweetness of apples and the saltiness of Brie made the Brie & Apple Crepes outstanding.

I liked the small shop with the great servers that made my order fresh and exceeding expectations.
The mango macron was delicious 😋. The hazelnut left something to be desired. The organetta were very good.

Charming little jewel of a cafe! Not only do they have delicious coffee selections, but wonderful food. Yes, you see the tempting display of yummy chocolate items and pastries,  but their menu has so many delicious meals. I highly recommend this cafe!

I came across this place several years ago and have been coming ever since. This is a great take out spot with great value. Most recently I feel like food has improved — what a great surprise.

Again, this is east coast style no frills Chinese takeout, which is an increasingly rare style for Chicago. A hidden gem, but don’t expect presentation, because that’s not what this style is about.

This place use to be great but now I just got the worst chicken & broccoli, pepper beef & shrimp egg foo young.  The  chicke had this horrible globs of thick gluttonous corn starch all over it like it was precooked and sitting in this gel waiting to be used, the beef also had thick gluttonous gravy only slightly better than the chkn.  The fried rice was dry w/dried chicken & too much soy.  Egg rolls were pretty good & the only freshly cooked item shrimp egg foo young was good.  I will not be coming back.

Okay… so a couple years ago they were not to bad. $7 for a big portion of Mongolian beef and shrimp fried rice is pretty good not gonna lie. But now they not good. Although thank you for your response. I changed my review to a 4 because you guys got under new management. The old management was terrible at the end just terrible.
No owners has sit down and improved food. The pepper steak was very good and fried rice is a bomb for reasonable prices and good American Chinese food this is the place.
Food is delicious and portions are huge. Keep up good work

The homemade blueberry muffins that are served with the lemon spread are fantastic!  They were an excellent treat to have with our coffee while we were waiting for our food to come out.  I had the buttermilk pancakes which could appear boring in comparison to all the other dishes on the menu, but they were wonderful!  They tasted like there was a touch of vanilla and also like the griddle had butter melted on it before the pancake batter was poured -- it had that slightly crisp edge that's so delicious.  The coffee wasn't very good and the service was pretty slow, but the tasty food was worth it.

Unbelievable horrible service. Came here to celebrate a birthday with friends. When we first walked in, I thought to myself that this was a pretty nice and classy looking atmosphere.  When we first sat down, we were greeted and was told that the menu was changing and they don't sell something with watermelon, and some other ethnic types of food. At first I was thinking to myself that I did not here what I thought I heard so I asked my wife did she catch what he said and she stated yes. We ignored it just thinking whateva. We proceeded to continue to look at the menu to make a order. Our waiter (Alex)left and never came back for about 15 minutes. No one ever came over to check on our table until it was time to order. As we were waiting on our order my wife and I were laughing and talking she took a drink of her water and almost swallowed a piece of broken glass in her water. Explained to (Alex) that my wife found a piece of glass in her drink. We did not get any type of explanation.  At this point my wife was very upset. We drove 1 1/2 hrs to this establishment and was very hungry.  Not one time did they offer any type of complimentary discount. My wife was very skeptical about eating her meal after this. I was already hungry and had not eaten since about 11 am that day, so I ate my food. I told them to pack my wife food to go and we left without tipping. The good thing about this matter was I Groupon the restaurant for the meal so I didn't pay full price for the meal. I would never recommend this place to anyone. They are racist, and are proud to show it. Only reason why they get 1 star is because I can't do a review without a star. Hint: I am a person of color that have been to many 5 star restaurants and this is not one of them. If you are planning to dine here, go somewhere else that is worth your money with better service.

The bread pudding was decent, and the wine was ok. However, the owner is appalling. He had no problem spewing his drunk racist hate about the people in the neighborhood to new customers sitting at the bar. The things he said about people of color in the neighborhood made me regret ever walking in the door. Seriously, if you are going to support a local restaurant, go somewhere else. This man does not deserve your business.
Mediocre at best...Maybe they're transitioning between chefs? We were not impressed. I would definitely steer clear of the muscles, we had to spit them out. Crab cakes were the only thing we enjoyed"
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. I've been here about 5 times. Love the grilled hanger steak. Their crab cakes are also great. This is a nice cute place to come and eat.

I told waiter when I walked in that I had the Groupon for 4 people. I only had 3 and was going to order for a 4th. She told me that I can use the Groupon or half off pizza deal. So I ordered $50 of food and they told me that I couldn't use the Groupon. Luckily the waiter was nice enough to give us these drinks on the house. But the manager over rides her decision. Besides that the food was bland and didn't have substance. First and Last time I come to leonas and would highly recommend never coming here

Monday night 1/2 price pizza. The pizza is O.KAY.  I've had better at a lot of different places. And my husband said and I agree, they're being stingy with the sausage on the sausage pizza. Well, at least it was on sale. On the upside, friendly and speedy service. Well lit, cheerful atmosphere, caters to all ages.

Sad to say this place has gone completely down hill. I ordered delivery from there a month ago for the first time in a year or so and the food was some of the lowest quality ive ever had. I ordered the jumbo chicken tenders (which were always phenomenal in the past) which came with French fries and I also got the mozzarella sticks. It seemed like it was cooked, left out for an hour then thrown in the microwave!!!! I had to throw the chicken away, I was nervous to eat it after a bite! Nothing was hot!! It was ridiculous! I ate the fries and half of the mozzarella sticks (the ones that still had cheese stuffed in them) only because I put them on my pizza pizzaz for 20 min! If I didn't wait over an hour and wasn't starving then it all would have been in the trash. It's a shame because this place used to be good quality! Did they get new owners in the past few years?? Needless to say, I sadly will never eat here again :-(   P.S. The people who are giving any good ratings are either employees or family, DO NOT TRUST THEM! It's not worth the chance of food poisoning or roaches laying eggs in your belly!

First let me state that I am one who writes honest reviews both when I am dissatisfied and when I am pleased. While I usually post on Yelp or TripAdvisor, I wanted to post this review to Google so more people are aware of the poor experience we had.

Tonight we went to Leona's for dinner because my wife was interested in their gluten free pizza. I will say, she loved it her pizza. It had pepperoni and bacon on it and she said the crust tasted different than most GF pizza which made it have delicious flavor. She also had a long island ice tea which she said tasted good.

On the other hand, my experience was very poor. Our server, even the manager had a tendency to drop off stuff at our table and then walk away quickly so they couldn't hear us asking for what we needed. Leaving us sitting and staring at our food for 10 minutes unable to eat ir. After we received our food we had catch a manager passing by to get us cutlery so we could eat.

I ordered the garlic chicken with side salad and fettuccine alfredo and a lemonade to drink. Oh, where to begin. The garlic chicken was bland and very dry. It didn't have any flavor like promised on the menu. It needs to have sauce with it or on it or they need to do a better job with the breading. The side salad was not fresh and didn't come with dressing. The fettuccine alfredo had a bland flavor-no seasoning, and has serious room for improvement. The lemonade was what you can find at the grocery store for cheap, yet cost $3 because they put sugar around the rim to make it fancy. I really wanted a refill to help me eat the severely dry chicken, but our server was busy with other tables.

I was starving so I ate the fettuccine and some of the chicken, but that was all. My meal cost $15 but that is a rip off considering you get better quality and better tasting chicken at Popeye's for $5. I refused to pay for the food I didn't eat, explained to the manager how bad the food tasted and how dissatisfied I was. The manager seemed more interested in defending the food than hearing my explanation as to why it didn't taste good, which in my opinion means he has no idea what good customer service is. We placed our money on the table and left.

I'm sure there are plenty of other Italian restaurants where you can get a $15 chicken dinner that tastes much better than crap they serve at Leona's.

Since my wife enjoyed her pizza I will give them a star, but I feel that 1 star is even generous considering the poor service and poor tasting food I had. She may return for the pizza, but I will not be returning.

I also share with everyone I know both the positive and negative experiences I have at restaurants. Fortunately, this is our first bad experience while being in Chicago. With so many other dining options in Chicago, my advice is don't waste your time at Leona's on Western Ave.

We came for the pizza and mozzarella bricks (amazing) at about 7p. Our server forgot to put in the mozzarella bricks and laughed when we reminded her, but did not offer a solution to us. Our pizza took about an hour to cook and every time our server came to the table... she asks, "still waiting?" Were we supposed to leave? Here's the kicker, another larger family came in about 30 minutes after us and had gotten their pizza before us. I believe it is because we are white and they are black. We asked for the check and that took an additional 35 minutes to get. Will never go back. Awful awful awful.

Cash-only brunch spot with friendly staff and live music. Slightly higher than expected prices for  menu items; some items had generous portions while others felt a bit lacking. Everything tasted great, though. The cappuccino was particularly good, even if the bespoke black cup and saucer it was served in were visibly water spotted. Overall a decent brunch spot, but the cash-only nature coupled with the slightly lower value for dollar proposition rank it a step below other local places.

The prices were very high which was expected because it was in Chicago, but the portions were small and did not taste great for the price. It was a cute outdoor area, but I don’t think I would recommend. The staff was friendly which is important.

Started with a Bloody Mary it was made with zing zang. Not as spicy as I like but they had hot sauce to put in it. Had the Tex Mex omelette with chorizo in it. I was thinking it would be a little spicier. Was very good. Would go back if in the area.

This place has been excellent I had been here multiple times and food and service is the greatest Definitely I recommend this place for a nice date or with a group of friends most come by! Food are delicious drinks need a little bit of improvement but besides that is good
We stopped by for a quick drink. I had the espresso martini and it was really good!! Everyone is really friendly, the place has a good vibe and great drink options.

Simply phenomenal. The service was good, but the food was simply sublime. I cannot put into words how good it was other than pure ecstasy. The salad was the perfect blend of mozzarella, tomato, salad, and olive oil that formed a union of flavors for a salad unlike no other. The salad was one of the simplest but best I've had in a while. Now the main course was just beyond what I expected. The perfect blend of soft pasta layers, sticky and savory meats coupled with crimson scrumptious red sauce and topped with fantastic melted cheese bring you straight to flavor town. The tastes, textures, and smells all combine to make the best Italian food I have ever eaten and the best dining experience in a few years. 10/10 would recommend to anyone wanting Italian. And for their low price tag, it's criminal how underrated the restaurant is. Delicious!

Perfect little neighborhood Italian restaurant with true flavors and ingredients. Reasonable priced with wonderful service by the owners. Nothing fancy here except the quality and comfort. FOLLOW ME for more thoughtful recommendations as I travel the world  🌎

Service was great and the food was fantastic!! We had garlic bread with cheese and a pepperoni pizza, both were delicious! We were so full but had to try their gelato and it did not disappoint. It was a tasty treat to finish off the meal. Highly recommend sitting on their patio to enjoy a beautiful evening

Family owned. Great thin crust pizza. The best in town. Located by the Trump hotel. Outdoor seating available. Rolled Eggplant appetizer is so good! Chicken Parm sandwich was just okay. The Caprese Salad is my favorite. Light and refreshing. Reasonably priced. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a quick , casual bite to eat in Chicago.

Before I get into the review, this place is located inside the River Plaza at 405 N. Wabash.  Turn at the River Plaza sign off N. Wabash and follow the sidewalk into the River Plaza building.

Stopped by during lunch while visiting Chicago.  I've had all the usual deep-dish pizzas and other well-known pizza places in Chicago, so wanted to try someplace different.  It was lunchtime during the week, but it was not too crowded.  There's about 10 tables both inside and outside, but it was a rainy day so opted for the inside.
