They don't sell individual slices, but the small 10" pizza is only 4 reasonable slices.  Service was very fast and friendly.

Ordered the 10" Capricciosa pizza which took about 10-15 minutes to arrive.  Pizza was straight out the oven and looked great.  Crust was a good thickness, crispy, just the right amount of sauce, and there was a generous amount of ingredients.  They also have desserts such as gelato, tiramisu, cannolis, and cookies.  I was too full for anything big, so just ordered 2 cookies after another customer recommended them.  It was a good recommendation.

Nice hidden gem for good pizza.  Good food and service.
Really good food. Got the Shawarma Mix entree, which was definitely more than one serving. Good meat, rice, and salad. Definitely worth returning to.

Delicious from start to finish.  The meat was charred to perfection — maximum flavor but not burnt, which takes a careful eye.   We got the vegetable plate and 4 way grill plate and it could easily have fed four people.  Great value for how much you get.  My only regret is that I forget to ask for hot sauce!  Will definitely be returning soon.
Absolutely delicious! Will be ordering again. Vegetarian Plate and Mix Grill 4 Way. 5* - thanks and glad to have you in the neighborhood!

I don't often write reviews but I have to for this place. The guys working there are so nice. I had the chicken shawarma sandwich, SO GOOD! They're very friendly and the food is great. Very affordable. Very nice to see more middle eastern food in Uptown! Sorry for the pic, I took a bite before taking the picture haha. Delicious!
This place is delicious, when they are open. They don’t follow their posted hours and I’ve been disappointed many times when trying to get lunch.

They moved one door down into a completely brand new space. It’s brighter and more updated. The working space also feels cleaner. Glad they’re back after a long renovation hiatus! Same great team as before.

I tried their newer location on 10/8/22 sometime in the later part of the afternoon. The place was bigger and more staff from the lasts time I visited with the older and much smaller location before. The staff was friendly and fast, the food was set up properly, cleanliness with plenty of meat to spare. Plus, I lucked out, one of the customers in line gave me a coupon for two footlong Subs for $12.99.

Subway is the healthiest and greatest deal I've had in Chicago NIH National Institute of Health recommends for one to eat 40% of their diet should be fruits and vegetables one Subway alone 6 in easily takes care of that requirement I like the deal bogo 50 buy one get one 50% off 2 ft longs for under $15 how could you beat that plus 175 points when you a amass 200 points it's $2 less at the cashier how could you beat that I'll always be a Subway fan cuz I have a voracious appetite

It was open, and I was hungry. That gets one stars. I was saved by what I realized was the manager, as she'd ask me a question, and then turn to another employee while I was answering,turn back to me and ask the same question again. She just walked away after handing me my receipt with my sandwich still on her side of the register. I reached over the register to get it and left. Another feature is the locked restroom which require a pin code to enter.

Whenever I've stopped here for food the people working here have been very rude and unhelpful to me. Every other Subway in the country that I have been to have had very friendly workers most of whom will go out of their way to strike up a conversation with me. Not this place though. The food tasted pretty good at least and the restaurant seemed clean. Something else that is not the restaurants fault was the other customers eating there had the look of hate in their eyes.

Great atmosphere and decent food. I deducted one star because it took an hour for the food to come out (we came at 5pm). The portion is a bit small so make sure you either get an appetizer or fill up on bread (the dipping was quiet good).

Wonderful meal! cocktail with pear and vodka light and refreshing.  Lobster ravioli- handmade ravioli with huge pieces of lobster as well as claw meat. The sauce was crazy good! Bread before/with was crusty in outside soft inside with a spread- nice to have something different than butter!
Service great, and atmosphere cozily elegant. Highly recommend!
I have eaten Italian food all over the United States and in Italy. This place is the real deal. Full of old world charm and great service I had one of the best meals I have ever had here.

Like swallows to Capistrano (chimneys) ... I come back to this place every year when in Chicago.
As of October 2018, Tammy will have been at T10 23 years. That should tell you everything you need to know about the place. As the person orchestrating your dinner and wine, she is phenomenal.
Read all of the reviews. Not much that hasn’t been well said. The place is great.
Here’s my perfect solo dinner in the main dining room - two half plates of their hand made pasta. Glasses of Multepulciano. Gelato.
The bar is wonderful if you are a party of two and can get a coveted table there. But you will not get Tammy - so, a trade off.

Lovely service and very well-crafted food; I would absolutely come back. Beet terrine salad was excellent; cooked perfectly and the fava bean garnish played very well both from flavor and textural perspectives.

Shrimp ravioli with the salmon roe garnish was inspired; the pop of brine offset the buttery sauce very well.

Profiteroles with gelato and Valhrona sauce was fabulous for the two bites I managed.

I very much appreciate that they offer two sizes for many of the entrees and desserts, which minimizes potential food waste.

We had our wedding celebration in the event space at Formento’s. Their event planning team, Jane and Elizabeth, were fantastic to work with. Extremely responsive and invested in making sure our event went off without a hitch. They were very flexible with some last minute changes that were made.

Also, the food and service at Formento’s is amazing. That was our #1 priority when picking a place for the event.

First time here tonight and it was wonderful. Great atmosphere and service was wonderful. Dani, our server, and her partner were a dynamic duo and took care of us.

Let me start off by saying that I have a gluten allergy and am also dairy free, so normally an Italian restaurant is not my first pick of choice. But, they walked through the details of both and Dani guided me to what I could and couldn't eat. They had gluten free bread, and the pasta was hands down the best gluten free pasta I've had in the 7 years of being gluten free. The blood orange sorbet was also amazing.

They took care of me and my dietary needs, and for this, I will certainly be back!

This is definitely a must-visit for me when I come back to Chicago!

Despite being under-dressed for this establishment, I was treated to a fantastic dining experience!

Our server was exceptional and the food was out of this world. I've been on the hunt for a solid carbonara, and Formento's has by far had the best one yet!

Early dinner starting at 6pm wasn't busy/crowded at all. Sat outside where there was more tables available outside than I would've expected and spaced well. Great spot for people watching as well as there are so many characters walking by!

Service was spot on from the get go as our server was extremely friendly having us laugh along with her. Gave good recommendations when we had questions and checked on us without going overboard.

Felt like we had ordered the entire menu as we got a nice range of dishes. Started off right as they brought out black pepper focaccia with olive oil to wet our whistle. For an appetizer, Oysters were tasty (east coast tasted smoother and would recommend those). Definitely get the burrata and heirloom tomatoes as well as grandma's meatballs. Tiger prawns were the only meh dish as they were a bit mushy in texture and so so flavor.
All pastas were great, but the carbonara nailed it with the crispy pork bits. Chicken parm was succulent as was the skirt steak.
Tiramisu was excellent, but the chocolate cake took the... Well, took the cake. Moist, succulent, right amount of sweetness... We ordered another to go.
Must come back!

I've eaten here many times and have never had a bad experience.

I usually come in a group of four and we usually order 2-3 appetizers and 2-3 entrees (pasta, meat, fish) that we all split. (Pic attached? I'd also start with 1-2 cocktails before splitting at least one bottle of wine.

I recommend the meatballs, Calamari, and  bruschetta, remember you also get bread which is good.

For entrees I'd recommend two pastas, usually one cream and one meat, and a steak or a fish. You really can't go wrong and everything is so good!

Pair it with a nice bottle of red and you'll have a great night, especially since you can bar hop on Randolph.

Went to Beat Kitchen last night to see a live performance. Great experience all around! The venue (located downstairs) accommodated a crowd of us in a smaller, more intimate setting. Drinks were surprisingly affordable and tasty. Looking forward to coming again!
I helped produce an event here and had the next experience. The bartenders are super attentive and helpful. The food is absolutely delicious! We loved the whole experience.

We came to watch The Rare Occasions one weekend. The venue was really easy to find, even being out of state. Staff manning the entrance were friendly and kept foot traffic flowing. The show itself was amazing and the venue was better than some I've been to. It was a warm Chicago night but inside the temp never got unbearable or even uncomfortable. Wish we had ordered food but we weren't too sure how late the kitchen stayed open.

Sat down to have a drink, which was great. Politely asked the staff to turn on the heater while we were sitting and they told me they wouldn’t turn on the heaters and that “I had to go” after serving us within 20 minutes of our arrival. Be more courteous to your customers.
Great venue! The sound is one of the best in the city. Super small super intimate super fun.

The service was quick and friendly. Coffee tastes great. Staff was very knowledgeable about the whole bean coffee I wanted to purchase.

I only give 4 stars because the egg bacon and cheese on English muffin was absolutely obliterated with salt. The sandwiches had more salt than the Pacific Ocean. I love salty food, but this was outrageous.

I still ate the sandwich and now I look like the baddie from Last Crusade who chose the wrong goblet.

Their banana bread French toast is scrumptious and delightfully crave worthy!!! The salads are very tasty and fresh! Everything is high quality and packaged with care! I highly recommend this jewel of a cafe! So happy to have this on Chicago’s Southside!!!

First time here and it will Not be my last ! This place is full of good food, good people and good vibes. They serve breakfast all day and that’s a winner for me. I had the Grits bowl and it was really different as well as really good. Never thought to pile everything in a bowl of grits  . My Chi tea latte was great and hit the spot as the weather is cooling down some… I got a peak at how to play chess which was cool too. I would have given 5 stars but they could use some extra help with cleaning as the tables were dirty and too many of gnats joined in on my meeting 🤷🏽‍♀️

Love there food very affordable and tasty.  The banana French toast was delicious. I ate my left over 😩 even cold it taste like banana bread. Sorry not Sorry they are the balm the banana smoothie is awesome as well.

This is one of my favorite coffee shops where I hang out. It's a nice atmosphere and a great place to do some studying or get some work done. They have amazing breakfast sandwiches. I always go for the bacon, egg and cheese on a croissant. Delicious. Great experience for anyone who comes here.

Came to Girl & the Goat for the first time a week ago with my boyfriend and had a great time! Our expectations were super high as I’d been hearing about this restaurant for years.

When we first came in the host tried to seat us at a tinyyy table sandwiched between two sets of couples on each side, all sharing one long bench. I asked if there was anything else and we ended up sharing a large table with another group that was already eating. I found this a little strange given the exclusivity of the reservation process and that the entire front part of the restaurant is taken up by an enormous sectional couch which they called “the lounge.” Why do you need a lounge if you can’t comfortably seat your reservations?

The food, drinks, and service however, were fantastic. Our server was super friendly and engaging! For 2 people, 5 dishes is plenty (which is what our server said). 4 if you’re getting the pork shank, which you absolutely should. Everything was super creative with innovative flavor combinations. I also loved that the restaurant is tapas style (although the plates were much bigger than traditional tapas), because it allows you to try more of the menu without breaking the bank.

Don’t skip: the pork shank, the green beans, the olive bread with feta

Came here to have a nice date night and to celebrate our anniversary. Unfortunately, it didn’t live up to our expectations because of a number of reasons:

- Noise level was way too high.
- No private seating, felt a bit squeezed (we also noted in the reservation that we preferred to have a more private seating/table due to the occasion).
- Dishes were served in a strange order (fish/meat came before veggies) and there was a looooong (!) waiting time between each dish. It just didn’t work to have a whole plate of cauliflower to eat at the very end of the meal after having eaten the more heavy dishes already. We also got a plate of green beans on the house because of the long waiting time (appreciated the gesture) - also arrived at the end of our meal, but like with the cauliflowers, it felt like eating side dishes after already having finished the “main meal” which just didn’t work for us.
- The 6 dishes we tried simply didn’t live up to our expectations and certainly not to all the hype. Yes, everything was delicious and there were some nice creative flavor combinations, but nothing that really wowed us at all. And a big minus that the $16 sourdough bread was burnt and very dry. Our favorites were the “popcorn situation” dessert, chickpea fritters, and halibut.

(Note: A person from the management team did apologize for the long waiting time between courses, which we highly appreciated.)

Overall, this was just not the right choice for our occasion. And because of the above reasons we don’t think it’s worth the hype nor struggle to get a reservation.

I think the ambiance (high volume restaurant that’s extremely noisy due to bad acoustics) and they way you’re seated (not private at all, rather tightly sandwiched between other tables or on large dining tables with other groups) makes this a better place to go with a group of friends rather than a nice date night.

Perfect date night this evening. The food was absolutely amazing 🤩. From the chickpea fritters tasty goat yogurt, to the fall off the bone sticky pork and the scrumptious green beans. The desert we ordered was the well balance dessert with the sherbet and the chewy like pastry and they put on the house. that was on the house.

Service was top notch and the food came out quickly. This was a well oiled machine worthy of all the starts and accolades.

Our first time but will be back.
This was our first time

Light, elegant, elevated American fusion food.

Everything was cooked to perfection and tasted so flavorful. Each dish was unique and worked beautifully together.

We had the salmon poke bowl, pan roasted halibut, oysters, woodfire lamb, goat cheese board and the popcorn situation to bring us home.

Make reservations - place gets busy and packed. Good for any size party.

Top 5 meal of my life. It was incredible from start to finish. I went here for Valentine's Day with my wife and it was prefix menu but everything was fantastic. I personally loved the pork belly the best. I look forward to going again to try out their full menu.

I have been coming to this Connie's for many years. It's right by Chinatown. I definitely believe this is the best location 👍 for Connie's in the Chicago area.

Today I tried something that a friend of mine introduced me to that I did not even know existed in the menu. Stuffed pizza 🍕 with sauce on the side - pictures attached.

Basically you have a top crust with the tomato 🍅 sauce on the side.
Eating this pizza feels like eating a Calzone and Deep Dish pizza combined.

On the positive side, it is a crispy pizza. On the flip side, it is a bit dry because there is no tomato sauce inside.
Not something I liked and I will probably stick with the deep dish and thin crust next time but you might have a different experience so worth a shot one time at least.

Now regarding the atmosphere inside, it's very bright and lovely. Beautiful decor that really opens your eyes and lifts your spirits as you walk in and see people having a great time having a meal and talking with their friends and family. The service at this place is also wonderful and you feel like you are being served by family and friends and not just work people.

My vote for this place has always been and continues to be a big Yes. Definitely worth a visit!

Been coming here for decades, still had the same feel and satisfying flavor. Not gonna lie since this last visit, it had been while since I came. It was nostalgic coming here again. My kids said the same. I'm definitely gonna start coming more often again. Like they say "food was fire!". And if you never been to Connie's or visiting Chicago you gotta try it out! I love the flatbreads but everything is good!

Great service, even when busy.  First time here, and it was a great choice for our family.  Apps were good, kids menu was perfect, and our deep dish pizza was the reason we came.  Overall great experience, would recommend to anyone who wants pizza in the windy City.

We dined in with 8 kids and they were all able to enjoy something that they loved. The pizza was amazing, we ordered a deep dish with sausage which was more like a pan pizza, I loved it. My son is allergic to eggs and milk and I asked the server to confirm with the kitchen whether the kids grilled chicken and fries were safe, when he came back with the food he let us know that the seasoning on the fries was not safe and gave us the options of carrots. It is so scary to dine out with a kid with allergies, I would definitely bring my family again and again knowing that the staff is knowledgable and care about allergies.

Delicious pizzas! Build your own pizza or order their pre-set pizzas. All are yummy!  Ingredients are fresh.

The location on Archer Ave is great for dining in or pick up.  Spacious for dine in and pick up is quick if your order ahead.

Join their rewards for pizza specials!

Plenty of parking in their private lot.
Good job of cleaning. Asked for proof of vaccination. Food was hot and tasty. Nice portions.

Low Quality Cooking either the Food is Over Cooked or Under Cooked....How Hard is it to Heat Up Food in a Wok....I Usually can Tolerate the Food ,but Today was Horrible.... They need a Better Cook who is Trained to know Food Temperature.

Great Panda Express, very quick service & friendly staff.  Always well stocked and freshly cooked.  Been a regular for 2 years and never had to wait for anything, they always have seasonal/special items too.

As always the food is spot on!  Nice and clean place to eat some goodies. Price is good (stick with the medium entree more bang for your buck).  The employee working at lunch time is so pleasant and can effectively describe all of the options available.

Literally have to force myself not too eat this too often. The kindest people and honestly I went in there today and a man who I assumed had never ordered came in and was super rude to one of the employees. I'm so sorry to that person who has to deal with him. They handled the situation so well, literally I wish them (all the employees ) the best

Pretty cool. I lost at darts twice: once I was really bad and the other I was really good (went over). DJ is awesome. Domestic beers are pretty cheap (?) and there's a cute little water cooler. Definitely had upstairs to get good tunes.

A small bar but really good and cheap.
Outdoor seating available as well as bar tables inside.
I went on a Friday night and this place was really busy.

We ordered tater tots, mozzarella sticks and chicken tenders served with fries.

Had a couple of Whisky pegs, Glenfiddich and Black Label and Buffalo Trace Bourbon.

They have a lot of options in Beers on Tap.

If you’re looking for a bar that’s a total dive but also has great bartenders that will take care of you ….this is a perfect place.

Nestled amongst all the glitz and glamour, this old school bar that has a fun atmosphere,  a warm vibe and is open late. I feel like everyone should go here at least once. And once you go you will make return visits.

Don’t come here if you want to have fun - bartenders are cool but bouncers won’t let you in if you come past midnight.

Guy turned us away because we had a six pack on the sidewalk. Won’t spend $1 here.

Absolutely the worst experience I have had at a bar. The bartender took a very long time to ask if i wanted to order, though i was directly in front of her yet she continued to look around me as if i didn't exist. It was not crowded , so her behavior was definitely baffling. The security guard tried to snatch a cup of water out my cousins hand WHILE HE WAS DRINKING IT!!! The bartender claimed the kitchen was closed even though it didn't close for another 2 hours!!! I would NEVER return to this place. I have NEVER been treated so poorly at a bar.

This was our wild card spot for lunch today while at work and we were all pleasantly surprised. Amazing vegan options weren't even advertised on Google maps, so I wanted to give a big shout out as the beyond impossible sandwich was wonderful! I was literally lamenting about my favorite pressed sandwiches and Cubano Fair and wishing there were vegan options (outside of my own kitchen) and low and behold, Cafecito delivered. I went with a non-vegan who ordered off the vegan menu as well as someone with dietary restrictions who found it easy to order a custom sandwich. We grabbed it to go because the eat in area is small and it was lunch time, but we will be back soon! The service was very kind and there were awesome soda and coffee options to go along with a great quick lunch.

Serviceable downtown Cuban. The lunch crowd gets a bit disorganized, and the place is small, so know what you want, order and pay, and then stand out of the way.

I was surprised that similar orders can take significantly longer than others. Two coworkers and I went in for sandwiches for lunch and one of us ordered an al pastor sandwich (because they were out of all chicken) and two of us got our sandwiches within 10 minutes, but it was closer to 20 for the al pastor sandwich. So not always the easiest experience at lunch; maybe ordering ahead would be better for this location.

If you’re looking for some amazing sandwiches and customer service this is the place to go. When you walk in there are signs saying the best Cuban sandwiches in Chicago and I can vouch that this is a legitimate statement. In addition, Isabella was one of the nicest people I’ve met in the city, which made the experience that much better. I will be returning! I hope this place prospers and stays open. What a gem.

Cafe con leche is my go to here, its so tasty. It's a very small shop, a couple of tables and a bar area but most people grab and go.

I haven't tried any of the food, to be honest, and the regular drip coffee is alright but my stars are for the great service and my cafe con leche.

This place is so good. I called 10 min ahead for a takeout order and the food was ready right when I got there. Chevito sandwich was a great balance of flavors, grilled nicely, and just the right amount of messy. Luckily though they thoughtfully included a few napkins. My only regret is that I didn’t also order hot sauce! Next time, I’ll definitely be back.

I decided to eat here for lunch

Very convenient location I like the fact that the food is made to order the only reason I gave this restaurant three stars on 91st and Stony  Island the cashier/cook female was kinda short/ rude (you felt as if she was saying hurry up so I can take your order and get you out of here, only she didn’t say it out loud she just treated us all that way ).

Remember customer service is always important no matter what you are hired to do  if it’s to cook, clean, work as a cashier, manage the place great customer service will always be remembered.

My recommendation don’t tolerate customers please treat every customer  as if they matter.

I placed an online order today at 4:15 PM. I then received an email stating my order had been delivered. I immediately contacted this Pizza Hut location at 4:35 PM. The manager Ed or Eddie stated, “my food was out for delivery and he did not understand why the tracker was saying it had already been delivered”. My 5:26 PM, I contacted this Pizza Hut location again because it had been over an hour and my food was not delivered. The manager told me again, “my food was out for delivery”. At 5:59 PM, when I did not receive my order I called again, Eddie (the manager) stated, “Let me see where my food is (there was a lot of scrambling in the background), he then said, “My cook is preparing your order now, we were looking for some dough! I have two drivers out I can get you your food shortly.”

I was appalled at the blatant unprofessionalism (over talking me) and lies (telling me twice my food was out for delivery when according to the manager upon my 3rd time calling, it never left the restaurant or it did leave and the driver disappeared with my food). The manager (who is to lead employees in an honorable way) lied to a customer and someone who has patronize this location for years. When I asked for the GM’s name, Eddie refused to provide me with a name, stating he cannot disclose that information. I will not be ordering from this location again.

Horrendous customer service. Mediocre food and a complete lack of care for their customers. I will never frequent this Pizza Hut on 87th and Stony Island again. I would rather drive 10 miles out of my way and get good customer service then deal with this.
Food was on time and good quality. There was a slight issue with my order but Tarina was very quick and happy to help me figure it out!
The most rough service. The lady was so rude and I think I will never come back again. Please , pay attention about your service and be polite to your customers.

I came here with a friend a few days ago and wow was I pleased! The lighting is fantastic for a date night or a family gathering. The portions may look small but it's so worth the price. Even if you eat on an empty stomach, I bet you'll be full. Also, the bread they gave out before the main dish was on fire! It's the best bread I've had so far!

Love this place, is in my own neighborhood, clean, good service, good food, good price what else you can ask? You have to try the pizzas (I already try all the pizzas on the menu) and the cannoli is a perfect place to enjoy a good date or a good dinner with friends without throwing all your money.

Idk what happened to this place but the pasta is horrible now. I used to order from here a lot about a year ago. Now it doesn’t taste the same. My stuffed shells were drowning in marinara sauce. The baked mostocholi is horrible now. Used to be so good. Now it tastes awful. Not sure what happened.

its not hard to change your hours on google, why does google say 12am when you guys are closed, wasted 30 minutes of my life, you guys owe me a free dinner. honestly, poor management if you cant change the hours, like cmon, its business 101.
Been going for years.  Never had a bad experience.   Best ribs around and fresh pasta

We ordered a "Quick Pick-Up" online. When the order was almost ready we went to the store. The store was LOCKED but there were staff in there. We had to walk to the drive through order window to talk to the staff over there that the door was locked. She said we had to get in line with the cars to get our order. My boyfriend was patient enough to do so. I wasn't but I didn't want him to wait there alone so I waited with him. We were in line with other cars in the cold for 20 minutes. When we almost reached the drive through window, I noticed that there was a customer sitting in there. The door was now unlocked. She saw me standing there with other cars and she didnt bother to shout out from the window saying that the door was unlocked already.  Whenever we get our pick up, other staff who are African-Americans are doing their job nicely but this white American cashier is so careless. So careless I wonder why is she still working there if she hates the job so much.

While a convenient location. Food took over 10 minutes (more than 20 minutes for the people that ordered before us.) There were small ants along the walls and some of the tables. Parts of the windowsill were missing large chunks leaving gaping holes.

No idea how this place survived over the past two years. Service has always been the slowest fast food. Every. Single. Time. It's the only thing consistent about this place.

Edited* Left this while waiting on my food. No joke, from swiping my card to walking out with my food took over 20 minutes for 2 burros burritos, a quesadilla, a crunchwrap and fiesta potatoes... This is the typical experience and only come back when I've somehow forgotten. Hopefully leaving this long review will sear it into my brain to never come back. KFC? More like jfc...

Picked up a couple of chicken sandwiches on a Friday. This place isn't going to surprise you with the quality of their food, but they made the sandwiches quickly, they were hot and actually stayed pretty warm due to the foil-lined bags they were packed in. Fast food might not be something you wax poetic about wrt the food, but there's a lot of other places that had far less in terms of service quality.
The worst. Simply asked for extra crispy 2 breasts and 2 legs. They gave me original recipe with 4 different pieces. It’s like they don’t understand simple instructions.

Enjoyed a proper Pint of Guinness :) it was great def comparable to the one I had in Ireland. Ann is a great host :)
Update 1/14 just had their Shepherd Pie 🥧 simple and divinely delicious worth the extra $$ better than a date haha give it a try. Also the Pub fries with Curry sauce amazinggggggg

Gave this place a second chance and still not 100% sold on the food.
After reading all the good reviews I thought it will be great food but not quite there. The service by the ladies is awesome.

Local bar for me, came in for a late night burger but sadly the kitchen was already closed, we decided to get drinks since we were already there. Friendly staff, Blue moon is one of my fav beers and they sure make it right, I would revisit and try the food menu as I hear it's good, I would also recommend this to family and friends. By the way, they also had the fight on TV!
Vaughan's is one of my favorite Chicago spots.  Great food, great beer and great service.  They never disappoint.

We hosted a private party on the second floor and we had fantastic service. Anne, Sinead and Devon were wonderfully accommodating and the food was terrific. Very grateful to them and the staff for making it a great experience I would highly recommend. We will certainly be back!

Nice cozy place in downtown if you are looking for something classy and Italian!

Authentic food, great ambience and good music. You do feel like you've just stepped into Italy. The hospitality is great too!

Bruschetta was amazing and so was the pasta. Quick service and delicious food.

I would come here again for special occasions only though!

Truly FIVE Stars! And four of those stars belong to Tracy, or better known as “Jack” as in “Jack of All Trades”!! The food is phenomenal but if it wasn’t for Tracy our dinner/evening would not have been nearly as enjoyable!! She literally was handling 30+ customers on her own and everyone was attended to in a timely, friendly manner, it was impressive to watch! AGAIN, the food was amazing, but the service was exceptional! Thank you Tracy!!! Because of you we WILL return.

Food was very delicious and atmosphere was very nice not to mention the laid back music playing in the background while having dinner. The bar tender was awesome 👌.  Thank you so much Maggiano's Little Italy for providing such a wonderful experience.  Definitely coming back here.

First time I went to this location and I had a great experience. I went with my husband and sister. It’s almost closing time but Tracy are so nice and sweet. She made our night. The food was great. We all enjoyed our food and desserts. Definitely come back when we’re in Chicago next time. Thank Tracy!

The appetizer was amazing. My spouse ordered shrimp pasta it was so good. The waiter recommended the chicken parmigiana and that's what I ordered. Mine was ok the chicken was over cooked and so hard. I never send my food back. We had mixed drinks that were made delicious as ordered. The food didn't take long to come out and the ambiance was romantic. The waiter was very attentive.

My friend recommended this place when I asked her for a pasta restaurant. She had her wedding here so loves everything. We ordered the Rigatoni, angel hair aglio e olio, warm ciabatta & roasted garlic and charred pepperoni pizza. Everything was DELICIOUS! I had a picky eater and a “not so easily impressed” person with me and they LOVED every dish. I would totally come back. They also have a nice happy hour special- half off all pizzas and select wines. It’s only for an hour though so check the time on their website. The only thing that was annoying was that we sat outside and it was so loud. The sirens, the motorcycles, etc. but I guess that’s part of city living.

My wife and I LOVED this place. The rigatoni and mozzarella pizza were delicious. We sat outside to enjoy the summertime Chi ambiance, and our hostess was wonderful too.

We will definitely eat here again.

I started looking for a venue to host my wedding around November 2020 with the plan of having it in March 2022, and after quite a few weeks of nosing around (and feeling very hesitant about rough catering reviews from various establishments), I found Osteria - a beautiful restaurant with glowing feedback and gorgeous photos. It looked like a rustic dream, and the pictures from other brides only further helped my choice.

Suffice to say, the wedding was this past Saturday, and I had the best day of my life here. Allison, the event manager, was a dream to work with and DEEPLY patient with my ten thousand questions surrounding timing, vendor inquiries and recommendations, and stress-induced what-ifs. All the way leading up to the event she was gracious and kind, and on the actual day of, she was nothing short of perfect.

Everything went smoothly, the venue was beautifully decorated, and my guests WILL NOT STOP talking about how phenomenal the food was. Not a single wine glass dropped below halfway (I have no idea how many I consumed due to this incredible service) and every need was catered to with speed and efficiency.

I recommend Osteria for any event, party, or even just a dinner out in town, because they are THAT good. I'll never forget this place, and even though we've since moved out of state, you bet we'll keep coming back in the future. What an unforgettable experience!
Great Chicago Restaurant dining experience. The caesar salad and meatball starters were excellent. The rigatoni with short rib entree is amazing and a must try! I enjoyed their espresso martini.

We just hosted my husband's graduation at Osteria Via Stato. We had about 52 guests total in the private area. Everything was GREAT! From the planning portion in the beginning to the clean up at the end - it could not have been better. They made everything seamless and easy to plan. And trust me - I am VERY detail oriented and super picky with everything! Allison was so easy to contact and always communicated quickly. I had absolutely no issues asking questions or getting information. The day of we dropped off decorations and centerpieces - I was nervous because there was only 2 hours until the dinner. However, Natalie and the team did great. I showed them a photo of what I wanted and they executed it exactly how it was shown. Our guests absolutely loved the venue and raved about the food. From the mixology bar serving our wine and cocktails to the gelato bar - everything was a huge hit! Our guests loved the bruschetta and all of the entree selections. Highly recommend this place and would totally host another event here in the future. Thank you Allison, Natalie, and our servers of the evening!

Delicious little Viennese style open face sandwiches and a lovely space. I have been here twice now and have been happy with my food each time. The last time I had tea service which had a sweet little set up. I would recommend this place for a relaxed lunch or meeting. I believe they also do catering which would be incredible in terms of presentation and taste!
Love this place. It has a clean fresh minimalist look and the vegan hot chocolate with almond milk is delish! Try a hazelnut beignet if you want to find your next favorite pastry.

I have ordered their sandwiches for two parties.  They are a huge hit and provide you with lots of variety.  The seafood and Greek ones are my favorite.  About three sandwiches per person and a salad and you've got a party.
My daughter and I finally made it to the place and loved the sandwiches, dessert, coffee and even the decor in the bathroom.  Staff was very friendly.
Welcome addition to the neighborhood. Everything made in-house -- this is so appreciated.

We spent two hours at Snickers having flown in from New Orleans.
Food was good, hot and served fast.
Some of the bartender services were excellent. Others not so much. Really clueless bartenders. We're from New Orleans. We know good dive bars with good, cheap drinks. This is not a good dive bar. $17 for a Manhattan? 😂. $9 for a glass of white wine? Best thing about Snickers is we know what a good deal we have in the Quarter.

looked like a cool local sports bar.   Took 12 min to get acknowledged when the bar was only half full.  The guy next to me was laughing because  The female bartender kept ignoring me and wouldn't make eye contact as she walked by to tab out others.  He said I must be invisible.   Then get charged $24 for 2 well drink?  Wow.  I'll look for another place tomorrow.

Great place  !!  Bloody Mary’s were the bomb !! Was just there for a couple drinks until shaws opened but the owner was very nice and let my girlfriend and I try some of the gyro, highly recommended  !!
Nice place.  Warm and friendly environment. The door man is cool ,very handsome and charming.  He said his name was Terrance.  I will go back again.
Great owner, great bartenders (Kim & Carolina), just amazing place. Always feel like family there.
Probably some of the best BBQ around this area! Would highly recommend the pulled pork as it seemed the most flavorful of the sandwiches. 🐷

Do not come here the bartender will take your card & put in on a tab and charge you DAYS later for stuff you didn’t even get. THIS PLACE IS A SCAM. THESE BARTENDERS ARE STEALING PEOPLES CARD INFORMATION. There is one other review like this. PLEASE DO NOT GO HERE.

Was there for appetizers and outdoor seating. Relaxed setting really nice outdoor area. Wings were spicy and maybe a little saucier than I like but good. The best dish i had was loaded tator tots but the guac was really good too.
Their ribs are AMAZING. Their staff is very accommodating. Am very happy whenever I get the chance to go there

We had a great dinner here. My partner had a burger that he said was a solid choice. My chicken wrap hit the spot for me. My mixed drink was well made too. Is it fancy? No. Is it good? Yes. The server/bartender was great and attentive even though we were the only people on the patio at the time. We'll definitely be back for more!

After several bad experiences I finally found a good place at O'hare! Their burgers are SO good! It definitely hit the spot for me and I recommend it 1000 times over any other place in this airport. I was hesitant to try it at first but I waited enough to see it filling up by airport staff, so I knew it had to be good! I'd rather walk all the way to this place from any gate than try to find another good place in O'hare. I've had way too many bad experiences with other restaurants here.

This is some of the worst airport food I've ever had I got the philly cheese steak with no jalapeno and it was so dry and my brother got the cheddar dog which look like it was drenched in mustard. WHEN HE GOT JUST CHEESE IT WAS JUST SO MESSY AND OOOOZZ LOOKING THAT I THOUGHT HE GOT MUSTARD. Also I got a meal voucher from the airport and while trying to put in the really long code the old lady was rushing me and told me to put in the wrong thing then got mad at me for it so I just said forget it after my second try and just used my card cause I was feeling pressured and rushed while just trying to use a voucher

Decent place. Only halal item is a chicken shawarma sandwich. Kinda dodgy how they make halal and non halal on the same stove... With same utensils. Not recommended but with it being the only halal option you've at the airport, might as well have it.

Pretty great restaurant for an airport restaurant. I got a cheeseburger and fries and the price wasn't that high for airport prices, and it was very good. The service was relatively quick too. Definitely recommend if you're looking for a good, quick bite at terminal 3

Can here for a quick bite before our flight. I like the cultural chicago themed ketchup warning sign. It is a small space which they make the best of with the flow however when it come to ordering your food and waiting for it it became the nightmare. People started waiting for their food inside the shop causing serious
congestion but then we found out they did this for a good reason. We are pretty sure the girl in front of us took our pizza and hers because she ordered one and came out with two. The receipts come with check #s or order numbers yet they don’t use them. Instead they call out the pizzas so anyone can just take yours even if they ordered them after. This is useful for the people causing congestion to get their pizzas sooner. So your best bet here is to get the refrigerated food because you will not likely get your meal you order or get it in time. We ended up getting a refund for our pizza Bc after 20 minutes of waiting he said there was no sausage mini pizza in the oven…..The pizza puff was good and the Thai drunken noodles where good with lots of flavor (heads up a bit spicy if you don’t like that or are sensitive to  spice).

The ambience alone makes me want to come back: Indian art objects decorate the walls setting a beautiful atmosphere.  The staff is polite and efficient, the service is prompt. Large selection of domestic and imported spirits. The extensive menu features something for every palate. The food is delicious. And all at a very reasonable price. Definitely a restaurant I will go to again and again.

Excellent food, speedy service, friendly vibe. Although you have to order rice separately from the entree, it is very much worth the $3. I ordered “spicy” and was put to the test. I loved it. If you’re not a fan of really spicy food I’d definitely recommend ordering mild. Don’t risk it with medium. Can’t wait to have my leftovers tomorrow 😋

The food was amazing! The butter chicken was so flavorful and the chicken was really tender, the naan was delicious, and the saffron rice was paired really well with everything. The staff is super nice too and the food came out very quickly! 10/10 would recommend!

Delicious food and knowledgeable service. Will come back. My friends didn’t enjoy their food, because it was too much coconut in it. (And too little spices) But my chicken and nan were perfect. I am very curious to try their other menu items.

Walked past this place literally a hundred times and never stopped in. Today as I drove past we stopped for dinner and I am so happy we did. The lamb biryani was some of the best I’ve had, the garlic naan was thick and moist, and the spice built up as I ate, but wasn’t over powering. They also do takeout so that’s an option we’ll be trying next. Their service was fast, professional, and friendly. We’ll be making Essence of India a regular in our meal rotation.

The worst McDonalds ever. The people who work there don’t care about their customers. They were supposed to give me a double quarter pounder and they ended up giving me the single. The quarter pounder was terrible and they hardly gave me any fries. Not worth it and this will be my last time coming here. They call this a medium fries.

came to buy food but my toddler needed to pee so i wanted to take her before i ordered so my food could be fresh. he refused to let my 4 YEAR OLD DAUGHTER in the bathrooms cause we didnt have a receipt . i told him im buyin food i jus need to let her pee first . he told me no and turned his bac . VERY INHUMANE ! wouldnt give me corporate number or his name, said he didnt have to ! I WANT TO SPEAK TO CORPORATE ! we are humans and deserve simple human decency ! a child should not be denied a restroom simply cause i wanted to her to pee first then order ! he does not deserve to be in customer service if this is how he would treat a 4 Year Old Child !

Awesome service àt this particular McDonald's store location! Staff were very courteous and professional! The food is very fresh and tasty! The items listed on the Dollar menu are excellent! This McDonald's location deserves more than Just 5 stars! Highly recommended! 🌞

I'm giving this place 5 stars, because I'm comparing it to other McDonald's restaurants. Relative to other McDonald's restaurants this one is very clean, the staff are friendly and helpful and the washrooms are always clean and well stocked. Also the staff are very accommodating when you ask for something to be made in another way other than what is typically on the menu.  Both efficient and friendly.

My friends and I finished a movie. Before coming to this McDonald’s we confirmed the hours were open until midnight for both drive through and dine in. We walked out of our way to get there and when we arrived the doors were locked. We also tried to order curbside pick up but it said it was closed online as well. Overall disappointing and a horrible experience. Why do you have those hours posted if you aren’t going to commit to them? It seems like they not interested in satisfying their customers.

It was a random walk in and with a pleasant welcome. The aromas were enticing I couldn't help but stay. It was also very clean.
They don't serve alcohol, but it is BYOB. I enjoyed a Kola Champagne with my delicious Puerto Rican cuisine! I recommend a pop in on a rainy day!

I have been celebrating my birthday at CC since Charlie was the Owner! Even when coming home from Hawaii where I studied my Mom never ever skipped my bistec con tostones from my absolute favorite PR restaurant I absolutely love it!! The frituras are great, the music while dining in, the wait staff are all very sweet! I highly recommend CC for your next Puerto Rican meal lunch or dinner!! The only time I didn’t get my birthday meal from them was during Covid19 so for over 37 years I’ve been enjoying my birthday at Cafe Central!! ❤️🇵🇷🤍 I love you guys!!

Best Puertorican 🇵🇷 restaurant in Chicago, I love their "arroz con gandules " and barbecue rib tips 😋
"Café con leche" is the bomb 💣

Best Puerto Rican food around! Been coming here for over 15 years and it's still delicious! Have been bringing family here too and they love it! They are always super friendly and welcoming! Would recommend everyone to go there!!!

Man, they knocked it out of the ball park.  We had their jibaritos, one steak and one lechón.  Both were delicious and perfectly done.  Meat was juicy and the ingredients were on point.  The pique did not disappoint.  Had a side of arroz con gandules and a papa rellena and both were super delicious.  Will be coming back, because their service was also phenomenal.

Huge potions. Big menu. It will take time to read it and order. Best crab rangoon. Friendly staff. Street parking. Wheel chair entrance available. Perfect price for what you get. Very popular among students. Restrooms available. Best sizzling chicken.

Ordered Lo mein on a Sunday night extra spicy veggies only no meat. The dish virtually had no flavor was pretty dry so not nearly enough sauce. It wasn’t spicy AT ALL just had an extra amount of dried chili peppers. Would not recommend.

The food here is always fresh and tasty. Huge serving size so the price is worth it. However they have a horrible atmosphere, they are so stoic its borderline rude. Ive eaten in once at this location, now I get my food and go. Honestly they don't seem to like "other or different" people. Everyone had different experience so if you like their menu I would suggest at least one try. Or a different location.

Chinese fusion restaurant your wife would like to spend money for. Not just “no cooking time” but also “it’s quite good!” However, if you think about paying $60 for the food(picture attached), I would invest the same amount of money to an authentic steak house. (Oops!) Long story short, your wife will love the food so you will be anyway fine. Enjoy Joy Yee tonight, my friends.

This place might be an overrated restaurant that serves tapioca milk tea and too bad noodle soup. I think the problem is they have too many items on the menu. Why would I come to a Chinese place to get myself Pho, Ramen, or any Korean or Thai cuisine? They may have some excellent chefs who can cook everything here but believe me, no one makes sushi better than a Japanese sushi chef. Quality is always over quantity. First of all, the bubble milk tea was over average as the Oolong and the green tea they were using are high quality, I think. However, the tapioca pearl itself was disappointing as it is tough, and not sweet. The Matcha drink and Avocado Custard Pudding Freeze were tasteless and terrible, respectively. There must be some other places in Chicago serving better tapioca milk tea. Second of all, the cane shrimp turned out pretty delicious. It was not too sweet as I was worried but tasty. The food was served five to eight minutes after ordering. Third of all, the noodle soup here was horrible. I have always kept in mind that the Chinese have great noodle soup. Thus, we ordered Free Range Chicken Noodle and Fishball Egg Noodle Soup. The broth is literally, definitely poor, bland, or no taste at all. No savory, no salty, no sweet, nothing, plain just like the boiling water of everything existing in the bowl. I was sure that the egg noodle is the noodle that is made with egg and wheat, yet the one we got was confusingly white and clear just like the white rice noodle. The price I paid for two bowls of hot noodle boiling water plus a dish of sugar cane shrimp was $38, not reasonable whatsoever. Probably, the food was better in the past as many of its customers said, though, the food quality of this very moment is destitute.

Decided to stop by and give this spot a shot. Ordered the Chicago Style Bratwurst w/Pepsi. Around $8. Looks decent. Price a bit expensive for something quick and easy. Overall, I would recommend this spot for a quick bite.
They’re ok. $8.08 got me a small fry, Sierra Mist and hot dog. Better hot dog and fries down the street in my opinion. Nice outdoor seating

First off, I asked the guy if they made their beef in house and I knew by the way he answered me that it more than likely wasn't the truth, so I asked again and was told that they make their own beef.

So I figured I'd give it a try as I am a fan of one of Chicago's most sacred sandwiches and I am always looking for a good beef joint.

Anyway, after being ordered to wait outside and waiting way to long for our order, I got my combo, which consisted of a sausage and a quarter of a sausage🤔 that had a snap to it like a hot dog, and a sprinkle of beef bits🤮 and to top it off it was $14.42 with fries, No drink!

If that beef is in fact home made, I suggest a new recipe.

ABSOLUTELY THE WORST I EVER HAD!

Dude should've steered me toward a cheeseburger instead!
Burger was great, the beef was great. The onion rings......a little on the skimpy side. There were only 4 rings. However, they were pretty good and deliciously golden fried. Would try again.
Great family owned business very friendly staff and great food unfortunately didn’t get to try more because I stuff myself but next time will explore the menu more . 👍🏻

I like eating here it had been a while that I hadn’t stopped by but it’s always a good experience the tacos are very big you can make double out of them the guisados and guisados tacos are also very delicious! And they have great taste and service

Victor Bueno's restaurant has some delicious traditional Mexican food. On the weekends they have some delicious carnitas available for $15 for 1/4 tray and $25 for 1/2 tray filled with carnitas and rib meat ready for the asking. That also comes with a cup of beans, rice and salsa. They also have delicious guisados, Carne asada, chiles rellenos and chicharron available. While they no longer have dine in, they are still very busy doing take out. If you haven't been there yet it should be on your list.
Delicious! Rice and beans alone were amazing, tortillas were fresh with a great bite, and the meats had wonderful flavor.
As former owners of the best tacos in history, "La Unica" they have returned with a vengeance. Fantastic food as before. Try the carne guisado.
They're a very nice family. The service is great and food is amazing.  We've been eating their food since they opened in pilsen way back in the day on 22nd pl.

I ordered takeout sandwiches from here twice. It was always ready to go on time and the sandwiches are pretty delicious. Will definitely try their other dishes. Quick service during the lunch rush too!

It's your standard corner bakery. It's fast casual.

I went on a weekday afternoon about 12:30 and there was a pretty long line.  It did seem to move relatively quickly but I would recommend ordering early and you can just go straight to the front and grab your bag of food.  They close it with a sticker so others cannot tamper with it.
CB is a fav of mine. You can get better mac & cheese plus the salads and soups are terrific and available in large and small sizes. Service is fast and friendly.
Ordered the Berry & Almond overnight oats (which I have gotten more than 100 times) and this was the worst.  watery with no flavor. only good thing was the raisin bread.
Very quaint atmosphere. Employees are very amiable. The pesto was scrumptious and the Wonton salad was tasteful. Vegan and vegetarian options available, 10/10 would recommend.

Favorite place in the neighborhood for food. Authentic Italian with exciting twists. Love the idea of sharing plates so you can try multiple dishes with your friends. Cozy, romantic interior makes it a good place for dates. Their drink is list full of amazing Italian wines and fun cocktails featuring Italian cordials.
Great cocktail menu and great fresh made pasta. Service could be better in the dining area. They seem to forget about you consistently. Food makes up for the defects.
Great homemade pasta. Cool place, little cramped. Good cocktails

Amazing and inventive pasta dishes that will please any crowd (taking it from someone who refused to eat Italian out due to its lackluster and run of the mill qualities). Charred squid and meatballs are a must for appetizers and order a few pasta dishes tonshare for the table. Small craft beer offering and cocktail list. Cozy atmosphere and friendly staff.

I'm unsure as to why some people have given 1 or 2 stars. This place is AMAZING! Close your eyes and point to anything on the menu. You can't go wrong!! Someone gave them a bad review because they don't have high chairs for children. I can understand that, but this place ins't really for small children. It's an adult venue. I don't think they really don't cater to kids I've lived in the neighborhood for several years and only recently realized that it was a new restaurant/bar. I consider myself a "Chicago Foodie" and I've dined in the best restaurants in this city. The Charlatan is among the best that the city has to offer! Try it once... you'll be hooked!!

Chill atmosphere, low priced food/drinks, friendly staff and sports on TV.. classic tavern feel. Not blown away but the Cheeseborger (not a typo, that's how they spell it on the menu) and fries but it filled me up and can't complain for the price. I would go back before/after an event at United Center and would recommend for a quick bite, wouldn't go out of my way for the food.
side note- they let you dress your own burger with relish, pickles, onions, ketchup/mustard.

Lively place, plenty of parking.  5 min walk from the UC.  Burgers and fries are good.  Didn't try anything else.  Great pregame atmosphere and it's fun to take folks from out of town there.  Everyone gets a kick out of cheezeborger, cheezeborger, cheezeborger!!!

Typical bar, drinks are decently priced and very well mixed. Food is okay, that greasy bar food feel. Billy Goat is said to have one of the best burgers but I don’t really think so. The burger is plain. They do have a toppings bar Italian beef is good, got the combo.

Super yummy cheeseburgers, and inexpensive.  Right down the road from a concert/sports arena. Very pleasant atmosphere. Well, the food is inexpensive,  the drinks however would be what you'd expect in Chicago.  My one shot drink cost me $8, my yummy burger was under $5.

Food was good. Everything else was great until I went to the bathroom. They had just bleached the sink without letting the customers know and I leaned up against the sink and it bleached my black shirt. They were not willing to reimburse me for the shirt. All they did was offer me a Billy goat tshirt. Not even close to the $50.00 shirt I was wearing. Very disappointing. We will never go back again.
The food is always spectacular here. Love the new remodeled look. Best steak and lechon/pork Jibaritos in Midwest!

This place is the bomb…. I came in here never having tried Puerto Rican food but came in with high expectations seeing all the flags in the neighborhood. I got the Tripleta to sample all the meats and it was the right choice. The tostones are pressed flat and fried like chips which was great compared to slices I’ve had before. There was one guy running the show that I believe was the owner. He’s doing everything right, this has been my best meal yet in my weekend trying restaurants in Chicago.
The absolute best Puerto Rican in the area. Best jibarito and pastelillos I’ve ever had! Awesome customer service too - the owner is so sweet! Pic is of the knuckle sandwich. Outstanding.

Every time we come here it is even better than the last, the food is always fresh and delicious and everything from the sandwiches to the hebaros and the stews…..don’t forget the frituras neither they are all amazing, my fave are the relleno de papa(stuffed potato) and the steak pastelillo. Never a disappointment and always worth the wait or travel for this awesome food that they serve here and also the awesome and curtious staff who work hard everyday here to let us enjoy the food are also the best

This use to be in a huge bowl but I digress!!! IT IS STILL AMAZING THIS IS THE STEAK BOWL IF YOU DON'T KNOW I HATE VEGGIES BUT VEGGIES RICE AND MEAT WERE ALL AMAZING... THE  Empanadas steak and cheese OMG ( NO PICS SORRY) so get boss sauce and dip it in that OMG AMAZING BUT BEEN GOING HERE FOR ABOUT 7 YEARS SINCE I WAS WORKING OVER THERE... FYI SORRY BOUT THE CAPS 😂🤣 ENJOY

I moved into the neighborhood a few weeks ago and my wife and I tried El Valle within our first few days because our kitchen wasn't unpacked yet.  We went kind of late and the place was empty but the staff was happy to have us dine in. We tried two of the combo platters and while they were out of tamales they substituted it with an extra taco. The food was absolutely delicious, large portions, inexpensive and they had no corkage fee for the bottle of wine we brought.

Last night we thought we'd try it again, my wife got the same combo - with the tamale this time, which was amazing, served on a banana leaf in a slightly smokey tomatillo sauce.  The sope in her combo was also very good with a homemade tortilla.

I got a burrito norteño which was one of the best I've ever had! It had a great: spicy sauce over it with mushrooms and peppers and the chicken was perfectly cooked and flavorful. Topped off with avocado slices and creme, it was really delicious.

Also of note; both their refried beans and guacamole are homemade and particularly delicious.

We found out on this second trip that if you bring tequila and triple sec they will prepare margaritas! Definitely going to do that next time - and I am sure we will soon become regulars. Glad we live so close to such a great BYOB place!

This was my first time there, the first thing I thought when we walked in was how nice the decor was, then immediately the servers were so kind and nice.  I can not tell you when the last time I felt treated nicely at a restaurant. I will go back with out a doubt. Thanks for the great food and service!

amazing food and all Chang's Martial Arts staff recomend this place we love it
chilaquiles are my favorite

We came here for drinks on a Sunday and were pleasantly surprised that it was still busy and going. Their Christmas drinks were delicious, especially their hot chocolate. Rooftop seating is in high demand so probably good to reserve. I enjoyed the murals around the bar. Service is attentive and efficient. ~$15 for a cocktail.

It was pretty inconsistent.
Some pieces of the burnt ends were rock-hard; other pieces were soft and juicy. Wish the orders came with more sides than the mediocre coleslaw.
Prices seemed high but I suppose it's the standard for the area.

The loud music wasn't a huge issue if the bass wasn't blasting in my ears constantly.

But service was good, restaurant is clean.
Loaded nachos were a bust. Cheese was just shredded cheddar cheese not even melted barely . I added brisket and it was just a slab not even pulled throughout. Also no season or rub on the brisket .
The burnt ends are more like pork belly - odd but still delicious. We weren't too big of a fan of the wings. It was too sweet and did not taste smoked at all. The service was ok too.

I love that you can smell the food as you walk in! We sat on the second floor with great views of Wrigleyville. The food was good but the fries in particular had this seasoning on then that reminded me of BBQ chips and they were delicious 😋. Can't wait to come back and try more items on the menu!

The place is cozy and you’re seated quickly. The food comes outs fast and is delicious! The portions are massive! We got the platter for 2 people but couldn’t finish it. This is one of my favourite Ethiopian dinners! I would highly recommend this gem.

Yes! Yes! Yes! Some of the best Ethiopian food I've had. Chill atmosphere and good people too. I had the vegetarian sample platter (I'm not vegetarian) and I didn't miss the meat! All of it was so flavorful, well seasoned and just enough.

I worked in Ethiopia off and on for two years, and in between, I would bring people to Ethiopian Diamond to share the experience with friends in Chicago. The food here is great, the atmosphere is laid back, and the large dining room feels inviting to me. This visit we started off with a small coffee pot, which they served with small cups and some sugar. We ordered some sambusa savory pastries, two filled with meats and one with veggies and one with lentils as an appetizer. Then we had the meat sampler plate, which came with 3 meats and 3 vegetarian offerings in a platter of the injera bread, and a platter of four more rolled injera. There was some salad in the middle of the platter too. Everything tasted great, the service was quiet and prompt, with frequent water fills since we stayed a long time given they weren't busy. Overall, a great choice for Ethiopian dining.

incredible food, welcoming atmosphere!! I’m gluten free and didn’t have any issues finding dishes to eat on the menu. Great price for large portions and food that feels (and tastes) home cooked. Will definitely be back again!!

That’s nice!
Food for everyone
Veggie, seafood, chicken etc
“Bread” is delicious and honey wine 🤍
I can drink from alcohol just this taj
Something really different in Chicago
Dessert is also nice
Servers was great both times!
A great pub  for any occasion. Warm welcome, great staff, great food.  A Lovely outdoor space AS WELL..

We sat outdoors on a Friday evening (good choice as it was crowed inside).  Food was great, and beer selections are some of the most interesting - on tap!!!

I had the fish and chips.  Tasted great.  I would have liked a longer fish and mushy peas as the brits do (instead of whole peas), but understand its a German style joint.

Service was good and attentive.

Great local pub to have a beer and visit with friends. There was plenty of places to sit and the staff were very friendly. We ordered their warm goat cheese spread as well as some of their awesome spicy chicken wings. They had a huge selection of beers on tap, as well as a great menu of specialty drinks and other foods. Five stars.

really like this place! The shrimp tacos are my "go to" and have had them 3 times. Guess i should try something else at some point. Service is always good, my girlfriend usually orders salads and says they are delicious. Support your neighborhood bar, this place is great and sitting outside in the summer is always a good time.

Great selection of drinks and the food was fantastic, especially for the price! I fully lose track of time whenever I am sitting out on the patio with friends. It's a wonderful vibe and they're open late! Mac and cheese is AMAZING.

Ok I've been ordering from this place for years and I always love the food and sauce! So today I ordered chicken and cabbage and I was talking about how much I love the sauce and the cashier said oh uk we sell it by the bottle so I bought a bottle look at what I got ! An unselled Gatorade bottle of sauce who does this!!🤢🙄😔🤔😡

I’ve been ordering from the restaurant almost year now. It was always great and seasoned well. Today I couldn’t even eat the rice and beans it was mushy and had a weird taste almost tasted spoiled they definitely did something different.

I’m Upset as I paid $35 for my grub hub order and waited an hour for delivery. I couldn’t eat half the meal.

they are Ok with customer service.. they could be better, but no complaints. Their dinners is $2 more than what I'm used to paying and it only comes with one side. I got the curry goat with mac and cheese.. sometimes the meeting the sauce is semi salty. Not always just sometimes.. I like how the rice is not dry. I had a decent amount of meat and not as many bones as I had last time. I would go back again.

I really must say Samantha Jones is lying. She's a hater and a liar because if a roach was under her food before she start eating the roach would have lost at least his legs. How I see it she was eating as you'll can see then put the meal down in her messy place. She went back to eat it and saw the roach. Don't blame other's for your nastiness messy lady.  Jamaican Jerk Spice highly recommended by a lot of people.  The food is properly cook, great taste and authentic Jamaican flavor. So if you're looking someone to be in your category don't mess.

I spent close to $15 for a 5 piece catfish only... get to my car open the box only to see 4 and a half pieces.  Now mind you i have stated this to them before about prior orders that were the same way, I have been a customer of theirs for close to 10yrs.  I let the cashier know she takes my order to the cook.  That person says that that is 5 pieces if I didn't want it I can get a refund.  No worries,  you just lost one.  PSA: GO TO "Just Jerk" 79th st.👍🏽

Also they have old meat mixed in with fresh meat 🙄
Me and my family members loved our drinks and our donuts. Everything was fresh and delicious. Will be bringing my family back here. Ps. We all had a Cappuccino Blast, two regular and two OREO.

Good customer service
The problem is if i pay close to $4.00 for a xl coffee I expect it to be full, not halfway filled. And 2nd i don't want to see coffee beans at the bottom of my coffee.
Sign says open but its actually close. 9;30 pm. It says drive thru ppen they only take orders when they feel like it

Today I had a terrible experience! I usually receive good customer service and polite encounters. Today was the exception, because the cashier was having a bad day. Once I paid my order the cashier closed the window. Since it was a drive-through Usually its fast but aleast say thank you and have nice day. The cashier literally closed the window and started to talk to another employee. He pointed and looked at me. I then gesture to see if there was something wrong because I thought they might if given me the wrong order. She opened the window and very aggressively asked what I wanted! I got upset and asked for her name and also her supervisor. She refused to both of my requests and didn't comply with her job. She didn't offer a lead or anyone else. She gave me 2 bogus names and closed her little window again. She needs better customer service training or not work with the public.
Only stopped here cause my daughter is expecting & needed a Sweet Flavored Coffee . Sweets are NOT my cup of tea .

This breakfast diner was beyond exceptional. No amount of stars can express how much I enjoyed my experience here. First of all, Patty, whom I thought was the owner based on her being so welcoming and friendly, made my experience even more memorable! The food and coffee was fantastic! The prices are unbeatable! The atmosphere was cozy and interesting as well (it has numerous vintage photographs on the walls). Chicago was my first stop on a two week trip and it was my first time being in Illinois. As someone that didn’t know the area, I simply looked up breakfast places after waking up from my one night stay and winged it. Exceeded my expectations. I even wished I had cash on me because everyone that works there deserves a tip! I will be back whenever I get the chance to be in Chicago again. Thanks, Johnnie’s!

Sometimes you simply want a great omlette, skillet, or classic breakfast. This place is around the corner from the "hip and new" places on Randolph st. but will have no line, lovely service, and a homey diner atmosphere.

If you are in the mood for a classic breakfast fresh made however you like, go to Johnnies Snack Shop.

I came in around 7:25 and was seated for breakfast. It has a great location and reasonable prices. The food was very tasty and I see why it was recommended by a friend. However, I did not receive my food until 30 minutes later. There were only 6 tables currently eating. The server was very friendly, so it is not her fault. I noticed other tables were waiting very long for food, as well. I am thankful I did not have anywhere to be right after eating. That being said, the food was very delicious and the fruit was fresh. I will be back when I am not in a rush, or may call ahead.
Fantastic!!  Old time place , adorned with local photos.  Great ambiance. Phenomenal , friendly service, excellently prepared breakfast and very reasonably priced.   Highly recommended.

Food is decent, we had scrambled eggs and a Denver omelette that came out just a tad overdone. Be prepared for long wait times for not just receiving your order but for simply being acknowledged. We walked in around noon on a Sat and were told to take whichever table we wanted. We then sat there for at least 15 minutes before one of the two servers finally gave us menus and water. You could tell they were hustling due to being understaffed but still felt weird we never got a “be right with you.” The servers had time to bus a handful of tables, refill other guests’ coffees, and returned at least a dozen menus before we were acknowledged. No apology or comment about the wait either. Wasn’t just us, at least two other groups sat down, waited, and finally gave up and left during the time we were there. Someone finally went to place a takeout order instead while the server warned, “Its not going to be any shorter of a wait, honey.” We had put an hour and a half on the parking meter and ended up needing to add another half hour by the time our food finally came out. Again you could tell they were hustling but it felt strange given the brunch rush was mostly over and the place is not that big to begin with. Just a friendly fyi, it’s solid diner food but be prepared to wait for seemingly no reason.

Did the restaurant week omakase and they did not disappoint. The fish used were so fresh and high quality. Some of them literally melted in my mouth. I enjoyed the fun combination of flavors used and the chef was very helpful,  accommodating, and chill. One thing that I wish was different is how often our server kept talking/interrupting us. Otherwise, I would go again for sure.

We visited Amari over the weekend. Upon arrival they checked our vaccination cards which we appreciated. We were a party of 5 and we decided to try the Omakase 2. My husband explicitly spoke to the server regarding his gluten allergy. He also explained to the server that he is okay with soy sauce, since there are only trace amounts of gluten (tens of thousands of times less than in something like bread).
We all enjoyed our 3 courses full of flavor. However the last course was a dessert full of gluten that the server gave to my husband completely disregarding his gluten allergy. After having a few bites, my husband noticed that in the dessert there was cake inside and asked the server if this contains gluten. The server confirmed it and walked away without apologizing. An hour or two later my husband was not feeling well.
Overall, flavor of the food was great but the service was disappointing.

Such a wonderful meal!! My husband and I got the chicken karaage to start, enjoyed a bottle of sake, then we did the 10-piece omakase. Loved the creative spin on some of the nigiri. Many of the flavors blended so well together, but nothing overpowered the fish, which was great. Some of the freshest fish I’ve ever had. Service was amazing as well.

Absolutely delicious! It was certainly worth the trip.  My far the best sushi I have had in a very, very long time.  The staff were all quite nice and knowledge.  I can not wait to come back!! Everything was so good especially the otoro!

- Visit 1 -
The sushi tastes incredibly fresh and the chefs know how to pair all different kinds of flavors in one roll. Definitely expect to leave impressed.

Ordered + would recommend:
- Zuke maguro kani
- Kani motoyaki
- Ebi Tempura 2x
- Zuke sake nigiri
- mochi flight
- edamame

- Visit 2-
Got omakase. Ismael - the chef - is truly an artist with his presentation of food and the combination of flavors he creates. It was an incredible omakase experience - highly recommend!

Hidden gem, must be protected At All Costs. The only downside is that neither the online photos of the menu, nor the menus in the restaurant are the correct prices. (You WILL be told the correct price over the phone though.) That aside, the food is EXCELLENT, made reasonably fast, and you get plenty for the price you actually pay. Can't wait to eat there again.

I found a very disturbing piece of metal in my sons orange chicken. I always examine his food prior to him eating it and I found a shiny piece of what looked like a paper sticking out of the chicken, as I pulled it out I come to find out it was a hard piece of metal . My food was great, but his made me just want to puke mine up. What i’m more worried about is how can that happen.

The man was not too friendly. He seemed asked for my ID when I paid , which was totally fine. When I said the order was FOR HERE he told me it is completely different service for here orders and I should have it to go.

Good evening to all, I ordered for my 2 co-workers and I and it was delicious, hot, came at a reasonable time, and we all ate well for under $40.  The deliver guy called 2 minutes before pulling up outside and was polite, also  gave me extra menus.  I highly recommend the general tso, and Singapore noodles extra hot.  I especially liked that they didn't cheat by using red chili flakes to make it spicey.
Thanks for the meal.
I would like to give 4.5 stars but not sure how.

I live nearby, and have ordered takeout several times. The food is decent for its price, and in hefty amounts. Their dishes aren't in large varieties; many of the entries are just varying stir-fry mixes of the same veggies and sauces, with different meats. The fruit smoothies are also a satisfying treat. There's only one-two people working both the desk and kitchen at a time, which means you're in for a longer wait, especially if the restaurant has a few other diners.

Huge Top Chef fan and had  to support the first female winner's spot.  We talked about the brunch we had here the ENTIRE trip. The flavor combinations are like nothing you have ever thought of. Such good food, love the vibe and we had excellent service. Love a good photo booth moment too. Was too full to try the bakery items but they looked wonderful. Have brunch here, you will not regret it. Start with the crab dip!

Ate here at least 2 times within my 3-day visit (3 times if you count breakfast to lunch {yes, we stayed that long}). The breakfast is a must. There are a lot of competitive locations in the area, but the Little Goat Diner is a must. The interior is very open and has sort of an old school diner feel. The “little Goat” concept really works for them, and the staff is welcoming. The titles for their dishes are fun, order anything form the menu, you will not be disappointed. Each visit we had we requested the waitress’s recommendations, and everything was on point. Please review some of the attached photos.

If you like the combo of savory and sweet in the same dish, this place is for you. We tried the "piggy went to China" and the bull's eye, both were tasty but on the weird side... The flavor combo is definitely a unique one. We ended the meal with the brown butter blueberries cupcake and a crunchy brownie. The cupcake was great but the brownie was a miss, and the toppings fell short. The staff were so fantastic! Interesting place for a bite.

WOW!! Literally the best brunch I’ve ever had. I’ve been to a ton of breakfast/brunch places all over the world and when I say this is the best, I mean it! We went here a few weeks ago and I can’t stop talking about it. I asked our server what he recommended and I did exactly what he said and I was so thrilled with what I got!
