I was a little annoyed that the kiosk didn’t give me the discount for multiple breakfast sandwiches so I ordered from the cashier. Instead of being two for $4 they were buy one for $4 and get a second for $1.

Hot and fresh which was slightly surprising but I won’t complain. I do wish everyone would get on board about the sauces. One day they are free the next day .28cents like keep it one way and run with it so that your customers know what to expect because it’s annoying to have to swipe my card or go digging in the car for a 28 cents🙄. Keep up the good work.

Throughout times in the past I remember being with my ex girlfriend in this location my head was wild too fast without a mind. Although I'm grateful for the man I've become today throughout all the pain. It has made me stronger
My head feels more clear and forward.
Place requires a security guard, locked bathrooms without a purchase enforced by security, no drink refills, none of the staff are friendly when approached, tables are filthy.
i ordered a Carmel iced coffee with three creams & three sugars. my drink was grainy when i tasted it because they did not mix the sugar… terrible service.
This is the cream cheese bagel I ordered, I'm in shock

I placed my order at 7:25 am. The register was off line so that was a 10min wait to pay. I order a larger caramel hot latte with an extra shot of expresso. I get to work. I have a regular latte no extra shot or caramel. I tried calling them 5times. No answer and voicemail filled, so I can’t leave a message. I took my drink back when I was able to get a break from work. The manager witnessed her worker be very rude to me and tell me “take the lid off my cup so she can pump the caramel in there since I came back 2hours later”. She went back and forward with me because I wanted a fresh latte made the way I paid for it earlier. I have never been so disappointed with the service I’m paying for. The manager also took attitude with me because she couldn’t control her out of order staff. I will be reporting my experience to corporate. My money matters to me.
Hour of operation not up to date on the door nor online. I work every weekend and when I come in around 2, they’re closed

First off, there was only one cashier servicing an ever growing line of customers, so by the time the young woman took my simple order (everything bagel with veggie cream cheese toasted twice). I had to wait another three minutes only to get my order. Upon arrival at work, I quickly discovered that my bagel wasn't toasted at all, so I had to take it back. Not a happy camper at all.

Should have read the reviews saying the chicken is good EXCEPT for the chicken sandwich which I got and almost got sick.
But the one star review is for them letting a homeless person come in and shake me down for food.
That should fly IN THE RESTAURANT. They want to ask me for food or cash outside that's fine but don't let them block the entrance and demand food

I visited this location Monday.   The food was excellent. The chicken was beautiful,  fresh and delicious 😋.   Well, I wish this was the end of my story.  I returned Tuesday expecting another wonderful meal.  Omg, I couldn't belive this was the same restaurant.   I had to check the sign on the door to be sure I was in the right place.   The food was poorly prepared and the size and look of the chicken was atrocious.  Then I remethat Tuesday's are their special day.  If thus is the reason for bad service and food we will gladly forgo the cheap chicken Tuesday.
Best spicy chicken tenders to date. We were in Chicago and just wanted some chicken. As I was eating I realized I was NOT getting spicy chicken I should be getting in my home state. Great job!
Southern crispy fried chicken with a spicy option, jalapeños, tasty mashed potatoes and gravy, cole slaw, tasty mini fried shrimp to go. Always efficient and fast.

Highly priced fast food place - based on what I ate here. I mean I know this is just another fast food place and I’m not supposed to expect healthy etc stuff but it could be a bit tastier for what I paid I think. The mashed potato was good. The chicken was a bit too dry. Wish it was a lil juicier. The place was alright to be a fast food place. KFC is cheaper and in my opinion - way better because It’s juicy atleast.

Absolutely the place you should go to if you like old-fashioned, home-style, and just straight up good eating. You will enjoy comfort food without feeling bloated and sick — which is sadly what happens so often in America. But not here! My partner is Czech, and she said the food is just like food her mother would make her. In fact, the website homepage says it’s just like grandma would make — and they’re right! Please support local businesses like these. They’re so important, and they deserve our business.

I really enjoyed this place. It was a completely serendipitous that I ended up here and I am very glad we did. The original byo that we planned on going to was closed. Planned on going to a different place nearby but saw this place and decided to try it. Glad we did. The food was fantastic and all homemade. Not byo, but corkage was fair. Tried a variety of dishes including many staples. All of them were excellent. Definitely try this place.

Just touched down in the Chi and this gem was our 1st stop. Wife being from Poland she wanted a taste of home as soon as we landed. Everything was delicious and we got the personal treatment. Food is a little pricey, (in our opinion) but the food left us very satisfied.
My first time here. Potato pancakes and meatballs in dill  sauce... The side of beets were also @! ~ Delicious!

My family just went to Smakosz for my birthday. The food was outstanding!!!! You can tell it was made with love and everything was so fresh! We each had 2 dishes plus dessert and wanted to lick our plates! We will definitely be coming back! So happy to have stumbled upon this gem!

This is a great place to go if you are looking for a quick donut or coffee, the staff are extremely friendly every time I step in here I feel so welcomed you can be free to ask questions and they will help you out with what ever you need any new coffee or new items in the shop they will be sure to tell you about it because that is just how good this place is, I do not understand why there are some negative reviews because this place to me is like a coffee paradise. Also feel free to stop by here more because they will remember you and grow a little coffee bond. The workers in this place is like a little family I can tell that they have a good connection with one another because of how perfect they can work together. Also the hash-browns here are really good here so make sure you try those and also make sure you try the blue raspberry coolatta that is to die for. So overall this place is to die for it is such a nice little humble store, so what are you still doing reading this go over there and check this great place out.
There's typically only one person working here, and they do a great job! Online order is always ready on time.
Great location! Placed my order on the app and it was ready when I got to the counter. Thanks for the speedy service and coffee
Changed after summer. They close pre-order window so you need to line with others even order via app.
Nice coffee ☕️❤️

Mexican food served in nice surroundings with pleasant service. The food is freshly prepared and very tasty too. And they have specials on drinks on certain days so you can have a margarita with your breakfast.

The food and drinks here were great! Good portions and great taste. The only downside was that service was very slow. We went after a festival so a bit of a delay was understandable, but we ended up taking most of our food to go after waiting for so long. That being said, I'd love to go back and give it another shot on a normal day, since that was the only negative I experienced.
🦞 Absolutely wonderful … Authentic environment and great food.

This is by far THE BEST Cocula! I've been going there since I was about 4 years old and the food is great every time. I'm allergic to radishes and they are very careful not to prepare them around my food.... I've never had an allergic reaction there.
Place was clean and quiet. Gave you decent amount of food. We were there for brunch,  liked that they serve breakfast all day. Waitress was nice and Friendly.

Never been to this Bar Louie Location before tonight but it's pretty cool with outside patio & some seating for upstairs. Food came out nice n hot & drinks were good but service from server was kindve poor. Moved from a table to the bar for better service & it wasn't even crowded. Came here on a Monday night for my girlfriend Birthday.

Came in with a buddy and sat at the bar. Bartender is a super nice guy let me say that first but, he forgot my buddies water 3 separate times and then we got chicken wings and they cane out rather pink just kinda disappointed with the overall experience. Also no prices on drinks makes literally no sense tell me how much I'm paying I shouldn't have to ask.

First time patron.

PROS: Beautiful architecture and excellent customer service! Loved the vibe of the place and quick turnaround of the food order. Also, the food was VERY good!

CONS: I paid extra for loaded fries, but there was no Applewood smoked bacon or scallions!?! At least that's how the menu describes loaded fries/tots. This weighs heavily because I was told Bar Louie rocks their loaded fries and I walked there specifically for those loaded fries. LOL. It [the menu] also shows three plump pickles that come with burgers, and I got 1.5 lol.

Giving 2 stars now and will update this review when I try them again because I'm definitely coming back.

Nice bar with a good atmosphere. Lots is sports playing. Basketball. American football and golf. The beer was decent. The staff was friendly. I had beef sliders with tater tots which were really good. Caught a girl having a cheeky chunder in the boys toilets hahaha
Great place for drinks! Great customer service. Drinks were delicious and well prepared.

Small family run place. I usually do delivery. Love their spicy wings and some of their noodles, chef specials, most everything I have had has been really tasty and delivery is on time and food is hot. If you pick up food is ready in not time, depending on how busy they are.

First time trying this place out. I read all reviews before going, which some are Pretty bad but decided to give it a try.

Food tasted good, and also a pretty nice amount for the price I paid which was a lunch special. The only thing was that when I got there the place looks kind of bad from the outside and the inside is a little dirty looking 😕😕😕 soooo that was upsetting lol it’s always nice to pick up your food when you get there and the restaurant is looking nice and clean.

Never had a problem ordering for delivery until today. Always got delivery and the gentlemen tells me over the phone that my location is too far when it’s 10 min away. He was super rude about it and just hung up on me. Lost a very loyal customer due to this.
We have been getting takeout from Wing Wah Lau for decades, and the food has always been dependably good.  I tried something new tonight—the spicy Korean chicken—and may have found my new favorite!

In times where I crave some orange chicken, crab rangoons, fried rice, etc. they always have good food in their menu. I have been a regular here for years now, with delivery making it easier to order as well.

I came here for a quick bite as I was about to explore the UChicago campus. The store was mostly empty when I arrived. I got a Buffalo chicken calzone and a green protein salad with honey dijon dressing. Even though I appeared to be the only one to order, it still took 15-20 mins for my order to arrive. This is likely because they were cooking my calzone. It was nice however that when it arrived, it was served to my table. The calzone was a good portion size and looked fresh. The bread had a nice exterior crunch with a soft interior. The filling inside was really hot and definitely would require some time to cool off. The flavor was alright. The cheese had a nice melt and the meat was soft. The buffalo flavoring was good as well, not too spicy, but my main problem was with how hot it was, making it difficult to fully enjoy. Otherwise it was a delicious and filling calzone. The ranch dressing they provided worked as a nice condiment for the calzone. The salad was plentiful and fresh. The honey dijon dressing also had a nice taste. The salad came with a side of bread (the same used in the calzone). It was warm and tasted great as well.

Overall, it was a good experience and value. For $10, the calzone felt worth it. The restaurant was clean and ambient. The cashier who assisted me was also very nice and courteous. She even gave me a student discount that I didn't even know I had! My only complaints would be the somewhat long wait time, even when it was mostly empty, and the hotness of the calzone on the inside. Finally, I wish they provided some more durable utensils; the plastic fork and knife were way too flimsy to cut up my calzone. I ended up eating it with my hands like a burrito. Otherwise a good place to get some grub.

Great pockets! The full pocket is big. Enough to feed two average people. It's healthy. Service is great! Pizza is good too but I would definitely recommend a pocket. It was about 15 minutes for pocket and pizza.

This is a delicious and healthy restaurant place that has become a go to at least once a week. They offer delivery and also dining service that’s very quick. The food is always delicious and I haven’t tried anything that I wouldn’t recommend to someone else. The frozen yogurt is fantastic and always tempting.
chicken chili was good. initially thought the bowl was small for $5.5, but plenty adequate. not busy at lunch time service. Server touted' cleanest joint on 53rd'  - interesting! they did their job.

This place used to be awesome. It used to be one of the few places that stayed open until 10 (although you had to order the calzones before 9:30). But now they close at 8 or 9 depending on the day, and lately they seem to be closed on Sundays. They also have been getting my order wrong a lot lately. Almost everytime I order a salad, they make me a pocket instead, even if I fill out the sheet and clearly check the "Salad" box. The food quality is still good, but the new hours and low order efficiency have really taken a hit.

Wow! Delicious seafood! Delivered to the table hot, fresh from the stove/ oven.  I had the stuffed pineapple with a side salad, french fries, rice and a piece of warm bread. I didn’t think about what the pineapple 🍍 would be stuffed with and I'm a picky eater. It was stuffed with shrimp, other seafood, red & green peppers, onion mushrooms 🍄 in a creamy cheese 🧀 sauce.
Food was a lot better few years ago less flavor but great customer service a Little price

Superb Delicious not expensive. I eaten a lot of Nayarit seafood style but this place stands out. Solid big portions incredible flavor and perfect size prawns garlic. Place is clean, big, well safety and excellent social distances. I really felt safety to eat there.
Really great food, great atmosphere, and great service! A bit on the expensive side but I highly recommend!!!
Very good food, their tamarindo margaritas are amazing and so are their cantaritos , ver great and attentive service !

Love tofu appetizer. Just amazing! Lamb chop is the best I've tried so far. mushroom is also good but a bit pricy. Also tried beef tongue and chicken gizzard. Great food! Waiters are very nice and serve the food quickly. I walked in the restaurant around 5:45pm so there are not many people.

I like this place. The food is very simple, yet good and healthy. We tried most of the menu while there. The beef is great, the chicken gizzards were very good and the asparagus was a success too. It's a Japanese place, so they have good fish too. It's a good idea to start with the fish, then move on to chicken and then pork if there is room left. Enjoy it with some flavorful sake.
The staff was nice and communicative. The ambiance is more austere, but it creates the image of a typical Japanese place.
This is quite a pricy place, it's not a place I would go on a regular basis to, but it's worthwhile every now and then.

I was taken here for my birthday, and fell in love with the small spot. The food was outstanding, and care in each item was taken to ensure that the simple preparations were full of flavor. We sat at the bar, and the chef did a great job of explaining each dish and its significance. We were also tempted to try the more obscure ingredients, and so glad we did. Everything was perfect, and the sake rounded out a great night.

Best Robata in Chicago. All the proteins are perfectly done. The Gobou with fried ginger is well flavored with layered texture. The liver pate has a wonderful creamy texture with hint of bone marrow, but a little bit salty for me. Dessert is really disappointing, and the cold brewed tea has a strong fridge taste totally covered tea aroma.

Best robata in Chicago, great sake selection and wonderful and tasty selection of appetizers. I love the outdoor area in the summer and there a cool bar downstairs. The owners have obsessed over the details, including making sure the right kind of wood is firing the grill.

Pretty disappointing for a lot of reasons. First off, the floor was covered in water as there seemed to be some sort of leak. As someone prone to falls, that’s something to at least stay on top of and mop up or at least have a warning sign. I could tell the server was super stressed because he was kind of talking to multiple tables at once and instructing another server. That’s understandable, but the service was slow overall. When it came to the food, we had to add salt to everything because it had virtually no flavor. We tried the kadai chicken and chilli ghobi, and thought they weren’t terrible, they certainly weren’t worth the prices at this restaurant. This may have just been an off day, but it’s not somewhere I’d return based on this experience.

Loved the murgh makhini.The service was slow, but the food was delicious so I cannot complain. The owner was very generous and gave me a complementary Gajar ka Halwa.I am planning to go there more often.
I really enjoyed Hema’s breakfast. I cannot have enough the Masala Dosa, Idly and Vada. A good starting points for authentic South Indian food. Will come back soon.

our food took 2 hours to get out. the food was good and very hot, but this was a terrible experience for us. we kept watching people who ordered takeout get their order within 5 minutes and sat baffled as to why it would take so long.

The food is absolutely delicious. By far one of the best Indian restaurants I’ve been to. This is a family owned business and you can definitely feel the hospitality, their service is impeccable. I am definitely going to be a regular at this place!
Comely pizza by the slice inside the dining area of the navy pier in Chicago. Lovely slice of cheese pizza if you need a bite grab this pie!

If your going to sell precooked pizza make sure you leave it in the oven til the cheese melts and the germs cooked off that been floating over the pizzas that's just sitting there. Never again eating here and Lil Caesar's Hot And Ready is better. What a bad look for me since I was visiting family for the weekend.

Agree with the others who say this is the worst Pizza they've ever had. Came in on a business trip and visited Navy Pier. Frankie's was one of the only places open locally (was around 8PM) and figured that Chicago was famous for pizza, so why not try it? The pizza tasted as if the dough was made with chlorine-rich tap water, and the rest of it was just so underwhelming and forgettable. I had low expectations going in, but somehow the bar was lowered by this place. Save some regret, money and calories and find someplace else to get your pizza (or any meal) fix.

Portions were very generous. It cost about $25 for two people as shown in the picture. I am not sure if the amount of fries was more generous than normal but I was very happy. The pizza was pretty good and comparable to many similar large slice places like this. Cheese fries were great as well. The wait time didn't seem to take very long but it was not very busy at the time.

Only went here because the wait at other places was 2 hours- and it was fast at least!... The pizza, however, was quite possibly the worst that I have ever tasted. It was barely room temperature and had no flavor. The pizzas looked (and tasted) like they had been setting out on the counter for hours, and even though the worker popped it back into the oven before serving it, it was still cold. I ended up paying over $16 for a single slice of pepperoni pizza, side of plain fries, and a drink. They also automatically add a 3% processing fee without telling you on every order. The only reason it gets two stars is because the strawberry lemonade was delicious (not cold though).

Everywhere I go these days, I always have to have an espresso martini. Gemini is up there as one of the city's best, in my opinion. The food and ambiance is also top notch. Our server was charming and made great food/drink recommendations. Such a great space!

Had such an AMAZING experience at Gemini! We were visiting Chicago just for the weekend and before visiting we watched a YouTube travel guide on restaurants to try and this place was recommended as one. Just from the video the food looked amazing, so we decided to give it a try. We originally had plans to go to Geminis for lunch at 12pm on a Saturday but didn't realize lunch started at 2pm, so we tried making dinner reservations instead, but we were told they were fully booked but if we tried arriving around 5:30-6pm we may be able to catch seats at the bar since they are full service at the bar as well. We figured we would give it a try and when we arrived, we were able to get two seats at the bar. The atmosphere was amazing, and the staff was super nice. I ordered the Squirtsky draft cocktail, which was delicious, and for an appetizer we ordered the warm parker house rolls which was SO GOOD! For dinner we both ordered the Maple Glazed Salmon with the truffle-parmesan fries and roasted cauliflower, and everything tasted AMAZING! Next time we visit Chicago we are for sure going back to Geminis!
Fantastic tasting burger and truffle fries! The best way to start my Saturday was a trip to this sweet restaurant. Will be back again! Warm and friendly staff and open & stylish atmosphere!

Overall, had a good experience here. The seating is kind of cramped which means the ambiance gets very loud. Drink menu has some decent cocktails but not many options, and nothing unique. The food was alright but the prices are high enough that I expect more.

Food 8/10 ( had some crunchy sandy particles in a roasted cauliflower, beside that - delish)
Cleanliness 10/10
Service 7/10
A bit on a slow side, however suggestions were made after my request. Drinks  were refilled on time
The best dim sum dumplings in Chinatown! Superior quality and price. Cozy dining atmosphere with multiple different vendors. But this lady’s got them all beat.

Decent food at affordable prices. Duck was decent. Dim sum was good. There’s a self ordering machine which is helpful for English speakers. ordering is done at the counter. I would not wholly trust the food quality, but it’s quick affordable food that I wouldn’t mind ordering occasional take out or dining in.

My usual $25 order: (1) 2 Sweet Tofu with extra sugar 😘, (2) $12/lb of fattier BBQ Pork, (3) ALL remaining BBQ Chicken Liver.

SWEET TOFU is hard to find in restaurants.  I was recommended here by restaurant staff.  Quality comes and goes, but good enough to satisfy craving.

❤️❤️ the fattier BBQ Pork option ($9 vs $12) is less red, and taste similar to the "sio ba" I grew up in the Philippines. Marbling could be better.  I don't think the Other place has an option, and it was too dry.

Woo hoo!  BBQ CHICKEN LIVER availability.  The other place is always sold out by morning.

BBQ wise, I think GOURMET FOOD has better temperature and time as it's less dry, with no hard edges.  Should you want hard edges, you can easily broil it at home.

As for prepared dishes, you are on your own. 😐 I don't think I will be ordering here anytime soon as there is no seating area.

I used love their food a lot. Today ordered silky tofu soup. It looks like has been left over couple days, and it tastes very weird compare to before. You can tell from picture, the tofu is very loose and not fresh made at all.
I ordered from the non-contact instrument, waited a long time and been told two of my items been sold out, and they can’t not make the refund, only exchange. I got other cheaper  items instead, and been told there’s an extra change for customer if I ordered on the non-contact instrument… Not happy at all about this experience, and I’ll never go back again.

Good authentic home style Chinese cooking.
Good consistent food & very reasonably priced.
A lot of Asians order & pick up from this place, so you know it has to be decent. A lot of repeat customers.

This location is really clean and nice! The person who helped me was nice and efficient. Unfortunately I can tell she is stressed out. She was the only one working on a Saturday morning. I completely understand staff shortages but where is the manager? I was a manager at a restaurant and we were trained to be there for our employees and make sure we didn’t get backed up. It’s extremely disheartening to see a hard working employee by themself with a line to the door. You are doing a great job! But the GM needs to step up.

The worst customer service ever!
First they have no customer skills whatsoever.
Both Indian workers bullying the new girl, making her do all the drinks.
They are slow AF, I waited 20+ min for my order to be completed.
This is the thing if you see a customer waiting isn’t common sense to ask if something is missing.
They never say hello good morning. Or May I help you!.
This issue is being going on for years. Doesn’t really matter if they change personal.
Which make me think 🤔 about the owner who gives a F…k about his business.
Employees here are unhappy and overworked
But that’s not an excuse to be rude.

The woman who always works at night is very kind and works hard. However, it's best not to do a mobile order, as they don't make them until all of the orders placed in person are done. This means that if you arrive 5 to 10 minutes after placing the order and there is a line, you will still have to wait until everyone in line has ordered and their coffee has been made before they will start yours. This has been my experience at least 8 to 10 times.

Very bad location I arrived to pick up my order and the lady treated me badly the lady should not work in that place I should definitely be out of that store it gives a bad impression And I don’t understand the way she speaks

Unprofessional and rude service. The girl was was talking on the phone while taking my order and giving me attitude as if I had interrupted her conversation. Disgusting inside. People give it 5 stars but it looked nasty inside.

We went to celebrate a birthday and had an awesome time. All of the food was delicious and with the prefix menu, it was easy to make selections for a great experience. We started with the crab and cucumber salad and the lobster tail salad. Both were great! We then had the Cajun quail and salt and pepper calamari for our appetizers, and the kitchen provided us a tuna tartare on the house. The salt and pepper calamari had great bold flavors and was a cool new riff on fried calamari. The tuna tartare was my favorite dish of the night - I was so glad that they surprised us with that. The fish was clearly a high quality and very fresh. For our entrees, we ordered the shrimp and the rack of lamb with a side of a veggie fried rice for the table. The rack of lamb was cooked perfectly and was incredibly moist. The shrimp was our favorite of this course; the veggies that accompanied it brought a great freshness and snap. We ended the night with the chocolate brownie and the lemon cheesecake. I had the lemon cheesecake and it was absolutely delicious. It was the perfect note to end on.

We had a great time and can’t wait to go back again. Service was incredible and the vibes in the restaurant were very cool and comfortable.
Great food, great service. We had the lobster fried rice, shrimp salad, walnut shrimp, dumplings, pork chop and strip steak. Everything was delicious. Great flavors

The food here is outstanding! The Mongolian beef was tender in a delicious and savory sauce. The dumplings were fresh and tasty. The calamari was fantastic! The four course menu is highly recommended. Can't wait to come back!
The place is impecable and the food is beyond delicious. You really get your moneys worth. Plus the staff was super nice and attentive. Definetly coming for the four course meal next time

Didn't even know this place existed but my is it my new dine-in go to! They have carry out as well. Don't pass it up when you're walking by, it's easy to do. When you first walk in, it's a little understated and I was thinking it wasn't going to live up to the hype. The menu is pretty simple and I opted for the pre-fixe, which has dozens of options and isn't limited at all. Started with the arugula salad with goat cheese, then the salt & pepper calamari, the salmon, and then cheesecake. Honey, all of these were amazing! The portion sizes are perfect for a four-course meal. I wanted to drink the sauce the salmon came in. Oh, we also ordered the lobster fried rice and baby, it was light and delicious. Every single morsel got ate! It's a new fave for me. The drinks were good, too.
Food was good they jus forgot to put my fries with it but the wings and philly cheesesteak sandwiches was so good.

Good bar.  Service was good.  I sat at the bar.  Talkative and friendly bar tenders.  A fun place to watch the Bears game....even though the Bears got killed! :(.  Drinks are standard.  I had a beer and a Bloody Mary.  Their Bloody Mary is OK...nothing to rave about.  I ordered a Salmon Caesar Salad with anchovies.  Solid dish on their part.  I've had bad versions of these salads...this was not one of them.  Lettuce was crisp, anchovies were good, and salmon was cooked well (I like mine medium rareish).  Overall a good place to visit if you're at McCormick Place for a convention and want to catch a sports game.

Terrible dinning experience on multiple occasions.
The food is mediocre at best, and over priced as you would expect for a conference center restaurant.
As someone who attends multiple conferences annually at McCormick, I would highly recommend you avoid this place at all costs.
The last time I dined there with my wife and a few friends, the waitress not only got the order wrong three times, she never came back to the table to check on us or the quality of the food.
The second time she got the order incorrect, my wife had to walk the floor to find her.
Considering the awful experience, we left zero tip.
This is the best part. Upon a submitting the credit card receipt for expense reimbursement we discovered that the waitress had added a "2" to the zero tip to try and steal $20 from us.
Needless to say this behavior is completely unacceptable. Not only do they employ incompetent wait staff, the evidently also hire thieves.

ZERO STARS ---- AVOID THIS PLACE!!!!
The appetizers are so tasty here that my family always orders a bunch of them and shares. The atmosphere and design of the bar is also very upscale and an awesome experience.
The food there is ok, but they don't have a lot of options on the menu. Pizza is good but kind of weird, sends like they use sliced tomatoes instead of sauce.

Terrible service. Overwhelmed. Management incapable of scheduling apparently. Bartender would not serve me since I already had a table...  Just pure lost opportunity.  This just in...  30 minutes to get a beer...

Chicago Q is a worthy spot in downtown Chicago.  Everyone enjoyed their food. The Mac & Cheese is  rich! The ribs are perfectly cooked…the meat falls off the bone! The shrimp & grits are good but needs the smokiness of the Andouille sausage, which is not present. Great atmosphere and bigger than meets the eye. I enjoy the quaintness of the bar area. The hostess & her husband make (waiter) a great pair!

Everything was amazing! The food was delicious, we got the mac & cheese, the baby back ribs and the brisket sandwich. All of them super tasty , BTW you have to try the french fries. Our server was really nice and delivered a great service, and the ambiance was the perfect complement of an incredible experience!  I will definitely come back and recommend it!

If you haven’t been here your gonna love it! They have the best macaroni and cheese. I often have thoughts about it! The pulled chicken sandwich is a great pairing you can’t go wrong! Service is above and beyond I would recommend to everyone!

I reviewed Chicago Q a long time ago but I have decided to rewrite my review now since the place has changed a lot.

We have been coming to Chicago Q on and off since it was opened.  I still rememeber our waiter told us on opening day that the chef won the throw down with Bobby Flay and the food definitely backed it up.  We didn't go as often as we would like because service was always very slow.  There was a time when we sat down and no one came for over 15 mins and we saw all of the wait staff walking pass us during this whole time.  We just left.

It WAS quality BBQ, tender meats, perfect smoke and unforgetable sauces.  You can enjoy the delicious pickled cucumbers and chips while you wait for your food.   After all of these years, the flavor of the food has not changed but the quality has gone down hill for sure.  We came on a Saturday night and there was no one here.  I think partially because of the COVID protocol (vaccine card check, and yes get your shots), partially because of the same old boring menu and partially because of the food quality.  The meats are definitely on the drier side, like others mentioned, reheated.  My whole rack of St Louis ribs shrink down to 60% of its original size.  I can understand COVID has caused a lot of issues for many people but cutting these corners will simply make things worse in my opinion.  One thing I just found out, they started charging for the chips and the pickles that was given out for free, $3 each and no refills.  Seriously, pretty soon they will start charging for toilet paper, nakins and take home boxes.  The menu prices have already increased by 20-35%.

I used to pick Chicago Q over Bub City and definitely Carson's, so even though the service was slow I will still make the effort to come once in a while.  But now it will be a very long time before I will come again or never.  No wonder there is no one here on a Saturday night.

Cool spot with sit-down bbq - don’t expect a shack-style atmosphere here. Meats are decent, although the sweet pickles are memorable. The main critique is that the meats are a bit too dry but the sauces help with that. Mac and Cheese also is decent. Service is friendly.
Staff is very friendly, coffee was good, but  muffin was very oily.  If not for muffin, would be 4 stars. Definitely a nice spot to visit. Will give another chance if I come for food vs snacks.

This is my first time coming here and I'm a HUGE fan! Everything is made fresh every day, and they're very transparent about their mission and purpose, with signs all over displaying HOW fresh everything really is.

Then I read that their leftover food is donated to the hungry every night, something that a lot of restaurants are afraid to do.

I'm sold on this place. The food was great, by the way, as it should be.
Healthy food for a quick lunch. We were greeted by the nicest and most energetic young men during the big rush hour at noon. Thanks for the smile!
Delicious coffee and a good place to chill in the heart of downtown Chicago.

I've been coming here for years! My only complain is the fact that there aren't MORE locations...but seriously; lovely cafe with delicious food. This place in particular is never understaffed. Here in the city, constant rushes of people bustling in from work for a quick bite. lines of 15 never stand for more than a few minutes. As a vegan, I am delighted to see more option being added to the menu, hope to see more put in over time. Coffee is exceptional, rarely ever out. they do a great job to make sure the canisters are never empty. Love you guys at Pret!

The decor and atmosphere are great. The food looked promising, they bake fresh pizza right there next to you. However, our 4 cheese pizzas were pretty much tasteless, which is weird for a pizza that contains gorgonzola. We were a party of 14 and asked our waiter if he could split the checks or what was the easiest solution and it took him THIRTY minutes to try and split the checks but he finally couldn't figure it out. The whole checkout took way too long.

The decor is a little funky. Not a big fan of the communal tables. I Don't want to sit with strangers. I go to dinner with friends, not to meet new people. Food is fairly good though but I prefer the food next door at their sister restaurant, Anteprima.

We had a great meal and had friendly, attentive service. Seating was a little cramped, but setup was good for conversation even on a busy night. The trout with mushrooms was nicely prepared, flavorful, and generously portioned. We'll go back soon to try the pizzas.

I don't know if this is just a Chicago thing, but apparently you "definitely" need a reservation to eat here. I walked in on a Friday night with my partner without a reservation. A server asked if I had one, and I said I didn't. This has happened before at other places and when the restaurant was generally empty, like it was this night I went in, I'm still seated and served. When I asked if we needed one, he very snobbishly (standing there in his untucked flannel and blue jeans) said "yes definitely...but we have seats in the back." We sat for 20 seconds and left because that rude reception would have soured the entire experience.

I don't really care how great you think your restaurant is. If you're standing there in your pedestrian clothes in a 2/3 empty pizza restaurant shaming me for not having a reservation on a quiet Friday night, expect to not have me. I'm literally never coming here again.

This place is adorable.  And whoever thought to make every table a booth wins all of the awards.  The waitstaff was super attentive, to the point one of my friends had to guard her plate so they wouldn't clear it (which was hilarious).  The food is phenomenal and I will personally recommend the pancetta wrapped dates filled with gorgonzola.  I mean, come on!  So good.  Pretty reasonably priced for tapas too.  It was my friend's birthday and she received a free piece of chocolate cheesecake with a candle in it!  yay. Good stuff.

My cousins and I visited here on a Monday night and it was such a great experience. Our waiter Stepper and the manager Miguel took great care of us and we spent hours there! Wonderful vibes and amazing views, would definitely recommend and come back! We all ordered espressos martinis and truffle fries and got the chance to try a new seltzer.

Made a reservation online on a Friday night. At 8pm there was a DJ - good music. People at the bar, people having drinks/eating. Really fun atmosphere as a place to go before you go out to another club. They have a dining room area separate from a bar area. Had the mushroom pizza-very very good!! It’s definitely an upgraded pizza, not a standard greasy thing. Had a roll of shushi too, which was tasty. I’ll definitely be back for a quick bite and drinks!

I will start out by saying make sure you're on the Pavilion! I started out with my experience being placed at the inside bar, and if that's where I stayed this would be a 2-star review. The temperature setting inside is set to match the Pavilion which is open air space and I honestly was sweating through my shirt. Also as the Pavilion is busier most the staff tend to be focused on that area so service inside is slower.

Luckily Jayce, the hostess, was able to get us squeezed into the Pavilion despite not having a reservation. Thank you Jayce that definitely made the experience much nicer!

Jackie, our server, was very nice and attentive. As soon as we sat down we had water ready and our first drinks on the way. We got two drinks:
• Summer Blossom
• Old Fashioned

The Summer Blossom was very light and refreshing. An easy to drink cocktail with a nice flavor.

ROOF on the Wit is not a bad spot to stop for a cocktail, just make sure you're on the Pavilion if you want a unique experience.

There were only a few places that were open on Christmas Eve! We found this rooftop placed on 27th floor on this day and came here with my love and had some foods and drinks. We enjoyed our Christmas Eve time together.
I liked the vibe, the lighting and the decorations.

The view is pretty good. The music is great. The Cheese plate and warm olives are delicious. I can’t give it a 5 star because it’s entirely enclosed. There’s no way to step outside for fresh air. It wasn’t as good as other roofs I’ve been too.
Great little place to pick up food under the blue line. The Belly Dog has a fun flavors and textures going on, a must try.

Tried the regular and the big bowls. The beef and chicken flavors are amazing! The pork was too sweet for my taste but that's just personal preference. They have beer, sake, Mexican cola, fresh juices and some nice soft serve options.

Belly Shack has the best food in the area. The menu specials change often. I really like the belly dog with ramen noodles and Kim chi. The french fries and dip are very good, the Hot and Sour soup is the best, and the soft serve ice cream comes with real, natural toppings. It's right under the blue line stop, easy to get to. The original owner sold to a different group recently, so I hope they keep the quality the same.

Friendly service in a hip, urban setting.
Korean BBQ plate, with Kim-chi, BBQ Beef, and Bread was good. I would have liked the bread to be thinner so I could fit more fixing into it.
Asian Meatball Sandwich very tasty, but the bread was ridiculously thick. Something closer to a pita would have been perfect.
The spiced fries were very good, with a nice dipping sauce.
We also had the Yuzu Lemonade!!!!!!  It was wonderful, not too sweet, not sour, very refreshing.

Oh my word. Ever since I left this place I am dreaming of when I will be able to go back and eat there again. I got the kimchi dog which was delightful. There spiced french fries are simply something that needs to be tried with its perfect tangy dipping sauces. The hot dog was not in your average bun, it was clearly homemade and so s moist. I think wanted to get the bacon soft serve that I had heard so much about but they were out of it so I opted for the caramel topping. I am happy that I did because I have never tasted anything like it before. I make caramels and caramel sauce all the time but this was something extraordinary. I will definitely be back...probably today!

Good rolls. Friendly service. Didn't know it was bring-your-own-bottle until we got there, but that was ok. The sushi came on a wooden boat with working rudder! Very cool! Got to sit right away, and the wait for the rolls was pretty typical for a busy night at any sushi place.

I visited their new location just this past weekend. As a loyal patron to their last location, I have to say I am disappointed. The quality of food and service have decreased as the price of the food has increased. I used to love the cozy and genuine feel to the last place, and was saddened to be greeted by a new cold, and unwelcoming decor. Some of the old staffers we love are still there, unfortunately we didn't get any of them as our server. The new chef is good, but I will definitely be looking for a new sushi place. If you're all for overpriced portions and a very Americanized "Japanese" dining experience, then by all means, enjoy. I, however, will not be returning.

Easily my favorite sushi spot in this entire city! If you haven't been here, you need to come. The more the merrier too! BYOB, casual, friendly staff, awesome chefs, super delicious food and they take reservations. What is there not to like about this place? It doesn't cost an arm and a leg either!

The food is amazing. The menu is not just sushi but a wide variety of sea food options and steak and chicken. I had the chicken teriyaki with burned carrots as a side dish. It was divine. I also loved the staff. Very helpful, considerate and nice! Will go there again. Note the place is on the expensive side. We paid 90 dollars for an appetizer, two entrees and 2 side dishes. You get what you paid for though. Great value.

Great new location and parking isn't too bad. I made it a point to make it to their old location and was there on their 1st week at the new location.  It's bigger, better and a lot more room.  This place gets pretty busy... What can I say?  Steak... Sushi... How can they go wrong lol.  It's making me hungry just typing this review.  Thanks again for taking  such good care of us guys. Will be back soon.

Quick service, and most importantly they listen to institutions on how you want your food made. The only thing that kept this location from 5 stars was the low amount of sauce on the wings. What are we doing here? Rationing? Throw those wings in that bowl and sauce them up! I only had a simple order. 15 wings, veggie sticks, and 2 blue cheese, but saucing those wings up a bit more so I don't get half the wings dry in a mango habanero sauce would definitely get that extra star. Small things, but great job otherwise guys. You guys work like a team, communicate, and get the job done. I will definitely be coming back
15.00 they didn't even give me my fries.
Had boneless wings and it was good. The fries were good. Everything was fresh and delicious. It was also clean inside.

Very bad customer service. The workers  were rude, impolite and bad mannered. They msde ne wait 30 minutes when they said my order will take 15 minutes. They had my order ready but didnt call me to pick it up.
Don't order delivery from these people because you aren't going to get it. You need to go pick it up, if you're too lazy to do delivery then disable that option.

The place has a good ambience and the service was quick, efficient and friendly. The food itself was very tasty - well-prepared, correct combination of tastes and spiciness, etc. The Gobi Manchurian appetizer was mouthwatering in taste, crispiness etc. The quantities were a little too less, but nothing else to complain about as far as the food was concerned.  Parking on the street was free and plentiful, one more advantage over the complete chaos of Devon street.

Sent us a wrong order on a sunday lunch. What more do you want to ruin a nice sunday. Finally the order arrived after 2:30hrs with not so great tasting food. Oily samosa, very garlicky nan, tangy channa masala.

Can’t ever order from this restaurant again! It’s extremely spicy and not edible unless you’re the kind of person who can drink a bottle of hot sauce without any issues.

They advertise 3 different spice levels on Uber Eats when in actuality, there is only a single spice level ( Extremely! spicy ).

I verified this with the hostess at the restaurant via a phone call. I informed her to please either change that or at the least please stop misrepresenting to customers.  Food was so spicy that it had to be disposed.

I use to get takeout from this place all the time when I lived in the neighborhood. I think it's time to breakup. The food / recipe quality has just gone so downhill in the last few years. My most recent order (chicken curry) was almost inedible. It was not a true, thick curry--it was soup. In fact it tasted like chicken noodle or minestrone, and was incredibly oily.

Hate to see a formerly great place lose the magic.
Delicious! 😘 I've been here a couple times. The chicken tiki masala is divine & creamy, the lamb is tender..and guess what?!..the Rangoli Platter is a meal all by itself. 😲 Try it!

Ordered delivery they forgot both drinks in the order. Whoever is cutting up your vegetables needs to be retaught how to cut like really I'm glad I caught this nasty excuse of prepping. Now if it isn't cut in house who was the smart one that decided this was acceptable to serve with my food??? Rice seemed stale as well had a weird crunch to it. What's with the Meat portions??? Other half of the bowl had no meat whatsoever very disappointed not worth the $60 spent here today

I live in the area is this is by far the worst chipotle I ever been to. Deserves 0 stars to be honest.  I’ll start with saying there’s no signs that say “card only”. As a industry bartender we usually carry cash. Unfortunately they didn’t say or warn they were taking card only so the food that was made was thrown away. I had $12.50 on the card and the total was $13.75. I told them I can give $2 cash but didn’t have it all in card. The cashier was super rude and disrespectful. On top of that the portion on the meat…..I legit had like 5 pieces of steak but I was like whatever at that point. My partner goes there often and she said they only been taking card for about two months…if you can’t trust money with employees then maybe look for different ones. I WOULD GO TO ANY OTHER PLACE IN THE PLAZA INSTEAD OF DEALING WITH THESE RUDE EMPLOYEES.

Saw the 2 star reviews on yelp but was in a hurry today and decided to take a chance. Good portions bland taste. Few hrs later I’m stuck in the bathroom with diarrhea. Choose anything else besides here! (Btw it’s the only thing I ate today so I know my sickness came from here)

Had the worst experience.  This chick gave us the worst customer service.  First she got our order wrong then when corrected she still gave us the wrong order and over charged me.  She had an attitude and handles food like if we owed her something.  Never going there again. Oh and the guacamole was black

Sad to see chipotle employees don’t know how to make a burrito. This is what I received after ordering a burrito online. I usually make my own burritos but had a taste for chipotle. Paid $20 for my order and it’s smaller than my hand this shouldn’t be allowed.

I had an assortment of 5 different flavors and they were all tasty! I am a huge fan of baked empanadas. Can’t go wrong with these spot.
I just wish they were a bit bigger on size.
I like the ambience and decoration. The place looked very clean.

I had the best empanadas yet in Chicago at 5411 this past week. I tried a bunch of different flavors, and I have to put you guys on to the bacon, dates, and goat cheese empanada. Easily the best I’ve tried, and the Malbec beef empanada is marinated for 24 hours in Argentinian Malbec which really made the empanada more juicy, I love this spot.
They specialize in empanadas. Are pretty tasty, but a little on the small side.They will allow to to call ahead and place an order. Pretty friendly service.

My husband and I discovered this amazing place a few years ago. These empanadas are incredible. You can’t go wrong with the bacon date and goat cheese!! We love it and come numerous times on our Chicago visits! Bring back the purple potato and honey ricotta. Those were the best!!
Great bang for buck for a snack. We tried Malbec beef, curry chicken, Mac n cheese, goat cheese bacon date, and sweet corn and enjoyed them all. Fast and friendly service!

We walked to Clark Street Grill from Wrigley Field after the Cubs game. There were a decent amount of people in there but we found a booth. Liked the feel of store, nice old school feel. We got 2 Chicago Styled Hot Dogs and fries.  This one was super good and had really nice snap to it.  Fries could have been a bit crunchier but still good.

This is a great no-nonsense spot for a quick pickup for burgers, dogs, gyros or fries.

I'm writing this review because the gyro I got was so good and filled with the most meat I've ever gotten in a gyro, all for $9.99! (Pic attached)

This place is great for a quick bite or late night delivery.

Get the mozz sticks, and cheese fries, you will not be disappointed. Everyone is super nice inside and I'm so glad I live right down the street so I can go all the time.

Excellent food and service.  Don't park in the nearby shopping center.  They put boots on tires and charge $175 to remove.  Even with that experience,  excellent food. Wind blew most of our food off that table, they replaced it for free.
Everything was delish- great ital beef- get it with both sweet and hot peppers. Fries are delish with tasty potato flavor not grease- yum. Traditional polish- tons of delectable sautéed onions- yum!

Good food, tasty, fast serving.
You can get some drinks at the bar in the other room, they have acceptable prices and friendly staff.
See you soon 🥂

This is not the same Los Comales that I remember. Food was not tasty at all. Their horchata use to be one of the best tasting horchatas and now I have to disagree with that. The menu doesn't have as many options as before. It was not a pleasant experience. The only positive thing that I can say was that our waitress was kind to us. But, I will not be going back at all.

I love this place! Everytime we go to Chicago we stop here and get the 30 tacos with horchata! Friendly staff and food is delicious!

The pitcher of dos XX was not badly price! $11

We got tacos de:
Asada
Al pastor
Tripas
Cecina
Suadero

Wd have been here a handful of times. Usually its great. Food is great as well as service.
This time the beans tasted burnt and our waitress was vedy rude. Actually yelled at me over my order because she either misunderstood me or she wrote it down wrong. Either way you dont yell at the customer and be as rude as she was.

1 star for food
3 star for service
2 star for pricing
3 star for ambiance

This location once had the best Mexican tacos in all of Little Village. It is so disappointing how horrible the food is here. The steak tacos lacked any seasoning and tasted of cheap meat. The Al Pastor tacos were overly sweetened and had zero taste to pork. The beans tasted straight out of a can and reheated several times. The rice lacked any seasoning and the yellow color seem to have been more dye that flavor. The red hot sauce was overly watered down on the upside the green sauce was not. The price of the food should be slashed in half for the quality of food that is coming out of this restaurant. As for service, it was friendly whenever we actually saw the waiter. The place was empty and still took 5 minutes to even take our drink orders. The only thing going for this place is that looks clean and has a nice view of the Village Arch. I would save your money and go anywhere but here. This once great place sadly has lost its magic and with it my service. I hope this once great place comes back to its glory days since it once was a staple to Little Village.
This new chef is killing it ! I love these tacos me and my family can get enough . The lengua is delicious and everything taste to fresh . Thanks!

Absolutely incredible rolls, fresh fish and elegant presentation. Service was a bit slow, but we were dining at a later hour so I think they were understaffed, but maybe budget a little more time or don't eat here in a rush. Seated us promptly and were very professional. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for sushi in Wicker Park.

We met with friends at this place for lunch. my friend recommended this place.  Well, it was very nice. the crew were so friendly and we had a fantastic feeling. The meal was fresh and delicious. We loved this place a lot and we will definitely return to this restaurant. Warmly recommended.

This is a reliable spot for sushi, tucked away on North Avenue. The quality wasn't mind-blowing, but it was, simply put, good. The spicy food really is spicy, so be prepared. I like that but some are turned off. Blue Fin is BYOB, but there is also a corkage fee

I arrive at this outstanding place every couple of days  as I enjoy the ambiance that is characterizes this place. The staff is highly attentive and skilfull. The service is extremely quick. Most important, the food you get is good. I visited many times and I was always happy. The price is reasobable. I highly suggest this restaurant to to all.

Really good sushi. I think one of the things that makes them stand out is that instead of using imitation crab in their rolls, they use a spread made from actual snow crab. Super tasty sushi. Ordered a few rolls and some sashimi and agedashi tofu. All were delicious. Sushi chef and waiter were nice and courteous. Even tho it was almost closing time and i was the only person in the place they still served me.

Fresh sushi! Cute atmosphere. Good drink specials. Will be back.

The turkey sub was delicious. The fries are my favorite---perfectly crispy shoestring-like fries! 💚
Prompt order, delicious food 😋
Restaurant and was clean and tidy too

Usually love Mr Sub but today I was very disappointed. Ordered the hot corned beef as I always do through the drive through. When I got home my sandwich had nothing on it except for some corned beef and mayo? No lettuce, tomato, cheese or mustard! If it wasn't for the fact that it's at least a 40 minute round trip I would've gone back. Very disappointed ☹️☹️
Haven't ate there in about 25 years visited the other week had a sub, still the same old school taste Good food with history....... thanks 👍
I love Mr Submarine. My daughter just moved to the Chicago 6 corner area where this one is😊I spotted it on my way back to Westside of chicago. Great Sunday Dinner For Hubby and I.

A fight was breaking out between 1 Black Female against 2 Black Males & i was with my 29 year old daughter & my 6 year old Grandson & my 10 year old son ! She was screaming & yelling out the front door of this joint & people inside were just looking at here like she was crazy ! Good thing I do conceal !
Hands down, my favorite bar in Chicago.  One of the best beer selections in the city and an awesome, friendly staff always willing to help you explore new beers.  Great old fashioneds, great food.

Illuminated by pink neon lighting, the skull motif vaguely reminds you of your mortality as you circle the drain. The bartender was more curt than courteous. Therefore, it was one and done. Almost forgot, the place was littered w 666’s.
Crook Country’s finest — Po boys, one of the most impressive beer selections in the entire city, and a neighborhood gem. Miss this place. Bring back the Mourning Wood!

One of the best beer bars in Chicago, hands down. They always have a great rotating selection of brews. And addition to that, the food is fantastic. The great ambiance is pretty much the cherry on top.
Love this place. Great beers and arguably the best fries in the whole city. Always chill, too.

I'm very confident about giving this place a 5-star rating!

1- Food: Food was absolutely delicious and healthy, you can eat as much as you want here without feeling stuffed. Everything is very healthy and cooked with little to no oil. I loved their teas too!

2- Vibe: The environment is great, pretty calm and relaxing! Also a lot of art work and interesting messages on the walls!

3- Pricing: Very reasonable, relatively cheap and totally worth it!

4- Cleanness: REALLY neat and clean. Germophobe approved!! 5/5!!! From the table to floor and bathroom, everything was very neat and clean!

5- Staff: super nice and friendly, didn't have any issues!

6- Menu diversity: their menu looks amazing and has tons of delicious options!!

100% recommend for vegans and non-vegans! Especially if you're looking for a relax place to eat some healthy food!

We had a fun group of vegan foodies. The dishes were beautifully plated and served! You get a lot of food per order. Chef served us!! The peaceful atmosphere was a great change of pace! Low I'm, musical chimes and great smelling incense. You choose: mild, medium, hot!

One of the best vegan restaurants I've ever been to. The food is overall delicious, flavorful, not too greasy or salty. My friend and I had Dr. K's soup, vegan dumplings, and yin and yang dish, all were worth trying. The ginger citron tea was soothing. I wish I had more of a stomach to try the other dishes on the menu. Def will have to come back soon!

Oh boy, where to start. Finally dined in at Amitabul and were beyond amazed with the food and hospitality. Do have the Energy Ginger to start with vs Green Tea. We ordered the dumplings off the Appetizers and they were fresh and light. We ordered a dumpling noodle soup and Bibimbap and they came out fresh, full of veggies and flavor. We are coming back to try more things off the menu. There is little to no oil used in prep of the food.
Wow! I was in Chicago for a day-and-a-half and ate here twice! Phenomenal food and energy in this place. The soups, the stews, the noodles, everything works together beautifully
Stopped in while visiting Chicago for the weekend.  Very neat place!  Friendly staff, great coffee, and delicious breakfast tacos. The homemade lavender syrup in my cold brew coffee was phenomenal!

Always a great spot to study at (best local coffee shop WIFI in Chi town, besides Starbucks)!

Also, the coffee is superb, staff are welcoming, and vibe is pretty chill.

Tip: if you’re going there to study, most spots in the back don’t have an outlet (@EmeraldCityCoffee would be cool to add some there if you guys can)!

Have been a customer at Emerald City since I've moved to the city 6 years ago, and to this day, it is still my #1 local coffee shop. They have a great selection of coffees, and the breakfast burritos are to die for. Plenty of seating to do work or study too.
My favorite coffee in the area. Every barista and person at the counter is nice. It's my exact type of atmosphere. Very cute spot. Breakfast tacos were underwhelming.
Great coffee space with very reasonable prices. Not a wide selection of food, so I wouldn't go there for a full meal, but for coffee, it's ideal. The coffee drinks are always solid.
The food is always spectacular here. Love the new remodeled look. Best steak and lechon/pork Jibaritos in Midwest!

This place is the bomb…. I came in here never having tried Puerto Rican food but came in with high expectations seeing all the flags in the neighborhood. I got the Tripleta to sample all the meats and it was the right choice. The tostones are pressed flat and fried like chips which was great compared to slices I’ve had before. There was one guy running the show that I believe was the owner. He’s doing everything right, this has been my best meal yet in my weekend trying restaurants in Chicago.
The absolute best Puerto Rican in the area. Best jibarito and pastelillos I’ve ever had! Awesome customer service too - the owner is so sweet! Pic is of the knuckle sandwich. Outstanding.

Every time we come here it is even better than the last, the food is always fresh and delicious and everything from the sandwiches to the hebaros and the stews…..don’t forget the frituras neither they are all amazing, my fave are the relleno de papa(stuffed potato) and the steak pastelillo. Never a disappointment and always worth the wait or travel for this awesome food that they serve here and also the awesome and curtious staff who work hard everyday here to let us enjoy the food are also the best

This use to be in a huge bowl but I digress!!! IT IS STILL AMAZING THIS IS THE STEAK BOWL IF YOU DON'T KNOW I HATE VEGGIES BUT VEGGIES RICE AND MEAT WERE ALL AMAZING... THE  Empanadas steak and cheese OMG ( NO PICS SORRY) so get boss sauce and dip it in that OMG AMAZING BUT BEEN GOING HERE FOR ABOUT 7 YEARS SINCE I WAS WORKING OVER THERE... FYI SORRY BOUT THE CAPS 😂🤣 ENJOY

A quaint, lovely little bagel stop offering a good selection of sandwich and coffee/warm beverage options. My husband and I both got the Fisherman sandwich, his with the jalapeño cheddar bagel, and mine with the everything bagel. Both were very delicious! Definitely ask for extra capers on this sandwich though. It needs that salty, briny kick to bring that extra level of goodness to the experience, and I found the sandwich a little lacking there, so I asked for extra.

And the drink I got was to die for! Definitely consider trying the bourbon vanilla chai latte if you stop in!

Be prepared for a decent chunk of a bill though. Our sandwiches were about $12 each, and my drink was $5, plus decent tax, so our total was around $32.

All aside, this was a lovely spot! I'd definitely give it another try in the future.

They used to be super friendly and nice but for the first time after years coming here,  the lady at the register was frankly rude and dismissive.  Honestly Printers Row coffee on the corner is much better for coffee anyway. They used to have 5 Star service but COVID has messed w everyone where customer service is concerned.  There are other shops that respect their patrons better.

Great spot for a quick bite and place to study/get work done. “The Bageler” was delicious, perfect amount of bacon, cheese, and chipotle mayo, with an egg to round it all together! The new ownership was very friendly as well. Will definitely be a frequent return customer!
Love this place! Great coffee and food, super chill atmosphere.

I was here today for the second time.  This place is an unassuming, unpretentious bagel and coffee place (they have a sign saying they also serve lunch), and that's the way I like it.  Their bagels and cream cheese are excellent.  If you're having coffee, I suggest forgoing the drip coffee/Americano/cafe au lait and going for something stronger.  This is a really nice place to chill out in for a short while, away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Street parking (free).
TVs are waaay to loud for conversation.
Burgers were relatively good, $16.20 for a burger with a fried egg added and garlic Fries. Would not order the Too Gouda be true again, needed something to break up the flavors. Fries were good, but regret not getting the Polish fries and not getting the garlic bites which were very good!

Bathroom was pretty good for a random burger place.

Menu was pretty small and could use some more options, they do offer to switch the burger patty for various alternatives.

Not bad but was empty most of the time we were there.

Great food and very reasonable prices! They specialize in burgers but I love the options to swap out the beef patty. My favorite is the Too Gouda to be True with a grilled chicken breast. I'm also a fan of their sides but caution against them if you are picking up as they may be soggy by the time you get home. Sides like the sweet potato tots and fried pickles are much better when fresh but that's not something I hold against BRGRBELLY as it's more of a testament to how hot and steamy the food is. Will definitely be back!
Great burgers every time, cheese curds are also excellent. Not a ton of seating so large groups would be hard but there are 4 tables setup outside in the warmer months.
One of the best burgers we’ve tried (Midnight Special and Too Gouda Be True)! Very friendly staff and great music taste! 👌🏻

I had the Old Time Religion burger & my guy had the Gallows Poll burger. We shared the Blue Cheese fries & thank goodness because the order was big! These burgers & fries were some of the best we've ever had! We were pretty hungry and couldn't finish all of anything. It wasn't for a lack of trying because the flavors were amazing...I hated leaving those few bites behind! :-) They have a great beer selection and were helpful in finding me a local wheat beer (that I fell in love with).
The staff is super friendly. The atmosphere is fun & funky with rock posters, art, & even a rock concert on the TVs. It was super clean, too. I'm really impressed with my first meal in Chicago and highly recommend this awesome burger joint!

The burger is great, the fried chicken sandwich too, same with the sliders. But the fish fry... Really? And you're gonna advertise it too? Really?
I mean it's not bad, but why are you bogarting the fish? Look at the size of that, what's happening here?

Love this little neighborhood gem! Perfect for Bama fans or really anyone into a good Saturday watching football with friends, old and new. Highly recommend a stop if you’re in the area or looking for a nice spot to relax after walking around.

There is a good vibe at Houndstooth Saloon. The food was innovative and I love the different names of the food. What struck me was the delicious seasoned fries, the fried pickles, and the sauces. Check it out!
I saw the deep fried Oreos on the menu and had to try them. They were divine. The only reason I’m docking a star is because vanilla ice cream would have sealed the deal

Came to Houndstooth Saloon on a Tuesday to experience Taco Tuesday! Every week they offer 4 standard tacos + 1 specialty taco, each for $2. They really hit the spot and I will definitely be back! The staff was friendly and we had a really nice time. Only thing to note is the outdoor seating is below the L, so there is frequent trains going through. Not a big deal to me, but something to know!

I’m surprised to see so many negative reviews - it seems like maybe they struggle with delivery. But my dine-in order was really good and the service and space were both lovely. The beans and rice are really tasty, and the steak in my tacos is super flavorful. Everything is soft, wonderfully cooked, and very tasty.
My boyfriend and I stopped in last night after hitting up a few of neighborhood bars. Great burritos, excellent service, and an absolutely wonderful staff. Highly recommend if you’re on Clark!

Seriously one of the best enchilada meals I have had. I'm not one for the beans but these were fantastic! I ate so much food here in one sitting I was in a food coma, I didn't want to leave. Service was great, quick, made great suggestions for ordering (I asked).

We have order before from here and the food was great, until today we reorder from there and the food had a nasty old taste, we pretty much had to call back and complaint, and the food also looks pretty old, it literally had a taste you will probably not want to ever eat again here!!!

Me and my Dad weren't having the best of walks through andersonville.. El Ranchito came in and saved the day! Amazing food (so juicy and delicious) and excellent service. Some other authentic Mexican restaurants did not allow us to use the bathroom, access some menu items etc. The waiter here was excellent and did not care that we were white. Highly recommended!
I have to eat here every time I come visit Chicago.  Best polish in the world.  I brought my wife abs kids with me this time and they loved it.  See you next time.  Strongly recommended 10 stars.

Always hot and tasty dogs including the fries....no frills, but always fast and efficient.
I've been coming here since the early 80s...and it's still just as good.
Ca$h only....

This place was great. The hot dog and polish were awesome! But the fries were some of the best I have ever had. Staff was friendly and worked fast. Get your food to go. It is small. Remember don't ask for ketchup!

Everyone stands 6ft distance that is s plus.  Even on busy days there is always parking. The prices are fair the hot dogs are hot with tons of fries. The workers work fast and doesn't waste no time.  The workers behind  the counter communicates with eachother to get the orders in-and-out fast.

A classic must!!! Been coming here for years. You can't ever go wrong with this place. Best suggestion is to just go yourself and pick up the order. Whenever I have it delivered I have to eat rather quickly to prevent the bun from becoming too soggy from the heat/steam from the meat. Also, best fries ever.

Weekday 2nd shift crew don’t know what a drive through mobile order pickup is. I place a mobile order for drive through pickup, then I drive through and pick it up. Simple. But the kids here don’t know what they’re doing (understandable, I hated my first food service job too). They will demand you walk in to get it and the “manager” claim it’s a “store policy” that’s been in place for months when I’ve literally picked up plenty of drive through orders within the last few months at the same location. The mobile app offers a drive through pickup option. What’s not to get? Just hand me the food through the window. Not hard. Otherwise, this wendys is good any other time.

I stopped here for lunch on 1-13-22 and ordered a double and a crispy chicken. The double was good BUT when I was taking off the lettuce from the crispy chicken I found this 3 inch long strip of metal under it!!  Thank God I don't like lettuce!  I was already a couple miles away so I didn't go back. I called but it just rang.  I'm very disappointed that they could allow this to happen.  I mean...  A strip of metal in my sandwich?!?!  How is that even possible?!
The best option if you are in a hurry and hungry furthermore they always have great prices on combos.

Quick and tasty lunch.
Lady taking orders was polite.
A Wendy's I would have no issues coming back too.
No complaints here.

This location was when we first tried Wendy's food for the first time, which was one evening after going to the Zoolights at Lincoln Park Zoo a few year. The food is always fresh and the best in quality and everytime me and my family dine here, the staff does excellent work. I never had an issue here and I always return to this specific location.

Been a patron of Market Fish since I can't remember. Lately food can be hit or miss. When it's good it's GOOD! I've been a customer for decades. They use to have real friendly people on the register. They knew the kind of fish I wanted when I called up. I walked in one day and learned my favorite register lady passed away. They later hired another young lady to run the register and she was good also, no longer there. Guy running the register now can be a grouch sometimes but likes to talk about basketball,  so it's cool to see him "lighten up" They spruced the place up got rid of those ripped foamed fold up chairs and remolded.  I keep coming back and tell others to check it out. Additionally, I buy fresh fish and chicken sometimes to cook at home.  An added plus is the rice in case you don't want fries. Vast majority of times food is ready when I arrive when  I call ahead. If you're hungry it will hit the spot. However, sometimes they "miss the tune" but when they are on Q they hit all the notes.

Most restaurans give you nasty fries as your side. Here they have rice as an option. It's great makes everything to a whole meal. I get rice with all my fish or anything else  I buy from them. Food great prices great. Service good and friendly. Good parking no long waits.

The fish - Jack salmon and Catfish - were cooked perfectly! The cole slaw was delicious. I would have added another star if the fish would have been seasoned with the Slap Ya Mama seasoning they sell. They give you plenty of hot sauce so that was my consolation.
Ordered the oysters. The seasoning was great. The crust or batter could be a little thinner but over-all everything was quite tasty.  I will definitely be back.

I have ordered from this place several times and I have always been satisfied but last night it I was sooo disappointed. I always order 3 large catfish dinners. Last night they fish was so hard, we couldn't eat it! Now, I am afraid to order again!

Excellent service and food.  Great location within the Bloomingdales shopping center on North Michigan.  The crab Rangoon is the best I’ve ever had.  The views of North Michigan Ave from the tables are an added bonus.
Will come back here anytime. Great food, view and service. Kao Soy was fantastic,

Good things first: very attentive and friendly service, an absolutely fantastic view, and decent drink specials. However, the Thai food itself was bland, overly-sauced, and generally far too 'American.' Prices are also fairly high. Not recommended except for a quick drink or an appetizer.

I had a carry out order and had the curry chicken and it came with white rice. I must say it was delicious. The level of spiciness was good as well (From a scale 0-10, I give it a 6). The pricing was fair, my meal came out for $14 including tax. They also have a mini buffe for about $10, which I intend to try out tomorrow.

An about to be nice experience turned out into a very uncomfortable one at the end. No complains about the food, it was good. The service however, was not welcoming. The server never asked how we were doing, if we liked the food, if we needed anything else.....not even a smile. Which, it would have been fine had not the server decided to demand for a tip (20% of the bill). She kept telling us we hadn't tipped her yet and we told her that we weren't and she started having this attitude. That was very uncomfortable and it wasn't until I asked if the tip was mandatory that she decided to drop it. Again food was good, but not worth the experience.

EXCELLENT service. The waitress is super polite and patient. Goes above and beyond. The food is mouth watering. Perfect blend of flavors. The prices are super cheap, you definitely get your money’s worth! For people that enjoy privacy this is a great spot for an intimate dinner.

Kohan was absolutely fantastic!! The food was delicious with good portion sizes, lots of options and great flavor! The staff were so friendly and engaging and just overall wonderful!
I can't express enough how much of a wonderful time we had here. We'll definitely be back!

Also their list of cocktail options is extensive! I'm excited to go back and try the Long Island Green Tea. The cucumber margarita was a hit!
Wow, so good! Their specialty roll was so good and the love boat had a little bit of everything. Very yummy and filling. Will come back for sure. The service was great, our waiter was so sweet!

One of the best places i have eaten in the last few years. Service was amazing and the food portions were more than generous for their prices. Staff was kind and attentive while the food was beyond amazing. I cant wait to make another trip to the city to stop by.

Small cozy place. There are multiple bigger tables for up to 5-6 people but you shouldn’t have any issue having more people there either! The service is good (though my visits occurred during the time when it wasn’t busy)
The quality and portion of the food are reasonable compared with the price. There are nice lunch deals (during the weekdays). I’ve tried a variety of sushi rolls (California roll is suggested, W3 rolls are a must-try). They have a nice variety of dishes served with rice. I suggest giving them a try.

Very local place. Peruvian ex pats go there.
Food was reasonable and authentic.
Ceviche was the best thing we ate.
The rest was tasty but a bit bland.
They did have a mustard sauce that was spicy and outstanding.

The food is great however the service is not good at all. You wait an hour and 32 minutes for good. No one comes to check on you. No napkins just throws your food at you and walks off. Poor service. Especially after driving 17 hours to get here because of previous years was amazing.
I loved the atmosphere and the service was very nice and friendly. The food (Lomo Saltado and Aeropuerto)and the drinks (Pisco Sour) were decent.
