Food was wonderful,  server was very nice but seemed short staff so not as attentive. But I love this place,  so I'll be back next week!

The fish ceviche was my favorite and the food overall was really good but I couldn't find my favorite worker there LUIS FELIPE, the day I went there with my group of friends you gave us great service. We miss you and hope we see you next time we go in LUIS FELIPE ❤️

The vibe and the foods were good. The grilled cheese was fantastic, with the perfect crisp from the bacon, some sweetness from the jam and abundant cheese over the whole thing. Shepherds pie is delicious too with the melted cheese over smash potatoes. Skillet cookie and ice cream was the highlight for this meal as the cookie is just so good.  However, they require a 2.9% transaction fee if you’re using a card, so consider paying with cash.

We had reservations for a party of 14 setup weeks in advance. Upon arrival we learned they had split us up into two separate tables without telling us about it before hand. The whole point of our reservation was to celebrate the joining of two families through marriage and we were completely separate. The service was not good. We told our server we had some people who were extremely hungry. He said let me put in your drink order and I’ll come right back. At least 15 minutes later we had to flag him down after he completely disappeared from the dining area for quite some time. I will say that the food and beverages were delicious, which is a shame when all you can remember is the less than pleasant experience you had. I would personally suggest the ultimate grilled cheese with bacon on parmesan crusted sourdough, and the sangria. Yum!!

Really cute place! Love the interior, but opted to sit outside since it was such a nice day. We started off with the Artichoke Dip and I had the Shepherd's Pie. Both were really good. Our server was very helpful and you could see him running all over the place helping customers out.

This is a neighborhood "go to" place in the heart of Chicago's Andersonville neighborhood.  With an Irish flair, the space is beautiful inside and has ample outdoor seasonal seating as well.  The staff has always been friendly and attentive in my experience and the food is consistently good.  I recently went for brunch and we had wings as an appetizer and then the breakfast burger (with no bun) and the chopped salad.  All good.  And, the bloody marys were tasty as well.  This place, open for lunch and dinner daily, is consistently good.

Ambience was great but food was just okay. My friend and I got wings for a starter and they were the best thing we got. We got the drive thru burger and chicken pot pie for our main course. Definitely recommend checking it out if you're in the area but nothing to go out of your way for.

They have such amazing sushi and the service is great.  I think it's family run and everyone I've encountered has been really nice.  The volcano roll is absolutely AMAZING!!  I've dreampt of it frequently since the last time I had it- I may be obsessed.  The restaurant itself is fairly small, but has a nice atmosphere.  The sushi is delicious and the prices are typical for sushi.

This is my go to spot. I work right down the street and order from here fairly often. The sushi is always fresh and tastes fantastic! The miso is spot on as well. They are always very friendly and happy to see me. I definitely recommend this place!
I love Shiso! A great go-to sushi place. Staff is friendly and the vibe is really low-key. The Shiso Signature maki and the Volcano definitely won't disappoint. And they have the best spicy miso!
I've been going to Shiso for the past couple of years. Their service is excellent and their sushi is delicious. Great neighborhood sushi place. Highly recommend.
About average to good sushi place. I would not go out of my way to go there but if in the neighborhood would order again.

This place is beautiful and the food is outstanding. Lisa was our server and was very sweet and accommodating. Started off with Spring Rolls that did not disappoint along with the the Vietnamese Crepe with Shrimp, so yummy. We all enjoyed our meals, my Chicken Curry was delicious and so was the Ginger Chicken and the Pho with Chicken. For dessert we had Banana Bread Pudding with Carmel Sauce and there really are no words to describe how scrumptious it was. My birthday dinner was amazing. Wine selection is a bit limited but you will enjoy every last morsel of the food. I plan on going back soon.
This place is perfect for a date night. Every item on the menu was spot on authentic using the freshest ingredients.  Wait staff were very solicitous,  courteous and congenial.

Outdoor and indoor spaces are very nice. The food was decent, but nothing memorable. Poor service. Our food took hours for our party of 7. The wine was constantly brought out (without being prompted, keep that tab growing!) but no food or explanation. The waitress initially refused to let us speak to a manager, and was downright defiant that the manager was busy (sitting at a table chatting). The manager brought out food tickets to try to prove we were wrong. Our food wasn’t rung in and we were ignored. How hard is it to just say that? I’ve never experienced a level of service like this. Was told by management to come in and “ask for her next time” and she would take care of us. I won’t be returning.
I loved this restaurant. Beautiful patio, great atmosphere, excellent service and the appetizer was really good! Next time I’m in Chicago I’ll come back for a whole meal and more mango mojitos

This was the cutest spot! Vietnamese cuisine in the most delightful, bright atmosphere. Outdoor seating area is large and white table cloths present inside and out for a cohesive decor. Had the fried chicken dumplings, the shrimp spring rolls, and the filet mignon on a bed of greens with white rice. Do not sleep on the Pear Ginger martini! Of all the positives here, I have to mention the service and staff were incredible! They genuinely care about your experience, are happy to make suggestions or accomodate allergies. I will definitely be back and will recommend to everyone!

The atmosphere is awesome and the service is familial and indeed personable. It's a mix of bohemian "Beat Generation" and French sophistication. I loved everything about Bonbon Cafe, from the food to the ambiance, from the Mexican cuisine to París pastries. I recommend it highly for those looking for the best in Mexican cooking and French bakery.

Holy chocolate deliciousness! I got a mini cake with all kids of chocolate good inside and out. The price was nice too, only $5! The place may look like it's closed but check the hours on the door (oh, and make sure you know your days of the week in Spanish) first. I went on a Sunday so they didn't have their full assortment of goodies; just a few cakes and fruit tartes. I'm dairy free but I gave it up for a minute while I indulged in my little cake. The pain suffered later was well worth it.

This place offers a great variety of baked goods that you may not get to see in a ton of places. But, if you don't come for the sweets they also offer a variety of other things like torts, which are delicious. They have a sit-down area that's cozy, and the staff will get you taken care of right away.
Got some cookies and a couple of small cakes. It was fast and best of all they are delicious.
I love this place and it's sister restaurant down the street. I actually will drive all the way from Glenview just to eat here occasionally. Some of the best Mexican in the City.
'Cazuela de fríjoles' is a really good example of colombian cuisine. Good serving size, tastes great and service is friendy.

$6.95 lunch specials which include a ton of food. The breaded chicken (milanesa) is soooo good. It's my new favorite lunch spot in town. The owner is very friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend giving them a try, especially for their lunch specials, which are priced ridiculously low. I've never tried them for dinner, but certainly would if nearby.

Best weekend special in town! Either Saturday (rib stew) or Sunday (hen stew) are the tastiest dishes you'll find on the menu. Great ambiance for big holidays (ie, live music for mother's day). PS, BYOB!!

Melao is one of the best Colombian restaurants I have tried in the U.S. Since the moment I stepped into the restaurant, I felt like I was at a restaurant in Colombia. The menu has a variety of options but it for sure includes most of the authentic Colombian dishes. My husband, who is from the U.S., also thought the food was delicious. He ordered the Bandeja Paisa and was completely satisfied. I ordered a Mojarra Frita that tasted like heaven. In addition, we each ordered a natural juice (passion fruit and blackberry) that complemented our meal in fantastic way.
Excellent authentic Colombian food, awesome service. Ordered a bunch of small plates and some entrees. Everything was on point

First off, I was put on hold for over 7 minutes. Ordered a football pizza with 2 ingredients. Pizza is $24.99 and $ 3 each additional ingredient. Price not a problem. Told pick up in 40 minutes, wife went to pick up. Waited extra 15 minutes. Opened box and ingredients were very  scarce. Had more sausage on frozen pizza. It's a shame, pizza tasted pretty good. Not sure if I would  order again. For the price I was hoping for a little more of the ingredients.

*edit* My family and friends have been going here for pizza for years and the food is fantastic but recently every time we order there is a mistake. They send food to the incorrect address. Tell us incorrect information about promotions on the phone. Or most recently it takes over an hour and 40 minutes for a thin crust cheese pizza on a Tuesday night which is just bs. They never offer to make things right when they are always creating problems for the customers. I really want to continue to support this small business the service I had in the past was great and I became a regular with the employees back then but the people they have running the place now need to get their act together.

I wish I could review the food. Order on Uber Eats was wrapping up for 20 mins, and then the restaurant requested more time. They kept kicking my order time out until I called Uber Eats customer service and got the order canceled.

Giving the place one star only because I couldn't give it a minus. Ordered delivery from DoorDash. Yvette was the delivery person. Had no idea how to get to my house. Finally was able to talk her to the house by phone. Delivery was very late. Now to the restaurant. First time trying it. Horrible food. I ordered a medium extra thin pizza with tomato and green pepper. Since I am lactose intolerant I requested very light on the cheese. What I got was a regular thin pizza with cheese so thick I couldn't even see the toppings. Never ate the pizza so not sure there were toppings. I also ordered a pasta dish that was shells. Instead I got penne pasta. Never ate that either. Also ordered a 6 pack of coke, Turned out they were out and instead sent RC. Never called me to ask what I wanted in place of the coke. Never ordering from them again!

I really enjoyed the pizza. Me and my children loved it. I ordered online the past two nights i been in Chicago. My baby girl wanted to take some pizza back home. She said that was the best pizza. Lol. I'm originally from Chicago. But been in Louisiana since i was 10. I love the taste of the pizza we all did.

THIS IS ONE OF THE MOST FABULOUS SITE TO ENCOUNTER, IF YOU FROM OUT OF TOWN. YOU DON'T WANT TO MISS THE ENTERTAINMENT THAT TAKE PLACE AS WELL AS THE COMFORT AND RELAXATION  SETTING THAT THEY HAVE TO OFFER. THIS IS METAPHYSIC FROM BLACK HAND STREET TEAM SIGNING OFF. IF YOU WANT TO HEAR SOME GREAT HIP HOP MUSIC, FEEL FREE TO TUNE IN TO OUR STATION ON YOUTUBE. BLACKHANDSTREETEAM. THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME AND PATIENCE.
This is m;y fave neighborhood high end dives.  You must check our the witty and cute as a button bartender, Chris.
Its an awesome environment and really fun
Never open horrible management
Real soul food cooking. Just what was needed on the north side. The food is excellent, the staff is great. I highly recommend eating there.

They give  you lil food and they french fries are greasy They Italian beef Was small with no meat on their It's was more hot paper's then meat in it was dry I would never get any thing else from there they need to work on getting you more food in cooking they fries better will cooking all they food better

Ms. Vette's  Way has a home feel to it...The food is great...The chef cooks with passion and doesn't mind cooking to your liking just ask...other than that the staff its respectful and  homey...great hospitality and great food...stop by...
Tastes like something real, not something rushed.  If you're in the area it's definitely worth trying out.
Great place to come and eat at. And injoy your self at.
Ordered through Uber eats. My fries were over cooked and wayyy too salty. Asked for well done wings, but these wings were super soft. Fries tasted like old grease. Won’t be returning.

Terrible experience!!! We arrived close to 10 PM, hungry and tired from walking all day. Ordered boneless, but got boning wings. We sat at the table, but were asked to leave because in dinning was closed! Open hours at the front door said and Google said til midnight. It would have been proper from the employees to advise that no in dinning was allowed and only take out was being process.
Not great. The hot honey rub was pretty good if you get past the flash fried wings. Fries both burnt and soggy. Coke machine was a disaster, no ice, spray all over, tasted like 3 year old soda.
They put like 2 drops of sauce on the wings. These we’re supposed to be the habanero wings

I really wanna give this review a zero I went in the Wingstop on 35th and king drive and sat there for half an hour then they gave everyone their order first then when I went to the window to ask where was my order she didn’t apologize or do anything they had legit forgot about my order I would never return. I wanna give a F for customer service… an apology goes a long way.

So disappointed to them this is a medium ice coffee. But you go to any other McDonald’s their ice coffee are bigger. In kids meal this is a small drink. So wrong of doing and then laughed at the customer. Like they haven’t been there so many time for so many years. Surely I will take my self to places where customers get treated right. So disappointed with them. This supposed to be a medium Ice caramel macchiato.

This McDonald's wasn't too bad the lines aren't very long there's 2 lanes number aint no matter the time of day they're pretty quick about it I've seen way worse and way better there I keep there dyif they're dining area clean still no inside seating but you can't go inside to order and use their restrooms staff has always been friendly and it's located at a easy to access corner

The Colombian guy Marcos is the best McDonald’s employee of all time. He’s so cool and attentive. When he’s around there’s nothing that goes wrong. I love going when he works! The ladies can be kinda rude and mess up your order but man is he the best! Will leave the drive thru with a smile on your face. He takes his job very seriously and passionately. He should train every McDonald’s employee he has great customer service and order accuracy. His voice is a bonus. Mornings with Marcos are the best.

This is absolutely one of the best McDonald's. It is McDonald's so you know the fries are great. I purchased some food once and everything was wonderfully packaged in one bag with great care. I still do really appreciate their service.

TERRIBLE SERVICE!

THEY FORGET EVERYTHING!
Do not go here!
At this point—
All I can do is write a review.
This is the WORST McDonald’s you’ll ever go to in your life.
Do not go here for dinner.
I go here sometimes twice a day and am fed up.
3 nights in a row they messed up my order.
It almost seems like it’s in purpose.
They’re lazy! They’re bare minimum.
It’s a shame nothing else is open late 24hrs bc that’s the only reason I keep showing back up.

Very close to a 🇵🇷 breakfast sandwich. We were the first to arrive. We were greated and seated right away. I orded a ham, fried egg and cheese sandwich. It was perfect, fresh and delicious. The crunch you get from the toasty 🍞 is memorable.

The only thing I would change from this visit is the fact that when we arrived our server,(which we did not know was our server) was outside smoking. So when she arrived at our table all we smelled was cigarette smoke. It is so important to wash hands and freshen up when working at a restaurant. But we still made sure to hit the congas on our way out, to show we enjoyed our meal.
Nice homey atmosphere. Food is fresh and quick. Had the soup and sandwich combo and it was delicious. Café con leche is a must. Perfect amount of coffe, sugar, just on point.

I really liked the chicken soup with the cuban torta, They do chucks and you can taste how good its cooked, very yumme.  One of the cafes has lechera and is divine taste, as a mexican +1 for using lechera.

The food was ok...I've had better, I've had worse.  Service was outstanding.  However, I had to look at a Republican fundraising sign staring me in the face while I ate my meal, which kind of made me lose my appetite and left a bad taste in my mouth.  I don't care that they're Republican, as long as they don't care if they lose a customer.  I'll never eat here again.
=>=>DISRESPECTFUL OWNER

Food was delicious.  I loved the Gumbolaya soup. Bread was a bit dry, but was still a tasty meal. The upstairs dining area includes an outdoor patio and is really nice ambiance. Looking forward to returning.. One star off for service. Cashier was very short and just not friendly--especially for first time customers. Did not really sour the overall experience too much,  but everyone in my party mentioned that he must not be in a patient or happy mood.

Prices were wrong. Cold brew menu price is $5 for a 16oz, but I was charged $5.50. It’s a digital menu on a TV too, so there really isn’t any excuse. Also, without my knowledge, I was charged a hidden fee of 3.5%. I didn’t see a single sign telling me that I would be charged this fee. Very shady. Leaves a bad taste in my mouth.
I love this place! Great food to order and pre-packaged as well. Awesome salad bar. They have an upstairs patio and dining spot that is nice. It's like a little convenience store/cafe.

I had a very bad experience. The coffee was a bit hot so I went to the counter to request a cup of ice. I was one of two patrons in the store. Even having made eye contact with the barista she ignored me for over 10 mins. I wasn’t helped until another employee walked out from the back.
Smart assortment, good coffee, ice-cream cone machine, nice terrace.

Simply phenomenal. The service was good, but the food was simply sublime. I cannot put into words how good it was other than pure ecstasy. The salad was the perfect blend of mozzarella, tomato, salad, and olive oil that formed a union of flavors for a salad unlike no other. The salad was one of the simplest but best I've had in a while. Now the main course was just beyond what I expected. The perfect blend of soft pasta layers, sticky and savory meats coupled with crimson scrumptious red sauce and topped with fantastic melted cheese bring you straight to flavor town. The tastes, textures, and smells all combine to make the best Italian food I have ever eaten and the best dining experience in a few years. 10/10 would recommend to anyone wanting Italian. And for their low price tag, it's criminal how underrated the restaurant is. Delicious!

Perfect little neighborhood Italian restaurant with true flavors and ingredients. Reasonable priced with wonderful service by the owners. Nothing fancy here except the quality and comfort. FOLLOW ME for more thoughtful recommendations as I travel the world  🌎

Service was great and the food was fantastic!! We had garlic bread with cheese and a pepperoni pizza, both were delicious! We were so full but had to try their gelato and it did not disappoint. It was a tasty treat to finish off the meal. Highly recommend sitting on their patio to enjoy a beautiful evening

Family owned. Great thin crust pizza. The best in town. Located by the Trump hotel. Outdoor seating available. Rolled Eggplant appetizer is so good! Chicken Parm sandwich was just okay. The Caprese Salad is my favorite. Light and refreshing. Reasonably priced. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a quick , casual bite to eat in Chicago.

Before I get into the review, this place is located inside the River Plaza at 405 N. Wabash.  Turn at the River Plaza sign off N. Wabash and follow the sidewalk into the River Plaza building.

Stopped by during lunch while visiting Chicago.  I've had all the usual deep-dish pizzas and other well-known pizza places in Chicago, so wanted to try someplace different.  It was lunchtime during the week, but it was not too crowded.  There's about 10 tables both inside and outside, but it was a rainy day so opted for the inside.  They don't sell individual slices, but the small 10" pizza is only 4 reasonable slices.  Service was very fast and friendly.

Ordered the 10" Capricciosa pizza which took about 10-15 minutes to arrive.  Pizza was straight out the oven and looked great.  Crust was a good thickness, crispy, just the right amount of sauce, and there was a generous amount of ingredients.  They also have desserts such as gelato, tiramisu, cannolis, and cookies.  I was too full for anything big, so just ordered 2 cookies after another customer recommended them.  It was a good recommendation.

Nice hidden gem for good pizza.  Good food and service.

I've been to this wine bar multiple times and it never disappoints. The wine selection is great and reasonably priced. The environment is great and flexible - to catch up with friends or start out a relaxed, no pressure, date. I enjoy the dim lighting and the fireplace over the winter. The waiters are friendly and attentive without being overbearing. All in all, I would recommend this bar to anyone.

Pretty laid back place and keeps a classy feel. We either didn't catch it or can't remember the bartender's name, but The Bearded Gentleman, TBG, was the best. Visiting Chicago for the first time, he was extremely friendly, hilarious, and gave us some great advice for the city. It wasn't busy when we were there and he definitely made the wine bar the best place of many we visited. Lucky for us, bottles are half off Mondays. Go sip a glass or two and enjoy your night.

This place has been a favorite of mine for the past 8 years.  It's a lovely neighborhood spot.  The atmosphere is quite nice without being pretentious, with fantastic food & drink to match.

This makes for a wonderful friendly hangout, with the right ambience for a fantastic date spot as well.

One of my wife's favorite places on the city. Their wine flights are awesome, and the cheese plates are really good too. It's very cozy and comfortable, and the real fireplace makes it great for a cold winter day.

My now fiance and I went to DOC Wine Bar after we go engaged with her sister and her fiance. It was the most amazing experience. The atmosphere was relaxing and warm when it was freezing outside. They reserved a table for us and had the bottle of Zinfadel ready for us to celebrate. The servers were extremely friendly and fantastic and all congratulated us. We are from St. Louis but when we come up to Chicago again we will DEFINITELY return!!!

Very nice place for a date. Food was very well prepared though there was an awful lot of fat on my steak. Food was flavorful, nice Peruvian music and even a love performance. Eventhough I do not understand Spanish, was still entertaining and set the mood for the cuisine. Great place.

I visited with my wife during the Chicago restaurant week, and the was somewhat decent. The food was flavorful (especially the ceviche) and plentiful. The pisco drinks are the specialty and are great. Waiters and busboys are very nice. Thank you pisco restaurante 😻

Good fresh delicious food. Generous portions at good pricing. Delivery and dine in visits have been great.  Delivery or dining in has been timely. Appetizers have been delicious. Dining in has good service with nice selection of alcoholic drinks.
Had a Groupon for this place. People are kind. Food and portions are nice for the price. Totally try the new fashion if you like sweet drinks. Would return again.

Food was good. Waitress was ok. The only issue was we were I big group and when we got the bill it was all messed up. The taste of the food was par to similar restaurants but not above, could be better.

Stopped by for lunch during the weekend and was very happy we made the choice! Easy walking distance from the science & industry museum, and the nearby bus stop. It’s a cute little diner with a lovely atmosphere. Staff is friendly and service is fast. Food is reasonably priced and generously sized. Everything you could ask for in casual Greek fare. Has a huge menu for breakfast and brunch items too! We tried Nick’s Delight and Souvlaki. Meat was tender and flavorful. They have soup specials each day of the week and the egg lemon soup was fabulous. Definitely check it out if you’re nearby!
We had the fried shrimp,  gyro plate and fried chicken dinner.  We normally come for breakfast,  but the dinner was not bad.

Small breakfast diner atmosphere great service and fantastic food! We ordered breakfast! The orange juice was squeezed right from an orange the waffles and pancakes were great our waitress was on top of her job today with friendly and fast service glad we tried this place! Everything was cooked perfectly and served quick as well!

The restaurant was nice. Honestly the only good thing that was good was their pancakes, I really didn't like their turkey sausage like that and I definitely didn't like their orange juice 🤢 I'd say this is one of those type of restaurants where you would meet an old friend and buy a cup of coffee. Other than that, its an eh for me.

Great Food and service! I loved the chocolate chip pancakes and hash browns. The server was also very polite and accommodating. Great place to break for lunch when visiting the Museum of Science nearby (10 min walk)

They moved one door down into a completely brand new space. It’s brighter and more updated. The working space also feels cleaner. Glad they’re back after a long renovation hiatus! Same great team as before.

I tried their newer location on 10/8/22 sometime in the later part of the afternoon. The place was bigger and more staff from the lasts time I visited with the older and much smaller location before. The staff was friendly and fast, the food was set up properly, cleanliness with plenty of meat to spare. Plus, I lucked out, one of the customers in line gave me a coupon for two footlong Subs for $12.99.

Subway is the healthiest and greatest deal I've had in Chicago NIH National Institute of Health recommends for one to eat 40% of their diet should be fruits and vegetables one Subway alone 6 in easily takes care of that requirement I like the deal bogo 50 buy one get one 50% off 2 ft longs for under $15 how could you beat that plus 175 points when you a amass 200 points it's $2 less at the cashier how could you beat that I'll always be a Subway fan cuz I have a voracious appetite

It was open, and I was hungry. That gets one stars. I was saved by what I realized was the manager, as she'd ask me a question, and then turn to another employee while I was answering,turn back to me and ask the same question again. She just walked away after handing me my receipt with my sandwich still on her side of the register. I reached over the register to get it and left. Another feature is the locked restroom which require a pin code to enter.

Whenever I've stopped here for food the people working here have been very rude and unhelpful to me. Every other Subway in the country that I have been to have had very friendly workers most of whom will go out of their way to strike up a conversation with me. Not this place though. The food tasted pretty good at least and the restaurant seemed clean. Something else that is not the restaurants fault was the other customers eating there had the look of hate in their eyes.

This place is awesome for Ethiopian food (take-out; they have like 5 tables, but take it and eat at home, or get it delivered). I'm often wary myself about a restaurant serving two really different cuisines (Ethiopian and Chinese), but the Ethiopian is delicious. I didn't try the Chinese, so I can't comment.

I spoke with one of the owners who works weekends, Dobaro, and I encouraged him to stick with the Ethiopian, although I imagine Chinese would sell better. In any case, he told me that it's surprisingly hard to find a Chinese chef. When they do get one, then I would say it's good for Chinese as well. But Ethiopian food is generally better than Chinese anyway!

So the food is awesome, and Dobaro is even more awesome. I think another big sell for this place is probably that it delivers! I don't know of any other Ethiopian places that deliver. Also, this isn't important to me, but this place is Halal! They buy their meat from a Halal butcher on Devon. So if Halal matters to you, then you finally have a place to eat some Ethiopian! If you're skeptical, they will show you the receipt from the Halal butcher.

In summary: EAT (Ethiopian food) AT LAKE LANGANO!
Wouldn’t suggest eating here found a bug in my food and the guy serving tried to rub it off like it was nothing

Excellent service, welcoming and friendly atmosphere. You can tell by the quality of food and service, the people working there take pride in whay they do! Will definitely return, 100% recommended if you're looking for a quick bite befkre the train ride home 🙃
They treat me great and they had my food ready right away
They wouldn't take my coupon for a free slice.

Ordered veggie egg rolls, as usual, but today they’re awful, can’t even eat them.
These are pre-made and the filling is mushy.
The flavor of the fried rice is way off.
Time to find a new place to go.

Since new ownership the quality of the food is not the same. Eggrolls are not egg rolls and are terrible. The orange chicken was not spicy and second time order was wrong. Time to look for new place to order from.

Super disappointed! Changed owner 2 months ago and the quality of food is terrible now. I’ve been going here since I was kid and super sad to say I will never be going back! The eggrolls are the worst I’ve ever had, very bland fried rice. Please avoid this place at all costs!
Worst food ever. No flavor, chicken was slimey with hard pieces in it. Egg roll was not a traditional Chinese egg roll but more of like a frozen Aldi egg roll.

Be careful! Bad, smelly, salty, and old food - dirty restaurant in need of inspection! Avoid if you don't want to get sick. Also delivery orders go missing even if paid for and management doesn't reimburse for missing food. Bad customer service.
Good Calzon pepperoni! One for two persons is good for lunch or dinner!

Loved the pizza slices!! Got them fresh out of the oven thanks to the cashier who told me if I was willing to wait an extra 10 mins I can get my slices fresh!! And I chose to wait and wasn't disappointed!! I been coming to this place over the past 5 years or more and im never disappointed by the service or the infamous pizza slices!!

Great place!
Great pizza!
I had the deep dish with sausage, mushrooms & giardiniera... that giardiniera was so fresh-- it was like a smack in the face!
My kid loved the calzones.
Great staff & super nice Owner.
Go.
Go right now.

The pizza was big I got a single slice and it was bigger than my head it was good but it wasn't hot I like my Pizza Hut so I'm giving in a three but besides that the pizza was effing big for a single slide
Pretty good with the slices... I liked it ... Almost gave me new York styled pizza

Had a great meal before a show. Food was excellent and came out quickly from the kitchen. All the food had great flavor and texture, very fresh. Presentation was awesome as well. Staff were friendly and helpful. A small jazz trio performed and it created an amazing atmosphere. Highly recommended.

Food is fabulous. Very fresh seafood, menu reasonably price, and food is well worth it.  Friendly staff, attentive to allergy  issues and ensured all proper precautions were taken.  No reservation or wait to get seated.  Very short wait from time of order until food arrived.   Will definitely go here again when back in Chicago.

Super classy restaurant to enjoy a wonderful meal. Amazing dining room especially with the live music. Plates are full and beautifully put together. The only negative - the menu is so good, it's difficult to choose one dish. You'll most likely have to come back multiple times. Highly recommended!

The food is delicious and the patio has a nice atmosphere. I had the cup of seafood gumbo, a strawberry bubbly margarita, and my entree was braised short rib and crab stuffed shrimp with crispy brussels sprouts. Everything tasted amazing. My waiter was very attentive and positive.

Catch 35 is a nice restaurant located on Wacker Drive just across the street from the Chicago Riverwalk. The service was great and ambience is nice. The food was just okay to me. Not really much to write home about. The salmon was good! The ice cream reminded me of the great value brand at Walmart 🥴 Nevertheless, it’s worth a try and you judge it for yourself.

Uncommon Ground (the Central Perk of Chicago??) has good food and great service, but I wasn't down with the horrible 80's music and vibe (Michael Jackson-- three freaking songs, no less-- and "The Boss" can die horrible musical deaths for all I care).

Food: vegan hash and the chilaquiles were both tasty and with a kick to them.

Coffee was decent as well.

The seats were uncomfortable though.

Visited the lake view location before a Cubs game a week ago. Outstanding service. Excellent food - such a fresh selection and super cool art vibe. Don’t miss the roasted cauliflower- Chicken sandwich was soooo good. Will definitely return!

We happened to pass this gem on our way to a sushi restaurant. My wife read organic brewery on the window and we decided to stop on our way  back to the train after dinner.
We had the best experience here!
It started with the host greeting us and making us feel welcome. It seemed that he was slightly confused because we were asking some fairly odd (odd because they probably should have been obvious!) questions, such as “Is this a coffee shop? Can we sit down?” He took it in stride and realized we didn’t know what we actually walked into. Turns out this place is a brewery AND a roaster of fine coffee!
My wife had the chai, our friend had a slightly(!) adult beverage, and I had a stout. We also ordered the bread pudding. I highly recommend the stout. Absolutely delicious! I enjoyed the bread pudding and the chai as well, but, damn! I’m going to go back for that stout!

If you happen to be wondering around Wrigleyville and you need coffee and beer and bread pudding and a great time, stop by Uncommon Ground. You will not regret it.

We sure as hell didn’t.
Felt a little average. Outdoor seating / service / drinks were great. Food was just OK. Folks around us did not seem to be enjoying their meals either.  Eggs Benedict were dry.

Super good place! Was looking to try something new and this place is a nice gem!
Good food options (brunch specials)
Great service 👌👌
Nice outdoor seating🙌
Pleasant experience overall on a lovely saturday afternoon
Meat is seasoned perfectly and cooked well while retaining it's moisture. Definitely would come back! Great food, but service could be a little more amiable.

Food is reasonably priced and tasty, but service is lacking, perhaps because they are understaffed. Didnt appreciate not being greeted or seated until we asked a cook, having to repeatedly ask for water, and waiter bringing our dessert sans two ingredients.
Great restaurant ,polite employees and delicious food.
Super good meat. Not a fan of the hummus
Good food, appealing place, and nice workers.

Found this diner while put for an early tour. Traditional diner in a vintage building lobby. The decorative lobby does add to the dining experience. Really nice, big menu. They seem pretty busy, but the staff are bustling and taking care of people quickly and pleasantly. The food was great. Highly recommended for breakfast.

Definitely consider stopping here if you are walking around the loop during breakfast time. It is a wonderful little Cafe in a beautiful building which has a tall ceiling and nice little tables. I got the eggs benedict and also a screwdriver. The screwdriver had the right kick to it to help me get through the soreness of walking over a dozen miles the day before, and the eggs Benedict were extremely flavorful. The staff were also helpful and friendly.

I had a wonderful omelette, called "veggie lovers" with onions, mushroom, spinach. I don't like bell peppers so I had them replaced with avocado. They don't accept substitutions and charged me for the avocado but it's fair enough as the omelette was simply lovely.
Courteous staff and spectacular location inside the liberty-style Pittsfield building. I'll come back!

Cool place off the beaten path a bit. True diner style where they have a bit of everything which is equally good. Definitely worth the stop. Pictures are of the French toast and one of their skillets, but you honestly can't go wrong with anything here. I personally had the Santa Fe breakfast burrito. Would do again. Also conveniently located near memorial park so you freely visit the bean after.

The staff was super friendly and welcoming! However, the cafe was pretty busy. My party and I arrived before 11AM, but by the time a waiter was able to attend to us, it was only minutes past the 11AM cut off for the specialty breakfast items. The food was good but not amazing. I noticed my avocado was a little spotty, but that's just me nitpicking. Overall, not a bad spot to eat at if you happen to be nearby!

Just a side note to anyone who is sensitive to loud noises - the staff cleaning and dumping the plates is near the seating areas, which means you can hear the dishes clattering quite often.

UPDATE: I was told by another manager after I called that I’d be refunded. Never happened (on an almost $100 order).

Ordered again tonight against my better judgment. The one and only topping I wanted, asked for extra of, and paid for, was not in the pizza. Domino’s makes it impossible to get a real resolution absent a manager like Tricia reaching out. Pizza points? So I have to spend more money because you refuse to refund me the money I paid for something I did not receive? Absolutely not.

I haven’t had this experience before this one store so I’m inclined to say, HIRE BETTER STAFF

The person preparing my order declined to read a single request (meaning toppings I paid for), sent burnt food, neglected to include sides I paid for, and when I called to request a refund, he told me it wasn’t a big deal because it was “just one pizza”. Well, that pizza was for a  specific 7 yo and that meant she did not eat because the pizza wasn’t right. Even if that wasn’t the case, he had the audacity to brush me off after lazily sending out an incomplete, burnt food order. Never using this location again and generally order weekly.

Take your chances with the other dominos. Randy needs a course on customer service. Now I’m being contacted by the driver after leaving my food on the public, dirty ground! The order is completed, there should be no reason you’re texting me!

I came in and ordered a cheesy bread and had to wait over 20 mins only for me to get it and it not only be burnt but no cheesy even though I asked for extra cheese and extra butter and got neither when I went back I stood there for about five mins before some greeted me I told them the issue and they remade my order which I had to wait another 20 mins for this isn’t the first time I have had poor service here and I honestly won’t be back

This has to be literally the worst dominos I’ve ever experienced also I never leave reviews NEVER but they got my order wrong completely I tryed to call the store to have them just fix it and they kept answering the phone then immediately putting me on hold so the phone does not ring for them ive tryed about 10 times until I ultimately gave up they close at 12 but I was calling to fix my order at 11 so they had ONE WHOLE HOUR before closing and they still kept ignoring my calls now I’m stuck with a pizza I can’t even eat
Fair prices for excellent and very fresh fish plus vegan options which makes it fun for everyone.

Tables were tiny and space felt tight. Service was good - we had a trainee as our server so leaving room for some grace there.

Great for a date - any larger parties and you're fighting for elbow room.

Very interesting layout of the restaurant. It's definitely bigger than one would expect. They have outdoor, indoor, upstairs and balcony seating.

Pretty busy place - be sure to make reservations!

The most worth it restaurant I've been to do far in river north. Delicious and filling Italian food without breaking the bank. Flavors were well balanced in every dish. Recommending it as a stop for when my family visits.
Despite a little bit of a wait, our waitress was awesome and the service was prompt.
It's a very busy restaurant, so expect bustling and noise.

We went for lunch on a Tuesday and had a great experience at the bar. Special thanks to the manager Nick and bartender David for taking such good care of us.

I drank some “grapefruitcello” (which is made in house) and it was very tasty. Also had the chicken Parmesan, which was delicious. Couldn’t find a fault with the whole experience if I tried.

It’s also a very big restaurant, and I’ve definitely seen it packed before for dinner. See pictures for different dining areas, also great for private events (from past experiences).

I would definitely recommend this restaurant to tourists and locals. The staff is also really good at remembering locals.

Fantastic dining experience.  Small plates, good wine list, yummy mixed drinks and tasty desserts.  We had the veal meatballs, salmon, roasted peppers, artisan sausage, and caramelized banana dessert, plus drinks.  Excellent service and absolutely incredible food.  The roasted peppers were perfectly charred, the salmon cooked with capers and cherry tomatoes that were melt-in-your-mouth delicious. Great selection, fast service and pleasant atmosphere indoors and out.  Popular place so get there early (5-6pm) or make a reservation.

Cute restaurant with ample indoor and outdoor seating. Portions are small which I liked. Fresh, authentic food didn’t leave me feeling heavy as other Italian restaurants do. Fettuccine Alfredo was delish. Try the tiramisu for dessert but share it. Quite large but oh so yummy. Restroom was upstairs which is a problem if you can’t climb the stairs. Didn’t see an elevator, but didn’t ask. Will definitely return.

9/2021  Interesting Greek restaurant.  Food was pretty good.  Not outstanding, but pretty good.  Service was ok.  Nothing special to say about them here.  Menu is typical.  Had breakfast with our party and they all enjoyed it.  Pretty old and din gee.  Few people in the restaurant when we were there.  And we were there for over 2 hours.  I would go back.  But not my first choice.  It is convenient next to the hospital though.

This restaurant has been here a long time. Their menu has gone through several revisions but it's managed to remain affordable. The decor is a bit dated but the service is excellent. Not sure how late they're open but it's a great place to get breakfast. I had a vegetarian skillet, added some bacon for a well rounded breakfast. It was excellent!

Worst BLT Club I’ve ever had and I use to love this restaurant. You can tell it’s not the original owner and staff. The place was dead on a Friday afternoon and their soda machine was broken so I was given a can of warm coke and a glass of ice.

The French fries were hot with no salt and tasted as if they were frozen.

The sandwich had slices of old tomatoes.

Overall atmosphere of this place was old, outdated and definitely not current.

I wouldn’t recommend anyone going to this place and save your money.

We had Absolutely Amazing Experience at Hilltop. Warm welcoming staff, positive ambiance with mouthwatering food. Well cleaned and maintained place. We had Chicken Soup, French Toast Combo and Chicken Sandwich. Everything was delicious. Quantity and Quality both are perfect. Lady serving the food is helpful and courteous. She was happy to help us to choose what we want and recommended several items as well.

The owner Hernen was on the register and he welcomed us and was happy to serve us.  I am definitely coming back next week!

Good Luck Guys!
Great prices. Our waiter was really genuine,  had great customer service and was very attentive. I would highly recommend. Thanks.

Pretty good sushi restaurant.
Very friendly staff.
Inside / outside eating that was comfy and roomy.
Lots of menu options.
Kind of pricey but on Roscoe St. so makes sense.
Probably a better deal to go to all-you-can-eat sushi, but for sit down style sushi, this was really good.

Ordered takeout from here on DoorDash the other day and it was some of the best sushi takeout I’ve had in Chicago! Super fresh and came really quickly, all the rolls had great flavor. I got these 4 rolls and would order the same thing the next time. Yum!

Super friendly server, but the guy behind the counter didn't seem to be in the best mood.. only had 2 sushi rolls, but the spicy shrimp and Philly were good. Standard quality.. nothing necessarily to write home about but was good

Excellent food, though the sushi lagged our kids' more conventional dishes. Loved the mai tai served in a big glass shaped like an ancient Hawaiian God. Outdoor seating on a beautiful summer evening was perfect.

The lunch specials are a really good deal and if you're with a friend the variety is good as you can get a Thai food item as well as a plate of sushi to share. The Crab Rangoon was super good and you can never go wrong with Thai iced tea.

The tacos are absolutely delicious. My biggest difficulty was in picking which ones I wanted to try. I will be back to try the rest! Food was served promptly. The beer and liquor selection was good, too. Lots of local options.

Big star tacos it’s a very popular taco venue in Bucktown/wicker park . The restaurant sitting  area is mainly outside in a simple relaxed environment. Their tacos are OK. They offer a decent variety with some creative options like the vegetarian taco in a bag. Their drinks menu (mainly margaritas and beer) lifts up the place. Margaritas pitchers are reasonably priced.

Delicious and fun stop! The salad is $10 and is very large and filling, it could be split between two people. The restaurant has a great ambiance and the service is very attentive. Huge bar selection as well, specials and happy hour on weekdays.

Mixed feelings about this place. The nachos were hands down the best plate, delicious and fully loaded. The tacos were okay, some lacked flavor more than others. Chicken and fish we’re good, potato and pork belly were okay. The boozy slushy we got was STRONG. Big win there. The service was pretty bad… food came out fast but waiters are also tending bar and they seemed overwhelmed.
Yummy tacos.  Al pastor was the best.  The food came within minutes of ordering.  Good service and drinks.

They only offer small sized pizzas, service is quick and efficient . Staff was friendly enough as well. Options are sometimes limited - like when I went on Sunday they only had small pepperoni and cheese no vegitarian available. Using the fountain dispenser was kind of confusing as well but the lady at the desk was nice enough to tell me how to use it.

Unfortunately I was disappointed. I thought Pizza Hut would all be the same, like back home. But here it was horrible. I ended up ordering Aurelio's pizza. Now that pizza went beyond my expectations.  Just like how their crust was crispy. There was a perfect amount of cheese in every slice, and the toppings were cooked to its perfection. Would definitely order at Aurelios again! Aurelios no debate best pizza ever!

I ordered a personal pizza combo, which comes with breadsticks. They were out of breadsticks, so I asked what they can substitute. The answer was nothing. Nothing. My money was stolen. I didn't get the full value for my meal. Neither of the people working cared (03/01/20 @ 3:30 pm). Wasn't even offered a receipt, I guess so I couldn't know the name of the person who robbed me. Don't eat here unless you're starving and seconds from death.

Beat pizza hut express I've ever been to. I've never been to one that produces personal pain pizzas that could have come from a standard pizza hut. Usually they look and taste like they were made in a microwave and served at a school or hospital cafeteria. . .
Lady at the counter refused to make a pizza saying, "I'm only doing snacks" Highly dissatisfied from unprofessional customer service
The place serves large portions and for affordable pricing. nice staff members. 5 stars from me.

Took my girlfriend here for Valentine's day 2011 (first time at Balsan for both of us), and I don't think we could have been more pleased.  The food was excellent - appetizers, entrées, and desert - all 5 out of 5.  Although modern, the atmosphere was very warm and pleasant.  The service was also very friendly and inviting.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.  Its a bit pricey, but the entire experience was definitely worth it.

The Balsan is beautiful, located in the Waldorf Astoria Hotel.Walking through the site sets high expectation for the guest. Unfortunately beyond aesthetics the European style food leaves little to be desired - its a mismash of italian, french, and everything else. Worse than the highly priced food, was the service. The waiter was pulling our plates before we were completely done.... not sure it worth the visit.

Delicious mussels and appetizers (the potted eggplant is a good bet). Good place to have a private dinner party too because they have a large classy room with dedicated wait staff. The wine is really good and even though it's a bit pricey, I felt like we were getting more than our money's worth.

Keep your eye on Balsan, because it's going to be making headlines soon on the Chicago restaurant scene.

We went there for dinner and were flat out blown away by the taste and quality of every single dish that graced our table.  The charcuterie and cheese plate that we started with was to die for--some of the finest melt-in-your-mouth foie gras and prosciutto, and the cheeses were exquisite.  I moved on to a salad of young lettuces that I had no particular expectations of, but was sent reeling by the intense taste--the dressing was a work of art, and it took an incredible amount of restraint to not ask for a glass of it.

And on to the spare rib.  Oh, the spare rib--at this point I didn't know how I'd even be able to eat it as I was already pretty full, but as soon as I took one bite, I knew I'd have no problem polishing the whole thing off.  Finished off the night with a great cup of French press coffee and the pear financier.  Fabulous.

Oh, and lastly, they carry a whole variety of rye whiskies, which means that they know how to make a real Manhattan, and let me tell you, it was one of the best Manhattans I've ever had.  I can't wait to go back.
Balsan is an beauitiful upscale refined restuarant . I had their sunday supper menu. excellent deal and wonderful food.

Had a fantastic time at Clutch Chicago for their happy hour! The drinks were all fantastic (that dehydrated lime on the mule and margs is so beautiful and such a nice touch!!), the ambiance is spectacular, and the food was also amazing. The chef came out to tell us about the latest specials added to the menu, and all of the staff treated us so kindly. Our server Bianca was super cute and sweet. :) as a vegan, i was so happy to have a veg option on the menu with the Beyond Burger, and it just so happens that the Caesar Salad’s dressing is automatically vegan! Highly recommend Clutch for a fun summer outing with friends.

LOVE Blüm! It so cute inside with all the flowers! Great place to hangout with friends or have a party. We went for brunch and the food there was absolutely delicious. I usually don’t like oysters but these were the BEST oysters I’ve ever had. We also ordered the breakfast croissant, biscuits & gravy and the Cesar salad. Drink menu was so fun and creative. My favorite would be the margarita tower! highly recommend checking them out!

Beautiful restaurant/bar! The staff was lovely, provided an outstanding service. The manager is a really nice person! Our drinks were strong and worth the money, and the pretzel we ordered was really good, not to mention it could possibly feed 4 people. We are definitely coming back. Big thanks! The only thing to keep in mind is the restaurant charges a venue fee and a service fee.
I really enjoyed this place. It's so pretty, airy and feels like a girl's ethereal dream. The food and drinks were soooo good! Good staff. I will definitely be back.

Loved ladies night here!

This is definitely a standout spot in River North with the beautiful decor, happy hour/ladies nights deals, and attention to quality in the food. Usually with the done-up spots in the city there’s usually a piece of the puzzle lacking, but I felt that service, food quality, atmosphere, and music were all great!

The drinks during ladies night were $8 each, with shots being $5 each which was an awesome deal in the city. The food was definitely more upscale than the normal bar food you’d expect, the chef even presented the food and told us how he only sources top grade tuna for the ahi-ahi, and that a lot of thought goes into the quality of the ingredients which I appreciated. Stand out menu items were the $5 chicken skewers on ladies night that come with hummus, the lobster Mac, and crab Rangoons! The $10 ladies night sliders were also delicious.

The spot gives off too Miami vibes and I learned it was designed after “Kiki on the river” which they definitely nailed with a lot of beauty throughout. This is the perfect spot to bring your girlfriends in the city!

The food here is really kind of the star of the shelf for somebody that's not in Ohio buckeye fan anyway... The southern fried chicken sandwich ( not original) is definitely top five in the city hop for the spicy mayo on the side.  The cheese curds are absolutely top two in the city.  The chicken tenders looked amazing I would say probably definitely top five in the city... This is some pretty high numbers for a bar with a ton of taps good selections of beer and actually pretty comfortable atmosphere. Will definitely be back. The service was great too, I have to say just not all around top 10 bar in Chicago

Okay, SO pleasantly surprised. We wandered in here after being turned away from a few of the “trendy” Southport spots on a Monday night. The patio was open and we grabbed a couple beers. Our server was actually awesome, giving us recommendations and somehow having a sixth sense as to when we needed him. I *think* from the receipt that his name was Alejandro?

After round 2, we realized it was $4 all drafts. What?!?!?!?! I didn’t think this existed in Chicago anymore. We of course ordered a third round and some tenders and fries. Again, surprised as the food was delicious!!! Perfect bar food. HUGE selection of drafts, great patio, great food, great service. We will definitely be back!
Happy they were opened for a weekday lunch during “off season”. Not trendy…. In a great way. Large out door seating. Get the fries - great seasoning!
Was a little disappointed they don't have bottomless mimosas anymore. Food and service was good. Clean environment. They have two floors for seating. Overall good experience.
Old school bar with a great selection of tap beers and drink specials.  We sampled the Southport burger paired with the 18th St draft .. quite good ))

Surprises don’t happen that often to me when go to the new restaurants but this one does. Everything in the food menu meant to be shared, portion sizes perfect for two and run by courses. Menu probably change every season too. Food come out looking or tasting anything like I imagined, but so tasty. There are perfectly salty, spicy and not too much of anything.
Cocktails here are good too. There are simple but well balance of alcohol and mix. Services are excellent as well.
I ordered four dishes and still have room for excellent cheese cake and port wine for dessert.

I don’t understand how there isn’t just a constant line around the block for this place. It was amazing! I happened to come in on Taco Tuesday.  They offer one meat and one veggie type each week.  I had the mushroom taco and for $2 it was a STEAL: so fresh, and earthy.  The bacon jam was slightly sweet, and more subtle in flavor than I expected. It paired perfectly with the ricotta.  That combination on the smoky toasted ciabatta was the perfect appetizer with wine.  My favorite was the octopus: it was SO tender.  The charred romaine, citrus dressing and fresh corn that came with it just took the dish over the top.

The staff couldn’t be any nicer, honestly.

I want to say it’s my favorite restaurant in the city, but I’ve only been here once. I guess I’ll just have to return 🤷🏻‍♀️

Great culinary experience and fun spot overall. Very friendly staff. The drinks menu, though not broad, is inventive, and the food is great. Try the duck fettuccini for sure.

There were some logistical issues the night we were there, and our wait was a bit on the long side. Without being prompted, the restaurant very courteously addressed this and it made us really appreciate the place all the more.

First, I appreciated the fact that they sat us w/o having a reservation. The staff was very welcoming. Nice seating but the lighting was really dim, which made it difficult for my date to see the menu. Like the concept of ppl sharing their plates w/each other to creating a spirit of sharing; hence, the name of the restaurant...."TWO" We had a Salmon and Hanger Steak plate. The Salmon was just okay but the Steak was one of the best tasting from a restaurant!

Delicious, family sharing style new american fare with a ginormous selection of drinks. They have a seasonal menu and all ingredients are sourced fresh from farms. Chicken Roulade and Herbed Ricotta Cavatelli with Grilled Chicken are must-haves if they are on the menu. For the smaller plates, Green Beans with Roasted Peanuts stood out because of the sauce and the the interplay of flavors. Duck Egg Fettuccine, which they claimed to be their signature dish was a little bit of a let-down. Service, ambience, presentation, and vibe were all on point for a comfort, upscale dining experience as you'd expect from a Michelin Bib-gourmand. Would recommend 7-8 shared plates for a party of 5. Standard meals with drinks would fall around the $45 mark per person. Shout-out to Zelle for her service and picks.

I just ordered a side of rice and a steak taco.the rice they gave me was old and the taco was very greasy. So I called and told them that the rice they gave me was old but the lady and the man in the store insisted that it wasn’t.so I asked them when was this rice made they told me at 4:00 and that it’s fresh.this rice isn’t fresh it’s been sitting out for 3 hours.I’m a paying customer if asked for my food to be fresh I want my food fresh. I will never buy anything from them again.

Love this restaurant on my way there now to pick up Tacos for my family. Coming from the north side😉😉😉 Their milkshake are the best. They never disappoint.I like my milkshake stiff the best. Thank you. The staff is awesome 👌 👏 👍 😍 💖

I literally asked the woman about a burrito dinner. I told her exactly what I wanted. She could've explained that the burrito dinner comes with fries instead of beans and rice like I wanted. But instead just assumed I was talking about another meal. Even after I told her it was my first time eating there. She then points up to the menu at the top. But I spoke directly to you. Why does the menu matter if we are speaking to each other? She clearly doesn't listen or execute orders. Then won't take accountability for a misunderstanding. It's my money so I want what I pay for. I don't want fries with a burrito. I want beans and rice for a side. The place was clean. But you can't eat there. Get a better listener who gives information better.

There's a reason why I stopped going here about a year ago. I'm not sure if the owners changed, but the quality and taste of the food has diminished greatly. The prices have gone up but not because the food is better.  The 2 pics attached are of a nacho supreme and cheese fries. The nacho supreme comes with ground beef, tomatoes, sour cream, lettuce. I don't eat meat but the price of the nachos did not change without the meat, ok fine. The cheese that they use now is really thick and tastes nothing like nacho cheese. The lettuce looks like they tore it instead of cutting it and the overall appearance was thrown together. The same thick cheese on the nachos is the same thick cheese on the fries. Nothing brag worthy about the food and I won't be going back anytime soon. I'll just make the trip to Raymond's.

I order food with enough time to be delivered passed 11:30pm still no delivery then I get a receipt that it had been delivered it never came.  I would like my money refunded.  I was so disappointed it places like these that bring business that bring business down for everyone.  embarrassed by their actions never again REFUND MY MONEY REPORTING TO BBB

What a fun place to celebrate a birthday! I was there to celebrate my girlfriend daughter's birthday. The food was delicious. Our chef, Benny, was funny and put on a great show. Be sure to bring $$$ as this is not a place to eat on an every day budget. Highly recommend Ron of Japan for a special night out!!!

6 people to one small circular table during covid.
Ok for starters we got seated at 7, chef didn’t come out until 8 to start cooking. He individually cooked everyone’s rice one by one and that alone took 35/40 mins. He didn’t even bother giving me  rice because I was the only one to get white rice. So my plate is still completely empty. Then he made the vegetables. He barely cooked them and didn’t season them at all. But nothings worse than when he cooked the meat. He was taking everyone’s oil from the plates being tilted and throwing it back on the grill. During covid!

This man used chopsticks to individually place each piece of meat down one by one. When he was finally done cooking it was past 10 and they were closing and I kid you not. He took 3 shrimp & a half a chicken breast and put it on my plate. I say there starving for THREE SHRIMP and a half a chicken breast. I will never be back. I ordered my cousin the same combination dish as me to go. 3 orders of this cost me $401. Almost $100 in service charge, tax and gratuity for 3 shrimp and a half chicken breast. At least the yo go orders had more than 3 shrimp

We had an ok experience for our first time visit here.  Food was delicious, our cook was super nice, our server was FANTASTIC. However....reservation was for 7pm. I watched many people come and go and we were literally the second last table to get a cook. Meal started at about 8:36pm. My parking expired at 9:15pm. It's now 9:50pm and I'm finally on my way home. We were given one complimentary drink even tho we had already ordered 2 prior to that one drink offer. At the cost per plate I feel like the manager could have at least offered 2 since there were 2 adults. I probably won't go back again.

What can I say about Ron of Japan? This place is a gem. Truly a place of wonder! Now you might be wondering why I’m saying this and that’s because I’VE NEVER HAD hibachi as good as this. Seriously get the shogun dinner and a few drinks and tell me it’s not the greatest place. Is it expensive? Yes definitely but you are paying for amazing food and drinks. This is the place if you want delicious lobster and steak cooked with egg yolk sauce that will make you die. Their staff and atmosphere is top notch. I love this place so much I drove out of town again just to come here it’s that good.

I took my mother there for her birthday for the first time I was in town and since we mainly go to Benihana  I thought to switch it up plus it’s close to all the shopping but from the moment we stepped in the girls at the hostess stand were very welcoming especially ( carina I think that’s her name) but it was our chef Juan that took it over the top he’s a true gem we’ll definitely return in hopes of getting him again but to be fair everyone was nice that we encountered food was nice and portions

Great place for an upscale breakfast for two. Menu had a variety of offerings and coffee tasted so good. Our server, Emilie, was attentive yet not overbearing. We'll be back on a non-rainy day to enjoy the patio seating.
Great place for an after work happy hour! Charcuterie board had really fresh meats and cheeses.  All the appetizers were really good and the specialty drinks were tasty.

While in Chi-town planned to go to ZOUP next door and decided try this place since the weather was nice and they had outdoor seating. The hostess was very nice and accommodating. We sat in a partially shaded area and she came out and moved us to a shaded table‼️ Loved that attentiveness‼️

The waiter was great, the service was great, my Waldorf salad with shrimp and Lemon Aioli roasted potatoes were great  but my companions chicken bites and Caesar salad were just ok. May come back again when in Chicago.

Nice setting. Not too fancy. Great prices. Decent menu selection but simple. The Marq slider was delicious with their signature aoli. The ceviche was on point. Marq slaw was less than average so I put the ceviche on top and made a bomb salad that is keto.

Good atmosphere, great apps, and an excellent entree. I had the wagyu burger. Would recommend! Fries are amazing. The hummus appetizer was definitely a crowd favorite. The chicken sandwich sliders were a close second. Sadly the only pic I got was of the best non-alcoholic beer I’ve ever tasted.

Great selection of beers.  Tasty appetizers.  Pizza is made with fresh ingredients and is big enough for 2 people.  Very nice staff.  A convenient place to eat before or after going to the theatre across the streets.

Oh the plethora of Belgian beers they have available!!! I haven't had so much good Belgian beer in a long time, and there were so many that I still want to try!

Ordered the pulled pork pizza, which was alright. I guess I just didn't care much for the toppings, but my roomie was really excited about it, so I just went along. The crust was great, and the pizza base itself was very good. I would definitely come back again in the summer and sit out on the patio and try more Belgian beers!

Update: Cooper's is gone. Closed suddenly the owner saying that it didn't make sense to continue in an "uncertain economy" (his words) and a new lease coming due. In its place is a Filipino restaurant that I haven't tried, so I can't comment.

HUGE CHANGE IN PARKING however. The lot used to be free. It now has an attendant and it now costs you $10 to park. Given the "surge pricing" the city now applies to street parking meters because of Cubs night games and events at Wrigley Field, $10 may still be a bargain. Unless, of course, there's no space because Cubs fans have taken them all! I know!
Wrigley is 8 blocks north up on Addison, but that doesn't stop the city from gouging you whenever they can!

Pretty good food, beer selection and cocktails. They are very overpriced but their redeeming virtue is they have a large parking lot to the rear that you can use when you're attending a theater performance across the street at Stage 773 or Theater Wit. It tends to fill up fast, so get there early, stop for some food and booze, then head over to your show. The overall evening cost is pretty reasonable when you factor in the free parking.

Literally the rudest staff. The waitresses don't come back to check on you ever. I've been hung up on while making an order BY THE MANAGER and they make NO effort to accommodate their customers whatsoever, be it party size, or food requests. However the food is great.
Cooper's is a great spot in Lakeview to grab a sandwich or a salad. Excellent beer list. Half price pizza on Thursdays.
Fresh, very hot pasta with some great sauces. Love the vodka sauce on the portabella ravioli.

Ok I'm been going to this McDonald's for 14 years , it was good , now is slow dirty and the employees don't speak English, the manager she is useless, I'm been noticing when I buy the large fries they give u the same amount as the medium fries, in other McDonald's i ask them to fill it up and there's no problem, today I ask the cashier and with broken English she said no , no , you shake so no , and ignore me after, i turn to the "manager" and she stars arguing with me that I shake the fries and until I said yes because you are supposed to shake and put more u r giving me same amount of the regular size. She took my fries trowe them where all the new batch is and did the same thing, I just took them , I didn't wanted to keep arguing.

They had a 2 for $4 special and looking at the size of my purchase, it should never cost more than that. Guess I'll be going back to buying my own ingredients and making it myself. At least I know I won't have sit in a cool environment with warm food.

Eating at McDonald's  restaurant have good days and bad days.  one complaint, McDonald need to redesign their apple pies because, sometimes they be dry and they have no sauce little apple​ inside them. I always enjoy my day at McDonald's, and I  believe it's a great place to eat. I thank them for their service all time.
Service was quick but we were here on Black Friday when all the buildings were closed. Nuggets and fries were very fresh. The seating is limited and most the tables were dirty.
Staff there are the best. They're open till 7 during the weekend. Great knowing that everywhere else in the Illinois center is close.

Staff is nice and helpful. I wish they didn’t give a plastic bag to people when they are dining in. It’s super wasteful and unnecessary. Also, it’s technically illegal according to the city’s plastic bag ban law :/

The guy serving at night is very rude and has no manners. Also he is too stingy and after asking to put more sauce if he hasn’t put for the first time, he looks as if he’s doing a great favor. Very poor customer service

They have false advertising signs right now such as open 24 hours when they close at 8pm. They still have a sign up $6.00 any footlong from 10pm-10am problem is they close at 8pm and only time to get that price is maybe early morning.
Nice clean place not to many peoples in there I enjoy myself
Very nice service I loved it specially the lady name Firdos she was doing her job very well so I tipped her 200 dollars just for the work she was doing.

It was empty for a Sunday. Food was mediocre...service was ok...it was empty and we got seated quickly...they gave a lot of food on the breakfast meal. I had a cup of chicken soup...chicken was tough. I figured I couldn't go wrong with that. They didn't have crackers...but the girl brought me out some toast for no extra charge. Give her a plus for trying.

This was my first time here and I have to admit I wish I would have based my choice of trying this place out from the reviews I read prior to coming on Yelp and not taken chance. Upon walking though the door the service was terrible. The young lady who seated us had no customer service at all and was very unpleasant like she would rather be somewhere else. She didn't introduce her self nor did she give us a warm hand off to our waiter.  She was also dressed as if she was at home, not working in a professional establishment by wearing mini shorts, a t-shirt, flip flop sandals and her weave hanging all over the place. After choosing a place to sit we had to move 3 times because all of the tables were dirty. I asked the waiter if he could wipe the table he said or I can sit somewhere the table was clean. He was a lot more pleasant than the lady but now I'm ready to leave. The menu had the wrong description of certain food items that didn't match the title of choice, such at the "waffles and wings". I wouldn't recommend a soul to visit this establishment unless the management taught the staff some proper etiquette.

Food was OK - nothing special, and the prices are reasonable. My service was awful. My wife and I ordered two breakfast meals which the waitress didn't write down, and (shocker!) I got scrambled eggs instead of fried eggs and the wrong kind of toast. The eggs were fixed promptly enough but when the toast came I just said screw it and ate. One mistake is understandable, but two? After not writing it down? That's just pure laziness. If your service is going to be that bad, your food ought to be better.

Alright so let me start off this review by saying I haven't been to Clarke's since it was closed down for a bit. I would always get the same thing every time;the buffalo chicken on a bun with fries. It was always so good...until my visit today. I got my order to go,but I should've known something was going to go wrong when I came in and they had a sign on the register that said 'no refunds or exchanges'. First of all,the fries are awful. Barely any soft potato from these shoestring fries. They used to have steak fries but I figured I could live with it. On that note,the sandwich had barely any sauce on it. Back in the good 'ol days,the chicken would be drenched in sauce. I'm thinking it'll probably still be alright considering I like plain chicken just fine. I take one bite and that sandwich was drier than the Sahara desert!!!!! I have never had drier chicken in my life! I had to keep taking sips of water to moisten it just to force it down. At least the lettuce was keeping it kind of moist...but wait...lo and behold I see a small dead grey bug just chilling on the lettuce. At this point I've just about had it. I didn't even finish my fries,but kept looking at my food on the way home. All of a sudden,I look at part of the bun from the sandwich I didn't finish and there was a black hair on it! I was so livid that I wanted to cry. I wanted my $10 back and some alone time to puke and regret my recent life choices. On a positive note,the hostess that served me was very nice and polite. She didn't even charge me for the little cup I wanted to get a beverage in. But that in no way shape or form makes up for the atrocious meal I had today! If you're really craving Clarke's,try another location, because this one doesn't deserve the time of day.

I have been to this location about three times in the past two weeks, all mediocre service but decent food but this last time will definitely be my last. We all ordered burgers, my mother and I had patty melts requested to be medium well. Food arrives and our patty melts are clearly overcooked no sign of pink at all, gray and dry. I motioned for our server he comes over and I told him our burgers were overcooked. After about 10 minutes in the back, he comes back with the SAME two plates we sent back stating that they wouldn't re-cook our burgers. We asked for the manager and the server says he's going to tell you the same thing I just told you. I said "I didn't ask you that, send him over." The manager comes over and is not accommodating at all and proceeds to debate with me about the way a medium well burger should look (what ever happened to the customer is always right), so I say we don't want the burgers, he takes our plates doesn't offer any additional compensation or ask if we want something else just leaves us sitting there. Then I asked for the check and the patty melts are still on there, you've got to be kidding me?!?! There was no way in hell i was paying 20 for two burgers i didn't even eat. This is the worst service I have ever received at any establishment and i definitely won't be returning

I work in the Tower and I love grabbing lunch from this place. Their salads are the best in all of downtown! All of the employees are great, but my favorite employee there is India, she's extremely hard working, super friendly, and always gets my complicated salad options just PERFECT!

Food is good - their salads are pricey but very tasty and filling for a salad. Getting your food is always a bit of an adventure, and I'm not sure why I continue to subject myself to the torture. Multiple times now I get an email saying my food is ready, only to have to wait 15 minutes to actually pick it up. My advice would be to order early, and wait 15 minutes after receiving the order ready email. That should improve the odds to 75%+ of your food actually being there.

This is first time trying this restaurant. I ordered Chicken Pesto Parm which was absolutely delicious and healthy as well. The lady who works there is also helpful and let me choose additional add-ons.

I love it !!!!! I start working there tomorrow. Since the first day I interviewed I was totally enamored with this illustrious establishment. The head supervisor, the employees and the service provided is impeccable. Come on down and treat yourself to the amazing hot honey salad (with goat cheese), and you'll be entranced with an indescribable utopia!!!!!!!  I can't wait to start working there tomorrow morning.
I love Sweetgreen, and the people working at this location are unfailingly friendly, even when busy. It's not the fastest line in the food court, but not the slowest, either.

Just grabbed a quick drink here. The bar is open seating so we sat down immediately which was great. There was a 40 minute wait for outside tables at 8:30pm on a Saturday, so pretty average I think. I got the Honey Nut Cheers golden ale. It was really good! And the staff is so quick and friendly. We didn’t get any food so I can’t speak to that, but I would definitely come back for drinks again.

Stopped during my recent trip to Chicago with my fiancee. It was delightful. The pizza and cheesy bread we had were delicious, and the beers and cider were awesome! We never had to wait long for anything (though we were there at a less busy time, mid-afternoon) and seating near the open front of the dining area made it feel like we were outside. Our waitress was Stella, and she was wonderful - friendly and efficient. If I'm ever back in Chicago, I will do my best to make it back here for the excellent food, drinks and atmosphere!

Initially, we had nothing but good things to say. Our first server was amazing! I don't recall her name but she's tall, slim with black and blonde hair. Customer service was awesome.  We had a beer flight, pizza and a burger. Food and pics were great and then there was a shift change. Our second server never came to introduce herself. We caught her in passing to order drinks as she was rushing outside to tend the customer with the dog. We waited as she brought the dog food, played with the dog and then started playing in her hair.
