I asked if she could bring us ice for the water but also if she could wash her hands first because I had a dog allergy and saw her playing with the dog and in her hair. She stared at us and said sure but she never came back to the table.  We received the drinks from the bartender and she was a good time as well. We caught the second server in passing the second time she went to rush to the customer with the dog and we requested the bill. The server brought the bill and I requested a paper copy of the receipt. I never saw the server again. No receipt no nothing. I don't remember if she said thank you. This would have been an awesome experience but the server with the jean shorts and tan/  brown shirt was terrible. We will definitely be back because the burgers were amazing and almost all of the customer service was on point, but we will probably sit at the bar or request the initial server if she's avail next time.
It is a wonderful place to have beer. These place has a lot of beer options and their fries and cheese breads are awesome. Highly recommended.
The beer here was great, especially their flag ship shark and hipster wheat ipa. It was delicious, a perfect blend. Also the Mexican lager was excellent and smooth with a soft pallet taste.
Order beef pepper and orange chicken everything was good only down was it I take out some green peppers and it’s was like only 5 pieces of beef

I think people need to try everything for themselves to determine how it is. I almost didn’t order based on some of the reviews. For me, it was very, very good. I loved it. It’s hard to find a Chinese restaurant when all the food was amazing. This will be my go to spot for Chinese.
Food is soo good, fast cooked and really nicely served .good costumer service love this place ❤

Listen. I’ve been looking to get a Mongolian beef dish on DoorDash. Sadly, the app failed me. Boy when I tell you I went to UberEats, found this restaurant and they delivered???? Oh man. It was spicy how I love my food. Goood lawd. They delivered. It was like... my eyes rolled back. 🥲 thank y’all. Amazing food. Chef kiss!

Their menu had all the selections we like, even some that others don't offer (like Lo Mein). The ingredients were good quality. The order actually arrived faster than expected and was delicious. Plus it's nearby. Let's see if our opinion holds up after a few more orders. (Wink)

Had an amazing time in this traditional Peruvian restaurant! Every meal was well made and truly delicious. The atmosphere and the waiters also contributed to a fresh peruvian experience. Highly recommend if you don't know peruvian cuisine but you are curious to get to know it!

The service was friendly, fast, and attentive. The food was delicious. We had the Tiger’s Milk appetizer, which is a type of ceviche served in a cup. It was simply delicious! We also had a beef empanada, which was sprinkled with powder sugar bay first, I didn’t know what to make of it. But once I tasted it, it was amazing. For main entrees, we had the rice with seafood and the churrasco with a side of plantains and a side of spicy potatoes. The Peruvian paella was perfect! For dessert, we had arroz con leche - a perfect way to end our first visit to Machu Picchu.

Overall: Solid Peruvian joint if you're looking for something authentic and different. Don't be fooled by the aging outdoor sign, this place is great!

The good: The food overall is very good. The rice dishes are fantastic and all of the fish dishes that I've had are awesome. The apps are all very tasty. It seems pretty authentic. The portion sizes are good sized and the menu is varied. BYOB and no corkage.

The not-so-good: One night was very busy, but the service was pretty limited. Took forever to get the order. The lomo saltado was a little too salty. Not a super fancy restaurant or anything, could be a little cleaner.

Atmosphere: 8/10
Service: 8/10
Food: 8/10

Fresh ingredients, friendly and attentive staff, and delicious Peruvian food! BYOB too! The food was super flavourful, every single thing we ordered was really good. Loved the staff who knew a lot about the food and culture, definitely recommend this place!
Beautiful Restaurant and a special thank you to our waiter Mr. Angel for his kindness. Totally delicious and fresh food 🇵🇪

Despite the negative reviews I decided to give this place a try and it was great and will definitely be returning. The dough was perfectly steamed creating a perfect cloud like dough on each bite. The filling was full of flavor from the savory to the sweet options. This is the place to fill that craving. You will not be disappointed and I high recommend this place for a quick dinner or lunch any day. They also have a rewards program that will only make it coming back easier on the wallet!

I love bao. It's like biting into a cloud filled with tender meat. I had pretty fair expectations of what I was going to get, and it was met fairly well. The bao I got was the BBQ pork and teriyaki chicken, and my dad got the Kung pao chicken. The 2 I got were really good, but the Kung pao chicken wasn't good. We also ordered some bubble tea, but the pearls were just awful. The tea itself was really good though. We've had Wow Bao in the past, but this time wasn't as good. We still really enjoyed it, but it didn't have the same quality as last time.
They are a little expensive and worth it. I love love love their strawberry lemonade with the rainbow fruit pearls and pizza Bao. Oh and the lids are adorable…

Almost everything they have is made sweet or with some sweet sauce. Honestly, I really disliked the food here. It was my first and last experience. I asked the chef if there was something  that was not sweet or with sweet sauces or seasonings; unfortunately, all of their food is made with a little bit of sugar or sweet sauces. I never understood people who add sugar to their chicken, rice, or steaks or food thats made to be salty instead. I wasn't able to tell whether it was too sweet or too salty; it was a mixture of salty and sweet seasonings.'

Had a good experience here: great modern atmosphere and the food tasted good. The service was quick and friendly. Unfortunately the food just isn't worth the price. My quinoa bowl was really salty (and there's no hot sauce lying around) and small. The baos tasted like they were prepackaged boas from a foreign grocery store. The food isn't authentic either.  If the price were a bit lower id be happy with this place.

I've been here and ordered takeout many times but last night we ate dine-in and ordered baby egg rolls, pineapple fried rice with shrimp, and the thai red BBQ pork. An incredible meal!! The egg rolls were soooo cute and crispy and good. The fried rice was perfection -- exact ratio of greasy to savory to egg-y to sweet. I get that fried rice order at a lot of Asian restaurants but Spoon's was by far the best I've ever had. The Thai red BBQ pork was the star of the show, though. The red sauce is peanutty and light, perfectly complemented by the brown dipping sauce. A great meal at a wonderful local place with kind serving staff too.

Take out experience was lackluster. I appreciated that the food was ready faster than originally indicated, but I still had a 20-minute walk to get there when I got a text that it was ready. The egg roll order was either filled incorrectly or it was a version of egg rolls I've never had - they were fine, but strange. Our all-vegetarian order had shrimp on one dish, which may have been an oversight on my ordering part, and chicken on another, which is definitely frustrating. Perhaps if you dine in you can give better instructions, but we found everything under-spiced and in general under-flavored. The pad see ew was gloopy, the green curry had no real flavor, and the tom kha gai was pretty bland too. Loved the gyozas!

Portion sizes are pretty good. The pad thai was good, it wasn't as saucy as I like it, but it met my cravings. My bf got the green curry and he was happy with it. It came with a lot of rice and he was super full afterwards. It was medium spicy. The thai tea is okay. I think they put a lot of attention to detail with their packaging for take out, which I really appreciate. They put the tea in a separate bag in case it spills. They also wrap the utensils nicely.

We came here since I fell head over heels on Thai food. My favorite type if food and don't get me started on their Iced Thai coffee? Strong but sweet. The food is yummy but also healthy we started off with a sweet and sour cucumber salad. It was so noisy all of that crunching, then we had their egg drop soup. Then with our entrees. Not sure what she had?  But I had Pad Thai cause I love noodles dish which was wonderful. It was hot to eat and very filling. This food memory helped me enjoy this type of food. I was searching where we visited to add to my collection on here.
Consistently good Thai food especially their curries. Simple decor but comfortable and byob. Eat in, carry out or delivery.

No joke, some of the best food I’ve had in Chicago! Every item is seasoned and cooked equally to perfection. I’m mind blown at how crispy the falafel still was since I got delivery. Big portions, amazing value and packaged with intentional care. Definitely gonna be one of my go-to-places from now on. Highly, highly recommend!!

ohhhhhhh wow this was filling, price-effective, & delicious. i wasn’t sure what to expect because of its location tightly packed around other businesses & a parking area. honestly though it was an unbelievably tasty meal & I’ll def be back. i had a shawarma bowl & fries. my partner & I also split some falafel - it was all soooooooooooo good. we got it to go but it’s super new so the interior is clean and updated so dining in would def be a good option if you don’t live nearby or if you’re too hungry to venture home. great, quick, relatively healthy option for lunch or dinner. check it out!

Don’t judge a restaurant by its generic name or outside appearance - walk in here to get exceptional and affordable mediterranean food. Generous, hearty portions of grilled meat with outstanding falafel - crispy on outside soft on the inside. Kind employees, fresh food preparation made to order. Check this place out!

You want some solid gyros? Homemade baklava? You wanna actually see the food getting prepared and the beauty of that wonderful meat spinning before your eyes? Falafel and Grill is a great way to get these things. I really enjoy the layout and overall atmosphere of the place too. It feels almost like walking into a modern home. The menu is also easy to navigate. If you're in the neighborhood and craving Mediterranean at a solid price, this is a good choice.

Please don’t serve the pita bread if burned, especially in the gyro sandwich the food tastes charcoal. Every lunchtime, I always buy gyro sandwiches from then until now I enjoy it. But now I am so disappointed, the gyro sandwich I buy now is too small. I thought the burrito was too small. $ 8.86 is not worth it. To those who have read my experience with Felafel, this is not slander, it is just the truth. No doubt about it the food is great, Your experience in this branch can be good, because of my bad feedback they learned to improve especially their cooking clean food. And of course, that’s how they deal with their customer.

Got here at 7:20 was told it would take 30 mins for my order I asked to olace it and was told I could not order because they close at 8 but yet food is still being prepared? Waste of time and gas. Got me never wanting a taco again
The location was 4888 S Archer Ave, Chicago IL 60632

Q BUENO! My new favorite place for Tacos, big or small. Whats the secret?  The shells are made fresh and you can watch the cooks make them! Awesome choice in fillings, tasty and melted cheese, and perfectly flavored sauces. The cute decor makes this place a perfect spot for meeting with friends for an authentic mexico city meal. I highly recommend this place over any others in the area.

Small place but good amount of tables. Great service and everything is cooked fresh. Great selection of salsa at the self serve station. Beware it can be very spicy. The quesadillas are very large and filling for an amazing price. My favorite spot for quesadillas!! Free Wifi.

There was no explanation of the making of the machete because the cashier could
Barely understand English so we got a regular one with 2meats and added one the machete was very bland like the meat wasn't seasoned at all didn't taste good don't think I'll be back looked good on tiktok but was a fail for me

I don’t understand why this place is empty? But you must try the big machete quesadilla tho. Fire quesadilla with pastor and a bunch of vegetables on top of it. The horchata drink was huge and sweet! Prices where amazing not gonna lie.

As an out of towner this was a gem stop on our way to Second City. The other patrons were welcoming and engaged in conversation. We grabbed something to eat and the portions were generous. The bartender was working alone and cooked our food. Friendly and efficient.
Food was really good. French fries are fantastic.  It was early Saturday so there was only one server (who was also the bartender) but he did a great job.
Y’all, your wings are way too saucy you gotta stop with the sauce it’s not ok.

Thoroughly enjoyed our Saturday evening trip to the Sedgwick Stop. Came in with a group of 10 hungry guys, and the staff was both attentive and fun. Chicken wings were massive and came out piping hot. Not a big spot but the place was tidy and patio outside seemed neat. You know where to find me next time I need a malort shot.
Back in July 2019, had a few awesome nights here. Bar staff were very friendly - they even played Mrs Doubtfire on the TV for us 🤣

This place is amazing! If you go, go for what they are known for. Tortas ahogadas. Amazing!!! But super spicy which we loved! If you not a fan of spicy stuff, then definitely not a place for you. The flavor is so darn good and meat taste so good. We got the tortas half soaked which was the way to go since it was really spicy so we had half that wasn't soaked to calm down the spiciness. We got the chicken nuggets for the kids and a taco for my other one. They both liked it a lot as well. Horchata was pretty good as well. Definitely will try this place out again. I wish they had one of these by me in Joliet/Plainfield.

Delicious Mexican food, always fresh and delicious. The staff is friendly. My favorite menu items to order are the Torta Ahogadas & Tacos Dorados Ahogadas. I LOVE how spicy the sauce is and the Carnitas are made to perfection.

Was craving a banana split and this place was the closest to me so I stopped in. When I got my order the presentation of the banana split was horrible. After paying $15 bcuz I ordered 2. Plus the  bananas were hard couldn’t even bite them. I think I could make tostones of them bananas! Smh never again!

The tortas ahogadas are good, but
I asked also for steak tacos, that meat was anything but steak🤬 meat was like ground beef, all tasteless and also has a chorizo color, but didn’t even taste like chorizo!
That was a carry out, otherwise I would of returned them!
Bottom line, is why the hell they serve something like that?
I’m paying for it, is not like I’m begging for some leftovers!
Worst chilaquiles ever!!
Los peores chilaquiles!

What happened to this place.  It use to be so good.  It really reminded me of the tortas ahogadas from Guadalajara. No good this time around.  The bread was no good for this dish. It would just crumble about and it was just didn't have the right feel. The cárnitas were too salty and real grease. The server kinda felt bad because she saw that i only took two bites and left the rest. Tacos de papa were good.  No complaints of the salsa though.  Great taste,  just not enough to make up for the rest.  Just my two cents.

Lumes is FANTASTIC! Delicious food, hearty portions and service with a smile, all at wallet friendly price! CLEAN; the only smells in the air are coffee and food! Mini waffles and raisin toast options. FRESH fruit, too! The server was super attentive even AFTER giving us the check! Now THAT'S good service!

Service was great and so was the food. Fast service and the coffee compared to Starbucks. My 1st visit.

If I'm ever in the area again,  I'd come here to eat.

Celebrating with classmate that we passed our Mortuary Science exams. Now on to graduation!

I even helped to save a life in the restaurant. God placed me in the right place at the right time!

God is Good!

Went here today and I was enjoying myself until the lady with 2 girls were at the table next to me saw roaches in her booth. She called the waiter over and pointed it out. He act like he didn’t see the roach  and she told him that he just killed it. This was my first and last time. Definitely won’t be back! Disgusted! Lumes on Western!
So so good! I had the Mayan skillet (with chicken sausage instead of chorizo) and mm mm mm!! So fresh and tasty!! I will be back for sure! 😋😋

Wife and I got breakfast here. Great service even though it was a bit busy. Food came quickly, sorry didn't think to take pics. Place was clean, atmosphere family friendly. Wife ordered California Sunrise breakfast she said was very well presented, perfectly prepared, very delicious. I ordered my standard breakfast fare, waffle, eggs and bacon - all ok, not perfect but good enough. Would definitely eat here again when in the area.

Everything was average (expect waiter - he was excellent) - ambiance of this location, atmosphere, food… I wasn’t delighted at all. The last time I visited Outback in another location I left with great impression. This time I just ate and wanted to go home. Ordered a combo - steak + shrimps, sides were fries and spinach.

This is false advertisement at its finest!!! My broccoli was over cooked, my steak looks like bites and the shrimp oh my could be better as well. Never again. The only saving grace was our waitress, she was amazing. See how it looks nothing like the pic.

Probably only good thing was waiter , he was nice and polite…
About food ?! I cant say nothing good, everything on pictures looks good before you order it , Cesar salad is spicy?! From when ? How you figured this out guys??? Pasta ? Stake and shrimp spicy? No one writed down this fact’s, sooo disappointed, I often go at Texas Road house, Longhorn but this is nothing similar, you have on 5 miles from here Texas Road house trust me it’s worth to drive extra 15 minutes!!!!

We were in the Sprinthill suite hotel and decided to eat at this restaurant. Very good food and very well cooked.
Only one small problem, the table clerk wanted us to eat 4 people at a table of 2...and there were empty tables.  She didn't want to change us but a very nice man from the bar changed us.  we will be back.

First time trying this place only because my mother in law got a gift card for her birthday. I ordered the 15oz ribeye medium well and it came to me well done. The baked sweet potato was a little greasy for my taste. The server we had rarely checked on us only to take our order and then to ask if we needed to go boxes. No water was given to us. Will not go back to any outback steakhouse!

Hands down the best pizza in Jefferson park. Super friendly staff. Not all Rosatis seem to be the same in taste and quality, this location is by far the best one Ive ever ordered from and very happy its conveniently down the street for all my pizza needs. Chesse sticks and mushrooms are a must order with the pizza.
My go-to pizza place! Great pizza and service every time. I recently tried ordering directly through their website instead of calling, and it was easy and error free.

Giving 3 stars because of bad circumstance. Pizzas that were ordered for me I wasn't a fan of. I just like traditional pepperoni. This last time I ordered a pepperoni calzone that came with a bunch of other stuff in it. So I didn't like it. So I'm giving them one last chance because if I have the RIGHT pizza or calzone next time, I might like it 😂 and if so, my rating will change

Flavors good but it definetly needed more time in the oven my deep dish pizza was very runny couldn't cut a slice with the spatchula and keep it in place bottom of pizza box was wet. This could've been done much better. 😕
Cold pizza my kids couldn’t even eat it

I never knew there could be a place like this in Chicago!

Laid back environment and professional people. Good food. Lots of vegetarian, vegan and gluten free options available.

You'll like it here more if you like Wisconsin 'cause the ingredients they add are mainly from Wisconsin and organic too!

Nice ambience - you may get the feel of 70's and 80's a bit.

Convenient store adjacent to the restaurant has lots of oriental stuff.

The food is great and you get a lot for your money. A great option for vegetarians and vegans while still catering to the meat eaters of the world. Plenty of outdoor space for nicer days and great music selection. Coffee shop vibe with restaurant options offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Could be a little cleaner though.
Waitress are super chill here, service and food are excellent, it's also a cute place and even better; all the products they use are 100% organic! I'm totally visiting again:)
Vintage breakfast restaurant and grocery store.  Awesome menu, with tons of Vegan & GF options. Great taste, good portions, all at an affordable price. Worth the visit!
Absolutely love this place!!! Awesome vibes and really great food for vegans, vegetarians, omnivores and everything in between! Everyone can enjoy the cafe-the food and the atmosphere.

This is a greasy spoon situation that was recommended heavily by my local guide.

Really great steak and eggs, really great breakfast sandwiches, I think I came here for breakfast everyday. The hashbrowns were good but make sure to request crispy. My friends got the pancakes and French toast and I didn’t hear complaints.

Get the coffee that they already prepare perfectly…and the OJ is sweet and good as long as you chill it a bit first.

I saw a FEW people come in and get the tacos while i waited but I never made it back for lunch To try them.
First time here. The burgers are absolutely delicious.  This is an old school greasy spoon and I mean that in the best way possible
Great food! Pancakes were soft, bacon was crispy, and the sausage we’re cooked well.

OPEN 24/7
But it isn't the same. I when a lot in the early 2000. Nowadays there's bulletproof glass and so u can imagine how uncomfortable it is to eat in there. I ordered the steak it's smaller but food is the same.
Ok them damn bacon cheese burger 🍔 😋 was so damn good. I need to try other selections of food items to give th 5 stars

When Google is needed to understand the menu, it usually means authentic Japanese cuisine will be served. So is Cocoro. To prove  my point, just check out the rice quality: very good balance of texture, stickiness and oiliness.
Edited: visited a couple more times and tried other dishes. Highly recommend the Grilled Saury Fish
The grill squid is amazing. Overall, this is not only my favorite Japanese diner in Chicago but also it’s the most authentic I can find. Remember to make a reservation before the visit.
Love this place! The lady was super nice and had great recommendation for the drinks, the portions are generous. We spent around $60 each person. I love that they’re not fusion

For traditional authentic Japanese restaurants in the area, this place is not bad.  We have been patrons to this restaurant on and off for over 10 years, we don’t go very often but this is really the only place in town that serves authentic Japanese with a full menu, and not one of those fusion sushi wannabe ramen places around town.  The reason we don’t go very often is because the service is very unpredictable, I would say 50/50 you will get prompt service and the other half, you could wait 15 to 20 minutes just standing there with a reservation and the restaurant only at 80% occupancy.  You could also wait at least 30-40 minutes for your appetizer and another 30 for on trays.  In other words, easily a two hour meal where 80% of that is just waiting.  There are 2 servers, 1 sushi chef, 1 busboy, and this guy who answers the phone sometimes and spends a long time chatting with patrons but does nothing else.   This is on a weekend.  So what we figured out after all of these years, is don’t go during the weekend if you don’t have the time to waste, if the restaurant is busy, look at the number of order tickets at the sushi bar and how many tables have been served, you need to order the right combination of dishes in order to get them faster.  Sushi is fast, but not when there are 10-15 tickets ahead of you.
The price is downtown price, more than the burbs for sure.  The quality of the food is Ok, compare to the same type of restaurant in Japan, they will get about 3 stars only but for the US, 4 star is good.  Most of the dishes to me are a little under flavored, especially the  nagasaki champon and Curry, the Sukiyaki is one pot style, so you cannot really choose what to eat when and how well to cook each item.  But at least it is better than the pre-cooked style over rice.  I still prefer the traditional way better, not many places in the US has that now.   I would recommend this place if you are downtown since this is it anyway and you have not spent any extensive amount of time in Japan, because if you have, it would make you miss visiting Japanese even more.

Wow. First of all, this is one of the very few Japanese places in town that offer a full Japanese dinner menu, and not just Sushi -which by the way was spectacular so its worth a visit if you're only having Sushi. A big part of why the rolls tasted so good was the sublime room temperature they came at, instead of the cold cuts we used to get at other places. I had never had a Japanese curry before, and was blown away with my dish today. My wife had the Unaju which was pretty much the best I had ever tasted, with melt-in-your-mouth eel on rice. We had the Salmon skin Maki that was so good we regretted not ending our meal with it, same goes for the incredible Uni which was the creamiest we've ever had. For the dessert, my wife love dher green tea ice cream which was a very generous portion, but I feel that my green tea cheesecake was a step up in flavor so I'd recommend that instead. Service was perfect and prompt, with very friendly and considerate servers. Overall we had a blast and I don't think there's any reason to have Japanese anywhere else in the city. My only complaint could be that when I had the rest of my curry boxed, our server placed the shrimp and rice in the box and didn't pour all the delicious left over curry sauce, that's all)

Clean with a very polite and pleasant staff. Street parking can be difficult to find. I signed up for their emails and came in for the complementary coffee and travel cup. I poured out the coffee and kept the cup. Their pastries are delicious, but the coffee was awful. Very watered down and cold. Maybe some flavor creamers would help, but for now I don't reccomend the coffee.

I love their baked fresh cookies and pasteries. You can get breakfast and lunch,soups and salads, hot or cold sandwiches. But No DECAF coffee!! Hot teas or regular coffee. I will stop in here after my doctor appointments.
Before the Pandemic they had outdoor seating.

We have been their customer for years. We love the pastries, soups, sandwiches (too long to list :) ).  Ladies, who work there are nice and helpful. They are always really nice to our kids and always have something nice to say. Please keep up your good spirit guys and thank you for highlighting our days when we stop by.

Soups, Sandwiches, Salads and Pastries? Mmm. Sold. This place has light, healthy eating. They have at least 6 soups a day available for their customers to choose from. They have a variety of sandwiches or wraps. Whether it's breakfast time or lunch time. Then close to closing time they put all their pastries that have not gone out for sale. Red Velvet cupcake is scrumptious. You can even call in your order ahead of time. Their Lemonade is  also very good.

This used to be one of my all-time favorite places to grab a quick bite. Not anymore, the quality of the food and the service have both decreased. What happened?!  Also, make sure you get a receipt and know what you’re paying for. The free bread with every entree, is Scam.

This place gets great reviews and I can see the food being good but we won't return. We spent $70 here which isn't the problem, paying $70 for old dry food that seemed to be cooked by Chef Mike(microwave) isn't ideal. I came in expecting to smell good cooking only to find it didn't smell like anything at all. Then I saw their giant pans of already cooked food that they heat up. With all the Mexican food options in the area, that's a nope from me...

We did give them 2 stars because the tortillas are homemade but that's about it. Huaraches and salsa had a little vinegar smell so they were likely on day 3-4 of being made. Rice, beans and al pastor were so dry they'd give the Sahara Desert a run for its money.

I remember it to be a bit better 2 years ago if my memory serves me well but it's still decent. The tinga, marinated chicken, tasted more like the plain pulled chicken. Bread had a nice smokey flavor to it though. Watch out for the 3% surcharge after you get the bill though. It's small, but they should be more upfront about it or include in pricing. Oh and these places should have an updated pricing menu online since everything is up by about 2 dollars. Not specific to this place but still.
Delicious and always a line. Homemade tortillas. Expect to wait for such great food!
Absolutely delicious food that reminds you of home and excellent service!

Outdoor sitting, clean and tasty food, agua de horchata AND Huarache of chicharrón verde (spicy pork) huge serving but enough for 1 person. I like the food and service, can't compare with great restaurants but for sure you can have a great tasty lunch/dinner here. I'll be back.

I've tried most of the casseroles at this point, and I think that my favorite is the Chicken Pot Pie. It is delicious--fresh herbs are laced throughout and the chicken is really juicy-- but what sets it apart from all others is the amazing biscuits they bake to order for it. Seriously, the best biscuits I have ever eaten in my life. They even sell them separately, and I had one for dessert with some jam they had. I ordered a couple dozen to go with a holiday dinner. I will probably never make my own biscuits again. I've also had some amazing soup here, too, especially the potato-leek (which was, surprisingly, vegan) and the tomato basil.

This place is also fun with a crowd. You can place your order (the casseroles all take about 45 minutes), and then head a block or so over to Bottles and Cans to pick out the best wine or beer to match.
Great place for a large group or small. The food was delicious and the staff was very hospitable. It's a real home cooked meal without having to cook!
We have loved everything from this place that we have put into our mouths, thus far, and we can't wait to try ALL the casseroles.
I brought some Johnny Casserole to a party recently and it was eaten before i had a chance to have any myself. It was the hit of the party to say the least.
The food and atmosphere are great. Comfort food at its finest.

Wow. First time having the all-beef Yugoslavian sausage and it was just incredible. We came here for the Vietnamese and were surprised to see a fusion Yugoslavian-Vietnamese menu. Turns out the husband is from the former and the wife is from the latter, and it worked incredibly well. We loved the sausage rolls, and while the mussles were a bit too chewy and not nearly as fresh/soft as others we've had at higher end places, the 'yummy' sauce it came with was just delicious and worked great with the bread. The big bread bun served with sausage in the photo here is the main dish everyone should order here. The bread was just so soft, fluffy and incredibly tasty. I personally loved the Pho so much and I want to go there just to have it again. Overall, this place was a delightful surprise and I wish I found about it sooner.

Don’t be intimidated by the looks of this restaurant! A cathedral style place serving pho?!?? They did it! This place is a family restaurant and it shows in the deliciousness of the food and the friendliness of the owners! We ordered rolls as appetizers, very good and fresh and both our phos (traditional beef and spicy lemongrass beef) were full of flavour!
I will definitely come back here each time I’m craving pho 🍜
The owners are both so incredibly kind and provide amazing service and food! This is probably one of my favorite restaurants in the city. The scallops are amazing and the pho has great flavor.

Absolutely delicious. Found this on google and went immediately!!! Probably the best pho I’ve ever had. Service was amazing & had a lovely table by the window. The couple that owns this place is personable, kind, and accommodating. Will be back!!!

Just had the lemongrass spicy beef pho, and it was amazing. The broth was rich and yummy. The ambience was very chill and nice, and the staff was absolutely friendly. I came alone and they were absolutely hospitable. Would absolutely come again :)

This is an amazing pub.  Food and drinks are great!  Rarely do you find a pub that has good cocktails and good wine.  Plus there is an excellent selection of scotch and beer.  The place is filled with books and historical memorabilia like a museum.  And if you sit at the bar, you will always enjoy conversation with Colin the owner and the many friendly and intelligent customers who hang out there.

Walking into The Red Lion Pub is walking into an authentic British pub. Had a really nice afternoon eating snacking on pub food, drinking Guinness, and socializing with others. I would absolutely recommend paying this place a visit, especially if you're seeking a good Reuben sandwich or fish and chips. Note: FYI the lighting is dim, so if you're looking for a very bright restaurant this is probably not the place.

I highly recommend the Red Lion! The food was very delicious, the ambience was extraordinary, and the service was incredible. Colin, the proprietor, was very friendly and welcoming, and his staff took great care of us.

What a terrific night out with friends. Had not been to The Red Lion Pub since Thatcher reigned over the land (maybe exaggerating, maybe). What a beautiful space. We sipped and dined in The Great War Room, fascinating.
Apps and dinners were to top notch. Bangers and Mash, Shepard's Pie, and Fish & Chips enjoyed by all. Best pour of a Boddington's I have had on these shores.
Topping everything off was the most friendly staff you will find. Perfectly attentive and, get this, personalities! I know, hard to believe.
Now stop reading this and go in already, you will love it!

The food, atmosphere, and people were exceptional. Very beautiful place. I had the bangers and mash and my daughter had the pub burger and we split a dessert. It was delicious. I love British culture and this place was great. Will definitely be back next time I'm in Chicago.

First time dining here and we were impressed with the experience.

Food: 5/5
They have both seafood and meats from the grille, we did the salmon app which was excellent. Followed by lamb shank (get this!), short rib kabob which was good but only a few bites of food. Lastly we had one sushi roll, which comes with 10 pieces and was very fresh and had some good spice to it.

Drinks: 5/5
Service: 5/5
We had a small bottle of sake and a mezcal cocktail a piece. The service was amazing and they were attentive and food came out incredibly quick.

We will be back.
Amazing and fresh quality fish! The flavors were exceptional and service was top notch! Such a unique menu they offer as well, if only my stomach was big enough for more!

Fantastic place!! The food was exceptional, we had tuna tataki (do not miss it!), seaweed salad, dragon roll, spicy mango roll and the hotate volcano. All of which were excellent. We sat at the counter across from the chefs making the sushi rolls and watching them is so mesmerizing, they are meticulous, hygienic and super talented.

Aside the food, the best part is that the staff seems so happy! Everyone seems to be in a good mood and the chefs at the sushi counter seem to love their job. Loved this place!
The Godzilla shrimp roll is DELICIOUS! I eat here all the time! The food is consistent regardless if you dine in, delivery, or take out. It’s very delicious! My GO TO sushi spot!

Overrated. Expensive. 260 with tip included between 2 people with 2 drinks. Plus they have a health surcharge on their bill on top of asking for tip. First time I saw that.

I’m not sure how this place got such amazing reviews? Must be more of a happy hour place or bar than a sit down for a proper meal. Also the pictures look good but trust me, it’s one of those Instagram restaurants where expectations just do not meet reality. Feel disappointed and scammed.

The edamame was tasteless with some bit of mysterious white powder on it. The bbq was burned and dry. Chicken thigh was deplorable. The hamachi was the only redeeming dish. The seaweed salad was so salty and saucy it left me drinking water all night. The rice on the 4 rolls we got were cold and dry. They clearly did not use fresh rice. Could’ve even been pre-made. The avocado tuna truffle specialty was a disaster. A 5 year old could’ve made it- just piles of ingredients on top of the other with some oily chips on the side.

I’ve never seen such low effort coming out of a kitchen. It’s shocking. I hope management reads this feedback and doesn’t take it personally but uses it to step up the quality of the food. As a customer, it’s easy to tell when the food is made with care…this food is absolutely soulless…almost like it’s made out of a factory only to shuffle tables to keep the cash register going.

Only 2 stars goes to the hamachi which was actually fresh and tasty and the service which was overall good although some inappropriate comments were made regarding our order.

Great venue with some character. Everyone on the staff that we interacted with was awesome, friendly and clearly cared about providing great service. I had the mainstage burger with fries. It was served hot, fresh and cooked exactly how I ordered it. It tasted delicious too! This was in the music joint/bar area. There is a small stage there where I have enjoyed a couple great shows in the past and a bass guitar clinic this time. Headed to the rooftop to hang out in the open air, listening to some heavy music playing through the speakers, people watching, enjoying a few drinks and the passing El Trains. There's a pool table, bar with more great food and a basketball shooting area. Then we headed back down to the street to go next door to the rock joint to watch the concert we came to see, the band Living Colour. Great sound, easy views of the stage. There's a balcony area with some seating as well. I really dig all of the band and other random stickers that are all over almost every available surface in the joint and the rock club, especially the bathrooms. Very rock n' roll! Along with the great food offerings, there is a pretty extensive drink & beer menu...I believe there were 5 pages in the menu to choose from. I will definitely be back again to see another show, eat a meal, drink some drinks, soak up the atmosphere and have a memorable time. Great place!

Place is very nice! Especially to hang out with friends. The outdoor patio is great in the summer, and it is worth to check out the rooftop too! Live music happens periodically, so make sure you are not missing out on the events. Had a lot of shareables and several different drinks among the table. Portions were generous and drinks were great! Cozy athmosphere and easy drinks: nothing more you may want to expect from a pub. The service was also great, I was offered to try a beer before purchasing it and the selection is wide! One time is surely not enough to complete the experence! I will be back for sure!

Reggie's is one of the best intimate music venues in Chicago. It's wide range of groups with perfect size, Reggie's will allow you to get up close and personal with the artists you want to hear and see. The offer a good beer and liquor selection and do have an attached restaurant if you need a bite before a concert.

That's a nice venue with a punk character. It seems to be loved by its patrons. The inside bar and the patio are equally cool places to be. The staff was polite and the beer was cheap, what's not to like?! Ah,  the surrounding streets are a bit shady if you mind.

Decent little spot. Our waitress was very polite and attentive. Good food.. especially the wings.. best I've had in a while. I would go there just to get em! Seen a show and the venue was very small but nice. No complaints. It was great not having to deal w a big crowd. Bathrooms are awesome!!

I am a loyal Dunkin Donuts customer. They are my first choice for coffee wherever I travel. I just drink regular coffee. This location is the closest to my office so I have it 2-3 times a week, often in addition to coffee I get at the Dunkin Donuts closest to my home in the morning. The coffee brewed at this specific location is not up to the normal standard. No restaurant can always get it right, but I've never had a cup of coffee from here that lives up to the standard of every other Dunkin Donuts I've visited throughout the entire country. It just tastes off.
During my visit at this location, the employees were friendly and very helpful.

I rarely give 5 stars! This place is amazing. The food was DELICIOUS. We ordered the roasted chicken, summer squash and the spring peas dish. The presentation was beautiful. Everything was seasoned perfectly. It’s wonderfully healthy and sinfully tasty! We finished our meal off with a few rounds of Japanese whiskey. Our server was extremely attentive and charming and really made the experience perfect. My tummy thanks you and we will certainly be back for more of your phenomenal offerings!

Longman & Eagle is consistently great. The food and service is always on point. My most  recent dinner came with excellent whiskey recommendations from our server. This is definitely a place to take any whiskey enthusiast to as their menu for liquor is extensive. I would definitely recommend for a fun happy hour drink or dinner with friends. The menu does change periodically but if you do go, I recommend the pork shoulder with collard greens and sweet potatoes.

Consistently a great meal! I’ve eaten here about about once a year for the last decade. And I’m always excited to go back. The service is wonderful and so is the food.

This time, I had to eat a special gluten-free free diet- first time I’ve ever had to restrict my ordering here. I was concerned, but I had some really exciting options.

Everything is great, you don’t need recommendations. Try as many things as you can.

A real gem on the north side of the city.  It is evident they have a Michelin star.  The food was incredible.  Fresh, great presentation and delicious.  The drink menu has over 300 bourbons and some great house cocktails.  They had a really nice decor and the outside patio was comfortable and fun.  The service was good - the prices were a bit high but in-line with the quality of food and worth it.

4 of us ate there on a Saturday brunch. 2 of us had the standard breakfast and the portion size was large enough. They also brought an additional bowl of the potatoes. The other 2 people also had good sized meals. Food was terrific. I had an iced tea and it came in a tall skinny glass that didn't hold much liquid. L in all it was a nice experience.

It's kinda new food to try. but i think the ingredients it's great made. the menu is big. hard to choose to try. Each order is huge for 2-3 people. i warm u "huge"  we all order own stuff and everyone asked for to go box after the meal.
The service style is you order at the catchier and get the number and sit at the table. They will bring food to your table.  There are some people around to serve you water and utensils and a main guy who will help you out in the dining area.

Awesome food, one of the best place if you want to get good food in reasonable price. They provide valet parking and the vallet who served us was a very well mannered person. All the employees working there were serving their customers with a smiling face and warm hearts. Washroom was clean and the overall ambience was decent as well. All the dishes from kebab platters to tea to dessert (Bamieh) everything was top notch. Definitely will visit again and am recommending.

Best Mediterranean food in chicago!
Food is so tasty and fresh. Cooked in the most authentic and professional way. Their prices are fair too and not overpriced. They have a diverse menu including the best beef and grilled chicken kabobs. Service was also great. will always come here .

Wonderful tasty Persian food with a rich essence of aroma and taste. The rice was well cooked and absolutely perfect to eat. The quantity was good enough for a person to have as dinner and also the delivery was very fast and the packaging was good as we received. Would like to highly recommend this place to everyone to try out good Persian and Mediterranean food.
This is one of the best Persian restaurant that I've been to in Chicago. I had the lunch special and the food was very flavorful. Thoroughly enjoyed my experience there.

Good value, but the tacos are a bit unusual. They are in a Mediterranean style and I wasn't in love with the tortilla. But to another reviewer's point: you can't beat the value for a River North lunch.

Elle on the River is a Pop-up summer Patio of Travelle in the Langham hotel. Open Mon-Sat 11am-10pm.

Great for a nice lunch or happy hour, but beware, as many downtown locations, it gets more shade then sun, so pack that jacket! There are a mix between high tables with backless stools and 4 nice lounge couches in the corners. The place was practically empty when I arrived at 5:45 on a Thursday night but filled up quickly.

The Menu is very simple, yet delicious. They seem to advertise as having tacos and punch, riverside.

They have a small wine and beer list, less then 10 options each. They offer 3 specialty punches, I only tried 1 but it was delicious, Elle A Noir grey goose, cherry noir, strawberry, basil, peach at $10.00

There are 4 taco options priced 3 for $9, 6 for $16, 12 for $30.

I really liked all the tacos, they all had a unique flavor and were served with three sauces, I only tried one because it had am amazing cinnamon flavor I couldn't get over!  Served On House-Made Chickpea Flatbreads. You Pick...

Piri Piri Chicken pepper aioli, mahon cheese, pickles -
No flavor over powered here, probably the least interesting flavor wise, but jazzed up with some of the extra sauces it hit the spot!

Crispy Chickpeas hummus, herb tabouli -
Chikpeas were fired and crisp, making it a very rich veggie option

Calabrian Mahi Mahi lemon cream, quinoa slaw-
The quinoa slaw was crunchy and amazing, a perfect contrast to the creamy avocado

Chermoula Braised Pork Shoulder radish tzatziki -
I was least excited about this one before ordering and after receiving it, but the meat had an amazing hidden depth of flavor!

The tacos are very filling making this one of the best values in River North. The only negative is with all the delicious toppings they are a bit messy, so don't be afraid to make a little napkin bib to save your business casual outfit from a nasty stain.
Seasonal place by the river but not a good view from the place.. Food and drink are average

Placed an online order, as soon as I arrived the young lady acknowledged me. What surprised me the most was that the food ready! Most places give you a time estimation and for the most part is never accurate. The food was freshly made and well packaged. Made it home warm!! You guys are awesome!

Thank you Ricardo for handling an error with such grace and compassion . What an impressive supervisor of this establishment! He handled an error without argument or attitude and fixed it promptly , because of this I will continue to keep my business at this location and always recommend it to friends and family.  Never have I seen a supervisor with such professionalism ! Make this young man a MANAGER.  Dealing with situations as he did tonight should be a standard across the board. As a regional supervisor I left wingstop so impressed!
Order#
13242397814489094

I've eaten at a lot of WingStops.

A lot.

This one is the best. A lot of the others suck. But this one isn't the best because it sucks less. It's the best because they know how to cook their food perfectly.

Order from here and don't look back.
The food was good but they got my sister's order wrong.  They did give her a store credit to make things right.

Sticky floors, windows are like sticky paper for mosquitoes to be stuck on.  And vents full of dust.   I wonder how clean the food prep area is?  Looks like they do a good job keeping the place clean… so it must be safe to eat…. Right?

Great little place to get a quick breakfast. Ham & Swiss and Bacon sandwiches were very good. Outdoor eating area is nice and spacious. If you have any trouble finding it just look for the umbrellas, the sign isn't obvious unless you're looking right at it.
Bagel sandwich tasted good and wasn’t overpowering. The coffee was strong and had good flavor.

The staff was pleasant and fast. I had to place a larger order on short notice for work and they were able to take care of it on time without a problem. I would definitely order from this location again.
My man Kevin was the best help! All around incredible dude and the man does not miss! Straight up helped me get through this morning, I will never forget you my man, much love brother

Was on my way to my hotel and stopped by for a snack. The location quiet and with good Wi-Fi. I had a very good plain bagel (I think it was the Farmhouse Bagel) with two eggs, ham, bacon and so on.
Enjoyed my stay and hope to be back the next time when I‘m in Chicago.

Great pizza! They are currently doing takeout only. We ordered the sweet heat and the big cheese. I personally like the sweet heat the best but both were packed with flavor. The sausage had a nice spice to it. The crust was cooked to perfection. It's more traditional Italian style. Would definitely orde from them again. The staff was great!

The pizza here is always good. We had the pie with pepperoni, sausage, and Canadian bacon. The one thing that I found was the appetizer we had, the  bruschetta, was very salty. The tomato topping was fine, it was something they put on the bread 5hat made it salty. Not a complaint, just something I noticed.

I've had this pizza before, but it had been a while. Tonight I customized my own and had it delivered. It hit the damn spot! I forgot the crust was sooo good. I'll have to come in next time cause the place has a good vibe.

Very solid pie! Got a large pepp for takeout. Flat crust, delicious red sauce, thick cheese. Reminds me of the pizza in Long Island. Not as thin as New Haven. Also important to note, excellent customer service. Very friendly over the phone and in person, and because my pie was delayed and I was waiting inside the manager offered me a soda on the house. Would love to visit in person when the time comes.
Wanted a calzone and searched for one in the area and found this one. It was great, great customer service. They offered me water by the bar as I waited. Will definitely come back and eat inside.

Very tasty pastries, very reasonably priced. They also sell house-baked bread, which looks amazing. And, as a lover of Russian and Eastern European food, I was delighted to see they sell frozen pelmeni/пельмени and vereniki/вареники - looking forward to trying those next! The space is quite casual and small (only a couple tables for seating), but clean and cozy, and you can see the huge brick oven. The service is very helpful and hospitable.

I love this place! They have amazing Georgian flat bread - lavash, pastries especially hachapuri(cheese pastry), homemade dumplings, churchhella(Georgian sweets made of nuts covered by thickened grape juice). Last time I was there they had two types of cake - Napoleon and Mishka. Both were so good I still think about them. My only wish is that this place would not be 2 hours away from my house so I can go there more often

We came here with one mission - to have their delicious khachapuri, and it was worth the journey to Devon Ave to dig into this meal. A meal because after placing the order and waiting about 20 minutes, the polite and generous employee working in the store provided us with three paper plates for the khachapuri with egg baked in it...three plates were definitely needed. It was massive, but oh so beautiful. The flakiness of the bread and crust was so comforting on a cold day, and the cheese used was so fresh. It was a simple, but delicious treat and representative of what else they offer here. Was a bit pricy because of what we ordered, but definitely worth it.

Best fresh bread on the North side and many Eastern European specialties are just to die for! Staff is very friendly, welcoming and will gladly converse with patrons on global issues. ))) love love love this place. A hidden gem.
!!!

There's no better place for Eastern European bread and other dough based foods, like pelmeni, chebureki, varenniki (pierogi for Polish), piroshki with cherries and cheese and many more traditional Russian delicacies.. want red or black caviar? Kvas? Hachapuri? Lavash? Dont look any further.

This place was amazing! First and foremost, would love to mention the really low key vibe this place has. Tucked below the sidewalk, the dining room is extremely intimate, and paired with bright walls and paintings, you feel as though you're transported to the coast of Spain.

The menu is a traditional tapas menu, so you'll want to choose a few plates to share. For a table of two, we did one plate from the first course, three from the second, and one from the main course.

The food was great and everything we were hoping it would be.

End your dinner with the butter cake. I definitely recommend it.

Dinner was absolutely amazing. They have an incredible bar program. The tropical selection of cocktails are all extremely well done. i especially liked the jungle bird.

I brought my future in laws here for an intimate discussion. We were treated with basically white glove service.
The prawn head special was interesting. i loved the spanish tortilla and the scallops.
Our server was extremely knowledgeable  about the menu and the cooking process.
The music in this place is also phenomenal!

Highly recommend. I will be back!

Great seafood oriented tapas style dining. The best basque cake ever and kick butt anchovy and boquerones dishes. The roasted mushrooms and the little gem salad courses were excellent. Liked several of the new dishes.
They made great food and delicious drinks! This place is relatively a tiny place. Make sure you call ahead before you come. You will be amazed how much this restaurant will surprise you!

Delicious food, fantastic service, and a lovely intimate space that's perfect for any date or special occasion. Both the wine and cocktail programs are top-notch: be sure to grab a glass or two with your meal.
Good and quick service, nice staff. Fries were amazing, definitely fresh. Spicy Gyros and hot dog were pretty average, nothing too big, portion sizes small, good prices though.
Nice little hot dog shack. Stopped in for a Chicago dog and it didn’t disappoint. Wish I had been hungry for more as their menu looked so good! Definitely want to try a milkshake next time.

I’m disappointed in the food I ordered. I didn’t even finish it was really that bad.

Fries-burnt, stale, cold.
Mozzarella sticks- burnt, stale, cold.
Onion rings- stale, hard, cold.
Cheeseburger- cold, missing peppers requested and old veggies.

I’m confused was this all food from Sunday leftovers? There was literally no heat or freshness from any of the food. This is the first I’ve ever experienced such bad food from here. I don’t think I’ll return again.
I'd suggest skipping Slim's. It's mediocre, and way over priced. This is a $10 cheeseburger (doesn't even come with fries). Yikes.

One of the best burgers I’ve had!!! Burger was well made and HUGE. I definitely recommend curly fries over regular fries.
Small little place, but really nice. I will be back to try the milkshakes!!!

This was a great find tucked in the corner of the Watertower Plaza Mall. Really fresh ingredients, and it only took about 5 minutes to get our food. Make sure you try a juice-the red power is amazing, and the Buddha's Satay was flavorful. The owner was friendly and treat his customers right with a healthy sense of humor!

Extremely disappointed in this location. I love Freshii, however this location gives small portions. I ordered the Buddha Satay and they were out of rice noodles, so I got quinoa instead. When I got my bowl it was only half full, and the veggies were mixed in with the quinoa making it look like there was more than there actually was. I’ve had Freshii several times before and the rice or grain is always on the bottom and veggies are stacked on top, right to the top of the bowl. I feel like they did this to save money on veggies. For $10.99 I expected way more than this. Now I did enjoy my meal, just wish I got the full size I ordered, I didn’t order a half size.
Great Freshii location, on a busy Friday all my friends enjoyed fantastic good roots bowls. Frozen yogurt with crainberry was a delightful desert. The cashier was fabulous fast and extremely helpful.

Do not order delivery from this place.  Found hair for a 2nd time today, on an order that was incorrect. That yellow substance between the 2 of 3 avocado slices is cheese and was just as disgusting in person, and was sitting next to a 12 inch hair. That was a double order of avo on the bowl FYI. And if you look hard enough you'll see a tiny slice of avocado that they charged 2 bucks for in the deconstructed wrap.

The man who manages this location is extremely rude and unprofessional. I ordered a wrap with chicken and it contained no chicken. I asked for another one and he said it wasn’t possible but that he could refund my money. Fine. But I was on my lunch break and after 5 minutes asked him how long it would take. He snapped at me aggressively and said I could leave without a refund or wait.

If you want great food and great hospitality - this is the place.

Took my friend out for breakfast and was not disappointed. The veggie sliders are great, bottomless coffee is good, the blueberry salad as a side to the sliders is my favorite.

The dessert were great too!

I would definitely go there again soon and try out other vegetarian options! The chicken however could be slightly better - it was too dry but rest of the food and beverages made up for it!

wow what a breakfast it was. Very friendly staff. Nice ambience with nice quantity of food. each plate had enough food for an adult. worth the money. still have the taster stuck to my tastebuds. a must try restaurant

Very nice experience. Food was great, we had caprese wrap, jalapeno breakfast bowl, meli's sunrise, chocolate chip pancakes and fruit parfait. All tasted very good. Hilary was great and responsive to our needs. Will visit again.

Friendly staff, no wait on a Sunday morning, but busy! The apple crepes were amazing, breakfast tacos were great too, breakfast panini nothing special but no complaints either. Excellent start to our day!

Food is just fine, i had a fresh juice that was good too. But... service was slow. There was no manager visible to provide good direction, busser/runner staff while numerous were awkward and didn't seem to have any good flow. It took awhile to get order taken, food came fast, but then took awhile to pay. My server was doing the best she could but she was in the weeds.
Great little place. Good portions for the price. We enjoyed the bruschetta and the ‘Almost Gourmet’ pizza. Slight wait for the food, but I’ll take it for the fresh food. Fresh wins anytime.

I have been eating their food for years! My favorite is the tequila lime chicken pasta! I just ordered a tray of it last night for a party, and everyone was asking where I got it! Also whenever I order, food is on time and staff is always friendly! Definitely a must try!
Their pasta with salmon is incredible! I always do angel hair with it instead of the clams. The tequila lime chicken is also really wonderful!!

So I came in for a pizza here and the staff was nice, and the place was very nice and tidy, but the pizza was horribly basic and bland. Maybe other things are good, but I would not recommend the pizza.

I can confidently say this is one of the best meals I have ever eaten. I ordered the Spinach Ravioli, along with mozzarella sticks and bread. Not only was the food some of the most delicious I have ever eaten, but the atmosphere and service were both superb! I would totally recommend this to anyone looking for a quality experience!

My wife and I got to Chicago Kalbi early on Friday, a few minutes after opening. I did not know you could make a reservation by phone, still, we got a seat shortly after arriving. The first thing I noticed was the countless pictures and autographed sports memorabilia proudly displayed throughout the restaurant. As a fan of the Bulls, it was captivating to see so much history and familiar names, such as Steve Kerr and Luc Longley. Cubs fans will appreciate it tenfold as there were even more Cubs players gracing their walls. I knew I was in for a treat.

Our waitress, who I believe was also a co-owner, took our drink order first. I got a Japanese white peach cocktail and my wife ordered a sweet Japanese plum wine. The cocktail was refreshing and subtle, and the wine was sweet like candy but still tasted great. After the drinks, we ordered food and got the pajun as our appetizer (Korean seafood pancake). For our mains, we ordered the hone kalbi, bulkogi, and Japanese sausage.

First was the pajun, a generous portion of food that could be shared among four people. It was light, fluffy, salty, and felt like it came straight off the heat with its freshness. On top of that, it had added texture from the squid, beef, and crunchy onions. The squid felt chewy, but everything else hit the mark. Once we finished the pajun, the staff prepared the grill at our table, and instead of a gas grill, we used a wood/charcoal grill to my delight! The banchan (Korean sides) shortly followed, and the meats. We were all set to start cooking and digging in!

Both the hone kalbi and the bulkogi were unbelievably tender. The bulkogi dipped into the sauce provided for us was a perfect sweet and salty bite. Mixed into the side of rice only made each bite feel more heavenly! The hone kalbi tasted of high quality yet was chewier than the bulkogi. The flavor was as great as the bulkogi, but it did not have the melt-in-your-mouth characteristic of the bulkogi. For my money, I would have ordered another bulkogi rather than the hone kalbi. As for the Japanese sausage, they were basically cocktail wieners and tasted fine; nothing that blew our minds. Between bites of meat, I tried each side, and they were all delicious. My two favorites were the kimchi and potato salad, which tasted made-in-house. If we had enough room, we would have asked for the wagyu beef menu they have available, but we were close to exploding by the end to try their wagyu. We saved it for next time!

Chicago Kalbi is a restaurant that's great and knows it. It does not need a flashy sign or marketing to flaunt itself and has trusted its food, service, and word-of-mouth to stay in business for decades. My wife and I were lucky enough to get a table at this packed hidden gem, and I join the fray of people that chant their greatness. This place is the real deal and offered us a delicious meal with friendly service.
Amazing Kobe and Wagyu meats. Delicious appetizers and ban chan, and friendly good service. No frills Korean BBQ at its best.

I've had Korean BBQ before, but this place was the best I've ever had. The meat was SO TENDER. We had a large group, and what looked like a mom & pop restaurant was able to handle the large group of rowdy adults without any issues. The food though, OMG it's mind blowing. The TASTIEST meats! Next time I'm in Chicago, I'm finding an Air BnB close to this place so I can eat here everyday. It's that good!!!
Always the best Korean/Japanese barbecue in the city! Will be back for many more celebrations!

Fantastic service! Best Japanese Korean BBQ in Chicago by far! Wonderful meats and veggies. Uses charcoal for BBQ. Great sides (really good kimchi). Such nice staff, very kind and friendly. Will definitely come again!

This used to be my number one location to go but now the rude and inappropriate customer service is definitely not a place to go to! I come order my coffee at 5am as I’m heading to work. They always mess up my order and when asked a question, the girls behind the counter ignore you and raise their voice as if they were agitated and angry being there. This needs to be fixed

Been having bad experiences lately with this location,  forgetting to do things when not busy. There's few people who do it right, one of the ladies is named Martha, she makes it how it's supposed to and its very much appreciated. There are girls in the who have an attuide because they messed up on something? I get what I pay for.. don't seem happy to work there.

Man I swear those ladies  are miserable working there the attitude they have are horrible I get attitude just for asking a question then they go and make my coffee watery they need new works there geez
Coffee is never made right, always order the caramel craze and they never put cinnamon even though it comes with cinnamon and last trip they left a hair in the coffee. Go to the location on Belmont
Clean has parking in lot. Friendly and fast service.

If you haven't eaten chipotle in the far out suburbs 1-2 hours outside of Chicago, you dont appreciate just how well the chipotle's in the city run. Occasional hiccups happen but the service is truly quite spectacular.
Food is fine quality, but my online orders are always very late. I get there when the app says it will be done, but most of the time they haven't even started making it.

Out of the last 5 times I ordered delivery from this chipotle I had a large chunk of ingredient in my food 3 TIMES. First two times was a large block of cheese. This time was an onion. The quality control for delivery is extremely poor at this location. This issue is way to consistent to be a coincidence.

Don’t walk in to get food here. There’s a fat lady with eyelash extensions, and another lady with tattoos that just look at you while making online orders. You’re better off just to get your food delivered as they’ll never service you inside.
Food tastes amazing. Sadly they are being SUPER stingy with one scoop of wherever meat you get. Chipotle overall has to stop being stingy

The Wendy's franchise has vastly improved there Menu. This location on Garfield boulevard stays busy but at the same time they move at a very consistent pace. Every time I come to this location the food has been on point. That is the reason they stay so busy. "Security" in the house and on point 👌.

Unbelievable experience! It was easy to count at least nine people at the register and beyond doing a variety of things. I would approximately three other people waited in an area to place orders for 6 minutes. Someone shouted from somewhere the line starts on the other side. We all move to the other side it is 10 minutes before I place an order. I noticed not one order has been given to a customer and the line is getting longer. A female employee comes from the bathroom and reports a catastrophic scene of filth. It is a full 13 minutes before I see one bag given to a customer as I listen to a customer in the drive-thru asking about the wait. I was really hungry and waited 26 minutes for a burger ( yes, one single burger). This gave me time to notice that all of the tables in the restaurant were soiled with leftover ketchup Mayo etc. During this entire episode I witnessed three customers served. In the distance there was a basket of cooked fries it was still there when I left. Will not return to this place.

Very long line at the takeout window. We only stopped there because it was the closest to the airport when we were leaving. When we got our order it was completely wrong. There was only enough Coke syrup to flavor the water light brown but it was mostly soda water. There was no way we could go back to get it corrected because it was a 45 minute wait in line. Thank goodness I will never have to go to this Wendy's again.

Food usually taste pretty good most times but the service is horrible. Past few times I’ve been there it’s always a problem. I ordered through the Wendy’s app mobile order so that my food would be ready when the person I had get it arrived. Not only was the inside closed way before 10pm but of course the drive thru was long and abnormally slow. Then he gets to the window and they take forever to come back to the window just to say they “don’t have that order in the system” despite me calling about it an hour prior. This was the worst experience and I wouldn’t recommend you coming here.

Did a mobile order to speed things up in drive thru. When I got to the windows the order was all taped up but was missing things. Luckily I wasn’t too much in a hurry to check. Was missing a salad. Sauce for nuggets. And spoon for frosty. Other than that it was Wendy’s

When I ordered a slice I wasn't aware that you get 2 slices, so I ordered 2 slices and got 4. These slices were very hot well done and filling. One thing that was off for me was the very strong seasoning what I believe was oregano, I felt like it was a bit to strong for my liking with every bite you tasted it had the same flavor the sauce I felt had a good flavor that can do without that extra oregano.

took my girlfriend to this place for lunch and the food was amazing, we got buffalo wings which ended up being very good as well as a panzerotti which was massive that left us with leftovers for later! most definitely recommend this place to anyone who hasn’t tried it yet it’s surprisingly cheap in my experience and the waitress was very nice, will definitely be coming again in the future

I order a pizza online  pick was 645pm -7pm 9/5/2022 Monday pan pizza it looks like a deep  pizza  very  salt and the the edges where burnt it was very disgusting for $31.51 I would never eat here again.
Great tasting sausage Supreme , and Pepperoni pizza.  Thin meaty crusted pizza. Nice and flavorful.  Two pieces per order when you order single slice.
Delicious as usual. Friendly service and great atmosphere to catch up with friends. Grew up in Brighton Park and love to come visit every so often.

DriveThru takes an eternity! There's also always some sort of person loitering asking for money. I understand if they do really need that money but I saw a man with the drippiest outfit on begging for money. He had the latest shoes which were in very good condition, he had the cleanest fit, but in order to beg he decided to wrap some old worn down blanket over himself. I would say it's not a common occurrence, but no matter how many times I go through the drive thru and no matter what time it's at, there's always someone there.

The food was okay, definitely not the best mcdonalds I've ever had but I mean, it's mcdonalds. Took literally almost 30 min in the drive thru alone to pay for my food. I prefer the mcdonalds on kedzie with better and faster service.

I have come to this mcdonald's for about 4 times now, and lately their service has gone downhill the customer service is horrible plus Everytime i get coffee it looks disgusting and i always say cream only and they always add sugar. Will not come here again. I guess its either Bk or Dunkin for my coffee from now on. Disgusting burnt coffee.

Went to this location for breakfast and when I walked in it was crowded people waiting on their order and it was a long line to order your food plus the drive thru was long .But the line real quick and I got out in about 5 minutes and the service was great and my food was perfect I got the Big Breakfast with pancakes got my Mother something.The Employees were friendly during that rush. Love that .😁😁😁😁

So I wanted in line for almost 2 hours, I understand the food industry could get hectic. But it’s very upsetting when you wait for that line and arrive at the window to get my food! Young lady says now I can’t remember if it was your order with the large fries, okay it happens, but I hear a conversation going while am wait for a large fries. Now I get home to see this!! I don’t like chicken nuggets .. I give them to my dog she lives them, my own dog didn’t want them. Sadly to say am very upset ..with the work ethic/ customer service.

There was a young AA man panhandling right in front of the counter, I don't see anyway that the staff could not be aware of what he was doing!
As far as I could tell, nothing was said, he actually HMU twice, once while I was waiting to order and again while I was dining in!

I ordered the spicy miso soup, unagi sashimi, smoked salmon nigiri, and kappa maki. My server was kind and courteous and made me feel welcome. The soup was delicious. A right amount of spicy to where it was not overwhelming, hot, and flavorful. The smoked salmon was not overly salty and it was a nice portion. The only "con" was that the kappa maki wasn't exactly cut evenly (which doesn't affect the flavor at all) and I asked for my unagi without sauce but it still had the glaze on there. The sushi rice was nice, they seem to have a good mixture and it compliments the their ingredients well. Their space has lots of bright and inviting colors as well. I will definitely be back.
Great service!! Extensive selection of delicious food. Everything super tasty! BYOB. Highly recommend

This place has always been hit-or-miss with me, sometimes the Ramen is fantastic, sometimes it is watery and tasteless. I guess it depends on who is cooking, but whoever was in Is the sushi kitchen tonight really outdid themselves. The tom yum roll and the crazy calamari  Had the most flavor, really enjoyed the texture variation between each bite. The shrek role was My personal favorite, the fish tasted very fresh and was very tender. We were tempted to get the Loyola lover role but were very full after 2 appetizers, 4 roles and a dessert.  Probably visit again if they have a happy hour we can take advantage of, it's little expensive but we didn't leave hungry. Tempted to try the chirashi bowl the next time we come. Great experience.😁

Freshly prepared food, very tasty. Service was pleasant and not overbearing.Nice atmosphere, colorful wall decoration make this place perfect for sitting and talking with family and friends and do not forget to bring your favorite beverage.

Ordered delivery from the Edgewater location and was very happy with my meal with one exception: the spicy Japanese tacos were much much too spicy (and I like spice.) I couldn’t eat more than a couple of bites before my mouth felt like it was on fire and I couldn’t even taste the actual food. Very disappointed. Other than that the rest of sushi and sashimi in my order was wonderful.

The owner  charged me two slices of sausage and which I  got one cheese and one sausage hate how they wanna wanna make up their own rules how is a cheese the same price as a sausage pshhhh never will I buy there !!!

Spaghetti n meatballs are good,
Better than Lincolnwood.
Not sure if better than sbarro ,

Lobster ravioli was on point 🎯

Ribs an fries are 🚨

Going back to taste the meat filled ravioli n deep dish,

WAY BETTER than vila on Devon in front of the thrift,

Great place to pick up pizza and sandwiches on the fly! Most foods are made fresh to order. If you call ahead, food is piping hot and wait time is very reasonable.  Best of all is the staff. Super nice guys, always very friendly and helpful, all familiar faces in the 2 years I've been going there. I can tell they take pride in their work and strive to bring value to the customer.
Sandwiches are a little pricier than I expected but they are delicious and you get a lot of food for your money. They don't skimp on toppings and the bread is great, toasted just right.
I can't say it's the best pizza in town but I grew up making pizza so I'm not easy to please... it is very good. Precooked Pizza by the slice is a crapshoot in terms of value and freshness, So it's best to get that during busy times. If it looks like it might be dry, it certainly is...skip it.
A better plan for serving fresh slices (Maybe they can be half cooked and heated to order instead of being kept warm in the display case?) and ditching the styrofoam containers would easily earn a fifth star from me.
If you like your pizza blacker than charcoal and late, these are your guys.

Great experiences with Tapia's! We got pizzas and salad there for lunches for a teacher workshop. Joel was wonderful to work with - so friendly! And he was great with accommodating several different dietary restrictions. Pizza and service were both stellar! I've also gotten their pastas for my family. Yum!! It was so much food. Each pasta dish could easily have served 2 of us. We got a few additional lunches out of that order. I'll definitely be frequenting Tapia's again.
Great food! Love their Philly Cheese steak sandwich. Gyro and nachos are also great, call before hand so you don’t wait for your order. Many different menu options to choose from.

I was at Nicky's Gyros and noticed a clean restaurant, a large menu and an attentive staff.
Specials and combinations are hand written on posts near the register. Prices are fair and the food is pretty good.

The gyros, hotdogs, & polish sausages do what they are supposed to do on a late Saturday night after a few rounds. However I wouldn't suggest the breakfast menu. My wife says it was pretty bad. Overall: Average.
Been getting food from here since 2018 and the food/customer service is ALWAYS good. They never disappoint.
Customer service was amazing!! Food was good!!

Absolutely the best and freshest Chinese you'll find around here. We had the sesame chicken lunch special with shrimp fried rice. Granted some items are a hit and miss. This is our favorite and bourbon chicken is our least favorite. Don't diss everything because of one bad experience. Keep up the great work. Affordable and tasty 😋

Meal was fantastic!

Crab rangoon was crispy and filled with meat & egg rolls extra yummy & The Entree was amazing & fulfilling as the others!

If I could give 10 stars, they are totally worth it. Me and my family eat here as often as we can. The food is always delicious and the service is fast. The employees are always friendly, nice & warming !!
Had the fried chicken wings and shrimp fried rice. The chicken was flavorful and juicy, and the rice tasted great and had a huge portion. I'll definitely be back!

I visited Wen Cai on April 1, 2022. I am very disappointed  with the great reviews.  This  place is not worth 3 or 4 stars. I ordered the beef lo mein lunch special.
