The beef was tender, but lacking bland seasonings. The shrimp fried rice and egg roll was terrible. I do not understand how some previous comments rate this place 4 stars. Don't waste the gas or time to visit.
Yes, I have the right to doubt the reviews that were previously given  about your establishment.  The bottom line is your food is terrible.

Romantic, great vibes, great fine dining…what more can you want. This rooftop blew me away considering this was my first time experience here. Homestead definitely is the spot. Food had great flavors and textures and the presentation was amazing. Will be visiting here again

Honestly, this is a GEM of a restaurant. The Filipino flavors were amazing and beautifully constructed. Every dish left me speechless. The service was amazing. Our water's were never left unfilled. The owner (I believe he was the owner) would always check on us and ask us how the food was! The pictures don't do it justice at ALL. We will be back for the brunch menu!!

It is an interesting restaurant. Seems family style and not part of a bigger chain restaurant. The food was good especially the mussels and bass meals. My only gripe was the waiter informed us that the chef cooks all the meals ordered at once (ie entrees and mains will come out together). We were seated on a very small table that could not contain all the dishes at once. Given they know how big their dishes and plates are you’d hope they’d have bigger tables throughout the restaurant, and not just a few that were already occupied. Between the two of us it made for a very uncomfortable squashed table receiving 2 large entree dishes as well as 2 mains dishes. This was made worse when our waiter brought our 2 large plates to dish the food into. There was much maneuvering to be done just to fit all the different plates/bowls on that tiny table, and eat. The chairs are also quite uncomfortable if you’re of a bigger girth. Other than that great food. They did call back to check if we were still coming for our reservation which was nice as we were running late and had tried calling them to notify them and got voicemail.

Cute patio with very friendly staff. For us, service was pretty fast. We were seated right away and they brought us our dishes as they were ready (staggered). We tried the pandesal, the papaya salad and the half roasted chicken. The bread and the salad were alright, nothing super memorable. We really enjoyed the flavor of the chicken and the side rice, very tasty! That was probably our favorite dish of the night.

Came in for the Filipino food iteration. Beautiful rooftop space.

We shared the pandesal, papaya salad, sinigang, and the shrimp and pork lumpia. We had also ordered the manok but didn’t eat that on site.

The food and drinks took an extremely long time to arrive at the table. Our server remarked on that fact a number of times. It was extremely loud on the rooftop with both the music and a number of large parties so it was hard to communicate with our server. He did his best given the circumstances.

When the food finally arrived, it was delicious. However, the wait times were so long that our server brought our check before the Manok had arrived at our table. We took it home in takeaway boxes.

Additionally, someone bussing a table nearby spilled water on me and only remarked “it’s just water” and walked away. They did not help clear the spill on our table nor offer me a towel/napkin to remedy the situation which was rather off putting.

I just now tasted the world famous chicken here at the KFC restaurant, the customer service of this place are too good. Very friendly, efficient and really on point to their work. Quick service.  The food was timely cook and served hot. The chicken was really excellent taste. The quality is always consistent.  Overall I was pretty satisfied with the service I received at this location. I also like their mashed potatoes. That some of the reason why loyal customers visit their favorite restaurant because of the qualities I mentioned above. Definitely will visit this location again and will recommend to my families and friends. Their chicken is fresh and delicious!

For our family's 4th of July celebration, my folks put me in charge of the KFC so I placed an online order for a scheduled pickup and when I arrived, a kind salesperson informed me that the food had been prepared too early and she needed some time to re-do the order. She was so kind and apologetic and she even gave us extra biscuits! I am so grateful that the employees worked so hard to fix an understandable mistake- I would have been in hot water if the KFC had been cold! Thank you KFC @ 1144 S. Western staff!!!

I bought a chicken sandwich only because they said the sandwich was made to order. Not only was it not fresh, it was greasy and sauce was slopped all over. The only thing good was the ice in the lemonade.👎🏿

Please be aware of their chicken there. Check your food for quality before you leave there so when you get to your final destination to eat your food your chicken not looking nasty an triffling like this. I had to put this out there because this was just plane nasty an triffling of them.

I was scheduled for an interview with Lisa Simmons they kept sending emails and text reminding me I had an upcoming interview Saturday at 11:30 I did confirm! I got there no one knew about my interview she was not even there I waited to get interview the girl was probably the manager she took down my info and said come back Monday for a second interview i am not not returning they looked racist had only colored people working there and unprofessional the way she was writing my info the way she was Looking and asking questions!
Good Calzon pepperoni! One for two persons is good for lunch or dinner!

Loved the pizza slices!! Got them fresh out of the oven thanks to the cashier who told me if I was willing to wait an extra 10 mins I can get my slices fresh!! And I chose to wait and wasn't disappointed!! I been coming to this place over the past 5 years or more and im never disappointed by the service or the infamous pizza slices!!

Great place!
Great pizza!
I had the deep dish with sausage, mushrooms & giardiniera... that giardiniera was so fresh-- it was like a smack in the face!
My kid loved the calzones.
Great staff & super nice Owner.
Go.
Go right now.

The pizza was big I got a single slice and it was bigger than my head it was good but it wasn't hot I like my Pizza Hut so I'm giving in a three but besides that the pizza was effing big for a single slide
Pretty good with the slices... I liked it ... Almost gave me new York styled pizza

Super laid back environment.  This is as authentic as you can get. Karoake as you walk in the door, eat off buffet menu or order a la carte, and BYOB.  I am not much of a singer but I do enjoy people singing their hearts out.  The lumpia shanghais (mini eggrolls) are awesome as are any of their breakfast dishes which is served all day BTW.  Breakfast for dinner - a plus in my books.  They were out of 3 ingredients that we ordered but they improvised and it turned out well.  I'll definitely be here more often now that it's less than 2 blocks away!
Great home cooked Filipino food!  Loved the Pochero and Grilled Liempo.  Topped off with a yummy Halo-Halo for desert.  Friendly waiter provided great service.  Street parking only,

First visit we ordered lumpia, poncit, and caldareta. Mmm. So absolutely delicious. Definitely a treat and the hospitality is equal to the food.

Second time around we added adobo and Sig Sig. Drive, ride the bus, or hop on a mule. Just get here! Tremendous food and a very friendly spot.
Very good food, I will go back

Great food!
Bad parking space!!

The food is good no complaints on that. But the customer service is very bad... four waitresses and no tables clean. One took our order with an attitude. After we got our food not once did the waitresses stop to see if we needed anything... but we look at them and they all chit-chating with the cooks and laughing. They need to have a better order in the night time. Pesimo servicio con las meseras se la pasan hablando con los cocineros y no se molestan en ver si nosotros los clientes necesitamos algo.

Delicious food.  Very good portions. Tacos loaded with fresh steak meat.  All fresh ingredients.
Weekends  hand made tortillas on site.
I've been coming here for years.
Eat in, phone orders for pick up. I strongly recommend. REAL MEXICAN FOOD.

This place is open till very late and have amazing tocos. The carne asada torta was also great.
They are quick to serve you and don’t rush you. The horchata and Rosa de jamaica drinks are very good!!
Plenty of off street parking.

Man I've always loved a good taco place which are hard to find now. The tacos here were very very good. They were mouth watering, juicy but well done. I can't say enough about the tacos. They had enough meat, not like these taco places that is all ingredients and not enough meat. I hate that. Give me a Carne asada with onions and cilantro and lime alittle avocado and some sauce and lime and I'm good to go. That's what this place provided. I recommend this place to anybody. I surely will tell who I know when asked for a good taco place this one will be on the top.
Straight fire. The guacamole was generous and delicious. Tacos were amazing, especially the chile relleno (probably the most stuffed chile relleno I've ever had..amazing). This is our new go to spot.

Love the food! Their soups are awesome I even take some to go. Everything is made fresh, we always get the caramel lattes with an extra shot of caramel, must try it!!! The atmosphere is alive and has a good vibe and a great place to eat. The employees are all friendly and Sonia is the manager and she's great.

Food was delicious, had leftovers and the taste was still there, even cold 😅.  Our server and the rest of the staff were wonderful!! My dear sister friend and me, chatted for hours and we were not rushed out. Definitely will go back! I had the Cubano and she had the gyro omelette. Pancakes were the same regular order with pecans and bananas.

Small shop with great choices and service. I was really surprised about the prices- extremely reasonable. Didn’t have to wait for a table on Sunday for brunch even though the placed seemed nearly full and every other place on Taylor had an hour wait. Great chicken noodle soup. Right in the heart of Little Italy. Highly recommend!

Amazing breakfast spot! It was a perfect place for the family, there is a mix of the classic breakfast, tex-mex dishes and amazing pancakes, I tried the very,berry pancakes and my mom ordered the tres leches French toast both were pretty yummy! Staff was very attentive and caring and helpful! I’d definitely recommend this place to friends and family!

First time eating here and everything was delicious. The black beans had such good flavor, I wish I had a bigger bowl of them. My boyfriend and I were completely satisfied with both of our orders. We had an Eggcelent Eggsperience 🙃🙃

The service is decent. The mussels are awesome in a garlic butter sauce with fresh bread to sop up the briney liquid. The red sauce for eggplant parmigiana and ravioli was on the neutral side. I added red pepper flakes and salt to kick up my dish. The eggplant and pasta was cooked perfect. BYOB but they do charge a cork fee.

Small Italian restaurant with a nostalgic look of the capone years. There are many pictures of famous Italian actors and movies . We got the pasta and found it to be overcooked. The sauce was good but the whole thing was stuck together. I did see the pizza and it looked good.  But I couldn't really tell you. The service was very good. Probably because there were not very many people there. We were given fresh warm bread which wad very good.
I would probably have to go back and give them another try...maybe the pizza next time.

Service was a bit mediocre, in their defense it was busy with 3 big parties in there. Limited seating. The appetizers were really good. Pizza was ok though. I have been coming to this restaurant for over 10 years. Even before they moved to their current location. I recall the pizza tasting better. VERY AFFORDABLE
I had such a great time the food was delicious and service was awesome everyone was friendly
BYOB Corkage fee $5. Compare with the food was fantastic. Love green mussels and antipasto.

This place is amazing for any blues fans or guitar players looking for great music. The manager at the time (Daryl) was one of the nicest host I have ever encountered, including the fact that we are from out of town (Toledo,OH). Not only giving us a tour after an amazing set that just got done, he went ahead and invited me to their next open mic. Buddy Guys Legends is a place I had been itching to visit ever since I first heard of it a couple years ago. I had an awesome time and can't wait to return on a Wednesday for open mic!

Loved it! Buddy came down to visit tonight. It was so nice. The show was awesome. Food is good, service is lovely, very relaxing and friendly atmosphere. We got there by about 6:30 but show starts later. Can arrive by about 7:30 or so and get a good seat. We visited on a Sat. There is parking garages all around but we found it cheaper to just park on street for $4.75 an hour as after 10pm parking is free. Spot hero quoted the nearest garage at $50 for 4 hours. Will definitely return

My friends and I had a fantastic time at Buddy Guys Legends.  Our waiter, I think his name was Andrew, was fantastic and kept up with the crowd really well. The musicians they chose to have perform were fantastic (Downtown Charlie Brown, Mama Yaya, and the amazing Sheryl Youngblood and her band).

Really appreciated the food, the seating, the affordable entrance fee and the attentive staff- you really can't go wrong with this location. It will definitely be on our radar for when we get back to Chicago.

Very nice establishment.  Stopped in on a Saturday night. Food, entertainment and drinks were good. Menu is small, more basket type foods. Catfish nuggets and fries were yummy, also had the cornbread and that was good too. Buddy Guy stopped in this night and signed merch and took pics with patrons. The waitress says he does frequently when not on the road

Can't tell you how much fun we had. Fantastic service and the entertainment top notch. Great crowd. Buddy was in the house and sang a number with John Prime. Opening act Ivan Singh from Argentina was a phenomenal new kid who we should keep an eye on.

Oh-My-God!!!! I haven't been here in such a long time, not since I was a kid. Everyone I know misses Quiznos everywhere! Their toasting STILL can't be beat and the food tastes as authentic and as marvelous as it always did!!! I can't say enough how extrodinary my visit was as far as service and excitement. This hits the spot, Quiznos fans, this  hits the spot.
I got the steak cheese chipotle sandwich and it was really good I was surprised by how soft the bread was and how not messy it was. 10/10.
Only Quiznos left in the city.  They make a great peppercorn steak. Staff is always nice. Sammies are great too. Always a good meal here!!

I have come serval times and never have problems with the making of my sandwich BUT every time the STORE OWNER is there It’s a PROBLEM for condiment substitutes. I could tell he is more focus on making gourmet sandwiches that come as-is, so after today and charging me for mayo(not extra mayo) I
WONT be coming back that’s bad for business and I will never suggestion this location to my clients going forward. It’s upsetting because I tip the workers and is a familiar face and I couldn’t add a condiment(not extra condiments) to my sandwich without being charged. It’s a sandwich shop for Gods sake. I

Best subs out of all the Sub shop chains, no question about it! This location is always clean, and the staff is quite helpful and polite. I just don't understand why anybody would go into a Subway with Quiznos being an option. Love the side pickles, and the amazing sauces. Thumbs up !

Checking in... Was on a diet and haven't ordered from here in over 6 months.. Very happy to report that the slices are still solid as ever (solid means that they taste good and they are big, not the best ever had) AND the soup was unfreakingbelievable as always.... Now I know how I initially gained so much weight after moving a block away a couple of years ago. Haters going to hate but all things weighed equal, for the money, this place is a solid choice.
Really the best thin crust in Buena Park...and yes, it is tastier than Michael's!

Ordered for pickup. It accepted my order online and charged my card, but when I walked there they were closed, and it was over an hour before their posted closing time.

Edit: Called and spoke with owner. Order was fulfilled at a later date.
Great Cajun pasta.. thin crust pizza wasn’t that good — too hard.

Placed an order for pickup today, during the hours that are posted on google and the website. Order went through and my card was charged, it didn’t state that they were closed anywhere. Got there and it was closed, I couldn’t see where on the door the updates hours are. This was the second time something like this has occurred.

This place wasn't even bad: good atmosphere, decent drinks, etc. but I will never come here again. You guys literally chased away 3 customers.

We got ran down almost a block by our bartender for a DOLLAR. We put down what we thought was the right amount of money for our last drink but apparently we were a dollar short. We leave and after a couple minutes we hear a distant "HEY!" and dude is running across the street after us. He gets to us and says "I'm not trying to be petty, but..." YOU CHASED US FOR A DOLLAR! THAT IS PETTY! We gave him his dollar and even tried to tip him for our mistake but he just walked off annoyed. Suffice it to say I will never go here again. Maybe don't do shots with your patrons if you're worried about money!

Good place - the beer list is somewhat limited for someone who doesn't have a taste for strong local brews, but the cocktails are pretty good. The tiki bar is adorable and great for the summer and the food is surprisingly impressive for what looks on the outside as a dive bar. Try the Jack Mac and Cheese - I like it "plain" which means it comes with bacon and red peppers, but  you can add pulled pork, blackened chicken or sausage if you are craving more meat.

one of a dying breed of original neighborhood bars with a diverse and unpretentious crowd.

the beer list is tiny by chicago standards and the drinks are just okay.

the food is always good, not excellent, but more importantly, never bad.

the atmosphere is unique. it's dark and modern, yet comfortable and cozy. the patio is a well kept secret.

there's not one thing to crave, but the entire atmosphere, intimacy and friendliness of this place a common go-to.

The first time I went it was great. Good food, good portions, good selection, fair prices. Not anymore. I went back recently with a friend after talking the place up all evening. To my horror, everything had changed. Tiny, boring, overpriced menu, uninspired watery cocktails, a couple terrible beers, bland food, and portions so insultingly small I asked for a manager. I guess it's run by different people now, which is a shame. I left hungry, sober, and disappointed after spending $30. What a rip-off.

One of the best and friendliest bars in Chicago. You can be yourself at this place. Great music and food.  Beer selection is limited but it should have something for every palate except for Belgian styles. The outdoor area is easily in the top 10 of the city.

Quick and fast service for some very delicious and tasty ramen.  The service was great and waiter was very attentive.  The decor was nice but if you like your space, might want to take this to go. It's pretty crammed and really tight seating but i didn't mind it. The only disturbing thing was the timer they have in the kitchen going off every couple minutes.

A nicely decorated, chill ramen shop in the Chicago Chinatown area that serves just alright ramen. I wasn't too impressed by the broth and the noodles were alright.

Food
Coming to Chicago for the first time and trying all kinds of burgers amd steaks left me craving some asian food. And ramen is one of my favorite. Compared to other ramen that I've had, Strings was a below average spot for me. I wanted to go all out and got the Super Premium tonkotsu ramen. The Super Premium has kamp while the Premium does not. The noodles were okay, but the broth was not very good. The broth wasn't as rich as I expected for a tonkotsu and watered down.

Atmosphere
Casual and a great spot for just hanging out! The inside looks very Asian with the lanterns hanging from the ceiling and the wooden tables and chairs are a nice touch.

Pricing
Pretty expensive for average to below average ramen (mine Super Premium was about $21), but not sure if this is standard ramen prices in Chicago... I've had better ramen for $5 less per bowl in the Seattle area.

Service
Service was good and the server was very nice. We had the option to either sit indoors or outdoors but given that it was a sunny day we went for outdoors!

Other
Looks like mostly street parking around here

My favorite part of traveling to a big city is the fact that they have so many culinary options!  My home in Central KY doesn't have any authentic ramen shops. This tiny shop was just what I imagine you would find walking down an alley in Tokyo.

The menu had several options to choose from and everything sounded delicious. The service was efficient and though it was a tight space, there was room to eat without sitting on top of your neighbor.

Three of us ate for under $50, all with water to drink. The large portions of steaming ramen were perfect for lunch on a crisp, fall day.

It was good but not the best rated spot in China town. The lady said a 2 spice was going to be hot and it wasn’t :/ I should’ve got the 4 but oh well. The meat was good though. A bit hot in the restaurant unfortunately. Need better AC or some fans. They were also wearing masks and it’s September 2022! COVID is over people. Oh well that’s just life. For me I couldn’t hear a single word she was saying. Very irritating 🤷‍♂️

If you are a person that is a larger than a size medium, you are going to have issues sitting inside. ** (read below)

For our 7 year anniversary we decided to try out strings. This restaurant was completely new to us as we have only been to very few in Chinatown. The chicken dumplings were really good. I definitely recommend those if you do decide to give this place a try.  Both my husband and I originally planned on trying out Ramen as neither of us have had authentic Ramen. However I ended up going with the meat lovers Rice Bowl as it was the only menu item that I could justify paying the price for. The chicharrones, or pork skins, are definitely from a bag. I like fried pork skins. I just thought they would be fresh. The meats were all flavored nicely. My husband ended up getting to the Hell Ramen Level 1. There was no heat (spice) for either of us. He also didnt like the texture of the baby oysters in the ramen. So if you go here to try this for heat, I would reccomend a different level. Even after adding the red pepper flakes in oil that is provided on the table, there was no heat.

Service is ok. We got water & a pitcher. So it was nice to be able to refill ourselves without asking. There's a QR code on the table to pull up the menu. We opted out of dessert.

** there are a couple booths to accommodate larger people however when we visited this location, we were offered a tiny corner table surrounded by a bunch of strangers. The table we were offered would not have sat us comfortably. We were sat at the opposite end of the tables. However we took up two full tables that were set to seat 6. If we sat in the orginal corner we were offered, me and a stranger would have been sitting uncomfortably and touching. The people at the booths did not rotate out at all while we were there (1.5hr).

After years of going to same popular tourist place for Beef Sandwiches, decided to switch it up and come to Al's #1.  So glad decided to come here.  The place wasn't busy at all, was able to walk right up to the counter, not feel rushed, and place my order.  Person at the register was friendly and helpful.  The menu is very simple with the obvious focus on beef sandwiches, but also having hot dogs, sausage, burgers, and chicken.

They have the usual options with a beef sandwich of dry, wet, and dipped, cheese, and peppers.  I ordered mine wet with peppers.  Also, ordered a Chicago Dog for the side.  Service was very quick and my order was ready within 5 minutes.  The wet sandwich had the right amount of gravy  and not too close to a dipped sandwich.  The beef was amazingly juicy and flavorful.  Peppers added the right amount flavor and heat without being overwhelming.  Chicago Dog was made just right and presented nicely.  I may have found my new place to come for a Beef Sandwich when visiting Chicago again.

Having been here about 10 years ago (of course thanks to Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives), I had to give it another try when back in town in 2022. It was still pretty good but a much stronger pepper flavor than I remember and gotta eat it QUICK before the bread is too mushy but otherwise I do recommend having it dunked in the broth fully. Their fries are perfect - super crispy and salty.

Great sandwich! Friendly staff and fast service! Generous portion of beef (I recommend getting it "regular, wet"). Fries were well cooked, although they could have used a little salt (none was available that I saw). Great meal, would come back!

We had lunch here 2 x over our 4 day stay in Chicago. My husband loved their Italian beef sandwiches. Great value for your money in comparison to other places . The hubby also liked the hot dogs from here . If you love beef definitely a place you should add on your list !

Can't miss- saw this place on Netflix Which inspired me to go to Chicago in the first place! This did not disappoint! Stunning food, fantastic staff, clean establishment- the dipped Italian beef sandwich was just out of this world good!  Such amazing value too!

Great place for a date night. Nice ambiance and wasn't packed for a Thursday night. I started with a glass of Brut,nice selection of cheeses and charcuterie. My date had the trout and I had the Gnocchi, her fish was good, but my gnocchi was overly salty, I couldn't finish it. They do Raclette on Sundays. I want to go back. Service was nice, wine recommendations were good.

The menu is great, the food and the service is the same. We had a party of 8 and they took care of is all. Highly recommended.
Sad news. Pastoral has closed all of its shops after 15 years.

Great selection of cheese with good wine, spreads/jams, and fresh bread to go with it. Their dinner entrees are delicious as well, but portions are pretty small for the price. It's a small place, so make sure to make reservations if you plan on going on a Friday or Saturday night. Overall- I'd recommend for the wine and cheese, but not for a real dinner because portions are so small. It's delicious though! Service can be quite slow as well, so don't go if you're in a hurry

Great selection of cheese with good wine, spreads/jams, and fresh bread to go with it. Their other menu items are delicious as well. We tried two kinds of cured pork, meatballs and tomato soup and I can definitely recommend everything we had. It's a small place, so make sure to make reservations if you plan on going on a Friday or Saturday night.  Overall, I'd say that if you like wine, cheese and a charming setting you should definitely check Bar Pastoral out.

This place is great! The market side has amazing cheese that changes week to week, with wine for every price range. They are very generous about samples (mainly of cheese). Great for interesting honeys, jams, crackers, desserts too. The restaurant has yummy food and good specials - the brunch on Sat & Sun is great too. Service has always been spot on.

Stopped here after leaving the Taste of Chicago due to overcrowding. This place had a line outside the door but the staff did great processing orders. The chicken was delivered hot and the fries were some of the best I’ve had. I also had mine with the bbq sauce which was a delicious dip for my fries.

Nothing special, I've had better chicken and fried okra. The staff was friendly and they worked efficiently to get orders out. I was impressed by the way they got people in and out in no time. Customer service was A-1!!! Great location near the the Hilton Chicago so we took a 2 minute walk to grab a bite to eat.
The fried chicken was a little dry and missing just a bit of salt, the waffles were good. The macaroni with cheese and chicken  was the best I have had in a restaurant. Absolutely top notch service.

My first time at Harold’s. After hearing all the hype about it thought I’d be blown away but WRONG. I ordered chicken tender meals for me and my son. The lady who took my order was nice. I also ordered 2 slices of cake and 2 drinks that I thought came with the meals I ordered. Get the total and almost 50 bucks and the tenders and fries were TRASH. Didn’t even eat the cake after first bite. Charged me $1 for a small thing of ranch plus charged almost $4 for not using cash and using my debit card. Isn’t worth the hype. Better chicken at Chick fil la or Raising Canes. Gave it 2 stars since the lady who took my order was nice. Oh and I tipped and had to wait 10 minutes for my order. I go to counter to ask how long it will be and what do you know it’s been sitting on the counter entire time getting cold.

First experience for me here. We took the chicken tender and waffles as well as the Mac and cheese. The chicken was good, but a bit dry inside as well as the waffle. However, the Mac and cheese was great!

This location has not disappointed!
Good customer service.
Great pizza!
Nice and big and good parking lot.
They do not skimp on ingredients—
Extra cheese was stuffed with the most cheese and very good share of pepperoni.
Offer dine in, take out, and delivery.

Great neighborhood location that has been in this strip mall for many years.  Have not gone here in several years.  So glad we went as they have expanded & now offer dining in option in addition to delivery or take out.  Not too many seats so if you have a large party you should call ahead first.

Spectacular Chicago classic deep dish pizza pie! The crust, cheese, and sauce is perfect. A native Chicagoan in our group confirmed our thoughts on the pizza. It’s a solid hit! The calamari was also delicious. Perfectly battered and fried. James, our server, made us feel welcome and provided excellent service and hospitality.

Giordano's is about as much of a chain restaurant as it gets while serving classic Chicago deep dish pizza, but this isn't to say it's bad. It provides a very consistent pizza experience. It is worth noting that the menu has a disclaimer pointing out how long the food will take to prepare.
Great service, delicious food, and able to dine in. All Chicago should try Giordanos at some time in there lives.

The employees might have kept some money for themselves.
I was charged $10 more.
I bought the special combo without the soda.
It would have been cheaper to buy things separately.
They gave me to receipts.
But my bank account showed I was charged the bigger amount..
Makes me wonder if there's a way for them to keep the money to themselves. Where they report in the system the lesser amount but charge the customer the bigger amount?
Either way they stole $10 from me.

Don't go through the drive thru, went today and I wasn't able to look at the menu. The cashier kept on rushing me and I kept telling her to give me a minute and still was rushing me. We left I called to speak to the manager and told me she was the manager. Don't believe she was she sounded uneducated, rude, also ghetto. Never again!
Good service food was good we were speaking Spanish before ordering and the cashiers heard us and when we where ready to order she spoke to us on Spanish thank you.

I was Coming In And Sat At My Favorite Spot Not It's Block One Worker That Block From Sitting There Said was Going To Clean it But They Never Clean It Since l Sat In My Favorite Spot !  I am Not Coming In Thete any More !

I ordered two crispy jrs, not rubber jrs, jeez almost broke a tooth. I don’t know how old these patties are but I know they’re disgusting, not to mention Burger King stole a value fry from me without giving me a receipt!
This place is employed by lazy thieves.

My order took over 2hours to receive! When I got it the food was cold and all over the place messy. I understand transporting can move it around but not like this! Also I will say I had sympathy for the driver despite my food taking so long considering he seems like the ONLY driver at that moment during lunch time and driving all over the damn city. Of course my food is cold and prolly everyone else’s. I gave him a very generous tip be cause he was nice and very apologetic but also mentioned the other delivery locations he has to do. It’s ridiculous  And under The circumstances I can see why everyone food is cold and shifted around. They clearly need more help OR not so as many deliveries.

Worst place ever I asked if the had aguachiles and the lady told me might as well order tacos because the sea food will take 3 hours
Then I asked for beer and she told me they didn’t have any beer I end up ordering a water of the sink next to me ??? I might as well should of made aguachiles at home !!!!!!! WORST PLACE EVERRRR

Awesome chicken tacos. Pedro was so wonderful, he took amazing care of us. It's hard to find late night food and this food is amazing for any time of day and tastes just as good when I have been here at 3pm and 3am.

This restaurant states that it is halal in Uber eats app

I would like food and health safety department to take an action against it

I ordered food just now and it’s stinking blood from inside the chicken wings

I have to throw the food

This place is racist towards non-latinos.
Ordered food and when I got there they told me that the order wouldn't be made, offered no explanation as to why and refused to give me a refund all while trying to ignore my presence and giving me dirty looks whenever I tried to ask them questions.  I had to start a credit dispute with my bank to get my money back.
Don't support this racist establishment.

I got a couple pizzas from Bivona and had them delivered. Ordering over the phone was simple enough and the customer service was nice, very patient with me. The only issue was the pizzas weren't that great, and they got my order wrong. I wasn't dissatisfied with the pizzas, but they just weren't something I would go back and get. They bordered on greasy, and the crust was softer than I typically like. On the plus side, delivery was very speedy.

This restaurant is a hidden gem. It might not have the best food in the city but the food  is definitely good and the owner is so accommodating and wonderful with families with young children. From the make your own pizzas to the free baloon animals- it is definitely a go to for anyone who wants a good meal and are dining out with kids under 10.
Amazing peach sangria!! $5 for a pitcher on Saturday!
Really good food, a little overpriced. Relatively quick service. Outdoor seating front and back. Great place to get some work done as you enjoy artisan food and drinks

I keep giving this place another shot after constant disappointment but this is it. Walk in today and order a BLT Italiano and a Johnny avocado toast. I walk next door to the pet store, blt is ready when I come back. Only given part of the order I have to clarify that I have more coming. 8 minutes pass, BLT is getting cold, no avocado toast yet. I ask if it’s coming, it’ll be a few moment I ask why they would make something with such a short cook time well before something else that takes much longer. The timing is off. She offers to remake my BLT. Very appreciative of that but they put this undercooked fatty excuse for bacon on here. I just want my money back. Doing this rather than come in because not to cashiers fault but I’m pretty disappointed and hunger with a month old baby. 3 minute BLT, 12 Min avoacado toast. I could’ve made both myself.

Been here tons of times and over and over again I keep giving them benefit of the doubt. Today was the 4th time that I ordered food and waited for over 20 minutes before learning that cashier never sent my ticket back. I ordered a simple grilled cheese sandwich and after 25 minutes, I finally got it. It was never even toasted. I try and support local but man.. unfortunately I think this'll be the last time I go in.

This also cost me $15.

Wonderful old-world find. Everything is delicious to the eye and to the mouth! Service is always friendly and fairly prompt. The soup is wonderful and fresh. Spoke to the owner once. She prides herself on making everything from scratch. Don't miss the exquisite garden in the back!

Letizia's Natural Bakery has been a staple since I can remember. Aesthetic and welcoming, this establishment caters to one particular group of people: food connoisseurs and everyone else. Although the options on the menu I've tried have not let me down, specific seating arrangements make it hard for me to give this place a five star rating. Sitting outside is great, unless you're in the backmost area, where no one seems to have a problem with throwing out bags full of garbage while you eat. That being said, phenomenal flavor and quality food. Over the years I've been eating here, I can honestly say I hope this place gets to be experienced by many more people to come.

To the greasy sob Gavino, you should be ashamed of how you present and run this restaurant. I highly recommend eating elsewhere because I was completely dismissed when I had a problem with my meal. The French toast was made on the smallest bread they could find and he did nothing to redeem it. “That’s our style” he says after I’d asked him for something else. I hope you understand that there are better people to spend your money with that will treat you better.
Ate breakfast here with our stay. Staff is amazing. Friendly, quick service. Food is delicious and reasonable prices.
Very friendly staff, I would rate our breakfast waiter for waiter of the year if I could.. Great place to eat as we stayed at the Millenium Knickerbocker..

okaIt's okay, the food is fine but it's too expensive, if your going to charge me 19 dollars for 1 waffle and two pieces of chicken :/ disappointed also the hot chocolate is great but no worth 4 dollars for one cup
We came her for breakfast and absolutely blown away. Great service, great food, clean atmosphere! French toast was awesome! I highly recommend

Neighborhood restaurant, greeted with the amazing smell of homemade tortillas being made upon entering the location. Typical Mexican restaurant decor, nice treat to hear a resident karaoke singer (accepts tips). Were provided chips w/3 chile sauces (green, red, and a jalapeno sauce).
Waitress ask for drink order, I always ask for water, which I received a slight eye roll :-( but table did also order the Horchata.
when asked about the soup of the day, waitress advised the same as the complimentary soup, although we were not provided any complimentary soup :-(
Ordered the steak quesadilla, and Tricolor Fajitas and Bowl of house soup (vegetable w/elbow macaroni).
The homemade tortilla for the quesadilla was tasty and a great size to be completely satisfied. :-)
The tricolored fajitas were well served, and seasoned perfectly also served with homemade tortillas.
The soup was average, needed better seasoning but well balanced ratio of  noodles to vegetables.
Horchata was average, not to sweet. Check was about 45
Good will go back when in the area or on Friday evenings when they have karaoke w/BYOB.

The place was pretty good but not extraordinary or anything. We shared the dish, which was more than enough for us two. I didn't expect the complimentary soup (which was delicious). The place was kinda lonely (there were two other groups besides us). I won't go out of my way to come here again but I don't mind coming if I'm close to it.
The steak tacos were fresh hot and delicious! The complimentary chicken soup was piping hot and the service was fast and courteous

Best tacos in the Nieghboorhood!  As soon as you sit down, you're greated with 3 different salsas and a small soup and fresh tortilla chips.  The steak used on the Carne tacos is high quality and so is the service.  Everyone is friendly and the vibe is fun!
The staff are super friendly and helpful. I easily found parking next to the restaurant. Lastly, the prices are really reasonable.
Very great place! Had the pleasure to talk to the employee as I was ordering my coffee. Very positive energy and atmosphere.
Great coffee even better donuts
Just got an old tough chewy bagel from here. I guess if you get it toasted they think it will pass but this is downtown. There is no reason to be selling day old anything.
this Dunkin’ Donuts LOVES you wether you coming in at 2am or 10am they took great care of us at midnight and the same great care of us that morning after, their drinks and sandwhiches are delicious
I go to this Dunkin because Amir makes the best dunkin coffee in town. Amir is one of the coolest guys around. God bless that guy... 🙏

This place is a hidden-in-plain-sight gem. Classy, metropolitan atmosphere and over-the-moon delicious food await. Their beet salad is phenomenal - and I don't particularly like beets. Their beef tenderloin is very good, and their salmon is the best I have ever had. The wine list is fine - not overly long, but solid, and even their cheapest selections are very satisfying. The desserts round out an already fantastic meal - try their molten chocolate cake with Grand Marnier sauce. The wait staff is cheerful, not-snobbish, and easy going - they do not hover but allow you to sit back and savor the meal.
This quieter, laid-back-sophisticated place is off-beat for its hipster surroundings. I love it and go back every few months. If you like a delicious, relaxing meal in a chic yet casual setting, you may make it a habit too!

It is a fairly quaint place, not very large on the inside, but roomy.  The wine list was decent, but not extensive, and they seemed to be out of many of the listed bottles.  The food was good, but not as great as one would expect.  In many cases it just lacked sufficient seasoning.  The salmon was actually very good, and perfectly cooked, but the mashed potatoes with it tasted like someone just smashed a potato.  The duck was tasty but tough and chewy, which also seemed a little off.  Bottom line: nothing was bad, just not outstanding, and many other very good options exist nearby which stand out much more.

Food was very good. Entrance was hard to find though (front door is in an akward alley). We were the only people in the restaurant (opentable 1000-pt table) and the service was surprisingly slow with that considered. Food was excellent though. Restaurant was pretty dark so we asked to sit on the side lit by lnaterns so we could read our menus. Salmon, french onion soup, scallops were all fantastic. Would go back but wish it were brighter and quicker

Perfect low key atmosphere combined with excellent service and some of the best French food I've had in a long time!  Prices reasonable as well.  All around great dining experience compared to restaurants everywhere in the country.
Great start: foie gras!! I loved the way they prepare and the presentation for all dishes are beautiful too!

I got a couple pizzas from Bivona and had them delivered. Ordering over the phone was simple enough and the customer service was nice, very patient with me. The only issue was the pizzas weren't that great, and they got my order wrong. I wasn't dissatisfied with the pizzas, but they just weren't something I would go back and get. They bordered on greasy, and the crust was softer than I typically like. On the plus side, delivery was very speedy.

This restaurant is a hidden gem. It might not have the best food in the city but the food  is definitely good and the owner is so accommodating and wonderful with families with young children. From the make your own pizzas to the free baloon animals- it is definitely a go to for anyone who wants a good meal and are dining out with kids under 10.
Amazing peach sangria!! $5 for a pitcher on Saturday!

I am a veggie lover, the soup I received shocked me how delicious it was. First of all hot temperature which is important to me. Loaded with fresh and generous pieces of variety of vegetables heated to perfection again. Yummy and satisfying 👍👍👍

I pass by ATK all the time and finally decided to order takeout (it's cash only if you're dining). I ordered Kao Soy because I wanted to try something different instead of the usual Pad Thai and someone recommended it on Google reviews and I'm glad I took their advice. Very delicious meal. The Kao Soy had a peanut sauce/broth that was tasty, I ordered shrimp as the protein. Price was reasonable and I look forward to the next meal from Andy's Thai Kitchen.

I have been going to ATK for my Thai cravings for over the past 3 years. They haven’t failed a single time. The service is wonderful here. Highly recommend their tom yum noodle soup, duck noodle soup and parang curry. Thai ice tea is a must as well. Make sure you bring cash because this is CASH only restaurant.
Easy to get a seat on a Saturday around 5pm, but I have heard it gets busy later in the night! My dish was a bit too salty, but still very good. The Tam Kah soup was awesome!

I've eaten at ATK twice, and both times have been FANTASTIC. The menu is diet friendly, and they work around your spice level, too. Crazy big portions for the quality and price, and the food is made to order, too!

Highly recommend if you're looking for an authentic Thai restaurant in Lakeview.
Food was ok but service was horrible took a hour for ravioli

This is a quiet sushi/thai place on Broadway near Hawthorne. They offer lots of Thai dishes and sushi rolls including an all-you-can-eat sushi option. They're rolls are good and prices are comparable to other sushi spots. They are BYOB, too, which is always nice. But by far my favorite thing about Kanok is their Tom Kha soup. It is hands down the best I've ever had. The flavor is unbelievably good and if there was anyway I could recreate it at home I'd be the happiest person around.

This is the best place to get delicious sushi in lakeview! They have an all you can eat option during weekdays which is a to-die for deal. My favorite appetizer is their crab rangoon, so if you like creamy goodness, this is a must! The dragon roll and caterpiller roll are my favorite maki. The staff is also very friendly and if you come here often, they will remember you!

pleasantly surprised with the all-you-can-eat offerings. sweet potato roll blew our minds: not just tempura, but avocado and cream cheese inside, covered in unagi and wasabi mayo. amazing. smelt roe nigiri was also an unexpected surprise. salmon nigiri was so fresh, and we had a great time choosing things we had never tried due to the extensive menu. go here now!  ps:  Also best crab rangoons ever.  pps: best sushi deal ever.

Kanok is a gem in the Lakeview neighborhood - very very good sushi, definitely try the sweet potatoe sushi.  Great date spot, all you can eat sushi most week nights and it's a great deal as you would probably spend more just on a few rolls!  Try it!

Sushi was fresh but at the same time dull and flavorless. You guys need to remodel and clean the whole place especially bathrooms, fix/refresh your furniture, and get rid of those ugly/dirty menus that look like someone pulled them back out of the trashcan.

Possibly the best scallops that I've had in Chicago. We ordered the dark pasta seafood with shrimp and scallops and it was simply great! The waitress was really nice and the staff was very friendly. The outdoor patio is my favorite. It is heated in the winter and I recommend it as one of the nicest outdoor seating areas in the city. The prices were a little expensive but definitely worth the taste. This is a great place for a date, special event or just good food, enjoy.

Ridiculously fantastic gluten free menu! Their gluten free gnocchi and ravioli were out of this world! The staff is so nice and attentive. The cozy atmosphere is very relaxed and welcoming. I definitely cannot wait to return!

Excellent service! When I was here, I spent awhile perusing the extensive menu of delcious Italian cuisine, and when asked for a suggestion, the server suggested a delicious option! I had scallops with a light angel hair pasta dish, and the scallops were cooked perfectly- so good! Their house Pinot Noir was great too.
As you leave, make sure to enjoy a mint chocolate.
YUM! Their tomato cream sauce is spot on. We really enjoyed the stuffed gnocchi - it's so soft it melts in your mouth. Definitely a neighborhood gem and going back soon.

The food here is GREAT!! Took my boyfriend for a nice dinner, and it was an amazing night. The house specials are always top notch. The service is great and the pricing is very reasonable. Definitely check this place out.

Great place to grab a quick and fresh bite to eat. I love the shrimp wrap - comes in a tortilla with shrimp, cucumber, cilantro and a spicy mayo sauce. Not cheap though, so hence the 3 stars. Average item is $6.50 and it's not big. Shrimp wrap is is $8 with tax. Everything is made fresh that day you so know it's going to taste good. They have soups too.

I stop here ~3 times a week to grab a salad for lunch on my way to work.  Something has changed recently.  For the last several weeks, there have not been any salads in the case at 7am.  today I took a later train so there were salads available; unfortunately, when I went to eat it at lunchtime, I noticed that there was hardly any lettuce in the salad and the avacodo was browning.   When they changed the packaging to the "eat colorful", the amount of lettuce decreased to a level that would barely qualify as a salad.  Today's experience took it to a completely new level (low level).  This salad is no longer large enough to be considered a meal for lunch.

I've always enjoyed a quick healthy lunch or snack from the various Pret A Mangers around the city, but at this location, the food seems fresher, attendants nicer, and the vibe, better.  The staff always greet you with smiling faces and are ready to expedite your checkout.  I had started a new job this week and in a complete brain fog, I left my wallet at the register.  I had not even realized it until my husband called me to tell me that the manager had reached out to him to tell him that my wallet was found.  Apparently, the manager did some hefty research to find me online through the contents of my wallet, make a connection to my husband on LinkedIn and email him to apprise him.  She wouldn't take anything from me, even though she deserves much of a reward.   Her actions shows that integrity in the workplace is still alive.  Thank you so much for being honest and wonderful people.  I appreciate it!!  PS - try the mac n cheese or one of the hot sandwiches!

I literally was just here yesterday and I had to come write a review. I got a pulled pork wrap burrito thing it was warm, and a bottled water it was like 13 dollars. So i agree with the previous person i should've gotten my receipt but my dumbass didn't. Anyway it was a pretty good burrito thing so that was cool but let me tell you it gave me the runs. I dont know what happened but like immediately after that i think i got food poisoning. Just be careful y'all!
Very quick pickup lunch place. I got the chicken Ceaser salad and it was pretty tasty. Not the best salad you'll ever have, but it was $8 for a huge salad and some good flat bread.

we went for the lunch special and everything was phenomenal. they give you spicy cabbage to munch on while you’re deciding. the house special chicken is amazing. great crab rangoon! we liked the rangoon better than the egg roll but both were great and served with spicy mayo. will def come back.

Decent and relatively authentic Szechuan food. Some sichuan ingredients and flavors were missing. The beef tripes didn't have the tenderness nor the imbued flavor that we are used to, but the rest, including the poached fish were very tasty and flavorful. Maybe it was because I came after peak hours just after the lunch, but I found the service lacking in attention. The prices are very fair as well as the portions. The decor is good too, as is the atmosphere.
Great tasting food. Started with a spicy cabbage. SPICY!!!! My group had Sesame Chicken,General Taos Chicken, and Fried Chili Chicken. Really good portions. Server kept water glasses filled.

As Lao Sze Chuan began to have multiple locations, I worried that its quality would suffer. So far, their dishes are still solid and full of flavors. This Uptown location even has drink menu that is unique to the neighborhood. It is one of the top Chinese options in a neighborhood that has number of outstanding Chinese restaurants.

I've been wanting to come here for a while and finally had the chance to.  Menu had alot of food choices.  When food was served we started eating right away, hence the partial plate pictures lol...but all dishes were so flavorful.  This restaurant and the cook did not disappoint us at all.  The flavor just burst in your mouth.  YUM!  Reminds me of the food I ate in China.

I absolutely love this place. For Father’s Day I would not have chosen anywhere else. It has a very warm, community vibe where you feel like it’s your family of aunts and uncles running the joint. Food is always hot, fresh, delicious and QUICK. Their system and service is great. Eppels never fails!

Very good spot to have a good, heavy breakfast. Please do try their pancakes. Rarely do I get to have pancakes that fluffy.

The staff were really nice and warm. The service was prompt (even on a Sunday morning).

Highly recommend this gem of a place.

Fantastic homely diner. Food was amazing, hot, and quick. Not too many other patrons at this time of morning. Waitress was very pleasant, and kept water and coffee topped up often.

Got The Works Skillet, with your preference of two eggs on top of hash with bacon, sausage, mushrooms, and cheese, and two pancakes on the side. Worth the 10$, and filling.

Definitely would recommend!

Eppel's is my new go to weekend breakfast spot. In the big city, it's hard to find the kind of warmth and comfort lost in other pretentious breakfast places. Portions are generous, service is friendly, and as soon as I walked through the doors I knew the smell meant they had the kind of biscuits and gravy that make you need a post breakfast nap. The only thing that could improve this beautiful west side gem is a pie case. Here, I have the Royal Canadian burger, cheese fries, and peach pecan crepes, a great midmorning meal before spending the day running errands. If it's your first time, try the country fried steak and see if they'll throw it on top of some biscuits and gravy for you. Cheers, and good eats to you all.

First time going and it was the best first experience. The staff are friendly. I got the Pecan Roll French Toast with a sides of bacon and scrambled eggs. Also got a strawberry milkshake. 😋 would go back again to try out more things from the menu.
The General Tso’s I got had a bland and watery sauce that all pooled at the bottom of the container without sticking to any chicken. The egg roll also could have used some more seasoning.

When I'm in the area I enjoy stopping by China Dragon for a quick bite to eat. I ordered fried rice with sesame chicken and soup. Everything came out in a reasonable amount of time and was hot & fresh. The sauce in my sesame chicken entree was especially tasty with the rice. My server was very nice and attentive and even the restrooms were clean. I'm sure I'll be back when nearby.
My food has a RUSTY set of STAPLES in it. I literally just finished throwing up. This doesn't make any sense 🤮

I love their smoothies. You can pick two flavors to mix from their fruit options and the option to add Boba. I like that this place is in Pilsen neighborhood so I don't have to go to Chinatown for a smoothie.

I was excited to try this Chinese restaurant but was sorely disappointed. The  General Tso Chicken did not taste good at all, as it sauce was a watery mess (no taste and not spicy). Shrimp fried rice was very greasy and the egg roll had a bitter taste. The pepper shrimp was the only thing good about the meal.

This has become a regular for my roommate and me when we want a hearty meal and fixing of Cajun food. Service is always great, portions are generous, decor is fun and festive (especially their wall of hot sauces), and there is so much seating room that I've never had to wait.  I get the etouffee of the day (side portion is enough) and my roommate gets the catfish, collared greens, and rice & beans. All are delicious! You HAVE to pair your meal with the jalapeno cheddar corn muffin with their sweet honey butter too!

I liked it a lot though it is a bit pricey. I took my boyfriend there for a date since he's a fan of spicy food. The gumbo was really tasty with some kick to it. The fried green tomatoes were at the right stage of green with amazing flavor. My entree of fried catfish was good with the fish itself being flaky and moist and not having the muddy flavor catfish can have sometimes. My boyfriend's Cajun stir fry was was tasty but not spicy enough for his palate. We'll have to go back so he can get the "Hot as a Mutha" dish you need to sign a waiver for. Our server was wonderful and I highly recommend this restaurant.

There aren't a lot of high profile Cajun places in Chicago so when I found out about Heaven on Seven I was pretty excited. From what I heard it was a great place to bring a group of friends who enjoy food from New Orleans and I heard correct.

4 of us came in and the atmosphere was a perfect fit for having a good time. A ton of people, great food (and smells from the food), and a huge variety of spices to add into your meal.

My personal preference here are the Po'boys. Though the Etouffee of the Day is usually great and most of the shrimp dishes (I'm a huge fan of shrimp) are exactly what you would want from a Cajun joint.

Pretty good cajun food, pretty place, pretty pricey. The centrally located Seven on Heaven offers a wide variety of cajun fare, from gumbo to shrimp to chicken burgers, they have it all. The place is really nicely done up, from the moment you enter, you'll feel like you've been transported and immersed in the cajun culture. It certainly does get you in the mood for the good food that is to come.

I had the sliders, which were pretty small for their price. But they do pack a punch. Each bite was better than the last and the flavours just kept on coming. I particularly liked the shrimp slider, crispy and juicy at the same time. I also had some fried chicken and it was pretty much the same story, crispy, juicy and full of spices. It was a delight to eat.

They handle large groups well, saw a lot of big tables filled up when I was there. The service was pretty prompt as well. I know this place is known for its gumbo and I'll have to try that the next time I visit.

The buffet is absolutely with the money, I can not praise it enough for both the value and quality of foods. Having never really eaten this type of food,  I instantly fell in love with it.  The flavor is rich and I'm sure it's very fatty,  hence why it's soo good.  Get the gumbo or the jumbolya for shrimp fans otherwise the mashed potatoes,  gravy,  and fried chicken/catfish will certainly fill you up. I look forward to coming back to Chicago for this bowl of heavenly gumbo! Great service,  inciting atmosphere.  This place is a must see.

The staff was very attentive and knew the menu inside and out! The drinks were fun and delicious. I was celebrating my birthday and they made me feel very special. And the place is beautiful! Loved the cotton candy and sparkler in the cake they brought me. Great experience. Will for sure be back

Amazing atmosphere!!our server Omar was supper attentive and very knowledgeable on their menu. Food was great ... drinks were on point. I had mango margaritas 🍹  and appetizers... the interior looks very appealing with a carnival theme .. on certain days they have performances with zamba dancers and aerial fabric performers. I definitely recommend.. dress to impress ! Or not either way it's a great spot to go to fir drinks and or food

I had a great experience dining at carnival.  The atmosphere was festive, and don't get me started on the dancing... so fun.  The food was above average, and the mixed drinks were amazing.  I would definitely think of this place as my go-to place for celebrations and party's.  Eating here will get you in a festive mood quickly, but if quiet and romantic is on your mind, think elsewhere.  Definitely coming back.

What an amazing experience Carnivale is!  I got here a little early for a dinner reservation and headed to the bar first!  The drink selection was amazing.  The food was superb.  We started with ropa viena and coconut shrimp—both were absolutely delicious!  We then shared an order of seafood paella and it tasted amazingly fresh.  Marco our server was attentive and knowledgeable about the foods and drinks.  He made us feel welcome.  At the end of dinner, we ordered the banana pecan cake—it was WOW!  It was an overall amazing experience.  I will definitely come back and recommend this place.

This place is absolutely stunning, it’s Festive!!! The customer service was great, bartender made me a strawberry/mango Margarita that was delicious!! Our waiter Pete was great. Food was delicious especially the calamari as our appetizer. We had an amazing date I will definitely come back
Very yummy and nicely priced. The shrimp and cheese pupusas were quite good and I’ve never had a tamale that moist. The empanada was chorizo was a bit dry. Overall, would come back.

Food was horribly, didn'thave the salad that goes with it. Everything was disgusting, the pupusa were out of meat and the tacos meat was hard and old 😒  mala comida horrible  las pupusas eran solo masa y el pollo de los tacos era pollo duros y no traia la ensaladas.

I've been wanting some popusas.... thank God,  I checked the reviews. I WILL DEFINITELY not make my way there whatsoever.
Thank you everyone for your unfortunate experience.
I'd rather give another Salvadoran money than them.
Really nice staff and the food was good. The tamale was a little meh but the papas were amazing!
Man The food was so bad trust me it's like if they didnt add no taste into to it Like what! The food so dry Dont come here..Its just going to be a waste of money

First time visiting so it was a little chaotic. Busy, and we weren't greeted. Had to figure out where, and how to order on our own, and with help from other customers. Once we were able to order the staff was friendly. Food was cooked to order. Presentation was good. Food was flavorful.

Tried their jerk nachos and their soup of the day which was chili. The chili was really good. I didn’t enjoy the nachos. I also tried their peanut butter chocolate cake which was okay to me. I would go again though since the chili was very tasty.
I consider Soul Veg the tastiest Restaurant in terms of what they do. In the past the customer service has sucked but as of late they seem to have improved. Once again food is awesome!

This place never misses the target. Food is ridiculously fresh. Hot. Green and lean! I did discover that the natural drinks in the cooler are very high in sugar so be careful. Drink it responsibly 😂 but the bbq ribs are awesome. The Mac and cheese is amazing and the desserts are awesome. The apple pie could use a bit more sugar but ig that's why it's vegan. But hands down. The best vegan food I think I've ever had. Fairly priced and always delicious. The ppl are always professional and educated on their product. You often forget you're eating vegan food. I gave it four stars because the parking is really bad. It's street parking so it is what it is ig. Other than that best ever!

We had fun!! Just so happened they were filming an episode of a cable series called, "Journey,"  We got to be extras. How cool was that!!! Great food, I love the variety, buffet style, and quick because I was hungry. Everything was delightfully fresh. The customer service was slightly off due to the taping. Yet it was good. The decor is lovely and the place spacious. OMG!!! The bathrooms were clean and the smell divine!  Clearly a woman's touch. Just be careful because overeating at this place is a real thing. The food is that good.
The manager here is very rude has very dry lips and yells at her employees in front of customers
Always wrong with the order busy or not even just asking simple things

Omg Nikki is the best ever! So sweet and bubbly! And she has the order memorized for almost everyone who steps through the door in the morning. I’ve picked up coffee for my husband a handful of times and I don’t even know what his order is. I just tell her it’s coffee for that tall guy and she knows exactly who I’m talking about, lol.  It’s such a great start to my day when she takes my order :-)
Used to be a good place... now Ghetto.. you can feel the hate when you order. They don't even talk..just stare at the register.

This is hands down the best Dunkin' Donuts! Best customer service I've ever had, Antoine is just a sunshine always cheerful and most of all pays special attention to anything he serves you!!! No matter how rough your day is always better after leaving!

This is the place to go for a casual, friendly meal. The environment is lax, and the food is wonderful. I developed a taste for Thai food via Penny's. Also, they make their own kick-ass spicy ginger beer. Come here for an easy-going lunch or dinner experience.

I love Penny's. I discovered it on the way to the station and walked in. The place is pretty much a diner, layout and seating utilitarian rather than decorative. The actual decor is kind of creepy and morbid- I'm talking about the pictures on the wall. But I go there when I'm hungry and at that point I only have eyes for the food.

I wouldn't say this place is super authentic, but they do dish up a really great meal. My favourties there are the bean thread noodle, the hot pepper noodle and i love love love the tom kha gai soup - it reminds me of my grandma's prawn curry, its super delicious and really filling. Just what you need on a cold day. I can say that whenever I go there, that's the first thing I think to order.

They have really large portions and most of their main courses are about $7 - not bad for a  meal. I can usually make it stretch to 3 meals, but I have a small appetite. Also, i find the food really fresh and filling. One thing I would whine about would the the amount of veggies- its not a lot and I like my veggies.

One surprise- they have a really killer chocolate cake. Yes I'm as surprised as you are and I wouldn't have even known about it if I didn't have a craving that day. Its mousse-y in the middle with a dark chocolate base and comes with raspberry sauce. I'm not a fan of that sauce but I am of the cake. When I go there with friends, we don't stop till the cake plate is licked clean!

Penny's was great, the serving were sizeable and the prices amazing, around $6-8 for a meal. Located close to the Damen station, it was easy to get to, and the waiters were attentive. I got the thai raviolli, which was kind of like a pad thai with dumplings in it, and really enjoyed it. Would absolutely reccomend it.

I really don't do noodles that much since i'm very picky when it comes down to that.  I happen to come to this place only because the wait at Big Star was over 2 hours across the street.  To my surprise i happen to liked their Vegetarian Bowl (Thin rice noodles served with tofu, lettuce, bean sprouts, red cabbage, carrots, green onions, cilantro, ground peanuts and slices of lime) a LOT.  I was very grateful for them to give me a fork since i was having very a hard time with them darn chopstick.  Also they carry a pretty decent craft beer selection.  Any place that carries Half Acre beer selection is place worth checking out.

One of my favorite noodle shops, Penny's delivers on flavor and a reasonable price. My favorites here are Gyoza,  the Vietnamese spring rolls, the chicken satay, Tom yum soup,   sauteed chicken, barbequed pork, thai ravioli,  and beef lad nar. Those are my favs, but everything is good here. The service is usually great. even when it is crowded. The prices are awesome, I can feed a family of four for less that $50, including drinks and tip. I love this place.

I am from Taiwan, aka seafood paradise. I didn't expect to get good quality sushi with reasonable price in the US. I have tried a lot and they are all rather disappointing. But this sushi restaurant is absolutely excellent! Their butter scallops are amazing and their rolls are fantastic. I particularly love the roll that is salmon with lemon slice (forgot the name). So fresh, sooooooo good!

However, I prefer their rolls rather than their nigiri. Ordered some shrimp nigiri before, not as good as their rolls. But their rolls...Every single one is awesome!

Food: 4
Decor: 3
Service: 4

3.5 stars, rounding up.

Our group of 4 decided to come here for dinner since the Toro Sushi wait was an hour, and I had to catch a flight.

1. Crazy eel, 11
Fresh Water Eel, Cilantro, Avocado, Cucumber, Spicy Mayo, Scallions Topped w. Mango & eel sauce.
~Not bad, although it wasn't as good as Toro. Mango was a nice addition.

I used to live around the corner, and Ponzu is so good that even though I moved away I still come back. Their best dish is the smokey tataki roll. It has seared salmon on top and is absolutely amazing. They took it off the menu at one point, but made it upon our request. Also, it's BYOB! :)

I wasn't all that impressed. I'm not a big fan of sushi in general, but my friends got me to try it. Seemed like we waited quite a while, but I can't be a great judge considering I'm not a sushi person :)
Had a great sushi selection. It has one of the greatest philly roels in the city. I definitely recommend trying this place!

Amazing food,  incredible service accompanied along with a comfortable and clean atmosphere. Home cut fries and huge slices as well as burgers and dogs. Washed it down with a nice iced tea, highly recommend experiencing a Chicago staple in the food community.

I love a good slice of pizza. However, I am very biased when it comes to pizza since I have never had a bad pizza. I really enjoyed the convenience of being able to get a slice and the jumbo size was perfect for me. I think the biggest issue with pizzas is the bread and the dough. It's no different for this pizza. It isn't the best, but it makes up for it with the cheese and toppings. Overall I was satisfied and had a good jumbo slice that satisfied my pizza hunger.
The absolute worst pizza I've ever had in Chicago. instead of wasting your money, just pour a ton of salt on a piece of cardboard and eat that for the same experience

Excellent prices,  taste,  location,  and size! My colleagues thought i had lasagna but it was this stuffed slice (as in one slice)! Do you see how massive this thing is?! The staff was friendly and the wait was only five minutes or around that. I'll  visit again soon.

I used to go to this Bacci all the time, but hadn’t gone since last summer (2021) because they were closed in the fall. I was appalled to see the price of a slice  of pizza is now $9 with a Square charge added on for card transactions. I was equally disappointed that the soda fountain was removed.

I guess harming small businesses and the middle class is what we get with an economic illiterate in the White House. By the way, the pizza was still decent, but Im not convinced any is worth that price.
#foxtrotjoybacci
Jibarito was so good!! I loved the garlic spread topped onto the plantains. The chicken platter with rice was good. The sampler empanada plate was okay, but the cilantro tamarind sauce was delicious.

Food was really good!!! Really nice atmosphere and friendly servers.
We order "El Jibarito" filled with steak meat and served with Arroz con Gandules (yellow rice with green pigeon peas) and "Mofongo con Camarones" to be served with Arroz con Gandules and avocado. The shrimp sauce had a nice spicy kick...I like it!!!

I use to love this place.  However today I was extremely disappointed.  I waited 25 minutes to get my jibarito & rice.  It wasn’t even crowded when I got there.  They had a full staff working.  I went to the staff to ask for hot sauce & to let them know my steak in the sandwich was cold.  Instead of being nice, the person wanted .30 cents for extra sauce! seriously!  Where is the good customer service?

AHHHH-MAZINGGGG! Had lunch here today and it was definitely one of those local places that is a must-go when you're in the Pilsen area. Heck, when you're in Chicago! Was there for about 1.5 hours and the place never had a "slow" moment.  The customers were constantly coming in and out and delivery services were constantly picking up bags and bags of orders. You know it's that good! Arroz con gandules was one of the best I've ever had and the chicken stew was incredible. Sweet plantains to top it off and I was in heaven and wish my stomach had more room. Already planning to come back. So happy to have found this place. Definitely recommend 100%!

Got a vegan jibarito, which came with rice and beans. The vegan jibarito is basically vegetables, which mostly meant bell peppers, which I'm not a huge fan of, but I still enjoyed it a lot. Also got a veggie empanada, which similarly was a lot of bell peppers. Was expecting more of a spicy food, but it really wasn't. First time trying, but probably won't be the last since I really liked the plantains. The service was speedy, and prices were very reasonable.

Their sandwiches are just okay in my opinion. But I bought Arancini ball from there the other day that was out of this world. I've never had one outside of Italy that tasted like this It was perfectly made and very flavorful and I'm going to go back and get more. I loved it.

.Rating the overall experience with this business outstanding! This family-owned Italian delicatessen is highly recommended. Everything is very fresh and their meats and cheeses are of superior quality.. Phenomenal subs!

The Deli in the rear has one of the best Italian subs in the city. I love JP Graziano's and Bari's. But you don't hear about Tony's much. Tony's runs with the big dogs. Super cute grocery store with imported canned good and sundries from Italy. The front of the store has baked goods as well. But for me, the draw is the deli/sandwich shop. A super sized sub sandwich, roughly a 20" sandwich is $9.99. I love it, the bread is crusty and delicious, the meats and cheese are a perfect balance, and the Italian dressing is the perfect topper on the sub. The sandwich is generously sized, so much that my wife often laughs when I walk into the house with this huge sandwich. I think the sign in the store markets it as a 15" sub or something. But they obviously err to the side of much larger. I'm never feeling like they've short-changed me on the sandwich size. Never. My only gripe is that I wished they offered some sort of onion choice, but it doesn't deter me from getting one of these sandwiches maybe once a week. I happily add some red onion at home to make this the perfect Italian sub for me. Delicious! Go there. Go there now. Just note that they usually close by 3p, which is rough for me when I have a craving for one of their subs at like 4p. I want one now.

A trip back home to Chicago for me isn't complete until I've eaten an amazing thin crust pie from Phil's pizza D'Oro and the perfect Italian sub from Tony's Italian deli & subs.  Family owned store that just does everything right using great ingredients at an unbeatable price.  A true neighborhood gem.

A+ service, A+ food, A+ experience.
Very generous portions for price. I highly recommend to all. Club sub is what picked up-Definitely impressed with Tony’s Italian Deli & Subs

The chicken had a good flavor. The Carne asada was also seasoned well. Rice and beans were tasty. I liked the tacos more than the gordita it was thin and a little on the crispy side. I like that they had a variety of Mexican bottle drinks and the Horchata was good. The restaurant was a little dark. The bathroom was not the cleanest.

Meson Del Taco is a very great Mexican restaurant. It’s my go to place for Mexican food. In my opinion the food taste better when you take out and not dine in. If you are going to try Meson I recommend you get the 3 Chicken taco dinner with sour cream and cheese. Also for your drink try the Horchata and get green salsa for your food.

This is the most delicious food ever.  I ordered the chicken enchilada dinner and they were perfect. The portions were HUGE for the price. Delivery was faster than grubhub predicted too.  I am very happy

Probably one of the better quality Mexican restaurants in our area. I mostly order tacos and burritos. Their meat quality is much better than any other local places. Their prices have gone up though recently to keep up with the prices of goods. Glad to see they prioritize quality. Tacos were delicious and well stuffed and packed.
I simply love this place. The pastor taco is full of flavor with pineapple tidbits. One of few places that serves 2 taco dinner. 3 tacos is too many for me. Highly recommend!

I love the flavors on the menu. Everything is very good. It’s a fast food take on Indian food. I always get the samosas and a wrap. I’ve tried a few different wrap flavors and they are all good. I like that the portion is manageable and priced appropriately. This is a go to spot for me.

Great quick place and one of the more affordable options in the loop. I love their wraps, lamb curry, and their sweet potato fries are good too!
The lamb curry wrap does get soggy but that makes it taste even better in my opinion.

Very affordable place to have lunch during office days. They offer wraps, bowels with both veg and non-veg options. I have tried samosas, paneer mix and rice which tastes awesome. The food is less oily and they also have wheat options for the wraps. There are a few tables for dine-in option too.

Easy 5. Lamb is best I've had any Indian place. Boneless but still moist and flavorful. Overall, so much flavor, esp at this price point. Chicken is very good too. Decent amount of food for the price. Sauces are all solid. There's not a lot of spice here. Enough for me but I know a lot of south Asians need a ton of spice. But I'll take good flavor and low spice over the opposite every day.
Idk why people say there's few options. There's several meats and several veg options

A simple bowl will run you about $14. Nothing really noteworthy about the food. The portions are rather small for the price. The taste was okay. Maybe look elsewhere if you want a decent lunch. When there are so many better options around, I don’t think I’ll be back.
