This is how my ordered was sent out after ordering through Door Dash. It arrived in a simple plastic bag with chips, cookie(stale), and brown paper bag. When I tried to lift the paper bag, it split from the side. I finished splitting the bag and it revealed my sandwich tossed around with the ingredients coming out.  Picture speaks for itself. Never ordering from here again!
Stingy on the veggies (3 slices of cucumber for a foot long) Not helping the overall subway brand. Other locations are much better, friendly and welcoming.

Got a Veggi Delit rap and the servant was skimpy on the ingredients. She saved their ingredients but lost a repeating customer. I don't like to be cheated when paying your full price of $9. Please don't support them and their treatment of customers. Let them save their ingredients!

Skimpy portions, more expensive than others, bathroom out of order, no hot water for the employees to wash their hands 😖
Go elsewhere
Expensive and small portions compared to the other subways near that area on top of it asking for the tips.

Great place and staff. Food is delicious and the lounge atmosphere with the jazz band playing is great. We had the bread plate, the cheeseburger, and the ribs and everything was good and tasty. Just one thing weird : the bottle of diet coke is about half the size of the regular coke bottle for nearly the same price... Could have been good to have the option to get a full size bottle.

5 Star, The Atmosphere was filled with happy people serving and bring plates to tables that makes your palate dance. I must say the salad vinaigrette was not over powering but just right with the crunchiness of almonds. The Salmon was cooked to flaky perfection. Bandera is on my MUST EAT list.

The waitering was absolutely amazing. Very kind and quite helpful with the suggestions of dinner choices. The ambiance was extremely cozy. A live jazz performance that made the night a more warming entertaining environment. The food, incredibly mouth watering. Absolutely delicious. Overall, it was a great experience and I highly recommend others to experience it.

Upscale spot in the loop for American food. Lots of good fish options. I especially liked the Emerald Kale and Chicken Salad. They have live jazz music every day which is pretty cool, made the ambience a whole lot delightful. Service was quick and staff was very professional and welcoming.

This place is hands down amazing! They have a live jazz band playing while you are enjoying your meal. The atmosphere is swanky with a touch of class. The service is amazing and they went above and beyond to make my dining experience excellent. Super attentive wait staff, greeted with a friendly smile by the hostess, food was out in a prompt and timely manner. I had the bbq ribs which were super tender and melting in my mouth and my boyfriend had the pork chop which was perfectly cooked. There is not enough good to say about the nice time we were able to spend at this restuarant. Oh, and the dessert was soooooo good! We had the walnut apple pie cobbler which was rich and full or warm caramel goodness.

Let us down this time! You may ask why our picture shows us eating our bowl with our lid… let me tell you: We had a day of it.... delayed flight. Lost luggage.... we were looking for some silver lining with some burrito bowls from chipotle. Got no silverware, no napkins, and wilted lettuce.
:( had to try to stomach it and eat it with the tinfoil top as a spoon :(

Extremely unreliable in terms of food quality. Sometimes the burritos are overstuffed with everything else except the protein or there’s barely anything in them at all. This location is one of the worst in downtown Chicago. Pickup orders are always 10-15 mins late, and most days the rice is almost never cooked all the way through. If you enjoy crunchy rice and barely any consistency, this is your Chipotle!

It was my first visit. They have a choose-your-own food type of bar. I can choose only Halal, so took brown rice with beans salad and avacode. Total bill was 9.6 $. Food was delicious and quantity was good.
Waiting time was very long. We ate in but still the food was cold. The food itself was tasty. Shane it was cold. Perhaps they're understaffed. Sunday is a busy night too probably.

Old lady serving food gives the tiniest portions. Not even a full scoop of the spoon. Also the rice doesn't even cover the bottom of the bowl as a bed. This is the WORSE CHIPOTLE I have ever been to. When I asked the lady for a better scoop she showed me a salad dessing cup and said this is all you get.

The tacos are absolutely delicious. My biggest difficulty was in picking which ones I wanted to try. I will be back to try the rest! Food was served promptly. The beer and liquor selection was good, too. Lots of local options.

Big star tacos it’s a very popular taco venue in Bucktown/wicker park . The restaurant sitting  area is mainly outside in a simple relaxed environment. Their tacos are OK. They offer a decent variety with some creative options like the vegetarian taco in a bag. Their drinks menu (mainly margaritas and beer) lifts up the place. Margaritas pitchers are reasonably priced.

Delicious and fun stop! The salad is $10 and is very large and filling, it could be split between two people. The restaurant has a great ambiance and the service is very attentive. Huge bar selection as well, specials and happy hour on weekdays.

Mixed feelings about this place. The nachos were hands down the best plate, delicious and fully loaded. The tacos were okay, some lacked flavor more than others. Chicken and fish we’re good, potato and pork belly were okay. The boozy slushy we got was STRONG. Big win there. The service was pretty bad… food came out fast but waiters are also tending bar and they seemed overwhelmed.
Yummy tacos.  Al pastor was the best.  The food came within minutes of ordering.  Good service and drinks.
One of the best Dunkin locations I've been to. The early morning employees are efficient and attentive, Thank you.

Cashier staff efficient excellent can't complain about them .For the past couple of weeks cups and lids are not safe secure it drips down the sides as drinking and  even holding corporate managers  and  need to fix this issue .
I tried to buy coffee between 2 am and 3 am and they always tell me that there is no system, I think that the person who is attending at that time simply does not want to provide service.
Whole new Morning crew! They move like Turtles! Wait time is always too long! Bring the old crew back please

This Is One Of my Fave Location But Today I Stop By To Make A Order But Some Reason They Were Not Taking Orders At 11 pm. They Should Of Put A Sign If The Lacation Is Closed So The  Costumers Don't Waste Time Stopping By For Some Coffee

Let’s talk Sushi! What a hidden gem I stumbled across just shy of the Fulton market neighborhood. I’ve been to this place 4 times since my first visit. Everything taste great. From the teriyaki chicken down to the Latin Infused Sushi Rolls. They also have some amazing margaritas Fusion enhanced with Saki. To seal the deal they offer Live entertainment on Wednesdays with Darioke, a very cool twist on Karaoke and Latin Thursdays with a some after work music & dancing with $5 margaritas for happy hour to top it off. A must try and the top at the top of my favorite Sushi Spot List.

Went there with my family on our vacation. The owners, Jessie and Sam, were fantastic and super friendly, even Sam’s mom was extremely helpful and friendly. Service was quick and the food was phenomenal. The Ikebukuro was extremely fresh and melts in your mouth, and it was so good that we ordered another one. Overall the experience and the food was exceptional.

5 star service. Great prices, amazing SUSHI and we LOVED the live music Wednesday. This is also a perfect date night spot. 10/10. We tried 5 different rolls and loved them all- entire staff was awesome including our server Nathan. Highly recommend.

This is my third time coming here and every time I go it is a flavorful wonderful experience. It is pricey but I don’t mind splurging on good food and experience. Here are some photos for reference.
Try their specials, my favorite is Lime Fusion!!! Magnifique 💋

We had a great experience eating here. I can honestly say they have some of the best sushi I’ve ever had. The drinks were great, I wish I knew what the strawberry whiskey drink we ordered was called, they had a lot variety which we love. The service made our experience that much greater. The owners were so friendly and kind, Jess caught my fiancé pretty much licking the plate of the lobster wontons 😂thank you for pretending not to notice haha . I would eat here again, we plan to go back for their events on Wednesday and Thursday nights.

Great local bar with friendly staff and a pet friendly patio. I think they have some of the best wings in the city (top 5). Their bangers and burgers are great as well. Love the beer rotation on tap and sports on the tv’s if that’s your thing. Always have a good time and great meal here.

Ordered delivery from this place and the food arrived in great condition! The duck grinder was absolutely amazing. So incredibly tasty. Kind of like a duck sausage deconstructed, but better because it tasted less heavy and more well balanced. Definitely going to order again!

Great local Fulton Market neighborhood tavern. Quick service, friendly staff, good beers, typical bar food, friends enjoyed mixed drinks. Buffalo Cauliflower is spicy hot! In & outside seating. Accessible with a little help.

This is my favorite neighborhood bar. Their food is amazing and their service is great. GrubHub messed up my order and they were incredibly kind and quick to make it right for me. I've been coming for a while since I moved to the neighborhood and every experience has been awesome. This one in particular was the cherry on top. And of course, my meal was delicious as always. They are responsible for converting me from a steak fry hater to a believer.

Just went there with our baby who was very well behaved. They told us we had to wait for a table and then gave away open tables to 20 something  year olds that came well after us. When we approached them they told us we still had to wait. Shouldn’t treat customers differently because they have children and just want a night out. Staff was SO rude and inconsiderate. Maybe also because I’m a person of color and white customers were given tables before me? No idea.

We walked to Clark Street Grill from Wrigley Field after the Cubs game. There were a decent amount of people in there but we found a booth. Liked the feel of store, nice old school feel. We got 2 Chicago Styled Hot Dogs and fries.  This one was super good and had really nice snap to it.  Fries could have been a bit crunchier but still good.

This is a great no-nonsense spot for a quick pickup for burgers, dogs, gyros or fries.

I'm writing this review because the gyro I got was so good and filled with the most meat I've ever gotten in a gyro, all for $9.99! (Pic attached)

This place is great for a quick bite or late night delivery.

Get the mozz sticks, and cheese fries, you will not be disappointed. Everyone is super nice inside and I'm so glad I live right down the street so I can go all the time.

Excellent food and service.  Don't park in the nearby shopping center.  They put boots on tires and charge $175 to remove.  Even with that experience,  excellent food. Wind blew most of our food off that table, they replaced it for free.
Everything was delish- great ital beef- get it with both sweet and hot peppers. Fries are delish with tasty potato flavor not grease- yum. Traditional polish- tons of delectable sautéed onions- yum!

Good food, tasty, fast serving.
You can get some drinks at the bar in the other room, they have acceptable prices and friendly staff.
See you soon 🥂

I went and placed my order at the drive thru one of my item was a bacon egg and cheese croissant WITHOUT CHEESE…. I get home and the sandwiches is not what I ordered ( picture ) i called and spoke to a girl who i informed of this error she told me i was able to pick up a brand new sandwich  however i told her i was unable right away because i had to go i to work if later on that day was ok. She responded with yes “ILL LEAVE A NOTE WITH YOUR NAME ON IT FOR THEN TO MAKE IT WHEN YOU COME BACK “.  I went back later that night and told them  of the situation and was told they had no note or knew anything of it , yesenia was very polite about telling me this information,  at this point its not about the 5$ the sandwich cost. Its about the time  wasted with employees who dont take responsibility of their mistakes.  Def not coming here again and this is “supposed to be the best dunkin for midway airport “

They spend to much time on the drive thru customers. Meanwhile there I was with three other people behind me waiting inside. One girl was cleaning around the coffee dispensers righting front of us without even acknowledging that we were there. I had to say something about them taking our orders to get us out of there. You guys need to do better with customer service for your inside customers. Don't just have us standing there while there is applicable employees that can take our orders.

Went through the drive thru and got a latte with whipped cream. To my defense I am a regular ol iced coffee or hot coffee but wanted to try something different. The associate was very polite and patient. There was no wait..I was in and out. DD for the win!

Goofy girls in the morning were running low on iced coffee. So instead of changing it out they tried putting decaf in my iced coffee that I ordered with 2 shots of espresso in it. Kinda defeats the purpose of paying for espresso shots. They remade it but ended up giving me no ice when I asked for light ice. It's not rocket science girls. Fet it together! 7-23-22 5:10am
Very slow express lane. Express lane was very dirty and full of debris. I asked for the senior discount, did not get it. No straw for my iced tea. No napkin for my sticky donut.

Absolutely fabulous experience. Going by the food it is undoubtedly one of the best in Chicago. We ordered the Scallops which were amazing. the flavours complemented each other beautifully. We also ordered the Risotto which in my opinion was good as expected. For entrées we had a rib-eye steak. It was hands down the best steak I have ever tried. They make it 16 Oz so go there hungry. The meat was really juicy, tender and very well cooked with great texture. The sauces in the steak complimented it very nicely. Absolutely recommended.

Yummy, what more can I say. Exquisite meal, includes Asparagus custard, Dorado Fish, Quail polenta, Soft Shell Crab, Rice Pudding, Goat Cheese Cheesecake, all very well done and paired with beautiful wines, great service, and beautiful ambiance. Highly recommend!

Came in for restaurant week. Was hoping we were going to love it seeing that this is a Michelin star rated restaurant and reviews were good. Came in at 9:30 on a Friday night. There were still plenty of people but seemed to be winding down. We were seated promptly and had water on our table in seconds. 15 min and two glasses of water later still no waiter.  Ill sum it up with this. Terrible service, I mean absolutely terrible service and decent food (by no means outstanding in anyway). So many better more affordable places in the city not sure how this place is still open.  I'm glad it was a discounted menu because I would have went crazy if we had a $400 bill for that food. My girlfriend didn't finish her meal and we had one bite of the desert. A live and learn experience. We will not be back.

Really first rate service, delicious food and comfortable atmosphere. I honestly hadn't realised it was such an upscale restaurant. We ducked in after work in business casual and felt a little under dressed. Although no one whom worked there made us feel anything but comfortable. We had a lovely meal, delicious flavors and beautiful presentation.

Went to Naha for dinner during Restaurant Week (before committing to a $300-ish date night). The food was incredible: Well-crafted, well-portioned and creative. What I love about this chef is the thoughtfulness in how both flavors and textures come together in the finished dishes. The donut dessert I had was probably the most fun dish I've ever eaten. I will definitely come back for a special occasion. Only complaint is that the restaurant got pretty noisy by the time we left, as the seating is very open and in close quarters.

Jorge our waiter was amazing! He was very friendly, courteous and on top of everything. He manage the service of our food well. The food was delicious. The calamari we order was lightly battered and fried to perfection. The risotto was delicious and a perfect complement to our food. I recommend this place.
Thank you Lynn for your wonderful service and recommendations. We enjoyed our meal very much, and our kids liked the food too. Definitely the best Italian restaurants that dined at!

This place is awesome. From the service down to the food. Tiffany was an amazing waitress and made us feel right at home. The food is delicious. Even My 2 year old approved!!  If you’re in Chicago you have to stop by here!

Outstanding food and service.  This was our first visit to Chicago and we went to Francesca's on Chestnut..best decision we made.  We were so impressed with the food and service we actually went there for a second time during our 4 day stay.  Jorge our server went above beyond, great Customer Service !! and we even stopped to speak with the Manager to let him know how impressed we were.  I guarantee our next visits to the area we will go back again and again!!

It's a great italian food here. We tried the pasta with white lemon and garlic sauce with shrimp is very very nice citrus for summer or someone like the refreshing taste. we sat at the bar. Our guy is great too. the place looks classy style. cocktail is great too.

It was nearly midday when I arrived, the display was half emptied but they still had plenty to choose from. I went with the donut holes chocolate and a seasoned favorite pumpkin they were fresh and satisfy My Sweet tooth quite nicely.

The dukin' donuts on Howard  needs to be shut down you can never go in and just order what you want without been harassed by all the homeless people who hang out in front then they have the Nerve to come inside and ask you if you can buy them something to eat the staff and management just stand there and does absolutely nothing #shuthispacedown pete's and subway dose not condone any type of harassment toward their customers
I love my Frozen Caramel Coffee they make it just how I instruct them to make it because of health reasons .

Just a heads up I ordered a Tomato Pesto Grilled Cheese at Dunkin today and the bread wasn't even grilled!  The sandwich doesn't look anything like their advertisement.   Very misleading.  When I went back she gave me a hard time about grilling it.  Can you imagine 🤔?  Well, she only grilled it on one side that's it.  The cashier said, they only grill it on one side, doesn't make sense to me.  If you're going to grill something, grill it!!
Do not get the croissant with the turkey sausage it's so greasy you can't even eat it I threw my sausage away

This place is going to be my favorite spot for breakfast around. They not only have delicious crepes but other food as well. We are crepe lovers so we decided to try three different crepes and they were amazing. Coffey was also very good. My bf said the milkshake was the best ever!

On top of this everything was so nicely served. They really pay attention to the details, look at the beautiful gold flatware!

We will definitely be back again or order online.

This is my favorite cafe spot. I wish I could come every day. It is always very clean. They are very friendly. Have tons of options. Peaceful environment. I love the affirmations they have in a jar. You get to choose one and open it up. Sorta like a fortune cookie (without the cookie). The plating is impressive and largely why I come. They care about the customer experience from beginning to end. They want you to feel at home. Great quality, local business that should be supported.

I was greeted by friendly smiling faces ! Provided with a nice positive quote to start off my day in the right direction. The food tastes amazing, with all the flavors marrying together. With a a larger party of 5 for the dining setting they quickly accommodated our party with very cute touches of gold silverware.

I highly recommend visiting the amazing crepe shop ❤️

I’ve been here about a dozen times and let me tell you this place is my favorite to get crepes. I am big fan of savory crepes and they make them so delicious here. Crape Twist is very aesthetic and has a laid-back chill vibe. The owner is Bulgarian and only recently opened this shop but has done such an amazing job with creating a beautiful atmosphere in the restaurant but also using high quality ingredients in the food. Absolutely love this place and would highly recommend it if you want to get the “best crepes in town.”

PLEASE DO NOT MISS THIS PLACE! Cannot speak highly enough of it. Cute and inviting atmosphere, delicious food and coffee, and wonderful staff. All around amazing experience.
A friend I was with has a lot of allergies and had never eaten a crepe before. They went above and beyond to make sure she was cared for with a gluten, nut, and dairy free crepe. We’ll definitely be back!

The drive thru line was ridiculously long. The order taker seemed to be patient. We arrived at the window to pay and instead of letting us know ahead that no receipts were printable, she didn't say anything and proceeded to close the window without even saying thank you. We sat there until she opened the window again and that's when she told us we couldn't get a receipt. That's why we need these clerks to have great customer service, because even if that was the case that they were out of receipt 🧾 paper her delivery would have made it a little bit better. They need customer service training and the management needs to keep up with their office supplies. A customer should never not have access to their receipt.

I usually try to order from uber eats but it's always busy which I understand. It cheap and supposedly fast. I went with my husband and kids on a Saturday afternoon. It wasn't busy at all which is why I don't understand why the area was dirty. Also they gave my son a crusty old chicken patty. If I knew this, I would have gotten my money back but it was too late and we were already close to home. I  just know not to come nor order from this location again. The only reason for 2 stars is the customer service.

This is by far one of the worst McDonald’s I have ever been too in my Life!!!!! For years I have tired to give this place the benefit of the doubt because of two young ladies who work there and the fact that working in the city that they are literally 3 minutes from my work. Every time that I go there it could be either walk in or drive up, I’m getting horrible attitudes just for being a polite customer. and very slow customer service. By the time I leave, my break is pretty much over which is an hour. From being on that side of the register before, I know how customers are capital of but that should not give the workers the right to treat a paying customer as such. Just because this McDonald’s is in a urban neighborhood, the attitude should not match. I’ve made up my mind that I’ll rather trying across town to receive better customer service.

It took between 5 to 10 minutes to get my order from a medium traffic drive-thru, they provided everything I asked for. The fries were a bit overcooked, rendering them crunchy. The jalapeño burger was tasty. As for the chicken sandwich, it was a bit on the dry side even with extra pickles... I didn't finish it... 😕

Manager Samantha, if that’s her name is a horrible manager. She was wearing a yellow shirt, glasses with hazel eyes and fat. She ignored my requests for her district managers name and number after she was absolutely rude to me. My food was handed to me cold out of the drive through window. Please don’t visit this location!!!!

Simply excellent. Came into town for a four-day trip and this was by far the most impressive place we visited. Food ordered: Oysters, Skirt Steak, Roasted Chicken, Crab Fried Rice, & Asparagus. Drinks: Live on Mars, Purple Rain. Everything was excellent. The service was also pretty fast. Would definitely revisit again someday in the future!

The Kitchen is impressive! The waiters and manager are so well educated and trained that puts this restaurant above average.
The new pastry Chef made the Coconut Tres Leches Cake with passion fruit perfectly and so rich of flavors!! We were overwhelmed!!
The food was really good as well, we had the Black Linguine with Shrimp, the tomato starter which has a mix of salt and sweet, and the Peruvian steak.
Definitely 5 stars for the food, service, and the amazing staff!

Delicious food, great views, and good service. We came here on a weeknight for a business dinner and got a seat outside facing the water. It was fun to get a full view of the river and see all the summer activities! The food was really tasty - definitely try the crullers, they are phenomenal.

This place has got my vote. My girlfriend & I were in search for a late night dinner on Saturday night on the river and we weren't having much luck (we'd been turned away from some places as it was late). Unbeknownst to the hostess it was our last night in Chicago in celebration of our anniversary and she was gracious enough to seat us with the kitchen so close to closing for the night. The manager overheard the comment of the kitchen closing soon and to our surprise was nice enough to bring us some comped champagne making the night even more special. The good things didn't stop there...our waitress Georgia was great and knowledgeable about the food which only added to how great our experience was here. The food was amazing, my girlfriend got the crab fried rice and I got the black pasta with cheesecake for desert. We definitely plan on returning to Chicago with Kitchen high on the list of a repeat place to go.

Loved everything about this place! Great vibe at the bar, the bartender was awesome! Made us drinks to our liking, the appetizers were delish. Best oysters I’ve ever had. I can’t wait to be back and explore more of the menu.

Pizza was absolutely terrible. They gave me reheated pizza and then denied that it was reheated. Whatever it was, it wasn’t fresh. In addition to that, when I googled the location it resulted under Nick’s Gyro not the real Milano’s pizza. No wonder the food was so terrible. I’ll know the check the address next time so this doesn’t happen again.

This was my first time trying them and it was worth it. Everything was super fresh and very very good. I ordered the rip tip meal with fries. They give you a even amount of both ribs and fries. It was delicious. I will definitely be ordering again
They are alright...I recommend you go in to their restaurant to get your food, that way you can make sure it is prepared properly.  If you get it delivered,  you will be disappointed.

I ordered a Salad and wings from Nick's and it turned into the worse customer service interaction I've ever had. Here's how it went.

Before I made my order via Uber Eats I called Nick's to verify that I could in fact order hotwings fried without flour due to my gluten intolerance. They confirmed that I could order fourless wings,  so I placed the order via Uber eats with the specifications in the notes. When I recieved my order the salad was fine, But the wings were breaded. No biggie right? I'm sure the restaurant will accommodate me...WRONG. I called them back and whoever I spoke to told me the manager wasn't in but would be back in 5mins. I called back and was told that the manager was now there,  but they couldn't find them.... Eventually the employee on the phone told me to just come up there...so I did... once there,  I was met by a middle aged woman with rotting bottom teeth and a singular tooth at the top that she strategically covered with her top lip due to an obvious insecurity...I calmly and respectfully explained to her what happed, but she did not care....She cut me off every chance she got and told me all I wanted was free chicken wings. She says, "if you had a problem with the chicken, where's the chicken at..how can we exchange chicken that we don't have...she continuously got loud with me and cut me off, while pointed to a policy sign that I couldn't have ever seen, given that I ordered from uber eats. We had a highly disrespectful 15min exchange that left me baffled, so much so that I thought I was at the wrong restaurant. I left empty handed being accused of just wanting free food. Very Ghetto, would not recommend.
The food and service was very good but the prices are through the roof. Double cheeseburger and a large fry cost me $13. Never again sorry!

My go to "I am craving breakfast for dinner" place! Food is always good and consistent. Service is always warm, welcoming, and engaged.

Nothing fancy, just a big menu with lots of good things on it.  Pancakes are ridiculously good.

Big plus=parking lot.

Don’t know why I had held off as long as I did living so close. Classic diner feel and offerings and furthermore to my delight, this location was very clean, the staff clearly takes pride in what they do. Chilaquiles were rock solid, eggs cooked perfectly, massive portion, so come hungry - made a mental note for the futures as a great hangover cure. The service was great as well, and will definitely be making this my “quick and easy” breakfast stop.
We wanted to taste some old favorites for lunch. The Golden Nugget Pancake House has so many choices from breakfast to dinner. They deliver satisfaction every time.

The waiter was really nice. However it was a long wait. For a ball of fruit it took almost an hour to come out. The hot food I expected to be long but not fruit. I really like Golden Nugget but I’ll give honest review. The waitresses walked pass me 100x and never assisted me. It can sometimes be unprofessional. They need to clean window seal because there was a bug but hey again not to bash just do better
One of the best meals I've ever eaten: Honey coconut chicken and waffles! What a fantastic take on a classic dish. My whole family enjoyed their meals, and we all got something different.

Came here for brunch with a large group of girls. The DJ played great music and the vibe was awesome! They were definitely understaffed to accommodate the size of our group although they knew we were coming in advance. We only had one waitress and she did an amazing job! It did take forever for us to get our food. I got the Crispy Birria Quesadillas and they were delicious!

Place is nice but that is it. Terrible service! Waited forever for the waitress to take our order, get water or a refill and get our bill. The place did not have alot of tables so I couldn't understand why the waitressing was so bad. You will get charged a fee to eat there, did not know that...? Note the ~18-20% mandatory tip was mandatory for 6 of us and was NOT earned as the waitress provided little to no service.
Food is meh, avoid the fries the season is overwhelming. Had a house Margarita and it was nothing special.

READ ALL IMPORTANT REVIEW- Me and my 4 favorite girls (all African American) went bar hoping downtown for my birthday. Instantly El Hefe bar music was lit and the vibe seemed amazing. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by security who was very nice. We went to the bar while we waited for a while to be served we just danced and laughed. Eventually a female bartender came to take our order, first round of patron shots. She was extremely rude so I did not tip. After the shots I needed water she completed ignored me. So I waited thinking she was just busy as she serviced the other none African American  men and women around us. We all tried to get her attention and she would make eye contact and tell us to wait as more people came in that were Not African American. She yelled at us and told us that we had to wait because she did not work for free. We were so confused due to the fact we were trying to order more rounds of drinks and we tip well. We are educated black women that experienced racism by a Caucasian bartender while trying to celebrate my birthday. The vibe here was amazing but the bartender they have is racist and it really upset the night for us. I also made the bar manager aware of the his name is Jeff and he stated he was aware who it was, he was not shocked.

They have to work on the service and making sure someone man's the hostess desk. We waited for about 5 minutes until I could flag down a waitress help us find a place to sit. It was pretty loud and gave more of bar rather than an actual restaurant vibe. The food in the end was really good and flavorful!

Went into the bar looking to listen to good music and have a few drinks. Sat down never greeted. My other half went to the bar brought back two drinks Hennessy and cranberry.. full of ice and a watered down drink.. I went back to the bar for two shots of Hennessy to add to it.. $25 bucks each total $50.00 and a 20% gratuity charge was given without my knowledge. Literally went back to the table , had our drinks And left. Management needs to do better I never in my life walked into a bar and had to fix a drink and literally paid 100.00 for two drinks. Music was great but I am really upset.

Went to Tanuki on a whim with my friend and we both had a great time! It was a bit busy, however, was still amazing! It is BYOB, so if you want to grab a drink, do it before.

The service was great, even though they were swamped with orders and such.

The Salmon Aloha and Tuna Tartare were our apps and they were amazing. Everything was so fresh and absolutely amazing! We also got two sushi rolls which were fantastic! I highly recommend checking out this place and stopping in!

I’ve always passed by Tanuki but never gave it a try until  last week and I was very pleasantly surprised with the yummiest spicy miso soup I’ve ever had that I had to order a second! I love sushi and this was one of the freshest I’ve had in a long time. It’s thinly rolled in rice so the rice isn’t overpowering and you can taste the flavors of the sushi. I absolutely loved all the sushi but the Philly salmon roll was succulent with a hint of smokey flavor. I’m already craving the spicy miso soup and their maki rolls. I can’t wait to try other options on the menu. They all sound so delicious. The service was a bit slow but very attentive server and def worth it! I’m definitely be a repeat customer :)

The service and food here are phenomenal. We made a reservation and ordered off the special menu for Chicago restaurant week. I could not finish all the dishes but really wanted to, they were so good! The best thing was the tuna poke with the guacamole and chips — it sounds so strange but goes together SO WELL. Also the miso soup is served in a large portion in a mug and it is delightful

Amazing service and delicious food! We ordered 6 different maki rolls and they were all so fresh and tasty. It was my sisters birthday and they went ABOVE and beyond making her feel special with a handwritten card placement and some complimentary mochi with a candle to blow out. Will definitely be going again and recommending to everyone!

I had my birthday dinner at Tanuki sushi with large group of people and we loved everything. Sushi was fresh, well decorated, asian hot dishes were also very tasty. I also liked the vibe and music, everyone who worked there was super friendly. Recommend to everyone who likes sushi and asian food. It’s a gem in the neighborhood

I ordered for delivery from this place.  Turns out that they don't deliver to my apt.  What's the problem?  They have the DELIVERY GUY call me twenty minutes after I placed my order and gave them my credit card number!  Then instead of going ahead and delivering the food that they already should have prepared (which is not that far from their restaurant) being good customer service and their mistake, they just say "Sorry for the mistake"...click.
A cheerful staff serves up delicious food in a timely manner. Plus, with prices like these, I don't need to go anywhere else for grill food in the neighborhood. Terrific!
This place suck. Unless you going next door to see hookers then grab a bite not really worth it even the hooker next door is a ugly.

This place makes some great tapas and sangria.  I love their back patio.  Its like a little piece of serenity off Halsted.  I recommend the bacon wrapped dates!  They have a great selection selection of cold and hot tapas.  I'm not  a huge seafood fan, but there is alot of that on the menu.  I like the meat and veggie tapas.  I love that they have some larger portion options in case someone's really hungry.

The tapas is fabulous, as is the staff. They have an extensive menu which is best enjoyed in their seasonal outdoor garden. The garden is the sort of place you think doesn't exist in that area of the city and there it is. I haven't had anything bad off of the menu- there is a lot to go through, but ask your waiter and they will surely suggest something extra tasty:)

I was there on  a Sunday afternoon, we were the only people there (2 of us). It was dead and the staff was taking a break.  When we finally got a server we asked about the wine list, witch was insultingly high priced.  I ordered the sangria and it tasted funny.  We also ordered a few dishes and they were very tiny and not very good. When they say tapas, they mean tapas...high price for unbelievably small quantity.   The empanadas were very dry and poor ground meat.  I had better frozen.  The manager was very uncooperative and didn't seem to care about our issues.  I wanted to return the sangria and get something drinkable, but the manager was very rude and would not take it off the bill, saying it was our fault because we ordered it, "To Bad" was his comment.  I was very disappointed and will not go back. The place needs an enema to rinse out the dread and regret!!!

The choice of tapas are great! The price of the food is perfect for those folks who do not want to spend alot but want to eat. The tapas are always hot and seems to be made to order. I think this place is a good restaurant that we should support in our community.

Tapas Gitana is a hidden gem in the boystown neighborhood. The food is amazing and there are a ton of Gluten Free food options and very reasonable prices. During the summers they have a huge patio in the back!
We had apple pie A la  mode 4 $3.58. A bargain. The richness of the ice cream complemented the cinnamon in the pie. So d-lish.

Great Price for Quality Food. The staff is Very friendly and Inviting. Kids love the Cheese fries. Adults Enjoy their breakfast all day. And I personaly Enjoy the Columbian Coffee with a Pecan Roll. I Keep coming back for more.
Nice neighborhood place to go and hang out and eat!

They never answer the phone to take a order , its covid season so the cook who is the only one in their now sits in their but when you go to make or pickup a order he will not let you in only takes your money while he locks the door and leaves you standing their waiting for your food and change back, Now this would be fine since i guess safety precautions and all but Like i stated They Never Answer The Phone to take a order and if you walk pass this little place you will see the cook judt sitting their not answering orders

OMG! So, I have to say that their Tacos and Burrito Al Pastor are fantastic. I pretty much stop by once a week to get either of them. The staff is super friendly and they treat you like you are at home. Always with a smile and ready to help. Love watching the Telenovelas while waiting for my order.
Small little shop but filled with lots of deliciousness. 100% recommend to anyone looking for great Mexican fast food.

Quesobirria, that’s all you have to know! They were recommended to me by the staff and they are not wrong. These are very delicious and tender. Fairly priced for the amount of food. The hot sauces were also really good. I will definitely be coming back here to get some more.

I tried their dinner taco menu, which gives three tacos of your choice together with rice and beans. I appreciated how the tacos had two layers of tortilla, preventing the taco from breaking down into mush. At the same time, this meant the tortilla flavors were stronger than what was inside it. I thought the rice and especially the beans were amazing! It was also my first time trying horchata, and that was pretty interesting. Not too sweet, with decent amount of cinnamon flavor.

I ordered the quesobirria dinner and horchata. The horchata was good but the star of the show was definitely the queso-birria with consome. That was so delicious. I will definitely be back! Highly recommend it.

Amazing tacos de birria. Very tasty consume. The tres leches is affordable and so delicious. The salsa and taco sauce ranges from mild to a nice kick with the habanero one.

I really recommend dining in so you can get service promptly. Their take out line can get pretty long. All positives.

Almost quite literally a hole in the wall place and what the influencers would call a "hidden gem".

The quesabirria dinner with rice and beans was phenomenal! OMG so good, the waitress was correct that this is what we needed to order. My girlfriend and I couldn't finish our plates. So much food for a really good price. You need to come here!

The food was amazing. We started with delicious crab cakes and then moved to the salmon sushi and salad. But all was not well! They forgot to bring bread to the table out of the gate. Then they brought us in a wrong dish. It would have been no big deal except our waiter would literally disappear for 10 minute increments.  I had to get up from the table and point out to the waiter that we had also ordered blackened shrimp and grits, which were probably delicious when they were cooked but now they were 15 minutes cold and a little more chewy than they should have been.

Three times we had to ask other staff to fill our drinks. While they graciously took off the dinner we did not order, it seemed like the staff was a little discombobulated.

But for me, the straw that broke the camel's back is when they brought my girlfriend her blackened shrimp and grits, to make a place on the table, he grabbed the mistaken fish and chips and actually asked her to grab her fork from her plate instead of just bringing a fresh one. Seriously?

It was my first time at this establishment. My girlfriend has been here many times before and assured me this was highly unusual. Time will tell.

It's OK...portions were quite small and I definitely have had much better lobster roll for less.
The Chilean sea bass was under seasoned and for being the highest priced fish I expected better.
All in all... Its just OK where it needed to be really good.

I do have to say that the oysters were EXCELLENT.  The options and variety is good.. From sweet to briny.  This was the best part of the meal.

We we thankful to get a table straight away on Saturday night holiday weekend. Sat at high top in bar area which is open to the regular dining area with white tablecloth. We started with chop salad and I think this may be their specialty. It was very nice. Shrimp cocktail amazing. our waiter asked if we wanted bread. iWarm potato’s bread. We had 5 or 6 different wait staff tend to us. Crab cakes great! Shaw platter and found the Scallops to be a little small but good very very well. Asparagus has a nice dip. The vegetable is from a local farm, It needed a splash of lemon, oil. s/p. This place is next to Andy’s Jazz club so it’s the perfect dinner before your show but I recommend a reservation. Finally, not sure why, but we were surprised with a free desert. Raspberry pie and it was out of this world!

This should be on the list of Chicago’s must try/eat/do. Such traditional feels and food is really good! The manager is so knowledgeable about the oysters and the food. The waiter was so warm and friendly. It checks every box for a perfect dining experience! I had the lobster roll and it was delish. I like that they used toast and not a bun. The oysters! Oh my…. So so good. I think I can just have the oysters for a meal… the key lime pie was nice, too. It didn’t have that over the top sour zing which I think makes it more enjoyable. If I ever come back to Chicago I will revisit.

Nice seafood food place too visit. Oysters were very delicious and lobster bisque was so tasty.  Waiters were very attentive and friendly.  I've been to quite a few seafood restaurants and I must say prices here are bit high here. Overall, very friendly establishment and very tasty good. Thank you Shaw's Crab House.

I absolutely loved it.
Maybe I've been on a calzone kick recently, maybe Sarpino's has the absolute best calzones of all time, who's to say?!
I got a CYO calzone and the italian one, it was so good, I had to order it again the next time to make sure I wasn't dreaming.

I ordered delivery through the Slice app. They were a little confused by my address, but called me quickly and it was resolved. There guys are open late and ALWAYS get it quick and right, I haven't had the opportunity to try anything else on the menu or even see the place, yet here I am; writing a review for a delivery calzone, it's that good.
I had the pizza a few weeks ago and it was decent! Tried calling again today, 3 calls, but no one picked up. Went with another pizza option as a result

I ordered delivery, waited an extra hour for it to arrive, and ended up with this. I immediately called and sent them this photo and was told I would be getting a refund. A week and a half later and 2 more phone calls, I'm still waiting on my refund.

----update----
It's been a few months and still no refund. Take your business elsewhere
Open late for a quick bite. Not the best food, but when it's late it will do. They have everything from Pizza to sandwiches.
The pizzas are good. Customer service is bad; the place is run down.

The ppl who work here are inattentive to customers, too busy having convos and eating amongst  themselves to even speak and say something as simple as hello. Small area could be cleaner and coolers should be stocked. I stopped by today (9/20/2018) around 2 pm.  The lady working  looked pretty disheveled as well.
There cream cheese cupcakes are the best. Relaxing place to eat
Price too high for being in a hospital
Always excellent

This place has great food. It may be easy to pass up with it's lack luster presence, but if you have a little extra time, you'll get a quality meal that's fresh, flavorful, and inexpensive.

I eagerly awaited the opening of Arami Go! late last year as it looked like it was going to be an express sushi place, while currently the only place I get sushi from in Streeterville is Niu Japanese Fusion Lounge, which is a little too classy for a quick bite, but Arami Go! is not a sushi place.

My first time here I got the lemongrass chicken ramen. It sounded so good, but I was really disappointed. The broth tasted like chicken stock, there was no hint of lemon, and it was filled with ingredients, but all of them flavorless. The chicken was juicy with broth, but tasted like just that, chicken broth. The best thing in the whole giant Styrofoam cup was the fish cakes. Though, I had to give this place a second try after tasting my boyfriend's short ribs.

Get the bento box. I recommend both the short ribs and the pork belly as the protein (probably not the healthiest choices, but defiantly the tastiest). You then pick out what to fill the rest of the compartments with from a choice of starch (the lemony fresh soba noodles are bomb), vegetable or spicy tofu salad (they're all good, but I can't stray away from the marinated brussel sprouts with the flaky bonito topping...drool), and a palate cleanser (basically edamame with different salting profiles). You also, by default now, get some lovely pickled vegetables to cut up your small dishes.

The inside has seating for about 25 people, and you approach a long walk-up counter along a narrow bland hallway, which tells you it has an express flow to it. Unfortunately every time I come here, I end up taking a seat at one of the empty tables for 5-10 minutes while waiting for my takeout bento box.

If you don't know what you're getting into, it's difficult to figure out what this place is and what you're supposed to order. Upon getting to the register, you feel a little more at ease talking to the staff. They talk about the food like they really take pride in it, and they walk you through all your options, but this seems like an unnecessary task.

The atmosphere is empty and has no personality. I used to think they just opened prematurely and just hadn't got to decorating, but nothing has changed and it's been a few months. They may have been going for a tranquil, cleanly feel... but it just feels temporary (they could at least use some instructional signage or photos). I want them to stay around, but I live in a residential building just down the street and I have never seen any kind of advertising from them. Hopefully they do well during lunch or for delivery, because there are a lot of new quick and inexpensive food options opening fast in the neighborhood and I would hate to see them forgotten.

Please try it! And grab a takeout menu on your way out.
Good for a quick but high quality lunch.  Pork belly was outstanding, the perfect combination of meat and fat.  A few Japanese treats like pocky etc as well.

Have you ever wanted food that tingles your taste buds and tantalizes tongue?
This is the place. No I don't work here and I don't get paid to write reviews, I simply
eat here so often that they know my favorite dishes and booth. I am originally from California, so no hate for Chi-Town, but we have the best Thai food in Cali and this place definitely ranks it up there with the top thai restaurants on the west coast. This is also the kind of place where they get to know you and make you feel welcome.

Amazing Thai food and great customer service.  They know how to cook thai food the right way.  The chicken satay is the best I have every had and I crave the fried rice.  One of the best fried rice I have ever had.
The food is always great, the service is spectacular, it is always a treat to go in and eat some quality food where you know everything is fresh and clean.
Gooder than F!

My friends and I went here on a whim (it was Easter Sunday and lots of places we expected to be open were closed) and we are so glad we did! The service was excellent - our Sicilian waiter made a great wine recommendation based the type of profile I was after, and he was attentive and responded to us throughout the night with great care. The food was delicious, fresh and was very authentic Italian - the capretto and the gnocchi were standouts. The atmosphere was great. Highly recommended!

Can't recommend Riccardo's enough.

Wonderful food and drinks but it was the service that really created an unforgettable experience.

Diligent, knowledgable and really friendly. Made to feel at home which only enhanced the enjoyment of the top class dishes.

Would return in a heartbeat when return to Chicago.
Cozy Italian place, our server was great, and the food was amazing. Calamari was delicious. I loved how they had good sized portions. *chef’s kiss*

My brother graduated from Navy bootcamp and he requested we go to an authentic Italian restaurant to celebrate his graduation and my, his, and our other brother’s birthdays that were missed while he was in training.
Riccardo Trattoria made the occasion so special. Firstly, it was small and intimate and because we went so early we were the only diners for the first half of our meal. My brother said everything he ate was the best food he’d ever had. Even for those of us who hadn’t spent the last 8 weeks eating food out of a bag, it was delicious. They also brought us panda cotta for our birthdays and gave us a discount for my brother’s service. I could not be happier with our choice. Thank you Riccardo Trattoria for making our family reunion so special!

Ricardo Trattoria was excellent.  Went with friends and had such a beautiful dinner. Started with a bottle of Barolo, our starters were the breasola carpaccio, fava beans,  veal meatballs,  all were super delicious. My main was the Veal Chop, delicious.The carbonara, ossobucco, and  seafood risotto, were all a hit as well.. Loved the Brunello and Chianti, went really well with all the beautiful food we enjoyed. Brenda our server was very kind and efficient. Will definitely return soon.

Extremely friendly service and speedy orders and food delivery. There's often a very fine line between bothering the people eating and being nowhere to be seen as a waiter. This place perfectly rode that line for wonderful customer experience. The drinks were served in beautiful containers and glasses and the food was delicious.
Fun place. Great food and drink selection. The staff is friendly and helpful. Looking forward to trying out the large outdoor space when the weather gets better.

The food was ok. I had the skillet and my friend had the boneless wings (half buffalo and half sweet and sour). The wings were fried nicely. The coating was crunchy. The sauce, however, was another thing. I despise anything spicy but the buffalo sauce was not spicy, which is bad if you want spicy wings. Secondly the sweet-and-sour wings were not sweet or sour. They had a weird taste that I can’t necessarily describe. The skillet was fine. I hate beans but the black beans inside of the skillet were refreshing, more  cheese and eggs could’ve been used. Additionally, shredded hash browns or roasted potatoes would’ve been a better option instead of smashed tater tots as the potato. My service was great.

I would say 4.5 stars.  The outside patio was lovely.  The staff from the time you walk in until done with your dinner was a pleasure.  I loved my kale salad, as did my wife her pear and Brie salad; I would have liked a smaller salad as our’s were a bit too large.  My pork belly and her elk meatloaf were very enjoyable.  They have a good wine list and very reasonable corkage fee.  We would eat there again. I probably would give it a 5 star rating if the dishes were just some how a little stepped up, I don’t know what I am looking for other than missing the Wow factor.  Nevertheless, I would return without reservation over and over again for really a first class meal and absolutely great people from the greeter to the person bringing the bill, and everyone in between.
Delicious food and great service at a wonderful neighborhood bar... amazing cheese curds
This food was horrible.  Suppose to be a nacho supreme but they use steak meat that look like gyro meet and the cheese was horrible. States they don't give refunds!
The fries were overcooked, the ambience was pretty ordinary from being a welcoming fast food restaurant.  The cook took a bit long to prepare me a hot dog with fries. Don't recommend it.

Big nope for the past couple of years. Used to be good. Now they screw up orders, barely any meat on the sandwiches, stale fries, cold food, then they get crabby and cop an attitude when you call to let them know about these issues. I hate giving bad reviews. I only do so when it's that bad. Zero stars is my honest opinion now.

I haven't been here in while, but my sister and I really like their onion rings! Nice and crunchy and flavorful. Their fries and hot dogs are good, but not sure about now. Now we'd only stop for onion rings. The service isn't the best.

Our fave restaurant. We had our wedding reception and silver wedding anniversary party here. This weekend I threw a big bday party for my husband with 40 guests. Huge success! We also come for smaller occasions. The steaks are excellent and service pretty good. Highly, highly recommended

Best vegan food I've had in Chicago. Yakisoba was very good, the vegetables were crunchy and the chicken substitute was amazing. Ramen with "shrimps" was terrific. The broth was flavorful and the shrimp substitute was surprisingly accurate. The drunken noodles were also very tasty. The prices could be a tad lower though.

Absolutely delicious!
We had spring rolls, sweet potato roll, and veg fried rice with (fake) chicken.

Highly, highly recommend this place!!!

Sort of an Asian twist on vegan. Food was fresh and very tasty.
I ordered the cashew mixed vegetables, spring rolls, and brown rice.

Very nice place. They had the most delicious spring rolls I have ever eaten. The tempura broccoli was also quite tasty. I wish I didn't live about 8 hours away from this restaurant because I would like to try most of their menu.

One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. The chicken Katsu curry is amazing. Also really like the fish sticks, the stir fried vegetables with soy chicken. I was not a big fan of the pepper steak, but it wasn’t terrible. Can’t wait to keep trying other dishes!!

I came here with a large group after a show downtown. It was pleasant and quiet because there weren't many people dining there on a Saturday. The servers were accommodating and understanding. I ordered the penne with peas and prosciutto in vodka sauce. The peas and prosciutto complemented each other well; a bit of sweet, a bit of salty. It wasn't the best I've ever had, but it was tasty. I sampled the zebra ravioli that my girlfriend ordered, but that wasn't as good.

The restaurant was comfortable and the restrooms were clean. Prices were very reasonable. I was not disappointed and the location was incredibly convenient for coordinating a big group coming from multiple locations.

Nothing says splurge like a work lunch.  I love looking at the menu knowing that price will not be an issue.  However, surprisingly enough, the prices here were actually pretty decent.  I ordered the BBQ Chicken pizza and left satiated.
The food here is amazing and the decor is beautiful.  My company had our Christmas party here and it was wonderful.  I would love to come back.
Excellent service from door to table. Food was delicious,  conversation was personable.
Great and delicious food, reasonable prices, and amazingly fast and courteous service.

We have eaten here 2 nights in a row!  Both visits were delicious.  Every bite was an explosion of flavors.  Everything is so fresh and flavorful.  Ended the meal with banana butter cake which was the best I have ever tasted.  The owners are delightful!  Customer service is top notch.   You will enjoy the food and service.

My husband and I went there for lunch but they had an issue in the kitchen. The owner and their staffs just knows how to fix it RIGHT, right away. The owner politely suggested other  options and we just had the best treatment ever at the restaurant. The owner is very serious about his business and feeding the customer happily. The foods that they serve were perfect, fresh, flavorful, and simply amazing. Who knew we ended up loving eggplants? Thank you for welcoming us and we will come back for sure.

Excellent excellent excellent service. We were served by the owner Dan and he was so incredibly attentive to the needs of every table making each guest feel so special. Ordered a plethora of tea and Vietnamese coffee which was perfect with our meal.

The portion sizes were smaller than expected for noodle and rice dishes but the meat was flavorful and tender. I wish that the dish had a bit more flavor but I do think that this is a great place to try on a week night for a good meal and a nice atmosphere.

The restaurant itself had ~15 tables so it got crowded easily so if possible make a reservation ahead of time. Overall good Vietnamese food in a relaxed atmosphere.

The food and owner are just amazing! My friend and I came here for dinner, and the owner showed his clear passion for food, cooking and everything in the restaurant. He also surprised us with this amazing fish that I honestly think was my favorite of the night🐟
We’re impressed by the balance of so many different flavors in each dish, and they all tasted great. We’d definitely come back when they bring back the laksa!

This restaurant has a very delicious food. It is neither too salty or too sweet, the taste was perfect. The ambiance was cozy and beautiful. what made me so impressed was every thing was very clean, and very organized,  the staff and the owner are awesome. Thank your for generosity and making the experience very comfortable. 👍

Discovered this place a week back. Now I'm going there almost daily. Their Falafel is the best! The staff is so friendly. Its clean and cozy. Shish Kabab and humus are amazing. If you want to try out Middle Eastern Restaurant then better not miss this one.

I stop by this location on occasion, seeing as I work nearby. This location recently switched ownership, and since the change, I haven't had the best experiences. Their new black beans for their breakfast items lack flavor, making my old favorite of the Fiesta Classic bland. While I appreciate the ability to custom made soups, bowls, and burritos, it's incredibly expensive. $2 for meat on top of the 5.99 or 6.99 base is out of my price range for just lunch, especially since I also prefer quinoa (at extra cost) to the empty calories of noodles or rice. Most items are flavorless, there has been high turnover of staff, and it's overpriced, even for the Loop.
Nothing but the best! Both quality food and service. I eat lunch here all the time it's quick and healthy, so I can finish the day feeling great! Wraps, salads, they're all great!

Amazing place!!! I ordered on grub hub for pickup and there was no way I was going to be able to leave my car and go get it so THEY BROUGHT IT TO MY CAR!!!!!! I can only imagine how good the food tastes when you get service like that!!!! Thank you so much Scott your awesome!!
great fresh food. make it vegan or add other items.
25 minutes for ordering lunch. Not worth the trouble that time of day.

Decent hotel restaurant, ate at the bar. Bartender was very nice and efficient. I was very happy with my steak frites and my brother was happy with his burger. Starter salads were very good as well. Only minus is very pricey wine list for an average selection. Could do much better at those price points.

I ate here with friends for restaurant week. I had the pre-fix menu, which is 33 dollars during restaurant week (an excellent deal). Service was excellent and the ambiance was distinctly high-class (I was out of place in a t-shirt and jeans). The fusion dishes were interesting, though many of them fell a bit short of perfect. Presentation was exquisite. It would be outside of my price range when not during restaurant week.

Don't be put off by the fact that it's in a hotel, this place is superb! I went here for Chicago Restaurant Week in 2011. Most of the dishes are light, modern takes on your favorite classic Asian dishes. And the service was flawless, to boot.

I have to give fair warning for the next stop for restaurant week.  It is really good food.  The Google directions to get there are horrid.  I parked to eat at Aria about 30 minutes before my reservation and was 15 minutes late.  Aria is in the Fairmont hotel, and it was pretty much dumb luck that I ended up finding the place.  Once I got there, they were closing up from the lunch service but seated me anyway.  The place is very flashy yet elegant.  The first thing you'd probably notice would be the marble tables with peach accents.  The person who designed this place wasn't afraid of color and shows it with the vibrant black and red carpet up to the red overhead lights contrasting from the dark brown curtains.  The decor definitely fits with that Asian mindset and I must say I was reminded of my travels to Hong Kong by the warm and inviting atmosphere.

The Thai Ginger Kitana, immediately jumped out at me from the cocktail menu.  The drink was one of those dangerous types where the presence of alcohol goes completely undetected.  All you get is the tangy taste of sweetness combining with fresh lime juice and a little spice from the ginger.  Think of it as a limeade with a little bit of a kick.  The naan, is the bread offering there.  The naan is some of the best I've had and a welcomed change from the normal bread and butter that you normally get before a meal.  The naan stands up on it's own but it would be foolish to pass on the four tasty accompaniments.  The spicy spicy tomato chutney was my favorite, followed by the curry lentil.   The spinach and yogurt sauces were also good but not as memorable.

The beet salad scored extra points for presentation, displaying the bright colors of the beet are easily noticeable   The sweet beets go well with the spicy arugula.  The candied walnuts at sweetness and crunch and the tangy vinaigrette. Next up was the short ribs.  In this dish the star of the show was the greens. They were tender but not cooked to death, had a porky taste to them that reminds me of the greens I enjoyed in my childhood (and still do today).  The subtle soy flavor in the background added something that made these greens probably some of the best that I've ever tasted.  For me, the greens stole the show, which is a pretty tough feat to accomplish considering how good the perfectly cooked and shaped little spheres of potato were.  Not to mention how aggressively seasoned, yet tender the short ribs were.

For desert, I was served a platter of truffles.  One garnished with sesame that was made with dark chocolate  that was so decadent that you could feel the richness of it before it hit your palate.  The other dark chocolate truffle had a rich fruit flavor to it.  My favorite had notes of coffee cinnamon and you guessed it caramel with milk chocolate.  The only truffle I didn't care for was the white chocolate which was overwhelmingly sweet and tasted like a Hershey's cookies and cream bar minus the cookies.  It was the only thing of the day that completely failed for me.
Not great given the price. Staff busy stocking wine during dinner hour rather than serving with a busy restaurant. Steak overdone, did not have several items available that were listed on their menu.

It was our first time eating here and the food was delicious. I had the Buffalo “chicken” sandwich and my friend had the popping jalapeño burger. The fries and the sweet potato fries were also very yummy. Cute little spot and very friendly service! Will be back!
Got their Orange Cauliflower delivered and was delicious, photo doesn't really do it justice. The sauce on the cauliflower was great and paired well with the fried rice.
Love this location! Such good quality. I got the chicken bacon avo club and it was really good compared to the same dish at other locations.

Honestly, as a carnivore I do not understand  how their food is SO GOOD. 10/10 recommend everything on the menu, especially the oatmeal  cookie sandwich. The only reason I didn’t give 5/5 stars is because the food is hit or miss in quality. Always good, but sometimes it’s phenomenal.

I like native foods. I always try something new when I go. I also always order the nachos, that's mandatory, they're so good! I don't think I've ever felt like I wasted my money and felt cheated. In terms of flavor, some days and locations might be more consistent than others but overall I haven't had any complaints.

What a wonderfully warm, and welcoming environment. Even before I sat down, just walking in to this restaurant envelopes you with a sense of warmth and serenity. Every server, all the personnel, have a smile on their faces - even with their masks on, the smile comes through. They already had me won over with their treatment for their patrons, however, it was their food that completely bamboozled me over.

The injera is soft, has that distinct sourness to it, and is pillowy soft and perfect. All the meats were unctuous, seasoned to perfection, and cooked excellently. The cabbage and the spinach were phenomenal, and the lentils were cooked well and tasted great! It was the tea that really took the cake!!!

I highly highly HIGHLY recommend this restaurant to any, and every, body!

This is the best, most authentic Ethiopian food ever!!! My parents lived in Ethiopia for a few years and say that the spices and Injera are spot on!  Staff is very friendly and helpful if you don’t know what to order.  We come here all the time and don’t think any other Ethiopian restaurant comes close to this good. Looks are deceiving; it’s so incredibly delicious.

The food is absolutely delicious, it’s authentic and made fresh. The food is full of flavors unlike anything else. The Ethiopian coffee is my favorite! I’m Hispanic and my husband is middle easter , and hands down Ethiopian coffee is my # 1 . It’s true that it’s the best in the world! Not only is the food delicious, but the the owner is so friendly and welcoming. It feels as your at their home having dinner.

This is the absolutely best Ethiopian restaurant we've tried in the Midwest and we've tried them all (Chicago, St Louis, Indianapolis, Madison). The balance of the spices, the texture of the injira, the perfectly cooked veggies, and the wonderful coffee served in a traditional Jebena -- it all comes together to make a perfect meal. We've been coming here for decades since it was called Ras Dashen and we're so glad to see that Maritu (the former owner's daughter) has taken over the operation. It looks like she is continuing the family lineage by using the same traditional family recipes that her mother passed down to her. Please carry on and don't change a thing!
Our first Ethiopian food experience, we ordered Yebeg De Beebere (lamb), Doro Wat (chicken), spinach, collard greens, all so delicious! Friendly atmosphere, great service, will definitely come back.

I was taken here for the first time not too long ago. I decided to get a grilled chicken sandwich from here on a pita with some tzaziki sauce. The pita was good but the lettuce and tomatoes that they use were cheap. I definitely liked their fries and how they were seasoned. However, their chicken was absolutely phenomenal. It was very juicy and seasoned very Greek style. No complaints their. Besides being a little pricey, the owner is nice.

NEEDS TO GET RID OF 50 CENT REFILL CHARGE. HORRENDOUS!!!

This place has no frills. No fancy sign outside, no ambiance and not even much seating. But what it lacks, it more than makes up for in it's food. Even their food doesn't look the most appetizing but it sure tastes great! Be it lamb, beef or chicken, it's properly seasoned and cooked to juicy perfection, with the right amount of oil to make it oh so tasty. The sauces are spot on and the portions are very decent to say the least.

If you need a lot of good tasting food at a reasonable price with virtually no wait time, this is the place for you.

This place makes the best chicken and gyro dishes.  My favorite is the Chicken Kabobs meal.  The chicken just melts in your mouth and is bursting with flavor.  The owner is always in the front and he makes you feel like family. When I have people ask me where is the best place to get a gyro, this is the place I suggest.

Best greasy breakfast in the gold cost. This place attracts the spectrum from yuppies, to cops, to construction workers and college kids. Cash only, on which I'm sure he pays tax on every dollar collected.
Great food, had a chicken pita sandwich. Good portion and tasty.

Very local place. Peruvian ex pats go there.
Food was reasonable and authentic.
Ceviche was the best thing we ate.
The rest was tasty but a bit bland.
They did have a mustard sauce that was spicy and outstanding.

The food is great however the service is not good at all. You wait an hour and 32 minutes for good. No one comes to check on you. No napkins just throws your food at you and walks off. Poor service. Especially after driving 17 hours to get here because of previous years was amazing.
I loved the atmosphere and the service was very nice and friendly. The food (Lomo Saltado and Aeropuerto)and the drinks (Pisco Sour) were decent.
Food was wonderful,  server was very nice but seemed short staff so not as attentive. But I love this place,  so I'll be back next week!

The fish ceviche was my favorite and the food overall was really good but I couldn't find my favorite worker there LUIS FELIPE, the day I went there with my group of friends you gave us great service. We miss you and hope we see you next time we go in LUIS FELIPE ❤️

Westside Gyros is worth the trip on Western.  Proudly support a family owned business.  Large portions, fast and friendly service and clean space. Ordered a Gyros platter and Italian beef sandwich. The platter can feed two, definitely ask for an extra pita for an additional sandwich from the large portion of meat. Gyro platter comes with Tsatziki, lettuce, onions, tomatoes and pickles. Italian beef came dipped and is a two handed tasty sandwich. Prices include fries and a can of soda so don't be sticker shocked as they require cash only for payment.
This place was smacking,  the portions were huge (I got the gyro combo) and perfect for a hangover 👌 ohh and ask for extra napkins js
Very good gyros. Fast and friendly service. Affordable. Highly recommend
The gyro was good but the onion rings was soggy in the middle like the onions dissolved within while cooking them.
The customer service was good. The food was hot and alright. It could've been better with some seasoning.

Oh-My-God!!!! I haven't been here in such a long time, not since I was a kid. Everyone I know misses Quiznos everywhere! Their toasting STILL can't be beat and the food tastes as authentic and as marvelous as it always did!!! I can't say enough how extrodinary my visit was as far as service and excitement. This hits the spot, Quiznos fans, this  hits the spot.
I got the steak cheese chipotle sandwich and it was really good I was surprised by how soft the bread was and how not messy it was. 10/10.
Only Quiznos left in the city.  They make a great peppercorn steak. Staff is always nice. Sammies are great too. Always a good meal here!!

I have come serval times and never have problems with the making of my sandwich BUT every time the STORE OWNER is there It’s a PROBLEM for condiment substitutes. I could tell he is more focus on making gourmet sandwiches that come as-is, so after today and charging me for mayo(not extra mayo) I
WONT be coming back that’s bad for business and I will never suggestion this location to my clients going forward. It’s upsetting because I tip the workers and is a familiar face and I couldn’t add a condiment(not extra condiments) to my sandwich without being charged. It’s a sandwich shop for Gods sake. I

Best subs out of all the Sub shop chains, no question about it! This location is always clean, and the staff is quite helpful and polite. I just don't understand why anybody would go into a Subway with Quiznos being an option. Love the side pickles, and the amazing sauces. Thumbs up !

I have never eaten in the restaurant, but have ordered delivery or for pick-up several times and was never disappointed.  Their sushi is delicious--I'm a big fan of the spider maki and spicy tuna rolls.  Fish tasted fresh and the rice was a good consistency.  Their vegetable tempura is also very good.  Delivery also was very timely (although I confess I do live across the street, so they don't have to travel very far...).  I will continue to order from them!

Best sushi in the city!  I have been going to Cafe Furaibo since it opened and have enjoyed every single bite.  Their food is amazingly artistic and unfailingly delicious.  The prices are ridiculously reasonable for the quality and their staff is warm and attentive.  This place is fantastic...truly a hidden gem in Chicago.

Love this place! Whenever me and my wife don't know where to eat, we decide on Cafe Furaibo. Great, really creative sushi, delicious appetizers, and amazing prices. The owner is really sweet and always makes us feel special. Can't get enough!

Got take out from here on a Saturday night. Chicken teriyaki flavor was lacking, crazy poke bowl was decent, but agedashi and croquette were just so-so. The biggest disappointment was the serving size -- tiny tiny tiny. Maybe half a chicken breast worth of meat in the chicken teriyaki. For the price, you can find better value and taste elsewhere. Cannot recommend.

I came here with a groupon. I tried the crazy roll and the miso soup and I have to say that both were good. The miso wasnt overly salty, and it was just the right amount of filling. I would like to try the spicy one the next time. The crazy roll was fresh and well prepared, the pieces are large too. I would say there was good attention paid to both flavors and textures for this roll. I will come back here when Im in the area. I liked the decor too, it has some nice pictures on the wall and the service was attentive. Food came out pretty quickly too.

My daughter wanted Pepes so we went here. The girl at the counter was very rude to  us. She texted on her phone while I was placing our order. When I asked for a receipt, it took her a while to print it out, and when she did she laid it on the counter. I guess I was interrupting her while she was texting. I started to be just as ignorant as her and kept the receipt on the counter. Even my daughter noticed how rude she was and she's 11!!. You can definitely tell she did not want to serve us.

Then we arrived home to find my daughter Nachos looking like the picture. My daughter said :Mom we should get our money back." We DEFINITELY will NOT be back there.
Food comes fast and the waitress is really sweet! I got the chicken flautas and they were really good!

I loved it! I eat at a lot of authentic places all the time and I have to say these half price margaritas and these portion sizes are great. The food is good just make sure you ask for the authentic salsa and you will get some spice! I am going to be a repeat customer on Thursdays for sure! Also they had a poster up that said 1 dollar tacos on Wednesday and Monday!

Excelent service and the food, DELICIUS.
Is our first time eating there, but we are so proud  to try they  food and is a 100% enjoyable.
My wife eat a Huachinango al mojo de ajo(in garlic& butter sauce) and I eat the TAMPIQUEÑA, the Meat super tender and DELICIUS 100% recomended.

This was a great lunch break between sessions of a conference. I had carne asada, the steak was flavorful, the beans were well seasoned, the tortillas were fresh, the chips were crunchy, the salsa good, but a little tomatoey... overall it was s good meal 🥘 I’d eat there again

My experience here was above and beyond all my hopes and expectations for a well prepared and authentic poke bowl 🥣
In fact I asked if miso soup 🍲 was included and initially my friendly server told me "No" then to my surprise she said the Chef 👨‍🍳 would be happy to accommodate my request.   She asked if I'd like my miso soup prepared spicy or non spicy so I went for the spice and I was exceptionally delighted.
The flavors of my miso soup was a blend of heat, good texture and interesting flavors.  There were many delicate mushrooms 🍄 and peppers 🌶 in the soup and I could see the red chilli oil within the broth.
