My Thai iced tea was also delicious and the trio poke bowl 🥣 was extremely fresh tasting with three types of raw fish, seaweed,  edamame and other vegetables including mango 🥭 squares.  Every item in my poke bowl was fresh tasting and complimented eachother.

The chef here cooks with great skill and love and all the team members here are so friendly and work well together.

I'm so happy I found this gem 💎 in Wicker Park and I will definitely be returning here again soon!

Food is good, but they charge ridiculous amount of money to modify order. I requested cucumber be added to my sushi roll, and spicy mayo on the side. I was charged $7.00 extra through DoorDash without my permission. Disappointing.

Their fish is very fresh. I can tell how well they prepare all the ingredients. Sushi man really know what they do. Waitress very polite and friendly as well. My favourite roll is Hawks Signature maki. So good!!!
Currently my favorite sushi takeout place in Chicago.  Giant fresh pieces of nigiri sushi made to perfection!

I came across this place by accident and sooo glad!! Was walking to the blue line but was starving and this was the first place I saw. I ordered two rolls and edamame then ran to the liquor store across the street for a Beer since it’s byob. I was served as soon as I got back. The rolls were big, delicious, fresh and priced right. I will be visiting this spot when I’m working in the area.
Best Biryani outside of Devon street. The Biryani was piping hot and the quantity given is decent too. Ordered a samosa which was kind of average. The prices are a little on the high side.

Anyone on Foster Beach and hungry best place to eat and Desi grocery all in one place. Lots of options of food. We order bhuna ghost and Mash Dall with pratha and Naan. Wooo good quantity and really good taste. No smell in meat and pratha was perfect. Brayani and Tikka is amazing too. Over all I definitely recommend if some one looking Desi good restaurant and grocery store.

This lovely place opens at 7 am. Alhamdulilah. Its Halal Zabiha. Great service. Food is good quantity. Some foods are spicy. I talked. I shared my thoughts. I got good suggestions. I need to wait for food to cool.

Great find , if you want great delicious food without any bells and whistles this is the place to go.
Yesterday we had chicken Biryani (outclass) and pratha with daal Chana
Today it is breakfast  and pratharolls for snacks
UT has been a while since I  had that great Pakistani food
And there prices are unbelievably low.

A mist during your visit to Chicago
One of the best value meals I have ever had in Chicago. Halwa Puri is awesome!!! Don't miss out on the market in the back of this place. Tons of hard to find products from Ethiopia, India and beyond
I got the Philly steak fries. The cheese sauce was better than a lot I have tasted. The portions were nice, and the beef was seasoned well.  Pretty good overall.

Had a regular cheese steak & fries. This variety has more bread than meat, and from my experience, limited au jus. The sandwich still has a lot of integrity, but it's not like you won't get your hands greasy eating this. Though not quite visible, the taste of cheese really cuts through. Fries were great crunchy and delicious.

At peak hours service remained pretty fast-paced, so if all else fails, this is a good place to head to.

Got the bacon and ranch fries. Who puts the bacon fat and gristle on the fries?? Barely had any ranch sauce on them either. Many of the fries were undercooked. No wonder they're the only restaurant in food court that has no line! I will never eat here again.

Small bread small meat, they're not very generous with the veggies. I asked for peppers and onion and I got one tiny piece of green pepper and a couple of no its of onions. These weren't full, grilled onion slices, it was just tiny bits.
The beef is way way too salty. It takes away from the actual flavor. They could also use a better bread.
The service was nice but I should have insisted she put more peppers and onion on it.
Won't go back...
Two stars because it tastes good but these Philly steaks are SOOO SMALL! It’s the size of a hot dog!

I've only been to this place once, but I am so pleased that I felt like writing a review about it. I had their vegetarian pho and an avocado bubble tea to-go, and everything was packaged nicely. The soup tasted absolutely amazing! Very well seasoned, fresh, and very hot. The bubble tea also tasted extremely fresh, and well-made! Will definitely be a regular!

Nannan Cafe is a great little neighborhood joint with pretty good ramen and some really great bubble tea slushies. Green tea and watermelon (may be seasonal) are two favorites. Definitely give them a try.
My favorite cafe to get fruit smoothies! :D

Delicious!! BYOB, semi-outdoor seating, and great food for a good price. The barbacoa burrito bowl was great. Filled with rice, beans, corn, salsa, cheese, it was very filling for $10.99. Fast-casual environment, order at the counter and they will bring you the food in their seating room.

I love this place, their deep fried tortilla burrito bowls are to die for! I moved to the neighborhood 8 months ago, and carbon is the place that I get food from the most often! I always get the fish burrito bowl, with cabbage instead of lettuce, with guacamole. The smokey red sauce is insane, I wish they'd give me a whole bucket of that stuff, I wanna put it on everything. It's super affordable too, I am so tempted to eat here all the time. I highly recommend this place. :)

Super friendly staff, very clean facility, and  extremely delicious menu. Ordered The Mother Clucker Burrito, Steak Tacos, Fajita Chicken Bowl, Elote Cup, and Guacamole with Corn Tortilla Chips to then wash it all down with several Lime Jarritos. You won't be disappointed with the experience,  decent sized seating area and BYOB.

So this is arguably one of the best new Mexican spots in the city.

My only issue is that their online order for pickup does not reflect accurate pickup times. I’ve patiently waited for my food, but I’ve seen others walk out in anger in the past.

Will be back, but please fix the online order system.

Do NOT order from here if you want to actually get what you ordered. I have always liked their food but my last THREE orders have been wrong. The food has also been delivered cold and soggy. Way too much to spend on a soggy burrito that is made wrong. The burrito bowl I ordered with rice and no beans had zero rice and was completely soaked in beans. Completely inedible.
I did not get all my food so I will not be ordering from this place ever again.  It is not worth the money!!! This place sucks!!!

We arrived at this spot for dinner. we heard about this restaurant from many people.  Well, we were not disappointed. The crew welcomed us with a smile and we had a fantastic feeling. The meal was tasty. We enjoyed every moment and we will definitely return to this restaurant. Warmly recommended.
Nice and quick meal with large serving sizes.

The experience here was awful. They forced me to get the big plate dish even though I specifically asked for just the plate. Then they don't even know how to work a simple Samsung pay tap. She kept swiping my phone across the sensor like an idiot. It's tap and go....

The experience was damaged when I was hit in the head with the cover of the napkin container.  Needless to say, I was even more ticked off at the staff when they started to laugh and offered me a crappy 10 percent off.   It took them awhile to understand that they should have comped the meal. No matter what I said it didn't click.  So I won't cater to this location

This is a great go-to place in Uptown. Nothing fancy but always solid Japanese and Thai food. Special rolls are quite good and flavorful and appetizers are also worthy of consideration. The place is BYOB, which saves great deal as long as you remember to bring your adult beverage. Parking is somewhat limited due to the fact that it share the lot with a medical research facility. You can, however, park in the facility’s assigned spaces at nights.

*Take Out Review*

Food arrives warm, fresh, and carefully packaged. Dib also offers high quality nigiri for a low price. We’ve enjoyed Dib both times we’ve ordered.

I think they have a different cook?
I've loved this place for 13 years! But recently something has changed.
Wherever I get home from a long trip, I always stop at dib before my house! Nothing is better than celebrating being back home than noodles from Dib! Again, until recently.
I've tried three times but it's just not the same.

This is a mom and pop style sushi restaurant which also features basil chicken and pepper beef. The service is good and is a popular local favorite. Surprisingly, another restaurant went out of business in the same location, but the food and service here are good enough that this business has survived and thrived for years.
Delicious veggie sushi and curry, and great service in a cozy location!

Recently renovated and improved their order and pick up stations. The fried goods are very authentic and tasty! I highly recommend their chicharones (fried pork belly), empanadas con pollo (chicken filled pie), and the best item was the arepa con queso (corn bread with cheese). Arepa had the best hint of sweetness.

$10 for 1 of each, sweet and friendly staff, and only took 5 min to get my order in a Sunday at 12pm. It had a long line of 5 people in front too. Highly recommend this place for a quick bite!

The very clean place, all well organized, the empanadas are excellent, the flan was very rich but I went for the tamal has a different preparation not ugly, but in my liking it wasn't as I thought but to try it well.
This food is made with love! I came for cafe con leche! And ended up ordering more.
Very tasty and fresh offerings! Friendly service! Not overpriced. We'll be back soon!
The best of the best for Colombian authentic! Delicious!!

Really tasty! Great atmosphere.

We came in while waiting for a train out of town with a few hours to kill before our departure. I got the Chicken Shawarma sandwich, and my partner got the Chicken Kabob sandwich. We also got Dawali Fries, but we ate those too fast to get a picture. Everything was lovingly made and very fresh with generous portions and good prices. Happy we came in! If we didn’t live so far away, we’d be regulars. Great job!

Stopped in for a quick lunch after hopping off the Amtrak at Union Station.  The place is super clean with plenty of seating.  The kitchen is out in the open behind the cashier so you can see your meal being prepared.  The spicy chicken wasn't exactly spicy, but was still flavorful and not dry.

I cannot express within the limitations of the English language how good this is. If you've ever seen the movie Ratatouille when the critic bites into the meal and has flashbacks to his childhood? That's me currently. I'm actually taking the falafel and hummus back home to Texas right now, as I feel a moral duty to share this with everyone I know, though it might not make it home and will nigh certainly end up eaten before we make it

Not only is this the best "Mediterranean" I've ever had, it's the best food I've ever had. Ever. I damn near cried at the table into my flavorful curried french fries, my perfectly crispy and perfectly fluffy falafel, and my smooth and decadent hummus. It's made fresh, and sure as hell worth the wait. You can see the steam coming off the falafel! The first bite had me reeling, and the plates were completely cleaned.

Also? This is the best price I have ever seen. $18 for the best culinary experience of my life is highway robbery, and honestly I would sell my soul to try it again for the first time.
Glad I found this place. Uber clean. Excellent food. The vegetable  Galaya and the rice were superb. My new favorite lunch place
Fantastic. Don't miss the Chicken Shawarma plate. Most authentic, delicious Mediterranean meal I've had downtown in quite a while.
I mean ya gotta love Domino's - they never let us down on a busy weekday night 🍕

It’s tasty, fast, and cheap.  I love what they’ve done with the sandwiches and pastas and bread.  But it is, at it’s roots, Dominos, so don’t expect something that it’s not.  There’s plenty of artisan, expensive pizza places nearby.
I ordered 2 medium $5,99 each,they said it takes 15 minutes, but it took 30 m,but they are nice people

Pizza was great delicious tasting but, the cashier needs to be trained more professionally. There was old man in front of me and couldn't hear very well, she act to him with no respect and me as well. Please be happy 3:30pm 01/23/19. Thank you
amazing pizza every time. always delivered quickly. 10/10

Some of the best chicken I've ever had. Such a variety to choose from besides chicken also. Gizzards were great and the hushpuppies were cooked to perfection. It must also be a local favorite because we asked someone at the gas station a good place to eat and she even had us follow here there. Very clean establishment and super awesome employees. Will definitely be back when we are in the area. If you're looking for great chicken and a friendly environment you need to go to Harold's.

Good fried chicken is hard to come by living in WI if you're not cooking your own. My husband is even more particular about which chicken restaurants he will eat at. This was our 3rd time visiting this location while in the city. We've tried 2 or 3 other locations in error due to not remembering which street this location was on. This is by far our favorite location and will NEVER try another location. Labor Day weekend we were in town for the Jazz Festival and stopped in before going to our room. The owner assisted us and went out of her way to welcome us. We remembered her from our 2nd visit. The chicken was fresh and so tasty(NO Sauce). The owner cracked a joke on us for not wanting sauce. To each their own but I will be a returning customer. Food has been BOMB all 3 visits!!

The food was good. I ordered lemon chicken wings and fries. I didn’t get the coleslaw that came with my food but I did get the extra piece of chicken I ordered. These are full wings, not broken down wings like wing stop.

My food was ready pretty quick about 10 mins from when I ordered from the car u til picking it up.

Good to come back home to some good ol' Harold's Chicken! Not all Harold's are created equal, but this one did not disappoint. I got the chicken and catfish combo, made to order of course. Sorry no pics. By the time I realized I should review, everything was gone. Lol Also know this is a good sized location to dine in, but I did take out.

I was visiting chicago for 2 days and honestly that was some of the best fired chicken I've had in a while. There is no reason that chicken should be that good. People there are also very nice I saw them helping some random drunken teenager on the street by giving him free food and taking him in while finding his parents for him. They are some great people there. The only complaint I had was I went Back for more chicken the next day but I went too late at night and they where closed which was my fault but now I will be for ever craving some of harolds chicken.
Delicious!! Fruit juice, pinchos, empanadas and fruit salad 🤤 yummy

I came here for a quick coffee. I agree that the waitress was super nice and she tried to make my coffee taste better but it really didn't. I got the cafe leche and it really wasn't all that sweet or leche tasting sadly. They were also out of the obleas when I came. Since all the reviews are for the dogs I might come back and try that.

Never got the chance to taste their food since the "lazy" young lady with glasses (she will recognize herself) completely ignored us today (June 23)
We were the only customers there, waited a couple of minutes, but the lady was still sitting on her chair behind the counter looking at her cell phone and pretended not to see us.
We tried to catch her attention, but I'm sure she was too busy checking her FB page. : )
To the owner(s): you'd better find someone else before your employee ruins your business.
All the best! Will never come back...

The Rapidito dog was fantastic. I don't even like pineapple or ketchup but wanted to try the traditional dog so got everything. Somehow they all worked together, it was excellent. The arepizza was delicious and the bean soup, phenomenal. I can't wait to bring the whole family back here.

We live a few blocks away but never went to Rapidito until tonight. I'm sorry we didn't go sooner! Everything was absolutely delicious! We have a difficult to feed family with one picky child and a vegetarian child. The corn flat breads were fabulous. The empanadas, both chicken and veg, were outstanding (and our vegetarian loved the veg one). I loved the salchipoppas and the steak skewers. We all loved the smoothies (especially mango!). I finished off my meal with a con panna, a scrumptious espresso shot with whipped condensed milk. The service was extremely fast and friendly. Needless to say, I highly recommend Rapidito!

I'm very confident about giving this place a 5-star rating!

1- Food: Food was absolutely delicious and healthy, you can eat as much as you want here without feeling stuffed. Everything is very healthy and cooked with little to no oil. I loved their teas too!

2- Vibe: The environment is great, pretty calm and relaxing! Also a lot of art work and interesting messages on the walls!

3- Pricing: Very reasonable, relatively cheap and totally worth it!

4- Cleanness: REALLY neat and clean. Germophobe approved!! 5/5!!! From the table to floor and bathroom, everything was very neat and clean!

5- Staff: super nice and friendly, didn't have any issues!

6- Menu diversity: their menu looks amazing and has tons of delicious options!!

100% recommend for vegans and non-vegans! Especially if you're looking for a relax place to eat some healthy food!

We had a fun group of vegan foodies. The dishes were beautifully plated and served! You get a lot of food per order. Chef served us!! The peaceful atmosphere was a great change of pace! Low I'm, musical chimes and great smelling incense. You choose: mild, medium, hot!

One of the best vegan restaurants I've ever been to. The food is overall delicious, flavorful, not too greasy or salty. My friend and I had Dr. K's soup, vegan dumplings, and yin and yang dish, all were worth trying. The ginger citron tea was soothing. I wish I had more of a stomach to try the other dishes on the menu. Def will have to come back soon!

Oh boy, where to start. Finally dined in at Amitabul and were beyond amazed with the food and hospitality. Do have the Energy Ginger to start with vs Green Tea. We ordered the dumplings off the Appetizers and they were fresh and light. We ordered a dumpling noodle soup and Bibimbap and they came out fresh, full of veggies and flavor. We are coming back to try more things off the menu. There is little to no oil used in prep of the food.
Wow! I was in Chicago for a day-and-a-half and ate here twice! Phenomenal food and energy in this place. The soups, the stews, the noodles, everything works together beautifully
Pizza is always spot on, first time trying out their pasta dishes and they did not disappoint. My kids loved the spaghetti. Definitely worth it

My roommate just picked up a deep dish pizza from Villa Rosa for me and it was one of the best deep dish pizzas I’ve had in a while. Tops all the places I’ve been to in chicago. Would highly recommend and will be visiting Villa in the future as well

Very good pizza,  but the pasta needs improvement.  I ordered the mostocholie with meatballs which was very dry and stale.
Prices have increased so be prepared to pay up.
The crust is nice and crispy with a buttery twist, and they have a good sauce.

The stuffed pizza we ordered yesterday was horrible!! It was dry, the cheese wasn’t good, and it was missing the signature creamy garlic sauce under the tomato sauce. We have been long time customers, something has changed and you need to go back to the quality you had before!! I noticed because of Covid a lot of restaurants are cutting back on quality ingredients!!!’
I just inhaled a Cheese Stuffed Villa Rosa Special! Best pie I’ve had in years. My order came out hot and on time, and Brenda behind the counter was a peach. I recommend Villa Rosa Pizza to all!

This trip was my first time eating here, and the food is amazing! My parents are visiting from out of state, and we wanted to have something not available in their small town. We had falafel, chicken kabob, and gyro, and all of it was great. The staff is all so friendly as well. I highly recommend it for a tasty, filling meal.
Food was good. Service on the other hand was the issue. I let them know the pop machine Cola wasn't working. They never resolved the issue. There was no customers there so they have plenty of time.

Koko's food is delicious, but the customer service is terrible. One of the young ladies who was working at the register on Sunday evening (May 22) was not being friendly. She took my order (a combo meal with french fries and a fountain drink. And an order of six chicken wings, she asked me what kind of wings, I said buffalo). I paid. She did not ask me if I wanted my receipt nor did she hand over my fountain cup drink after I PAID for my combo meal and wings. I waited to the side for my food, and she took more customers' orders at the register. I heard her ask the other customers "Would you like your receipt?" They said no, and then she handed over their fountain cup drinks (even though they didn't ask for their cups) – she just randomly handed them their fountain cup drinks. Apparently she picks and chooses to which customers she wants to hand over the fountain cup drinks right away. Very unprofessional of her. Once my food was all set on the tray, I went to go sit down at a table. I noticed that my buffalo chicken wings didn't come with a dipping sauce. So I walked over to the register and told the young lady that they forgot to put a dip sauce, on my tray, for my chicken wings. She told me that it was already included, she told me that the dip sauce was on top of the chicken wings (which was the buffalo sauce). Apparently she was trying to be "smart" about it and she ended up charging me at the register for one ranch dipping sauce. This young lady was just very RUDE.

The Falafel and salad is always good and the service is fast and friendly. Even when they're a little busy I get my food quick. Their fries are delicious and sometimes I stop in just to get an order of them.

Have eaten here quite a bit over the years and was always good maybe a bit over priced. Ate there recently and prices up which understandable in the current environment but quality was way down. Pork kabobs smaller and dry whole dinner was different not in a good way. At least keep the quality up if you have to raise prices. Won't be spending my hard earned money there for a while.

This was a great find tucked in the corner of the Watertower Plaza Mall. Really fresh ingredients, and it only took about 5 minutes to get our food. Make sure you try a juice-the red power is amazing, and the Buddha's Satay was flavorful. The owner was friendly and treat his customers right with a healthy sense of humor!

Extremely disappointed in this location. I love Freshii, however this location gives small portions. I ordered the Buddha Satay and they were out of rice noodles, so I got quinoa instead. When I got my bowl it was only half full, and the veggies were mixed in with the quinoa making it look like there was more than there actually was. I’ve had Freshii several times before and the rice or grain is always on the bottom and veggies are stacked on top, right to the top of the bowl. I feel like they did this to save money on veggies. For $10.99 I expected way more than this. Now I did enjoy my meal, just wish I got the full size I ordered, I didn’t order a half size.
Great Freshii location, on a busy Friday all my friends enjoyed fantastic good roots bowls. Frozen yogurt with crainberry was a delightful desert. The cashier was fabulous fast and extremely helpful.

Do not order delivery from this place.  Found hair for a 2nd time today, on an order that was incorrect. That yellow substance between the 2 of 3 avocado slices is cheese and was just as disgusting in person, and was sitting next to a 12 inch hair. That was a double order of avo on the bowl FYI. And if you look hard enough you'll see a tiny slice of avocado that they charged 2 bucks for in the deconstructed wrap.

The man who manages this location is extremely rude and unprofessional. I ordered a wrap with chicken and it contained no chicken. I asked for another one and he said it wasn’t possible but that he could refund my money. Fine. But I was on my lunch break and after 5 minutes asked him how long it would take. He snapped at me aggressively and said I could leave without a refund or wait.

Excellent pizza shop that sells by the slice. These slices are gigantic! They also had calzones, but I was way too full to try one. They warm it up when you order and the Supreme slice I had was made with fresh ingredients and absolutely delicious.

Just a rock solid place to get a slice of newyork style pizza in Chicago, including a couple of veg. options.

Apparently they have been in business for the past 29 years. That means it gotta be good..... and it is!
It’s really really hard to find any type of new york style pizza in Chicago, but this place really hit the spot. It’ll be my new go to place when I crave it!
Absolutely love this thin sliced New York style pizza served by the slice. Chewy crust, perfect amount of sauce and heated up to crispy perfection. Yum!!
It was $40 for a standard two-topping, 18in. thin crust pizza (not including delivery or tip). What happened? I recommend finding another pizza joint after these drastic price increases.

Quite simply the best.  The food is innovative and fresh, and the atmosphere is authentic but still different than the many other Chinatown restaurants.  I highly recommend the twice cooked pork, as well as the vegetable fried rice.

Lao Mala specializes in spicy food.  I highly recommend coming with more than just one friend so that you can try all the tasty things.  Highlights from my visit are the hand shredding pancake, the pork belly with mashed garlic and the house specialty boiled fish in a spicy broth made up mostly of hot peppers.  Don't be intimidated by the hot peppers, they're more scary looking than they are hot.

I'll have to come back to try the skewers.

The place smelled wonderful. We went Friday night and had a very short wait. We ordered 3 items and were completely full. We had to ask for rice three times, but the other services were fast and quick.
Loved it. Deliciously spicey chinese, great ingredients. You will sweat while you eat, and you will love it.
Had some problems with the service.  But the food was fantastic.
Amazing food, great prices, lovely service. Corn tacos and gorditas were perfect!

If I could, I would give this place ZERO stars. I'm not sure if these other reviews are fake but the food and service was not good. I started off with the queso fundido chorizo and there was not enough cheese. I also ordered the combo #2 which was a taco, quesadilla and an enchilada all with beef. The taco was alright, the meat was very dry and the tortilla tasted stale. The quesadilla barely had any cheese and no meat. I couldn't even eat the enchilada because it smelled like the elephants at the zoo and did not taste good. The waiter also overcharged me on my food even though the menu clearly states the prices. It was a waste of my money and I will never come here again!!!

I rarely give out one star; but the pastor tacos were dry and full of large pieces of fat, the queso fundido con chorizo wasnt enough for one tortilla, the quesadilla was nearly empty and also dry, and we were overcharged and had to tell the employee to correct their menu prices…plenty of other mexican spots with better food and atmosphere. Wish half a star was an option.

This place has really gone down hill. The staff used to be friendly. I have stopped by twice within 30-60 after they open according to their Google hours; and there is a guy sitting at the table with his arms crossed and tells me that I need to leave that they aren't open. Why is your door unlocked and the open sign lit up then? Update your Google hours and don't unlock the door.

Love the food. Love the portions. Love the people. I can’t recommend this place enough for some great local Mexican food. I ordered take out this time but I’ve dined-in in the past and it was great then too.

We enjoyed celebrating my recent birthday(Dec 12th) at GSI(Jeff Pk)…There is no better place we would rather be…Have been coming to GSI for a long time —enjoyed EVERY visit….GREAT service, DELICIOUS food along with the PLEASANT atmosphere(bar area booth)….Thanks to George and Oscar for making this day special!  We will be back soon   for one of our favorites —London Broil!

Was very nice for upscale steak and seafood. They changed the menu to burgers and Mexican food. The bartenders were professionals and could make you any drinks now the have premix drinks. All for the upscale steak and seafood price. I am a repeat customer before COVID closed it. I will not be back.

I have to say, I thought it would be a fast food place, but it's a great sit down and fresh cooked meal place, pricey, but definitely worth it, great atmosphere, great employees and service, a place you should check out and enjoy, definitely will be coming back!

Gale street has NOT gotten it together. The worst of the pandemic is over and they are the only restaurant I am aware of still living in the pandemic. IF they ever get organized  to reopen they will change into an adults only space for parties of less than 8.. Good luck! Sounds super weird to me!!

TREMENDOUS RIBS! HELPFUL FRIENDLY STAFF! Fresh Alstremerias, Mums &
Zinnias in the Ladies restroom!
REMARKABLE!You need reservations...nice quiet Friday P.M. dinner for 4! A+

I’m just done ordering from any of their franchises. Every single time i never get what I ordered and this time I was overcharged. I 2 burrito and did not even receive one. This is starting to become ridiculous and I will no longer be purchasing from Taco Bell as a brand anymore. I could not go back to correct this error because there is a storm warning and I am already in the house.

Hands down this is the Worst Taco Bell in Chicago. Either they’re only taking mobile orders, or the fryer is broken. And if that’s not the issue, the order accuracy is horrible. I’m all for supporting minority businesses, but they really need some sort of professionalism here.

Worst Taco Bell that I’ve ever been to, every time I go they’re rude. I have attempted to go there 3 days in a row each day they tell me they are only doing Uber eats or doordash orders! 79th & Stoney Island is the worst.

Didn't get a chance to order anything,they took so long waiting on two customers ahead of me that I changed my mind!! Mind you,they both were only buying slushies!! So I knew my taco's would take awhile 🤦

If I could give this place a zero I would! This location will keep you waiting just for them to mess up your whole order it’s ridiculous ! I literally spent $20 dollars here just to receive a $5 dollar order ! I called about 5 times and no one picks up . I’m so mad I’ll never go back and I better be receiving a refund!
One of my favorite spots. Order the pad thai with tofu, or the green curry. The milk tea is amazing. This is a family business with a beautiful story. If you are a student, use your discount.

I had green curry, spring rolls and brown rice. Rice wasn't excellent but got the job done, the real star was the curry. Sauce was excellent, i just drank it, and it was certainly up there with the best I've had. They weren't shy with the helpings, i had enough and then some. Spring rolls were pretty good and a nice compliment to my meal.

I'm not having much luck lately at new restaurants. I ordered chicken saute. The chicken had a strange taste to it to the point that I couldn't swallow. Plus the peanut sauce was runny like water. I lost my appetite and returned my dish. We were the only customers in the place during peak dinner time, which I'm now realizing why.

I ordered delivery and accidentally gave them the wrong address, and the delivery man still got my food to me quickly. He forgot my drink though, which I wasn't going to complain about since I caused confusion with my address, but he called me right after he noticed and brought it all the way back over to me. So nice! And the food was delicious.

Absolutely amazing service, Authentic food and great prices! I ordered the Pad Sea Ew which I’ve ordered all over the country and this is one of the best I’ve ever had!! I can’t wait for my next trip back!

The food was good. Not as good as Rosco's in LA but good. But the service wasn't that great. We we're waiting for the other half of our party to arrive so they didn't seat us right away. They eventually seated us because my mom wanted some coffee but they did not refill her coffee and they didn't have hot tea, not even hot water. It seemed liked they were rushing us out. Sorry, I didn't get a chance to take pictures of our food.

Food is so amazing! I ordered the Monique with a side order of home fries. Best home fries I’ve had in my life! Waffle batter was flavorful and thick, so yummy. Employees are attentive, great service. Told my friends we need to come for dinner! I’d love to try their mac and cheese, corn bread and so much more. Recommend, 10/10

Vacation in Chicago, had to stop at Chicago's Home of the Chicken & Waffles. It's a soul food spot owned by a Black Man. Food tastes as if his Momma or Grandmother taught this man how to cook. 💣 food. Cool atmosphere. No complaints. For Dessert try the peach cobbler a la mode. 🔥🔥🔥🔥.

We had a pleasant experience at the restaurant. There were some downfalls on the service side, cause it was very slow, and we waited 50 minutes till the server realized that she messed up our order, and it didn’t reach the kitchen. And in the meantime, no refill of coffee or other interactions. Against that the food was quite good. I liked the greens the most, as they were heavily and good seasoned. The Chicken was perfectly fried, just the waffle could have had some more flavor - it fell flat against the other dishes. Also the cornbread was extremely dry, some little moisture would soften it up and be more pleasant to eat, then just picking up dry crumbs. If the service and minor food issues are fixed, the restaurant is definitely up for a five star rating.

The food used to be great here but my chicken, grits and waffle didn't come out hot which makes me think the plate was sitting for awhile and then they added the eggs with cheese which was good.  The chicken didn't have that great seasoned taste it used to.

Over priced meals, rice was stale , and the beans were dry. You could tell the salsa was going bad because of the smell and the salsa container was puffing up. The chicken did taste good but it was just such a small portion! I would not return.

Great chicken!
Chicken is always hot, not over cooked and great taste.
It's ok,, I'm assuming it's because of Covid,, Food is good,,but I remember when they first opened the Food and service was way better...😃
The chicken dinner here is utterly phenomenal. The chicken dinner for two is very generous in portions and the chicken tastes just like its been grilled in the backyard. An excellent choice.
Small Mexican Restaurant that focuses on grilled chicken. Decor is a bit depressing but overall food and customer service was pretty good

Save your time and money. The drive thru and dine-in are always closed at this location, even though the sign says open til 10pm. I've tried at 7pm, at 5pm, weekdays and weekends....closed. Right now @ 7pm the drive thru is closed, no one taking orders and the person on intercom is intelligible forcing you to drive off, they're not coming to the window either. Why are they even still in business!!!??

Although original recipe is my favorite fried chicken, this super small breast and tiny wing combo was not worth the 8$ I paid for it! The biscuit was dry like it had been from the first batch of the Day and they made the mashed potato container smaller to further disappoint in price. Eventhough the flavor is always good, I hadn't had KFC in years and now I remember why! Popeyes, here I come!!!

This location is the WORST!!! They never have any chicken and this crazy because they don’t have any costumes. Their so slow and some of the employees are so unprofessional. I went there once just to buy 2 large Coleslaw’s, and when I got home I noticed all I received was 2 large bowls of shredded cabbage no slaw mix  no where!  Horrible just HORRIBLE!!!

Horrible experience. The place is super dirty, tables, chairs, everything. Your shoes get stuck in the floor. The cashier was rude. They give you old and cold food. Fortunately this wasn't my first time in KFC, if not, I wouldn't come back ever again. This place makes KFC looks bad. If I could put 0 star I would.

I paid for a 4pc combo but all the meal was not eatable. The 4pc Chicken Combo actually turned out to be a 2pc Chicken Combo; which mean I should have paid $6.00 but paid $12.39.....not worth my money. I really need a refund and don't have a problem with returning the uneaten portions.....just say the word. Unless I get my money back I won't be eating at this KFC...... I've had better.

Recently this place has gone downhill. New employees are terrible. Every 3/5 visits something is wrong. The quality of food is abysmal. Had to write a review after my final straw. Burnt, soggy, and and raw at the same time. Drinks have absolutely zero flavor. Such a shame. Avoid if possible.

2am visit and no hot items available so while we were disappointed because then what's the point for being open late... Tashun was very friendly and welcoming, offered to warm up a muffin, made our coffee order and greeted us at the window. Excellent customer service that deserves recognition despite reading reviews that staff is not great at this location.
Nasty 🤮, this morning I bought a croissant and look what I found inside.
They put the donuts upside down. So when you get your donut it has no chocolate because it's stuck in the bag , specially the drive thru orders ...

This place is far from the same. The staff is so unfriendly. Some of the woman are nice, but the guys are so cold, and rude through the Drive thru. They never ever say hello, or even a thank you. They give you this dirty look, like they don't want to be there. This particular Dunkin Donuts has the worst Customer Service than any other establishment in the city of Chicago, or suburbs.
I stopped going. I'm a regular every day customer that belongs to their reward programs. This kind of Customer Service, and their high prices, it's not worth this kind of behavior.

Love this place & their service is top notch. Everything tastes so fresh and delicious. I love their chicken garden salad and assortment of daily soups. The beef barley & broccoli cheddar are my favorites. Excited to try their 1/2 soup 1/2 sandwich combo.

Definitely exceeded my expectations! There was so much variety! A must go to spot if you’re into pastries or if you just want a quick bite- there’s sandwiches and soup! Glad I gave this little gem a try:)

Custom Home Care has used Bake for Me! for holiday cookie trays for our referral partners for several years, and we get rave reviews! Excellent customer service, fair pricing, and they even deliver.  We always add extra cookies with our logo which adds a personal touch. High recommendations!

They got our order wrong on DoorDash (where they were called “Coffee and Stuff”), and the pastries tasted roughly like someone went to Jewel and bought Entenmann’s and repackaged it (and marked up the price).

I needed a design on a cake for my wife’s Jack and Jill ceremony. And they did a great job of giving me exactly what I had desired. The cake was very moist and sweet. My family enjoyed it. Thanks so much for your great customer service and for being able to provide a cake in a two day turnaround.
I had White Castle’s veggie burger made like the 1921 burger. The staff was more then willing to help me with all I needed help with ANNNND then bathroom was clean.

Ordered online. Was easy. One car in line but not long line. Burgers were finally nice and juicy with lots of onions. HOWEVER, I asked for no pickles and of course burgers had extra pickles. Receipt even showed no pickles on the order.
Tried placing a order In so I could pick up and go never came in on their end but the manager was super helpful and was able to recreate my order quickly and was very nice.
I like white castle every so often but this location was nasty... The buns were stale and hard. And the cheese wasn't even melted.. Definitely not going to this location again...
Use to like this one. Called to complain. Person on phone claims to be a manager. Very unpleasant. I will find another white castle with better customer service.

what an awesome burger! it is fairly small as is the menu but damn was it delicious with a perfect combination of toppings and it was super juicy. they are really slow behind the counter though.

thank God these guys are open late
One of the best "smash" burgers ever! Outstanding! Hotdogs are simple but good fresh cut fries.  Really good spot, definitely a must visit!

Kay took our order. She was quick to help and gave us suggestions on what to pick. Not hailing from this area, she also helped with the how to get to other areas in Chicago. The dogs and fries were outstanding. Best experience!

When you're craving a burger and fries in Chicago, this is a place to check out. When they say fresh cut fries, they mean fresh and we all know fresh food is best! They fries were delicious, but if you prefer your fries crispy, you won't enjoy them. This is a cash only place, so make sure you have cash on you.

I didn't get a burger, but fiancé said it was delicious.
A very good deal for the dollar. I got the depression dog but the double cheese burger is the thing to have. Fresh cut fries come with it. Had a beverage and came out less than $10.

What a great buzzing atmosphere. The place is deceiving up front, the restaurant is huge. The service and attentiveness of the staff is first rate. The Sangria is excellent and has many flavor choices. The Tapas is well served and fresh. The food is fun and tasty. Did not try to Paella but it is a popular dish. Reservations are a must, the place was packed even with an late afternoon reservation.

It’s a great place for family, friends, co worker n date night. it’s tapas spanish food. Served in small portion that perfect for trying many dishes. we tried many dishes. they all are good. There is variety choices of sangria drinks, check with the server for sangria of the day. it’s busy on the weekends so recommended to try.

One of the best tapas places I’ve ever tried.   The service was fantastic.  the food was excellent. I couldn’t  take pictures of all our plates since every time a new plate came we devoured  it. The food was so so good. Highly recommend the bacon wrapped dates and Spanish octopus!   come hungry.

This is easily one of the best Spanish themed restaurants in all the Chicago. The staff is always helpful but we went with the clear favorites of the meatballs, the potatoes, the chicken, ham croquettes, the meat and cheese board, olives and the like. The peach sangria was to die for. We went for a happy hour special and was very pleased of all the food we got for a cheap price.

The Tapas menu was super cool. Definitely definitely try the Omelette, the Beef Empanada and the Butterscotch Custard - amazing! The Passion Fruit Sangria didn’t feel worth $20 for half a pitcher. The Margarita was super strong!

I love the hot dogs: great flavor! The bun was fresh and tasty as well. They have many other options in their menu.
Friendly service. This place is CASH ONLY (they have an ATM tho).
Jeff's Red Hots is a traditional chicago style hot dog place. With over 30+ serving the Six Corners community they are sure to please hot dog lovers. There is a parking lot and free street parking.

This family owned business is great.  Everyone knows everyone and they connect with each customer that walks in.  They have that type of burger that you would get at a bbq but bigger, better,  juicer over all delicious.  Also the fries! I anyways order a small only because the small is a large and the large is a whole bag 😆 no complaints though who doesn't love fresh crispy fries!

they have quality food and the place is pretty clean with plenty of tables. The biggest most consistent problem here is the procedure they have for ordering your food. It's done by memory. Either by the owner or by the person behind the grill. they verbally take the orders and go by memory. plus the guy behind the grill was not a good communicator. Bottom line, good food but you have to be deliberate and check that everything you ordered is in the bag. Sucks that they just can't get the order right. People in the neighborhood mention this issue when they talk about Jeff's. Funny but sad. stopped going there.too many mistakes.
Excellent service. The gyros was fantastic. My order was correct. Jeff's is getting expensive. One meal was almost 14 bucks. Won't be going as often.

This location is a joke. Every time I go there I always walk in on an inappropriate conversation that the staff is having. The last time I was there  the girl name Sandra that I now know is the Manager was making a pizza and sneezed into her hand then continued to make the pizza. I asked if she was going to wash her hands and she looked at me and said “oh I didn’t sneeze”. But I was like I literally just saw you. I proceeded to ask if that was my pizza and if so could it be remade after she wash her hands. She told me she doesn’t have product to waste on remaking pizzas. So I said never mind I don’t want the pizza can I just have a refund. She told me the machine was down even though I just paid with my card about 7 minutes prior. Yea I would never be eating from this Domino’s again.. At least not while Sandra is still there.

I recently purchased Domino’s Pizza on North Avenue in Division and when I went to pick it up my order was wrong for the third time  The second time this elderly  man Name Dave he was even very rude to me and he’s the one who dropped my pizza.,don’t know what’s going on but this is definitely really sad! And the workers behind the counter didn’t seem like they wanted to help me or resolve anything I felt disrespected and definitely embarrassed. Never again !

Worst customer service experience ever! Ran into errors while placing an order online. Called them twice only to be bounced around only to be RUDELY informed that they won't deliver because of a shortage of drivers. The lady on the phone seemed to be having a bad day or just liked to speak like she was shouting orders.

WORST SERVICE EVER!!!!  Order 2 orders with door dash 20min before our pizza order and they both arrived over an hour and a half earlier than Domino pizza delivery. I also called twice to speak to manager as per system online saying it was Jordan and then Jordan was not even working and spoke to manager James who said 30min and we waited another hour. We use dominos all the time in Canada and get great service. But this was appalling and disgraceful. Waste of time and cold food!!!

I've ordered online for carryout twice from this location. The order is on time and the staff are polite. The pizza tastes like Dominos pizza I am used too. The pizza in the photo is a large bacon, provolone, and cheddar pizza.

Quick and easy pick-up to go order. I got the combo 1 catfish with 2 wings and fries.  The catfish was a nice big portion and the wings were well seasoned, crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. The fries were a little over done and not fresh hot. When I placed my phone order it seemed like the employee didn’t want to be working - not the best customer service over the phone. However, when I arrived to pick up my order it was a totally different experience. She was friendly and offered me the options for a soda, hot sauce and tarter sauce. I recommend ordering at least 10 min - 15 min in advance to ensure your order is ready when you arrive. There were people waiting on their order to be made. Good place for a quick bite!

It's a good fishing or better said seafood based restaurant I've really only ever got delivery from it but it's never failed food is always hot and fresh delicious at that hefty Wich is my favorite part the shrimp is amazing I definitely recommend the shrimp and fish, and speaking of fish always very well cooked white and tender I the inside while crunchy on the out I only didn't give the five stars because I've never been to the place so I feel I can't fully put the 5 other then that I got no complains and the prices are fair

Catfish sandwich with fries was decent, good seasoning and put together neatly. Plan to take your order to go, though - they definitely do not want people eating in and there's nowhere to sit even though it's a large storefront with a large dining area. It's also a little dirty in the dining space, everything in there needed a wipe-down.

The chicken was great and the customer service was even better! I had to put together a last minute lunch for my the teachers at my school and they had an order of 150 pieces of chicken ready in 20 mins, were super nice as I paid, and helped me carry my order to my car.
I will personally be back to try the catfish as other peoples orders of it looked amazing.

Food is good and well prepared but I called in my order because I was running late and when I arrived 30 mins after I placed my order they had never even started making it.... Which made me late anyways. The girls working the counter acted as if they did not care and like they didn't know why it wasn't made yet. I won't be coming back, and it's a shame because the food was so good.

I just now tasted the world famous chicken here at the KFC restaurant, the customer service of this place are too good. Very friendly, efficient and really on point to their work. Quick service.  The food was timely cook and served hot. The chicken was really excellent taste. The quality is always consistent.  Overall I was pretty satisfied with the service I received at this location. I also like their mashed potatoes. That some of the reason why loyal customers visit their favorite restaurant because of the qualities I mentioned above. Definitely will visit this location again and will recommend to my families and friends. Their chicken is fresh and delicious!

For our family's 4th of July celebration, my folks put me in charge of the KFC so I placed an online order for a scheduled pickup and when I arrived, a kind salesperson informed me that the food had been prepared too early and she needed some time to re-do the order. She was so kind and apologetic and she even gave us extra biscuits! I am so grateful that the employees worked so hard to fix an understandable mistake- I would have been in hot water if the KFC had been cold! Thank you KFC @ 1144 S. Western staff!!!

I bought a chicken sandwich only because they said the sandwich was made to order. Not only was it not fresh, it was greasy and sauce was slopped all over. The only thing good was the ice in the lemonade.👎🏿

Please be aware of their chicken there. Check your food for quality before you leave there so when you get to your final destination to eat your food your chicken not looking nasty an triffling like this. I had to put this out there because this was just plane nasty an triffling of them.

I was scheduled for an interview with Lisa Simmons they kept sending emails and text reminding me I had an upcoming interview Saturday at 11:30 I did confirm! I got there no one knew about my interview she was not even there I waited to get interview the girl was probably the manager she took down my info and said come back Monday for a second interview i am not not returning they looked racist had only colored people working there and unprofessional the way she was writing my info the way she was Looking and asking questions!

I’ve been wanting to try this place out for quite some time now. Just finally went tonight and I was blown away with how delicious everything was. My husband and I never even spoke to each other during the meal because we were so busy enjoying our food. I got the seafood linguini special and my husband got the chicken/mozzarella with vegetable dish. We also got the mussels appetizer and the broth that comes with it is so full of flavor (make sure you dunk the bread in it, and top it with the Parmesan they serve with it). We were too full for dessert but next time we come in all make sure to get the tiramisu. Service was great as well. Can’t wait to come back!

This restaurant was on my list to visit since before the pandemic shut down.
We finally got to come and this restaurant is absolutely superb!!!
The service is impeccable, the food is outstanding, and the atmosphere is perfect.
My boyfriend had the steak, I had a delicious pasta dish, and they were kind enough to make a dish of plain pasta for my picky toddler. We will definitely return!!!!

Their eggplant and pork chops are incredible - it’s probably my favorite Italian eggplant dish of all time. This evening we also had the grilled prosciutto and mozzarella, the old fashioned and the grilled sausage.
I've been coming here for at least 15 years and it never disappoints. Still my favorite Italian restaurant in all of Chicago.

Neighborhood staple for years in Logan Square. They renovated & it looks fresh & new with giving more room between tables. Food is still delicious Northern Italian cuisine with ample portions. Great for date night or special occasion. Wonderful wait staff & service.  There is also patio seating when the weather is nice outside.

Food was good! I had an omelet several times that week and the one from Yolk was by far the best! The potatoes that came with it were just okay... they could have been crisper. Pancakes were good, but nothing special.
We ordered the following:
Cinnamon roll French toast, banana nut bread French toast, side of bacon. The Works omelet that came with a side of seasoned potatoes and pancakes.

We got there around 8:20 and we were warmly greeted at the door. The place wasn't packed and we were seated in a booth. Our server shortly came to take our orders. We started of with drinks and ordered a very berry French toast and the breakfast mac & cheese (turkey sausage instead of ham).
We were very surprised by how quickly our food was prepared and even more surprised & pleased by how delicious it was. The portion for both meals was generous and enough for breakfast and the price was also reasonable. We thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast and will definitely go back. I highly recommend this place for a quick breakfast but I suggest going there before 9:30 because it starts getting really packed after that.

Came to get breakfast on a Sunday morning.  Luckily there wasn't a wait and we got a table right away.  Menu had lots of great breakfast and brunch options.  We got the California omelette and it was good, a little on the heavy side.  The eggs and pancakes was great though.  Great place for breakfast and brunch! Will come back and try other stuff for sure

Fantastic breakfast spot. Delicious French toast. Everything is done well and done right.
Whenever you want a good breakfast look no further.

Service is also really good and quick. And the prices are right as well. You can tell that everything cooked was fresh as this place is always busy and thus flips tables regularly.

I would recommend this to any one in the area or traveling and in need of breakfast.

This was our first time eating here and it was fabulous! Only a two minute walk from our hotel which is a huge plus.

It was so bright and modern on the inside. I ordered a caramel latte, red velvet French toast, and cheese grits. All so delicious!!

Our waitress was so friendly and overall just great!

Where to even start.  Best meal and dining experience I've had in years.  First of all, 2 ladies stopped by with freshly-made margaritas and man oh man were they fantastic.
The service was impeccable - 0 missteps. The food was indescribably amazing.  So many flavors and everything was beautifully cooked and beautifully presented.

Not quite Mexican, not quite latin but this place should definitely be in your plans.

Two thumbs up. We were a table of 3, ordered 7 items and was served and out the door in 40 minutes in a Saturday night at 6:45pm. That was incredible service. This place was very lively and loud. A bit upscale so avoid jeans or shorts. I did not see kids inside but saw a family outside with the kids eating Mac and Cheese. My favorite was the mango guacamole as well as the spicy sweet corn. Dishes are moderately sized. I suggest getting a variety of items and sharing. Plenty of veg options.

Delicious food. A Mexican food restaurant but with a new style. Drinks were incredible! Definitely will come back. During the weekends try to get a reservation if you're planning to go here.
The service from the waiters could be better though.

I would give 5 for the food.They have delicious mouth watering tacos, drinks, and other food here.
The service I would give 3 to 2 stars only.
We dined in a party of 9, 3 of us had to squeezed in one very small table despite of our tons of orders. I kept asking our waitress for a table or a chair atleast for the 3rd person and she kept saying no! There are vacant chairs and tables around.The waitress was also strict where our friend will put his coat. So we had our friend sat awkwardly in the long chair and put his coal behind my already small chair.. it just felt weird and not right. We just decided to ignore it and enjoy our night. I just have this need of leaving an honest review about it so it won't happen again, and management would teach their waitress not to treat people like they are in the canteen or in just a cheap restaurant, because The restaurants was in a great location and offers delicious food, it has potential to look classy. Just do something about the attitude of the staff so it will radiate classy atmosphere.
I am only posting photos of the food and drinks that what I had, not including the food and drinks of the rest of our party.

June 9, 2022- we ate here because we love the food and it didn't disappoint us. The service was nice and fast. We were seated outside so we are comfortable, it looks like they gave enough spaces between tables inside of the restaurants. Our food attendants was nice. Changed 4 to 5 stars.

Some of the best tacos I’ve ever had! The steak tacos get a 10/10 from me. The chicken and fish tacos were also delicious. The chips & mango guacamole were incredible. Mercadito is officially on my favorites list.

I just now tasted the world famous chicken here at the KFC restaurant, the customer service of this place are too good. Very friendly, efficient and really on point to their work. Quick service.  The food was timely cook and served hot. The chicken was really excellent taste. The quality is always consistent.  Overall I was pretty satisfied with the service I received at this location. I also like their mashed potatoes. That some of the reason why loyal customers visit their favorite restaurant because of the qualities I mentioned above. Definitely will visit this location again and will recommend to my families and friends. Their chicken is fresh and delicious!

For our family's 4th of July celebration, my folks put me in charge of the KFC so I placed an online order for a scheduled pickup and when I arrived, a kind salesperson informed me that the food had been prepared too early and she needed some time to re-do the order. She was so kind and apologetic and she even gave us extra biscuits! I am so grateful that the employees worked so hard to fix an understandable mistake- I would have been in hot water if the KFC had been cold! Thank you KFC @ 1144 S. Western staff!!!

I bought a chicken sandwich only because they said the sandwich was made to order. Not only was it not fresh, it was greasy and sauce was slopped all over. The only thing good was the ice in the lemonade.👎🏿

Please be aware of their chicken there. Check your food for quality before you leave there so when you get to your final destination to eat your food your chicken not looking nasty an triffling like this. I had to put this out there because this was just plane nasty an triffling of them.

I was scheduled for an interview with Lisa Simmons they kept sending emails and text reminding me I had an upcoming interview Saturday at 11:30 I did confirm! I got there no one knew about my interview she was not even there I waited to get interview the girl was probably the manager she took down my info and said come back Monday for a second interview i am not not returning they looked racist had only colored people working there and unprofessional the way she was writing my info the way she was Looking and asking questions!

THE WORST WINGSTOP. I couldn’t believe how rude and long it took these employees to do anything. There was NO other customers and they had ONE receipt hanging, he said ten minutes and it was 23 minutes exactly before we got our food? Unreal. They forgot forks and ketchup and even the girl who came back from her break was upset. I love wingstop but I would literally never come here again.

The place including the parking lot is filthy. They have trouble following special orders whether you want something low sauce extra sauce or well done. Honestly I'm surprised their corporate office hasn't suspended the franchise.I was actually given undercooked chicken. I also believe they qaterdown the sauces cause other places sauce doesn't taste so weak like the one on Lincoln does. EWWWWW

We place an order at 10:01pm and they told us to wait 15 minutes until it had passed about 30 minutes, I had also experienced another customer had placed an order about 2 minutes after us I had overheard that the cashier said that they would have the food ready in 10 minutes, those 10 minutes had passed and it still wading ready so they had to get a REFUND ON THEIR FOOD, the staff was laughing and playing and just joking around like there was no orders waiting, overall bad customer service I do not recommend coming here it is awful.
Employee on phone the whole time. Did not drain oil and ended with quarter cup oil in my food. The sign in Spanish has only the cognate correctly spelled.

Take too long for a wings. @40 ?mnts. It was togo order,and I didn't see much costumers..
Sad..

This place is comfort food done right!

The portions are very filling and the price is pretty reasonable.

Food tastes good and I had no complaints. Definitely get some of those tasty cinnamon rolls, they give you 2 as a single side! The place was packed during rush hour lunch time, so get there earlier than noon or after 1pm sometime during the weekends.

Definitely recommend.

Visited this breakfast place on Sunday. The big advantage they have a parking. We came at 10am and got a table immediately. The portions are really big. But it was tasty. I like breakfast bagel with a side of cottage cheese. We also tried cinnamon rolls and muffins which are insane! Hot chocolate was very good also. The only thing that I didn’t like they served sweet dishes first. So we got muffins and cinnamon rolls first and then savory eggs. Which is kind of weird. The waitress wasn’t very nice and didn’t offer an extra chair as we got a table for 4 while we were 5.

If you love Cinnamon roll, then THIS is the place to go. My kids loved the roll, but I thought stuffed potato pancakes were great as well. Strawberry banana smoothie complemented the meal. Service was fast and friendly. No reservations needed.

Yes yes yes!! This is a must for brunch/breakfast when in Chicago! They are known for their cinnamon rolls so you have to try them! A lot of the plates come with the 2 sides and you can actually do cinnamon rolls and some other great items as sides. It is also BYOB (they provide mimosa fixings) so bring a bottle or 2 of champagne! This location has a target across the street so could also grab some there. Staff was also super friendly!

They do make a solid cinnamon roll 🤤 The Salmon & dill omelette was also better than I expected. The portions are huge —every egg dish comes with not one, but two huge sides. I made a mistake with the hot biscuits though, I was expecting southern-style buttermilk biscuits. Whatever this Swedish biscuit was, I wouldn’t exactly recommend it.

I can not say I've ever had a disappointing meal from this place. Always fast and friendly delivery people not to mention quick service and competitive prices.

Has been my go-to for years and will continue to do so. Keep up the great work Domino's!

Sincerely, satisfied customer 😀
Great people working there and good customer service but the pizza was absolutely horrible. They overcooked my pizza!
Nobody wears gloves while touching the toppings and in general while making contact with your food (just go in for pickup you'll see for yourself)
One of the best places to have pizza, the staff is so friendly and nice, they personalized the order for me!! I really love going here 👍
We got two pizzas today, and they were cooked really badly, wasn’t fully cooked and vegetables were not sliced correctly, the crust was not hard at all, and slices were easily breaking.

District Brew Yards is an unforgettable place for beer, food and fun. The expansive open atmosphere is inviting. And high top tables inside while outside has couches and chairs to arrange for any size party. Staff are friendly and patrons are happily satiated with the various choices of beverage. There were four featured breweries and each had their own wall tap. The concept is really simple, get a swipe card and charge to a credit card for purchasing any amount of liquid gold. Short or long pours the choice is yours. Those that get hungry can go to the barbecue joint And we highly recommend the brisket loaded fries.  The outside patio is dog and family friendly, make District Brew Yards the number one stop for happy hour or plan an outing or event.

Very cool place where you get to pour your own beer from a large number of taps.  AND you get to pour as much or as little as you want so you can taste a lot of different beers and decide what you like.  You pay by the ounce (not exactly a value proposition, but fun just the same).  The food is pretty good there too.  Only bummer was that they closed early while we were there with a group the day after our daughter's wedding because they said they were slow.  We originally thought it was going to be open until 11pm!  Recommend giving it a try.

Interesting place. Social seating with beers from four breweries to choose from. A district brewery yards you pay by the ounce. The cheapest per ounce Brew I saw was $0.59, with average prices around mid .60 to low .70 cents. When you enter the building you give them your credit card, they in return give you a card to place on taps. The place is completely self-service. You pour your own drinks and you clean up after yourself. Many games available the play. Place was quite busy and loud when we visited. Food is on site and again totally self-served. We didn't eat there but it did smell good. Don't worry about tax and tips it's all included in the per ounce price.

Great place for a perfect winter afternoon with lots of beer options. They do have heated patio where dogs are allowed. There are 4 beer dispensing sections with each offering 10 beers. You are given a swipe card which you can use to pour your own beer. Its a pay by ounce concept which makes it pretty easy to get carried away. Watch out on how much you drink if you are driving. Tried the fried pickle and cheetos mac & cheese. Both were great!!

Must go for beer rookies and those who don't know what they like or don't want to commit to a pack that they haven't tried before. They have 4 brewery beers on site and are constantly rotating what they offer. Bbq food for the munchies and pet friendly outside on the patio. There are board games available indoors so you can get a group over to have a good time. You leave a card on file at the entrance and you pay per oz per beer/beer type that you pour. Great for groups and supporting local craft beer. They offer merch and cans to go in in the front
I placed my order, arrived 5 minutes later, waited another 5 minutes, and somehow received a soggy sandwich. Not going to eat this. Very sad.

I have ordered from this Jimmy Johns for  the last few months. They always forget to bring things for my order such as Mayo packets for 3 times in a row that I have ordered. I am in the office by myself on Saturdays cannot leave for that reason and do not have the time to tell them how to do their job. I know there is work shortage and they have new people, but train them better to read the receipt of what should be taken.

I think this is the best Jimmy Johns in Lincoln Park. The entire team who was working there today went above and beyond when I ordered my sandwich to the wrong store, and worked so quickly to make it for me at this store instead, exactly how I wanted it. They had a great attitude and the sandwich was made PERFECT! I was having a hectic day before and that really meant a lot!  Thank you!

45 minutes for my turkey sandwich to arrive - jimmy johns’s super slow. The manager is very rude, hung up the phone when I complained about their delays using “wowwwwww” as her response.  Too bad the service is this bad, because the sandwiches are good (in general) when ordered from other locations

The food is incredible, the staff are incredible, the setting and ambience are perfection—our first time in was Valentine's Day 2019 and it was such a cozy, warm, happy place to spend the evening. We continued to get carryout throughout covid and love returning now that it's back open for dine-in. But it's also perfect during any season and it's become our go-to spot to take visitors, celebrate special occasions, or when we want to enjoy amazing food any day of the week. Support this small, local restaurant, you won't regret it. It's full of talent, heart, hard work, and is a very special gem in the neighborhood and city.

Some tips:

Don't sleep on the desert! You think you don't like mousse? You haven't tried theirs. Think the desert empanadas sound too heavy? You're wrong!

For what it's worth it's a Bib Gourmand restaurant aka Michelin recommends it and so does Mr. Fieri himself.

You can bring tequila to have margs, or wine and beer (read the website for limits).

It took us way too long to come here so stop what you're doing and don't waste time like we did. We've lived in the neighborhood for 6+ years and at first glance, the mixed reviews kept us from popping in. Well if you do your research, you'll see it mostly seems to be people who are angry they don't allow you to get obliterated via the BYOB policy.
Great small plate menu options. The simple dishes were really well done. The prices were on the higher end of what I would be willing to pay however the BYOB option is a nice perk.

Best Mexican restaurant in Chicago that serves up very regional dishes! My favorite was the chiles en nogada (Mexican national dish) and the pulled pork platter with string cheese. Everything else was phenomenal - you can go wrong with any of their dishes!

For dessert, I highly recommend their flan and peanut butter empanadas. Perfect endings to an incredible meal!

For drinks, Chilam Balam is byob!

Ambience is a super fun vibe - great for hanging out with friends or family! Service is very efficient as well!

Went for my birthday as a group of 10 this week. I had to put down a $10/pp deposit when I called in the reservation. This went towards our final bill. Just let them bring out whatever they want. All the courses were amazing! Venmo and Cash only

Guy Fieri knows good food and boy was he right about Chilam Balam!🔥🔥🔥 No idea what these yuppies are complaining about in the reviews, if you want amazing, unique, delicious food, in Chicago, give Chilam a try, you will NOT be disappointed! The service was on point!! The Brussels sprouts app is a MUST, absolutely amazing and you know how most of the time you don't get dessert at a restaurant because you're too full? Yeah, no...the sweet empanadas are to die for...do your tastebuds a favor, and visit Chilam Balam at your earliest convenience!!! 🤤

The goat salad was probably one of the best salads I've ever had. When it came to the pizza I'm usually one to get meat on it, but they had a great vegetarian option that I just had to try and it did not disappoint. I would have given them five stars except the first specialty cocktail that I ordered was overpowered too much by the lemon in it, couldn't even tell that there was bourbon in the drink. The next cocktail was a lot better though. I am looking forward to heading back. The price may look high per person in my review but I did have a salad along with pizza and two of their specialty cocktails. I felt it was very worth the price.
Pizza was a bit burned. I was expecting a indie/rock vibe but it was an obnoxiously loud gangsta rap non-stop. Crew was nice and the free shot it you use their atm is a nice touch.

We enjoyed our food and had a fun time. It was a cold and rainy night so unfortunately we were sat outside (it’s covered). Ellen was okay and seemed pretty busy that night! Malcolm was a great bus boy and runner!! We loved his overalls and he was really attentive and helpful! The food was yummy, everyone really liked the purist slice. We enjoyed some cocktails like the Pen Island and Old Dutch Mule. The cash only aspect was frustrating especially because she couldn’t split our bill for us but we did the math and figured it out. I didn’t love that they were playing animal planet and spiders were on a projector while I was eating, but oh well! Lions were on their too and we loved that!!

Casual, lively experience for a pizza place.  I really enjoy coming in, whether it's to sit on the patio, in the dining room or at the bar.  Beer selection is solid.  Pizza isn't on the cheap side, but you're getting a wealth of ingredients without weighing the crust down and ruining your slice.

Love the Boiler Room! I've been going here for years. Their slices are delightful and they have a solid beer selection and a great ambience inside right near the blue line California stop. Only complaint is that they continue to be cash only (which is surprising after 2+ years of pandemic times) but they do have an ATM on site if you need it.

I ordered a cheese pizza slice and it was huge! Thin crust baked nicely, excellent full of flavor, and nice amount of cheese. Yummy. Warning, if you want crisp, this isn't crisp, more like NY style which I like! The kitchen staff are fast in preparing the pizza.

I wanted to try a vegetarian/vegan pizza that had toppings but unfortunately the only choice was cheese pizza. I couldn't order the vegan slice pizza with toppings  due to my allergy. I wanted to order one more food and didn't want a huge pizza instead try to order a vegan sandwich so I asked about a specific ingredient in the vegan meat due to my allergy. Staff did not know and manager response repeatedly "I don't know." I was taken aback that she wouldn't try figure out or call the owner or the guy that actually made the vegan beef. She said she didn't have contact numbers and didn't know and couldn't find out. As a manager, that was not how one answer the customer. From my experience, vegan restaurants will find the answer for their customers. The cashier was apologetic and tried to be helpful.

The interior decor reflect the name opposite of exterior. It is unique and easily located on a corner.  The space is not large. It is best for order to go especially for large group/family.  There are a few high chairs seating for one or two people. Also four tables for 2 people. Parking on the street is available.

Came here for a quick bite near closing time. Ordered their vegan slice with "sausage" which was huge. I've actually never had vegan pizza so I don't have any comparisons but it was pretty good. Their pesto cheese bread was buttery and flakey. I would get it again!

I grew up in Chicago and near west burbs, and I am super picky about pizza.  I've eaten a variety of pizzas here and in Italy.  This has been our go-to pizza spot for as long as they've been open here in Logan Square, which I think is 10 or 11 years?  Anyhow, I love their unique and creative pizza combos. Their pizzas are very large.  The crust is thin, with a substantial edge that is sprinkled with oregano, which I really like. It's not the traditional style Chicago thin crust that I grew up with, but in some ways, like the herbed crust and lack of greasiness, it's better. We moved from Logan recently and this is one place I will really miss because there's no other pizza place like this.  Okay, maybe there is one sorta like it in Palermo.

I've gotten slices of the day from Dante's several times, and they are always delicious! Slice of the day today was very spicy with three different kinds of peppers! Huge slices. They were playing "What We Do in the Shadows" on the TV. Latin inscriptions and a wooden pizza paddle with goat head/ pentacle hanging on the wall give the interior a Gothic feel.

Easily one of the best pizzas in the city gotta put in back in the oven once you get it delivered and then its absolutely perfect once the bottom is nice and crisp. The pepperoni is also the size of my face the sauce is always good and the dough itself is tasty.

This place is awesome with great pizza! It is an eclectic place with I think 3 or 4 pianos throughout a music stage a large selection of vinyl records and an amazing kids area. I read somewhere it may be the most kids friendly pizza place in the city and I agree. The service was fast, the pizzas were great and everyone that worked there was extremely friendly. They also have music performances every Thursday. We will definitely be returning as both my daughters love this place and the pizza.

Pretty disappointed. Read the great reviews online and thought this place was worth checking out. The pizza itself tasted ok but the overall experience was very poor. 3 significant mistakes with a 2 item order is terrible  execution. 1. I specifically asked for our pizza to be pie cut in the online order. The cashier pointed out that she “accidentally” tavern cut it. This is a giant pet peeve for me and I would have asked for it to be remade if I had more time., 2. Ordered boneless wings, specifically write that I want them covered in hot Buffalo with blue cheese on the side. What I got - Plain wings, hot sauce, no blue cheese anywhere. Great., 3. We open the pizza and there is this burnt black sand looking stuff all over one side of it on the bottom. I’m assuming they decided to scrap the oven as my order was in there. Looked absolutely disgusting. I’m seriously shocked they managed to get this much wrong. 1st and last time they’ll get an order from me. They get 2 stars because the pizza not covered in sand was edible.
