Family friendly local
Pizza joint. We found this place on accident and was a wonderful experience-good thin crust pizza, incredibly friendly owner, vinyl records, games and fun-even had chess to play. Great neighborhood pizza place.
Good thin crust pizza with plenty of cheese. Great atmosphere and vintage wood decor and a solid playlist.
Really enjoyed my experience. Old school pizza joint meets kid-friendly restaurant, meets music venue... really unique environment. Would be happy to return

This place has changed over the years. I used to love coming to this place when I was a resident of Illinois. Now, the service is abrupt and borderline rude. The food was not good at all. The chicken was decent, but the rice which is usually amazing was dry and not what I asked for. They have these new teas and they were yummy except my daughters had several pieces of hair in hers. If I didn't have to travel so far back to the restaurant I would've taken it all back. I was disappointed.

I used to come here all the time I live in the area.  I started to notice that depending on who’s working the register the prices are deferent. If the guy behind the register rings you up he charges you more. I came in one day and ordered the same thing I had the day before and was charged way more. And they play you on the shrimp.

I tried milk tea for the first time with tapioca balls and popping Great delicious. Will be going back to try some more flavors. I love the popping I had add they were different and excited me every taste.
Food was more salty than usual. Broccoli was overcooked. What happened to the fortune cookies? I guess the prices go up and they take thing away.
No sauces was in the bag and chicken fried rice wasnt spicy as asked also egg rolls are extra small now lol

For the best Tex Mex in Chicago please don’t miss this eatery. It’s casual but the food is out of this world. Best shrimp fajitas in town hands down. And the crispy fish tacos too. That spicy cheese dip was magical. It’s BYOB! Go here!

I absolutely loved their enchilada suizos as it was a burrito dipped in enchilada sauce. I ordered the one with fajita veggies and it is right around Belmont. It was a huge portion so I you will have leftovers. If you are in town, go check it out.

This was a suprise for us. We'd just gotten to our Airbnb and wanted so food before our concert. Mixteco had a steady stream of delivery people in and out so we decided that was as good a sign as any. We were not disappointed! It's pricy, but the food is amazing! The portions are huge and the wait time was minimal. If we are ever back in that neighborhood, this will be a stop! Highly recommended!

I always do take out and they are incredibly fast, ready within 5 minutes every time I order so everything is always super hot.

If this is your first time ordering you have to get the nachos, which are always so packed with toppings and well worth it, get them with spiced beef. Also get a burrito which is amazing and they use such fresh ingredients.

I would also get the fajita quesadilla which chipotle chicken, it's so good, pair it with hot salsa .

Food: 4/5
Speed: 5/5

I'm giving Mixteco four stars because the food is kind of expensive. For example a la carte tacos can be $4.95, which honestly is crazy for a few bites of food and makes it one of the most expensive tacos in the area. I always get the fajita quesadilla which is 8.99 but then with chicken it brings the price to $12.50.

Overall I'm glad this place is down the street, they run a taco Tuesday special which I think is 19.99 for 10 tacos which is a crazy good deal.

Better than Chipotle, a bit pricey but definitely worth it. Food is delicious and tastes fresh. I ordered a chicken bowl and a steak taco bowl. Even though it was delivered, food presentation was great.
Si Fu has some pretty decent food at reasonable prices. The combos are the way to go. Four delicious tacos for cheap. Try the tuna taco. I loved it. Good spot.

This is a standout restaurant for me on Roscoe St. A common complaint I have of restaurants in this area is that they are overpriced for what they provide but I've been very happy with the food I've eaten at SI FU so far. Great flavors and service, I hope they do well and stick around.
Fun, new cuisine.

This place wasn't even bad: good atmosphere, decent drinks, etc. but I will never come here again. You guys literally chased away 3 customers.

We got ran down almost a block by our bartender for a DOLLAR. We put down what we thought was the right amount of money for our last drink but apparently we were a dollar short. We leave and after a couple minutes we hear a distant "HEY!" and dude is running across the street after us. He gets to us and says "I'm not trying to be petty, but..." YOU CHASED US FOR A DOLLAR! THAT IS PETTY! We gave him his dollar and even tried to tip him for our mistake but he just walked off annoyed. Suffice it to say I will never go here again. Maybe don't do shots with your patrons if you're worried about money!

Good place - the beer list is somewhat limited for someone who doesn't have a taste for strong local brews, but the cocktails are pretty good. The tiki bar is adorable and great for the summer and the food is surprisingly impressive for what looks on the outside as a dive bar. Try the Jack Mac and Cheese - I like it "plain" which means it comes with bacon and red peppers, but  you can add pulled pork, blackened chicken or sausage if you are craving more meat.

one of a dying breed of original neighborhood bars with a diverse and unpretentious crowd.

the beer list is tiny by chicago standards and the drinks are just okay.

the food is always good, not excellent, but more importantly, never bad.

the atmosphere is unique. it's dark and modern, yet comfortable and cozy. the patio is a well kept secret.

there's not one thing to crave, but the entire atmosphere, intimacy and friendliness of this place a common go-to.

The first time I went it was great. Good food, good portions, good selection, fair prices. Not anymore. I went back recently with a friend after talking the place up all evening. To my horror, everything had changed. Tiny, boring, overpriced menu, uninspired watery cocktails, a couple terrible beers, bland food, and portions so insultingly small I asked for a manager. I guess it's run by different people now, which is a shame. I left hungry, sober, and disappointed after spending $30. What a rip-off.

One of the best and friendliest bars in Chicago. You can be yourself at this place. Great music and food.  Beer selection is limited but it should have something for every palate except for Belgian styles. The outdoor area is easily in the top 10 of the city.
Fairly priced for as good as they are. 100% would recommend. Staff is all super nice too. Great place.

We had chicken burritos and veggie tacos. Taste was good, ingredients were fresh. More of a native Spanish restra. We found it hard to communicate in English, but as long as you get what you want in your plates, it is ok.

So unhappy with my order yesterday it’ll be my last time here. I normally love this place but yesterday as I’m about to eat a cebollita I see a rubber band on it . I’m assuming they forgot to take it off as cebollitas come wrapped in rubber bands and that’s extremely dangerous. It could have been one of my kids eating that. They need to be more careful when prepping food. I won’t be coming back

Don’t eat here. $16.93 for a taco dinner, sour cream and cheese is extra. It’s called a DINNER and there’s NO DRINK. I asked for a receipt and it’s NOT ITEMIZED!!! It don’t show how much nothing is. lastly!? The entire receipt is in Spanish.
Asked for no onions they literally gave me 9 steak tacos with soooo much onion not very good Quality meat. Sucks entirely.

Standard cheesie’s experience what more can you ask for. If you are prone to heartburn definitely need to arrive with a bottle of tums. Very nice location near lots of other nightlife with a bar for drinks. Everything is on the pricer side but worth it if you are out with friends. I remember going to cheesie’s on Belmont in my early college years.

As a first-time visitor to the restaurant, I had a positive experience. First of all, it has a designated location which is the main reason why I was able to find it besides being recommended by a friend. The restaurant is clean and in between bright and dim. The staff are nice but not really friendly. What I liked at first is definitely their menu, which has a variety of options, especially on their sandwiches. It was my first time, but the staff was not kind of friendly staff, but they seemed nice nonetheless. I was not able to ask him for some recommendations. I just simply ordered their balboa sandwich.  I thought that the service would be fast since the restaurant is not really busy , but I was wrong. It took a long while before my order was served even if it was just a sandwich and some fries. Anyway, the balboa sandwich was delicious. It was simply delicious and I definitely like it. It was so cheesy and the flavor of it was the best. I will surely be back.
They have ms. Pac-Man! The cheese sandwiches were pretty tasty.

Me and my partners favorite place to grab some grilled cheese!! I tried the Tenderizer today for the first time and it was SOO good. Place is pricey, but for the amount of food you get, it is worth it!!

My man up front was super cool and was in shock after my girlfriend devoured the Mac, loaded tots, and fried pb n j. I had the bal boa and the food is and always will be on point definitely coming back here on a day off to have good food.

The crust was good. For what it was worth; pretty expensive pizza. I got the Lous pizza in a medium Size and it cost $28. The pizza is very filling, though.

I had to transport this back, so it got really soggy. This is best eaten fresh at the restaurant, but there is no where to dine in inside. Service was meh. I can see the appeal, but not my favorite style of pizza.

First time getting deep dish in Chicago and was told to give this place a go even though it was a chain. It wasn’t bad but nothing that blew my socks off. Staff was very friendly. One thing that was odd, was that they ran out of pepperoni. Probably the most popular ingredient and they ran out of it. Supply chain issues I guess.
Wow worst pizza ever. You come from out of town to get a Chicago deep dish and this is what you get. No cheese just garbage!! Thanks for wasting my money appreciate it!!

This wicker park location not only crossed up my order with someone else’s in my same building, the manager was by far the rudest person I’ve ever dealt with in my life. He was trying to tell me that my delivery was on time but he mixed it up with my neighbors order. However instead of investigating the situation, he placed the blame on me and treated me horribly. He said he was too busy doing his job. Buddy …this is your job! I used to order 2-3x /week. I will never again order from this location. They don’t take accountability and are just bad people. What a shame!

Pizza took over an hour to be done for pick up. They had told us 40 minutes so I went after 45 minutes and then they told me it would take another 20 minutes. I returned then and it took another 15 minutes. Pizza was good but they need to be better with timing.

Asked If The Burrito Was Actually A Flour Shell.Cashier Said Yes. I Get Home 2 Eat.It’s A Gyro Bread Pinta.An it was a dam taco with lettuce an tomatoes with jalapeños.Do you know the meaning of a burrito 🌯 that’s what it look like.wrapped up.in a big tortilla shell.flour.

I had  ordered  the corned beef On rye it was suppose to come with fries and a can of pop. Most places it comes with cheese but this place charged me $1.50 on top of $10.99 just for sandwich and fries. Didn't even come with a pop!!!!! On top of it when I asked the cashier for my pop he said it was an extra charge. I was like my dude the sign in window says $9.99 for sandwich fries and pop. He wanted to argue saying that was just for the sandwich and fries. I said dude dont play with me that is b.s. He then tells me to take it up with management. Then the sandwich had more mustard and bread than anything. Wth? Barely any meat!!! And the $1.50 I spent for the cheese was like half a slice.who does this? Anywho I will never come back and make sure my peeps dont either. Terrible food and terrible service. I will stick with Stony sub where $10 gets you the sandwhich with cheese fries and and a soda. Oh and did I mention like a lot of meat!!!!! Nickys do better!!!

I went to this restaurant today and ordered 3 chicken wings and a hot dog. The fries were undercooked and the wings were either overcooked or fried too long they were extremely dry and hard. I was VERY disappointed this was not my first time ordering but this will be my last.
The food was most delicious. I ordered bake chicken, corn, salad, fries, and garlic bread. The service was fast. Customer service skills was very good.

Used to be great food, now they mess up orders and going up on their prices.  Went up on the chicken wings $5 extra and they changed their fries to the fries that you can't reheat. Fries be soggy and dry.. My last time ordering from here
Great tacos. Fast, easy and convenient! I recommend trying, when ever I want some takeout Mexican food, this is my place.
Excellent food exquisite dishes. The best Moroccan restaurant I have seen in ages. Definitely will come back on my next visit to Chicago.
Very good Moroccan place. Has good mint tea and the dishes are good portions and delicious. Definitely come here if you have the time. The fish and the lamb kebabs are great

Made me miss my Ramadan predawn meal because they didn't bring the food in time, nor did they tell me it wouldn't be ready in time...making me and my friend fast an entire day without food. It's a Muslim restaurant and was open specifically for that purpose, too.

Cosy spot with very friendly staff. The customers seem to be very open and converse freely with each other across the tables. A rather homely feeling although easy for one to feel out of place if you don't speak the language of the patrons.
It's neat but at the time of my visit, felt the overbearing presence of a scent and wasn't sure what it was.
The wait time was fairly long but the food smelt absolutely irresistible, it made my mouth water. On the other hand it tasted okay.
It's small so the bathroom is in very close proximity. Otherwise not a bad experience.
Great place to get relaxed with delicious food n snacks...Like the Moroccan mint tea. Customer service is also awesome ✔

My first time trying Afghan food and this place becomes one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago! The food is delicious and the portion is huge. Either friends gathering or a simple meal for one, you cannot go wrong with this place.

We had the Lamb shank Entree and Chicken shish kabob and it was the best ever!! Marinated, tender and fresh food. I have been a customer here since 2018 and appreciate their hospitality and hard working people to make such great food.

We ordered to go 3 and 2 combo entrees and potato samosas.  Everything was delicious and tasty! We especially liked the aromatic garlic 🧄sesame sauce and the hot 🔥green samosa sauce. We will sit at  the little patio next time when the weather is warmer. We will be back!

Delicious 🤤 , specially qabli pulaow smell too good , chapli qabab taste also so yummy 5 stars ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Staff gesture also great and most important you will get easily free parking , restaurant enviro thumbs up 👍

We went there 2 weeks ago there and enjoy delicious foods, Ms.Farida was really friendly, hospitality was good and she offered tasty kabob to me, we decided went there last week again and she recognized us and I was really like that , they are really professional and friendly and also really clean place, I really like go there every week and you can enjoy their foods. And their prices was normal and their portions was really enough.

Food was good and the wait wasn't bad. I got my sweet and sour chicken combo. My husband got the honey chicken (spicy) and my son got the shrimp fried rice. They also have smoothies. I'll try one next time.

Apparently if you want to eat cleaned shrimp you should spend MORE money and order the jumbo shrimp....pulease! I ordered a large shrimp fried rice and not only were the shrimp not cleaned but some also were still shelled. The taller Asian lady is RUDE and should take a course in customer service.

Never spending my money in that place again.

Not to good!!! I got the shrimp egg foo young dinner and the gravy on it was nasty and thick. I usually get that meal and it's always good but not this time...they need to go back to the old dark gravy

People must understand, that when you condition your palate to the same dish regularly you will say it is tasty and the best you have ever had. Eating at multiple restaurants gives you an idea of what an Asian meal should taste like. I am not Asian, but I am Jamaican and I can cook my soul out. However, I am somewhat disappointed with the customer service provided here because It was very poor. Perhaps because it is in a black neighborhood or perhaps we allow this mediocre behavior to be acceptable.

Moreover, the food is not all so tasty but their sweet and sour chicken is good which got them two stars. I have gotten the unprecedented opportunity to dine at divergent Chinese locations both on the west and Northside of the city and honestly, this restaurant is lacking and lagging behind. I have bought several times from them my usual sweet and sour chicken. Today, I wanted to change things up. However, today will be my last time patronizing them.  My shrimp in lobster sauce was horrible and the food was made in anger, not love. It was evident how they spoke to the customers. I know now moving forward I will spend my money where respect is delivered to their customers irrespective of one's skin color, environment or attitude.  07/11/2021

Wife ordered the chicken and broccoli and it was covered in slime zero taste and the food had a very weird bite to it. The fried rice was good, egg rolls tasted like they had been cooked and set aside for a very long time but I wouldn't recommend.

Simply spectacular. We had the buffet and one of each soup. Everything is delicious, beautiful, and high quality ESPECIALLY for the price. If you're in Chicago you must eat here! The service is very nice too with a cozy atmosphere.

Excellent buffet here with authentic, made from scratch - Ukrainian food. Everything we tried was delightful 😊 The service was very welcoming and quick. I highly recommend trying this place out. Street parking - was easy to find a spot.
We stopped here with our Ukrainian friend. He said it tasted like home! The borscht was amazing and the other buffet selections were authentic… plus, they had Ukrainian beer! This is a must stop!
Great buffet with a lot of good options.  One of my first times eating Ukrainian food, was not disappointed?m!  Though a bit overstuffed.

We had the weekend buffet and it was incredible. Absolutely more than worth the 20 dollar cost for the high quality and variety. Try the blini. And all the salads. They shine just as much as the borsch and other main dishes.

Checking in... Was on a diet and haven't ordered from here in over 6 months.. Very happy to report that the slices are still solid as ever (solid means that they taste good and they are big, not the best ever had) AND the soup was unfreakingbelievable as always.... Now I know how I initially gained so much weight after moving a block away a couple of years ago. Haters going to hate but all things weighed equal, for the money, this place is a solid choice.
Really the best thin crust in Buena Park...and yes, it is tastier than Michael's!

Ordered for pickup. It accepted my order online and charged my card, but when I walked there they were closed, and it was over an hour before their posted closing time.

Edit: Called and spoke with owner. Order was fulfilled at a later date.
Great Cajun pasta.. thin crust pizza wasn’t that good — too hard.

Placed an order for pickup today, during the hours that are posted on google and the website. Order went through and my card was charged, it didn’t state that they were closed anywhere. Got there and it was closed, I couldn’t see where on the door the updates hours are. This was the second time something like this has occurred.

Ok ok, another pizza pie. But this reminds me of east coast and a needed alternative to the typical Chicago deep-dish. The sausage is proprietary here, have to try. Also the pepperoni cusps up like true deal. She loves the Plain Jane but I am a fan of half pepperoni / half sausage. BYOB, there is a store a 2 blocks away (south). It's easier to park on the west/east one ways than Damon if before 6pm...!

Not bad at all. I am just visiting from Houston. My friend wanted to try this place out. We had the 18" Dolce Vita and added sausage. Not bad at all! I will say, I'm only going 4 stars because they are pretty sparse on the toppings. Ours was 95% cheese with some peppers and sausage sparesly spread around. But it's not a huge deal. I'd still say give this spot a try and see what you think!
Such a great find! Unpretentious place with great pizza, cozy atmosphere and super friendly staff. A must place to go when in Wicker Park, but definitely worth the trip.

Great quality 🍕that satisfies my soul🧘‍♂️- The missing star is because it’s a little salty past the first slice, but nothing major. The Tuesday special is amazing, and is my go-to in the neighborhood.

Great pizza, decent prices, and very friendly. The pizza is like the thin, bubbly stuff you find in Italy. They sell pizza by the slice early evening (call for times, I forget exact time) and it reheats well, unlike other places that I've had that do PBTS.

I would rate this as 4.3 stars.  The place has this really cool vibe with its rich dark wood interior and bar.  I also like the entrance-way that feels like its a “tucked - in” corner, though along a busy Wells Street straight-away.  I visited for brunch right when they opened.  I ordered the Mothers Little Helper which had creamy cheddar grits with pork belly and sausage.  The egg, though stated as fried, is actually over-hard.  The plate was very good, but I like my eggs over-easy, would add a nice silky texture on top of the slightly stiff but tasty grits.  The meats was salty, fatty and nicely pepper flavored.  The staff is very nice and friendly.  I will need to visit for dinner to try their main courses.  But overall, a very nice Old Town neighborhood staple.

The beer dinner I attended was worth every penny I spent on it.  The beers that were paired with each dish really complemented each other.  My favorites were the braised elk and the peanut butter cake which was SUPER RICH.  I hope they do this again soon 😋🥩🍰🍫🍽

Mid.
Burgers appear to use frozen patties but still taste fine. I wish there were more fries. Loud atmosphere, Woody interior.

3.5/5 nothing really interesting to see here.

I ordered the “Let it BLTE” sandwich for brunch and asked to have the bacon on the side for my sister since I don’t eat meat. Waiter said the cheesy potato casserole isn’t cooked with chicken broth either 🙂 All of the food was fresh and delicious! I ordered a taster size of the local cider, Blossom, which was pretty nice as well.

We had an absolutely fabulous time at Old Town Pour House yesterday, while we attended the art fests in the area. It was the perfect place to sit down, have a meal, and a few drinks.  The food was delicious, the service was stellar, and the atmosphere was super fun! Even though it was very busy, it didn't feel like it because of how well managed the place is. George took very good care of us and clearly has the place running like a well-oiled machine.  Can't wait to visit again. This will definitely be our go to every year for the fests.

We went there on a Saturday evening and the staff told us that it was a 5 minute wait. I thought it was funny and why not! There are valentine’s decor up and it’s so cute and romantic! I also really loved the twinkling fairy lights but I was sitting against them on the ledge of the window. It was not uncomfortable per se; it was just very narrow and inconvenient especially with all the big winter coats. They got a bit busy but the staff were still very friendly and service was great nevertheless.

We got the Takoyaki, Kameya Ramen (extra spice on the side), Kameya house roll, and Godzilla roll. The ramen was chewy and there was depth to the broth, pork belly was a little overcooked. The makisushi were delicious and the presentation was beautiful🌺 - each table had a different picture on their plate.

I also got pork gyoza and 911 salmon roll to-go. The gyoza was so yummy 🤤 (so was the salmon roll) even after I microwaved it a day later. The wrap was soft on the sides and crunchy on the bottom and the meat inside was not dry.

The bill wasn’t too bad for how much we ordered; it was ~$30 per person.

Absolutely loved the food at Kameya. I am a vegetarian and loved their veggie spring roles and avocado sushi was so fresh!!! I finally ordered Veggie gyoza ramen in miso broth, which was exceptional! The person, who served us was very polite and also played some k-pop songs as per my niece's request. This was overall a great experience and I highly recommend this gem of a ramen restaurant.
Everything was wonderful! The sushi was high quality and delicious. They were able to add a table outside for us which was great. Loved everything and service was excellent! Highly recommend!
Decent ramen,  good size portions.  My only complaint was that the ramen tasted like it had a little bit too much flour.

Definitely check your order before you leave.  Chicken is great, price and service not so much.  It's disappointing to make a special trip here only to return home only to be missing an important part of your dinner.    With the prices so high they should really make an effort to get your order correct.  Ruined a special family meal.

Very happy we found this place on our trip. So many places in the area its hard to figure out which ones are worth going to and which aren't. Houlihan's has a very comfortable feel inside, lots of local brews on tap, and some very good food. So good we decided to go back the next morning and have their breakfast buffet. Was a great way to start the day and less than $10 to boot.

If it is your first time here, start your meal out with an order of the disco fries. They are like a new twist on the Canadian Poutine. If you check-in on foursquare and show the waitress your phone, you can get the Disco Fries for free (check the specials). The service isn't bad but try to hit Houlihan's up around 2-3p.m. as it seems to not be as busy then. Definitely worth the cost.

I placed an order for pick up and the young lady that answered the phone forgot the name of the restaurant. Apparently she is new and didn't know the menu and placed me on hold a couple of times to find out what I substitute options I had for my side dish and what soups they had for the day.  All things that I can oversee because she is new and still learning.  When I went to pick up my food I was asked by the waiter if I wanted 1/2 a wrap or a whole wrap and asked me what I wanted to sub the chips that comes with the wrap. It seems that my order was not taken correctly and the waiter apologized and told me that the young lady that took my order was new.  I finally got my food and when I opened it, I did not get the side of chipotle mayo that I asked for but the restaurant surely made sure to charge me for it. The green beans that came with my food were in a little plastic bag labeled Saturday which I am assuming is the bag they microwave them in which was touching the chicken wrap. The soup had 1 measly piece of chicken in it.  And the side of cheese with tortilla chips smelled as though the cheese was old and sour. I order from Houhilans often and today the food was horrible for over 18$ it was certainly not worth it.  McDonald's would have been way better then this........It grossed me out.

I ordered a stake wedge salad to go. I am extremely disappointed by what I got. It is so hard to screw a wedge salad up , because there is nothing to it but it was completely messed up. The stake was not cooked it was put in a small box with asparagus which were not fititing in the box properly so they were sticking out of the box and all of the Stake juice was leaked out from the box openings. My wedge cabbage was not washed thoroughly. I took a bite and I felt something Stoney, it was sand from the cabbage. I had to throw the entire thing to the trash at home. I am a student and had to pay 17$ for that salad, plus I tipped 4$. I literally threw the money I don’t have to the trash !  I will never go back again. And I definitely do not recommend the place!

For the traveler looking for a cheap and well prepared breakfast buffet - there is no better place that Houlihan's.  For just 10 dollars, you have a well prepared breakfast that will leave you full and ready to go about your day.  While nothing is particularly amazing, the service is kind and courteous and they have many of the staple breakfast items to enjoy.

Some people come to Chicago for the deep dish, but that monstrosity is a weird pasta dish if you ask me. Real Chicago pizza is Guerrero’s. Perfectly sized crust, ample amount of sauce, and enough cheese to satisfy without a cheese overload. Mmm mmm. This joint also has burritos, but I’m all about that succulent and savory ‘za.
Pizza was ready in 25 minutes! The cheese was really thick and filling. Large served two adults and we had leftovers.

Good pizza. It can get a bit crowded in there. The speciality is pizza slices, which are good value for money. Though pizza slices are usually ready, sides might take a little wait time. The full pizzas are quite large - even the small sized thin crust is enough for 2 people.
Fire steak tacos$4/each worth it . and good pizza slices $3/
Best small business in the area. Tasty food at reasonable prices.

I was so excited to finally try this vegan place, & the nachos sure did not disappoint! They were amazing, just everything about them was perfect, tasted like pretty authentic Mexican nachos. I give it four stars because the mac & cheese was just not good at all. The consistency is good, but the taste is just not there what so ever. It was too salty and in a way a bit bitter?? Was disappointed because I was really excited to try it!
They have vegan croissants! I got the breakfast croissant sandwich and cheesy broccoli, both were great. My coworker got the bacon ranch cheeseburger which they enjoyed

Absolutely love this place, BUT I just got the Togarashi bowl and it was in a much smaller container at the same price, and went to plain rice instead of the purple rice like before. So I was bummed about that. Really took a step back on their best item (in my opinion) on an already limited menu. Much love to this place though, I will of course still be a customer, just wish they'd scale back the price as well...
The food was amazing! Best vegan food spot I've been to in a long time. Definitely a hidden gem that deserves recognition.

I love this place! The food is yummy, especially for being vegan. I'm addicted to their chocolate, sunflower seed cookies. I also tried the chocolate cream donut. It was good. I personally am not crazy about whipped cream, but it was still tasty. I also like the people there. Very nice and positive vibe.

Nice spot in the loop for quality thin crust pizza.  Pizza is good but not great, the dough was lacking any flavor.  Atmosphere and service are great.  I like that they offer wine pairings for everything on the menu and the server is more then happy to explain why.  I wish they had a few more vegetarian options.

This was a nice sport in a convenient location. I awaited my friends at the bar where service was friendly. They have a weekly wine special, which I ordered and it was nice. They were honest about recommendations between menu items. We were then seated. I had a  butter lettuce salad that was very good and I ordered a white pizza (shaved artichoke). Unfortunately they do not have chili oil, which I discovered in Italy and love on my pizza, but they were kind enough to bring out olive oil and crushed red pepper, which was thoughtful (usually restaurants just bring out the pepper without thinking to bring olive oil).  Ambiance was nice and not too loud. We had difficulty getting a reservation on a Saturday night but were ankle to secure a Sunday night table.

Amazing pizza and salads. Its good for 2 people or with a group. I have hosted a work event in their semi-private room and it was awesome. The staff was attentive and helpful in picking out the right amount of food. I tend to crave the 3 hour aged grape pizza. Great spot.

I honestly cannot believe I didn't find out about La Madia until recently.  They make some amazing Italian dishes without the flow of grease that you often get in Italian dishes at non-top-notch locales.

Ambience: Classy but casual - you can sit at the pizza counter or the dining room.

Service:  Our server was so attentive until after he served our dishes.  Then he kind of disappeared, and we had to wait and wait... and wait... and wait....... to get a box and the check.

Food:  What a lovely surprise of fresh and tasty Italian food!  The pizzas are a must have, and you should definitely try one of their pastas!

Probably my favorite place for sit-down pizza in the city.

My two favorites have to be the seasoned wild mushroom with smoked mozzarella and the triple pepperoni.   But I have yet to have any I haven't loved right down to the roasted grapes.

Great wines and salads to make your meal complete!
Just learned about granddaddy's on this Google restaurant location. I had a salad, wow !!! Delicious.  I can imagine what there foods taste like mmmm......... Hell good
The food is ok but it could be better  like more veggie on the sub.
Hands down the very best sandwich I have ever had!!
The Philly Cheese Steak is to die for.
Very good

This is my 2nd time ordering from Thai Lagoon. I prefer the sweetened "crisps/glaze" that coats lightly atop of the wide noodles. I really enjoy the taste.  The gyoza is crisp as they seem fried. As for the Miso soup it's a perfect comfort soup if you wish to keep it simple. The tofu isn't tough and is the perfect texture. I do plan on trying other dishes in the near future. The price isn't outstanding and the amount of food given is generous.
Delicious meal! Glad we tried this gem! Will be ordering takeout and pickup when not being able to dine in. Waitress is attentive and kind. Their crab Rangoons wont disappoint !

It’s the best Thai place in the neighborhood. We had the satay chicken, the Penang curry, and the mixed vegetables with beef. All three were good - perfectly savory with the right blend of Thai flavors. Nearby tables also ordered the pad Thai (which is popular) and the Thai iced tea. This place is BYOB so perfect for an affordable date. Just remember to tip kindly!

Basil chicken was very watery, almost like soup. Tom yum soup was very lacking, basically just mushrooms and a couple shrimp. Broccoli beef was too sweet and also somehow very soupy (like the basil chicken)

Pad Thai and paseeew was fine, but they gave me chicken instead of beef, whatever.

Great food but over the years it looks like their chef or recipes have become very simple. Used to LOVE ordering their Curry Fried Rice with family all the time.

We would ask for low or mild spice because the heat can really hide the overall flavor and they would accommodate fully. Post pandemic they can no longer accommodate a heat request. Unfortunately will be ordering from here less often, but if your taste buds can withstand the heat go for it.

Best Japanese experience!! It’s not just sushi it’s an experience you have to try. Menus are hard to understand, but you can’t go wrong with any of the choices. Everything was deliciously fresh!! Flavors and fish are so unique, you won’t regret it. In fact, you will want to come back for the FULL experience. FYI asparagus pudding was to die for!

Chef Chan knows his sushi and Japanese whiskey.  If you want to impress anyone visiting from Japan, take them here.  Good sushi and whiskey is meant to be expensive.  Don't let the prices scare you away.

Came here for Valentine’s Day. We had a reservation for 8:30 and were told they could not seat us because the kitchen was running behind. We were told 30 minute wait, then 10 minutes. However it did end up becoming a 30 minute wait. There were 10 people (5 couples) standing around in a very tight space waiting to be seated. We tried to order from the bar and server just straight up refused to take an order because “we are so busy, we just can’t). We were told the manager will come speak to us but they never did.

What a disappointment. Not the frontline staff’s fault, but an event that was meant to be special was completely ruined by management’s lack of foresight.

Fantastic sushi. The curated meals are done really well and forces you to try things you wouldn't necessarily try but really should.

A bit on the pricey side. Dinner for two can easily run $300.
Best sushi in Chicago. Both authentic and contemporary,  innovative at the same time.

I stopped in to try something different than the pizza, so I had the meatball sandwich, which was excellent. Big sandwich with a fresh tasty baked roll and 3 large meatballs, with plenty cheese on top.
The small salad included was perfect.
The restaurant was very clean as was the restroom, and hand sanitizer available.
Highly recommend if you are just in the mood for a sandwich.

OMG. The crust is AMAZING. we ordered the individual deep dish, garlic cheese bread and endless coke. The servers are friendly and very helpful in terms of ordering for the food

I have a small appetite so i was done in 1 and a half slice of the Individual deep dish pizza. But everything was AMAZING and did i mention about how good the crust is!! 😋!!

This was my first time in Chicago, and the family wanted to get some Chicago's style pizza. Since we were going to the Field Museum, Giordano's was close by. I will have to say, this place does not disappoint. The flavor and cook of the pizza was fantastic. Our server was also great. He had some jokes and we played along and returned some of our own. Eating here was the highlight of my Chicago trip. I wish this place was closer. Fortunately, they do deliver to other states! Delicious pizza served through serious delivery.

My first deep dish pizza and it was definitely worth the wait! It was delicious! Deep dish pizza takes about 45 min to make from when you order. The staff was so friendly and amazing! I am exited to come back!

Everyone’s heard of the Chicago deep pan style pizza. If so and it’s on your list, get yourself down to Giordano’s. There’s a few dotted around downtown Chicago, but I prefer this one since it’s not as busy as the others. Pizza was great and the meatball’s sub was excellent! Fully recommend. Not that the deep pan pizzas take 45 mins to prepare and a small one is enough for a single diner.

Great pastries - we loved the poached cherry elderflower tart. The chocolate croissant was one of the flakiest croissants we've ever had.

We showed up at 9:30am on a Saturday and the line was short so no need to order ahead of you want to see the pastries and make a game time decision. Most seating outdoors was taken but there's lots of seating inside.

Nice staff. Good selection of beverages including bottled juices and sparkling stuff. Super cool that they serve as a pickup hub for farmer deliveries.

What an incredible hidden gem! The store smells amazing, and though none of the baked goods are kosher, they looked divine! The coffee was great, and everyone working there was warm and lovely to interact with. I'd come back!

Don’t be scared by the limited menu - what’s there is sooooo good! Honestly, you can’t go wrong with anything baked, and that includes their granola. My favorite? Basque cake. Moist and crumbly and crunchy all in one cake, with a bonus custard center. Drool central. They even have vegan options and different fancy tart each week. On top of that, the staff is super friendly, and the street is quiet, which together combine for a lovely atmosphere.

This is an exceptional bakery! They accommodated my request for a Pavlova which is not currently on the menu.It was absolutely gorgeous and so delicious! Would highly recommend this place- I definitely will be going here again!

I have eaten a lot of croissants and I’m pretty sure this is the best ham and cheese and almond chocolate croissant in the city. Show up at 8 when they open and they are still warm and flakey in your mouth.

I’m picking up items at these type of restaurants they don’t understand drivers are independent it’s not their job to see if drivers are delivering food. That’s the app job and when they tell you to confirm the order trying to say you work for me which I don’t and we bring a big lawsuit against people that dude, especially JJ fish certain stores that’s trying to control drivers they’ll understand then when we take them to court and ask for P
The chicken pita is amazing. All the sides are great. Everything is so fresh. Like good home-cooked food should be! Love this place.

The chicken is delicious. Food is priced very well. You get a lot of food for a great price. I got the three piece dark meat platter w/ two sides and pita bread and it was about $9. Enough food to leave you stuffed. Chicken is juicy and comes out hot and fresh. The mashed potatoes were great and so was the Mac n cheese. Several different types of sauces to choose from; most of which were great. The place is relatively small. Street parking only. I would recommend this spot.

Excellent food, decent prices. Definitely knocks Boston Market like places out the box and waaaaay cheaper. Clean and friendly atmosphere.
Cashier was sweet as pie, nice young man. Thank you.
Stay safe.
This is the best chicken restaurant in the whole world. I dream about their mac and cheese. I live in a different state, and every time I come back to Chicago, I have to eat here.

Another "not my first time here, but first Google Review" for this place! One of Chicago's top Ramen spots for me! Definitely get their early! This underground spot has great ambience and jams, with 16-seats, reminiscent of Japanese taverns. Review here is on Saturday late afternoon after St Paddy's Day Parade and Chicago River dyeing. First in line at 305pm! Would rather wait in line before opening versus waiting in line after opening. Definitely get one of their bowls beginning at half spice. I typically get their Shoyu. Their Slushies are delicious but so are their selection of Sake. Can't wait for next visit!

First off, the wait to eat here is crazy!! But once we got down there it made a lot of sense because the sitting area is super small and intimate. The service was spectacular and we even got free shots after our meal. The ramen was delicious but definitely spicer than I thought! The overall experience was super fun and I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting or local to Chicago.

I liked that this place feels very exclusive. The vibe is cool and the food tastes delicious! I wish they took reservations because the wait time on a Thursday night is 1 hour. After that, the ramen is more on the pricier side than other ramens in the area. I would have given 5 stars if it wasn't for wait and price.

I heard about this place from a couple of friends and they talked highly of this place but I tried it out and unfortunately our experience were disappointing. We waited a long time to be seated. It’s a fun small space in the basement of green street smoked meats with speakeasy vibes. Atmosphere is dark and everyone was friendly. After a long wait, we both ordered Tonkotsu and asked for mild level of spicy. The server warned us about the spice and we thought mild would be okay but it was not haha. We really gave it a good try but can’t get past three bites. There was a fragrance of garlic but it was too salty to taste other flavor. Broth is surely thick like tonkotsu should, maybe the nonspicy version would be better. Egg was made perfectly. Chasu is delicious but it be better combined with less salty broth. At the end of the meal, they gave nice towel and green tea candy (which end up being the best part of the meal).

Some of the best ramen I’ve ever had, even including Japan.

This ramen den sits in the basement of Green Street Meats in a cozy, bar-style layout with very limited seats. More likely than not, you’ll need to put yourself on a waiting list, and you can’t call ahead or make reservations. I promise, it’s worth it.

The moody lighting and eclectic atmosphere sets the tone for a pretty stellar meal. Grab a painkiller and drink out of a stone skull while you wait for your tasty noods.

I’ve had the tonkotsu twice and swear by it. So good. The broth is deep and rich, the noodles are just firm enough, and the full spice is perfect. You can adjust the spice level to suit your preference at half, quarter, or none (mild).

I would literally fly back to Chicago just for this ramen.

Melt in your mouth rib tips, premium ingredients and generous portions add up to a great experience at Muchies Gyros & Pizza.  Nice folks behind the counter will make certain you are happy with your order.  Go Muchies !!
I love their food it's sooo good..very delicious!! 5 forks up very clean in the restaurant!! Smells so clean great service!!

Accommodated my request for 1/2 chicken 1/2 regular gyro plate. Very welcoming and clean establishment with fast courteous service.
Visited after work today and got a giant gyro sandwich, ate half and was full. Looks like a have lunch tomorrow. Awesome service and portions, worth the money for sure.
Solid munchies! Well priced, quality service, good food.
I sometimes come here for gyros after climbing at Avondale. If you're hungry looking for a cheap and heavy hit of carbs / fat / salt, then I highly recommend.

I enjoyed this restaurant.  It took me right back to the small mom and pop restaurant business in Korea.  All the staff was super friendly and welcoming.  I hadn't had Korean food for awhile, so this experience was right on time.

Went for galbi and was not disappointed! Woo Chon is on the more expensive side but it tasted great! Ordered two servings for two, and it was a good amount for us - since we had also ordered cold noodles and bibimbap. It didn't seem too busy when we arrived so service was quick! Will definitely visit this place again!
Good. A bit expensive. We got 2 appetizers and 3 BBQs for 5 people. Plus, 18% tip is added if party of 5 and more. It came up to around 60 bucks a person.

The prices were more than they were online. The service was also a little lackluster. Another server that wasn't the one taking care of us came over and thought we'd want out chicken more cooked, so she burnt them. My wife, who wanted the chicken, was very upset it was burnt to bits by someone who wasn't even taking care of us.

The food was good but we probably won't be back.

This is what authentic Korean food should taste like in Chicago, healthy, organic, fresh, and a well-balanced meal of entrees served with freshly made vegetarian side dishes.

The Korean Naengmyun, a summer dish, is garnished with fresh ingredients, and the contrast between the chewy noodles and cold broth was quite refreshing.  The overall service was good with side dishes being refilled when requested.
Very nice service, terrible bagel. That’s the everything bagel I ordered yesterday but couldn’t eat so put it in my fridge until I got hungry enough for a dry, stale, everythingless bagel.

Ordered a small shake via the drive thru. The menu board says $5.99. I get my receipt which says $6.79. When I asked the staff about the discrepancy, the answer was “oh yeah, the manager raised the prices.” When I commented the menu board was inaccurate they just said “yeah.” Then my $7 shake (after tax)was a huge glass of milk with less than a scoop of ice cream blended in. All I could taste was the milk.

The manager there is very rude and disrespectful! she literally yelled at her employees in front of the customers. The service isn't good at all. Many time they have been out of certain items which doesn't make sense why they would be out so many times. Ever since the last 2 red shirt supervisor left, the store has gone downhill badly. Who ever the owners are, they need to fix this problem ASAP

Drinks are great, but be careful at this location. They charged me 1000% (yes, 1000%) more than they should have when I've gone there. I reached out to customer service and they did not help. Please double check your app after you pay so this doesn't happen to you.

Top of the line employees, trainees should have more time
Only my observation but that's what I do, I  consult on store environments haven't meant owner...its managed well, and pretty quick on busy days no drive in and under staffed at times..the crew early or late afternoon work well together...

So again I enjoy my interactions
But critique a little to much
I highly recommend this place over any fast food chains. Affordable and better quality. Tasteful burger. No complaints. I'll be going back.
As always, the fish tacos are the best! If you can, try to eat there for the best texture when it’s still crispy

In my honest opinion, the tacos are good nd thats about it! Burrito suizo the al pastor was salty and the sauce tasted like a marinara! Cermak burger is basic and the gyro is one of the worst ones I've had, meat was burnt!  Ill stick to the tacos and thats about it!

Chicago hot dog taste different from the other Chicago hot dog. The bun was a different bun and miss two 🌶. Replace for two pickles. The hot dog was ok. The Cermak burger was good. It is just a normal burger with the sliced ham and mozzarella cheese and bacon. Gave it a much more taste to the burger. Also I want to said thank you for the fries. Even though I order just the Cermak burger and chicago dog. I enjoy your food

Order grilled chicken chipotle with fries , chicken was so bland no seasoning and hard. Fries was salty and limp. Gyro meal was purchase for someone else didn't taste like gyro even my dog didn't want to continue to eat it.

Finally found authentic pizza that has homemade sausage, the freshest cheese and great sauce & perfect crust.  Had many pizzas and so called Italian food, this is far the best. Italian beef melts in your mouth , and the bread its served on, I can eat just plain, not to mention the appetizers, mmmm. The best hospitality from Dennis , we love your place. Thank you for all your hard work.

We moved to the neighborhood a few months after the initial shutdown of 2020. The first time I drove by, the sign caught my eye and I knew it was a place I had to try. We ordered delivery not long after and it immediately became our main source of pizza. Tonight, instead of delivery, I stopped in to pick it up. The old school charm is real. I think the owner was who greeted us and he was a super friendly guy. I can’t wait to dine in with my whole family.

Old school charm when dining in. Was taken care of by the owner, Dennis who was great to have a conversation with. Had the thin crust pizza, which was excellent. Everything is made fresh and worth every penny. It’s no wonder they’ve been in business for 70 years.

Such a cozy spot! My girlfriend and I came by Frank’s for a low key date night and left very happy with our decision. The thin crust was terrific and our waitress Sharon was incredibly sweet. We loved the old school vibe and enclosed booths. As we’re now locals, we’ll definitely be back.

The definitive Chicago style thin crust pizza. Speedy delivery. Still has the original neon sign with a phone number that includes letters. As good now as it undoubtedly was during my granddad's time when it first opened because it has been around this long for good reason. Get yourself a cannoli for dessert.
The waitstaff was very professional, attentive to any needs.  The food was aesthetically pleasant and tasted great.  Pricey and an auto 20% gratuity is the only detractors in my view.

We ordered the 676 Burger, Chicken Calzone, and Pepperoni Pizza. Everything was delicious and the crust on the pizza and calzone was crispy, chewy, flavorful goodness. Our server Dena really made our experience 20/10! She was personable, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu. Our drinks were never empty and the food arrived quickly. I definately suggest dinner at 676 Restaurant & Bar!

Upscale.  Friendly and casual in a very high end sort of way.  Everything seems to be done exceedingly well but at the same time it is not a fancy place.  For example, the pizza and beer  I ordered were both really nicely done (service, presentation, quality etc) even though pizza and beer is not exactly fancy.  Same with other orders like coffee or matcha (okay maybe matcha is fancy, haha) always done really well.  I think my favorite thing was how easy they made it all feel.

Classy, quiet space for a good drink and nibbles. My chai infused Old Fashioned was perfectly balanced, my partner was happy with his Espresso Martini. Only thing letting it down was the breads on the charcuterie were on the stake side. I get it, things are kinda slow so stock may not be turning over as quickly. Still a delicious bite.
The food was alright. I wouldn't say I loved it but I wouldn’t say I hated it. Overall it was expensive so I’m not sure I would return, but the meatballs were pretty good.

Where to even start.  Best meal and dining experience I've had in years.  First of all, 2 ladies stopped by with freshly-made margaritas and man oh man were they fantastic.
The service was impeccable - 0 missteps. The food was indescribably amazing.  So many flavors and everything was beautifully cooked and beautifully presented.

Not quite Mexican, not quite latin but this place should definitely be in your plans.

Two thumbs up. We were a table of 3, ordered 7 items and was served and out the door in 40 minutes in a Saturday night at 6:45pm. That was incredible service. This place was very lively and loud. A bit upscale so avoid jeans or shorts. I did not see kids inside but saw a family outside with the kids eating Mac and Cheese. My favorite was the mango guacamole as well as the spicy sweet corn. Dishes are moderately sized. I suggest getting a variety of items and sharing. Plenty of veg options.

Delicious food. A Mexican food restaurant but with a new style. Drinks were incredible! Definitely will come back. During the weekends try to get a reservation if you're planning to go here.
The service from the waiters could be better though.

I would give 5 for the food.They have delicious mouth watering tacos, drinks, and other food here.
The service I would give 3 to 2 stars only.
We dined in a party of 9, 3 of us had to squeezed in one very small table despite of our tons of orders. I kept asking our waitress for a table or a chair atleast for the 3rd person and she kept saying no! There are vacant chairs and tables around.The waitress was also strict where our friend will put his coat. So we had our friend sat awkwardly in the long chair and put his coal behind my already small chair.. it just felt weird and not right. We just decided to ignore it and enjoy our night. I just have this need of leaving an honest review about it so it won't happen again, and management would teach their waitress not to treat people like they are in the canteen or in just a cheap restaurant, because The restaurants was in a great location and offers delicious food, it has potential to look classy. Just do something about the attitude of the staff so it will radiate classy atmosphere.
I am only posting photos of the food and drinks that what I had, not including the food and drinks of the rest of our party.

June 9, 2022- we ate here because we love the food and it didn't disappoint us. The service was nice and fast. We were seated outside so we are comfortable, it looks like they gave enough spaces between tables inside of the restaurants. Our food attendants was nice. Changed 4 to 5 stars.

Some of the best tacos I’ve ever had! The steak tacos get a 10/10 from me. The chicken and fish tacos were also delicious. The chips & mango guacamole were incredible. Mercadito is officially on my favorites list.

The chicken tacos were absolutely amazing. The prices were worth it because the quality is so good. If you are going to drink happy hour is the way to go! The strawberry margaritas were so good too.

The only issues we had was the server couldn’t get our bill right and had to void 2 separate transactions. It was honestly a little chaotic. But because of how good the food is I still give this review 5 stars otherwise it’d be 4.

The covid experience here was good. We were seated outside. But the outside atmosphere was friendly.The service was timely. The food tasted good and the margaritas were tasty as well. The only problem was that the elotes tasted a little weird ( kinda like coleslaw) and were not able to get seperate checks.

We had so much fun at Blue Agave. That's why this was one of our favorite go to places around Chicago. My favorite was their salsa and nachos (free appetizer) when you ordered drinks. They have a very good margarita. The Enchiladas was our favorite and the skirt steak! We ordered Tres tacos , Enchiladas, Taquitos, chicken tortilla soup. They're all delicious! Our waiter Fernando was very nice too. We had a very Fun night! Thank you!
Decent place. Nice clean interior.  The chips and queso were nothing special, but the salsa was excellent!!!  Very chunky.  I did not eat a main course, so cannot comment on the food.
Great traditional Mexican food served in upbeat ambiance. I had shrimp send in molcajete bowl. It had cheese that was ooey, gooey and so yummy!

With great views & reasonably priced food, you really should eat here every time you visit the Museum of Contemporary Art.  Some people come here for the food, not the art.  They will be having a new menu for the David Bowie exhibit that looks really interesting!  #CityExperts @GoogleLocalCHI
Plated presentations are often more attractive than the art on the walls! Great service and I love the open space!

Yes Starbucks! I love this one! Spacious and pretty. I love the walls and layout... just a great vibe overall. Great baristas who get your coffee right on the money! I also loved that I could buy replacement straws for my at home Starbucks cups! My order had a couple specifications and came out so good. It was not too busy and we were able to get work done here too and it was a great way to start the work day before heading in. Thanks for the experience and keeping this store so FREAKING CLEAN! (: plenty of cool cups to buy if you want - they do have the IL "been there series" cups as well

This Starbucks location is one of the best in the Old Town/Lincoln Park area of Chicago. It is a large space providing lots of seating and places eat and talk with people. The service is very good and the store itself is very clean. I go here often and it has never failed me. I highly recommend anyone to visit this Starbucks location.

I absolutely love Starbucks at Pipers Alley! I love the Baristas. They are so nice. Michael is so sweet and polite. The young gal with the coolest eyelashes is wonderful. (sorry i don't know your name) Always a pleasure having my coffee there, if it's a frap, or a hot mocha. Always done to perfection. You all put so much love in your drinks. You all just made my morning so perfect! I love you all. Bright Blessings.

-100000 stars if possible.
Extremely rude staff. The staff even skipped my order; hence, I got it only after I asked to another staff. Come to this place if you want to feel disrespected. I have never experienced this, and even make me write a review.
Excellent experience and offers unique Starbucks gifts.  They follow COvid restrictions so you need immunization card and ID.

1st time there. Reserved a table easily. Great service, atmosphere, MUSIC, various sports playing, & food. Peanut butter jelly shot was awesome! Definitely making this a spot to visit throughout the summer!
Went on a Sunday afternoon. Staff was very kind drink specials were great and food was delicious with huge portions. It’s right off the train station. 10/10 would recommend
I love the vibe of this place and I found that they had excellent food at low prices. I sat outside and enjoyed a football game on the outdoor TV. Super nice staff and overall great place!
$5 burger night at Waterhouse is a must on Mondays. Rob and Molly are a fantastic duo. Great service and delicious food. If you haven’t been here yet for a Monday night you’re missing out!

Wife and I went in on a Saturday afternoon, and we're pleasantly surprised. There were tons of vegetarian options and the drinks were fantastic. Definitely would go back to visit, but the only downside is that it is a Purdue bar. Go Hoosiers!
First time there. Great atmosphere, friendly patrons, and super cool bartender. Very inviting and cozy spot. Great for a group of friends to chill after work.
Excellent food, chill place to hang out and secret back porch great for warm nights to hangout

Nice bar on the Chicago vicinity, they serve very nice wings and fries and the coldest beer. Ask for Rambo, the best bar tender of the house. Simply and nice. Prices are very good so you will not go out all broke. So join them and enjoy your self.
Nice quiet little spot with fantastic food and drinks! Phenomenal pierogis!
Best place if you love to stay to your self and enjoy your drinks and food

I've been coming to Hong Kong for the past 7 and Half years and let me tell you, they do not disappoint you at all. Their portion size of food you most definitely get your money's worth. The staff is way beyond helpful and friendly. Ready to assist you in anyway possible.  Higley recommend this spot.

Hong Kong Restaurant was such a nice surprise! To be honest, I'd tried going to two other Chinese restaurants before I happened to drive past this place. Both of the other restaurants were closed, even though their posted hours said they should be open. Frustrated, I decided to just go home when I stumbled upon Hong Kong. After making *sure* they were, in fact, open, I parked my car and stepped inside.

It's fairly small with a fast food/walk up counter vibe so I wasn't sure what to expect but nothing ventured, nothing gained, so I ordered my usual: crab rangoon and szechuan chicken. Since white rice was the only option with my meal, I also requested a small order of chicken fried rice. Oh, and I had one can of coke.

Within minutes, my rangoons appeared, deliciously hot, crispy, and full of flavour. A short while later, after asking if I was ready, my main course came out. It. Was. Huge!! And really good! The sauce with the chicken was a little thicker than I like but it still tasted good. The fried rice was perfect.

I was only able to eat 1/4 of what I'd ordered! My bill came out to about $30 - a very fair price, especially considering how how much food I got. I literally have enough food for another 3 meals! I've added Hong Kong Restaurant to my list of go-to places for Chinese food in the city!

This is my go-to Chinese take out place.  Awesome food at such a great price.  Staff is always soo nice and the food comes out quick and piping hot.  My favorite dish is the salt and pepper fish, I highly recommend it!!
Quick, inexpensive and good takeout.  Lunch specials are my go to. If you're in the mood for the standard wok fried takeout this place will do you just fine. Eggrolls always crispy
Great takeout, great prices. Although double check the time it closes because on maps it told me 10pm but they actually closed at 930pm!

Went out to eat with my family only to receive terrible service and food.
Starting with the food, we ordered ribs and pasta. When the food arrived there was an awful smell to it but ignored it and decided to try the food anyways. The ribs were hard and had a green tint to it, topped with a sauce but really tasted like a sauce that was watered down to just being water and some color. We tired to get past that and ate two, but couldn't take down any more. It really was that awful. The meatballs and pasta were even worse. My kids couldn't even take down a bite.
I went up to the service counter to let her know that the food wasn't that good and only to be told that I had no idea what I was talking about. And this is putting it Nicely.
I asked for a refund and was only given a very small partial refund because we ate the coleslaw( the only semi edible thing) and touched the ribs.
As a customer I felt completely disrespected. The least they could've done was given us a full refund but  they couldn't even do that!
Never coming back. Never recommending. And should really up their customer service game.

Ordered a full rack of beef ribs, corn on the cob, pasta salad and a loaded baked potato. The ribs were more sauce and bones than meat and the meat was tough, corn was chewy, macaroni salad blah, loaded potato was generously loaded with cheese sauce and bacon but a really expected real cheese, not cheese sauce on a $7 potato. We ordered through Grubhub, being out of towners wish we had checked the reviews, meal was $37 with delivery fee and tip. So disappointed, I was looking to treat my husband who is in the hospital. I called the manager to share my disappointment rather than leave a bad review but she was unreceptive.

Ordered online, and was very disappointed.  They say they sell ribs, but it's only short ribs or rib tips...doesn't say that on the menu.  Ordered ribs and got fatty short ribs instead, and they weren't interested that their menu was misleading.

I don't know what their decor was like, but this review page forces me to make a selection, and N/A isn't an option.
Im not a fan of pizza but my little guy loves this place and I love the ribs so it works out :D
Best Italian beef in town. I drove from Westmont Illinois for one. 45 miles

We love this place and have been coming here for 5+ years. on days where we don't feel like cooking, this is our go-to. All of their food is fresh and delicious. I love the way their dishes are always hot and makes you want to dive right in! The quality of the vegetables is amazing and the proteins are extremely tasty. We tend to order the egg rolls, wings, orange chicken, lo mein noodles (get them spicy sooo good!) & pepper steak. Choose this place often!!!

I ordered a small shrimp fried rice with extra egg and shrimp. $3.00 extra. It was  extra shrimp was at the top of the container, but hardly none in the middle or bottom. I had to stir around looking for some shrimp. I called and told the young girl 👧 who answered the phone and took the order. She said look 👀 it should be some at the bottom. I said no. I can count on my hand how many shrimp were in there. Maybe they need to mix it together better . Taste was good. They did call me while I was writing this review , apologized

I ordered combination fried rice with ham instead of beef. This around 1:30pm 4/14. The bits of shrimp( tiny) chicken ( slithers like nail clippings) and ham ( the size of a tictac) were all at the top and not mixed in. The quantity was laughable... maybe a quarter cup of meat for a large container of fried rice. This place is a joke!!! Find another place. Don't waste your money!!! I would give zero stars.

if i could give this place 0 stars, i would.  my dad went here today for lunch and asked for beef fried rice, they asked if he wanted combination or shrimp fried rice; he said no because he's allergic and to please please please put NO shrimp in his rice. they said ok but when he got his order and started eating it, he started to cough and felt his throat start to feel tight. he combed through his rice and found small cut up pieces of shrimp. he didnt have an epipen on him and the person he was with had to race to the closest walgreens to buy one and inject him. now not only will we NEVER eat here again, he will never eat chinese food again because he is scared of something like this happening to him again. who knows who else they've done this to. also i am going to keep posting my review where ever is available because people need to know .
Very tasty food, reasonable prices & they have lunch specials as well, I have never been dissapointed, I usually get their beef and shrimp dishes. 10/10!!!

How I found this place is still a mystery to me - even to this day. After driving around in circles for what seemed like days, my friend and I finally spotted this Roly Poly which was tucked away in the side of a building down a narrow alley. We thought we were going mad looking for the address, but were relieved to find it. So in a state of frustration and Groupon in hand, we made our way in.

Not surprised, the place was empty like a total ghost town. I didn't mind though; no lines for us! We made our way in the counter and I noticed that the place is waaay understaffed granted I don't think people are coming in flocks because the location is so hidden - there was about one cook and one cashier and another person standing around. The Groupon iss such an amazing deal - you get 5 full sandwiches with five sides, which consist of chips, cookie, potato salad or pasta salad, as well as your choice of drink (fountain drinks or bottled).

The menu is HUGE so make sure you look at it online before you come in. We chose to try the pesto chicken, buffalo slim, key west cuban, oriental chicken, and chipotle chicken sandwiches. The standout was definitely the pesto chicken sandwich with large chunks of chicken, provolone cheese, mushrooms, and sundried tomatoes. The other sandwiches were alright. Avoid the oriental chicken sandwich - super watery and bland.

For the sides, we chose potato salad. In hindsight, we should've just chosen cookies and chips because the mustard in the mayo based sauce was too overpowering. As we were dining, there were loads of people coming in and it got a bit hectic so they should defs hire more people to man the front of house. Other than that, there's parking, but it's tricky cause it's downtown and there's free wifi as well! Am I rushing to go back - NO. But, if I were to purchase another Groupon, I could see myself going again. Especially because now, I know where this hidden (literally) eatery is.
Pretty good options here.  It usually takes about 10 minutes to get warm wraps.

I definitely recommend this place! The deserts are great and so is the steak. The service is pretty good, but it sucks that you have to wait like 45 minutes sometimes. They definitely need to expand or hire more waiters. Overall, it's good food for a fair price.

We were seated right away and our server was very friendly.
Something to note though, was that it took a long time for our drinks to come out. My grandmother had ordered a coffee and when it came out, it was kind of cold and was really weak. The waitress fixed that with a brand new hot cup of coffee so all was well.
I ordered the spicy shrimp tacos and they were very good!
BTW, you can pay at the table...how bitchin is that?

I just came chili's on 2 E Ontario and it was a really good experience until I got home to see that they over charged my card. My bill was 75. 39 me and my best friend split the check they charged her 38.17 and charged my card 44.66. When I called the restaurants the server tried to tell me I was mistaken and he never charged my card 44.66 then some random lady got on the phone tried to argue with me about what I was seeing in my account. Horrible I will never return to this location only to get my money back.

I am usually pretty happy with the service and food at this Chili's location. I probably visit this Chili's about once a month. My most recent visit, I was given an entree with undercooked beef and was told by my waitress that it would continue to cook while on my plate. This of course was false and I had her send it back to finish cooking the meat.
Be sure you check in on 4 Square when visiting to unlock special promotions (free chips and salsa, free desserts...)

Best burgers ive had so far. When i go in there i would get seated quick. They have fast service. There hospitality is great and it feels like they enjoy having there costumers. Thinking about the burgers are making my mouth water as i type.

This is the best McDonald’s carry out restaurant in the Chicago area. I always have a blast when I go to this location. This is in a real happening neighborhood and there’s always a lot of action down here. Especially at night. This is also one of my favorite places in the city to people watch. One can check out all the latest fashions and see them worn in style. Don’t miss out on this Chicago institution.

Just another standard McDonald’s restaurant. They give you a number and then bring your order to your table.

I was a little annoyed that the kiosk didn’t give me the discount for multiple breakfast sandwiches so I ordered from the cashier. Instead of being two for $4 they were buy one for $4 and get a second for $1.

Hot and fresh which was slightly surprising but I won’t complain. I do wish everyone would get on board about the sauces. One day they are free the next day .28cents like keep it one way and run with it so that your customers know what to expect because it’s annoying to have to swipe my card or go digging in the car for a 28 cents🙄. Keep up the good work.

Throughout times in the past I remember being with my ex girlfriend in this location my head was wild too fast without a mind. Although I'm grateful for the man I've become today throughout all the pain. It has made me stronger
My head feels more clear and forward.
Place requires a security guard, locked bathrooms without a purchase enforced by security, no drink refills, none of the staff are friendly when approached, tables are filthy.

A good old fashioned Italian restaurant with a modern vibe. The wine by the glass was good and well priced. Small selection but representative at fair prices.  Neopoltian pizza is among the top 4 in chicago, over which there are over 30. The crust was perfect and the tomato sauce had a hint of sweetness. I didn't try anything else but will on my many return visits

We sat at the outdoor seating, which was nice with a good breeze. Wait staff was very friendly,  but not very attentive (reason for not giving 5 stars). Food was delicious, but a bit pricey. Cocktail was $12 and half the glass was a single giant ice cube.

With a small-town feel in the center of Old Town, this Italian pizzeria serves not only stone-oven, neopolitan-style pizzas but a great selection of pastas and drafts of Goose Island. If there is a wait but available bar seating, take advantage of comfortable chairs that easily allow you to talk with others in your party and also have access to quick service.

One of my FAVORITE pizza spots in Chicago. Warm and inviting Italian atmosphere. Seating options are very limited so I recommend giving a call ahead of time.

Both the Carne Rosso and the Margherita pizzas are incredible. Pizzas are cooked in a wood fired oven and have an authentic Italian feel.

They have surprisingly great wine options that really close the deal. I believe they have half priced bottles on Wednesday. We went with a Barbaresco. Many great Italian options.

Anyways, check this place out if you are in the mood for pizza and wine in Old Town.
The Carne Rosso pizza is amazing. The wait staff was attentive and actually spoke Italian. Great wine selection, too!
This place is amazing, my fav fast food spot. They have fresh food and healthy options everyday.

The food is tasty and fresh and there is generally ample seating during nice weather when there is both inside and outside seating.

Service is fine when they aren't busy. During the lunch rush it is a madhouse. There are separate lines to order different types of food, but all very close together which makes it a bit confusing. To add to the confusion, the lines to pay get blended in to the ordering lines when it's crowded.

I recommend using the Ritual app to order food to pick up from there instead of ordering on-site. I'd give them 4 stars if ordering through Ritual.
Great lunch place! The salmon with roasted vegetables is very tasty.
Its a good place to visit ,ande at ,and relax thery is from ice cream to pasta (spaghetti and more) they serve very good coffee.

Very stable and understandable menu, you will know what to expect on the second visit. Good quality, little wait even on a summer lunch. Pasta is a bit soft (too far from classical al-dente). Soup bowls spill over easily when carried on trays.

Absolutely the best Czech restaurant in Chicago! Unique Czech style interior, most friendly servers. Excellent place for any celebration party! The owner, Milada, is happy to do everything to make you comfortable. I'm always coming back because I love it here!

AMAZING AUTHENTIC CZECH AND SLOVAK FOOD!!! You Must Good and experience it. Great service and cleanliness! The Best food you will ever taste! Great for a family meal or even just to get a drink to catch a game. They do private parties with class! Stop thinking about it, just Go eat there you will not regret it. Dobrú chuť

Love the authentic European food. Service have very good knowledge about the food and drinks. My favorite dish is the Oven roasted duck with a nice glass of wine. Would definitely recommend to make a reservation since they are super busy.
Delicious with delicious authentic cuisine from Czech Republic. It also features a must try in the steak and shrimp kabobs.
Celebrated Lane Tech City champ over here and everything turned out amazing we loved everything about this place. Food was delicious but most importantly our boys was happy #teamLT💛💚🤼‍♂️

I use to love this place but this not a pizza that was freshly made. Taste like the made awhile ago and just put it back in the oven. I’m disappointed I usually always go here over Barney’s Pizza. Not this best this time.

Used to come here alot as a kid , tons of memories but man idk if it's just that ive had better over the years or they just fell off because this don't taste like elliots from the early 2000s. The slice was alot smaller and lacked the flavor it used to have , never the less it wasn't nasty it just taste like they use cheaper ingredients.
Good food, prices went up and the portions have gotten small. Charge for anything ( mild sauce, croutons, cheese) going on your order.
I Love Their Italian Chicken Omg Its Da Best And Their Salads As Well
Food was delicious... 4 stars for the chicken Italian beef. I never had this before. The service was fast and freash

How I found this place is still a mystery to me - even to this day. After driving around in circles for what seemed like days, my friend and I finally spotted this Roly Poly which was tucked away in the side of a building down a narrow alley. We thought we were going mad looking for the address, but were relieved to find it. So in a state of frustration and Groupon in hand, we made our way in.

Pretty good options here.  It usually takes about 10 minutes to get warm wraps.
Not bad. A little to thick for a thin crust. Sauce was good, could have used a little more, cheese too.
