Pizza is ok and we orderd a large and the large is actually small went to a lot of pizzerias and all their smalls are like the “large” of this place thats what got me disappointed ☹️

The pizza is OK. But I’m giving it one star because if they can they will try to rip you off. I went in for two slices of pizza and two cans of pop. I was told the pizza slices are $3 each and the cans are $1 each and I paid the exact $8 and everything was good. I come in the following week and get the same order but this time I pay with a $20 bill and he only give me back $11 change basically keeping an extra dollar for himself. Now I know it’s just $1 difference but the fact that he did this tells me that he will take advantage of people when he thinks there’s an opportunity. I didn’t say anything but I was somewhat surprised he pulled this stunt. The sad part is I’m pretty sure it’s the owner who did this. Just be aware that they don’t try to take advantage of you because they will especially with the money.
The pizza and cheese fries were good but by the time it was delivered to me it was pretty cold 🥶
Their food is delicious. You can get this big half pound burgers with fries and coleslaw. 10/10 would recommend eating here.

Had lunch and dinner on different days. Tomato soup and pear salad were fantastic. Drinks were well made with top shelf alcohol. Service is fast and friendly. Sitting at the bar was fun. We ended up with quite a few of us enjoying time hanging out. Even the coffee is good and they have non dairy alternatives... Thank you lord!

Standard hotel restaurant... nothing bad, nothing outstanding. When I traveled here, I was actually on a burger kick, so I had a cheeseburger from the menu. The burger was cooked to order (medium) and actually pretty big and good...but again, nothing made it bad per se, or outstanding either.

The service is good here, even in the afternoon around check-in when it was fairly quiet. There's not much to look at or listen to if you're not in good company, so if you're rolling solo, take a good book I suppose. Pretty good hotel, and this is an A-ok, pretty good restaurant as well.

Most of the dishes had some sort of spiciness to them with not a lot of variety of other options. However, staff was nice about letting us know a last minute option for an out of stock substitution, and the Crème Brulee was good (though strangely topped with whipped cream). The restaurant was a nice experience, and convenient, however, due to their high prices and the limited variety, I don't think we would choose to eat there again.
The bar has reopened evenings. Limited selection but at least a place to go when staying at the Marriott.  Can eat room service in the bar was nice.

October 27 2021
According to the person who answered the phone number listed, they only do drinks and no food.
Based on this listing, that doesn't seem right. Something isn't making sense.

my friend and i venture here for authentic korean food and we were satisfied. We got doenjang jigae, al jigae (cod roe stew), and tobboki. Everything tasted clean with deep flavor and a good spice kick. The price is very reasonable for how much food they give us. Theres also a wide selection of banchan. I’ll def come back here to try their bbq items!
Great place for Korean food that you can cook yourself on real charcoals.  Fun for everybody! Great yeast good speedy yet describe service.

We got different bbq meats and a soup that the server recommended. The marinated bbq meat tasted better then the pork belly. The pork belly was just too thin and also too chewy. The marinated short ribs were fantastic. The soup was a bit flavorless given that we were eating heavily marinated meat. Store was smoky but service wasn’t bad. They change the bbq rack frequently which is a plus.

I am hesitate to put a 4 stars here. The numbers of sides were tremendous which could be refilled as you may experience in South Korea. The pork belly and tongue were great. Foods were all great! The thing that bothered me was the services. This was my first time to be forced to pay more tip as we were party of only 4 people. It was dinner and I know most people gave 18% tip, but I have never seen any restaurant force their customer to pay a certain amount of tip as you did not pay the check.

We had literally so much food. Came at an earlier time so not too many people. The plates took over the entire table- I don't even know how we finished everything. Food was authentically delicious and staff were nice

Went here for their Sunday brunch and the food was delicious and their service was absolutely phenomenal. I got the Duck Sope, the Rotisserie Hash and the Sticky Bun. The sope was by far the best of the three, but the sticky bun was like a more delicious cinnamon roll with candied pecans, and the rotisserie is good if you like a good vegetable medley. The service is what took this restaurant to 5 stars for me. By far some of the kindest servers/hosts that I’ve encountered in Chicago. The prices are also reasonable so I’d recommend you check it out if you haven’t yet. A diamond in the rough, I’m surprised that there isn’t a line out the door.

The food was fantastic as was the service! I will likely be back again next week because there's still more I want to try. The wings are incredible. We also had the duck sope, the smoked salmon toast, and their special. The biscuits and gravy on the special were fiiiire!
The Duck Inn was amazing. The food was delightful and the service was exceptional.  I ordered the peaches and cream French toast and I was not disappointed. The sticky buns are also to die for.

My fiancé and I love going to this restaurant. We come here  when celebrating an anniversary or have a random date night and get fantastic service. On this particular day, Bernard served us. He got to us after 15 minutes to get our drink order but was very unfriendly and bland. His personality with the tables around us was very kind and friendly. We got our drinks and finished them and waited a very long time before he came to get our app order and we ordered a second round of drinks. We tried to order our main course but he said he would be back. We got our drinks and app and finished them and again waited a long time for him to come back. We ordered our food and not once did he check in on us. At this point seeing how extra friendly  he was with everyone and not us we got uncomfortable and just decided to pay and get dessert at the bar. The bartenders and bar back were great and treated us well. We still tipped Bernard 20% cause we’re in the industry but his service towards us was horrible.

Heard this place had an underated Italian Beef sandwich so I had to try it out. Sat outside on their patio on a Saturday evening and enjoyed the sandwich accompanied by the fries fried in duck fat.  Delicious.
Best bet for late night pizza in Old Town. Jumbo slices and a soda for $5 is a great deal! Fun to see them prepare the extra large pizzas in the window as you walk by.

Please try the Vodka Rigatoni. It is seriously some of the best pasta I've ever had!! Also the nutella bites are amazing! They are more like Nutella Empanadas. If you love Nutella and Empanadas you'll love these!!
Jumbo slices really hit the spot when you have a late night craving. Plus, one of the only places open in the area late night. $5 can feed plenty.

Depending on the time of day the pizza kinda of varries. at night the crust is better then if you go during the day. THe workers are preetty awesome. theres almost always something on tv worth watching as well.
Garlic cheese bread is fabulous... in fact it's better than the pizza in my opinion. Worth a try, but don't forget to get the CHEESE bread.

When I call in my orders, the staff is always kind. Food is fresh. When I arrive to pickup my food, the order is accurate and ready. The parking lot is small. Park on the street unless you want your door dented. Hopefully, Red Snapper Fish Chicken can move across the street in the old KFC.

I went into the facility they only had one customer ahead of me I was told it would take 12 minutes from my freshly fried chicken wings In less than 6 minutes I was told my order was ready I did not see the person dropping in the grease at all I said is that my order  The young lady replied yes I said what do you guys pre fry your food. You said no we fried him fresh you didn't see it. I asked for my money back and they gave it to me and I will never going there again.

I ordered a pick up order and when I went to pick my order up they told me they gave my order away to a driver… 🤔 it’s a pick up order not a delivery order… but anyways the “lady” behind the counter gave me an attitude even though they gave my food away she had an attitude 🤯 she asked me if I wanted my food order cooked again… of course I do… it’s 8 at night and I would like the food I ordered… then she finds my order but had a problem giving me forks and napkins… not going here again. When I emailed the store about her incompetence to have hospitality in a hospitality industry… crickets. Bye Red Snapper. I will not eat at any location ever again.
Seafood was nasty. We got an order of perch and catfish it was disgusting. It was barley done fries was old. This was my first and last time visiting this place. The bread was nasty and tasted old.
The cashier with the red hair is very nice better then others she needs to only cashier I think her name is zamria she’s very nice

This place is adorable! Low key yet upscale. I placed my order online for pick up at the restaurant. As soon as I walked in the staff was welcoming and friendly. I arrived to the Range a little bit early so my order wasn’t ready. The staff was nice and polite, they sat me down and offered me water while I waited for my order to be ready and in about 5 minutes later I received my order. (Not restaurants fault, I got there earlier that the projected time I got online when I placed my order) When I got home, both my husband and I agreed the Range is one of our favorite restaurants around the area! My husband ordered the Range burger with bacon and a side of fries and I ordered a veggie burger with a side of salad and we got chicken fingers as an appetizer for both of us to share. The food was delicious! The food is well seasoned and cooked to perfection!  I thought the portion sizes are big! My vegan burger was big and the amount of salad too! I think their prices are well matched for the portion sizes we received of what we ordered.  I totally recommend! I give the Range a 10/10.

We absolutely loved our experience at Range.
Service: Friendly, knowledgeable, attentive, but not intrusive.
Atmosphere: Refined, cozy, welcoming, and intimate.
Food: Perfect portion sizes, balanced flavors, reasonably priced. I really loved all of the gluten free options and their dedication to sourcing from sustainable local farmers.

Overall I'm super impressed by this this restaurant highly recommend it.

BTW our server Addy (I hoped I spelled that right) and her whole team were so wonderful. Thank you Addy!

I had the pleasure of having my daughter's birthday brunch at Range.  Everything was was excellent.  The food was delicious and all of the staff members that I encountered were polite, nice, and welcoming. We really enjoyed ourselves here and look forward to returning.  I would like to give a special thanks to Joseph.  From the beginning he was very professional and kept in contact with me to ensure that this event would be perfect.

I have always enjoyed this place. Amazing neighborhood restaurant focusing on local, seasonal ingredients. Every time we come here (and it had been a while), dishes are similar but always changing depending on what is fresh. The wine and bar program are lovely as well.

What a wonderful place to eat! Every bite is pure homemade fresh goodness. The Tomato Peach Flatbread is so delicious! The Chicken Sandwich was “roll your eyes up into the back of your head” delicious. Service was great and we were doted on and treated wonderfully, like we were in a friend’s kitchen. Fresh is an understatement for every ingredient used in every dish. The music was such a wonderful variety too. All over the board with something for everyone. The atmosphere here can’t be beat. The place is clean as a whistle too. We will be coming back any chance we can.

There were 3 of us stopping in after attending a funeral. The meal was delicious. I had their Fox's hamburger; my friends had the broasted chicken and the Pasta bowl. We were all very pleased with our selections. Since there weren't many people dining, the service was good. My companions had doggie bags and one ordered the hamburger to go for her husband.

Ordered linguine with broccoli and added chicken to be delivered. It was the absolute worst meal I’ve ever had! The broccoli was so overcooked, it wasn’t even green. It was gray! Looked like it must have sat in a steam table for hours. I added chicken for an up charge. It was dry and leathery. It came with a cup of beef vegetable soup. It tasted like it had been reheated several times. Ugh! What a waste of $16.99! My family has been ordering food from them since 1975, but won’t be ordering from Fox’s any time soon.

Pizza sent back twice service was okay will not return 2 hours to get a pizza and the restaurant spoke to both managers one was the owner and did nothing about it. Will not return. The manager said he would take it off the bill they never did they still charge my card.
Sarah was our server! She was helpful, friendly and knows the menu. The pizza was out of this world! We will be back and hoping to get her as our server!
Pizza is nasty and the crust don’t suppose to be soft had better pizza talking about really yes yes yes ace pizza better than that
Me and my family members loved our drinks and our donuts. Everything was fresh and delicious. Will be bringing my family back here. Ps. We all had a Cappuccino Blast, two regular and two OREO.

Good customer service
The problem is if i pay close to $4.00 for a xl coffee I expect it to be full, not halfway filled. And 2nd i don't want to see coffee beans at the bottom of my coffee.
Sign says open but its actually close. 9;30 pm. It says drive thru ppen they only take orders when they feel like it

Today I had a terrible experience! I usually receive good customer service and polite encounters. Today was the exception, because the cashier was having a bad day. Once I paid my order the cashier closed the window. Since it was a drive-through Usually its fast but aleast say thank you and have nice day. The cashier literally closed the window and started to talk to another employee. He pointed and looked at me. I then gesture to see if there was something wrong because I thought they might if given me the wrong order. She opened the window and very aggressively asked what I wanted! I got upset and asked for her name and also her supervisor. She refused to both of my requests and didn't comply with her job. She didn't offer a lead or anyone else. She gave me 2 bogus names and closed her little window again. She needs better customer service training or not work with the public.
Only stopped here cause my daughter is expecting & needed a Sweet Flavored Coffee . Sweets are NOT my cup of tea .

My first experience here is based on a private event and I can’t wait to go to have a regular dine in experience.

RPM steak is such a beautiful place, with beautiful people (great staff), beautiful decor and amazing food. The food and service is incredible. You just feel so special here. Every dish was plated beautifully, mouthwatering and so much flavor! Great drink selection, including whiskey.

I headed out to RPM for my anniversary and our experience was so lovely. We sat down and we’re immediately greeted by our waitress and handed complimentary glasses of champagne. This was the best service we’ve ever had!! The food was incredible (I’ll let the pictures speak for themselves) and I still can’t get over how accommodating and sincere the staff was. It was the perfect night out in the city to dress up a bit and celebrate. I wish I could go there for dinner every night!

Tonight was our first time at RPM steak Chicago to say the experience was amazing would be an understatement!! The place is amazing inside, the food was outta this world, and the service was second to NONE! Our servers name was Anna she made the experience perfect! She was very knowledgeable, very professional and quite funny which made the night even better there needs to be more servers like her. We've been to alot of the top steakhouses in Chicago area and RPM jumped right to the front of the list we will definitely be back. Do not hesitate to try RPM

Very nice place. The server was friendly and observant. Meat quality and flavor was excellent. The steak was cooked just right and the truffle sauce delicious.
Only gripe is that for the price, it only gets 4/5 stars as I have had better value for money.

Excellent service, the server actually took the time to read the request my husband put in when we reserved that we prefer alcohol-free drinks and halal meat. So the server  helped us choose the best for our preferences.
They have halal steak on their menu, and authentic wagu steak from Australia. Also they gave us a complimentary banana flavored cotton candy with our dessert for our anniversary that small touch really made the whole experience special.

Good quick cheap food! Pierogies dough is thick and chewy, filling is good, but a little bland. The carmelized onions are good and bacon is alright, although the seem like the processed kind you'd find at a salad bar.

First time having pierogies so a little tough reviewing. I eat a lot of Chinese dumplings which are pretty similar. Although the filling is less fatty than dumplings which makes it feel a bit dry. Also never had sour cream with them but definitely a good combo.

Overall, a decent place to get something quick for under $10!

I wouldn’t call it heaven. It wasn’t bad but it wasn’t delicious as well. As a Polish woman I can tell they could be way more tasty but considering the place - they are okay. Just ok - don’t expect anything extra and don’t expect traditional polish cuisine since it’s just not. The filling of pierogis (flavour) is a little bit hard, should be softer (especially the ones with meat, spinach and meat&spinach. As we are here: true polish cuisine do not recognize the meat&spinach filling, it just doesn’t go well together, this combination is not a tasty one. Kraut and mushroom filling is okay, no regrets and no astonishments. The dough of the pierogis is way too thick and hard. Soup (red borsch) gives a feeling as made from the powder or some concentrate. It’s ok but still you won’t be delighted. But it’s served in a big portion! Summing up: for people who don’t know the true polish cuisine it’s a nice place to go, you will eat there a decent meal in a nice price. For people who know polish traditions - better not, you won’t be satisfied. I don’t regret but I wouldn’t go there again.

Their sausages were sooooo amazing. My fiancé is Polish and his family cooks really well, so I’m pretty spoiled with authentic polish food. But these sausages were divine. Pierogi was good too, we tried different fillings. Highly recommend! Also price is very fair too!

Phenomenal Pierogis. Calm, quiet sit-in restaurant that is fast and easy - just outside South Wells St exit of Clark/Lake CTA station. Over a dozen different pierogies that you can mix with your order. Different toppings available as well. Polish sausauge was good too. Fast, inexpensive and delicious with a super friendly staff and great location makes it a must :)

Legitimately amazing pierogi made fresh on the day. Coming from poland myself its really a breath of fresh air to get this sort of quality at a reasonable price point!! If you want good pierogi with quick with little fuss or frill come here without a doubt!!!
Food is amazing! Staff is courteous and fast. Would definitely,  price considerate great place

I ordered the pollo especial and it smelled good but The chicken was very dry. My issue was the cook/cashier. He looked dirty his super long nail was dirty and brown. I saw him touching everything in that kitchen with no gloves. Grabbed the money and went straight to the fridge to grab a raw beef patty and then grabbed the tongs for the chicken follow by grabbing the basket of fries. I agreed with some of the previous reviews cooks should wear hair nets and definitely use gloves. Also saw the big tray of chips just uncovered with flies. The mural is cool but the hygiene is not. I wouldn’t recommend to anyone especially if the city has tons of chicken spots.
Update 8:35pm I definitely have food poisoning from them. My stomach is very upset.

Excellent service and huge portions. I had the chicken enchiladas with mole sauce dinner platter. The mole sauce was a bit on the sweeter side but it was very tasty. The hubby had the Chicken fajitas dinner platter. I've driven by this place many times and I'm glad we stopped. Was about $35.00 including 2 sodas plus tax. Was initially put off by the fries on the platter but, they tasted Awsome. Is it a tiny bit pricey....yes but, isn't every eatery during Covid. This place is local to me and I plan to go back.
Excellent service!!!!! Delicious food

Love the beautiful remodel, They made some beautiful improvements to the lobby. The way the prepare the chicken has be updated, and I found it to be just as delicious as before!!! So happy they are back open!!!

The young man that was taking our orders was extremely nice and did everything with a smile. Which is rare these days. He completed our 5 orders relatively fast. They also have a large table inside that has charging imbedded into the table. Convenient.

HORRIBLE service! I’m a regular here, or was for that matter. I just left there on Wednesday 8/10 at 4:15pm without my order due to how rude the girl was there. No cars in front of me at the drive thru. I had been waiting for 10 min at the speaker for someone to take my order. Within those 10 min I said hello 3x to ensure the speaker wasn’t broken as I wasn’t getting a response. I had no response all 3x so I drove up to the window to place my order. I didn’t get her name but the short hispanic female with darker complexion was extremely rude and stated I needed to order at the speaker. I only say this so the owner can identify her. I told her no one responded when I asked 3x. She rolled her eyes and refused to take my order stating they were busy and that’s why. Okay, I completely understand this, although it’s not difficult to say one moment please. She wanted me to reverse my car to go to order at the speaker again. I tried to, but the car behind me pulled up so I couldn’t. I told her this. I gave her my coffee order and she didn’t put the order in or take my money and rolled her eyes and said to meet her in the parking lot. I waited for 20 minutes and she never showed. I guess she just tells everyone this so that they can leave. She could have just taken my order at the window. I’m not one to complain, but the blatant rudeness and lack of service was uncalled for. Frankly, she needs to get a new job as this hood rat should not be dealing with anything customer service related. I will be forwarding this complaint to corporate. Looks like I’ll be going to the new Starbucks they are building on Montrose for my daily coffee.

Went there today ordered a coffee with cream, sugar and nutty pumpkin at the drive thru. After receiving the coffee and looked at the label I realized it just said regular coffee with cream and sugar but not the nutty pumpkin. Drove back around at the drive thru and asked the lady about it, she said oh I am sorry I added pumpkin instead of the nutty pumpkin in it. I said ok, started driving for about 10 minutes and tasted the coffee and had no pumpkin flavor at at all. I had my husband taste it also and he said that was a regular coffee only with no pumpkin at all, so they literally lied to me in my face ! Bad customer service, lies and rude!

I live right down the block and they never get the order correct.....terrible traffic and please put someone at the cashier that understands and is not ready to argue. Girls in the back lookin at customers instead of getting the order correct Spending 30 dollars and not getting the order correct anyone would be upset.  All that moeny to improve the property and customers still come out flying from the drive thru.cross the street with your kids..... #boycottingdunkindonut

Wow talk about bad customer service.  Waited for about 5 minutes without any acknowledgment from the service team.  The Hispanic girl that with the straight brown colored hair that finally decided to take our order was rude. Doesn’t check if something is in stock and just says no… threw the change instead of handing it over… if you have a problem with your job maybe you should find another place to work.  Maybe the staff needs to be retrained in customer service skills. Yes everyone can have a bad day, but having manners doesn’t hurt anyone. Maybe she should learn to have some.

Phenomenal and such a blast! We came for the live entertainment and cabaret - loved every minute of both. Did not expect the food to also be SO GOOD. Our flight was delayed, and we called to see if there was any chance of pushing our reservation later. The staff was so kind and accommodating even on a Friday night (though this accommodation may not be possible all the time depending on the crowd). We were so thankful it was possible tonight so we didn't have to miss out on such a lovely evening. Our server was also wonderful. You will not regret giving this place a try. Will absolutely be coming back next time we are in town!

My husband and I really love coming here whenever we can make it downtown. Food is great and they have an extensive selection of whiskeys. We have enjoyed excellent shows as well. Definitely stop by their library. That wall is full of the best selections. It's a great treat for a Saturday night!

Very nice Speakeasy with multiple rooms and spots to take pictures. The cod dinner was pretty good, the mushrooms were good but definitely had a strong kick back taste from the sauce put on it. My drink was a little watered down as well, but I loved the show and band seating area. This place will definitely give you an experience.

This place is super rad and unique - immediately waking down the stairs its like you're transported back to a different time - with strong drinks, good music and great food. The burger was delicious and served with a literal mountain of fries. We are lucky enough to catch a great blues band while we were there - definitely recommend going for the more traditional music show and not the "EDM" style that they have later in the evening.

It’s fancy place. There are a couple room for dining with different style and music. We booked in the quiet room (means no music band in the room) it’s crowded on the weekend. There is a full bar (i mean real full full bar) Our food is great. smoke tartare is fancy presentation. bathroom room is fancy as well. recommended to try.

Pretty good Florentine Eggs Benedict! They also have a pretty full breakfast menu with lots of options that can accommodate many dietary restrictions. They have both indoor and outdoor seating space and the restaurant doesn’t get too loud or crowded. Perfect for groups or singles. Will definitely be back!

Delicious food, blackberry jam is a must try .generous portions Coffee was very good. Our server Magaley was the best!reasonable prices. Restaurant and washroom were spotless. Indoor and outdoor seating.

Vegetarians, Muslims or Jewish people, they will not accommodate you in the slightest  if asked. Simply wanted the ham in a western omelet on the side because we like sharing meals. According to server and the guy we heard in the kitchen, "the ham isn't precooked we have to mix everything together and cook it." It is clearly precooked ham.
But let's pretend it wasn't, how hard is it to cook some ham at restaurant where there are 8 or so  tables sat of 30+ on a Sunday morning before the rush starts?

On top of that all of the cheese was in the dead center and not exactly melty.

We also did not have salt pepper or sugar on our table. Asked for them and was only brought pepper.

I have been going to Original Pancakes House's for 16 years; today was the first (and obviously last) time at this location. The Gold Coast location is a classic for me, grew up a few blocks away. Lincoln Park was also great because it was just down the street from my school, LPHS.

The Santa Fe omelette with Chicken Sausage is good. Strawberry pancakes are good. The breakfast potatoes were soft and I was expecting it to be crispy!
We got the Southwest Skillet and it was all soggy and soft. The base of skilled is supposed to be hash browns or atleast crispy potatoes which was not tha case.

Go for the pancakes and omelette!

Recommended:
I would could give it a 4.5 but have to choose between 4 and 5. The only bad thing about this place is their hash browns - very strange in terms of taste, look and the way it is cooked. They should also serve better (and stronger) coffee, but it isn’t bad. Also, food quality and service are good. Prices are also reasonable and the portions are big. All in all, I think 4 is a fair score.
The Buffalo Philly cheesesteak is awesome and is to die for. The owner/ manager of the establishment is great and very friendly. I have come here twice and both times it was excellent

The Original Philly Steak is really good. But the other steak sandwiches are just wrong. Who puts lettuce and tomato on a Philly Steak? The cheese burger is very good. Better that what you would get at McDonald's. The fries are very good. The King Potato is excellent. This place is surprising good.
The one in north riverside mall is the real great steak, this one is something else. The taste is way off.

Let me start by saying the food was good which was the only reason I gave this location more than a single star.  My sandwich was first given away to another customer further extending the already lengthy wait.  The customer who received my sandwich (much larger than what she ordered) proceeded to eat my sandwich when the kitchen realized their mistake the young girl proceeded to blame and chastise the customer and continued to trash talk the customer after she threw the sandwich away and left.  The issue was resolved by simply giving me a 7 inch sandwich that was already made and making another (as I ordered a twelve inch originally).  I have been in the service industry for over a decade in currently in a supervisory role, not only would I do my best to fire the girl who shamed the customer but I would have done far better to repair the experience with the original customer (myself).  Sadly I will probably never return here and I will take note to warn all who ask not to patron this establishment.
Very tasty cheese sandwiches, great fried chicken and tenders and the fries absolutely good.

It's a new favourite of mine for sure! I adore the veggie dragon sushi, it's seriously some of the best sushi I've ever had. As a vegetarian, I always appreciate when a place like this can make a vegetarian dish full of flavour. I love the vibes of this place, too, the chandeliers are a nice touch. Our server was helpful and very friendly.

We went around 4 PM on a Sunday and it wasn't too crowded and very chill.

It was very good and nice, the server was very nice and helpful she recommended some very nice rolls. We also had the crispy wontons. I really liked those as well. I would definitely recommend this place if you are in the area

Place is cool looking! Food was good. Staff seemed a lil standoff ish.

Tempura is great but it doesn't come with sauce. Weird.
Really enjoyed the sushi here! I loved both the sushi rolls that I ordered!! Both unique and had good flavor. Will definitely recommend this place to others!

Upon entering, I grabbed hand sanitizer and the attendants there looked confused, as if I knew what I was coming in for. I was waiting as the sign said "wait to be seated". They told me to sit wherever I wanted to.

The place itself is slightly dark ambience, where not much light is around compared to outside. You have to wait a while for your eyes do get adjusted to the room.

As I sit down, the waiter did not explicitly give me directions on what to do, but I was able to understand that the menu is the QR code.

While reading the menu, it was slightly confusing to me as I did not know if the bottom of the page had a correlation with the next column of the menu, or continue scrolling down to see the rest of the section.

Food:
Upon arrival, the person serving my food (not the waiter)  threw the plate to the table, not placing it gently on the table. My actual waiter did do this when my second plate arrived.

The pork bun was not how I expected it to look like. The flavor of the pork could have been better. The other items that went with the pork bun did give it flavor.

The main dish mostly actually good. The lemon wedges did take the main flavor away on some fish, but it's good to have that there for people who like a little acidity.

The white rice actually had flavor. That's a plus. I was not able to tell the flavor, but it was certainly different compared to how others places prepare their white rice.

Upon paying, i was given the recipe through a rusty, old box that looks as if it was stolen from American Express (the company logo is on there). That was not too amusing.

Overall, if I could, I give this place 3.5 stars.
4 stars since it rounds up.
The lightening could be improved, especially for someone who's coming in, when outside is very bright. The method of providing the receipt needs to be improved.

LOVE this Freshii!! The owner is so nice and the smoothies are immaculate ❕❕❕so are the peanut butter coconut bites! Although my favorite thing there might be the chia pudding, it has fresh fruit and it’s so good ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️/⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ 5/4 stars
I’m not sure if it was the kind of burritos I got but they were just awful and flavorless. SO. BLAND. Overpriced and undercooked too.
I dunno about their regular food.  But I got some big fat cookies there!

Awesome atmosphere!! I walked in expecting to have just a healthy meal for my lunch break, but stepped into an oasis of friendly faces (and great air conditioning). Everything from soups, bowls and salads on the menu, to creating your own CUSTOM versions of all. It was a great reliever walking in there during lunch and have made it a tradition ever since!

This place is my go to if I want something healthy. The smoothies pack a lot of calories so be careful with those but the salads are decent sized, filling and the ingredients are portioned out so you can mix as you like. The bircher museli with green apple and cranberries is my fav!

Started ordering delivery from this place years ago and the spicy shrimp rolls have always been the best from this place! It was my 1st time dining in and I loved it!! Presentation definitely won my date over and it's not pricey. Great drink menu, w/good service!!

Honestly, I was so happy to visit and find the same quality food that I tasted back in 2014. Great sushi and very impressive presentation. It’s honestly way over the top which is really fun especially if you have a date. Delicious  desserts too!

Very impressed with the selection and variety in the menu. Hostess was super attentive and dropped by multiple times to make sure we had everything. 100% will be back!

Excellent fresh sushi and green curry!! Very creative presentation. The mochi is plated with fresh fruit..
Wide selection of Japanese items on the menu.
Servers are friendly but on a Saturday afternoon seem overwhelmed. Green tea 🍵 is tasty - I wish they had jasmine tea.

Space is comfortable- in the winter, sit further away from the door as you will get a cold breeze every time someone opens the door.

The food is tasty, reasonably priced, and presented well. The pictures don't do the presentation justice due to the low lighting, but the flower theme is lovely.

I only ordered small plates (no entrees), but the small plates filled me up. And the massive drink definitely did its job and I didn't need to order another.

For those who like a lot of spice with their suchi, the wasabi is very light, so you'll need to pile it on to get the kick you're looking for (ask for extra).

I would give 6 stars if I could. Very zen atmosphere with friendly and professional staff. Great music and even greater service. Very fresh sushi, very hot served dishes. Aesthetically pleasing for all five senses. I love how they care about little details like serving glass filled with crashed iced when you order a drink or edible flowers with appetizers. Pricing is great as well. My favorite sushi place in town!

This is EXACTLY how Chicago Deep Dish is supposed to be! It's hot enough where the cheese is melted, the toppings are flavorful, and the crust is crispy, buttery and delicious. Yes! Yes! YES!!!! Oh, and the service here is so friendly. It takes 45 minutes to bake a deep dish. Our waitress came around many times before and during our meal to check up on us. Simply AMAZING! Parking is Valet or Garage right across the street.

Great place to get an authentic Chicago style deep dish pizza! It is recommended that you order a deep dish prior to arriving as it could take over 40 minutes for the deep dish to cook properly. We ordered mozzarella sticks with buffalo sauce and I recommend it! Chicago is not a place I travel to often, but this was my second visit in five years and it is exactly how I remember! The sauce to cheese ratio is perfect, and they are very generous with the toppings! If I come to Chicago a third time, this will make my list again for sure.

We decided to try this pizza restaurant in Chicago after watching the TV series man versus food. This was the first time I’ve ever experienced £80 Chicago pizza, and Boy did it not disappoint! The food was delicious and there was plenty of it even when we ordered a small pizza! The venue was great very hipster and offers the opportunity for you to write your name on the walls which adds to the deco and hipster feel of the venue. Will certainly be back even if it means travelling from the UK to try one of their pizzas again!

It was one of the best pizzas I've ever eaten. I can not forget. I miss Chicago pizza. It was full of cheese and plenty of meat inside. The pizza dough is thick and chewy. The buffalo wings were also spicy and very tasty.

Thank you for the meal.

Honestly everything was exactly what we wanted. We wanted to try some Chicago deep dish pizza and there are SO many options that we didn't know what we were getting into when we chose this place. But it was amazing. They had some great topping choices (I had mine with spicy pepperoni and white truffle oil) let you customize and mix and match pretty much however you'd like and it came out fresh and hot and amazing straight to our table. The aesthetics of this place are fun and edgy and they offer a marker for you to write on the walls once you're done. Def enjoyed the food, atmosphere, and service and would go here again!
Great pizza good service awesome price.
Closed as of May 2016

Clean with a very polite and pleasant staff. Street parking can be difficult to find. I signed up for their emails and came in for the complementary coffee and travel cup. I poured out the coffee and kept the cup. Their pastries are delicious, but the coffee was awful. Very watered down and cold. Maybe some flavor creamers would help, but for now I don't reccomend the coffee.

I love their baked fresh cookies and pasteries. You can get breakfast and lunch,soups and salads, hot or cold sandwiches. But No DECAF coffee!! Hot teas or regular coffee. I will stop in here after my doctor appointments.
Before the Pandemic they had outdoor seating.

We have been their customer for years. We love the pastries, soups, sandwiches (too long to list :) ).  Ladies, who work there are nice and helpful. They are always really nice to our kids and always have something nice to say. Please keep up your good spirit guys and thank you for highlighting our days when we stop by.

Soups, Sandwiches, Salads and Pastries? Mmm. Sold. This place has light, healthy eating. They have at least 6 soups a day available for their customers to choose from. They have a variety of sandwiches or wraps. Whether it's breakfast time or lunch time. Then close to closing time they put all their pastries that have not gone out for sale. Red Velvet cupcake is scrumptious. You can even call in your order ahead of time. Their Lemonade is  also very good.

This used to be one of my all-time favorite places to grab a quick bite. Not anymore, the quality of the food and the service have both decreased. What happened?!  Also, make sure you get a receipt and know what you’re paying for. The free bread with every entree, is Scam.

This was my first time in a Sopraffina's, and my partner and I enjoyed it! To be fair, we went on off-hours during the weekend; after skimming other reviews, that seems to make a difference. We got there shortly after opening, there were no lines, and the staff was super helpful and answered all our newbie questions. They've got a large menu that's divided into things like salads, pizzas, antipastos, etc. I noticed they have gluten free and vegan menus, too. True to form, my partner got ham and pineapple pizza—which I'm usually not a huge fan of (it's just so overdone, ya know??) but Sopraffina's was delicious! I ate more than my partner. (≧◡≦)
We also got a walnut-pear-something-something salad, which was fantastic, if a little sweet (but I'm into that in salads, so I thought it was good).
I can see how this place would be a challenge in terms of mobility accessibility; the seating is a bit cramped and the actually process of ordering your food involves standing and moving along very high counters. ╮( ˘ ､ ˘ )╭
Staff is unfriendly and usually very short. Carrot Brussel salad literally has just lettuce and maybe one or two Brussel sprouts in it. Over priced and not much to it.

Usually I love what I get. Today I ordered the sandwich on gluten free bread. It was the size of a half sandwich, but I was charged for a large full sized plus  $1 up charge. It was not toasted, so all the shredded cheese fell out. For almost $10 is was a big disappointment.

Salads are best there because they make it in front of you but it is pricey so anything extra is going to cost you. Free refills, bread comes free with pasta or a trio cold pastas.  Pizzas are medium size,they sell two veggie sandwiches also some vegetarian pasta choices. Desserts are pricey . Also chicken salad and tuna and shrimp pasta are a dollar extra since their protein. Space is limited to 50 ppl, variety of drinks .

This place is pretty packed at lunch and I'm not sure if they have the best setup though the lines are separate if you're looking for different types of food which does help.

Plenty of seating in a more modern atmosphere, the building is also well lit.

Great tasting soups and the sandwiches are good when you want a step up from places like Potbelly for a place that has fresher ingredients and more creative options.
The indy deal was Cool...
Alot of food for your buck. I seen this place on Chicago Best and decided to go check them out. Well I'm glad I decided to go

Friendly service and large quantities of good, good breakfast food!

My only regret was not being able to try one of their humongous pancakes and omelettes! I saw some pass by and the omelettes looked STUFFED! Both the pancake and omelette separately, filled the styrofoam to-go box to the brim.

Sometimes large quantities mean okay good, but the steak and eggs are one of the best in the city! Loved!

The staff was incredibly welcoming and friendly, it looked like there was only one dedicated waitress but the rest of the staff kept taking turns asking if I wanted my coffee and water refilled. I was impressed that even with the lower price point, the staff was so friendly and patient.

The place is a little 'cozy' and note: cash only.

I just love this restaurant and the owner comes out and talk to you she's so sweet. The food is so yummy and the portions mean you will always have some to take home. I wish she stayed open longer because I can't even imagine how good her dinners would be.

My grandson and I had brunch at Leifs today.  Good food, good value.  Large portions, its worth the wait cause they fix the food after you order.   Food is fresh, steak was tender and the coffee was excellent.

Place is crap. The only place in the world that simultaneously doesn't accept credit cards(red flag) and REFUSES to cook the steak that you are PAYING FOR the way that you want. Not sure how this place stays in business. I guess people in the 'hood love crappy service. On another note, my waitress was very nice so that's the only reason why I'd give it two stars.

Mutton biryani is amazing, chicken biryani is okay not so great, rotis and paranthas are very soft, veggie biryani is worst and there are not much veggie options. Chicken fry is good but too oily, chicken 65 is not that great. Haleem is good. You can visit here for haleem and mutton biryani for sure, but I don’t recommend other items.
My wife and I LOVE this place. Lovely food. Lovely service. Great atmosphere. Always a favorite, the best biryani - reminds me a lot of the ones we had in Chennai.

This really felt like I was having the actual Hyderabadi Biryani from one of Paradise/Bawarchi/Mehfill outlets. The price is decent for the quantity! Small menu but has the required dishes that you are looking for! Usually occupied on weekends. Felt like I was in Abids in Chicago, haha!
Nice place for cheap Indian (specially Hyderabadi) food. If you like haleem, this is your ultimate destination!
They have tasty Biriyani with reasonable price! Tea was not good though!

This is the chiken samwish i received. This is a fuken joke?? No lettuce, no mayonnaise or tomattoes!!! I paid 9 dollars for this chiken samwish!!!! woow !! and my son was so upset  with his chesse burger. No mayonnaise neither !! Why are the prices so higher if i'm gonna get my food like this. People yall need to check your food before leaving !
Also I waited 17 minutes in the drive tru. this is the worst mcdonalds i been to.

This place needs a better managing, 30 min for a curbside??? Drive thru was less time to do an order. I stood in curbside for 30 or 40 min and decided to go to drive thru and ask for my food. I miss whoever was in charge before, this place was 5 min and out. Never was full ever. Now you have multiple people waiting in the lobby for more than 20 min for food on a small order. There was a lady who was waiting for her food for 1 hour. Please have someone come in and see how this establishment is doing.

Ordered a large macchiato, the kid brings me a large ice coffee then I told him it was wrong order. He said the f word out loud not directed at me but as in the mistake. He walks back comes out a minute later with correct cup. I tasted as I pulled out the lot to realize he just poured the ice coffee in the cup and added caramel. Scary location as well never again

No one seems to want to run the drive through between 10pm and 1am because though there are staff inside they always seem to deny service between those times. Pretty frustrating considering that's when lots of people around here get off a shift and are willing patrons. I end up going to the one on 47th instead they are open when they say they are open atleast, though the lines are often 12 to 13 cars long.

Placed order through drive thru wasn't told total wasnt told to move up wasnt told my items weren't available but they started taking next lanes order so I went to pay  window hoping they actually took my order.  At window there was no mention that they couldn't make my order of just fries and a apple pie. Go up to pick up window and was then told they have no apple pies and if the cashier had removed it from bill. Which did not happen and was no longer an option. To top it off fires were stale with no salt.

Best halal pizza option!
The pizzas are great, meat lovers is my favorite one, the waiters are very welcoming and helpful. The restaurant is clean and the set up is nice as well! 👍

Love their food! So happy to see their new location on Devon w modern industrial decor! Simplified menu & same delicious flavors! Like with any spot on Devon, finding parking can be challenging but they still offer curbside pickup & well worth it. Please get HFSAA Certified to accommodate everyone.

I have been coming to Italian Express since its first location on Western Ave, since 1990s.  I order from them frequently and almost always have a problem with my order.  Today when I called, I asked for "very easy cheese" and explained that it meant little cheese.  When they showed me my pizza, I think they added extra cheese.  I showed them my order ticket and they said that the people in the kitchen don't understand. I told them that they should then explain it to them. I'm giving two stars because the coleslaw is very good and I'm glad I ordered that.

Love chicken nuggets
Buffalo wings
And zinger burger

Awesome food

Horrible food. Ordered a thin crust chicken Tikka pizza and it tastes nothing like that. Just some chicken pieces tasteless with so much cheese, it was not at all thin crust. Ordered shawarma as well. One with rice , one with pita. Chicken was uncooked and it was the same chicken which was served in pizza as well. They served it with no side such as hummus, ganoush. For them shawarma means rice and dry chicken or pita and dry chicken that's all. Shawarma and pizza cannot get worse than this. The lady at the ordering counter mislead me about portion sizes and we ordered more than what would have been sufficient. And shawarma with rice costs extra as well which was not conveyed before ordering.  On top of that they charge 15% surcharge on your orders included by default. I don't mind about price or service if atleast food is good but here food was downright trash.

This was the only restaurant open in the area, hence I had no choice but after looking and tasting the food we just had to throw everything and go back home with empty stomachs. Had to cook meals again at home.

All the reviews here are absolutely correct. I wish I had seen those before going there.
The cheese steak fries got a lot smaller than they were before. Plus now they charge you for each ingredient on it. Not worth it...

I try to go here everytime im in the city. They have really good steak meat that they put on fries with cheese. Unfortunately they charge to put Cilantro and onions etc on it but you have to have that otherwise it's just meat on fries.  Tacos, burritos, polish, fries are all good!
Always Delicious! Never a miss! Check out the "barria" bangin!!!!

Your average burrito but for the price of a burrito and a 1/2. Not sure if they put too much sour cream or whatever was the reason but it was a little too wet, I wished the tortilla had grill marks cause the only grill mark was where they closed the tortilla. It was almost $15 with taxes and it was not that big neither. I am being a little picky cause if you want to charge this much you got to step up your game, otherwise it would be "ok".

Their tacos are sooo good BUT their steak cheese fries are OUT OF THIS WORLD!!
Friendly staff and restaurant is always clean

Good people and good hot chocolate and the best store manager in t hff e city very clean and organized wish all starbucks are like this one it is a small one but the store manager and staff know how to do it. They are plenty of starbucks and they are filthy.

Amazing staff. I feel so welcome every time I come in! The atmosphere the staff has created (particularly the morning staff- which is SO needed in the morning to start the day right) is so positive and upbeat. I always leave this location with a smile on my face! Definitely my favorite Starbucks around- and it’s hands down because of the amazing people who work there!
Abby was quick on her feet, and made my coffee perfect! Keep on smiling girl!

If every Starbucks could have the team this one has, I would be happy. As simple as coffee is, it's hard to find staff that appreciate and engage with the customers. This is up to and including them full on supporting those in need. There is a Street Wise vendor who is a mainstay in the morning. We've raised money for him to get medical care and now he started his own business with his son. Might not be possible if there wasn't community support like there is at this location.

As far as Starbucks locations go, this one is very good for reliability, friendliness and speed. I've never had a wrong order and rarely had to wait (even when clearly very busy). Because it's a triangular location to fit the intersection, it's a bit of a weird layout that often muddles customers placing orders in-store and waiting to pick up online orders. It is also very accessible by walking, but not as much by driving because of the busy roads and street parking surrounding it.

The last few drinks I've received have been super bad, I had to take one back recently and have them make it again because it wasn't drinkable. I've also been getting drinks that aren't filled, I'm talking close to an inch and a half from the top. When I pay for a large I'd like it to be full.  I'm not a picky person by any means so it pains me to come here and drop shade but something needs to change.   I don't think I'll be going back for awhile, or at least until they get better employees.

Refused service because mint chocolate chip ice cream is too hard!
I asked a few times just to make sure & the young lady said she wouldn’t get it because the ice cream is too hard.
That’s a new one.

Store says closes at 10pm. Lights already out and employee hiding with lights out at 9:23. All I want is for a DD to actually stay open till 10pm. Just looking for my hot cup of coffee for the beginning of my shift. No 24hr DD around me.

I don't really expect much at chain places with how employment has been...but atleast TRY to do your job.

I waited at the front desk for 10 minutes while the workers were laughing and walking past me.  I guess carrying a box back and forth smiling is better than serving a customer.

Waited ten minutes for a mobile order and after asking several times (to which the workers rolled their eyes), did not see them even begin making it until my partner started prompting them to make it now. Then, once I received it 12 minutes later, it was just a terrible. Worst Dunkin’ experience.

This was my first time here. We ordered seaweed salad, miso soup, unagi cucumber sushi, sweet potato tempura, crispy tofu, garlic rice tofu.
The service was amazing and the food was hot and good. Overall, I recommend going here for a casual night. You won’t regret. I have just had better sushi. The miso soup was my favorite

We are definitely coming back my good long time friend Pat inviting me to experience her restaurant. Do to COVID restrictions and shut down it was not possible. Now that my husband and I felt more comfortable we come to try all her delicious plates. We had two tables filled with such amazing and delicious food. I will invite all my family and close friends and clients to experience the high quality of service and hospitality. Beautiful ambiance and delicious cocktails.
Love sushi place at the corner of Diversey Parkway and Sheffield Avenue. Fresh and delicious sushi and seafood menu. They have a variety hot and cold appetizers as well.
First timer but I will be returning!!!! The martini is a must and the noodles had the freshest ingredients

Food was good but very underwhelming considering the price.
Beware of the per bottle/can corkage fee.
Service was definitely not up to expectations: Slow and our server forgot parts of my group’s order.

A very dynamic atmosphere with great food. It was difficult to decide what I wanted because everything sounded amazing. The drink menu was well rounded and offered many options for all palates. I settled on the southern dandy w/ old bay fries and it was everything i thought it would be. I will definitely be going back to try the rest of the menu.

We each picked out a beer from their decent tap  selection and then we shared two burgers between the four of us. Both of them were amazing. The Fig is in burger is very different but good. You can sub a delicious salad in for the fries if you want. Fun atmosphere in the place with eclectic decor. We would highly recommend this place!
Very friendly staff. Like the drink options, and we all loved the cheese curds! My friends really liked the burgers, but I thought they were ok.

Bad apple is such a great place to get a burger! They have such wonderful though out burger creations that are delicious! The meat is fantastic as well so even a plain bad apple burger is delicious. The drink creations are fantastic too and their beer list is good.

Had a good time at The Bad Apple. I tried their Poutine and it was pretty good, not something so easy to find around this area. The burgers were all very interesting, with creative toppings and names to go with it. We had "The figs is in" and "Jake and Elwood" and absolutely enjoyed it. Will come back to try some of the other burgers!

The pizza at this place is fantastic. True Chicago style pizza. I would highly recommend this place for the food as the pizza was fantastic and the mozz triangles were good. The service was good and the waiter very friendly. The restaurant was clean and spacious with plenty of room to move around in the booth. The pizza is not cheap though worth the price. I ordered the small all meat pizza and ate off it three times as I could only eat about 2 pieces at a time. Also, as with any good pizza or food for that matter, there is a wait so either have a beer or order ahead to avoid the wait. This will definitely be a spot I will frequent during my visits to Chicago though I will be taking friends to help me eat this pizza. Go if you haven't been.

We went at like 10:20pm and they close at 11. The staff was polite and very friendly. They assured us we could order whatever we wanted and would have time to eat. Not wanting to hold them up we ordered something quick and easy. The food was good but we wish we would have gotten the deep dish pizza. Overall it was a great stop and we'll sure visit again
Delicious Deep dish Chicago 🍕 pizza!  Famous Giordano’s Pizza!!! Amazing, delicious, full of yummy ingredients!  Thin crust full of toppings!  Fun decor for Wrigley Field fans.

Its okay only because of the service. It was bad, sat at the table a good 20 minutes and my husband went up to see if we ordered at the counter. Was told they would get right on it. Not. BUT, the pizza was awesome. First time for deep dish. We don't have deep dish in Pennsylvania.

Great service, great pizza, a Chicago tradition for many years. I highly recommend Giordano's to anyone traveling to the Windy City looking for great deep dish pizza! The mozzarella triangles were great as well!

I had a taste of their crispy salted fish & chicken and it was delicious! Pleasantly surprised. Also tried their BBQ pork fried rice which was simple yet tasty. I'd definitely come here again, especially when it opens at 10-ish and the food is fresh! Pictured below is the fish on the left and sweet and sour chicken on the right with BBQ pork fried rice.

I used to grab lunch here all the time before the name change. My go-to entrées were the Garlic Eggplant Chicken and the Salt & Pepper Chicken. They were hard to find elsewhere and perfectly prepared at Chinese 65.

Today was my first time back in a year or two and I was shocked that the dining room wasn't packed at noon  like before. That should have been my first sign to turn around. I ordered my usual and they only had the bottom of the pan bits left. She plated the dry looking Eggplant Chicken and said I could wait for more Salt & Pepper Chicken if I wanted since I turned down the other available items on the line. Everything looked dry and old. A couple minutes later the lady at the register walked over with my food after paying $13.

I'm really disappointed by what I found in the container when I reached my desk. The portions are much smaller, which I'm fine with. The cost has gone up since I've been here last and clearly the quality doesn't match the price. I won't be back. I'll let the photo speak for me. I also have video of me throwing the entire container in the trash.

I ordered a medium Mongolian beef with a side entree of orange chicken on white rice. I also tried the egg roll and crab rangoon. It came to just under $16. Nice portion sizes. Felt very full probably could have gotten a smaller order and still been full but wanted to try a couple things as my first time. The orange chicken had a nice kick to it. Mongolian beef was okay. The sauce was a bit runnier than I would like. It tastes fine but I preferred the orange chicken. Both the egg roll and crab rangoon had a lot of filling and great flavor. I added spicy mustard to the egg roll because that's my favorite. For downtown location it's reasonably priced, good portions, and great flavor. I recommend if in the area
An fast food restaurant… truly fast food. I was in and out within 15 minutes. If you are really hungry and can’t wait in-line. This is the place. Average quality of food.

I love this place so hard!   All the ladies (!!!) that run this place are so sweet, the dishes are tasty and reasonably-priced, and the fact that you can choose from multiple sides is so clutch.

I generally order multiple medium entrees, with different sides, then eat off all of it for days.

Place is spotless, organised, and they've got a great selection of add-on beverages.

A staple for me.

If I could put negative stars I would, this review is long overdue.  You ALWAYS have to ask for more on your sandwich or salad, they are stingy (actually counting the portions out).  I just paid $13 for a half bowl of a sad looking salad, and a little cup of soup.  Pathetic.  Used to go here a lot, looked past it, but never again.

I work in the same building (500 W. Madison) and I gladly walk over the Subway on Clinton street to get my subs, instead of this store. The subs here are made hastily and soups are watered down so much that you cannot avoid feeling ripped-off.

I am a vegetarian and do not appreciate subway workers not changing gloves after making meat sandwiches.  Any time i point this out to them and ask them to change their gloves they frown, give me this disgusted look and on most occasions just toss my sandwich aside and ask someone else to make it.  I must have visited atleast 15subways in the last 2years and this is by far the worst.  Being a vegetarian and expecting some basic subway etiquettes from these folks seems to overwhelm them..
The girl working this morning made me the perfect salad! I had lots of specific requests and she was more than accommodating--also had a nice sense of humor. Give her a raise!!
Cheapest footlong sub is $9, they don't have specials or honor coupons. No free refils. Go to a different subway.

What an amazing place, from when I place the order on the app until I had it in my hands, was a total of 10 minutes. Talk about efficiency, the staff was friendly and amazing as well! Great Job Wing Stop!! Def making it a frequent stop, I'm in the neighborhood so feel free to invite me over for dinner from time to time! Lol 😆

Restaurant is short staffed but my hat tips off to the 4 staff members keeping it open and running today. My order was hot and ready on time and even though some customers were rude the girl behind the counter getting the orders ready still managed to be nice and courteous. The boy handling the register and taking orders was also very nice and the older man getting the chicken ready and the boy cooking it all worked together nicely.

Have been calling since September 13 about a refund. Both girls were rude on the phone and tried not to offer me a refund. They talked to the manager and they say I will receive a refund within 7-10 days. It’s goes by and still no refund for food that was NOT picked up. I call past the 10 days leave my name and number and the girl says their manager will call me and that was on September 23. Today is October 11, still no call or refund. This place has horrible customer service and is very rude.

When I called wingstop they told me they're only taking walk in and online orders when I get there she tells me I have to wait I wait about 25 minutes then she tells me when she takes my orders gonna be another 25 minutes I told her no problem she says give me a second comes back 10 minutes later and tells me I have to place my order online that she's the only one there. When I told her that she had me waiting there for an hour she said I can take it or leave it thank you wingstop for showing great customer service not never will go there again find new employees that really want to work there

My first time at this location definitely the best Ashley R took my order shes amazing! customer service, my wings everything was great ! exactly the way I wanted them nice & crispy nothing was left out & everything was ready quick definitely will be going back thank you Ashley! ☺️❤️

I had the BBQ Chicken Wrap on my first visit to Pockets. I thought the wrap was good overall. In my opinion, it seemed a bit heavy on the lettuce vs chicken ratio. Wrap, chips, and a can of pop were about $15.

This place is AWESOME. Had a Southwest pocket sandwich, and the Gobbler hot sandwich and both were amazing. Super fresh, clean environment, and really good flavors. Not your average salad restaurant, will definitely return to try more of the menu.

Also kind and quick service!

If you’re wanting to eat healthy.  This is the place to go! Delicious and creative meals with natural selections. As someone with dietary restrictions and living that organic lifestyle, this was my go to place fast casual restaurant in Chicago. It’s awesome to have a healthy food option! While I appreciate that and the food was decent One of the best healthy foods. Ordered original pocket. Food was awesome and on point. Food was fresh and everything was well thought out. Great taste. Great vegan and vegetarian food Excellent service. Excellent food menu with way too many options! Impressively menu. Employees are so friendly and very professional.  It was fantastic service. Would definitely be back again.
Excellent food and a clean restaurant. Lettuce is always very fresh and flavorful. One of my new favorite lunch spots because there are so many great menu options!
One of the few healthy fast food options in west loop. Good wraps and sandwiches. The brown butter rice crisps is a go-to if you crave a cheat treat too.

Most flavorful fried rice I’ve had in Chicago… extremely tasty…

Strong value, too! after tax a large serving of fried comes to ~$16 and I felt like it could feed four hungry people! Felt a pint of tightly packed fried rice. Would certainly stop by again with a big appetite (or just order a small haha)

Hands down the best fried rice we tasted in Chicago(or Illinois)!! Can't believe we stayed in the uptown area for more than an year and didn't come across this place. It's really word of mouth marketing or if you happen to cross that place by chance, which is how we discovered it. It's right next to Wilson red line cta stop. Also, if you like spicy, the spicier version is much better than regular version. Guess our hunt for the best fried rice in town is finally over!!!
Best fried rice in town and they always fill it up!
Their shrimp fried rice it the best I've ever tasted in my life! The smoothies are as equally great! 😋 my goodness! Well done guys!

Crab Rangoon was fantastic. Shrimp fried rice was plentiful. Nice cook on the shrimp. Each ingredient added to the fried rice.

Well done
I wanted to try a new place and Raw II did not disappoint. The maki was great. Try the seaweed salad. It was super good. Definitely recommend.

Actually ended up here because next door (don't even remember what that was) was busy.  SO glad we came here!  The atmosphere was warm and inviting and the staff were helpful and informative, and the pictures of the food looked so good. The amount of food is excellent for the value as the prices are pretty fair.  Foods like crispy pork with Chinese broccoli (add sunny side egg on top), good selection of noodles (dried beef noodles and drunken noodle was a favorite) vegetable stir fry, and cream cheese wontons were all worth coming back for.

This place is the best in the neighborhood. Sushi is fresh and tasty. Soups are delicious, (Tom Yum is fantastic)! Poke bowl is fresh and will not disappoint. Polite owner and friendly staff. I’m so glad to be so close to this establishment. 5-Stars!
I wanted to try a new place and Raw II did not disappoint. The service is fast and friendly. The food is delicious.

This restaurant is currently open for takeout only. Their sushi is rather than average, as well as there is a sashimi. I had the seaweed salad which has generous in size (and sweetness unfortunately).
Got the regular thin crust and I must say pretty great pizza! Great cheese, amazing crust! Not too thick and not too thin! Definitely recommend.

I love the whole staff & JOJO IS THE BEST !!!!! Her food the drinks the atmosphere the live music!!!!! It is a good time has by all and you make new friends all the time. Come see what a great place this really is

Ordered an extra thin and crispy garlic butter pizza through GrubHub and this is what I received. In what world is this extra thin and crispy?? Also put regular pizza sauce on it instead of the garlic butter🤣🤣 2 stars because the clam chowder was good

Great place to stop by and grab a pizza and beverage of your choice. Parking can be a bit of a pain, the lot is rather small but still worth stopping by. Prices are fair and the food is really tasty. They occasionally have live music as well, and the acts are pretty good too.

First time visitor, had the pizza by the slice, gooey cheese had good flavors, perfect amount of sauce which stayed hot down to the last bite, crust was nice and crunchy. For a quick bite with bar atmosphere, can get a bit loud, it's spot on for indulging in good ol Chicago style pizza.

Really skillful, relaxing and tasty place! The iced Thai bubble tea was an excellent caramel flavor and appreciated the soft tapioca balls. The beef skewer appetizer was savory with a great crispy edge. My friend and I shared the lemon grass beef ban mi and the cubed filet mignon which was juicy and very flavorful, every bite was great. Had the flan for dessert and loved the texture and presentation.

The restaurant is well designed with a calm and laid back atmosphere, music (smooth jazz) is at a perfect volume for enjoying without  overwhelming, tables and chairs were very comfortable as well.

Great service, the staff are very friendly and polite, they made us feel very welcome and appreciated. Can't wait to be back to try more!

You know you are in a good Vietnamese restaurant when there are Vietnamese customers, the nice aroma of fish sauce lingering and a young kid sitting in a booth behind a pile of plates and napkins studying and playing games on his phone. The service was quick and too the point. The food came out promptly with a generous portion of sides. Everything tasted perfect, full of flavour and texture.

Hands down the best Bo La Lot (Hawaiian leaf beef sausage) in town. This is my go to place when I crave for Bo La Lot. The service is always amazing and fast. If you haven’t tried this Vietnamese dish yet, please do yourself a favor and try it. It requires some wrapping so be prepared to get your hands dirty. I promise you it will be worth it.

Some of my favourite Vietamese-Chinese dishes!

If you come here these are the dishes I recommend!  And come here to do family-style dining rather than individual dishes per person.

Hawaiian Leaf Beef Sausage Rolls, Steam Seabass with ginger-scallion, or the whole Red Snapper with pickled veggies sauce!  I also always get the Water Spinach stir fried with garlic...a simple dish, but hard to find a place that does it as flavourful as this place does!

Don't get me wrong, they also have on the menu ala carte dishes like Pho noodle soup, rice dishes, and Vermicelli Noodle Bowls. And they are good.  But I think these dishes are what makes this place stand out!

This place is well known for their bò lá lốt and you definitely would order so that you roll it your self and make to add bánh hỏi to your order. Their dipping sauce for each dish is unique authentic and delicious. We ordered:
- grilled beef skewer with lemongrass (fragrant and yummy, perfect to use in wraps too)
- grilled beef wrapped in grape leaf seed (smoky and delicious, def wrap your own and add bánh hỏi)
- bánh bèo (average but the sauce that comes with is addictive)
- bánh bột lọc(good and filling, love the sauce)
- vietnamese ice coffee
- sugar cane juice (refreshing, must get!)
They were busy and it took a bit long to get our orders in but would come back again!

Came here on a Friday night; great outdoor seating!

Food- $6-$8 burgers, add about $3 to make it a combo.

I had the turkey burger with cranberry sauce. Messy experience but incredibly delicious and juicy burger! Add 50 cents for a pretzel bun- worth it! Although the bun could have been a little burger and toasted- love the crispy crunch of a toasted bun! Service is very quick too! I got my food in about 10 minutes!!

Easy street parking, highly recommend! One of the few burger places that doesn't have waiter service.

More of a order up front then sit down and wait type of place.  I tried the chicken burger which was pretty tasty. We ordered the fried green beans which were also good.  I liked the truffle fries and thought it was reasonably priced for what you get.  I will try burger philosophy again.

If you like a moist tasty burger in your mouth... try BP.

A very tasty BBQ burger with an ah-mazing chocolate shake. Thick and yummy + big portions.

The workers are attentive, prompt to wipe down tables once vacated. Multiple times they came over to check on us. Bike parking is decent.
Really great burger for a moderate price. They give you a ton of food for your money, the place is plain but the food speaks for itself. The "Good Morning Chicago" is a piece of art.

The burgers are ok, the fries are good but the service is an absolute joke. It took about an hour to get two burgers with fries. The couple with kids who ordered after me got their  food and were half done eating before the cashier came out and asked me what I ordered... You don't know what I ordered? Well then why did you give me this stand with number 56, just for fun? After fumbling about for a few minutes, I'm handed a bag with a someone else's grubhub receipt. I say I think you gave me someone else's order but it was actually my order. So I get home only to find out the order is wrong... I go back, get one of the burgers remade and finally receive the aioli after asking 3 times... The food isn't bad, it's just not worth dealing with these fools.
Ordering or picking food up from this place during the Covid-19 is not the best experience. Since May it's even got worse.

The worst McDonalds in America. It was so dirty. The employees were so slow. I was late getting back to work because it took them 15 minutes to serve the 3 people in front of me. I thought I was gonna get mugged and I was asked for money from people in the restaurant multiple times. Ugh never go here.
My husband ordered a bacon breakfast meal, which comes with 2 slices of bacon, and this is what they gave him. 1 slice of bacon broken in half. SMH. First and last time here.

I have tried to give this McDonald's the benefit of the doubt but every time I have to go into this location they have people wait in one line. Their AC has been down for a long time. During this COVID times they shouldn't be having to keep a small place crowded. The AC should be working. They need to hire more staff to keep the customers moving.

Horrible customer service at the managerial level. This McDonald's finds ways to cut corners and not provide customers with full items on menu. As I was told they "have their own way of doing things" depsite what is evident on the McDonald's website.

This place was so great! Bright my husband up to Chicago for his birthday and this started it off right. Super yummy pizza. Light crunch on the crust. Very cheesy! Calzone was so yummy. Real ingredients speak for themselves. No need to add a bunch of stuff if you're dealing with the best. Reminded me of my Aunt's cooking. Definitely recommend this place. Thank you!

As I was walking by this restaurant I smelled the welcoming aroma of cheese and fresh baked bread that I had to enter and get a slice of the good stuff..  I ordered a slice of their Deep dish cheese pizza to go and I wasn't so impressed 😔

Though their service was really nice, the pizza wasn't the Chicago deep dish I thought it out to be. It was quite cheesy, but the base was over bearing and dry.

Probably a one time try for me .

It’s not the best pizza....it’s not the worst. I probably wouldn’t come here again—shouldn’t have gone in the first place, but for a big deep dish slice for  $6.69 (including tax), I thought, “why not, I’m hungry and feeling like pizza”.

The crust is breaddy and lacks flavor (I had to add pepper flakes, oregano, and parm’). The pizza was warm—because of a reheat, but cheese was a little burnt and not cheesy.

I ordered a deep dish pizza and wings for delivery on Saturday at 4pm. I ordered via their online system, which was a pain in of itself. The user interface is very user unfriendly. I couldn’t scroll up the menu without the triggering webpage refresh on mobile. Refreshing the page also emptied the check out cart, so it took several tries to get my order right online using mobile.
My order qualified for the free garlic knots coupon they had on their website and their brochure, and I made sure it was in my order when I was through ordering it.
At 5:15pm my order was delivered...without the garlic knots. I called the restaurant immediately to report this, and was met with a nonchalant “oh, well it didn’t show up on our end. We’ll make it up to you next time.” And I said “what do you mean?”
“Well do you want to come pick them up or...?”

I said there won’t be a next time. I’ve always been more of a Lou Malnati’s fan anyway. Food itself is good, my only recommendation is to call your orders in to the restaurant itself and go for pick up instead of using their online service using mobile.

Ps: the deep dish pizza I got is NOT deep dish. It’s just regular pizza with a thicker crust. I’ll be ordering from Lou’s in the future instead.
We ordered a deep dish 12-inch. Ingredients tasted fresh and the pie was perfectly seasoned. Awesome service and nice, cozy locale. Will definitely visit again.

First of this is our first time ordering from here Robinson's No. 1 Ribs. My husband wanted ribs while I order pizza from one of our favorite place. He was excited because the were smoked and not baked ribs ( how he likes them). After getting home with the ribs and the pizza was delivered we sat and started to eat.
