I took one bite of the ribs and I spit it out. It was salty and dry.. I also order chicken tenders and they were dry. Both felt like they were just reheated and served..

But I will also acknowledge that the staff was supper friendly and went out of the way to comply with my demands.. I will rate them 5 ⭐ for their great service.

Robinson Ribs was at the Taste of Chicago July 2022. They had boneless rib sandwich on the menu so I split this with my friend instead of trying to do ribs and fries b/c we didn't want fries. Well, the sandwich seemed like a thin patty from costco's no rib taste. The McRib would have been better than this. I see it's on their regular menu too. Sad because wanted to enjoy them I see another review said the ribs weren't good so you may want to eat somewhere else instead.

The BBQ was delicious! Ordering was a bit challenging with masks, accents, and my general grogginess to work through but I wasn't bothered until they forgot to give me my German chocolate cake . The size of the slice made up for that mistake. 😋 Of course, I might be biased. Had a juicy pulled chicken sandwich, coleslaw, and baked beans here after 2 days of Amtrak lounge snacks.

Surprisingly good pulled pork for a random place in the train station. The fries leaves much to be desired. Overall if you need something at the train station and don't want McDonald's or a sub it's worth a try.
this hidden gem in Union Station food court has some of the best tips in the city! you can also get all other delicious BBQ: pulled pork, ribs, hot links, chicken, etc, etc...  😋🔥🍗🫕🍴

This is the original home of deep dish pizza and an absolute must eat. This is by far Chicago's best deep dish pizza I have had and I've tried all the others(no need to name them). Plus, the wings are really really good too! Dining area is small and fills up quick, but we'll worth the wait. If in downtown Chicago, make sure to eat here; can't say that enough. I'll be back for sure next time I'm in Chicago.

I came to Chicago open minded and wanting to try their famous deep dish pizza.

I first tried Giordano's stuffed pizza.  I was in for a surprise.  they use pie dough instead of real pizza dough.  A real disappointment.  I had to try another place...

So I searched for the original place, where it all started: Uno!  So instead of a stuffed pizza, they serve real deep dish pizza.  Better overall, better toppings, but...  Still that pie dough!  I will never get why Chicagoans use pie dough instead of real pizza dough.  For me, it was better reheated the next day in the microwave, really weird pizza...

You still have to try it, it's just not for me.

Came in on a chilly Thursday afternoon straight from the airport.  We were greeted by a very nice server and a bartender. The restaurant wasn't busy.

We ordered small pizza Uno ($21.99 as of January 2022) and an appetizer "shrimp and crab dip" ($12.99). They warn you that the pizza takes about 40 minutes to be made and they mean it.

Shrimp and crab dip was amazing. Very creamy and served hot.
A small pizza is divided into 4 very generous slices, and one was plenty for me. It tasted kinda homemade, which I liked.

Overall, good experience and great food!

Haven’t had deep dish pizza since probably since 2003. Too enjoyable of an experience.
Came here with a colleague and we both sincerely enjoyed our pizzas. Staff was great. Pricing was good too for what you get. Part of the Chicago experience

This is by far the best pizza I have had. The birthplace of deep dish pizza. The pizza was so delicious that I even enjoyed eating the crust. This place is a must visit when you ever visit Chicago. The staff was courteous and friendly! Cozy place… great place to rendezvous with friends and family.

Ordered Ino's (via Grubhub) for delivery. It was my first time having Ino's, and I am pleasantly surprised at how good it was. Their delivery service was really fast for being at least 3 miles from our location, and their delivery guy actually walked up the three flights of stairs to our apartment instead of waiting at the bottom like most delivery persons (big perk).

Food itself was good. Garlic bread was crispy on the outside, soft on the inside and not over cooked or too buttery. Pan-pizza required a fork for the first few bites, but the crust-to-topping ratio was perfect. Enough toppings for flavor, but not so much that the crust couldn't support it.

Decent price, they do have some deals if you call in, tasty pizza, and great delivery. They're added to this apartment's pizza delivery rotation.

Ino's Pizzeria is small pizza and sandwich shop in Edgewater, located in the former GaztroWagon storefront on North Clark Street. The name comes from the middle name of the proprietor, Rene. His middle name is "Innocente," and from that, they get their nifty name.

The storefront only seats about 10 people, but it is well-kept, and is a decent place to hang out and enjoy a casual meal or to wait while your to-go order is prepared. They have a rather expansive menu, but I've latched-on to their pan pizza. The pan pizza is rather hefty, with a nice crust that is a bit more dense than you'd find at Lou Malnati's, but the pizza is similar to Lou's style. The sauce is on top of the cheese, and the outer crust has a nice, buttery chewiness to it. They don't skimp on the toppings, either. I typically get mine with pepperoni, mushrooms and onions, and the onion chunks are nice and thick - not stringy like you'd find at a chain pizza restaurant. The mushrooms and pepperoni are plentiful, too. The pizza is great hot, but any leftovers also hold up well when re-heated at home.

The thin crust pizza is a bit more standard fare. I think the crust of the "thin crust" is a bit too thick for my tastes, but it is still a decent pie. I think that, if you want to get a pie from Ino's, go for the pan pizza.

In addition to pizzas, they also have lots of soups, sandwiches, salads, and other items. I've had the philly cheese steak, and it was excellent. Their soups are also quite tasty.

The service there is very friendly. The staff are always willing to strike-up a conversation and make you feel welcome. If you're in the neighborhood, I recommend that you give Ino's a try.

Every time I've ordered from this place my food arrives in a reasonable amount of time and hot! :-)  The staff is very friendly. I've gone to pick up my food on a couple occasions and found the place to be very quaint and clean with a small neighborhood feel. It' right on Clark street so very convenient for people in the community. And the food is very good!
Oh no closed! Ino's was SO good and SO cheap!

They moved one door down into a completely brand new space. It’s brighter and more updated. The working space also feels cleaner. Glad they’re back after a long renovation hiatus! Same great team as before.

I tried their newer location on 10/8/22 sometime in the later part of the afternoon. The place was bigger and more staff from the lasts time I visited with the older and much smaller location before. The staff was friendly and fast, the food was set up properly, cleanliness with plenty of meat to spare. Plus, I lucked out, one of the customers in line gave me a coupon for two footlong Subs for $12.99.

Subway is the healthiest and greatest deal I've had in Chicago NIH National Institute of Health recommends for one to eat 40% of their diet should be fruits and vegetables one Subway alone 6 in easily takes care of that requirement I like the deal bogo 50 buy one get one 50% off 2 ft longs for under $15 how could you beat that plus 175 points when you a amass 200 points it's $2 less at the cashier how could you beat that I'll always be a Subway fan cuz I have a voracious appetite

It was open, and I was hungry. That gets one stars. I was saved by what I realized was the manager, as she'd ask me a question, and then turn to another employee while I was answering,turn back to me and ask the same question again. She just walked away after handing me my receipt with my sandwich still on her side of the register. I reached over the register to get it and left. Another feature is the locked restroom which require a pin code to enter.

Whenever I've stopped here for food the people working here have been very rude and unhelpful to me. Every other Subway in the country that I have been to have had very friendly workers most of whom will go out of their way to strike up a conversation with me. Not this place though. The food tasted pretty good at least and the restaurant seemed clean. Something else that is not the restaurants fault was the other customers eating there had the look of hate in their eyes.

Checking in... Was on a diet and haven't ordered from here in over 6 months.. Very happy to report that the slices are still solid as ever (solid means that they taste good and they are big, not the best ever had) AND the soup was unfreakingbelievable as always.... Now I know how I initially gained so much weight after moving a block away a couple of years ago. Haters going to hate but all things weighed equal, for the money, this place is a solid choice.
Really the best thin crust in Buena Park...and yes, it is tastier than Michael's!

Ordered for pickup. It accepted my order online and charged my card, but when I walked there they were closed, and it was over an hour before their posted closing time.

Edit: Called and spoke with owner. Order was fulfilled at a later date.
Great Cajun pasta.. thin crust pizza wasn’t that good — too hard.

Placed an order for pickup today, during the hours that are posted on google and the website. Order went through and my card was charged, it didn’t state that they were closed anywhere. Got there and it was closed, I couldn’t see where on the door the updates hours are. This was the second time something like this has occurred.

I really liked our appetizers and my ramen bowl here. Had to dock a point because the vegetarian ramen (which is supposedly one of the best veggie ramen options in the city) was a bit too busy (a lot of vegetables and flavors going on). If you’re looking for traditional ramen fare, definitely hit them up. Delicious!

Hot bowl of rich noodle soup is always welcome in the dead of winter! Casual intimate space, fast & friendly service.
👍Spicy garlic shoyumen: deliciously deep broth with delightfully chewy wavy noodles & house-made hakata noodles. Just the right amount of spicy kick. So much broth leftover I ordered another side of noodles to go, excited to have it again the next day!

A must try ramen spot in the heart of Wicker Park Chicago! Minimalist design, with strong wooden accents, and small like other authentic Japanese ramen joints. Definitely different than my other favorite ramen spots, including the noodles. Walked in at a perfect time, 545pm on a cold Saturday. Shortly after, a ton of people came trickling in and had to wait. I do not think this place has reservations. Pictured here are the Sake Caliente aka Hot Sake, Buns: Goki (highly recommend!) and 6hrs Pork Shoulder - all come with more ingredients than the bun! - and had the Umami Ramen which was a Spicy Level 2 and had more room for spicyness. Can't wait for the next visit.

Favorite ramen spot in Chicago!  First time coming here and it was great! Our food came out very fast,  everything was hot and tasty. The prok belly is so tender you don't need teeth to eat it, just falls apart in your mouth. I had the spicy garlic dish and it was the perfect amount of spice.

Really enjoyed our warm bowls of ramen on this windy spring day in Chicago. We popped in last minute before visiting some nearby shops and were enormously pleased with the quality of food and service.

Hot garbage. No mobile ordering. No deals. Just surly employees making sub-mediocre product. My burger bun was crispy stale. Like, how… the hell… does a burger place let their buns go bad?!?

Place is filthy. Fingerprints all over front door, sticky surfaces.

G. R. O. S. S.

Never ordered, mobile coupons not accepted.
Wait... Mobile coupons not accepted? Yeah, no soup for you! (Seinfeld world today)

Let's start with the pros. The service was good and the food was fresh and hot. They seemed to be preparing orders in the order they were taken and no one seemed to be waiting a ridiculous amount of time (even during lunch hour). Now the cons; they have NO shakes or ice cream (despite them being on the menu). At least not yet. Hopefully they plan on getting that together soon. Second, they just had bags of buns sitting open on the counter between the register and the toaster which I thought wasn't the best set up. They should implement a better storage solution for that. Lastly, I ordered 2 cookies since they had no shakes. The cashier pulled out a pouch of cookies from a clear bin and bagged them for me. They were not only not fresh, but hard as a brick! I didn't even eat them. Again, hoping this gets better with time as well. Overall, I see that they are trying and it is nice to have a BK in the area. I will be back, just not any time soon. I will give this place some time to work out the kinks and get the error out of the trial.

First time trying the impossible Whopper in drive thru. Tasty, but even in an insulated container the warmth didn't survive 2 miles in light traffic. The burger was good the fries were cold. Would eat again, but onsite.
The ladies working last Friday are true model employees. They were busy, under staffed & still polite & smiling. Food was on point. Clean. Give those girls a bonus!

I’m surprised to see so many negative reviews - it seems like maybe they struggle with delivery. But my dine-in order was really good and the service and space were both lovely. The beans and rice are really tasty, and the steak in my tacos is super flavorful. Everything is soft, wonderfully cooked, and very tasty.
My boyfriend and I stopped in last night after hitting up a few of neighborhood bars. Great burritos, excellent service, and an absolutely wonderful staff. Highly recommend if you’re on Clark!

Seriously one of the best enchilada meals I have had. I'm not one for the beans but these were fantastic! I ate so much food here in one sitting I was in a food coma, I didn't want to leave. Service was great, quick, made great suggestions for ordering (I asked).

We have order before from here and the food was great, until today we reorder from there and the food had a nasty old taste, we pretty much had to call back and complaint, and the food also looks pretty old, it literally had a taste you will probably not want to ever eat again here!!!

Me and my Dad weren't having the best of walks through andersonville.. El Ranchito came in and saved the day! Amazing food (so juicy and delicious) and excellent service. Some other authentic Mexican restaurants did not allow us to use the bathroom, access some menu items etc. The waiter here was excellent and did not care that we were white. Highly recommended!

Walking home and I hear the voice growing louder….I thought I was being followed but instead it was my stomach telling me to stop. I passed a burrito joint, a Hawaiian spot, a NYC pizza slice of Heaven before I decide to indulge in sushi. Indulging is exactly what I did!  Best of Both Worlds, Krunchi and Edamame hit the spot like no other choice this night could of. Great service as I sat at the sushi bar. Ordered and everything came as expected. A taste of each and it blew my taste buds to foodie heaven. Definitely a must go to in Lincoln Park. I lived four years in Japan and the sushi here made my stomach stop speaking.
This place is always amazing. Best soft shell crab app. Sashimi was great. Innovative rolls you can't find anywhere else like them. BYOB!!!

AWESOME SUSHI !!!
For all sushi lovers highly recommend 👌
Service is always great 👍

Toro has been our top sushi place in Lincoln Park if not the city for some time now.  We have been going to them for over 10 years, and there is not a time Mitch and team disappoint.  From the unique rolls (Kamikazee, yellow submarine, and sunny) to the fresh pieces - you really can't go wrong.  The funniest is talking to  others about it and hearing their passion even if you haven't ever gone there with them.  While dining in is the best, don't forget about the takeout to "get your fix."  They do an amazing job!
Yellow submarine roll was the best. Great quality fish. I'd give 4.5 if i could!

Located just a block south of Willis Tower, this is a nice place to blow off some steam after a hard day of in-person work in the loop. The specials menu for food and drinks keeps rotating and is really nice. the ambience is lively and the music will not overpower conversations. I've tried their soups, burgers, beers and sides and they're all great. I'd recommend the spinach artichoke dip with pita! the only downside is the price point. it's a bit expensive (~$30 per person)
Relaxed bar with a huge draft beer selection. Awesome everyday happy hour specials. Service is attentive and extremely fast.

Behind this cooler is the manager on duty. His staff smiled when I asked if the manager was adtessing the issue, obviously they felt comfy in his leadership. WORK HERE, the food & experience they deliver is why I came here from 200Km away when I needed a day away. I trust these folks!

Nice place with good staff. Our server was funny and put up with our jokes and joked right along with us. We appreciated that.

Really good food. Decent parking nearby. It’s not too loud. Good spacing between the tables. Heck of a drink selection.

Quick stop at Franklin Tap. Service is always friendly and fast no matter what time you arrive. Great beers on tap, cans or bottles. Tried the  Revolution Peanut Butter Eugene Porter 6.8 ABV and Surly Darkness Russian Imperial Stout 12.5 ABV. Both are rich, tasty and refreshing with a roasted malt. Get some today.

A couple of weeks ago we were going to have some Mexican food at La Choza on Clark St., unfortunately, they had a small fire, and they are close, so, we looked for another restaurant on Clark, we found El Charro. This place has very authentic Guadalajara-style food. No, it’s not a Michelin star restaurant but they do have very decent and flavorful Mexican food. Very reasonably priced and you can bring your beer or wine.  Anyone looking for decent food at a very reasonable price, order or go to El Charro.

The tacos didn't stand a chance. They tasted sooo good. Even though the place was small and packed. The service and the waitress really took care a business and she wasn't bad on the eyes. Keep up the good work, definitely will be back.

Are you kidding me are you kidding me this place is so good oh my God the chips and salsa they gave you like three different kinds four different kinds of salsa definitely 420 approved phenomenal best food I've had since post-covid. Thank you for a great experience oh there are horchata is to die for also they make their own ice cream bars

So about that Al Pastor!?!?!? Fire!!! Absolute fuego. Best Al Pastor I’ve ever tried with no exaggeration. I hope it wasn’t just a one time thing as this was my 1st time there lol but definitely loved that all sauces were flavorful and spicy as well. Customer service was solid! Made sure to leave a tip. Oh and the limes were fresh and so juicy.

I’m convinced people do not know good food. I came here b/c the reviews were good but again a waste of hard earned money. The chips were stale, rice was dry and the steak for my tacos was chewy. Smh don’t believe the hype. People haven’t had good food before. Smh. Not good. It’s funny b/c I knew it wasn’t going to be good when I walk in b/c of the smell of the restaurant.

Excellent bar staff. Very knowledgeable and passionate in creating numerous cocktails from their volume of recipes/menu. The bartenders are also willing to go "off menu" and play with some creative cocktails based on a few questions of your likes and dislikes. I've sampled from both the regular menu and the bartender choice and I infinitely prefer the bartender choice, mostly because of the enthusiasm displayed by the bartender as they whip-up something special. Food menu is very limited but delicious.
Beautiful bar, friendly staff, amazing food and drinks. Quiet atmosphere. The seating lends itself to small groups. You can have a conversation and relax without feeling crowded or eavesdropped.

Edit: I do really love the cocktails here, but the past several times I have visited, the service has been very very slow and not a very up beat vibe. Last time, one of my friends waited at least 30 mins for her drink with no explanation. Tonight when we visited, my date and I sat at the bar and for 15 minutes no one acknowledged us (except someone who brought us water but didn't say a word). Several people were working frantically behind the bar (it looked like only one poor guy was actually making drinks though  - on Valentine's night). Finally I said something to a bartender/barback and he took our order but it made me anxious to have to sit there for so long and for no one to even speak to us!

I totally understand if you are busy especially on a holiday, but acknowledging customers and explaining that you're busy would be very helpful and help me feel better about paying the higher prices for drinks too. After we got our drinks the main bartender did say they were just slammed, so I do appreciate that, but I wish he had said that while we were waiting for someone to at least look at us for the first 15 mins... 😬

Original review:
Delicious cocktails. Great spot for a date or to get a drink with friends when you're wanting a nicer drink. Very expansive cocktail menu.

Low key, dimly-lit cocktail bar with a speakeasy atmosphere. There's a piano and pool table upstairs. There was a small group of flapper girls when I went in one evening and it really played up to the 20's vibe. Loved it!

An absurd amount of excellent cocktails. Romantic feel inside. Bartenders are friendly but leave you alone because, romance. :) Almost everyone in there is on a date - I probably wouldn't bring a pack of bros inside but maybe one bro.  :)
Amazing food!! Staff here is kind and very friendly. The food was clearly cooked fresh and paired well with a glass of wine. I highly recommend this ristorante!

We came shortly after they opened after the bears preseason game on a Saturday. My Dad is the only person who has been here before. Service was top notch. EVERYONE in there is friendly and outgoing. Our server was excellent. The Owner came over just to say hi and introduce himself. The food is excellent. We had Calamari for an appetizer. It was wonderful. I had Cheese Tortellini with marinara, my father had Meat Tortellini in meat sauce, and my cousins had the Chicken a la Tippi and the stuffed artichoke. All of the food was delicious. My cousin was raving that it was the best stuffed artichoke she's ever had. Would go back again and again!

I found this place online today and had to have a girls dinner here immediately. I felt like I was at somebody Italian grandma house. Every worker was friendly, sweet and kind. We had the veal parmigian with alfredo and lemon chicken (I forgot the actual name). The food was delicious though and the portions were huge. Also, the server gave us chocolate covered cherries that she made, as a complimentary treat, and they were real good.  I will definitely be back here

DELIZIOSA”””
A wonderful classic Italian restaurant with food to match.
Calamari perfection. Whitefish Vesuvio,incredibly fresh. Italian beef sandwich good. Last but not least homemade cannoli, couldn’t be better.
Pricing very reasonable.Quality top notch.Decor homey and comfortable.
On street parking can be difficult.
AWARDED 2.5 YUMS ON A SCALE OF 3
Great thin crust crispy tavern-style pizza with proportionate toppings.....Just too much sauce......Excellent chicken marsala

I ordered takeout sandwiches from here twice. It was always ready to go on time and the sandwiches are pretty delicious. Will definitely try their other dishes. Quick service during the lunch rush too!

It's your standard corner bakery. It's fast casual.

I went on a weekday afternoon about 12:30 and there was a pretty long line.  It did seem to move relatively quickly but I would recommend ordering early and you can just go straight to the front and grab your bag of food.  They close it with a sticker so others cannot tamper with it.
CB is a fav of mine. You can get better mac & cheese plus the salads and soups are terrific and available in large and small sizes. Service is fast and friendly.
Ordered the Berry & Almond overnight oats (which I have gotten more than 100 times) and this was the worst.  watery with no flavor. only good thing was the raisin bread.
Very quaint atmosphere. Employees are very amiable. The pesto was scrumptious and the Wonton salad was tasteful. Vegan and vegetarian options available, 10/10 would recommend.
Very nice service, terrible bagel. That’s the everything bagel I ordered yesterday but couldn’t eat so put it in my fridge until I got hungry enough for a dry, stale, everythingless bagel.

Ordered a small shake via the drive thru. The menu board says $5.99. I get my receipt which says $6.79. When I asked the staff about the discrepancy, the answer was “oh yeah, the manager raised the prices.” When I commented the menu board was inaccurate they just said “yeah.” Then my $7 shake (after tax)was a huge glass of milk with less than a scoop of ice cream blended in. All I could taste was the milk.

The manager there is very rude and disrespectful! she literally yelled at her employees in front of the customers. The service isn't good at all. Many time they have been out of certain items which doesn't make sense why they would be out so many times. Ever since the last 2 red shirt supervisor left, the store has gone downhill badly. Who ever the owners are, they need to fix this problem ASAP

Drinks are great, but be careful at this location. They charged me 1000% (yes, 1000%) more than they should have when I've gone there. I reached out to customer service and they did not help. Please double check your app after you pay so this doesn't happen to you.

Top of the line employees, trainees should have more time
Only my observation but that's what I do, I  consult on store environments haven't meant owner...its managed well, and pretty quick on busy days no drive in and under staffed at times..the crew early or late afternoon work well together...

So again I enjoy my interactions
But critique a little to much

The place is cozy and you’re seated quickly. The food comes outs fast and is delicious! The portions are massive! We got the platter for 2 people but couldn’t finish it. This is one of my favourite Ethiopian dinners! I would highly recommend this gem.

Yes! Yes! Yes! Some of the best Ethiopian food I've had. Chill atmosphere and good people too. I had the vegetarian sample platter (I'm not vegetarian) and I didn't miss the meat! All of it was so flavorful, well seasoned and just enough.

I worked in Ethiopia off and on for two years, and in between, I would bring people to Ethiopian Diamond to share the experience with friends in Chicago. The food here is great, the atmosphere is laid back, and the large dining room feels inviting to me. This visit we started off with a small coffee pot, which they served with small cups and some sugar. We ordered some sambusa savory pastries, two filled with meats and one with veggies and one with lentils as an appetizer. Then we had the meat sampler plate, which came with 3 meats and 3 vegetarian offerings in a platter of the injera bread, and a platter of four more rolled injera. There was some salad in the middle of the platter too. Everything tasted great, the service was quiet and prompt, with frequent water fills since we stayed a long time given they weren't busy. Overall, a great choice for Ethiopian dining.

incredible food, welcoming atmosphere!! I’m gluten free and didn’t have any issues finding dishes to eat on the menu. Great price for large portions and food that feels (and tastes) home cooked. Will definitely be back again!!

That’s nice!
Food for everyone
Veggie, seafood, chicken etc
“Bread” is delicious and honey wine 🤍
I can drink from alcohol just this taj
Something really different in Chicago
Dessert is also nice
Servers was great both times!
I did not get all my food so I will not be ordering from this place ever again.  It is not worth the money!!! This place sucks!!!

We arrived at this spot for dinner. we heard about this restaurant from many people.  Well, we were not disappointed. The crew welcomed us with a smile and we had a fantastic feeling. The meal was tasty. We enjoyed every moment and we will definitely return to this restaurant. Warmly recommended.
Nice and quick meal with large serving sizes.

The experience here was awful. They forced me to get the big plate dish even though I specifically asked for just the plate. Then they don't even know how to work a simple Samsung pay tap. She kept swiping my phone across the sensor like an idiot. It's tap and go....

The experience was damaged when I was hit in the head with the cover of the napkin container.  Needless to say, I was even more ticked off at the staff when they started to laugh and offered me a crappy 10 percent off.   It took them awhile to understand that they should have comped the meal. No matter what I said it didn't click.  So I won't cater to this location

Have been wanting to try fifty/50 after always walking by it and reading the different reviews. Our server was very helpful and honest. She helped us to not over order since the portions are big. The wings are not the small little ones so with the sides ordering 25 wings for 6 people was actually sufficient. I don’t have the picture but their nachos were killer! We ate that so fast I didn’t have time to take a picture 😉

Great bar atmosphere and amazing wings. Stopped in saturday for lunch (1/9/22) to grab some wings and bar food.  This place has high quality versions of your every day bar food and also has other menu options for twists if you are feeling a little adventurous.   I recommend the cauliflower-bites cheesy fried goodness. The homemade hot sauce is amazing as well as their vast selection of sauces. The service was fast reliable and very friendly. Kitchen staff and managers were super helpful and welcoming.  Other things that we had were top notch cheese curds, wings and pub fish sandwich.   If you are looking for a place to watch a game, drink a beer and eat some good food this is it.    Place is clean lots of TVs and great vibes.  Will be coming back soon.

Known for their jumbo wings, I ordered a 6-piece, bone-in, all flats. NOTE: there’s an additional charge if you prefer all flats as well. The wings were crispy and I was satisfied with the wing sauce I chose: Award-Winning Buffalo. Their waffle cheese fries are also good. Drinks are strong, I had the Naughty Lemonade, (Vodka & Lemonade).

This place is a must go to place I loved every moment and the food was off the chain yum I recommend the waffle fries, awesome wings and nachos to die for omg oh and can't forget about the drinks yummers for the pink lemonade with vodka made to perfection will be going back soon and was told on certain nights they have trivia a must go to as well. Loved it 🥰🥰🥰🥰
I order wings and fries here, both were good. The sauce on the wings was delicious. I wanted to buy a bottle, but they didn't sell that way. My drink was good as well too.

This is how my ordered was sent out after ordering through Door Dash. It arrived in a simple plastic bag with chips, cookie(stale), and brown paper bag. When I tried to lift the paper bag, it split from the side. I finished splitting the bag and it revealed my sandwich tossed around with the ingredients coming out.  Picture speaks for itself. Never ordering from here again!
Stingy on the veggies (3 slices of cucumber for a foot long) Not helping the overall subway brand. Other locations are much better, friendly and welcoming.

Got a Veggi Delit rap and the servant was skimpy on the ingredients. She saved their ingredients but lost a repeating customer. I don't like to be cheated when paying your full price of $9. Please don't support them and their treatment of customers. Let them save their ingredients!

Skimpy portions, more expensive than others, bathroom out of order, no hot water for the employees to wash their hands 😖
Go elsewhere
Expensive and small portions compared to the other subways near that area on top of it asking for the tips.

Roati's claims Chicago's best thin pizza. It's not great by any stretch. It's dougy and truly wasn't very thin. The crust rolls up in a weird way.

Ordered an Italian beef too. Roll was grilled and it was not dipped in au jus, nor did it come with any.

They're open late for a quick bite. That's the best I can say.

I am torn by this one, service was basically OK, a little chaotic, but not terrible. The two slices I got one of sausage and one of what I assume is pepperoni supreme, though as I am unwilling to register for delivery or pick I can't say for sure what it was.

Brings me to the actual slices, pizza was tasty however, the think crust, which I don't have problem with, my issue would be with the state of the crust, which was extremely hard, not toasted almost stale and tough feel to it.

May try again to see if the crust is still what I would consider unpleasant.

My family came here on 042622 for a late bite to eat. They serve slices which was great because we hadn't eaten and didn't want to wait for a full pie. The pizza slices were good size and tasted good. Would eat here again. The staff was all very nice and another reason I'm giving this 4⭐️

Omg I love this place! They were so nice and loving women! Cylicia & Amber are their names! I tipped them $20! Give them a raise!!!! I also shared my slice of pizza with them while they were closing.    I love them. Soooooo much. I’m coming back tomorrow and the next day.

Ordered for pickup and apparently a delivery driver took my food by mistake. I get it, mistakes happen, but the best you can do to make up for it is either make me sit there and wait another 45 minutes for them to re-make the pizza or refund me? Sure, I got my money back, but now I'm sitting here at 10pm without food...

This place is great first of all because it’s 24 hours! It’s always clean in the lobby(even with the winter weather 👍🏾) The Italian Beef and the Jim Shoo is delicious and tasty, the portions are very generous every single time!

I have started sampling Jim Shoe sandwiches. Unfortunately, I didn't get to eat this while it was at its best, it cooled too much before I got to eat it. It was good, but I think it would have been a lot better, if I got to it in time.

My fault, not theirs, so I am still going with 4 stars.

The food here is sooo good! The guys in the kitchen really know how to cook! The food is fresh and hot. So tasty and delicious 😋 customer service is pretty good. I've never had a problem there. My only issue is that they only take cash which is very inconvenient. They have a atm machine but they charged $3 to use and that's a lot! They either need to accept cards or lower that fee. But overall still a great place to go!
I ordered the wings. A little small, but well cooked and had a little seasoning. Comes with shoestring fries. Their Jim shoe sandwich is very good as well. Friendly service!!

I woke up late...running late for work, no time to make or pack lunch(5am). The guy work that morning greeted me and asked for my order. I want and ask for an Italian Beef and I got it in 7 mintues. I even got fresh fries (breakfast) too.

Thanks guys. I can't wait to try your breakfast.

Love this Goddess and the Baker location! The workers there are really sweet. I got the Vietnamese cold brew which was yummy & I just asked for it to be made a little less sweet & it was perfect. The avocado toast is yummy but too much arugula. Other drinks I recommend is: wildflower honey and chagaccino. Also the chocolate croissant!

Stopped in for Carrot Cake for my husband's birthday. Left with a few extra goodies. The carrot cake was amazing as expected. I also purchased chocolate chip cookies and a slice of cherry peach cake. I will be back the dessert were delicious.
Wow! This place is amazing. I had an iced caramel latte and husband bad a a red eye. Thier baked items all looked so yummy.

Cute shop with a small sitting area outside, plenty of space inside. I got the matcha tea latte (delicious) and the oatmeal (also a great choice)

The service was efficient and no offensive. Overall great experience!

I fell in love with my strawberry matcha green tea latte (hot) and avocado toast, today was not as good as usual. The avocado toast was more of a arugula salad on top of avocado toast, the my latte was still great! My server knew what I was going to say before I did and she was very sweet to recognize.
Please, don’t mess it up for your returning customers! It’s such a nice enjoyment for my stopping by!

Not only was my large pizza was over cooked but my super spicy wings were dry and not spicy. There price range is also too high, especially just for pizza. To top it off the service had no customer service skills. I think he was even smoking weed on the job. Over all don't eat there people.
convenient neighborhood place with great tasting pizza. we're regulars.
It's okay

Was visiting Chicago and stopped by this place on my way back from Navy Pier. Lovely Indian style taco bell I would say. Loved the paratha wrap with meat and veg stuff. And also the Indian street food like samosa. I got the paratha with lamb curry. I was really happy with their assorted lassi drinks. I tried the pistachios lassi for the first time and really liked it so much that I had to go back and buy two more bottles lol. It was so delicious 😋😋😋 The paratha wrap was good and I believe it must be ate fresh so it's crispy and nice. It was not as amazing as I thought after I took it to my hotel room. Definitely a great place to visit and try some affordable Indian meal near Navy Pier.
Good for fast Indian food. Great that they have a self-serve ordering kiosk. Very fast service. Could stand to have something other than a 70s pop music track running.

Review Date: November 26th, 2018

Bombay Wraps was… the bomb.

A final stop on my post-blizzard trip to Chicago. After grabbing dessert and a coffee at Stan’s Donuts, I walked with said coffee to Bombay for some real food for the first time on this day. While scouring my GPS for a place to eat at Stan’s, I saw Bombay Wraps. On a cold day, a hot meal sounded wonderful. Of all the places detailed in this blog, there hasn’t been an Indian place until know.

It took about 10 minutes to walk there from Stan’s, due to the traffic and the amount of people out and about. Once I got there, I was surprised to see it mostly empty during lunch time. Maybe I had just missed the rush. Oh well, all the easier for me to order.

The menu was kind of foreign to me. I knew quite a few of the terms, but that doesn’t mean I knew how they tasted. A few minutes passed of looking over the menu before I had to decide between the chicken tikka and chicken reshmi. In the end, I picked the chicken tikka. The lady cooking it asked if I wanted it spicy. I quickly said “yes” before she could finish her question.

The way they make it is almost like subway. They have all the ingredients out and make it as you walk towards the cashier. I was given my food before I could get my change from paying.

I grabbed a seat at one of the stools that was along the front wall, so I could look out of the store front as I ate. I noticed my wrap was smaller than I expected but that was fine as I had most of a massive donut a few minutes before.

As I tried to pick up this soaking and messy wrap, trepidation set in. I was about to taste my first Indian cuisine and I was nervous. Wrap in mouth, I take my first bite… and am pleasant surprised by how delicious it was. Once I finish the first bite, the spicy kicked in and I took my first sip of the coffee I brought with me. It did nothing to settle the slight burn that was setting in.

Wow. I took my time eating the wrap as I was trying to enjoy all the new flavors and tastes I was experiencing. It was delightful. Sadly, the wrap was a lot smaller than I expected it to be. For $5 and change, I was expecting a bit more to the wrap but the quality of what I got couldn’t be beat. Each bite was filled full of flavor and a spicy kick that couldn’t be beat.

Alas, this was my last stop before I resumed some family duties. I was in a hurry to get back to where I needed to be that I forgot to snap a good photo of the inside. It was a bit sparse when it came to decorations but there was plenty of room to handle a lunch/dinner rush.

This may have been my first Indian cuisine sampling but I doubt it will be my last.

Had a taste for lamb today, so I ordered from Bombay Wraps. Food came well packaged. No leaks. I ordered the Lamb Curry wrap and lentil soup. Very tasty. They give you a choice of how spicy the curry is. I love spicy food, so I ordered the Spicy Cilantro mint chutney. I couldn't wait for the next bite. Wasn't too spicy. Just enough to make it delicious.

This food was very flavorful and affordable. $5.49 for each wrap (Spicy Reshmi and Tikka) the cheapest I’ve seen in Chicago. However the wraps were small in my opinion. Would have been 5 if it weren’t for the size.

What a great buzzing atmosphere. The place is deceiving up front, the restaurant is huge. The service and attentiveness of the staff is first rate. The Sangria is excellent and has many flavor choices. The Tapas is well served and fresh. The food is fun and tasty. Did not try to Paella but it is a popular dish. Reservations are a must, the place was packed even with an late afternoon reservation.

It’s a great place for family, friends, co worker n date night. it’s tapas spanish food. Served in small portion that perfect for trying many dishes. we tried many dishes. they all are good. There is variety choices of sangria drinks, check with the server for sangria of the day. it’s busy on the weekends so recommended to try.

One of the best tapas places I’ve ever tried.   The service was fantastic.  the food was excellent. I couldn’t  take pictures of all our plates since every time a new plate came we devoured  it. The food was so so good. Highly recommend the bacon wrapped dates and Spanish octopus!   come hungry.

This is easily one of the best Spanish themed restaurants in all the Chicago. The staff is always helpful but we went with the clear favorites of the meatballs, the potatoes, the chicken, ham croquettes, the meat and cheese board, olives and the like. The peach sangria was to die for. We went for a happy hour special and was very pleased of all the food we got for a cheap price.

The Tapas menu was super cool. Definitely definitely try the Omelette, the Beef Empanada and the Butterscotch Custard - amazing! The Passion Fruit Sangria didn’t feel worth $20 for half a pitcher. The Margarita was super strong!

standard Americanized Chinese food. Its good though, but the space they use kind of creeps me out. They must get inspected, but the place does not feel clean to me, and oh is it cramped. But it has been there for years and people seem to enjoy it.
Best orange chicken and crab rangoons. Great place to have lunch.

Had the opportunity to visit Fontano's subs while Visiting UIC for a tournament.  Amazingly fresh subs and wonderful staff made the place a great choice. Looks like I'm covered for lunch and dinner with the 16-oz wise guy.  The peppers are a must

EXCELLENT “Wise Guy” sub!! Went here for lunch two days in a row while in town for a robotics competition at Credit Union1 Arena. Short walk & completely worth it! I’ll be visiting from Ohio AGAIN!! Thank you!
Very good itslian subs, I got the Blockbuster to-go and they piled on the meat and cheeses.  Was here about a month ago from this posting.

Delicious sub sandwiches with nice thick hearty bread made however you want.  Wish more hot sandwich places used bread as good as theirs.  Great neighborhood spot for those who don't need to find a place to park as most local parking is by permit only.

Call it a grinder, call it a sub, people born and raised in Chicago call this the best damn sandwich you can buy.

I usually do not give fast food more than the stars. So for me to give it four stars means Fontano's is exceptional in my book.

I have been getting the"Big Al" now named the "Big L" for over 30 years.

To be honest you can't go wrong with any of their sandwiches.

Just make sure you get the mayonnaise, oil, seasoning, and giardiniera (hot).

No nasty sour miracle whip on this baby, it's Hellman's all the way!

The only thing that could have made this place better in my youth was if they served hot sandwiches... They started serving hot sandwiches.

If you want to combo done right, this is the place.

I believe Fontanos was a neighborhood butcher shop and grocery store back in the day.

If you're looking to add sausage to your Sunday sauce, I strongly suggest picking up a pound of Italian sausage (hot) while you get your sandwich.

Remember, 90% of taste is actually smell.

As you are chewing, take a deep breath and enjoy the aromas in the back of your pallet.  This will enhance the blend of flavors and your brain will have a more vivid response to the "taste" inputs.

This place was amazing! I usually pass by hore on Sundays. Today on my way back I decided to try it out. I am in love with this place. The crepe was very light and delicious (Spartan Crepe). I added bacon to it and With the sauce that they add it was a very satisfying and delicious selection.

Now if there is something that I like is Tiramisu. If I go somewhere and they have one on the manu, I'm going to try it. This is by far, the best Tiramisu I've ever had. The tiramisu was great and they add an especially delicious coffee whipped  mousse that in combination with the tiramisu, I was blown away by the flavor. If you are around the area or if you are looking for a good place to eat without spending a ridiculous amount of money, please, do yourself a favor and eat here. Absolutely amazing!
Chocochip waffle, iguana frap, pasta is a must try. Coffee so much better than Starbucks and same price as SB.

Amazing variety of European inspired dishes. My favorites are the different styles of stuffed crepes, truly each one has been filled with amazing combinations of flavor and I've tried almost all. Delivery is always quick and easy, favorite to go for lunches.

This spot has simple, delicious foods and a calm vibe. We split the pizza bread (without salami) and it was warm, melty, and bready. I appreciate that it (and all of the other foods we got) didn’t have an overly oily or buttery texture or consistency. For my meal, I got the Zurich savory crepe (with mushrooms, red peppers, tomatoes, cheese, and chicken). It had a creamy sauce on the side that enhanced the flavors, but it was so fresh and naturally flavorful that I hardly ate the sauce. Honestly, it’s a great spot hidden in plain sight, with reasonable prices, easy and simple combinations of flavors and textures, and even a live iguana up near the ceiling (in a terrarium).

One of the best European cafes I’ve ever been too. I am definitely recommending this place if you love European Appetizers, Sweet and Savory Crepes, Belgian Waffles, Sandwiches, pastas and Specially their Desserts and Coffee.

They also serve Wines, Cocktails and beers. Also have Coffee Liquors.

My friends and I tried Savory Crepes and Bougatsa (very special item) - must try.
Everything was delicious.

The WORST experience I have ever had getting delivery. Hair in EVERY SINGLE container I opened. Not one piece, hair was strewn through my rice. Disgusting. I want to puke just thinking about it. When I called to get my money back - THEY HUNG UP ON ME TWICE! So I called grubhub to see if they could get a better response but they were hung up on as well. DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE!!! Waiting for grubhub to get back to me after speaking with the owner. So freaking gross. I can't stop thinking about that much hair in my rice. You could clearly see it, it almost looked intentional.
3 hour delivery.  Extremely rude customer service.  Will not again buy.
loved it

I usually don’t come at this place around this time(5:30pm) but I had a taste for donuts. There was nothing left for donuts, so I grab the only donuts they had available, the donuts were so nasty and cold and it look like they’ve been sitting there forever. I don’t think I’ll be returning☹️

Still forcing mask 9-11-21
They need some training by mcdonalds on making a iced caramel macchiato
If you’re a people watcher, great place!

Your order is never consistent. 85% of the time my things are burnt and I usually just let it be... but when I spoke up and asked for it to be remade, I was met with attitude. Without Rosie working here, this place falls apart.

I don't get any donuts from Dunkin so not qualified to say anything about them, but I do got for the coffee and in my opinion it's pretty good.
I would say go and try the coffee and hopefully you'll enjoy it as much as I do.

The person who was working as customer service at 6 pm on 5/27/2021 is the worst person for such position. He told me and my partner there is no bathroom without even bothering to ask why we were there. I don’t want to go into speculation as to why he thought we were there just for bathroom not for a coffee or donuts. To say the least, that was very rude.

I use to love this place but this not a pizza that was freshly made. Taste like the made awhile ago and just put it back in the oven. I’m disappointed I usually always go here over Barney’s Pizza. Not this best this time.

Used to come here alot as a kid , tons of memories but man idk if it's just that ive had better over the years or they just fell off because this don't taste like elliots from the early 2000s. The slice was alot smaller and lacked the flavor it used to have , never the less it wasn't nasty it just taste like they use cheaper ingredients.
Good food, prices went up and the portions have gotten small. Charge for anything ( mild sauce, croutons, cheese) going on your order.
I Love Their Italian Chicken Omg Its Da Best And Their Salads As Well
Food was delicious... 4 stars for the chicken Italian beef. I never had this before. The service was fast and freash

I had  a taste for pizza so I decided to visit this location. I have not been here since before Covid-19 so to see the change of the place is a new look.

I was greeted at the counter by Destiny. Such a pleasant, sweet voice. I ordered a personal pizza and traditional buffalo wings for a total of $27.50. I asked was the blue cheese chunky . I love blue cheese.

I normally go on Mannheim but this is the closet to my home.

Got a 12 inch pepperoni and sausage pizza with mozzarella sticks as an appetizer. Yum 😋
In the Beverly neighborhood on Western Ave.
Our server was super sweet too. Pizza was good.
For more reviews/ restaurant highlights check out southside_Chicago_food on Instagram
Always a pleasure, food was hot and fresh my waiter was very attentive and polite excellent customer service I visited Home Run Inn Pizza on Friday 03/25/2022 @4pm

Pizza pieces on top of one another & disshelved in the box with pizza slices bonded together. upon pick up. The cashier whom I received my order from shrugged me off. The mgr took off the price of 1 topping and did not address the poor customer service. I made a 40 min special trip to patronize the business only to be sooo disappointed.

Frozen food! Waited 30+minutes for a 6 piece chicken dippers. Then I proceed to go take a seat to ‘enjoy’ my food and this lady comes to me asking what I’m doing as I answered I was going to take a seat to eat she orders me to sit at a table because she needed to see me eat and not make a mess.  Horrible place to eat but amazing cashier Poot thing had to work in that ugly place

I absolutely love this place. For Father’s Day I would not have chosen anywhere else. It has a very warm, community vibe where you feel like it’s your family of aunts and uncles running the joint. Food is always hot, fresh, delicious and QUICK. Their system and service is great. Eppels never fails!

Very good spot to have a good, heavy breakfast. Please do try their pancakes. Rarely do I get to have pancakes that fluffy.

The staff were really nice and warm. The service was prompt (even on a Sunday morning).

Highly recommend this gem of a place.

Fantastic homely diner. Food was amazing, hot, and quick. Not too many other patrons at this time of morning. Waitress was very pleasant, and kept water and coffee topped up often.

Got The Works Skillet, with your preference of two eggs on top of hash with bacon, sausage, mushrooms, and cheese, and two pancakes on the side. Worth the 10$, and filling.

Definitely would recommend!

Eppel's is my new go to weekend breakfast spot. In the big city, it's hard to find the kind of warmth and comfort lost in other pretentious breakfast places. Portions are generous, service is friendly, and as soon as I walked through the doors I knew the smell meant they had the kind of biscuits and gravy that make you need a post breakfast nap. The only thing that could improve this beautiful west side gem is a pie case. Here, I have the Royal Canadian burger, cheese fries, and peach pecan crepes, a great midmorning meal before spending the day running errands. If it's your first time, try the country fried steak and see if they'll throw it on top of some biscuits and gravy for you. Cheers, and good eats to you all.

First time going and it was the best first experience. The staff are friendly. I got the Pecan Roll French Toast with a sides of bacon and scrambled eggs. Also got a strawberry milkshake. 😋 would go back again to try out more things from the menu.

Simply phenomenal. The service was good, but the food was simply sublime. I cannot put into words how good it was other than pure ecstasy. The salad was the perfect blend of mozzarella, tomato, salad, and olive oil that formed a union of flavors for a salad unlike no other. The salad was one of the simplest but best I've had in a while. Now the main course was just beyond what I expected. The perfect blend of soft pasta layers, sticky and savory meats coupled with crimson scrumptious red sauce and topped with fantastic melted cheese bring you straight to flavor town. The tastes, textures, and smells all combine to make the best Italian food I have ever eaten and the best dining experience in a few years. 10/10 would recommend to anyone wanting Italian. And for their low price tag, it's criminal how underrated the restaurant is. Delicious!

Perfect little neighborhood Italian restaurant with true flavors and ingredients. Reasonable priced with wonderful service by the owners. Nothing fancy here except the quality and comfort. FOLLOW ME for more thoughtful recommendations as I travel the world  🌎

Service was great and the food was fantastic!! We had garlic bread with cheese and a pepperoni pizza, both were delicious! We were so full but had to try their gelato and it did not disappoint. It was a tasty treat to finish off the meal. Highly recommend sitting on their patio to enjoy a beautiful evening

Family owned. Great thin crust pizza. The best in town. Located by the Trump hotel. Outdoor seating available. Rolled Eggplant appetizer is so good! Chicken Parm sandwich was just okay. The Caprese Salad is my favorite. Light and refreshing. Reasonably priced. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a quick , casual bite to eat in Chicago.

Before I get into the review, this place is located inside the River Plaza at 405 N. Wabash.  Turn at the River Plaza sign off N. Wabash and follow the sidewalk into the River Plaza building.

Stopped by during lunch while visiting Chicago.  I've had all the usual deep-dish pizzas and other well-known pizza places in Chicago, so wanted to try someplace different.  It was lunchtime during the week, but it was not too crowded.  There's about 10 tables both inside and outside, but it was a rainy day so opted for the inside.  They don't sell individual slices, but the small 10" pizza is only 4 reasonable slices.  Service was very fast and friendly.

Ordered the 10" Capricciosa pizza which took about 10-15 minutes to arrive.  Pizza was straight out the oven and looked great.  Crust was a good thickness, crispy, just the right amount of sauce, and there was a generous amount of ingredients.  They also have desserts such as gelato, tiramisu, cannolis, and cookies.  I was too full for anything big, so just ordered 2 cookies after another customer recommended them.  It was a good recommendation.

Nice hidden gem for good pizza.  Good food and service.

This is my 2nd time here. First time I was invited out and thought it was decent. This time around, I brought my husband to check it out...not so good! Very pricey dinners options but since we were there for lunch, the prices were above average. However, the lunch plates were SMALL and we left not completely full. Pina Coladas were big but not blended properly. We were unable to drink from the straws due to the large chucks of ice. They tasted just ok and questioned myself if there was any liquor in it. Extremely WEAK! If I'm gonna pay big bucks, I want big, great tasting food and drinks. However, during the week they do offer lunch specials at a more reasonable price. NOTE: THEY CHARGE A FEE FOR CREDIT CARDS!!

Joey's shrimp house is super delicious, no doubt about it!
"Ojo", But it's extremely over priced, extremely small portions, specially the rice! It's definitely under staffed, whom tend to be rude if order comes out wrong, which happened the second time I went on Saturday, 6/17/17. I do not recommend to go on Saturdays or Sundays. It's an extremely small "restaurant"! Get your food to go, but check it before you leave. Oh and the Paella Jíbara, don't hold your breath, & good luck if you get! They don't & wouldn't make it, i asked for them to make it for me the first time I went on a Friday, which they said only on weekends, so I went on a Saturday, I was denied that plate and got poor service instead! Customers beware! No digan que yo no les avise! Suerte!

I love this place! Their jibarito sandwiches are so delicious. Their steak with rice and salad is to die for. I loved the sauce on the side which is used to dip the tostones! Great location. Its very cozy and welcoming! Our server Jesus was very professional and attentive!
Great food but if ur doin carry out CALL AHEAD!!! But this place is great. Not too expensive. &the owner is great!!!
Great price for lunch specials from 11-3:00 PM. Shrimp jibarito is awesome :)
Placed an order through the drive through, about 2-3 people that were behind me got their order while I had to go around & re-order. Ended up pulling up to Wendy’s. I enjoyed the 4 for 4 combo

The lobby is never clean. The Mexican lady ask nicely to their employees to please clean the lobby but they won’t listen to her.
06/28/2022 6:31pm
Is not busy there’s no body on the front or driver-thru they could clean whiles there’s no costumers.

In and out with no problem but... I have the BK app in my phone, the BK location showed the one closest to my home, once I switched to this location prices were higher! And the offers were different! And both locations are in the city of Chicago 😕

Well to start off. I just went to this particular Burger King because I know it versus going to other Burger King's I also know. The main reason why I came is because of the "Impossible burger" or Burger King's version or a vegetarian or vegan burger they kept advertising on regular TV . It was something that I put in the bucket list. I'm sure every other Burger King has the "Impossible Burger" but so far it does taste like a burger but it's not as greasy as a beef burger Whopper. Has the right texture and the right taste of a burger no aftertaste of a vegetable. Do try it but very expensive at just $6 for the sandwich alone versus if you order it with the meal. I'm trying to avoid eating fries and carbonated drinks also ordered a Hershey sundae pie but it doesn't look as nice on my picture then it does on the menu as you see my picture I took. On the other hand, I did taste the Hershey Sunday pie and it was delicious however for such a small portion I was not satisfied. It is like eating a French Silk Pie which is one of my favorite pies to eat next to fruit pies. Other than that three stars for this and not focus on this particular Burger King location wise on the food not the service. I can't give it more because there is nothing super good about the Impossible Burger which was the main reason why I went to Burger King as a bucket list for a quick lunch along the way.
Their impossible whopper is delicious if you have a craving for total garbage comfort food but don't want to eat total garbage meat for a change!!

Absolutely our favorite restaurant when we are here for business every six months!  The mozzarella is SO yummy. I haven’t met a dish on the menu I didn’t love, especially the steaks. We love our waiter, Steve, who we request every time we are here. He will tell you all about the history of the building, which is always a fun addition to a nostalgic night.

Well decorated with unique memorabilia as soon as you walk in the doors. Staff was able to accommodate us without having a reservation. Waitstaff were all very experienced and made the dining experience very pleasant. Portions were large and prepared in a timely manner. Overall a nice dining experience.

We dined at Harry Carey’s on August 11.  We sat at the bar so we could watch the Field of Dreams baseball game.  Interestingly enough, I had been inside Harry Carey’s the day before as I had taken the Chicago Gangster Crime tour and this restaurant (and the basement safe/hidden passageway) was on the tour as a stop.  Firstly, there is a ton of history in this building.  Loaded with great photos and news clippings.  I could have spent two hours just looking at all that stuff alone.   So over to dinner.  We were greeted immediately at the bar by our bartender.  Ordered our drinks and delivered within minutes.  We were then handed a basket of homemade fresh cut potatoe chips lightly salted by which we devoured.  So yummy.   We shared a 14 oz strip loin steak, a wedge salad and grilled asparagus - served with complimentary buns and butter.   Salad was fresh light and crisp with delicious dressing.  The steak served perfectly (medium) and hot, as were the asparagus.  We were too full for dessert so we took a tiramisu to go - eaten by my hubby who said it was the best he’s ever had with a slight hint of booze (not overpowering). I would highly recommend.  If it wasn’t for the Gangster Crime Tour I would not have even considered this restaurant (I had checked out the menu the day before and all the servers were super friendly and welcoming).  I believe they have a large private space upstairs too for large groups as both days there were large events.  Also, all servers are male professionals who clearly take their roles seriously and work incredibly well as a team. Different people brought the food, the buns and cleaned up promptly. The level of professionalism was impressive. Again - these gents take great pride in what they do and do it very well.

The steak was delicious. Prices were a bit high for what you got. The server was great and helpful, but did get distracted with a large group for half the service. Good food and a nice spot to visit for the history.

I had the opportunity to eat here while on a trip. Everything was amazing. The history and atmosphere were great to learn. The menu is vast with a great range of appetizers, salads, pasta dishes, and steak. With it being a steak house I had to try the Kansas City Cut. Which I had never heard of before. It was a great cut. The steak was cooked to perfection medium rare. One downside is the sides were not included, but I was able to try the Brussel sprouts and mashed potato which were amazing. I would say it is a great place, lots of history, if you have a chance it is worth it.

Best Asian food I’ve had in a long time.. fresh, hot and tasty ... I don’t know about the customer service because I ordered DoorDash!!! Food well done.. not messy.instead neat.and  presentable.. I ordered the dinner for 4.. everything I eat ... yum ... forgot how good this place was... a diamond in the mud for sure..
Very good and inexpensive they are not jacking up their prices like other places

They are usually good but guess it depends on the cook at time of service. One thing that gets to me is the rude cashier I've never seen someone as rude as her in a food establishment especially for no reason. For that reason alone I stopped going and its a shame cause I traveled far just to have their food. She's running your good paying customers away.

I work across the street and after a day of getting slammed with people, I walked across the street and tried to order some Chinese food here. I have to say the young lady at the counter was probably one of the rudest people I have ever met. I tried asking if they had any combination plates for lunch specials because their menu is overwhelming and hard to understand if you have never ordered here. When I tried to ask her she cut me off and waved her hand at me saying, "No, no, I don't know." The best part of my visit was realizing I forgot my wallet and had to leave and not give them one cent of my money!!! I don't care if this place is across the street and convenient, I will pay extra for delivery and excellent customer service!

The food was pretty good however the orange chicken while tasty, the sauce was soooooo thick, it looked like glue. Such a turn off. If they got that part right I would order it again and give five stars. I also had egg rolls, combo rice, and pot stickers all good, delivery was fast. Just please, please fix the orange chicken because I couldn't even finish it.

By far, my favorite spot for authentic tacos, nachos, and chicken / asada plates. The prices are reasonable for the quality of food you get. Kitchen staff is extremely clean and you can see them preparing your food with gloves, and masks. Definitely try their plates, burritos, tamales, and tortilla chips with cheese and verde sauce. I will never go anywhere else!!
So delicious, fresh, and affordable. Also indoor Plexiglas boxes for dine in makes you feel very safe. Also the security guard and staffed parking lot is a great extra layer of protection!

Second time here and I still think it's pretty solid food. If you are a covid freak this is a safe space. They have little sectioned off areas for each table completely surrounded in plexiglass. I had the steak platter and a pork taco with green sauce. The tacos are gigantic and I appreciate that! The steak was pretty good as well. My buddy got the pork in green sauce and wasn't super impressed but when it comes to Mexican he is pretty picky. The horchata was alright and it only comes in one size, I wish they had a few sizes as I like to drink alot. We also got some tamales, I tried the strawberry and the coconut/raisin one. They were both very good and moist. The strawberry one had what seemed like almost a jam on/in it.

My friend and I dined inside... The seating was in cubicles. If you're overweight you may have a hard time seating in those. It was tight for us. Lol

I had the chicken taco plate. They didn't cut up chicken which was fine. I liked the chicken, it was grilled and had a nice flavor. The beans were too soupy. The horchata wasn't sweet.

I will be back for the chicken though ☺️.

LOVED LOVED THEIR TAMALES.
Today they were out so I got the Plato de Carna....lol or Steak dinner. It was excellent
Nice and tender and I like that I could make my own. Unlike most place that chop up the meat.
Their salsa is some of the best. Flavorful & Fresh.
Place was kinda okay, not the cleanest. The service was fine for the drinks, but they forgot to give us our food. Sister had to remind them we're still waiting on our donuts.

Good morning, this is the third time that the orders that I ask for pick up is not what I expected, this time I ordered a sweet black pepper bacon croissant and a coffee where the cold foam is not even a bit, I place my orders every morning Because I used to like how they attended and made my orders but now every day the service is very bad.

The night shift employee with the pink hair was very nice and was very professional. There was a long line for just ice cream about 1-2 weeks ago and she still managed to get my order right even when it was stressful. I had my best refresher ever. Strawberry with green tea. Thank you!

Staying at my aunt’s condo unit nearby and this is the nearest dunkin branch. The service is fast but the lady serving the donuts is unprofessional and a bit rude and unhygienic. If you’re in Michigan ave, st clair or ohio street and craving for some dunkin, look elsewhere.
i come almost every night and the girl on who’s night shift most of the time with the red/pink hair is so sweet and helpful.  she is the only reason why i come to this store 💖💜

Staff is nice and helpful. I wish they didn’t give a plastic bag to people when they are dining in. It’s super wasteful and unnecessary. Also, it’s technically illegal according to the city’s plastic bag ban law :/

The guy serving at night is very rude and has no manners. Also he is too stingy and after asking to put more sauce if he hasn’t put for the first time, he looks as if he’s doing a great favor. Very poor customer service

They have false advertising signs right now such as open 24 hours when they close at 8pm. They still have a sign up $6.00 any footlong from 10pm-10am problem is they close at 8pm and only time to get that price is maybe early morning.
Nice clean place not to many peoples in there I enjoy myself
Very nice service I loved it specially the lady name Firdos she was doing her job very well so I tipped her 200 dollars just for the work she was doing.

Came here for my dad's birthday, and we had a great time. The food was delicious, we came for the French Week prix-fixe menu. We all got a 3-course meal for $38 each which was a pretty good deal, the escargots were great, as were the frog legs and our individual dishes which we let each other try. I got the lamb shank, which I thought gave me a lot of meat so I was pretty happy. The only thing that concerned me was that we were there for 2+ hours because only one waiter was working all the tables in the restaurant so each dish came out relatively slow. It did not bother us because we used the time to catch up as a family, but there were a lot of people waiting to be seated. The second thing was that it was a hassle trying to find parking around the restaurant that was not terribly expensive. All in all, my family and I had a great experience!

Bistro Voltiare is the perfect place for an intimate date. The food is excellent and authentic to the French cooking styles. I had never tried frogs legs and I will keep going back for more, they were delicious! The service is enjoyable and everyone was attentive to our needs. Order a bottle of great wine and enjoy!

There are not enough words to describe my experience at Bistro Voltaire. I love coming here!!!! The food is always delicious..... I love the escargot and get it every time. The atmosphere is warm and inviting with good music always playing in the background. The staff is very friendly and always offer fantastic suggestions if you are ever caught trying to decide between two great entree options. I will say a good default for me are the scallops. If you have yet to try this hidden gem you need to do so!! I will also say that more often than not I have eaten at the bar and it is just as inviting as sitting at a table. The added bonus, I can go when I want without a reservation and not have to wait for a table :)

This is my only favorite French bistro. The service and the food stand out. Steven the head waiter takes pride in his work. He is one of the best waiters you will find in Chicago. The fresh baked bread here is amazing. Honestly it is the best bread ever. I have two favorite dishes here: the mussels and the duck. The mussels bowl was loaded with a ton of mussels. I needed more bread to soak up that delicious broth they were cooked in. There is also a great selection of wine to wash it all down. Plus Steven knows his wines and he will direct you in the right direction. The owner is also really friendly. The other day I saw him sweeping in front of his restaurant. I love this old world charm and respect for his business. I have never seen an owner do that in America. So this makes me appreciate this business even more.

Very deceptive. The service was great, but the food was really bad. We started with frog legs. This could be a delicious dish, but here, the legs were obviously frozen and badly cooked, therefore very watery and tasteless. Then we continued with a lamb shank. It was also very deceptive, quite tasteless. The polenta it was served with was good though. My wife finished with profiteroles: the choux were too hard. I finished with a chocolate cake: bitter... Will not return :-(

Menu has a lot to offer!   I am new to the neighborhood and I sat outside at a 2top with my 2 year old son.  It took a bit to review the menu and decide so I did not mind the slow service while sitting outside.   It was a challenge to keep my son entertained but the food came and it was great.   The stuffed tomato came with lots of fresh veggies and coleslaw- I opted for tuna salad (chicken, egg, salmon salads were other options).  There was no kids menu online but to my pleasant surprise, there was a kids menu on the menu handed to me.   My son went with the standard chicken nuggets.   I thought $9 was a little expensive for kids meal (no drink) but it was enough food for either 2 kids or 2 meals so we took over half home.

Our meal ended and while we were waiting for the bill and To-go box,  my son became restless so we were up and I was chasing him around and doing my best to keep him out of the way.  I admit this is problematic and apologized to staff/patrons while we waited.   The manager/ owner/ host (older man with shaved head in a loose skirt sleeve button up) had the nerve to say "get a grip on him" INSTEAD of bringing a bill or box or doing anything to resolve our issue.

Had I gone to the Bagel without my child or not alone with him,  I would have rate a 4 or 5, but I focus my reviews on dining with children and I likely will not return with kids.... I live nearby so I might get takeout because I was very happy with my meal!

Very large menu with lots of delicious options! Highly recommend for a fast and affordable meal that is also great quality.

We'll definitely be back!

I get a sausage and cheese omelet everywhere I go. No one to date has topped a place back home in MN called Fat Nats Eggs. I can officially say The Bagel is now competing with Fat Nats.

Well-balanced omelet with good proportions of sausage and cheese. I finished my hash-browns the same time as my omelet which made for a beautiful pairing.

My significant other received a great quantity when getting a lox bagel and I can confirm, it was fresh and fulfilling.

As far as breakfast joints on Broadway street in north side Chicago, The Bagel takes the cake.

My only question is do you have a public restroom? I was not able to locate one in shop, which could be problematic for people with IBS.

We enjoyed lunch here earlier this week. We love a good bagel but when we saw how extensive was the menu we went for chicken liver meal, that was enough for two people also we got the beet borscht and to top all that a lox bagel. No pictures taken as we were starving. But the Borscht was to freaking good. The livers needed more seasoning for me but were fine for my partner.  The bagel well we inhaled that. If you enjoy original home cooking Jewish dishes stop by and give them a try. Service was good not on top of you and not too difficult to get anything either. I always sit indoors is not sanitary for us to be on the sidewalk but those that like that they have tables outside.
Delish! Delish! Delish! Wow!!!! Seriously very tasty! Pastrami was perfect.. split pea soup was great.. those fresh pickles tho.. & lastly that damn basket of carbs was pure heaven!

Came here on a Friday night; great outdoor seating!

Food- $6-$8 burgers, add about $3 to make it a combo.

I had the turkey burger with cranberry sauce. Messy experience but incredibly delicious and juicy burger! Add 50 cents for a pretzel bun- worth it! Although the bun could have been a little burger and toasted- love the crispy crunch of a toasted bun! Service is very quick too! I got my food in about 10 minutes!!

Easy street parking, highly recommend! One of the few burger places that doesn't have waiter service.

More of a order up front then sit down and wait type of place.  I tried the chicken burger which was pretty tasty. We ordered the fried green beans which were also good.  I liked the truffle fries and thought it was reasonably priced for what you get.  I will try burger philosophy again.

If you like a moist tasty burger in your mouth... try BP.

A very tasty BBQ burger with an ah-mazing chocolate shake. Thick and yummy + big portions.

The workers are attentive, prompt to wipe down tables once vacated. Multiple times they came over to check on us. Bike parking is decent.
Really great burger for a moderate price. They give you a ton of food for your money, the place is plain but the food speaks for itself. The "Good Morning Chicago" is a piece of art.

The burgers are ok, the fries are good but the service is an absolute joke. It took about an hour to get two burgers with fries. The couple with kids who ordered after me got their  food and were half done eating before the cashier came out and asked me what I ordered... You don't know what I ordered? Well then why did you give me this stand with number 56, just for fun? After fumbling about for a few minutes, I'm handed a bag with a someone else's grubhub receipt. I say I think you gave me someone else's order but it was actually my order. So I get home only to find out the order is wrong... I go back, get one of the burgers remade and finally receive the aioli after asking 3 times... The food isn't bad, it's just not worth dealing with these fools.

I applied to a "urgently higher" status at this location. I'm retired looking for a part time job. They  told me I'm not qualified. I'm thinking it's because I'm a white man over 50. I'm a qualified worker. Retired proccess technician. Union vice president. Chairman of federal apprenticeship program in Chicago for Graham packaging. I'm thinking about calling EEOC .

The General Manager Veronica is still really rude and for the food to not be fresh as a former worker there she’s never learned customers service and from seeing another review she picks and chooses who she wants to hire and to her liking it’s only young boys really weird I could see why she’s so rude and miserable I would be too if I was 40 some going into my 50s and still in the same position.
Second time...chicken not done 8 piece meal in the garbage..chicken breast made me sick to my stomach just looking at it!
