They did give me a free french fry to "make up" for the wait but I told them I don't eat fries and would rather have an ice cream. . .of course I didn't want to have to wait another 15 minutes for that so I just left. Ugh

Please bring back the grilled chicken!  Also please clean up the alleys and streets near the property. McDonald's trash is all around.  Coffee is decent here. I don't really eat at McDonald's since there's no grilled chicken.

For a McDonald’s, this is the nicest one Ive ever seen inside and out. Nicest outdoor areas (yes areas… meaning multiple), nice restaurant area inside, and nicest bathrooms Ive ever seen at a McDonald’s ever. For a McDonald’s this deserves a 5 star rating

Great place for dim sum in Chicago Chinatown.  We ordered a variety of dishes. All were tasty. Staff was helpful in assisting us with deciding on what to order. If you aren't familiar with dim sum, it's similar to tapas, snacks, or small bites. You will need to order several so all parties will be able to have enough to eat. We ordered a variety of buns, dumplings, rolls, chops, and other bites. All were delicious.  I recommend trying this place out if you visit Chicago Chinatown.

This place is awesome. We decided to go to this place because we asked a local Chinese auntie and she told us that this is the best dim sum place. 大三元 in Chinese. The amount of food they serve are much more than other Chinese Dim Sum places and also much cheaper. I would recommend everyone to go there. The food is so delicious. We ordered too much and we end up being too full. I really like the stir fried turnip cake & the beef honeycomb.

Exceptionally delicious dim sum but a really difficult seating process. The wait was about half an hour longer than was quoted and the waiting process (wound up waiting about an hour and a half) is a little stressful. You go upstairs to get a ticket (like deli numbers) and then they shout numbers inside the entryway only. You can’t leave your phone number and you can’t wait outside, you can only wait with the crowd inside.

But oh man, as soon as you get to your table and your food arrives, it’s worth the wait. So delicious! They bring out a few different sauces as well which is great. The dough of the dumplings is the perfect consistency. The fried dumplings are so deliciously crispy. The steamed dishes are perfectly soft without being chewy. Really bright flavors in everything. Good prices too.

Really enjoyed the dim sum.  We ordered about 12 different plates to share among 6 of us and it was just the right amount of food.  The Baos are excellent.  Also enjoyed everything else.  Favorite was the chicken soup dumpling.  Great egg rolls.

I understand why all the travel blogs, reviews and Trip Advisor recommended this restaurant. The food taste amazing, the service is really fast. It was a great experience and I recommend it. Be careful as the plates are huge! Good place to share few different meals to allow you to try as much as possible!

I've been getting pizza delivered for almost a year since we moved to the neighborhood. It's always been fast and delicious. Today I decided to go in instead of ordering delivery. Auhmayzing! The staff are very friendly and personable. You feel welcome as soon as you walk in. The spaghetti and meatballs is enough for at least 3 people (or 3 meals if you're single) and is really delicious. I'm amazed at the portion for the price. I'll be ordering more than pizza from now on and definitely stopping in regularly to sit at the bar and watch a game. My new favorite spot in the hood.

Worst “deep dish”/pan pizza in the history of the world. I’m moving to LA in a few days and wanted to have Chicago pizza for the last time and unfortunately chose this place. I really hope nobody eats this and think it in any way represents Chicago pizza. The pasta is really good here though, I enjoy the pasta and would describe the rest of the food as fine.

Had the wings and they were very crispy and quite spicy. Both the chipotle bbq and the buffalo tasted great. They also have $5 modelos which I was a big fan of. My review is solely based on the wings though, my friends weren’t too fond of the pizza they bought but I wasn’t able to try and confirm if it was good or not.
Ordered wings and sliders.  Wings good.  Sandwich terrible.   Burnt bun, burnt meat patty.

I love the pizza but the manager needs to learn how to properly take care of customers. I called about an uber eats issue and was told they gave my order to a driver. Well it appears they gave it to the wrong driver and I never got my food. When I talked to the manager he had an attitude and at the end of the call rather then apologizing he just decided to hang up on me.

What a great place to have in the neighborhood and worth traveling for.
You have a great European market on the first floor, fresh sausages and meats of all sorts, cheeses, chocolates and all you need to be fed. Beer and wines on the second floor. You will find something interesting guaranteed. And then the rooftop. All fresh sausages and a few other snacks, draft beer (so fresh and clean), and a nice view of the city.
Weather on your own or with a group - worth a visit.

Fantastic European market, butcher shop and local grocery store in the heart of Lincoln Square. This used to be Meyer Delicatessen, but it changed into Gene's quite some time ago. Whether you're looking for some smoked meats, or looking for some great European style beers, Gene's has just about anything that someone could want!

Whenever I have a friend visit me, I always take them here to pick out some sausages for dinner. I'm very fond of the spicy bockwurst. If I'm making a stew, I go for the hunter's sausage.

If you need refreshment to go with your meat, they have a huge selection of alcohol on the second floor. Very easy to find something for even the pickiest of drinkers.

The picture attached is the selection that my friends chose for dinner!
Gene's is a great place. Excellent sausage, beverages, European sweets, and a whole lot more! The rooftop beer garden is a perfect place to enjoy the Fall weather with a brat and a beer!
One of the best grocery stores in Chicago. Huge variety of excellent foods, drinks, and treats. Will be back to try their sausage
The mofongo experience!  The food wasn’t terrible, but it wasn’t great! I guess we don’t know how to eat mofongo properly.

I used to come here all the time when I worked nearby. Yes they take to long with getting your order made but it was always fresh. It used to be good, but not sure what happened. Bought a Groupon because I knew I was coming to revisit since it was offered on Maps. Came by around 12PM and the place was closed. It opens at 11AM from what it said online and Google Maps. When I looked inside, the fridge was empty behind the counter. Kitchen was empty and clear. Looked like the place is closed down. Called and voicemail is full. Not sure what happened. Luckily I was able to get my coupon refunded thankfully. Next time I'll call ahead!

I like the food, but it never opens on time and when it does they will take about 40 minutes or more to get your food if it opens at 11:00 the staff should arrive at least 30 minutes earlier to pre everything terrible service!

Excellent food and service! We are first timers at Cousins Grill and I don't know why. We don't live far but never heard of it. So glad to find it. We especially liked the Pollo Fresco with all the sides. Excellent food and service.

I've been calling this restaurant for two weeks straight, no one answers the phone. So I decided to go personally twice one week and they were closed. Why would they be closed for 2 whole weeks but online it says they're open. Do these people not like to make money??? Now I'm stuck with a Groupon for this place. Total disappointment!

A love letter to Mindy’s…this bakery needs no hype…the line is always out the door and around the corner but there is a special magic here that I can’t help but gush over. The food is absolutely unmatched in every way. I have a hard time getting less than a baker’s dozen treats every time I’m here but the thing that is not immediately seen about Mindy’s is the kind and generous team she has in the store. The place is quite literally never not busy and all of the people who work there are always completely stress-free and so so so kind. Mindy’s, you are the stuff of dreams.

I have a preference for savory baked goods rather than sweet, so I tried the 3 offered during the first bake and I was blown away.  My favorite was the mortadella & gruyere croissant.  It was flaky and moist with salty and fatty balance from the meat and cheese.  I really liked the crispy cheese chip that is a by-product of it oozing out during the baking process.  Kudos to the pastry chef for these great savory treats!!

Delish! We went for the afternoon bake at 12:35ish, some things were ready and some were still coming out of the oven. Mindy was there and serving customers which was so fun. I’m so glad the new location is open and ready!

Highly recommend! Tried the Gruyère croissant, sausage egg cheddar chive danish, and vegan chocolate pecan banana bread. There was a ~15 minute line Sunday morning - would advise showing up earlier rather than later
In such cold, windy weather their super rich, chocoatey, thick hot chocolate is just perfect! Pair it with a delicious, flaky pop tart pastry and you have yourself a perfect Sunday treat.

Five stars!! This place has some of the best papusas I’ve had in the entire city. I highly recommend coming to this cute restaurant right in the heart of Albany Park. Great service and prices too. Will be back!
Pupusa mixta was delicious and so was their horchata, which is Salvadoran horchata. I'm definitely coming back the rest of their menu. They also have various vegetarian friendly pupusas.
Food was Excellent but you have to be very PATIENT because they make their Food from Scratch 😃 I recommend this place 😃

Super Delicious!
My non-Latino friends, if you like soft tortilla stuff with cheese and or fried cracklings, this is a must. Don’t forget to add the vinegar coleslaw on top.
Everything we tried tasted as it was made with care. Wonderful hospitality. Byob
Nice little sandwich shop. Maxwells been around for many years. A line can form outside. No seating or bathroom inside. Grab and go. They are known for their pork chops sandwich.

The regular hotdog that I ordered was very good! But the onions that I typically order with one at hotdog joints were likely spoiled. I felt sick for hours afterward and I'm not sure if I was just unlucky or if this is the norm. It was enough for me not to go back.
delicious gente muy amable i got the double hot dog wit everything and fries !!!! amazing delicious hit the spot i love this place

Me and my Dad (R.I.P)To my father I miss him so much, he passed away in January 2021 from COVID. We used to always make it a little tradition for us to get to Maxwell Street and I would get so hungry on the way to you guys lol. He loved his 2 hot dogs no ketchup of course, I always got my Hamburger with everything-fries and coffee 😄.  We are Italian so I love this picture too. I recommend you go here definitely 100%%
Awesome food. Everything is made fresh, hot and prepared in your face. The people there are attentive to your order and instructions with your order. Try them

This was maybe my 2nd time patronizing this business and my wife's 1st time and we were pleased with the freshness and overall delicious food at Home Run Inn Pizza. We order some crispy hot wings, cheese sticks and obvious a pizza topped with sausage and mushroom. The staff was friendly and the store was very well maintained. LTS recommended 👌🏿

I ordered a 16 inch half pepperoni/half sausage garlic crust pizza along with a gluten free pizza. My son picked it up and when he arrived home, the middle of the regular pizza is not cooked all the way. As you can see in the picture attached. We love Home Run Inn and choose you over local pizza places due to the gluten free option for my son. I am very disappointed that for $50 we get a pizza where the middle pieces cannot be eaten due to the dough not being fully cooked.
HRI really got me with this deal! What more can one ask for? A large pizza, wings and fries for less than 40$ I’ll take it over and over again! Thank you for having this superb deal.

I ordered an extra large sausage and cheese pizza as take out but as I’m eating my pizza i taste bbq sauce. Knowing i have nothing in my order that pertains bbq, i look under my pizza and saw bbq sauce there. I am highly upset. It’s obvious that they are not sanitary there

Hadn't been here since the pandemic began. I understand all prices are rising but the price point to value and quality just isn't there right now. The cheesey garlic bread was just a loaf of bread with cheese across the top of two pieces. Not butter, no garlic. I always get the same salad, which apparently is now only on their catering menu? So I got a salad which they said is for two but definitely is in a normal deli salad bar container for an individual. So for $55, and what you get it just wasn't what I'd expect.
Ordered straight from their menu and we were very happy with the Thai Chicken Crunch and the Chicken Caesar salads.  Staff were friendly and helpful.
The beet salad was fresh and delicious.   Decided to try the fish special of the day which was a white fish with a puttanesca sauce.  A great choice for lunch as it was light and full of flavor.

Really delicious salads with a wide variety of options. I usually go for their recommendation of salad/dressing combos, but you can always switch it up and substitute or add ingredients. Just know they charge extra for add-ons. They are super fast during the lunch rush, but the space is small, so there is only a counter top area to dine in. Highly recommend for loop lunchers looking for a healthy and fast option!

I'm new to the downtown area for work. I decided to try this place for the first time. My experience was wonderful. The person who helped me was super sweet to me and patient. The gentleman who checked me out was so kind to me. They are card only at the moment I only had cash and he let me slide. They will continue to get my money and my business. By the way, the Backyard BBQ salad is amazing delicious and refreshing. Thank you for the warm welcome to downtown Chicago

For lunch I come to this location often and just LOVE the salads and topping choices.  Saul helped me today with completing my order - he was kind and patient.  Much appreciated and the salad was delicious!

I truly cannot express how fantastic this place is. My partner and I ordered the evenings tasting menu along with the wine paring. The favors were amazing, intricate and nothing less than incredible. Please offer our compliments to the chef and kitchen staff. The wine tasting selections were also perfectly curated and coordinated with the night's food offering. Service was outstanding and we sincerely enjoyed discussing our food and wine adventures with Gwen (I believe), who was taking care of us. We will come and visit again sooon. Thank you so much!

Stumbled upon Sepia just walking the street and decided to stop in for dinner. Little did we know that it was a Michelin Star restaurant. What we thought was going to be a light meal turned into a 4-course meal off of the tasting menu for $85 per person. We were down for the experience and for a Michelin Starred restaurant with high quality service $85 is very reasonable.

We were promptly seated and asked to select our 4 courses up front. The menu had 3-5 options per course that you can choose from with a vegetarian option available at each course and for the main course there was a fish, beef, duck, and veggie option for all palettes. The portion sizes are small, it’s a tasting menu so the 4 courses in total leave you feeling satisfied — not overly full but satisfied. My courses were very neat heavy, I would’ve preferred to have at least a vegetable on my steak plate or something to balance the meal out. The dishes themselves were a little too salty for my liking as well.

Overall great experience and a wonderful surprise but I have no desire to go back.

Wow, what an amazing culinary and sensory experience. Time slowed down and floated pleasantly as we enjoyed the tasting menu at Sepia over a two hour dinner. As someone who has a few dietary restrictions, I really appreciate a tasting menu with a few different choices (Sepia has 4 for each course) so that I can choose plates without having to ask for substitutions or accommodations. Portions were perfect, tastes, textures, and presentation were right on, and the service was kind, engaging, and informative. Highly recommend for a nice meal if you are visiting Chicago. It was a highlight of our trip - and I would have paid more than the menu price for this meal after having had it. Sepia has a great thing!

Best dining experience we've ever had. The food was incredible. Every dish was carefully thought out and presented beautifully. I would eat here every day if I could afford it. The staff was all very pleasant and kind as well. The whole experience was wonderful.

Absolutely amazing! The tasting menu is incredible especially with the wine pairing. I loved hearing about why a certain wine was chosen with the course, and everything matched perfectly! I would love to go again and try other dishes as the tasting menu is reasonable priced.

Good fast food, I would never eat sushi from here.  Place needs to be DEEP CLEANED ASAP.. Been in multiple times to see sushi being made with bare hands, cross contamination!! ..  Thing's you don't see when you order food from uber.
Small place 4 tables. lots of take out business! Sushi was excellent chicken on chicken pad Tai was runbery and meh, but noodle were on point and delicious. Prices matched quality.

Small portions (the photo is of dinner sized Basil Fried Rice entree). The first time I visited the customer service left a lot to be desired, but the second time we were treated well. We enjoyed a few sushi rolls and noodle dishes. Be careful on the spice! No gluten free soy sauce.

I ordered this place from UberEats.
The sushi is so delicious and fresh even though I ordered it so late at night. Pretty cheap for the portion.
I find their sticky rice weird though, not the typical Thai. Unfortunately, it doesn't taste good.
This is what quality sushi tastes like! Anytime I'm back in town I have to come back for more!!!! And the crab rangoon are perfect!
Ordered the 10 piece wings for 18.99 and all I got was wings from a Cornish hen. A newborn baby can eat these . Should have followed my first mind and went next door!
I love the grilled chicken salad. I order one about 3 days per week. The garlic chicken salad is to die for also. The entire menu looks delightful. Take my word for it! 👍🏽❤💯

The Cashier Are Very Welcoming And Also The Security Officer Name Sgt. Lewis The Homemade Lemonades Are To Die For And The Chicken Is Cooked To Perfection With Fresh Oil By The Cook Name George,The Restaurant Is Clean And Spacious They Stay Open Late For My Connivence Which Is A Plus. And Accepts All Forms Of Payments.😃
Turkey Burger was dry and didn't have any flavor. A waste of money. Food was cold upon delivery. My first and last time ordering from this restaurant. HORRIBLE  !!
Hello,It's nice too see some of the Food courts still Open on the South Side!and the take out was made just like you Ordered!

There was a long line on a Saturday afternoon but it's mostly because they only have one window open for taking orders. They accept credit cards.

I got the swirl soft-serve with peanut butter dipping and chocolate dipping. You have to be patient for the shell to harden. I like the chocolate flavor better than the vanilla flavor but neither of them are significantly more delicious than other places offering soft serve. I'd say it'll be a place to visit if it's in your neighborhood but probably not worth driving here on purpose.

The sweets are great, but the food is meh. Friend and I dropped in here mostly to grab a freeze, but we also got a burger to hold us over until dinner. Burger was as impressive as a Burger King. The freeze was delicious though, can hit just right on a hot day. When looking at all the other treats people were getting, you can tell this place gets ice cream right.
I love it for quick and inexpensive Ice cream. My usual is the almond delite with chocolate ice cream instead of vanilla. I also love the onion rings
I had some very delicious onion rings, a veggie dog, and a wonderful “dirt and worms” sundae. They have such a huge menu! Yum!
Best place for soft served ice cream! Theres usually a line but it goes quick. Highly recommend.
Place was kinda okay, not the cleanest. The service was fine for the drinks, but they forgot to give us our food. Sister had to remind them we're still waiting on our donuts.

Good morning, this is the third time that the orders that I ask for pick up is not what I expected, this time I ordered a sweet black pepper bacon croissant and a coffee where the cold foam is not even a bit, I place my orders every morning Because I used to like how they attended and made my orders but now every day the service is very bad.

The night shift employee with the pink hair was very nice and was very professional. There was a long line for just ice cream about 1-2 weeks ago and she still managed to get my order right even when it was stressful. I had my best refresher ever. Strawberry with green tea. Thank you!

Staying at my aunt’s condo unit nearby and this is the nearest dunkin branch. The service is fast but the lady serving the donuts is unprofessional and a bit rude and unhygienic. If you’re in Michigan ave, st clair or ohio street and craving for some dunkin, look elsewhere.
i come almost every night and the girl on who’s night shift most of the time with the red/pink hair is so sweet and helpful.  she is the only reason why i come to this store 💖💜

LET ME TELL YOU ALL ABOUT THIS MANAGER AT THIS LOCATION SKINNY GUY WITH GLASSES DO YOU ALL KNOW HE TOLD ME IT WAS OK FOR HIS WORKERS TO MAKE THE BURGERS WITHOUT GLOVES ALSO HE LET ONE OF HIS WORKERS DISRESPECT ME AND SAY HE WAS GOING TO TALK TO HER AND DID NOT ALSO HE THOUGHT IT WAS COOL TO BRAKE A WHOLE DOLLAR OF MINES FOR A PENNY AND GOT THE NERVES TO SHORT ME 4 CENT BUT TOOK 1 CENT OUT OF MY DOLLAR BECAUSE I DID NOT HAVE A PENNY AND I WOULD LIKE TO SAY THIS LOCATION NEED TO BE CLOSED DOWN THEY ARE SO UNPROFESSIONAL AND DON’T SHOW NO RESPECT TO NO ONE THEY TERRIBLE AT THIS LOCATION GIVE YOU ATTITUDE WHEN YOU ASK FOR YOUR FOOD TO BE FRESH AND HOT TOUCHING SOME OF EVERYTHING WITH THE SAME GLOVES THEY MAKING YOUR FOOD WITH IT’S UNSANITARY AND SOMETHING NEED TO BE DONE

Totally disappointed. I was tired and didn't check my food. I order a 10piece spicy & a 6 piece spicy. BUT I WAS GIVEN a mixture of regular & spicy, luke warm nuggets & my fries were not fresh. Had I gotten a receipt TODAY it would have went back..only ate the maybe 6 spicy and went to bed. Guess because they gave me extra sauce I'd be happy😭😭🥺 Won't happen again NO MATTER HOW TIRED I am. $8.83 down the drain.. @Wendy's night shift Be ASHAMED of yourselves!

I went to have my lunch at this restaurant. It’s been a while since I last visited this place, and it has not changed a lot. I was able to order quickly, and the service was also fast, so I was able to get my order just after a couple minutes of waiting, and I am glad that I did not wait longer since the place was not really that busy or packed on that particular day. The staff behind the counter are also nice and friendly. My order was just their spicy chicken sandwich combo, which includes one spicy chicken sandwich, fries, and a drink. I like the spicy chicken sandwich. The chicken was crispy and juicy. Aside from that, it was fresh and hot, and the veggies in it were fresh as well. I have a little complaint about the fries. It was fresh and hot too, but it tasted a little bland for me, and it definitely needed some salt to it. Despite that, I liked the meal I had because it was still a good one and the price was so cheap. The food is not really that bad, and in fact, I like the spicy chicken sandwich, and for its price, I think it is still a pretty good deal.

Food was good, fresh, hot, clean, and delivered in a very timely manner, and servers presented it with a smile. Only turn off was a bunch of very loud, annoying, and disrespectful High School student's making the dining experience less enjoyable.

My wife and I usually get some burgers from there. Dave double is my favorite or that salad with avocado and chicken. Today my wife was getting a burger. it was 11 AM the breakfast was just over . She then noticed that the employee doing the burgers in the back did not have gloves on. She asked him why he was not wearing gloves? The employee replied " to avoid bacteria touching every where" which to me is completely false. Having myself been  in the food industry I know for a fact that employees have to wear gloves when dealing with food .
My wife then asked to talk to a manager and the alleged "manager" repeated the same thing that the employee said. I told my wife not to order anymore. I was disgusted that employees who supposedly have taking the city of Chicago food handling and sanitation classes are still handling burgers with no gloves.
If you stay in the Wicker Park neighborhood, please pay attention to who is making your burger in the back. These people don't have a clue what their doing.

One of the underrated thin crust pizzas around. Their pasta dishes are also great, as is toasted ravioli as an appetizer. Convenient location from Uptown, Edgewater and Andersonville. If you go in the evening, the parking lot next door is available. Great ownership that does many good things for the community. Highly recommended.

Very arguable place. Clean, which is good. Some food is good (pasta alfredo), and the other is just horrible. Chicken wrap was so bad, it’s bitter!!! And didn’t smell well. Lettuce is not fresh, chicken is literally burnt and black! and sauce…what kind a sause is that? The menu says it’s Cesar, but it’s oil bitter stuff…:( never thought it can be so bad.

The Gnocchi Heaven was exactly that.  The absolute best cream sauce I have ever had.  Ever.  My starter salad was fresh, crisp and surprisingly flavorful.  My wife had the Italian Wedding Soup to start and it was scrumptious. Her spaghetti was delicious as well, and I don't like spaghetti.  We had the the Sausage and Peppers to start, again, delicious.  We will be repeat customers.
Delicious food.  Really great and attentive service.  Calm clean bright and welcoming atmosphere.  Great experience overall.  Definitely recommend Eggplant Parmesan!

Get this pizza ASAP! Lol

I've ordered delivery from grubhub twice and picked up once. The food is always spot on!

I have ordered their white pizza, which is absolutely delicious!

We got their Aroma special pizza and added sausage, olives, spinach and tomatoes. OMG! Thee best pizza ever! I tend to eat with my eyes first and presentation is always an A+ with them. Fresh ingredients and they're always offering some sort of discount!

Overall the best pizza in town hands down, we plan on trying more items of their menu.

Oh, and the carrot cake is to die for! But you didn't hear that from me.. 😌

Anybody that gives this place a bad review is just confused. Great prices, fast pick up. Look. If you have one bad experience I don’t trust the review. I come here pretty regularly for pick up when I need a quick dinner and its fire. Always super hot and spicy. Never let down. They have awesome combos. And again. Good prices. The perfect spot for a quick pick up. I tried a lot of spots nearby and this is my go to. We need more places like this.
Really good food. We always order from them and food is always good, fresh and with authentic flavor. Order from them and you won’t be disappointed.
There  Mongolian beef is my favorite!!!! Orange chicken is pretty good too, both have a great heat to them. This place is great, always have the orders correct.
The food was delicious and everything was very fresh. Rapid delivery, definitely ordering from there again.

First time ordering, FANTASTIC food, the first chicken Pad Thai TENDER. The Mongolian beef, super tender, not with hit and miss tenderness. Sweet and sour chicken - wow, tender again, beyond words. LOVE IT!

The bagels are great but the cashier should go back to school and get a personality. Nowhere in “Retail101” does it say it’s appropriate to eat something while ringing in a customers order. Handling my food order while she is eating just doesn’t seem right!!! Again, my Nova Lox was very tasty.

It was my 1st time at Einstein's, and I liked it a lot. I had a Texan Brisket with Garlic Beagle, the location has an excellent location (conveniently close to my chooses hotel 😏) and a lot of inside space, it was barely crowded and device was as quick as you could expect. Restorooms were clean and staff was very attentive. In my opinion, the combination I chooses was a bit too dry 😅 but very tasty 🤤.
Ordered baked hash browns from here which turned out to be too oily and undercooked. Very disappointed. This is a take away only store.

WOW!! I exist in a bagel coma after this morning's amazing experience at Dearborn and Kinzie! I ordered using the app and arrived a few minutes early. A nice woman confirmed that my order was next to be fulfilled. And a super nice woman carefully packaged my bagels and spread, walking my bagels and super divinely hot coffee to me with zest and kindness. I felt like she appreciated my business. I surely appreciated her, and I hope that she knows it. And the bagels! Oh the bagels were DIVINE. My beautiful puppies also enjoyed licking the cream cheese from my fingers, lol. Their picture of this activity is attached. Thank you so much to your team of workers. I am grateful.

This place is terrible. You wait so long.  All the food is fake like subway. The Chorizo on my breakfast burrito was a broken up patty. Looked like cat food. Tasted nothing like Chorizo. Idk what it was.

I'm visiting from NYC and we decided to order chinese based on a craving. This makes the list of top worst food I've ever tasted. I ordered something really basic chicken wings w/ fried rice. At first look I though everything would be okay but one bite into the wings and I was done. The rice looked too dark but I decided to taste it anyways. That's when I realized we were all complaining because of the oil used for cooking. I believe they reused really old oil. We got some sweet spicy wings and because of the sauce u was almost fooled but the oil use for cooking was there. Why would you do that as a restaurant? Also I was told the noodles for "lo mein" were overcooked.

The food is delicious and well made. We loved the flavors. In addition, the portions were big, and the prices were excellent. The cashier was so friendly. I recommend this restaurant to anyone who craves excellent Chinese food. 👍🏻

Some of the best fried rice,  that I've had in a lonnnng time. I've been searching for a long time for excellent Asian cuisine and I've found a winner with King Wok. I'm so glad my colleague recommended them.They would have gotten 5 stars, but my order was missing my egg roll. The food was hot and delicious!!

We ordered food to our hotel room, and the delivery was quick. The driver was professional and friendly. The food was awesome and very hot.   We had Crab Rangoon which were big and delicious , and General Tso Chicken which had plenty of sauce and was the best!!

We were super hungry after a long day. It was only two of us and took like 50 minutes for the order.  I ordered a side of fried jumbo shrimp and they gave me egg rolls with a 1/4 a shrimp in it.  Chicken fried rice was also tasteless and the beef with broccoli was a size of my fist.  Not gonna waste my money and never again.

Checking in... Was on a diet and haven't ordered from here in over 6 months.. Very happy to report that the slices are still solid as ever (solid means that they taste good and they are big, not the best ever had) AND the soup was unfreakingbelievable as always.... Now I know how I initially gained so much weight after moving a block away a couple of years ago. Haters going to hate but all things weighed equal, for the money, this place is a solid choice.
Really the best thin crust in Buena Park...and yes, it is tastier than Michael's!

Ordered for pickup. It accepted my order online and charged my card, but when I walked there they were closed, and it was over an hour before their posted closing time.

Edit: Called and spoke with owner. Order was fulfilled at a later date.
Great Cajun pasta.. thin crust pizza wasn’t that good — too hard.

Placed an order for pickup today, during the hours that are posted on google and the website. Order went through and my card was charged, it didn’t state that they were closed anywhere. Got there and it was closed, I couldn’t see where on the door the updates hours are. This was the second time something like this has occurred.

Please help the employees here. Don't go in, it is just too much effort for them, especially for the young lady with very long false eyelashes. When we walked in she just looked as it was all too much for her to walk to the till and asked what we wanted. Foolishly I asked a question, the look she gave me was if I had crawled out of a drain. But at least she gave me a look, because she didn't give me an answer!

The ordering process was tortuous, how dare I look at what items they had before I rattled off what I wanted!!

We cancelled the order and left, it must have been the right thing to do, because it made the employees laugh. This made me happy as I did feel guilty about interrupting their day.

So don't make the same mistake as we did, make their day and just walk on by!!

I wouldn’t even give this place a one star with today’s horrible verbal abuse of the employee. Went in there for two simple drinks just a coffee and cappuccino blast. The female worker that was there started to accuse us of having an attitude and all we did was order two coffees. Apparently between ordering the coffee and her making the coffee we gave her some time of attitude according to her. So she processed to tell us that we can go somewhere else. We were confused and decided to leave, as we were walking to the door she started to belittle us and started making comments on our weight. That’s when I didn’t understand why she was making fun of our weight when she is bigger than my boyfriend. She even had the nerve to flick us off and stick her tongue out as we were leaving. I won’t be going to this location anymore.

Check out the new improved DD.

So I'm guessing the brand is doing one of those regular general appearance and branding updat
This spot has gotten so so much better. I gotta say the changes they've made are greatly appreciated.
- Security (thank good)
- Better Lighting (a world of a difference)
- Larger Display Glass (looks delicious)
-LCD monitors everywhere (easy on the eyes)
- CLEANER! (the visibility upgrade encouraged more janitorial effort?)

If you haven't stopped by to grab an OG Carmel Latte in a while; hold the venti, grande, and snobbery, you should give the one on Adams a look. There's still work to be done as far as professionalism but . . .

This Dunkin' Donuts is going places!
Right into my gps between for some overnight cramming and 'spresso.

they forgot to take out the paper for cheese, 0 service
literally the worst dunkin donut experience ive ever had
Only one person working. No air conditioning. Quick service but iced tea didn't taste very good.

When I tell y'all that this is the BEST service I've ever received, I'm not even playing.

⚠️long post alert⚠️

There was a short wait to be seated, but we were guided into the bar area where we could have a drink while waiting (super smart on their part!). Also, since we were closer to their closing time, one of the staff members offered us the menu so we could order before the kitchen closed. Super kind of her!

When seated, we had the BEST waiter. I feel like he might have been manager or owner of the place (didn't catch his name - sorry!). Either way, he was very kind and very patient with us.

My friend has a gluten and dairy free diet, and he made sure they got all of their substitutions correct - right on! 🤙🏾

Not only did I almost cry when we got a complementary piece of cake (that was delicious!!!), but the waiter also replaced a berry that had fallen out of my fruit salad.

I know it sounds insane, but the fact that he was attentive even to a small detail like that meant that he truly cares about providing great service. He even gave me a to-go cup for the ice coffee I didn't finish - at no charge!

Honestly, I dread driving to the city (I'm a suburbanite) but I would drive out to go to this place over and over and over again. 👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾

The absolute friendliest staff! Brunch was delicious and the drinks were some of the best I’ve ever had. Lots of intentional options for gluten free folks along with accommodating other dietary needs. And the atmosphere was one that was welcoming and inclusive. Love to see it!

We live in MN and our friends brought us here for breakfast, and just wow. Everything was perfection. The service was beyond wonderful, the staff was SO friendly and attentive. Loved the menu. The food was incredible. The steak burrito and omelette were phenomenal and have us wanting to come back for them again before we leave town. I adore how they brought out a gorgeously colorful coupe of fresh fruit before the rest of the meal. I loved how they bring a little carafe of more of your tea/soda water so you have an unlimited bev supply. Literally everything was amazing and I wish we had a place like this in MN! Oh, and need to mention the hash browns are made by pure angels in the kitchen. Couldn’t have been more perfect! Thank you Tweet!!!

the place is packed but you get seated quickly. bottomless coffee and good mimosas. i didn’t think the hollandaise was exceptional but i would come back to try something else! great staff. oh! and i don’t know if this is usual, but they gave us a little slice of apple spice cake to munch on while we looked at the menu.

For a fun and funky diner vibe with a vast selection of breakfast and lunch dishes (including a ton of dietary accommodations), Tweet is your spot.

We were visiting Chicago from Pittsburgh and looking for a good brunch spot. This is one of the most enchanting breakfast joints I’ve been to—and that’s saying something.

We went on a Thursday afternoon (brunch time) and it wasn’t busy. Perfect! We were sat quickly with a small dish of chocolate chip coffee cake, a sweet touch.

The waiter was fun and bubbly, while being informative and helpful. He kindly answered all of our questions,  even with a few “dad jokes” thrown in. My favorite! He was masked, which was much appreciated. We started with water and coffee. These were filled consistently and the coffee was great! Off to a great start…

I had the French Toast with syrup and a side of Chicken Sausage. My friend got the standard breakfast (eggs, meat, potato, etc.). The portions were big and filling—the value was great for the price. The French Toast was phenomenal: fluffy, perfectly browned and dusted with powdered sugar. AND it was served with good maple syrup, not the flavorless sugar water you find at some places.

Meals were served with a fresh fruit cup and it was good too, not mushy and overripe. Everyone enjoyed their food.

As a visitor to the city, I’d recommend this spot to anyone coming through. Thanks for adding some color (and tasty eats) to our trip!

Lovely breakfast. The steelcut oatmeal will set you up for the day. Coffee is nice and smooth. The breakfast sandwich was gorgeous too. Free Wi-Fi. Staff forgot to give me a cup for my ice tea and I didn't have the receipt to prove it unfortunately.
Great coffee and cozy ambience. Very polite and friendly staff. To-go place for a quick bite when travelling or for breakfast.
Great healthy options and delicious food. Good service, very good for a quick bite between sightseeing stops. Great location, nice street views!
Good food and service. I ordered tuna salad on multigrain plus iced tea. I like to put potato chips on my tuna salad.
The food is always of high quality and I love coming here to use the coupons. Definitely try the season items when you can.

I honestly wish I could give no stars with giving a review, my service today was worse than I ever experienced at this location. I ordered ahead and was very specific about how I wanted my tenders which is shown on the receipt (there in the picture) I didn’t have the time to go in and speak to a manager because I was on my break but when I got upstairs to eat my lunch not only were my tenders not done the way that I asked but they were a bit raw in the middle and my ranch barely even had a drop in it. I am very upset with how my order was done today I didn’t even eat it. I just want my refund.

Amazing joint..juicy burgers.. nice cool seating.. But I stopped at 4 Star because of the price point - the burger, fries and drink all need to be purchased separately..No meals available! So it gets pricey!!

I wanted a double bacon burger in a lettuce wrap! I got my burger and then saw I had no bacon, I had paid for extra, they gave me bacon in a cup. I paid extra for no reason honestly. 1 pickle and the lettuce was just slapped on top! These burgers aren't even subpar! Tasteless and the bacon is sweet, which I didn't like at all. Especially not for 17 dollars! They're more expensive than 5 gives but don't even come close to how good they are. Don't waste your money. Then the staff is texting on the phone and not paying attention. Buy food else where. I hope they go out of business and put a different restaurant!

1.) $4 for a soda.

2.)My burger only had pickles on it. No fries available either.

3.)Bye.

it was rly lame . they only take card or mobile payment methods and we paid 27 dollars for two cheeseburgers , one chicken sandwich and a milkshake . it was 5.49 for each burger, and the burgers were no bigger than the palm of my hand. there was nothing special about them, and im not gonna lie , a mcdonalds burger tastes better than this. way too tiny to be 5.49. the milkshake was also tiny, it came way too thick, and for 4.99, you could get a larger shake at mcdonalds. don't waste your money here.

I’ve been coming to this location ever since they opened because I work at the restaurant down the street. I usually have a good experience, pizza is always awesome and the staff is polite enough for you to feel welcome. But today was just a different story. I walked in, the staff I don’t think even acknowledged me, the girl making my pizza dragged her feet to the counter and if I didn’t say hello first I think she wouldn’t even bother greeting me! The ingredients were scarce, I asked for some bacon she put a few little bits in the center and called it a day. So my pizza went in to the oven, without being rotated as they usually do, came out BURNT the cheese turned brown and the edges were black. At this point after the whole unapproachable attitude I didn’t even bother complaining. Taste of the pizza is 3/10. I worked in the industry for so long and I get it the kitchen gets hot everyone’s agitated but we can still provide basic customer service.

My pizza had large areas with no cheese and no sauce. From my photo you can see it was pretty burnt. I don’t have a Blaze near me so I’ll try it again, but I hope they do better. I even bought a large thinking it would be delicious and it wasn’t.
Create your own pizza ...and a wood fired oven so the pizza is done in less than 5 minutes ....nice.

Quick, friendly, reasonable. Great pizza with whatever you want on it. The guys here we're all super nice when we visited and cooked up a good pizza. It won't be the best pizza of your life, but it'll never be bad.

This place puts almost no toppings on your takeout pizza, and when you complain they say to ask for more next time.  The support people via social media are just awful as well.  Best bet is to go somewhere else.  Blaize: don't reply posting the link - I tried that, the reply i got was "During your next visit, please feel free to ask the team members for more toppings."

The best service I've received anywhere. They run a tight ship. I've been here twice in the past week and have been seated right away.  Servers take away dishes as you're done with them, check in with you frequently (but not too frequently where you feel like they're bugging you). They are kind people and seen to enjoy working there.

The menu is extensive, which makes me think jack of all trades, masters of none, but somehow they've always delivered. The food is delicious and reasonably priced. Very filling.

This place rocks! Good coffee, great staff, extensive menu, and pretty reasonable prices, especially if you go early on a weekday for their breakfast deals. They serve my ideal hash browns - a little crunch, but soft on the inside. I can’t wait to come back for the biscuits and gravy. Tried them in the country time skillet so I know they’ll be great on their own.
Pass by this place almost daily and finally had some time to stop by for breakfast. Enjoyed the Red Velvet French Toast combo. Friendly and quick service

Used to go all the time before the pandemic. Ordered a couple times in the last few months including today, and both times the food tasted terrible, vegetables were old, avocados were moldy. Threw both of our food out both times. Extremely disappointed given that their prices skyrocketed. Idk who would want to pay $22 for old food

So delicious. The lemon marscapone pancakes with berries were delicious. I had the corn beef hash skillet and baby....I ate the whole thing !!!! Great service, turnaround time was awesome. Valet available on the weekends. Will return soon.

Only had appetizers but they were so delicious and the spiked iced tea.....I can't wait to go back for more. Best spinach dip I've have. Hot wings on point. Definitely will go back and the staff was so friendly.

One of the happening places in the heart of Old Town - Gold Coast of Chicago.

Great ambiance and music. Service is fast, the waitress was very attentive and made good recommendations.

We had The German Pilsner Beer and a Kona Beer from Hawaii.

We ordered Wisconsin cheese curds and since it was almost a Kitchen Closing time, we had to leave before ordering anything else.

But would be back soon.
Went here for St. Patrick's day lunch -- the atmosphere was very enjoyable and the food was especially delicious.  We tried the Rueben sandwhich and the house made veggie burger.
Extremely slow service, wasn't even busy. Veggie burger was like mush, Alfredo was lacking flavor. Cheese curds & ribs were good.

I’ve tried filet and ribs combo and my friend had steak sandwich. We both enjoyed our food and filet was so delicious. Dine-in area was comfy and clean. Servers were friendly. Seems like perfect place to eat and chill.

Valet parking, big space, great distance between tables feel clean feel safe here.
Grill calamari, grill octopus, grill shrimp with butter sauce, grill scallops, grill lamb chop with red wine sauce every dish we try was the best. Great portions well balanced of flavors. Every dish have piece of lemon to add  another layer of flavor. Just perfect. Not the best sangria but definitely value. One pitcher probably one bottle of red wine in there. Must try dessert plater. All dessert here are perfect flavor and textures. Absolute not too rich and finished them with cup of cappuccino. Perfect dinner for us.

Nice outdoor patio, large indoor space abd bar. Dogs welcome outside. Special cocktails, good selection of wines by the glass. Free Greek olives. Service a little slow. I got paella which takes 40 minutes and was excellent. Large portions.

Expensive! Decent portions, good tasting. Tried the Paella Camposina, which is like a vegetable paella, not bad but I’ve had better. The skirt steak was excellent along with the roasted red peppers. The croquettes were very very good. Service of course was very very, so really the only complaint was the price, very expensive. I’m not sure I would call it entirely authentic Spanish cuisine, but very close. We were Cafe Ibérico fans, but they’ve since closed. This is second best!
Fantastic Mother's Day brunch ... the food is excellent and the servers are very friendly.  On special occasions they have a fixed menu with a carefully selected course of tapas.
Great ambiance in this restaurant. A smart choice for sure. Stylish, great food, a prices to won't make your jaw drop. My dish was delicious.
Fast service with delicious food!!!! Even the drinks were good too!!!! Try the pastor tacos and margaritas from there❤️

I was lucky enough to find paid parking right in front of their establishment. I couldn't help but notice that from the time you walk in to the time you leave ... their business was plastered with reminders and notifications that if you dine in they will automatically charge you an 18% gratuity to your bill. I always tip between 20-25% but felt somewhat uncomfortable with their forced gratuity. Anyway, I stayed because I was hungry. The place was very well kept and clean. The waiter was very friendly and attentive. He brought out the chips and very watered-down salsa right away. I ordered a taco dinner with rice  beans and a lemonade. I already mentioned that the salsa was watered down. Their lemonade was lemonade. The rice was ok, the tacos were cooked right but lacked flavor just like their beans. Their food lacked seasoning and flavor. Now, I have an idea as to why they force the gratuity onto their patrons. This was my first and last visit here.

This is one of my favorite places in Bridgeport. The food is always fresh and hot. The service is great and parking is easy to find. It wasn’t crowded at all. We got a table quickly and enjoyed the delicious mango margaritas and burritos.

Food used to be better a couple years ago when ordering online. Went in to dine in last night, food was bland, green salsa needed salt, the tortillas were dry, prices went up and they are definitely not worth it!  They now add an automatic gratuity of 18% but they write it as a service charge on the receipt. The service leaves a lot to be desired, it's no wonder they added an automatic gratuity, otherwise the tip amount would be lower. Save yourself, go somewhere else!

Stop by for some tacos. Didn't know that I had to pay extra for cheese. Also tried the enchiladas
The food was ok. Prices were high to Me
Asked several locals where to find the best dogs in downtown Chicago and was told to come here. Fast, fresh, and friendly! Loved the char dogs, and the fries!
Great char dog with excellent toppings to dog ratio! Crispy fries! A little pricey for the portions but yummy lunch!

Blah. The dogs are ok. We had the Chicago dogs char style. They were glorified hot dogs that were not impressive at all. The 2 guys still the stand were inpatient and sarcastic. As tourist trying out one of Chicago's "spots" we were not impressed enough for a repeat.
I thought there'd be more Chicago dog places in downtown Chicago. This place made a pretty mean dog, but the meat was not huge, so order the double if you're hungry
I had a really good grilled Chicago dog, but i should have ordered the jumbo. The regular was too small.

Wraps are good and fresh , Potatoe salad was good, ribs however they were full of Grease making them impossible to eat. The manager was very friendly and  helpful in helping my experience be a better one. The restaurant was very clean and  I was shocked that the aroma of your typical BBQ house wasn't present.

The prices are reasonable and the staff is courteous.  I loved the meaty rib tips and the collard greens were absolutely delicious! Don't forget to pair up this side with the cornbread  (Johnny cake style).  You won't be disappointed.

Great food and most of all great staff. I wish them the best I write my little girl here and she enjoyed it is well. I cannot wait to come-back. Good luck guys. Actually, I know you have good luck I wish you continued success. I'm done .

IT WAS A BED BUG IN BETWEEN MY NAPKIN! Now, I've been here 3 times, and I always get the pulled pork sandwich. This time I went, there was a special 2 pulled pork sandwiches for $10. I got that. They stapled my bag together so I know it was from the restaurant. That is so gross. I don't recommend this restaurant until this issue is resolved.

Service was very good however the food was just ok. My fries were cold and the bread not really fresh. My rib tips were very tender the Mac n cheese was just ok.. I might considering trying them again but not close to the closing hour.

I took a friend here Friday night for the Asian fusion menu, the romantic vibe, the reported excellent service, and the location in bustling River North.

We got all of that and more, with outstanding service from Ryan G, everything my friend and I wanted food and drink-wise, sexy hip-hop in the ambience, and seated by the tall windows so we could enjoy seeing the flow of people stream by.

The bathroom is downstairs, past a seeming dance party area, and I loved the club bathroom feeling. We closed out the restaurant unwittingly, which may explain how I was able to get so much time at the bathroom mirror making funny faces.

Excellent date spot, would highly recommend.

Booked on open table and said no patio seating but when we checked in they accommodated for a great brunch on a beautiful summer day. Bottomless mimosas seem a little pricey but the spiked coffee with donut was good. We had the burrito (it was good but a bit bland even though there were several ingredients) and chicken biscuit that was amazing.  Super nice staff.

Fun environment. We had the Halibut tacos and the Filet Mignon tacos. Flavor and season was very good. They were delicious. The blueberry butter cake was fantastic. We really enjoyed our date night here. Peter, our server was super friendly and very attentive.
This was my second visit and bang-bang cauliflower does not disappoint! You must order this delectable appetizer on your next visit!  Enjoyed the chicken tenders love how the fries are preseasoned.

Had a great server and atmosphere of the restaurant is good. Also has some good happy hour specials. I ordered the Mongolian Beef. It came out with so much oil it was pooped at the bottom of the meal. I had to send it back and get something else.

HALF OFF WINGS ON MONDAYS.
I use to be there every Monday when I worked nearby. Now I try to get there once a month with some buddies for a cold beer and some buffalo wings on Monday's. Lots of tvs to see sports and they also got free popcorn in the back! Love this place! And it's open until 4AM!!!

The cleanest 4am bar i have ever set foot in. Great place to catch the last few rounds with friends, or rendezvous with a tryst who sent you a "you up" text at 1am before deciding whose place to go to. Collegy to be sure, and you might see some interesting things play out, but definitely the least schezzy place to end your night after the other bars close.

Surprisingly not terrible. I'd strongly recommend Galway Bay right next door instead, but the drinks are reasonable and the bar is spacious. Plus, it's a 4am bar, so you'll be sure to finish the night strong at Yak-Zies.

I ate a buffalo chicken pizza from here a couple years ago and thought it was the best thing since sliced bread. In retrospect after last night's experience, I may have just had a few too many overpriced beers here prior to ordering. I tried to order one of these pizzas online last night and that was a complete debaucle. Right after I got done ordering I realized that I had forgotten to order pop. So I called back right away and they refused to just add it on to my order. Instead they wanted me to cancel my online order a replace it. At this point, I was a little annoyed and they accomodated me by saying I could just pay cash for the pop. So okay fine, but they asked if I wanted a can or a six pack - ok, I'll take the six pack. To my shock and horror - a six pack of diet coke was $7. WTH?!?!?! Fine, besides all that - this was the worst pizza I have ever eaten. By the time it got to us it was cold and the cheese was coagulated. The blue cheese dressing that they claim to be famous for is runny and thin and mostly tasteless. We threw half the pizza out and spent the rest of the night complaining about how gross it was. Won't make that mistake again! Maybe if I've had enough to drink and I'm at the restaurant, just maybe I'd give it another shot but sober I think not.
This is a little secret place in on Diversey where I have to come quite often. Great conversation with Dave, the bartender and the best buffalo wings you will have, period.

My wife and I decided to try this place after walking up and down Broadway. We thought that the prices were reasonable, there were people already eating at the restaurant (which is always a good proxy for the quality of the food) and the decor looked very reminiscent of a typical restaurant in South east Asia.

I had the red curry with beef and my wife had the satay noodles. Both were pretty good. My red curry had just the right amount if heat to it and wasn't overpoweringly sweet. The beef was cooked nicely, with it being quite tender and juicy. My wife's satay noodles had a sauce which was done quite nicely, with a good amount of peanut sauce so you could taste it. Wasn't too thick or sweet as well.

Overall, this is a pretty good place for Asian food. My only gripe is that for the price, the portions are rather small, you might have to order and addition dish or bowl of rice.

The restaurant is very inviting when you walk by. It seemed like a very nice place to get your thai food fix. I decided to check this place out. I walked in and stood around for 5 minutes before talking to the cashier and she told me I can sit anywhere. I sat at the table for 20 minutes before I was given water to drink and another 15 minutes before my order was taken. I saw 5 tables get up and leave before even ordering anything. How is this place in business! I ordered an appetizer, calamari. It took 15 minutes to get out which was fine, but once I picked it up the coating fell into pieces. It was awfule. I cancelled my entree and paid for my appetizer and left. Awful experience ever in that area. I don't recommend this place for anyone. There are a lot more better options. I went to CRISP...great food! check it out.

Love this place. Food gets an A+ for presentation and great prices, fabulous service, yummy smoothies and teas. Definitely try their green tea bubble smoothie. Can't go wrong with anything you get here.

I've been looking for a good Thai restaurant close by and tried this one out. I wasn't super impressed with their pad thai – too salty and not enough of the rest of the flavors. Not writing Bamee off, but I'm still looking.
I really liked the food. I tried the Basil chicken, crazy noodle and spicy glass noodle and they were all really good. I would definitely recommend this place.

Great menu with something for everyone and excellent service. We live very close to Seven Lions so it is our go-to spot for brunch anytime we have people visiting from out of town. The restaurant is beautifully designed with a vibe similar to Restoration Hardware. Lots of great options on the menu, but you can’t go wrong with the Lobster Roll, avocado/lox toast, cinnamon rolls, and eggs Benedict. Highly recommend Seven Lions to locals and tourists alike.

The wife and I could not have asked for a better night out, and it all started here. We're both had the 3 course pre-theater meal and it was wonderful. I would highly recommend doing this before a show and definitely spring for the wine pairings as well. Thank you Seven Lions for making a rare date night wonderful.

Nice service, pretty space and the food was tasty.  Started with the Brussels sprouts and burrata on crostini, skimpy on the burrata but good. Lamb shank and salmon was sore 5 delicious, as was the apple cobbler.

Went with brunch with a lady in the restaurant business, who added such great insight to what really goes on. We stopped in on a Saturday for Brunch. We started with the pitcher of Mimosas. Fantastic, can’t go wrong!! She had the Lobster roll which looked Devine!! I had the lemon and blueberry pancakes. So much food!!! We also split a side order of biscuits and gravy. One of the best breakfast gravies iv has in a long time. Spiced just right!! Service was attentive and prompt. All items were  served fresh. All staff members were very knowledgeable about the menu and ingredients. Will return!
Beautiful location right across the bean. The food selection is very appealing and tasted amazing. Staff is kind and very helpful and fast to help.

I brought some friends from out of town to this place because they were craving asian food but didn't know what exactly. There was something for everyone! The atmosphere is relaxed and the food is pretty good. A good place to fall back on with a wide variety of food. Chinese, Thai, Korean, and Japanese options 👌👌👌

Our food was pretty good. We had soft shell crab, pad thai with tofu, and Singapore noodles with chicken. The tofu was fried too long so it had a hollow spot on the middle of each piece and was a little tough to chew, but lets be honest. Tofu can be challenging. All in all everything else tasted great.

We were a little bummed they took the sushi options off the menu though.

As a vegetarian, the ramen here is amazing. It's my favorite food item, and I've tried it in Honolulu, San Francisco, Charlotte, Vegas, Portland, and Seattle, and I can say this is probably my favorite. The broth is flavorful without being salty, and noodles are a perfect consistency. I order extra eggs, and other toppings, because they are all made with care. Highly recommended.

We ordered Four Belly on a Saturday evening ramen whim and really enjoyed the food. The Spicy ramen was fresh and very spicy, just how I like it. We received a side of these little fried pork balls, which we didn't even order. Bonus! Everything was very good, but nothing exceeded expectation. I would definitely try dine-in sometime and perhaps increase my rating. Give it a try, it won't disappoint.

They have a large selection of Asian food for a very reasonable price.  My girlfriend and I often go here and order many small items off the street food menu and share it Tapas style.  The Kara-age (fried chicken) is amazing.   If you don't want to share your food, there are a lot of great individual meals.  I really love the Panang curry!

Literally one of the worst places I've ever been in Chicago. This is the goat cheese dip. Where is it? That, coupled with the world's worst bartender who literally said, "What is a Double IPA? I've never heard of that." While simultaneously saying it's her first day on the job, and being completely disrespectful to all customers....just wow.
Phenomenal service! Great drinks! We had a wonderful time watching Sunday football games, as visitors from another city.
Great place day or night for eats, drinks and catching sporting events...Located in River North with quick access to hotels and other evening venues. Have IG? Follow @t_lovesfood 🤗

Sports bar located in an accessible area with pretty good food and good service. Went here for a firm party and the staff worked hard to make sure thr food was always fresh and hot and everyone had a drink in their hands. The screens were showing a football countdown to a Bears game on one and women's basketball on the other until the game started. Not too rowdy but everyone looked comfortable and happy to be there.

Attended this past weekend for a Birthday celebration, which let me tell you was pretty packed for mother's day weekend. I have read other reviews and think you have good and bad nights out. My experience was great from the security outside to the manager sitting us from the front door. Our group ordered a couple of bottles and they came out really quick. The server Emily was helpful and always around our table.

I know people have posted will never go back or don't go, but go check it out for yourself. Customer service and the music was on point. everyone looked like they were having a great time.

I ordered from here all the time and the food is delicious. I love the fact that they have so many options to choose From. Their lamb chops are a hit and the new philly salmon.. smacking.. not to mention the desserts.. there are so many items I love from this restaurant. And the customer service is great, the girls are so nice..
I love this spot...I order via Ubereats often and then never get it wrong! Hot and Delicious! In wish I could post my videos of a few of my previous meals on here. The pics are doing it no justice
Phenomenal food. 10/10 every time. Staff is very polite and always makes sure the order is filled properly. The menu has great variety to choose from also.
The food was good. But the customer service needs some work. She was rude to a fault.
This sht horrible the pot roast was bland the mac & cheese is dry the dirty rice is boxed spanish rice only thing is they give you a healthy portion for all the money you spend

One of my favorite places for a chill dinner in the neighborhood. This is a perfect place to sit on the front patio, get a glass of wine and people watch. If I go here for brunch, I feel like I could sit there all day! The staff if really friendly and, in true European dining form, they don't force you out of the restaurant or try and turn your table around quickly.

I would say the best mussels on Wells street and their Bistrot salad is to die for as well!

Was looking for a place to grab brunch with my girlfriend yesterday. Lines and long wait times in most of the usual places on Wells St, but this place had no wait. Sat down outside under a nice, big umbrella, with flowers along the outside railing. Server was very nice, and food was delicious. I had the apple cinnamon french toast, which was amazing.

The only thing I was a little dissatisfied with at this place was that no one ever came by to refill my water during the meal, which is something I think is pretty standard practice at a majority of sit-down restaurants.

This Old Town restaurant is usually very crowded for lunch and dinner but I enjoy breakfast at Bistrot Margot the most.  The brunch menu is great and I really like the french toast.  Outdoor patio is really nice for warmer weather.  Steak frites for dinner is a good dish

My daughter and I were looking fpr a place to have dinner before a Second City show.  We happened upon Bistrot Margot.  The menu looked reasonably priced and the offerings looked delicious.  As soon as we walked in we knew had made the right choice.  The aromas were fabulous, the atmosphere was elegantly casual.  We had a hard time choosing our entrees because everything looked enticing.
We shared steak frittes and pork tenderloin.  They were both prepared very well.  It was a memorable meal!!

French Deliciousness! I was here with a group of young women for a bachelorette dinner. The main floor feels a bit like you're typical old-school Chicago bar with its brick walls, but go upstairs.
The white walls and airy atmosphere will make you forget Chicago and truly make you believe you're possibly above the Champs-Élysées. On top of it all the service is impeccable.

Like every restaurant I just want to rant about their entire menu, Bistro Margot is no different. The entrees are pricey, but delicious and delicately prepared. They have a variety of meats, from Veal, to Duck, to various types of fish. I've also perused their brunch menu, another reason for everyone to check this place out.

I have ordered from Papa Giorgio's for about 3 years and have always been very pleased with their food.  The prices are good for the quality of food compared to other pizza places.  The pizza is better than a lot of places I have tried.  I even asked the cook to pre-cook and freeze pizzas so I can ship them to my son and daughter in other states and they loved it because for some reason they can't get good pizza where they are located. (even after being "frozen")  So I have to disagree with the writer (4-years ago) that says, "it taste like frozen pizza." Perhaps it was the cook that particular night or a bad night.  By the way, I noticed the cooks have changed.  The only problem with this restaurant is the location and size, but it's okay for carryout, delivery, or a quick bite as you're passing by.  BTW the slices are huge.

OMG. Don't even know where to start. First off, there is like one thing on the menu, so you don't have to waste time thinking. Then, it takes like an hour to get your food, which gives you time to think about your life. Then, the food tastes so bad, you barf, relieving you of all your sins. Then you get stomach problems, so you go to the bathroom, where someone smeared a cross made of poop, which supports Christ. Then a rat ran in, which shows they support all life forms. Then when I order desert, the guy says "Me no English.", and hands me a burrito. And I think the ground beef was poop. Then, a fight broke out between a mutated rat and a ninety year old striper. I had an anti boner.
Pizza is worst than the crap I got in the army. Worst pizza I've ever had... honestly! They also got our order wrong.. and we only ordered 3 things. Stay away from this place for God's sake
Richard delivered the largest pizza I have ever seen out of kindness. I would have fallen down the stairs. So good and we will be eating for s week. Go giorgios!

I personally love papa giorgios their pizza is awesome but have it without there jumbo hot wings mmmm  pasta is good too... for a small food joint... please stop by and try don't judge a book by its cover... it might not look like a 5 star restaurant but dammit places like this, are the ones that are the best... I'll put money that this place has the top 5 of the best pizzas in town..

Club Lucky is a hidden gem. The moment you walk in the door you feel at home. The atmosphere is comfortable and exciting. It's a mix between an old school dinner in the front and a regular restaurant in the back. The walk up bar is decorated with beautiful bottles and lighting. You can eat and/or drink at the walk up bar. The drinks are amazing and the food is unforgettable. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Eating family style is your best bet with large groups. Highly recommend the Veal Parmesan. They cook everything to perfection and the staff are amazing. Really nice and super friendly with everyone. The place is a must go if you are in Chicago. Highly recommended!

I've gone to Club Lucky a few times but never ate anything because I am the Bus Driver for the Pizza Tour and the Drinks Tour as well. But this time I brought my mom along and both had something to eat while we were there. Food was great, plus the dessert was great as well.

Come for the drinks- stay for the pasta! Club Lucky is one of my favorite places in Bucktown. We sat outside and the outdoor space is lovely. The waitress was great- she helped with recommendations and helpful tips. I am definitely going back again sometime soon. Loved the espresso martini!
What a great place for some Italian food! Nice vibe inside. The food was great and plenty of drinks to choose from. Clean and covid friendly.  Staff was great.

Perfection. Old school fee. No frills but classic exceptional eats. Large pasta selection. Slightly higher price point… average entree is about $25, but very large  portions. Staff was very friendly. The calamari came with cocktail not marinara, which was great - simple but best thing ever.

The day I went (Saturday before mother's day) they had an all you can eat buffet for $20! 🤯 And BOY.. Everything was delicious!!! The macaroni and cheese was AMAZING and the BREAD PUDDING with RUM SAUCE was literally the best thing I have ever put in my mouth! Not kidding! 🤯🤤😅 I wanted to go back again the next day. Lol My only complaint would be that the decor is a little dated but this place has been here forever and a lot of older people dine here so it makes sense. I cant wait to visit Chicago again so I can go back to Pearl's Place.

I stopped in hoping for a late breakfast and discovered a new favorite restaurant on the near south side. I tried their breakfast buffet and was treated to a homemade omelette, potatoes, bacon, sausage and fresh biscuits. Everything was delicious, hot and fresh. I’ll definitely be back to try out the lunch and dinner menu.

What Lunch!! Looked forward to eating here from the reviews. I was pleased beyond ny expectations.  The food was great!! Down home southern cooking!! But what makes it great is the staff. From my greeter, to the server, to the chef at the buffet.  Plenty of southern selections.  Also you can order from the menu.  Also white table linen, and a homie feel in the dining room.  A must visit.  Do not let the outside area or oarking put you off. Must visit.  Thank Pearl for a wonderful lunch!!

The service was friendly and the food was really good. Almost every menu item was on the buffet. Pancakes, waffles, grits, eggs, build your own omelettes, potatoes, ham, bacon, turkey sausage, salmon croquettes, fried chicken, Mac n cheese, catfish nuggets and I'm sure I'm forgetting something. And that was just breakfast!

Wow, the service was impeccable! Our waiter was one of the best I've had in any fine dining restaurant! Although I can't recall his name, I can remember he was the only waiter with green stitching in his chef coat. If your looking for a nice family feel restaurant this is the place.
The food was nice portion, affordable and good. I had rattle snake tall & the turkey dinner.  My wife had shrimp & grits.

Sarpino's is has the best thin crust pizza in Chicagoland. Orders for various ingredients and toppings are handled very well, and deliveries - by their own staff! - are accurate and on-time within 10". Highly recommended!

Ordered via DoorDash.

Order showed up quick, and on Thanksgiving. Kudos for that. The pizza was not the worst I've ever had, not the best. It will do in a pinch.

Ordered a Coke and a diet Coke. We received 2 diet Pepsi. Not the end of the world.

Ordered a pizza half cheese only and have cheese and pepperoni. Got all pepperoni. We picked that off for the kids.

Terrible timing management! Ordered pizza online, which announced that delivery will be made in 30-40 minutes. More than an hour after placing the order, I called the place to follow up, they said that the order is baking. 1h 40 min after placing the order  called again, and they said that the order might be deliver in  10 min.  2 hours delivery time?? Please, announce it to the customers. Poor communication. If you guys are so slammed with the orders, reach out to the customer to prepare them for 2 hours waiting time. Didn’t offer a discount, or anything. Had to cancel the order

Took away the “taste the difference” special because they are stingy. Don’t order from here, they raised their prices and lack the quality to do so. You can order anywhere else and get better food for the price.
Had an experience once where my food just didn’t show. But otherwise I’ve received great service and food from Sarpino’s. Thankful for vegan options.

If you're a Parks and Recs fan...THIS PLACE IS AMAZING.  A Ron Swanson themed restaurant is just what the world and every person needs. My friends and I all chose different dishes and weren't disappointed at the slightest by any of them. Highly recommend you all do the same when it comes to a party of 3 or more. Just share a few bites off each other's plates. Will definitely come back here one day.

This places is BYOB so we took 3 bottles and bought some freshly squeezed orange juice which was amazing. Menu sounded a bit weird at first, but everything was delicious. Huge plates, full of flavour. Place is tiny, so either book in advance or be prepared to wait. We were 4 ladies, and went to another place for mimosas while we waited for our table (about an hour on a Sunday at 1230). No matter the wait, it is definitely worth a try. Would love to go again next time I'm in Chicago!

I love Whisk. I live close by so I come often. It's cash only which is tad annoying, but not major. 1 star off because they only have pork gravy and no other substitute. Wish they had a mushroom or chicken sausage gravy. If they end up adding that I will def. Change to 5. Decor is amazing because it's homage to Ron Swanson from Parks and Rec. Service is awesome.

Very good experience and the food was absolutely delicious. The southern chicken sandwich is definitely not to be passed over. Will definitely be visiting again especially one Taco Tuesday and Wing Wednesday. Highly highly recommended

This place is fantastic.  Great breakfast, great service.  Prices are pretty decent and had a great experience at the community table.  The breakfast food is a creative.  I have the crab cakes, which where great, but my wife's pancakes were fantastic. I will definitely go again.  I absolutely love the decor.  Go to feel your inner Ron Swanson.

LOVE this Freshii!! The owner is so nice and the smoothies are immaculate ❕❕❕so are the peanut butter coconut bites! Although my favorite thing there might be the chia pudding, it has fresh fruit and it’s so good ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️/⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ 5/4 stars
I’m not sure if it was the kind of burritos I got but they were just awful and flavorless. SO. BLAND. Overpriced and undercooked too.
I dunno about their regular food.  But I got some big fat cookies there!

Awesome atmosphere!! I walked in expecting to have just a healthy meal for my lunch break, but stepped into an oasis of friendly faces (and great air conditioning). Everything from soups, bowls and salads on the menu, to creating your own CUSTOM versions of all. It was a great reliever walking in there during lunch and have made it a tradition ever since!

This place is my go to if I want something healthy. The smoothies pack a lot of calories so be careful with those but the salads are decent sized, filling and the ingredients are portioned out so you can mix as you like. The bircher museli with green apple and cranberries is my fav!

I have carry-out lunch here often.  I order their yummy salmon burger with truffle fries (the truffle fried are very delicious when hot) and a blood orange or limonata  San Pallegrino sparkling water.  Most of the time, I  call in to place an order and it is generally ready in 15 minutes.  I recommend this place as an alternative to fast food.  Always remember they close around 6 p.m.

Lunch was very good! The veggie chilli dog with fries was exactly what I was looking for; the pesto grilled cheese could stand to improve a bit. The high volume on the TVs was slightly disruptive, but the interior was generally appropriate for a hot dog joint with higher aspirations.

H-Dogs is a unique eating establishment in the Chicago Bronzeville neighborhood on the South Side. It has a gourment menu with wild game sausages. The fare is fresh and whimsical version of fast food restaurant. It is spacious,  clean, open and inviting. It is across the street from the Harold Washington Cultural Center. It is also located a few doors away from the Jokes and Notes Comedy Club.
