I was fairly impressed by the quality of food in this establishment. A lot of people use their take-up service. Whenever I have dined in, I noticed that most of the customers take their food away. Very clean establishment, excellent customer service, tasty food. I did think though that they were a bit pricey, especially for a hot dog place.
Awesome! I wanted somewhere to eat lunch and work with a coworker. Found this place on Google and was so satisfied! Italian beef and portobello sandwich were great! Delicious food and free Wi-Fi.

Best halal pizza option!
The pizzas are great, meat lovers is my favorite one, the waiters are very welcoming and helpful. The restaurant is clean and the set up is nice as well! 👍

Love their food! So happy to see their new location on Devon w modern industrial decor! Simplified menu & same delicious flavors! Like with any spot on Devon, finding parking can be challenging but they still offer curbside pickup & well worth it. Please get HFSAA Certified to accommodate everyone.

I have been coming to Italian Express since its first location on Western Ave, since 1990s.  I order from them frequently and almost always have a problem with my order.  Today when I called, I asked for "very easy cheese" and explained that it meant little cheese.  When they showed me my pizza, I think they added extra cheese.  I showed them my order ticket and they said that the people in the kitchen don't understand. I told them that they should then explain it to them. I'm giving two stars because the coleslaw is very good and I'm glad I ordered that.

Love chicken nuggets
Buffalo wings
And zinger burger

Awesome food

Horrible food. Ordered a thin crust chicken Tikka pizza and it tastes nothing like that. Just some chicken pieces tasteless with so much cheese, it was not at all thin crust. Ordered shawarma as well. One with rice , one with pita. Chicken was uncooked and it was the same chicken which was served in pizza as well. They served it with no side such as hummus, ganoush. For them shawarma means rice and dry chicken or pita and dry chicken that's all. Shawarma and pizza cannot get worse than this. The lady at the ordering counter mislead me about portion sizes and we ordered more than what would have been sufficient. And shawarma with rice costs extra as well which was not conveyed before ordering.  On top of that they charge 15% surcharge on your orders included by default. I don't mind about price or service if atleast food is good but here food was downright trash.

This was the only restaurant open in the area, hence I had no choice but after looking and tasting the food we just had to throw everything and go back home with empty stomachs. Had to cook meals again at home.

All the reviews here are absolutely correct. I wish I had seen those before going there.
Ordered straight from their menu and we were very happy with the Thai Chicken Crunch and the Chicken Caesar salads.  Staff were friendly and helpful.
The beet salad was fresh and delicious.   Decided to try the fish special of the day which was a white fish with a puttanesca sauce.  A great choice for lunch as it was light and full of flavor.

Really delicious salads with a wide variety of options. I usually go for their recommendation of salad/dressing combos, but you can always switch it up and substitute or add ingredients. Just know they charge extra for add-ons. They are super fast during the lunch rush, but the space is small, so there is only a counter top area to dine in. Highly recommend for loop lunchers looking for a healthy and fast option!

I'm new to the downtown area for work. I decided to try this place for the first time. My experience was wonderful. The person who helped me was super sweet to me and patient. The gentleman who checked me out was so kind to me. They are card only at the moment I only had cash and he let me slide. They will continue to get my money and my business. By the way, the Backyard BBQ salad is amazing delicious and refreshing. Thank you for the warm welcome to downtown Chicago

For lunch I come to this location often and just LOVE the salads and topping choices.  Saul helped me today with completing my order - he was kind and patient.  Much appreciated and the salad was delicious!

Delicious food and great service! The place is really cute, perfect for a date night! My husband had the pasta with salmon and I had a special (butternut squash ravioli - the best I ever had). We will be coming back, for sure!
Food is definitely good for its price.They only accept cash.
Tht was my favorite  place  to  go but now it's permanently  closed  don't  know  why😔
The food has a great taste.. love it
The food was really nasty

my friend and i venture here for authentic korean food and we were satisfied. We got doenjang jigae, al jigae (cod roe stew), and tobboki. Everything tasted clean with deep flavor and a good spice kick. The price is very reasonable for how much food they give us. Theres also a wide selection of banchan. I’ll def come back here to try their bbq items!
Great place for Korean food that you can cook yourself on real charcoals.  Fun for everybody! Great yeast good speedy yet describe service.

We got different bbq meats and a soup that the server recommended. The marinated bbq meat tasted better then the pork belly. The pork belly was just too thin and also too chewy. The marinated short ribs were fantastic. The soup was a bit flavorless given that we were eating heavily marinated meat. Store was smoky but service wasn’t bad. They change the bbq rack frequently which is a plus.

I am hesitate to put a 4 stars here. The numbers of sides were tremendous which could be refilled as you may experience in South Korea. The pork belly and tongue were great. Foods were all great! The thing that bothered me was the services. This was my first time to be forced to pay more tip as we were party of only 4 people. It was dinner and I know most people gave 18% tip, but I have never seen any restaurant force their customer to pay a certain amount of tip as you did not pay the check.

We had literally so much food. Came at an earlier time so not too many people. The plates took over the entire table- I don't even know how we finished everything. Food was authentically delicious and staff were nice

Took my girlfriend here for Valentine's day 2011 (first time at Balsan for both of us), and I don't think we could have been more pleased.  The food was excellent - appetizers, entrées, and desert - all 5 out of 5.  Although modern, the atmosphere was very warm and pleasant.  The service was also very friendly and inviting.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.  Its a bit pricey, but the entire experience was definitely worth it.

The Balsan is beautiful, located in the Waldorf Astoria Hotel.Walking through the site sets high expectation for the guest. Unfortunately beyond aesthetics the European style food leaves little to be desired - its a mismash of italian, french, and everything else. Worse than the highly priced food, was the service. The waiter was pulling our plates before we were completely done.... not sure it worth the visit.

Delicious mussels and appetizers (the potted eggplant is a good bet). Good place to have a private dinner party too because they have a large classy room with dedicated wait staff. The wine is really good and even though it's a bit pricey, I felt like we were getting more than our money's worth.

Keep your eye on Balsan, because it's going to be making headlines soon on the Chicago restaurant scene.

We went there for dinner and were flat out blown away by the taste and quality of every single dish that graced our table.  The charcuterie and cheese plate that we started with was to die for--some of the finest melt-in-your-mouth foie gras and prosciutto, and the cheeses were exquisite.  I moved on to a salad of young lettuces that I had no particular expectations of, but was sent reeling by the intense taste--the dressing was a work of art, and it took an incredible amount of restraint to not ask for a glass of it.

And on to the spare rib.  Oh, the spare rib--at this point I didn't know how I'd even be able to eat it as I was already pretty full, but as soon as I took one bite, I knew I'd have no problem polishing the whole thing off.  Finished off the night with a great cup of French press coffee and the pear financier.  Fabulous.

Oh, and lastly, they carry a whole variety of rye whiskies, which means that they know how to make a real Manhattan, and let me tell you, it was one of the best Manhattans I've ever had.  I can't wait to go back.
Balsan is an beauitiful upscale refined restuarant . I had their sunday supper menu. excellent deal and wonderful food.

I had never heard of this restaurant before I received two gift cards from a friend. What an awesome place this is. I had the brisket sandwich and it was absolutely delicious. My friend had chicken and ribs, and my other friend had the salmon. I would highly recommend coming to this restaurant for good food and good service. Try the fried pickles too!

BEST RIBS EVER!

We‘re looking for a nice restaurant which offers Ribs in Chicago. Thanks to Google we found Bub City. The ribs and chicken wings were the best we ever had. The meat has fallen from the bone and tasted delicious. The service was very friendly and helpful and we‘ll come back.

Stopped by Bub City tonight, after walking around to find a place to dine. Our waiter, Julio V, was fantastic!! He gave us great suggestions & was very patient as we took our time deciding. I ordered the No Shoes, No Shirt & it was delicious! It tasted like passionfruit juice but I didn't taste the alcohol, nor did I feel it. If you're looking for a great tasting sweet drink with hardly any alcohol, this is your drink! We ordered the fried pickles, I'd give them a 2 out of 5 only bcuz the ranch dipping dressing was good. My friend ordered the ribs & they were not tender nor did they fall off the bones, maybe that's not a thing in Chicago (shrug). She also ordered the cornbread & it was very good!!! I ordered the Cali burger & it a good. The tater tots were okay, they tasted better dipped in the ranch dressing. Overall, it was a decent visit.

Amazing food and staff. Bartender was extremely friendly and knowledgeable about all the whiskeys and bourbons I knew nothing about. We got the Berkshire pulled pork and the brisket burnt ends grilled cheese and loved every single bite.

It is a another great restaurant under LEY, we have been coming here since it opened, mostly for brunch and occasional dinner.  I am updating this review since the menu has changed some after COVID.
The BBQ is always good, not the best we have tried but it surpasses Chicago Q since that place ran down hills.  I liked the old days when they put all of the sauces on the table, the special BLT sandwich for brunch, the bread pudding... but that is no longer the case.  The main BBQ items are still the same on the menu, my favorite nachos, burgers, chicken and waffles etc.  I definitely recommend the nachos to share, and the burnt ends to start.  As for brunch, biscuits and gravy.  The fried chicken items and grits are just ok for me, nothing special, I would go elsewhere for that.
The alcohol selection is large and stays true to the southern theme, live music and sports on TVs, pretty standard bar setup.

The best tacos I have ever had. Period. We tried a lot of tacos but the spicy chicken Tikka and the shrimp and grits were my absolute favorite. The place is offers dine in and take away and is available for delivery in door dash as well. There is enough room for dine in as it has a 1+1 setting. If you are in Chicago these tacos are a must try!

This is my late night taco spot well basically my all day taco spot. The staff is always friendly and they offer a variety of tacos for different tastes. There is plenty of seating upstairs to get out the way incoming patrons. Not sure if the upstairs has handicap accessibility. Convenient location with plenty of stores to walk off the tacos.

Every taco I have tried here has been great! They have some pretty unique flavor combinations and they all seem to work just right. This time I tried the fish and chips and the spicy tikka tacos and both were very good. I also got the barbacoa nachos on the side and it was a good amount of food. The main floor of the restaurant is small and is usually crowded but there was plenty of extra seating and a chill open air vibe upstairs. If you’re thinking about trying Velvet Taco, try Velvet Taco.

This is the best and weirdest place I have been for a while.  I have no idea why red velvet cake and tacos are mixed together but it's solid.  The staff was friendly and professional and the environment was fun to be casual but wasn't dirty.

The flavors didn't look like they should work together for the tacos but all did.  Only complaint was I think the margarita was "okay", but as they are kinda pre-mixed I didn't have high expectations anyway.

We visited this taco place in Chicago during the St Patrick’s day weekend and it was crowded. Visiting here with my kid felt a bit odd as there were only bar stools and no provision for high chairs. The concept of fusion tacos is pretty impressive. For vegetarians the Nashville Hot tofu , falafel Tacos are amazing and we also loved the chicken tikka and picnic chicken tacos.
cheap ingredients with a cheap price! I loved it, and the people that work there are very friendly. would definitely recommend for a weekday lunch only $6 for this burger

Service was pretty swift. I was able to walk to the counter and immediately place an order.

As for the food, I had the Greek style charbroiled chicken with rice, Greek potato, and garlic bread, with a side of soup. The chicken was charred pretty good but could’ve had a slightly lowered fire. It could’ve also use some more of the Greek flavorings. The rice and garlic bread was perfect. The potato was nicely seasoned and tender. The soup (style unknown - kinda a surprise to me) was decent, and tasted better with the croutons but I don’t see myself ordering it regularly.

Prices here are very reasonable. The dine-in area was pretty clean and spacious.

I can definitely see myself coming back here. My next selection would be the salmon burger.
Food is amazing been coming here for years and will continue. My favorite breakfast spot in Chicago even though they make more then breakfast. Family owned very nice establishment.

I am not very familiar with this restaurant, and I just decided to give it a try a few days ago. It is actually a good restaurant, especially for breakfast. I went there for breakfast and their menu with different options is something that I really like for breakfast too. I ordered a blueberry pancake and a sandwich. The food was made to order, so it was fresh and hot when it was served. The portions are surprisingly huge, especially on the pancakes, and overall, they taste good too. I was satisfied with the food. I was also able to eat all of them, even though at first, I thought that I would not be able to. It did not taste the best, but it does taste good and is reasonable for its price. Their prices are generally fair and reasonable too. I like the food, and I am certain that I will be back. The customer service is also great. The staff are friendly and accommodating. They serve food quickly. They also have a clean bathroom. The parking is also fine and it is easy. The food may not be the best, but overall, it is a good restaurant, especially for breakfast. I am looking forward to trying their other foods.
I know i have a big mouth  but still ... very big chunks of everything.  Good food tho

Stopped in for dinner with my  coworkers a few nights ago. We did the Traditional Tasting Menu at the recommendation of our waiter. He was amazing. Very knowledgeable and knew his stuff. Best customer service I’ve ever had at a restaurant.
We also had the Aeros De Moriscos Paella’s.

The best paella’s I’ve had.  The tasting menu was great. The food comes out staggered at the perfect time. It was a fun experience. The bacon wrapped dates were awesome. The Bavette was fantastic. The salsa brava and garlic aioli with chili oil on the Patatas Beavas was delicious. The meal was very filling and everything was delicious.

The servers replaced our plates multiple times to make the experience better.  Foodies would love this place. I would do this again if I get back to Chicago.

While I’ve always enjoyed the very tasty food and small plates, the service continues to be extremely disappointing and this most recent visit was no exception. I highly recommend the garlic shrimp in the house potatoes if you choose to visit. Understand If you’re looking for top-notch service this is not the place to go. The restaurant has amazing ambience and well appointed.

What a wonderful restaurant! Yes, definitely pricey, but for the feast they laid out it was worth it. The only things I didn't like were the tuna (bland, though the crackers were a very good fit) and cheesecake (so overbaked!). Service quality was adequate.
The Traditional Tasting Menu was dynamite! Friendly, attentive, professional staff. Reasonably priced, delicious wine. Rich, smooth coffee. Beautiful space. I will be back! #churros
Spanish cuisine with great cocktail options. Must try their Cauliflower appetizers and Paello veggie...

My friend recommended this place when I asked her for a pasta restaurant. She had her wedding here so loves everything. We ordered the Rigatoni, angel hair aglio e olio, warm ciabatta & roasted garlic and charred pepperoni pizza. Everything was DELICIOUS! I had a picky eater and a “not so easily impressed” person with me and they LOVED every dish. I would totally come back. They also have a nice happy hour special- half off all pizzas and select wines. It’s only for an hour though so check the time on their website. The only thing that was annoying was that we sat outside and it was so loud. The sirens, the motorcycles, etc. but I guess that’s part of city living.

My wife and I LOVED this place. The rigatoni and mozzarella pizza were delicious. We sat outside to enjoy the summertime Chi ambiance, and our hostess was wonderful too.

We will definitely eat here again.

I started looking for a venue to host my wedding around November 2020 with the plan of having it in March 2022, and after quite a few weeks of nosing around (and feeling very hesitant about rough catering reviews from various establishments), I found Osteria - a beautiful restaurant with glowing feedback and gorgeous photos. It looked like a rustic dream, and the pictures from other brides only further helped my choice.

Suffice to say, the wedding was this past Saturday, and I had the best day of my life here. Allison, the event manager, was a dream to work with and DEEPLY patient with my ten thousand questions surrounding timing, vendor inquiries and recommendations, and stress-induced what-ifs. All the way leading up to the event she was gracious and kind, and on the actual day of, she was nothing short of perfect.

Everything went smoothly, the venue was beautifully decorated, and my guests WILL NOT STOP talking about how phenomenal the food was. Not a single wine glass dropped below halfway (I have no idea how many I consumed due to this incredible service) and every need was catered to with speed and efficiency.

I recommend Osteria for any event, party, or even just a dinner out in town, because they are THAT good. I'll never forget this place, and even though we've since moved out of state, you bet we'll keep coming back in the future. What an unforgettable experience!
Great Chicago Restaurant dining experience. The caesar salad and meatball starters were excellent. The rigatoni with short rib entree is amazing and a must try! I enjoyed their espresso martini.

We just hosted my husband's graduation at Osteria Via Stato. We had about 52 guests total in the private area. Everything was GREAT! From the planning portion in the beginning to the clean up at the end - it could not have been better. They made everything seamless and easy to plan. And trust me - I am VERY detail oriented and super picky with everything! Allison was so easy to contact and always communicated quickly. I had absolutely no issues asking questions or getting information. The day of we dropped off decorations and centerpieces - I was nervous because there was only 2 hours until the dinner. However, Natalie and the team did great. I showed them a photo of what I wanted and they executed it exactly how it was shown. Our guests absolutely loved the venue and raved about the food. From the mixology bar serving our wine and cocktails to the gelato bar - everything was a huge hit! Our guests loved the bruschetta and all of the entree selections. Highly recommend this place and would totally host another event here in the future. Thank you Allison, Natalie, and our servers of the evening!

What an amazing place, from when I place the order on the app until I had it in my hands, was a total of 10 minutes. Talk about efficiency, the staff was friendly and amazing as well! Great Job Wing Stop!! Def making it a frequent stop, I'm in the neighborhood so feel free to invite me over for dinner from time to time! Lol 😆

Restaurant is short staffed but my hat tips off to the 4 staff members keeping it open and running today. My order was hot and ready on time and even though some customers were rude the girl behind the counter getting the orders ready still managed to be nice and courteous. The boy handling the register and taking orders was also very nice and the older man getting the chicken ready and the boy cooking it all worked together nicely.

Have been calling since September 13 about a refund. Both girls were rude on the phone and tried not to offer me a refund. They talked to the manager and they say I will receive a refund within 7-10 days. It’s goes by and still no refund for food that was NOT picked up. I call past the 10 days leave my name and number and the girl says their manager will call me and that was on September 23. Today is October 11, still no call or refund. This place has horrible customer service and is very rude.

When I called wingstop they told me they're only taking walk in and online orders when I get there she tells me I have to wait I wait about 25 minutes then she tells me when she takes my orders gonna be another 25 minutes I told her no problem she says give me a second comes back 10 minutes later and tells me I have to place my order online that she's the only one there. When I told her that she had me waiting there for an hour she said I can take it or leave it thank you wingstop for showing great customer service not never will go there again find new employees that really want to work there

My first time at this location definitely the best Ashley R took my order shes amazing! customer service, my wings everything was great ! exactly the way I wanted them nice & crispy nothing was left out & everything was ready quick definitely will be going back thank you Ashley! ☺️❤️

Me, my brother, and my best friend ate here the night of the Rage Against The Machine concert on night 3 of their Public Service Announcement Tour. It was within walking distance of our hotel, which was nice, they stayed open late, and they were super cool people that worked there. The pizza was good and fresh out the oven hot. We ordered over the phone and walked there and when we got there, got our drinks, and sat down, our order was ready. So perfect timing and the pizza was fire!

Last night a coworker and I ordered 2 Italian beefs well dipped with mozzarella cheese and peppers; this is what we got. They verified everything we asked for as they prepared the food and still gave us trash, which is exactly where this mess went. We will NOT go back there

Avoid this place at all costs! They steal from customers! Tonight I ordered three full size salads, and I received two full size salads and one side salad, despite paying for three full sized. None of the salads that arrived matched what I ordered, nor what was on Primo’s menu (see pictures). I called to explain what happened, and two EXTREMELY rude employees spoke to me. I am disgusted by the male employee who spoke to me over the phone. Not only did he have zero explanation of why this happened, he told me he was unable to help me in any way and offered zero ideas for resolution, even when directly asked. His unprofessional and absolute rudeness and disrespect were appalling. I paid for and ordered things I didn’t receive, and Primo’s stole from me. I wasn’t offered a refund, discount, redelivery, explanation, or anything. The employee was extremely disrespectful and blamed me for Primo’s issue several times. I am appalled at the disgusting quality of food and lies, but more are how this issue was handled. He didn’t even offer to ask my information or offer for someone to call me back at a later day/time. I am disgusted and appalled by the complete lack of customer service, even more so than the fact that Primo’s lied and stole from me.

I am giving 1 star because I can’t give 0! Pick anything over Primo’s- what a disgusting place in every possible way! I did not receive what I ordered and what is on the menu I ordered from, but paid the full price with zero offer to even slightly resolve. I ordered salads with toppings as specified by Primo’s only menu and Grubhub’s online menu.

Someone from Primo’s could have called if they did not have the ingredients, and someone could definitely have been sympathetic and understand and offered any help at all, but they are incredibly rude. I don’t know what I received from Primo’s, but it is not what I ordered. I am appalled by Primo’s lack of service and quality. Avoid at all costs! I will be telling everyone I know to never support Primo’s, with lying menus and low quality ingredients, who steal from and openly disrespect paying customers (who Primo’s stole from). Absolutely disgusting restaurant in every possible way!

I'm a sandwich gal. I'm slightly obsessed with the Italian sub. Today I tried the American sub. Each visit, it's consistent, tasty, and served with a smile. Even when they are busy, they pour the same love into each sandwich! It's part of my lunch rotation. Must visit. Thank you!!

The service: Midnight is not a good time to come for food here. They look completely lost back there. Don't bother calling for takeout because they wait until you show up to pick up your order to start making your order. I ordered 30 mins ahead of time and they still made me wait an additional 15 for 2 slices of cheese and fries.

The food: mediocre and the Alfredo sauce is a watery mess.

Advice: the young lady with the long hair should be wearing her hair up so it's not waving around as she's cutting, plating, and boxing the customer's food. Get actual pizza slice boxes so you're not wasting time cutting slices into geometric shapes just to fit the takeout boxes. Stop telling customers, "It'll be out in 10 minutes," because that's never true, you know it's not true, and it certainly wasn't true the last two times I ordered. "We're completely out of cheese slices," was what you said after you told me my order of cheese slices was ready when I called ahead for takeout. And after I showed up and still waited nearly 15 minutes--totally mindboggling.

I’ve been waiting for my food and they closed early. I’m knocking on the window so I can speak with someone and they’re ignoring me. I ordered online and they won’t give me my number. I would appreciate someone from corporate call me now. This is ridiculous. They could’ve simply given my food, but instead they wanted to ignore me. I need someone to call me asap tomorrow or there will be a major problem. This is unacceptable and I want my money back. I’m

Great kitchen staff!! Always quick and accurate service!
Love this location ❤️

Food quality is just like any other chipotle. Employees don’t regulate how the line works. Their line system is confusing - can take the shorter route when not busy and longer route when busy. Lots of people were cutting the line during a busy time by taking the shorter route. Customers shouldn’t have to confront other customers.

Was extremely impressed with the quantity of food they gave me.  Some Chipotle employees spoon out the smallest amount of each item, here I got heaping spoonfuls! I am not sure if he just appreciated the concise way I ordered - chicken bowl, white, black, fajita veggies - (most people ignore my order and make me repeat each item two or three times) but this guy was impressed, which may have been why I got a mountain of food :D Either way, I'll be coming here again for a quick bite.

Chipotle is one of my favorite go-to spots for a quick, tasty lunch when I forgot to make one at home. I can pick up a Burrito bowl or salad and customize it for my diet and taste. The generous portions are filling and the pricing is very affordable. I really enjoy all of the protein options (including the Sofritos) The cafeteria style service is quick and efficient and I can usually get in, get my food and pay in about 2 minutes flat, providing it's not too busy.  Chipotle is a great choice for the entire Family.

We stayed in the hotel connected to the restaurant so we tried our first Chicago deep dish pizza here. It was yummy and we actually split the small cheese pizza with 3 people since the slices were very thick. We also ordered a side house salad which was very large and was shared between two people. My youngest ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and said it was yummy. We had a very nice waiter that kept our drinks filled at all times.

You will leave full. The Mac n Cheese bites and Chicken tenders appetizers were great! The deep dish sausage and green olives traditional Chicago style pizza was served to our table hot and the slices plated at the table. The pizza ingredients tasted fresh. The prices were very affordable. May want to make a reservation if deciding to dine in during peak hours.

Incredible!!! So, so happy we discovered this place. What a gem. The sweetest staff in the city, a clean, peaceful atmosphere and DELICIOUS food. The deep dish pizza was exceedingly satisfying. I can’t recommend this place enough! Definitely stop in for a wonderful experience. Thank you, Pizzeria Ora!!

Family dinner here was so perfect! The staff gave us a huge table, never stopped refilling water and drinks all evening. The salad was fresh and crisp and dressings tasted homemade. We enjoyed deep dish pizza and thin pizza. The fresh tomato sauce is unlike any other pizza in town. Sausage pizza was a standout and worth mentioning!!! I was shocked we had room for dessert…. Mousse pie, cheesecake, and ice cream. Everybody loved the meal. Would go back in a heartbeat!!!!

We went to a concert in the area and were looking for a place for a late night pizza and happened upon Pizzeria Ora. My sister convinced me to get out of my comfort zone and try a pizza I normally wouldn't eat, so we got the El Blanco pizza. I'm glad she talked me into it because it was delicious! The guy who served us was very nice. I will visit again if I'm in the area!

Qdoba is my all time favorite food because of the gumbo. This place at the great location and the crews are friendly and welcoming. The food quality and taste is great. There is not a waiting time and it was quick. The ambience is good and clean.
Rudest worker I've ever met. Dude working evening shift aug 1 made it clear he actively hates his job and anyone who comes in
Better than Chipotle and far superior to Dos Toros. Much more value for the money. Fresh, quick, and friendly.
Staff was happy and patient with me while I learned their menu

Terrible attitude rude people I will never return I don't like the way they made my food to me they are unorganized not professional don't greet people nothing don't waste your time with this location

Came here after working out super laid back environment and the staff was very friendly. We got the gym rat and warrior smoothie as well as th cucumber celery juice all were amazing. They made everything so quick too.

Loved it!
As a Brazilian I love trying out different açaí bowls around and theirs were very good.
Service was great, great atitude. Definitely coming back!!

ABSOLUTELY ONE OF THE BEST HIDDEN GEMS ON STATE STREET FOR FRESH TO ORDER FRUIT SMOOTHIES, FRESHLY PREPARED VEGETABLE JUICES, & FRESH TO ORDER SMOOTHIE BOWLS AROUND!!!!! SO GLAD THIS GEM IS FOUND!!!!!
Big açaí bowls 🙌🏽 Wish they were open later tho
I stopped in yesterday and was simply very pleased with my order.

Eduardo's has a wonderful atmosphere, very warm and welcoming. The aesthetics are fantastic, it's a great place to enjoy a meal. Service was terrific, the staff was super nice and friendly. They gave me a great wine recommendation.
I ordered the Lemon poppy bucatini, it was good but not great. From the description, it sounded really good and it just wasn't what I expected. I enjoyed my meal and had a great experience nonetheless. I will definitely be back and try the pizza next time.

Fun people watching walking by outdoor dining to Gold Coast and from Rush Street. Patio is nice and dog friendly. One of few places open on Monday w 25% off wine bottles.  Salad of asparagus, snap pee and mint yogurt was excellent. Pizza was fine. Service could be more helpful.
Very decent place. I used to go Marios table(opposite from the street) a lot, but now I prefer coming here. Pizza options are sufficient. Appetizers are refreshing and tasty.

We were really disappointed. I've been to Eduardo's in the past and have always ordered takeout, but this past Friday night was enough to make me not want to come back. Homemade pasta is amazing and you can't beat their bolognese, but its not worth the absolute annoyingly horrible service we received during our last visit. After being sat and clearly waiting rest of my guests I was not offered anything to drink aside from water that was already on the table. I had to get up and ask the manager for wine. After that, my server was constantly bothering me for updates - clearly no understanding of social queues. Once my friends and I were all enjoying wine we were told we only had an hour left at the table (mind you, the restaurant was empty aside from us). But we get it, Friday night and a small restaurant so we ordered quickly. Once complete, they rushed the check and wouldn't even let us split evenly three ways (annoying). THEN, with maybe a few sips left in our wine glasses our server said we had to get up and the next party was there to sit down. It was a SHOCK when we saw only one of the next fourtop was there and could have easily waited another three minutes for us to enjoy our last sips - the restaurant was only about half full too. Our group frequents local Gold Coast restaurants monthly and this one is coming off the rotation. I'd rather go to Mario's where they treat people more like guests than a table to turn.

The manager was the BEST(I realized I never got her name). BUT She was so sweet and welcoming while giving us all of the best recommendations. It was our second time there, and will certainly not be our last! They surprised us with some strawberry gelato for our 2 year anniversary (which was absolutely delicious). Great pizza, great environment, amazing people! So happy with with our experience

This is my first time to a Capt'n Nemo's sub shop and I found it one of the best sandwich shops of the fast food realm the best. The sandwiches are already set with their ingredients so it's not like subway where you get to choose every ingredient you want. But that's okay I found something on the menu that I enjoyed.

The restaurant is a very clean and relaxing area to be in, cool art above the booths you sit at, however I found it way too cold in the restaurant.

Today was a good choice for Capt'n nemo's.

An unassuming sandwich shop with some of the best classic subs available. I was really impressed with the size and quality of the sub. The half sub size is comparable to a full size Jimmy John’s sub. I got the Northern Italian. It was packed full of flavor. The bread is deliciously crunch. The pasta salad is fresh and a good addition to any sub.

Subs are really good and unique. I love the high flyer with ham, turkey cheese and fixings the addition of hard boiled eggs and the CSS- captains secret sauce (which is super tangy and delicious) make it so different from you typical sub. There are two subs that have liverwurst on them that are so good too, definitely try them if you even remotely like liverwurst. And the soup is hearty and delicious too.

Excellent sandwiches, soup, and chili! This place is under the radar a bit but really solid! And they must treat their employees well as they all seem to have been there for many years! Make the trip, and try "The Balboa!"

Very friendly staff, and the sandwiches were good. I didn't try the soup, but they offer a free taste before you buy. Prices are affordable and I would go back again.
Thank you for reaching out..I will go back to try the brownies again. Thank you Steve!!

Last night we picked up an order from Great Sea Restaurant and it was really good!
Lollipop Chicken: 5/5 - these were AMAZING. We got a half tray since we had a good amount of people to feed. They were still warm after the 20 minute drive!
Mongolian Beef: 3/5 - this wasn’t horrible, but it was very salty. The noodles on the inside were also soggy, however, that is probably due to pickup.
Sweet and spicy shrimp: 4/5 - honestly, this probably would be a 5/5 if it was fresh and the shrimps coat wasn’t soggy by the time we got home. However, was still really good.

All of this food costed around $95, which wasn’t horrible. The pickup service was alright, will definitely come again!

I know times have changed and supply is limited, but ever since the new owners took over, the food has not been the same. As everyone knows they are popular for their lollipop wings. It's definitely a must try for first timers, but being a frequent customer of maybe 10 to 15 years--the quality and quantity has declined which does not match the heavy increase in price. Their Mongolian beef used to have this spectacular crispness and flavor to the dish that you couldn't find anywhere else, but now it's quite soggy and bland. The wings do not taste as fresh, but dry and fried multiple times. The sauce is definitely something to buy by the bottle, delicious. The black sauce noodle dish came pretty watered down the last few times we ordered, which is completely different from the past. I just miss the old great seas...

Got takeout lunch specials (orange chicken and sweet & sour pork) the other day. Friendly service. Good portions and sauce, but the chicken was dry and the pork was very tough. Significantly more expensive than other local Chinese places, which have higher-quality food. Probably won't go back.

The food is amazing!! I have been looking for wings like these ever since Take Me Out in Pilsen closed. The wings are juicy and the skin crispy. The rice is also very good. My only regret is not buying a bottle of their sauce.

This place has awesome chicken wings. You should get the spicy version (not that hot), but there is also non spicy.
The hot and spicy shrimp has a nice slightly crispy texture. The sauce on there is also a bit sweet. I kept eating them even after I was full.
The service was really friendly today! (it didn't used to be).

Super cute spot for brunch in Lincoln Park. We loved the sweet potato fries… I got the sesame chicken salad (replaced chicken with shrimp), it was so very refreshing and the dressing was light and tangy. The mix of veggies was also great - kale, cabbage, bean sprouts, watermelon beats, pickled pepper - overall a fantastic salad full of flavor! My partner got the veggie burger and he thoroughly enjoyed it as well.

Interior of this restaurant is very adorable, and I am a fan of the cute plates they use as well.

Decent food but Very unpleasant service. The waiter hardly came to our table and it took him about 15 min to come get my original drink order. He may have just been having a bad day but it ruined my experience unfortunately. He also wasn’t pleasant and seemed bothered to even be serving me and my friend. It made me uncomfortable.

The table next to us was also concerned with his behavior so it was obviously not just my table having a one off.

The upstairs bar is very cute. I will be back to probably just have cocktails at the bar only..

Everything we ate was delicious. The upcharge for the protein substitution in my salad was priced very reasonably. The drinks were not the strongest, but still very tasty. The farmhouse chic vibe was very comfortable. Highly recommend you to check this place out!
Very fresh food and beautiful interior! We had the Brussels and kale salad, farm stand burger, corned beef hash, fries and cheese curds. Curds were amazing!

Such a cute and cozy place! Drinks were great, food was ok for that price. Crab cakes were super flavorful but the chicken on the salad was dry and unseasoned. The staff was so friendly and helpful, thank you Vesna!

Great place for an upscale breakfast for two. Menu had a variety of offerings and coffee tasted so good. Our server, Emilie, was attentive yet not overbearing. We'll be back on a non-rainy day to enjoy the patio seating.
Great place for an after work happy hour! Charcuterie board had really fresh meats and cheeses.  All the appetizers were really good and the specialty drinks were tasty.

While in Chi-town planned to go to ZOUP next door and decided try this place since the weather was nice and they had outdoor seating. The hostess was very nice and accommodating. We sat in a partially shaded area and she came out and moved us to a shaded table‼️ Loved that attentiveness‼️

The waiter was great, the service was great, my Waldorf salad with shrimp and Lemon Aioli roasted potatoes were great  but my companions chicken bites and Caesar salad were just ok. May come back again when in Chicago.

Nice setting. Not too fancy. Great prices. Decent menu selection but simple. The Marq slider was delicious with their signature aoli. The ceviche was on point. Marq slaw was less than average so I put the ceviche on top and made a bomb salad that is keto.

Good atmosphere, great apps, and an excellent entree. I had the wagyu burger. Would recommend! Fries are amazing. The hummus appetizer was definitely a crowd favorite. The chicken sandwich sliders were a close second. Sadly the only pic I got was of the best non-alcoholic beer I’ve ever tasted.
Very nice service, terrible bagel. That’s the everything bagel I ordered yesterday but couldn’t eat so put it in my fridge until I got hungry enough for a dry, stale, everythingless bagel.

Ordered a small shake via the drive thru. The menu board says $5.99. I get my receipt which says $6.79. When I asked the staff about the discrepancy, the answer was “oh yeah, the manager raised the prices.” When I commented the menu board was inaccurate they just said “yeah.” Then my $7 shake (after tax)was a huge glass of milk with less than a scoop of ice cream blended in. All I could taste was the milk.

The manager there is very rude and disrespectful! she literally yelled at her employees in front of the customers. The service isn't good at all. Many time they have been out of certain items which doesn't make sense why they would be out so many times. Ever since the last 2 red shirt supervisor left, the store has gone downhill badly. Who ever the owners are, they need to fix this problem ASAP

Drinks are great, but be careful at this location. They charged me 1000% (yes, 1000%) more than they should have when I've gone there. I reached out to customer service and they did not help. Please double check your app after you pay so this doesn't happen to you.

Top of the line employees, trainees should have more time
Only my observation but that's what I do, I  consult on store environments haven't meant owner...its managed well, and pretty quick on busy days no drive in and under staffed at times..the crew early or late afternoon work well together...

So again I enjoy my interactions
But critique a little to much

The food is delicious.  The staff is kind and at your disposal.  The drinks need some work. The margaritas were watered down and very little flavor. If that is worked out the place would be perfect.  Loved the outdoor seating option.

My sister and I enjoyed the food, libations, and service.
A little expensive for Mexican food.  The guava cheesecake was scrumptious!!!!
Top of my list! This dishes are amazing and full of flavor. The staff and chef are very attentive and polite. Recommend!
The salsa was spicy but very tasty. The soup felt under seasoned. The ribs were delicious! Service was mediocre. Would return.
Tried two of the mezcal flights, lamb and veggie plate with grilled chicken. Everything was delicious. The chips and salsa were also really good. Would visit again.

Do an online order only to find out one of the two subs I had is not available? I understand when things are out of stock, that's not my issue. My issue is instead of calling me prior to inform me of such he decided to make my sub and tell me the other one is not available during pickup. Not to mention he doesn't know how to wear a mask..
Clean & fresh food it was jumpin in there , those guys didnt get a break prices went up tho like everything else I guess .
If your going to close at 10 pm change your sign and turn your lights off

This has got to be the worst location, I ordered through grubhub for pick up, stated I was here to pick up an order for Kenith McIntosh, Clerk said from grubhub I said yes, he went to get the food brought it back and mumbled something I couldn't understand him. I thought he said something I about ID so I showed my ID he said no, I said what? Then he mumbled something else I couldn't understand him, sound like something about a phone, so I showed him the order number, he said no. I'm like what are you talking about? He mumbled some more stuff, I couldn't understand him. Then he pushed my food toward me on the counter. I called grubhub immediately and told then about the incident, because I don't trust someone that incompetent making my food. They issued me a refund and I placed the sub in the trash. 4303 Irving Park Rd location
AS WE SPEAK THIS SERVER HAS THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER EVER VERY DISRESPECTFUL BECAUSE HE HAS A JOB TO DO DOESN'T COMMUNICATE PROPERLY!!!!

We went to Chopsticks after 2 years. But this time we are highly disappointed. We used to love the Chicken Satay but this time it was 3.5 pieces of boiled chicken stir fried and served. Zero flavors.
We ordered the Cashew Stir fried entree. We added  chicken as option. Well it was $2.50 extra for the chicken. And we were offered chicken that tasted weeks old. We asked to make it spicy but it was sweet.
We ordered the regular fried rice but were given The Chopsticks fried rice. We specifically didn’t want the Chopsticks fried rice as we don’t eat broccoli. Fried rice was still the only good thing in terms of taste.
Well sadly this will be our last visit to this place.

Pretty decent Chinese food right by the train station, though my sweet and sour chicken was a bit dry. Good smoothies.
It's to-go only at the moment, so plan to eat elsewhere. No public bathrooms.

A much needed meal in the cold weather of Chicago. Found this spot randomly walking around. Great ramen, very flavourful and a good portion of it too. The pork wasn't too fatty and was the right amount of meat. I enjoyed the ramen and their spring rolls. Service was good and fast, place is a little small spot next to the metro. Recommend it when it's cold outside .
Food was super hot and full of so much flavor and the fried rice was actually fried and not that fake yellow rice you get at most places
They chargered me 10cents for a paper place and 2sweet and sour sauce and I'm a regular customer
A large take away portion is actually large. The food is delicious and not your typical overly sweet American Chinese. I absolute enjoyed this food and have no hesitation in recommending them 100%.
I walked in for a smoothie and was immediately stopped near the door ..so since he was in my way I asked can I order a smoothie and was told no smoothies no food...this place is horrible...
Just ok

When i heard that there was a brazilian restaurant by my apartment, i almost died! This place has really good steak picanha. Just go there for that. They recently changed to serve mexican food as well, but the brazilian food is amazing. They even have cheese balls too. You must try!

When they open the place I liked it better, but now most of the portion comes lot smaller and not that tasty as brazilian original food, lot of times we order certain food and then they find out they don't have available, the problem is that we pay it before and then we kind force to choose another because we already paid. I think became kind of expensive for an express food and the amount that comes. I like the atmosphere and the fact is Byob. The service most of the times is good, but not excellent. I don't go often anymore.

Did not taste authentic. had no 'tempero' or the 'tempero' had gone bad. The Coxinha also tasted like italian food or something. I have had coxinha in the north to the south of Brazil and have never tasted a coxinha like that. I did not have anything else- but that was enough for me. It was as if someone made cheap and bad version of Brazilian food- then packaged in in a plastic bag for months- then microwave and serve. =/
it was a really good place to find brazillian food at the beginning but now with a mexican menu along with it the quality went down !!!! i hope they fix it !!!

Great, Authentic, Affordable -
a "can't miss" for Brasilian food in Chicago

Gross.
I've been there a couple times and i thought that it was actually not bad.

Today, I had a nice surprise in my salad.
I started eating my salad when suddenly something felt wrong in my mouth.
Something was not right, really crunchy for a salad.
I spit it out and there was lying on my salad a 2 inches long grasshopper.
Grossssss.

I took it back, did not make a scene, and before the guy gave me my money back, he asked me if i wanted another salad instead.....

H3LL no!!!!!!!

Ain't going back over there

Ordered a salad on Grubhub. Came with iceburg instead of romain. The tomatoes were slop(not good anymore), and they didn't even bring me the correct beverage. The salad was questionable, so I tossed it.

A friend of mine at work introduced this place to me for dinner. I ordered a pesto chicken Panini sandwich and to be honest, it was the best Panini sandwiches I have ever had. I would love to order more if they can deliver down in Des Plaines.
Tasty, healthy food. Clean crisp veggies and well cooked meat. Great pricing too. The occasional winter soups are very good.
Great healthy food.  I’ve only been once but they made an impression!

This place is pretty awesome, try their brunch mimosa deal or any of their crepe dishes. Fresh tasting food at a decent price!

I came for brunch and ordered the ham and egg on crepes and it was delicious. The dish was light but still flavorful. The taste of each component was strong and came together for an albeit simple dish but the execution and ingredients made it. The side potatoes were roasted well and overall I was very satisfied by my meal.

The decor was rustic but still looked new and comfortable. The place was pretty busy but the high back booths made it so the noise wasn't too loud. The staff was pretty slow the day I went though, looked like not enough staffing but it didnt bother me too much. They also have wall sized windows so the view was nice but on a bright day, sitting under the sun got very hot.

Overall, I really liked this place and recommend you give it a shot if you're in the area!

Definitely a good restaurant that's worth going to. I had the croque vegetarian which was delicious and unlike anything I've had before. It was also filling, which I didn't expect. The flower power cocktail was also good, not weak like other places. I was also impressed that there was basically one guy doing everything, including waiting tables and the bar. He did a great job. I would go back.
Fantastic French inspired menu. Wine on tap. Excellent variety of specialty cocktails. If Angela is bartending consider yourself lucky! Great Happy Hour menu! Check this place out!!

I really do not believe the kitchen had any ideas what French food is despite description “French bistro” at the entrance.
Order of ‘Coq au Van’ arrived as nothing like a chicken cooked in red wine and more like a microwaved freezer meal. Salmon BLT was smeared with green dressing On the bread which made it really mushy.
We won’t be back.

Our waiter was rude short with us from the get-go. He didn’t want to answer questions and made nearly no eye contact and seemed “irritated” that we wanted to split the check (which we told him about right away). The valet situation with Hotel Felix was a mess. No valet was at the stand and we had to speak with 3 people to find the valet and finally get them to agree to the $12 fee the restaurant assured me of when I called earlier that morning. (They wanted $26...)The food was just okay. Nothing too special. The truffle fries were good, but the crepes were hard and dry. We didn’t really have a great experience and probably will not be going back. It’s a shame because the atmosphere and location are cool.

Loved this restaraunt.  Its located across the street from the park. Views of the trees and some of Chicago's skyline. We wanted to sit outside upstairs to really enjoy the views, but it was closed due to weather.  We shared a burger, Wedge Salad and I ordered the cup of French Onion Soup. Everything tasted great. The Ranch dressing was delicious. The French Onion Soup was the best I've had. Burger cooked perfectly. Atmosphere was intimate and cozy. Would definitely return.

Great food, wonderful location. We ate in the dining room, which was very cozy. Prime rib chili and the club sandwich we very tasty. Two people could split the club! Our waiter, Bill, was friendly and anticipated all of our needs. Good time.

My expectations were sky high when I arrived for a business dinner at Tavern at the Park.  They did a lot of things right and the filet mignon in mushroom sauce was indeed delicious.  Somehow however my experience was good but nothing stood out as exceptional.  Maybe this restaurant deserves 3 and half stars.  Dessert was okay and the service was efficient.

Cool spot that seems to be very popular with businessman/businesswomen during lunch and after 5:00.

The short rib sandwich was good, but a little salty for my taste. Service was good but not great. It was nice that we could check our bags there during lunch.

The bar has lots of good beer on tap, so after 5:00 stop by, but it fills up quick.

Fantastic!  Restaurant up the street was packed so we took a chance and made the right choice.  Good selection of local beers.  I had the blueberry frech toast and it turned out it was these huge and dense french toast logs.  Picture does not do it justice.  Was so good and filling!  Nice friendly wait staff.  Was here with a group and they all got other things, some breakfast, some lunch.

This is a very basic Thai place on Western in Rogers Park. The food was good - not outstanding good but absolutely fine good at the price point and location. My friend had the Panang curry and I had the Thom Kha Gai, a Thai coconut milk based soup with chicken, which was good but somehow a little too sweet. The service was great, and I loved that the water came in glass glasses and not plastic (yuck).

*The green curry with veggie is still stellar
*The red snapper fillet with hot n sweet chili sauce superb
*Pad Thai used to be golden standard years ago but still ok
*Pad See Wu disappointing - no Chinese broccoli , not quite the dark and sweet savory taste from just a couple of years ago
Clean and friendly place. I ordered over the phone and everithing went perfect, no mistakes in the order.
Delicious mini egg rolls and green tea ice cream!
First time visit. Delicious food, I had Chicken PadTai and my partner had Rama Chicken-- both were fresh and tasty. Service was lovely. We'll be back

Amazing!  An unexpectedly nice surprise.  You’d not expect such a lovely and warm place from the outside.   The food is wonderful!  A hidden gem, not only for a Colombian restruant but for any restaurant.  Everyone from the staff to the patrons we friendly and welcoming.  Will be back!  5 Stars +

Really good spot for authentic Colombian food and it’s BYOB. Started with the Colombian empanadas and they were great! The matrimonio dinner was really tasty too, good portion for one really hungry person or to split. Not bad on the jugos either. Fairly priced meals

Really good flavors, nice portions and reasonably priced. Chicken was a bit dry but dipped in the Aji was delicious. Chicken soup was made with interesting dark meat with little bone which makes it hard to eat and smell is a little weird. Empanadas and chicharrones were tasty! Service was friendly. A perk is that they allow BYOB.

Unfortunately this place is not the same.  The last time we were here was to dine in and we were treated well.  This time we wanted to order food but there were no signs where to order.  When we were asked if we wanted to sit, we said we just wanted an order to go and the waiter rudely  said to order it at the register.  We went to the register just to get ignored and be pushed around.  When  we ask a server where we can order, he rudely said there's a line and pointed at a "line" of two people but when we were there there was no line. This place was chaotic and the restaurant wasn't even a full.  My family and I will not longer be coming to this location anymore.
Edit:  The chicken was too dried and the they didn't give us all the sides.

I was there yesterday and my experience was not good with the waiter, he never brought us the drinks and he gave us a soup that we never ordered, and the answer was I'll pack it.  We asked for a chicarrón and the arepa was super hard, you couldn't even break it with a hammer, the waiter's response was, that's how it's coming out.  wow a waiter is supposed to work if you tip but this man has no idea about that.  Very bad experience I do not recommend the place nor do I plan to return.

These guys stand out in the whole of Chicago for authentic  Hyderabadi cuisine. Must haves:
1. Weekend  Mutton Biryani on  Saturday’s and Sundays
2. Kabab rolls - chicken boti kabab
3. Chicken malai kabab and boti kabab
4. Apollo Fish (appetizer)
5. Desserts - Fruit salad and kheer

The above are my favorites.

If kings of good times was supposed to be rewritten it must be written as “king of good grill food” place in Chicago. Br Moiz and his back-end team serve the best Hyderabadi traditional food. Be their platter, Haleem or custom ordered Mandi Platter. The wait for good food is well deserved.
The Best Indian food I had in Chicago. The flavours and taste are on top level.

Updated Review August 20, 2022: We visited recently with my in-laws after speaking so highly about this place. They have expanded but the service has declined tremendously. The man working seemed like he would much rather be any where else. Customer service skills lacked tremendously. We were told the mutton kadhai could not be ordered. Isn’t this a Pakistani restaurant? Mutton kadhai is a staple dish. Anyway. We miss this spot when the owner was actually present running it…

My husband and I have been coming to eat here since April 2021 every time we are in town. This is a must visit spot for us for at least a meal on our random weekend Chicago trips. We live 4.5 hours away. The food is phenomenal, fresh, and so flavorful! The owner is attentive and kind. We typically order the mixed platter and butter chicken. The chapati is perfectly made. The bihari kebab is a must try and I can never leave without getting the falooda for dessert. So yummy!
Restaurant is clean and service is good too..mostly hyderabadi cuisine and taste.Dum biryani and Bbq platters is good but karahi isn’t authentic

Biggest. Lox. Bagel. EVER! Looked so good I ate it immediately without taking a picture (which is completely normal but I understand it would be a plus for the review, take my word it was a beautiful presentation) but— enjoy the photos of the establishment. I can’t start my day with out a lox bagel; especially while on vacation. Corey’s Bagels has a clean, lively, inviting atmosphere —with funny, energetic kitchen communication, you’ll have to experience first hand to truly understand the delight. The cherry on top: Corey’s IS A BOARS HEAD ESTABLISHMENT!! The menu offers a wide variety of deli style goods —sliced meats, potato/pasta salads, etc… Sadly, for the cheese lovers —they DO NOT have any cheese flavor/Asiago style bagels. Corey’s is affordable and has a seemingly endless customizable menu with bagels/breakfast/lunch sandwiches/salads & soups . If a Lox bagel or other bagel sandwich isn’t  perfect spot for a quick toasted bagel with your favorite shmear. Meals are prepared when ordered. They also provide online pickup & app delivery services. I can’t wait to make my way through the menu! Much LOVE for this spot!

Don’t know who Corey is but he should feel proud because this place is great. Super tastey bagels and massive selection of add-ons and spreads so you can get real granular with your order. I got the lox spread with veggies but ate it too fast to take a pic. Here’s my boyfriends sausage breakfast sandwich. Uh Yum??? 😋

To put it shortly, great bagels. The flavor of these bagels is great. The out side has a nice thin crisp crust the inside the perfect soft dough that not chewy. They say the secret to a nyc bagel is the nyc water but these get the flavor almost on point. The bacon was crispy, the egg was an actual egg fried up perfectly. Before going, look on the online menu as it’s not your typical menu. Need to add on each topping like bacon and cheese to the bagel sandwich. Highly recommend for breakfast. Can’t wait to try a lunch sandwich. Would be nice if they offered a rewards program for frequent/return customers.

I WISH my town had a bagel place like this. I’m from Michigan, and when I tell you that I will come here every time I visit Chicago, I mean it! The staff were so fun and nice. They gave their opinions on what we should try and those combinations were perfect. I loved the energy in the building and they have so many cream cheese options! Definitely check this place out.

Got a few sandwiches with friends, everyone's bagel was hard and difficult to chew. We went at like 9AM so wasn't expecting them to be that stale...
nobody was impressed with their food, sadly : (

Delicious and fresh dim sum 🥟.  Best ever! The shrimp rolls were delectable.  Good service. Only negative, silverware was dirty and had to return for clean ones.  But also was able to mostly use the chopsticks.

We went on Friday at 10:00. The food overall was good for the price, but there was no cart service. The taro dumplings were not as fluffy as I expected, and I was told by someone later on that their food is not made scratch in the restaurant, but brought in frozen.

We returned after a 9 years hiatus. It still tastes like it should!

I was delighted to find the Lotus Leave Sticky Rice with chicken without pork or shrimp 😂 while the rest of the ladies complained it is not authentic without them. Nonetheless, they hit all the right spots for dim sum reminiscent of childhood.

So for the nostalgia of seeing the square from the floor to ceiling picture window, for the authentic Cantonese flavors, the great chrysanthemum tea, the witty waiter and attentive service, a 5 star is warranted to keep the legacy of this place going in Chicago Chinatown. Besides, they updated their menu to be quite veg. friendly. So no excuse 😆 go find something yum!
A Chicago Institution. Good food. Excellent Waiting service. Good prices. If you never had Dim Sum. Please try this place.
Delicious dim sum and great service! We appreciate the manager who chased after us to return our bag when we left it behind. Can’t recommend this place enough!

Took my girlfriend here for Valentine's day 2011 (first time at Balsan for both of us), and I don't think we could have been more pleased.  The food was excellent - appetizers, entrées, and desert - all 5 out of 5.  Although modern, the atmosphere was very warm and pleasant.  The service was also very friendly and inviting.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.  Its a bit pricey, but the entire experience was definitely worth it.

The Balsan is beautiful, located in the Waldorf Astoria Hotel.Walking through the site sets high expectation for the guest. Unfortunately beyond aesthetics the European style food leaves little to be desired - its a mismash of italian, french, and everything else. Worse than the highly priced food, was the service. The waiter was pulling our plates before we were completely done.... not sure it worth the visit.

Delicious mussels and appetizers (the potted eggplant is a good bet). Good place to have a private dinner party too because they have a large classy room with dedicated wait staff. The wine is really good and even though it's a bit pricey, I felt like we were getting more than our money's worth.

Keep your eye on Balsan, because it's going to be making headlines soon on the Chicago restaurant scene.

We went there for dinner and were flat out blown away by the taste and quality of every single dish that graced our table.  The charcuterie and cheese plate that we started with was to die for--some of the finest melt-in-your-mouth foie gras and prosciutto, and the cheeses were exquisite.  I moved on to a salad of young lettuces that I had no particular expectations of, but was sent reeling by the intense taste--the dressing was a work of art, and it took an incredible amount of restraint to not ask for a glass of it.

And on to the spare rib.  Oh, the spare rib--at this point I didn't know how I'd even be able to eat it as I was already pretty full, but as soon as I took one bite, I knew I'd have no problem polishing the whole thing off.  Finished off the night with a great cup of French press coffee and the pear financier.  Fabulous.

Oh, and lastly, they carry a whole variety of rye whiskies, which means that they know how to make a real Manhattan, and let me tell you, it was one of the best Manhattans I've ever had.  I can't wait to go back.
Balsan is an beauitiful upscale refined restuarant . I had their sunday supper menu. excellent deal and wonderful food.

Cute bar spot with a 1940’s decor. They have a bike mounted in the ceiling. Interesting! During a bar crawl when I visited I had stopped in here. They serve comfort food and then some on an extended level. I thought this Fat Cat was like the one in Norwich, Connecticut and I was wrong. These are definitely two different styles of places.

Wonderful place! They were very busy with only 2 staff memeber in the front of the house and did a fantastic job serving everyone. Food was amazing and delicious. Drinks were awesome! Music was nice, restaurant was clean. Just beautiful place.

The experience is always great for me and my family. Especially my daughter she loves the straight up burger. The servers are always so courteous and nice. They are always on top of things when we are here. Today are server was Jen. She was very friendly and got are orders in when we are ready. Today we both got the straight up burger with a side of fries.  Got are order right out. Thanks Jen
Had the most fabulous drink called the Riviera. It seemed like the perfect choice before seeing a show at the theatre with my sister. Our bartender was so kind and we will definitely come back!

Good service, nice place to chill by yourself or with friends. We got an outside table to enjoy a beautiful crisp wednesday Chicago evening. For food we got roasted cauliflower and fried Mac and cheese and they were pretty good. Their drinks which were decent, could have been boozier.

Awesome place. It's a family ran business. They provide a friendly / welcoming atmosphere. Great food as well. I've been going there probably since 1979 / 1980. I've never had a bad experience there. No food, good people. I have no complaints. You should definitely check this restaurant out.

8/2021  Was here 4 years ago.  Ok if it is another 4 years.  Food was tasty.  That was the saving grace.  But the size of my corned beef sandwich was insane!  And no hot mustard?  Really?  Onion rings were good.  Pickle was just ok.  Not much of a pickle here either.  They should advertise that the sandwich fits in the palm of your hand!

Been coming here on and off for several years, just a great consistent location for hot dogs and burgers and chopped beef and even a fried seafood platter.  Not a lot of Bells and whistles, But that's because it doesn't need it. If you can make me a good Chicago dog in under 6 minutes, I have very few reasons to complain.

This place is INCREDIBLE. I can't say enough good about it. This is like if Five Guys added a bunch of good sides and other options besides burgers for like half the cost. Plus the folks working here were so sweet and kind.

I will absolutely be back. 👍

Good hot dog  eatery in the Edgewater neighborhood. Super nice family serving makes this one of the best and most underrated hot dog restaurants in Chicago. Right next to the Thorndale branch of the library system and a bus stop.

Great experience all around! My wife and I had dinner here to celebrate our 18yr anniversary. We had our wedding at the South Shore Cultural Center so this was the perfect place to have dinner and celebrate. I requested the best table in the house and when we walked in they had placed a reserve sign on our table. The food was good and the waiter went out of her way to ensure we were having a good time. They brought out complimentary sparkling apple cider in tall champagne glasses for us and really dressed up the desert especially for us. It was quiet with a small crowd, good background music, the ambiance was romantic and the view was fantastic. Quality cuisine at affordable prices. Thank you for a making our evening special!

This is a nice restaurant in South Shore Cultural Center. The aesthetic is grand, the view to outside landscape is relaxing. I had salmon and spinach, which I very much enjoyed. Went with a few buddies to celebrate the anniversary of our fraternity crossing ceremony.
Nice place to enjoy with friends.
Food is just ok, but the place is beautiful, right on the lake. Definitely worth going

I went there about 2 weeks ago with my wife and son and the food was amazing. The decor was so romantic. We went on a Friday night and had a 7:45 pm reservation (which the last reservation is at 8). The place had just the right amount of people in it. I think there are less people toward closing hours which makes it more romantic. It seemed as though we were transported back to the 50's I should have had on a tux and she a lovely night gown. Unfortunatley we were unable to see the lake due to it being night. The service was bad at best but the food made us make a reservation again for tonight!

We came here for Father’s day brunch and it was absolutely perfect. The buffet options were tasty and the service was impeccable. Definitely recommend. But remember that it’s BYOB- so bring your own libations.

Had this for the first time with a friend via Ritual. The woman on the other side of the counter hooked me up! I had the chicken shawarma bowl with some hummus, salsa, and sour cream.

The food was really tasty, and at a decent value for this location. They're not open after lunch so make sure to grab yours before rush hour.

Disappointing. Used ritual to order, so maybe that explains 3 dry peaces of chicken. I noticed many places minimize the portions when I order online. But nothing can explain $2 for side of hummus (so small that I thought it was extra dressing at first) which didn't matter anyway, because it tasted nothing like hummus, I ended up throwing it way. Really the only thing that I actually liked were olives, had to pay extra for those, but they tasted good... Probably cause there is no cooking involved, they just placed them on top of my order. Rest was pretty bad and I'm usually easy to please.

Great food, worth the extra walk from my work place - roti is nearby, but this place is definitely better in terms of quality and quantity. Best falafel and salads I've had compared to other fast-food chains. The chicken shawarma is great too. The pita bread is poor though.
Usually i will be impressed with normal stuff itself, but here spicy chicken is not at all a soicy chicken and chicken is kind of very hard with no taste, pita seems like a ready made bread.
Sauces are bland creamy stuff from a Subway-style squeeze bottle. They put shredded cheese on the bowls by default if you ask for "everything". Falafel is hard and dry.

Westside Gyros is worth the trip on Western.  Proudly support a family owned business.  Large portions, fast and friendly service and clean space. Ordered a Gyros platter and Italian beef sandwich. The platter can feed two, definitely ask for an extra pita for an additional sandwich from the large portion of meat. Gyro platter comes with Tsatziki, lettuce, onions, tomatoes and pickles. Italian beef came dipped and is a two handed tasty sandwich. Prices include fries and a can of soda so don't be sticker shocked as they require cash only for payment.
This place was smacking,  the portions were huge (I got the gyro combo) and perfect for a hangover 👌 ohh and ask for extra napkins js
Very good gyros. Fast and friendly service. Affordable. Highly recommend
The gyro was good but the onion rings was soggy in the middle like the onions dissolved within while cooking them.
The customer service was good. The food was hot and alright. It could've been better with some seasoning.

Takashi was a small but jewel of a find, the limited menu items were very interesting and delectable. For me, the appetizers were the true appeal of the restaurant, ranging from scallops to sweetbreads and escargot, all of the appetizers we had were phenomenal. Perhaps because of the extraordinary appetizers, the main dishes were a little underwhelming than expected but still very well prepared and overall definitely worth the trip.

Great sadness fills my heart to know that this place is closing but I'm happy to have experienced it.  I was also very surprised to find out that they offered a vegetarian version of the tasting menu.  This allowed me to stick to m original ideal of the tasting menu.

To be honest, it was a great value but after seven courses I was slightly hungry still.  Keep in mind it was the only thing I had to eat and my reservation was for 7:30.  So you shouldn't be afraid of being stuffed after ordering it.

I opted for cocktails vice wine pairings and this turned out be a bit of a tactical error since the server was slightly inattentive in that regard.  Our drinks were finished by the end of the third course where we asked to see the drink menu again, we didn't get the drink menus again until after the fourth course and then he pretty much never bothered to take a drink order.

The food was excellent.  Highlights were definitely the pork belly buns.  It was cooked perfectly so that the meat was tender and pretty much dissolved in your mouth but still didn't taste like overcooked mush.  The duck two ways was also amazing.

I went to Takashi with a friend, and we did the 11 course tasting menu. Definitely some of the best food I have ever had in the US, and probably the best tasting menu I have done in the US. The dishes were perfectly portioned and bursting with flavour which is what you want when each dish is a few bites. 3 of the 11 courses were ridiculously good, so much that I would go back just for them. The only thing I would say is that next time I probably would do the 7 course menu, because 3 of the additional 4 courses were not really to my liking.

We celebrated our wedding anniversary at Takashi on a Sunday evening.  It was a prefix Japanese style dinner menu with a choice of 6 courses/10 courses and optional wine pairings.  Each dish was deliciously different with beautiful presentation.  The staff were also excellent!!!    As the evening was winding down, Chef Takashi came in and mingled with the dinners!  We really loved our first visit to Takashi! Will return soon!

Heavy Japanese influence on most dishes, which i think works better than trying to add an element of multiple Asian cuisines. Prices are on the high side, but not totally out of line with other restaurants of this quality - Japanese or otherwise.

Second visit had the 7 course tasting menu. Really enjoyed it, almost all of the dishes were outstanding, especially the pork belly and scallop.

I can confidently say that this was THE BEST dining place in Chicago. Loved the hospitality, friendly customer service and the delicious foods. The manager was so nice that he even offered us a free dessert and saffron tea ☕️  I would 100% recommend this place, you will definitely love it.

My favorite restaurant at Devon. They have upgraded themselves well over the years. Their Mutka dishes are our new favorite. Weekends, they serve lunch buffets. During the busy weekends, kitchen might close early depending on the rush. So please your visit accordingly, not close to the restaurant closing time. Their collection of drinks is also awesome.

Amazing food! I am a food lover and finding the right food and the right taste is no joke!  But I found this place to be the best in everything they have. Loved everything, Sadiq or Siddique uncle was really nice. (I hope am getting his name right) he offered kheer as a sample to try. Great experience with family and friends.

What is not to love about Usmania! This and only 2 other restaurants on all of Devon have stayed true to consistency, quality, quantity and variety! We hadn’t been back here since pre-covid so it was nice to see the beautiful remodel and expansion of the restaurant. They did such a nice job. We booked the last Friday Ramadan Iftar and we were not disappointed. I loved that is was reservation ONLY! One seating for the night and not people coming and going as other restaurants do. The tables had plenty of space between them and already had dates and bottled water ready to break our fast. I also enjoyed hearing the Azaan when it was time. There was more than plenty of good food for everyone including chenna, nihari, biryani, goat karahi, mutton korma, fresh fruits, lassi’s, juices and chai. Plenty of pakoras, samosas and dhai balay! They offered a different menu every night. Our waiter Raffa was very nice about taking our empty plates and keeping our table clean. This place stands the test of time and their buffets are always really good! We were so happy and satisfied with everything. If you want a very large variety of Pakistani foods to choose from that are tastefully done then look no further- this IS and has been THE place for the last 20 years I’ve been coming here!
