They were giving away free Haleem one day and yes it was good. That reeled me in and I had dinner here but I was disappointed with their service. The samosas were served after the tea was cold and the appetizers were served after the entre.

I’m today’s episode of Discovering Treasures In Your Own Backyard…a trip to the South Side caused me to catch sight of Janson’s extra funky facade. The Maxwell Street Polish, fries, Mexican Coke, and Oreo shake are all legit. The Polish in particular was grilled to perfection.

Food is very good, totally worth all the calories and extra pounds. Their milk shake is also legit! Fast and very coordinated customer service. Certainly one of the best dinners in the area. Little wonder they have been in business for so long.

I haven't been to this place since I left high school, I was in the area and decided to go... I order their seasonal salad which I have to say I'm a bit disappointed for the lack of ingredients and the price.  I literally paid $17.00 for a salad n a brownie... Which in my opinion is just highway robbery... And then the icing on the cake was when I proceeded to ask the cashier if I could possibly get an extra dressing for the meal she informed me that it would be $1.05 more for extra condiments... WOW! TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED.

I have seen this place for 50 years, going to and from { Evergreen Please }. This is the first time I have ever been in here.
First : The staff were kind and fun.
Second: My food was cool to order.
Third: 5×s 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
The food was so good.
I will be back, another new spot...

I must admit I had the gyros from here previously and they were great! With that in mind, I ordered a Italian combo for myself and Italian beef for my husband last night. The fact they charge for peppers is a slap in the face within itself but trying to give me high blood pressure with the amount of saltiness in those beefs. The beefs were so extremely salty it was inedible. Just off that I can’t even trust them to do my gyros anymore smh. Don’t order the beefs unless you want to have a stroke.

Very delicious restaurant. We sat at the kitchen counter and saw the cooks which was a fun experience. The staff was knowledgeable and helpful. We ordered mussels, pork ribs, and a goat cheese salad. Every item was delicious in it's own way. If recommend everyone getting some of those ribs! We will definitely make sure to come back here in the near future!

This was an excellent choice for a coworker and I. We would completely come again to try more things on the menu. Excellent by glass wine menu. Bone marrow is well executed. Beets as the salad dish complemented well by the pistachios and goat cheese foam. The octopus with grilled vegetables was very well done. Foodies will be very at home here. We got chef bar seating and were fascinated what the cooks were making.

The reviews on this place were great and we have always wanted to try it when in town.  We finally tried it for lunch and it was really good.  They serve small sharable plates and everything we had was good.  We especially liked the whipped Feta with toast and the Halibut was amazing.  We also tried the sardines and some mozzarella item that was good.  I don’t have a single complaint about this place and I’m looking forward to going back.

There were three of us for lunch and two of us had a hard cider.  It was not a cheap lunch, that’s for sure. The bill for three of us was $116 not including the tip.

So many friends recommended this place so here we are. We were warned that the dishes could be a little bit too salty so we asked for less salt. It turned out great! My favorite is the half duck. Cut it and put it in the slider with the yogurt - tastes amazing. The duck meat is very tender. My second favorite is the mussels soaked in rich tomato soup. Love this place and will come again.

I was blown away by my experience here. How can a dish under the "Vegetables" section titled something as simple as, "Salt Roasted Beets" be my favorite menu item? It was FANTASTIC. I will never forget how perfectly the whipped goat cheese went with the beets and how the pistachio butter somehow made the perfect complement to the meal. For this dish alone i would fly back to Chicago. If that weren't enough, the pasta was also fantastic. Such a hearty serving of the fresh house made pasta too! I couldn't finish it because of course i had to try a dessert to really embrace the full experience. I paired both of my courses with a wine recommended by the bartender and it all went together perfectly. Will definitely be back in the future!

Crossing is my jam.

It's got a great patio area, with nice couches, seats, heaters, and a bar, and is consistently voted as one of Chicago's best patios (they advertise themselves as having one of the best secret patios, but they do so with a huge poster on the side of the building, which is fun and silly).

They also have a great interior, with multiple bars, and a very friendly waitstaff.

I came here for their Wednesday trivia and had a blast. It was very easy to hear the trivia host, had some great questions (difficult enough to make it hard, but not so difficult that it wasn't fun), and a good atmosphere.

I did not have a chance to try the food, however the beer selection good. They had the usual Chicago specialties (Green Line, Daisy Cutter, a few Revolution beers), which always does the trick.

Overall, I'd highly recommend checking it out. Don't be fooled by the outside either, as it looks like an old German Sausage spot. It's really cool and modern inside.

Some of the best bar food of any sports bar in Chicago. It's always packed, no matter, the Chicago sporting event. The back patio is a great spot and it's really ideal for any time. Very different crowd on Friday or Saturday nights, but overall a great place!

The fact that the Crossing is a KU bar is reason enough for me to love it but the food keeps bringing me back! The fish tacos are and tortilla soup are some of my favorite in the city.  The staff is always friendly and attentive.  Great food specials during the week, and a perfect outdoor patio in the summertime.

The Crossing is owned by Four Corners (Benchmark, Kirkwoods, Trellis) and is a great neighborhood sports bar. It's a Kansas bar, so you can expect it to be packed on Saturdays in March. They also have a huge beer garden which opens in the summer. Wednesday night they offer trivia with a $250 prize, and the bar is HUGE so they can accommodate a ton of teams.

The Nachos are excellent and a large order can feed 4 people, easily.

Oh my those tacos! I hardly remember a more delicious assortment of meats wrapped in a warm tasty flour tortilla.  Such good food!  My cocktail, a divine concoction served directly from Jesus's Christ's personal personal bartender.  Best of all my server Joyce was there to make sure everything went well.  Could not have asked for a more pleasurable place to dine out.

Could’ve eaten an average burger meal  for less than $27. Who puts this much onion on a burger ? Where do I start? I went to Fatso’s on a Sunday night looking for something grubby and this is right around the corner from me. I thought, why not try it ? I could’ve skipped it in hindsight. I ordered 2 Single Fatso’s with cheese, fries and a shake. Simple, right? The first burger was pink inside. In general the burger Pattie’s were like sponges; squishy and wet. The buns were like dry sponges, used to hold it all in place. Despite all of the sauce spilling off of it there was no flavor at all! The burgers as a whole tasted like nothing. They do give you a generous amount of fries, but it’d be great if there were tasty burgers to go with them… Overall I am unimpressed. This was a waste of money and overall a let down to my burger cravings.

Oh my god this char dog was so good. I’ve been to Chicago before and never had the chance to visit Fatso’s. I was able to make it in on a super rainy day. They were empty and I ordered a char dog with everything. The simple pleasure of enjoying this hot dog inside of this place is indescribable. It was so delicious and the employees were great.
One of my favorite places to stop when I go to Chicago! It makes me want to explore and see what else the Ukrainian Village has to offer. The Char dogs and fries are amazing!
Charred Double Dogs and Fries with side of Cheese. Good food, service, and clean facility. Nice outside seating. Will return for another scrumptious meal.

This was definitely a great hole in the wall find! The restaurant itself has major history in the area and for good reason too! The burgers were thick and juicy, and the fries were the best! They were crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside with the right amount of salt! The milkshakes were great too along with there cheesy mac and cheese that melted in your mouth. The area was nice too with outdoor seating looking at the nice architecture of the churches or city.

Service was excellent and food was tasty.  They were able to accommodate our large group of 7 adults and 5 small children. Note they only have 2 high chairs and no children's menu, but we made it work. The only negative was it took a long time for our meals to arrive for being pretty much only ones in there, but the waitress was attentive and helpful. They gave us some crackers and small veggies to munch on while we waited. Meals were also large portions, a handful of us took home leftovers.

A friend who grew up in Chinatown recommended this restaurant. I asked the host what the best thing to eat was and he told me to order the Szechuan chicken. Perfect amount of heat and very fresh ingredients. I'm coming back.
Generous portion sizes, moderately priced food, and a decent environment. Good southern Chinese Cantonese food. I recommend trying a smoothie with the tapioca, they are just as good as Chinatown.

Ordered online at 830p not knowing it closed st 9p. They confirmed the order and I had a delivery time set for 940p.  Well that never happened as they closed at 9p. Sat waiting for my food all night that was never coming.
Thought the service was great, very reasonable prices, high quality Chinese food.

I'm walking down the street when I found this store. I'm starving already so I took my time to come here. It was fast food so I hope they have fast service. They don't have a table and chairs to stay in so I just eat it while walking. I ordered two burgers. And it took so long for my order to come. I thought it was quick. So it served me in a good plastic wrap.

One burger that I ate was Express Grill with porkchop, yellow mustard and grilled onions. When I bite it I bite the bone of the pork chop. They should have removed it since it was a burger. But the taste was really good.

The one burger was also really good. It came with a tasty patty and fresh veggies. I also taste the cheese and mustard on it. I love this.

Absolutely abysmal service. I got sick after eating it. The polish was way too spicy and the cashier didn't tell me it was going to be that hot. In fact, he couldn't tell me anything because he could barely speak a word of English. He got mad and irritated at me because I couldn't understand him. It's not my fault you can't speak the language. He just threw a little box at me. I later figured out that I was supposed to put my debit card in the box to pay. Overall 0/0
Ate here for the first time last night and I must say the food was delicious!!! I had the polish(minus the sports peppers, I can't handle hot stuff) .. very good! Highly recommend it!!
Been coming here since I was a wee las, to bad they stopped the 24hr deal, but I understand why. Everyone and their momma would come here to show out like a ghetto as,sss car show. Still good food!

One of two outstanding polish stands in The Chi!!!

The story of the two cousin that split is legendary here and is still the talk between the two stands.

A favorite among the Chicago locals, the polish sausages here are good. Grilled onions and hot peppers on the side. Toss in a bag of fries and it's a party.

The cost is fair, all things considered.

Right off the freeway, you can grab a bite to eat and a pop to wash it down.

My favorite and go to Thai restaurant in Chicago.  I haven’t had anything bad from this place. Service is always good.
List of my favorites.
1. Moo Ping
2. Larb Gai
3. Kra Pow
4. Pad Kra Pao (Basil Chicken)
5. Tom Yum Noodle Soup
6. Boat Noodle
We love the boat noodle here. thai authentic food and pork ball with tamarind dipping sauce. They are very good.

Awesome food! HOWEVER, terrible customer service. I got my order online to pick up, once I got there, they charged me more, saying that prices went up. Not just the price went up as also, its coming less food than usual use to come, I would say 30% less. My Pad Thai came with parts of egg shell as well.!!! see pictures!
The food is absolutely delicious. The summer roll is my favorite as is the Thai roasted chicken. The flavors are great. Spicy tuna is also great as are the potstickers. The service is awesome.
Love the food. Fresh and homemade. Tom yum soup the best.

I came across this place several years ago and have been coming ever since. This is a great take out spot with great value. Most recently I feel like food has improved — what a great surprise.

Again, this is east coast style no frills Chinese takeout, which is an increasingly rare style for Chicago. A hidden gem, but don’t expect presentation, because that’s not what this style is about.

This place use to be great but now I just got the worst chicken & broccoli, pepper beef & shrimp egg foo young.  The  chicke had this horrible globs of thick gluttonous corn starch all over it like it was precooked and sitting in this gel waiting to be used, the beef also had thick gluttonous gravy only slightly better than the chkn.  The fried rice was dry w/dried chicken & too much soy.  Egg rolls were pretty good & the only freshly cooked item shrimp egg foo young was good.  I will not be coming back.

Okay… so a couple years ago they were not to bad. $7 for a big portion of Mongolian beef and shrimp fried rice is pretty good not gonna lie. But now they not good. Although thank you for your response. I changed my review to a 4 because you guys got under new management. The old management was terrible at the end just terrible.
No owners has sit down and improved food. The pepper steak was very good and fried rice is a bomb for reasonable prices and good American Chinese food this is the place.
Food is delicious and portions are huge. Keep up good work

This location is like a small hamburger stand on the edge of a remote, dusty town instead of in the middle of a major financial and cultural area. The place was dirty, garbage cans practically overflowing, and there were only two people working. It also doesn't have the updated look that other locations have. The owner probably figures there's no point in trying since they get lots of commuters and customers from the buildings in the area. What was also puzzling was how the Shamrock Shake wasn't even blended, but instead made of sloppy layers of mint syrup and vanilla.

I go here pretty much every morning and it's one of the fastest McDonald's I've ever been to. They are like a well-oiled machine in the morning and turn around meals very quickly. It's also in the base of my building, so I don't even have to go outside to get to it. I always use the McDonald's app for the McCafe punch card and other food deals.

Twice I've waited for an iced coffee long after all the people in line behind me have gotten their orders and left.  I think there's a disconnect between them giving me my food order and clearing their screen, so the person making the coffee doesn't ever see my order.

Found hair in my food and the manager a women was very rude and all I was trying to do was tell them to where there hair nets stop being rude to your customers and where your hair nets. Oh yeah and fire that manager she should jot be working with coustomers at all. Very very rude.
Nice clean McDonald's. Fast service. Free refills. Very nice view, you can sit and eat in the window and watch Chicago pass you by.

Food is average at best… this is so sad because Mexican food is quite tasty and diverse… please don’t let this bad experience prevent you from trying other Mexican restaurants.
I order a Burrito with fries… (please don’t do it) I don’t know what I was thinking…extremely oily and blend… super soft fries: disgusting, I asked without tomatoes but they adecided to put tomatoes… thanks :) for robbing me of my money

Such great tacos! And not tiny, either. I had two varieties (steak & ground beef) and loved both. Tasty cheese, fresh lettuce, really just a great lunch, and for a fair price, too. Highly recommended if you're near Belmont & Lockwood any time soon!

Food and crew are fantastic!! You can't get better mex then TBK. The food is always fresh and tasty. Proportion is perfect and with price you can not go wrong. Fav burrito, sherreded chicken. Gotta have it!!
Not a fan of their food. Maybe it's just me. There's nothing wrong with the food it doesn't have enough seasoning for my taste.

A dam fine late nite spot for a burrito " that you won't regret eating 6 hours later.
Good portions, very fair price for what they serve.

The service was amazing. Took my wife here for her birthday and we were lucky to have a full booth to ourselves. Reservations were made but not needed. The food was AMAZING! My steak is always requested the same way and this is the first place that hit it right on the nail. My wife LOVED her crab legs and other dishes. Best calamari I’ve ever tried.

Ahhhhhhh best oyster in town! Fresh and incredible great price. If you are a seafood lover and looking for a roomy place to get together with your friend, this is the one you are looking for.

Staffs are very nice. It is such an enjoyment to see the gentlemen open the oysters.

Our visit here was quite nice!  Our server and the manager were very warm and welcoming.  The food was good. Our steak was cooked at the right temperature. My favorite thing on the plate was the red potatoes. They were seasoned with Lemon, garlic and just the perfect amount of spice.  I would visit again.

I’ve been coming here for 4 years now. And this place has been open for 30years. It’s an icon and any seafood lovers dream. Had the best meal last night. CY, the owner is so great. All the fish was fresh and trust me I tried it all. Their new Fall Specials are spectacular. Get that salmon and prawns platter. And spicy shrimp from bar specials. Great wine program too!
10 out of 10 would recommend. The mussels were amazing! The boil was divine. Everything was fresh and ultra delicious.

Early morning visit on a Wednesday. Not to busy.  Large selection to choose from.  I got about 6 different items, as I was buying for a group.  We had buns, steamed buns and rice crepes.  Everything was delicious.  Definitely worth a visit when you are in the area.
Cash only! We forgot so we had to walk back to the car and luckily there was some cash in there. The pastries were good but nothing special. Tasted similar to many of the Chinese bakeries.

I dropped in here on a whime to grab some much-wanted dessert. I was surprised by the selection!

I got a Portuguese-style egg tart (pasteis de nata...I remembered devoring them 6 at a time in Portugal!), a cream cone, and a coconut cream bun.

Cash only establishment (but I spotted an ATM inside).

Everything was fresh when I got back to hotel. Nothing stale. Good flavor, though I expected the egg tart to be a big sweeter. Very good! A+
Bakery here was alright. The coconut bun had no filling inside so it was kind of bland and the taro filling in the taro bread was a bit dry. I would recommend the tarts as they do look good.

The coffee mousse cake was good. Would prefer more cake than mousse but was overall still pleased. 1 slice is under 5 bucks and big enough to lovingly split with one other person for a nice memorable treat!
Good food and atmosphere.  Staff very very friendly and helpful.
Good food. Great location. Great customer service. The 3 cheese mac is delicious. The cole slaw is tastefully spicily delicious. Try it!

I order this for the office regularly and everyone loves it.  It's delicious and the staff is beyond kind and generous. They even deliver on bicycles to the local area -- catering for 150 comes on two cycles with carriages.  It's delicious and eco friendly.
This place is clean, Staff is friendly and most important food is great! Totally affordable too. Good portion
The Mac and cheese is fantastic, if you like your bbq saucy, you'll have to ask for extra sauce.

Frozen crust used for pizza it was ok

When I opened the door I was like wow c someone was smoking between the doors but to my surprise they were smoking in the restaurant
Super good, Bosnian burger!! Warm and nice people

Very interesting old school bar and pizza joint. Looks closed from the exterior.

As another review stated,  there is a cigarette smoke smell upon entry but didn't overpower. After a sip on my cocktail I forgot...

Our customized pizza was great.  Thin crust with Bosnian sausage and fresh toppings. Greek salad was crisp and good size for two. Bartender needed a little help mixing a Martini but could pour a nice Chivas 12 yo scotchy scotch. Bathroom was a "C" , small, clean, tidy but outdated. $42 for two plus tip. I'd recommend for good food and service but ambiance is lacking.
I've ordered 3 times and the quality was never the same. One pizza was good, one was dry as dust and the third pizza was inexplicably a thick crust, unlike the other two. Plus they're kind of rude

This place is a hidden gem.  I love the pizza from here.  Lived in the area for quite a while  and boy did this place have me fooled.  The outside might not look too exciting or even the inside but once you taste the pizza it will leave you saying "why haven't I gave it a chance sooner. " prices are not bad.  Nice people.  My place for 🍕!
Great food and a wonderful service.. The owner he is a really nice guy.

So I order chicken wings and a steak quesadilla 20 min later I get drumsticks with buffalo sauce WTF really, I was hungry so I ate two "drumsticks"one hour later toilet here I come, never again would I eat at this place, only drinks if that, next time if you dont have wings dont give out what ever you want, thats why a hate some mexican places and im mexican
the food and service is lackluster. BUT they play punta!! Shame no one danced
Love it great food n service
I love there wings n fries

Really tasty food for reasonable price! Everything was pretty much spot on besides the AC being turned up a little too much. Fried pickles, tomatoes & gumbo were all great. I would like to try the dessert next time. Come hungry and bring cash. (ATM available in restaurant)

We went there on Tuesday for a late lunch.  No wait got right in.  It was a cold rainy day so we craved for hot gumbo.  It was located on the seventh floor in a business-looking building so we would’ve never expected there is a restaurant in the middle floor.  We had to ask around where the restaurant is located and then we learned that we need to take the elevator up to 7th floor.  Ambience is pretty cool.  Southern decor resembling Louisiana I assume.  Service was outstanding.  We had some questions on the menu and the server was friendly and explained all the questions we had.  A lot of seasonings on the table for your customizable experience.  We ordered the famous Nashville hot chicken, jalapeno corn muffin, and a bowl of gumbo.  The chicken dish was really hot and the muffin helped a lot.  The hot chicken was not on the regular menu, it was written on the board on the wall as house specials.  We were full after the chicken and the gumbo, could not finish the muffin and the fries all the way.  Two of us paid $29.80 after tax.  Very reasonable price for the quality food.  Highly recommended.

The best Cajun food in Chicago. Super friendly waiters who don't mind sharing their hot sauce recommendations. Must try the fried shrimp, gumbo and the jambalaya. Also, ask for the ghost pepper hot sauce.

Edit: it’s cash only, so come prepared. There’s an ATM inside the restaurant too if you need it.

If you are looking for hearty dishes made with love – this is your spot! Their Po’boys cannot be beat! I really loved their jalapeno cheddar corn muffin, fried green tomatoes and a few others! The staff here is top notch! They are some of the nicest people I have ever met! At the same time – when stepping into this restaurant you feel as if you are transported out of Chicago and into a Louisiana diner! Also portions are pretty big so make sure you bring some friends with to share! I cannot wait to come back and check out their full menu! Lastly don’t forget to check out their drinks (get the hurricane)! Btw if you don’t try one of their hot sauces... you need to go back!

Decent prices, very generous portion sizes. It's a bummer they are cash only but luckily we had enough to not have to not order things. The jalapeno cheddar bangers were great, I really liked the friend pickles too. The vegetarian gumbo was gross (spinach and white rice). We liked the fried chicken and the cajun coleslaw as well. Drinks were decently priced and good portions/alcohol content. I'd recommend the place despite the cash thing.

Pleasantly surprised to find that it's more than an average soup / sandwich place, and tastes good. I expected standard menu items like turkey, cheese, chicken, club sandwich, chicken Noodle soup, broccoli cheese... But they have prosciutto, goat cheese, gruyere, salmon, avocado, kale and white bean soup, pea and Avocado soup, etc.

Most poorly constructed sandwich ever. Classic  Turkey Club on pretzel baguette. Impossible to eat without it falling apart. It should have been cut in half. Anyway this $12 sandwich ended up in the trash. I'll never go there again!)
Yum! Single vegan choice that was phenomenal. Easy to be healthy (or unhealthy) with the variety of choices. Staff was friendly and had great calm energy!

I would never had guessed that super easy-to-miss place is capable of producing sandwiches as good as these are. Most of them are offered on pretzel bread (but there’s an option for regular bread if for some reason you’re not into that) and include super fresh, premium ingredients like organic cured meets, hard and soft cheeses, pesto, truffle, smoked salmon, and more. The sandwiches still manage to be substantial and reasonably-priced which is surprising given it’s prime location in the city. I tried this for the first time recently and can’t wait to come back!

My friend and I stumbled across this fine establishment while looking for a place to nosh on some lunch while in Chicago. Upon entry, they were playing Hayden’s trumpet concerto in E flat major. The work staff was very friendly and made our sandwiches promptly. We were quite satisfied with our food. Overall, I would recommend.

After my second visit, I would rate this place 3 stars. First visit was phenomenal, I left thinking I found an awesome place with good food and sake. Second visit was for a small birthday party. Our server was borderline annoying, borderline unattentive. She spoke too loud, that alone removed us from the calm peaceful atmosphere this place created. She didn't pay attention, not such as bringing a knife for our cake, or fork, or matches for candle. We asked for the them one by one.

Food I ate at the second visit was pretty good, but i didn't match or beat my first visit. I would recommend the steak buns, and sushi rolls. Their sashimi Chefs special wasn't special and was way overpriced, so avoid those. But the Scottish salmon was  on point delicious.

As you see, it's a borderline experience. It could be really good or just terrible. Dice roll.
Small little Sushi place with really good food. They usually have a table for you and they have huge windows so you get natural moon light or sunshine.

Scottish salmon is unreal, just melts in your mouth.

Everything else is great too

Lovely breakfast. The steelcut oatmeal will set you up for the day. Coffee is nice and smooth. The breakfast sandwich was gorgeous too. Free Wi-Fi. Staff forgot to give me a cup for my ice tea and I didn't have the receipt to prove it unfortunately.
Great coffee and cozy ambience. Very polite and friendly staff. To-go place for a quick bite when travelling or for breakfast.
Great healthy options and delicious food. Good service, very good for a quick bite between sightseeing stops. Great location, nice street views!
Good food and service. I ordered tuna salad on multigrain plus iced tea. I like to put potato chips on my tuna salad.
The food is always of high quality and I love coming here to use the coupons. Definitely try the season items when you can.

It was our first time eating here and the food was delicious. I had the Buffalo “chicken” sandwich and my friend had the popping jalapeño burger. The fries and the sweet potato fries were also very yummy. Cute little spot and very friendly service! Will be back!
Got their Orange Cauliflower delivered and was delicious, photo doesn't really do it justice. The sauce on the cauliflower was great and paired well with the fried rice.
Love this location! Such good quality. I got the chicken bacon avo club and it was really good compared to the same dish at other locations.

Honestly, as a carnivore I do not understand  how their food is SO GOOD. 10/10 recommend everything on the menu, especially the oatmeal  cookie sandwich. The only reason I didn’t give 5/5 stars is because the food is hit or miss in quality. Always good, but sometimes it’s phenomenal.

I like native foods. I always try something new when I go. I also always order the nachos, that's mandatory, they're so good! I don't think I've ever felt like I wasted my money and felt cheated. In terms of flavor, some days and locations might be more consistent than others but overall I haven't had any complaints.

I haven’t had Jamaican Gates in a couple years but I recently ordered some on Doordash and it was amazing! The chicken was so flavorful I didn’t even need the jerk sauce and I absolutely LOVE jerk sauce, with that being said the jerk sauce was thick and spicy, I hate when it’s watery. The cabbage was perfectly cooked and well seasoned. The oxtails were pretty fatty but that’s just the luck of the draw with oxtails but they were perfectly cooked and full of flavor. Overall I wish I could give them 10 stars because I have not had jerk that good in a long time plus they are reasonably priced! I plan to order again tonight because I could not stop thinking about that meal.

I went to Jamaican Hut Reoxtail on 101st & Halsted for the first time last week and was truly impressed with the taste of the food! Ordered catfish with beans and rice with a side order of mac n cheese and sweet potatoes!   Everything tasted superb and will definitely be returning in the future to try their oxtails.
They have very good food and service. They are reasonably priced, especially in this economy. The portion sizes are good.  Unlike other places in the area, they're not price gouging people!
The food was good.Very Pricey now. So I expect the food to be great all the time. Could not get exactly what I wanted because they were out. Need to give out more jerk sauce

Curry Goat had too many bones, more bones than meat, plenty of cabbage and one slice of plantain.($17)
Grilled catfish was very good.

Steak was okay. When I went to pick it up I asked if I could sit on one of the many unoccupied chairs around the restaurant while they finished making it. I was told forcibly that those chairs were not to be sat on by an employee sitting in a chair. Kinda made for a bizarre atmosphere with me standing over him and his many unoccupied chairs while they finished making the sandwich.

Best philly cheese steak pizza! 🍕
First time ordering and won’t be our last, the pizza was fresh, delicious and soooooo good 🤤 but unfortunately the chicken Philly sandwich wasn’t as expected, It was ok but definitely not the best, the meat doesn’t taste good at all, also the fries was flavourless. Would only go back for their pizza.

Always come here. Best phillys. But today  While waiting for food the man who you give your ticket to for food coughed in his hands and did not wash them. The cook cooking the steak was chewing gum while doing so yuck ! No one had gloves, no one was washing their hands after touching things and no hair nets. Had hair in my buffalo chicken Philly.
Get the garlic bread with your sub so good.  Fries were ok.

Gyro Pizza - 10/10 absolute perfection.
Philly Cheese Steak - 10/10 absolute perfection. Make sure you build it like you want it.

Can’t get enough of this food. Right taste, right price, right everything. This is a downtown bargain and a personal favorite.

First time dining here and we were impressed with the experience.

Food: 5/5
They have both seafood and meats from the grille, we did the salmon app which was excellent. Followed by lamb shank (get this!), short rib kabob which was good but only a few bites of food. Lastly we had one sushi roll, which comes with 10 pieces and was very fresh and had some good spice to it.

Drinks: 5/5
Service: 5/5
We had a small bottle of sake and a mezcal cocktail a piece. The service was amazing and they were attentive and food came out incredibly quick.

We will be back.
Amazing and fresh quality fish! The flavors were exceptional and service was top notch! Such a unique menu they offer as well, if only my stomach was big enough for more!

Fantastic place!! The food was exceptional, we had tuna tataki (do not miss it!), seaweed salad, dragon roll, spicy mango roll and the hotate volcano. All of which were excellent. We sat at the counter across from the chefs making the sushi rolls and watching them is so mesmerizing, they are meticulous, hygienic and super talented.

Aside the food, the best part is that the staff seems so happy! Everyone seems to be in a good mood and the chefs at the sushi counter seem to love their job. Loved this place!
The Godzilla shrimp roll is DELICIOUS! I eat here all the time! The food is consistent regardless if you dine in, delivery, or take out. It’s very delicious! My GO TO sushi spot!

Overrated. Expensive. 260 with tip included between 2 people with 2 drinks. Plus they have a health surcharge on their bill on top of asking for tip. First time I saw that.

I’m not sure how this place got such amazing reviews? Must be more of a happy hour place or bar than a sit down for a proper meal. Also the pictures look good but trust me, it’s one of those Instagram restaurants where expectations just do not meet reality. Feel disappointed and scammed.

The edamame was tasteless with some bit of mysterious white powder on it. The bbq was burned and dry. Chicken thigh was deplorable. The hamachi was the only redeeming dish. The seaweed salad was so salty and saucy it left me drinking water all night. The rice on the 4 rolls we got were cold and dry. They clearly did not use fresh rice. Could’ve even been pre-made. The avocado tuna truffle specialty was a disaster. A 5 year old could’ve made it- just piles of ingredients on top of the other with some oily chips on the side.

I’ve never seen such low effort coming out of a kitchen. It’s shocking. I hope management reads this feedback and doesn’t take it personally but uses it to step up the quality of the food. As a customer, it’s easy to tell when the food is made with care…this food is absolutely soulless…almost like it’s made out of a factory only to shuffle tables to keep the cash register going.

Only 2 stars goes to the hamachi which was actually fresh and tasty and the service which was overall good although some inappropriate comments were made regarding our order.
The Buffalo Philly cheesesteak is awesome and is to die for. The owner/ manager of the establishment is great and very friendly. I have come here twice and both times it was excellent

The Original Philly Steak is really good. But the other steak sandwiches are just wrong. Who puts lettuce and tomato on a Philly Steak? The cheese burger is very good. Better that what you would get at McDonald's. The fries are very good. The King Potato is excellent. This place is surprising good.
The one in north riverside mall is the real great steak, this one is something else. The taste is way off.

Let me start by saying the food was good which was the only reason I gave this location more than a single star.  My sandwich was first given away to another customer further extending the already lengthy wait.  The customer who received my sandwich (much larger than what she ordered) proceeded to eat my sandwich when the kitchen realized their mistake the young girl proceeded to blame and chastise the customer and continued to trash talk the customer after she threw the sandwich away and left.  The issue was resolved by simply giving me a 7 inch sandwich that was already made and making another (as I ordered a twelve inch originally).  I have been in the service industry for over a decade in currently in a supervisory role, not only would I do my best to fire the girl who shamed the customer but I would have done far better to repair the experience with the original customer (myself).  Sadly I will probably never return here and I will take note to warn all who ask not to patron this establishment.
Very tasty cheese sandwiches, great fried chicken and tenders and the fries absolutely good.

My wife tries to avoid meat whenever she can. She recommended this place that I’ve tried to not look at the past 352763273672 times I’ve driven passed it. I reluctantly agreed, assuming in my head I was going to be disappointed. I WAS WRONG. SO WRONG. The service was prompt and pleasant. The windows made the restaurant really bright, but still a cozy dining experience. I had the Thai Basil with soy Chicken protein (and fries because…. Well… they looked and smelled delicious). My wife got one of the curry plates with soy chicken as well. It was delicious. It’s sparked a curiosity in me. DEFINITELY coming back and recommend everyone looking into this place to come down and give it a shot.

The food here is one of the best vegan in the city!!!! Always excited to come back! We dined in, the staff is always busy with takeout orders. Great teamwork! I’m thinking about my experience and already planning out my next meal🤤💯💙
The BEST Thai food I’ve ever had. Everything on the menu is 100% vegan…including 5 types of protein. Large portions, even for lunch. Courteous waitstaff. Can’t wait to come back.

Having to eat a quick meal I was impressed with how attentive and quick the staff helped. The biggest problem I had was deciding on which dish to get as they many options on the menu. I went with the sweet and sour chicken which had a fresh taste, and it also did not weigh me down. The portion size was very big.
Highly recommended! I will return here at my next opportunity. The papaya salad is spicy and delicious, and the soy chicken is tender and flavorful. Truly exceptional.

Overall a perfect experience when trying new food! My mom and I loved the food here and we will definitely be going again! A friend of mine from school works there and they were able to help pick out some food that we will enjoy :) The restaurant was very decorated and I definitely felt comfortable being there. Shout out to my very good friend for helping us :)

Came here for Valentine's Day. The owners were so sweet, sending us home with roses and chocolate! The soft shell crab appetizer is fantastic - the batter is different than how it's prepared in a spider roll (which they also do well). Sashimi and rolls are well-executed without breaking the bank. Ambience is cozy and serene. Servers/staff have always been very thoughtful, like packing our leftovers as if they were a carry out order with extra wasabi and everything! Great spot for a casual date night.
I’ve came here three times for dinner and all three times the fish was super fresh and the prices were fair too! The third time I came in and ordered a lot and they gave me a free mochi so sweet

The food was excellent. The seafood was fresh. The dishes were flavorful. Authentic Japanese cuisine. Good size portions. Everyone was pleased with their meal. The environment was great and our waitress was lovely. A very pleasant experience.

I was debating between Vienna hot dog or tacos and I’m super glad I found this spot.

The four piece was of the chain!

The ramen soup was great to with some hot sauce!

But that’s just my preference I love hot food!

Definitely should try it out!

Got an Italian beef late night. Absolutely delicious. The chef was on par with the best restaurants of Chicago. Quick service and that beef was streaming hot….best way to eat it. I can’t recommend this place enough

Ordered through grubhub because they said they were open. They accepted the order, even had a status update that the food was on the way. Half an hour after the delivery window, still no food. Tried calling, no answer. When we did finally get an answer, the person on the phone was incredibly rude. Apparently despite being listed as open and taking the order, they were closed today. Nothing on their site hours, not bothering to turn off their grubhub, and complete lack of just basic customer service for their failings.
Homeboy hooked it up late at night. Bacon on the BLT was beautifully charred. Onion rings HITTTT!!!!! With the bbq sauce of course. Tip the man hard.

I ordered a gyro sandwich last night from them and it was a decent sandwich. The meat was warm, pretty fast delivery and was pleased with the taste of the meat. Usually late night deliveries the food is not warm and you can tell it’s been sitting there for hours. Will be ordering from them again.

DO NOT waste your money here. Got a chicken gyro plate and a chicken kabob plate. The first issue was the gyros were a weird combo of rock hard chewy. Second the chicken gyro looks like pre made slices a meat substitute and tasted as such. Very disappointing as I would be a regular if it were edible.

Came here for a vanilla latte and I received regular coffee with cream, I also ordered a egg & sausage and received no sausage but only egg and cheese.... Worker's here cannot follow instructions... I won't be coming back again.
Ordered a breakfast item. The clerk couldn't or didn't know how to make change. I was told to pay exactly or leave. First time that has happened.

Came here and absolutely the worth experience ever from manger Noel I was given old donuts where I asked for a refund and also given a drink that was terrible I finally received  a refund after  the manager being argumentative hostile and absolutely ludicrous over the money I spent I did have to contact the police department never go here
I stop by a lot because it’s by my job and the employees are all super nice and helpful every time

This Dunkin does whatever they want I have came here  a couple of times and times and most times I ask for hazelnut swirl in my coffee and they don’t put it in. The first time I let it go because I thought it was a mistake.  I also came in for hot coffee, cream, and sugar and they don’t put it in the sugar. I came in today and I asked the man at the counter if there is hazelnut swirl in my coffee and I’m tasting it and no hazelnut swirl.There is one person that got my order right out of all the times I’ve been here. I’ve worked in restaurants and coffee before and I understand that things can get stressful but we still pay for the extra add-ons to our coffee. All in all I’ll just find a better Dunkin’.

It is the first time that we bought here, it was a good experience, friendly staff, food on time and the best thing, the mac n cheese is delicious. If you are looking for a delicious mac n cheese this is where you should come… “Free Cookie with 💲5 Purchase”

It's my 3rd or 4th time here and my second time getting the pulled pork. So delicious is very filling! I got full not even halfway there. I believe they also gave a pizza flavor one that was very tasty. I don't recommend the froot loops shake I had last time as I wasn't impressed(if they still have it). I definitely recommend Joey's to everyone.

Here for the 1ST time i can't wait to try the "MAC & CHEESE W/ MILK SHAKE. Rep Christina is the best very sweet ❤. I've just taste the strawberry milkshake just horrible not strawberry flavor at all . Ordered Italian Beef Mac and my coworker got Veggies..THIS IS NOT MAC AND CHEESE PEOPLE IDKWTHTI waste of money but the GARLIC BREAD IS GOOD😬😔

Update: 8/9, spoke to the restaurant the day that I left the original review, they informed me they would refund me for the cake. It has now been over a week and no refund whatsoever.

Ordered tiramisu with our food,
1. This is very much not tiramisu, it’s got a strong rum flavor almost like rum cake and coconut in the frosting
2. It was moldy. Moldy in numerous spots, not on the surface but within the layers between the frosting and the cake. This is unacceptable to be serving moldy food.

After walking by many times, I finally decided to give this place a try. I'm so glad I did, because it was delicious! I tried the classic mac with added pepper jack cheese, and my mom who dined with me ordered the classic with no additions. We both ordered a small and it was plenty for each of us! Very generous servings. Cheesy and tasty pasta as well. We also tried the fresh cut fries and they were excellent! We ordered take out and didn't get dessert, but we saw lots of great looking cookies behind the counter. Next time I'm in need of comfort food I will definitely come back to Joey G's!

I recently moved back to Chicago and was so relieved that Soupbox is still around! Comfort food at its finest! Almost makes me crave the cold winter nights so that I can curl up with a bread bowl.

Delicious.

Great soup. Love their broccoli cheese and lobster bisque. I don't think you can go wrong with any of their soups. The grilled cheese and oatmeal cookies are perfect additions and good too. Delivery was great.
Perfect for a winter day! Soup was  flavorful and they give a lot. Loaf of sourdough only 2$! Definitely will be back , staff very friendly

Soupbox on Broadway has been around this 1996.  If your restaurant can survive that long on Broadway, you're doing a lot of things right.  Make it a point to stop by to say hi to my friends Dru and Jamie and their crew for the best soup around.  All homemade with the freshest ingredients, they simply have no equal.  Today, I had the Roadhouse Beef Chili and it actually reminded me of my Mother's Chili, yes, it was that good.  Love Soupbox !!
Soup and chili are absolutely delicious. My favorite around! Great service, employees are super friendly. Great soup selection. I highly recommend!!

The cashier Rich took our order he was very pleasant and he suggested two smooties for us the Tropical Passion with pineapple juice, and the Mango Madness they were both very tasty. We also ordered the turkey burger which was home-made and made to order definitely not frozen. With an order of the waffle fries which were a big enough order for both me and my fiancé to share. Thank you again Rich for a wonderful first time visit. We most definitely will be bringing our "good energy" back!!!

The cooks here are good.
Smoothies are yummm and pretty much everything I’ve ever ordered the 10+ years  coming to Jubille occasionally. I will say that almost anytime ever the cashier customer service most recently is extremely rude. Sunday I called at 7:15pm to order 3 things and the woman who answered seemed like patroning this business was a burden to her and rude social skills.  Like , hello.. I’m just trying to eat and help pay your hourly wage.

Omg, we wish we had took a picture of our food. But, that tells you how good it was. It taste so good we forgot. I had the philly cheesesteak on a bed of lettuce with ranch & it was soooooooo delicious & the Steak was soooooooo tender. This was all due to the efforts of the excellent customer service we received from the Cashier Rich. He gave a lot of options and suggestions and was very patient with us. Which all of his recommendations were on point and sooooooo tasty. He also suggested the Spinach & Strawberry salad with grilled chicken, we also ordered the Roasted vegetables, the Hummus plate, a Bacon Cheesburger with Fries to go for my Son & he also suggested the Orange Berry Dream Smoothie that was a Dream, lol (It was very satisfying & tasty). Everything was Excellent, I take my hat off to the Cook. I really appreciate all the help we got from Richard he was very personable, attentive but, he didn't pester us, and he went above & beyond to make sure myself & my Spouse experience was great at the restaurant. Please Don’t Lose Rich he's a true asset to your team and Kudos to the Cook, as well because everything was so Delicious. Being in CS I know Great customer service when I see it and I love to give praise when it's deserved and they earned it.

Love the fresh healthy food and fresh squeezed juices. My go to restaurant in the West loop hands down.  I work in the area and love the staff here too, they are always super friendly and accommodating.
Great smoothies. Totally unexpected because you're probably going to get something from their great food menu. Try a smoothie when you get there. I think you'll like it.
Ordered a medium fry and big mac and this is what’s I got. Food quality is poor and employees don’t care and give you anything. This place is trash. Will never purchase anything from them again.

Ordered an Oreo McFlurry and received a water bottle🙄 fries and nuggets that I ordered was super cold. I live around the corner so it wasn’t the delivery🤷🏽‍♀️. This places sucks, the people are super rude and offer such poor customer service. Sadly I will have to start ordering from a different McDonald’s.

I usually have a good experience at this location. However, this time they got my order wrong after I told them that they charged me incorrectly (I had a coupon for a free Happy Meal with the order of a combo meal). I have used this deal multiple times without issue, including at this location. They were out of all drinks except for water and fruit punch so I ordered fruit punch, but didn't get it. Got home and realized there were no fries with my combo. I really started to go back. I stopped at McDonald's for convenience, but this trip was anything but convenient!

Terrible experience! I have never felt so disrespected at any fast food restaurant!
They got my order wrong three times and was given incorrect change that morning; Causing me to be late for work. When complaining that my order was wrong, I was told by employees that I didn’t know how to order. And the manager accused me of getting the right order when I got nothing! I will never go to that McDonald’s again! Because of the hostile environment and unprofessionalism of that McDonald’s! I would not suggest anyone go to that McDonald’s! Good customer service there is Nonexistent! I wish I could get a refund of my time Wasted there! P.S. no sense in speaking to the manager: he got my order wrong too!😤

Honestly, I’ve been living in this neighborhood for 10 years I’m 43 years old every morning I come to this establishment these employees always have an attitude problem very unpolite these employees always give a nasty look to the customers not respectable very lazy and a light skin young man with the colorful hair very unprofessional. In my opinion I will get rid of all the females everybody and replace them with Mexicans or Palestinian. Or change the attitude problems, helping be more fishing and bring more black males if that’s the case hire more guys at this establishment because at this point these women are not doing a good job. Very entitled attitude, slow and very opposite. Appreciate it the job, but they got.

We had a great time,  very festive. If you are not up for a celebratory atmosphere this is not the place for you. It was very loud, we really could not talk at our table. The service was great the food was average,  the cost was exorbitant. We fed 6 people one of which just ordered white rice for $350.  We did have 4 drinks and a dessert platter which was $40. The dessert platter was not what was pictured and 4 of the pieces which where apple pies where deep fried but still very frozen in the middle. Very hard to eat. If you are going for a party and cost is not a concern I am sure you will have a great time.

This was our first time here. As soon as we stepped in, we felt transported to Mexico. The decoration and ambiance are right on point. The menu is vast and full of options for every kind of palate. We ordered the steak fajitas and cheese enchiladas with guajolote sauce. The enchiladas were a bit salty though (thus the star off).  The service was good. This is definitely the most Mexican restaurant in all of Chicago!

This place is AWESOME!! The food was great and service was wonderful. Our waiter Christian is a top notch guy who attended us with an awesome personality.  The band playing was great.... we felt like dancing.  It was great witnessing some birthday celebrations with music and sparklers. I was amazed with this restaurant.  I highly recommend MI Tierra to anyone and everyone. Thank you MI Tierra for a great meal and entertainment.

Love how much space this place has. Huge venue with separated area you can rent out.
My best friend's family chose this place for lunch. Our large party of 10 were seated with no reservation on a Sunday after Church. Another 2 friends showed up and were able to grab a 4 top nearby no problem. It was busy and getting busier throughout our meals.
Everyone's food looked so good and a table nearby had a Big Mug of a Michelada.
My Bestie and i were sad they did not have Horchata or Fresca....our favorites.
We were told the guacamole was not made fresh tableside and to be honest tasted funny which got me sad because that is what i always want. We stayed with the yummy free salsa. I shared a shrimp taco plate (3 tacos) personally was only able to eat 1 taco before i had to run off. I had to go to the bathroom to change a diaper. By time i ate my taco, the purple soft shell was soggy and falling apart. 🙈 I normally will give a 4 star for most places because 5 stars are for WOWing me. And because there is always room for improvement but My 3 star review is because everything i wanted horchata, fresca, tableside guacamole were not on menu and that is what i hoped for...and the one thing i ate was only ok. THE PICTURE OF THAT DELICIOUS LOOKING GRILL PLATE was the table next to me. 😭🤤😍🤦‍♀️ so maybe i will come back. But this place seems great for parties and special events.

Wonderful atmosphere, super friendly/polite staff, clean and food was delicious. They also celebrate birthdays, graduations and other special occasions. Been coming for years and was never disappointed.

If I could give them 0 stars I definitely would. I am not one to be mean but I ordered a burger with fries today and one of the fries was still frozen…. Also the cherry on top is I took a bite of my hamburger only to find a white string that looked like dental floss (not sure what it was) coming from inside the meat…… I will never eat a hamburger again.

One of the few resturants that come the downtown population full. Prices are reasonable the cook is excellent and the waitress was superb. Eating here at least 3 times a week rather it's breakfast or lunch. Definitely worth it
Hard to find. Food isn’t great, but quite possibly one of the most cost effective breakfasts/lunches in downtown chicago for office workers.

Today was a first for me. I ordered a breakfast sandwich and asked for my bread to be buttered and toasted. Well suffice to say the worker didn't do this. He only ran the bread through their toaster. When I stated that he didnt butter his demeanor shifted.
This employee spreaded butter on my already prepared sandwich.  So now my bread is soggy with the butter and the meat is saturated!! OmG!!
How unprofessional!

Not bad! This cafeteria-style lunch spot is more down-to-earth and less crowded than any Market Creations or the Chase Building basement cafe. It's all pay-by-the-pound, so be mindful as you scoop up a little spoonful of everything! All the food was good and very traditional - so it was perfect for even picky eaters.

My kids wanted fried chicken and we like to support small businesses and restaurants in the area so we gave them a try. We were not disappointed, the chicken was perfectly fried and very crispy, the mostaccoli had a nice red sauce with a kick and I had a hearty salad. We will be back!
Man i was looking for pizza joint and im glad i found this place super good and yes piña on it ... recommended 💯

We were seated right away but told it would take took 45 minutes for our deep dish pizza to be ready.  The pizza was undercooked, very bland and soggy.  The veggies could use some seasoning and the dough definitely needed some salt. The tomato sauce poured on top of pizza was tasteless and really made the whole experience unappetizing. $25 for a small pizza (6 cut) was too steep but am glad we filled up on cheesy garlic bread appetizer which was good.  Won't recommend.

I've been coming to this place for a while and I really like it. I enjoy the food and the very nice and calm interior to sit at while you wait. I frequently come here and I am not planning on stopping. Love the place.

This mom and pop place serves the best pizza on West 63rd Street nearest Menard street. It is a small world. The owners were familiar with where I once worked. The decor is simple but the food is their flair. Try the Chicken Parmesan. You will be surprised with the sauce.

If I can give this restaurant 0 stars I would! My husband ordered two horchata drinks that were suppose to be large and look like if they were a size small. We also ordered enchiladas that were suppose to have chicken and turns out there was no chicken and cheese only which we did not order. My husband ordered a steak dinner and the meat had no type of flavor and was also hard to chew. It needed to be cooked well. I will never come to this place ever again! First and last time.

Listen if you looking for some delicious food this place will leave you satisfied and stuffed. Everything was tasty the Salsas the Burritos and the steak was tender and juicy. Staff made me feel like I was VIP and we could not have been more pleased with our visit.

The meat used was not steak as requested it was some kind of beef roast.  When we called them they said only use arrachera when requested. Also ordered 1 veggie and one steak burrito, they miss labeled them. Will not be back.
now i understand why people only go there once! absolutly the worst. bad service. bad food. small portions.El milagro chips out of a bag?? Really?2 TBLE spoons of pot roast on a burrito!!? nasty.

Sick and tired of this place.  Too many times I've given it chances.  Too many times I've been disappointed.   Ordered a steak torta, EXTRA MEAT.  Looked like extra bread to me.  See the pictures for yourself.  This is one of many times I've gotten screwed from this place.  I took it back and got a refund.  Then I went to Taco Burrito King, got the same thing, and was very very pleased.  I wasn't pleased however, that I wasted almost an hour of driving back and forth.

Chicago Airport location -
The female clerk at the counter (on 9/21/22 approx 12:30 pm) was so rude I didn't complete the order. Lost some time, but took my business elsewhere.

Good salad with a wide selection of dressings available. You can also do a build your own salad if you like to customize things. Typical airport prices, but no worse than anywhere else. Friendly service!
Ingredients were not fresh (I could taste the preservatives in the apples) and they left the chicken out of my salad.  Will not be returning.

I have had salads from this Saladworks location about three times because it is definitely a healthy choice. The ingredients are typically fresh and their dressings tasty. It is clean and the people are friendly. I have had their Mongolian Chicken Salad. I’m only giving them three stars because their prices are a bit high for a light salad and because when I asked them to change one of the ingredients (I asked them to replace their noodles for mushrooms) they didn’t tell me they were going to increase the price. I found out when I checked my receipt after paying a bit more than $11 dollars for a salad. I will come back though because it’s one of the healthiest choices at O’Hare.
biggest rip off on earth. had a salad here during a lay over a few weeks and i’m still mad about it. tiny salad for $20. awful. literally order from a vending machine you’ll be better off.

Papa Chris’ has been at this location over for 35 years and we know why! The food is sensational. I got the gyro plate and my aunt got the gyro sandwich. The portions were generous and tasty. I had enough food to bring back home for another meal. The decor inside makes us feel like an old school Chicago place. Right off of Touhy Avenue, this is an easy location to go to. We will definitely be back soon. The staff and owners are great!

Was in Skokie at the Backlot Bash. The band I wanted to see ended and I was leaving, while walking to my car, I checked Google maps for "gyros" and this was the place that came up. High rating, close to where I was, easy drive. Sold.

Google maps was not wrong. Very good gyros. Very friendly people. And the view from my table was cool too.

Will definitely come back if I'm in the area.

Great food, cheap prices, fast service and excellent staff! Also probably only place you can get hotdog and fries for under $5

Ordered the special of the day Fried polish
Excellent job for lunch today.  Always a pleasure dining here with Papa Chris.

I saw this on TV, Chicago's food to go, so glad we decided to try it out, friendly family  take care of you and the food was yummy. I had a francheezie, wow it was good and the onion rings were huge crunchy yummy rings, best I've had in awhile.  Its right across from the leaning tower, we've  passed by so many times, now we'll be going back, they have a huge menu, they have curly fries I'll go back to try too..

I'll be brief: The food at CS is good, but the restaurant is missing an absolute necessity, and that is a public bathroom. One can't wash  his or her hands, or do anything else done in a bathroom. I asked about it and was told to use the restaurant next door.
I am not going here again, and you shouldn't either.

The food at China Spring has never been great but its been adequate and the lunch special has been a pretty good value.

But today when I stopped in they could not be bothered to make me pork egg foo young. Through out the Covid pandemic I have supported this business, but I guess they just don't care.

Also they have increased the lunch special prices and eggroll or soda no longer comes with lunch.

Never going back again and I let them know that, they didn't seem to care so that shows you have much they value their customers.

Decided to grab some quick takeout from here since we’re closer to this place than others in the neighborhood. Placed and online order, went early to pick it up within about 10 mins and they hadn’t gotten the order “till we walked in”. The food was sub par. Chicken wasn’t fresh tasting, shrimp with vegetables was slimy and soggy, and the rice was bone dry. I’m sick to my stomach the next day, worse than I’ve been in a looong time and that was the only new food I’d had all day.

Ordering: personable,  and easy to understand( I can be demanding)😤.  Food:Orange chicken so danged fresh,  vegetable fried rice not too oily, dry and steamy to perfection. Egg rolls had great flavour.  Xl Portions were enough to feed myself, my hubby, my son, my sister and her baby. Twice.  For under 35 bucks.  Speedy delivery.  Best in the area, hands down.

This restaurant was taken over by a new person and this evening when I went to pick up the things I had ordered, she(the new owner) was very polite  and greeted me with a smile; unlike the ex-owners of the restaurant. The last time I went when the ex-owner was still in position, she barely even talked to me and just asked me for the money, but this time, the "new" owner happily greeted me and politely asked for what I wanted/how she could help me with.

IDOF is one of my go to place. I love the falafel
Bowl but the staff at this location sucks. In a bowl they wont even give you half a bowl and if you ask anything they will make a face. Other location’s are so good and serve well

This particular location has friendly staff that will get you in and out with a quickness. The Falafel's were delicious! Moist, fresh, and bright green on the inside. This is a great quick stop for a yummy lunch with healthy options.

Sooo delightful chicken Kebab,  juicy with the perfect body of flavor.  The wrap tastes better than a burrito and it is healthier.  Or you can get the chicken Kebab in a plate. Also the spicy level is adequate  (spicy tomato recommended). Music is so cool (indie rock) we should have some middle east music perhaps.

Oh my goodness! This is an amazing little restaurant with very friendly staff.  I ordered the chicken salad and added olives... it was simply amazing. Highly recommend stopping in for a falafel and some baklava too!

I'm not the biggest fan of Mediterranean food so the first time I came here I didn’t give it a good rating. I recently returned with a friend and got something similar to what she had and the food was delicious. It’s similar to Chipotle in that you can build your bowl. I don’t eat dairy and they had a nice of variety non-dairy foods to include in the bowl. The food was a bit salty but it may be what I put in my bowl. I recommend checking this place out.

LOVE this brunch spot! The Nana's monkey bread is to die for! My mouth is watering just thinking about it. They have awesome Bloody Marys with a great garnish. They have this creamy hashbrown side dish that we couldn't stop talking about, everyone at the table loved them. Friends loved their omelets. I can not stress it enough, GET THE MONKEY BREAD. It will change your life.
I grew up on Chincoteague Island VA but this is the best Fish I have had since I have moved here over a decade a go. There fries were awesome as well!

It's a small cozy place. The staff was friendly, but after a few mistakes on their part their attitude wasn't the greatest. My party ordered 3 rib diners and 10 minutes later the manager came by and said they only have 2 left so someone had to change their order. Soon after she changed her order they brought only hers out and the rest of the party's food was not ready yet. The beers on draft are delicious and very fresh. I had a burger with ham and bacon. It was supposed to be medium-well but was well done instead. Besides that the burger was delicious. I would rate this place a 3.8/5

This is a nice, casual neighborhood spot with a good patio during the summer months. The food is good, if uninspired. Brunch has vegetarian options, although not with many vegetables. The veggie burger for lunch and dinner is a good. Beer selection is decent, with a selection of the standards and some craft brews. Service was friendly and prompt.

Dunlays has an awesome ambiance. Great for families, a date, or if you just want to grab a quick bite on your own. Portions are nicely sized, and the service is great. It's also one of the few spots left in Logan Square that don't get incredibly swamped with people. Would definitely recommend the Amish chicken and ribs. Bacon potato cakes are insanely flavorful and delicious.

Amazing food! These employees have a natural aptitude for cooking. If you think that you have tried everything on their menu then think again because you will be surprised when they tell you about their off menu items. Ask for Jahannum Burger.

I arrived at the restaurant looking for some good halal food i heard about this place from my friends and was recommended as the best burgers and pizza in town. So when i got there i found them to be very friendly and good service and the food was of the hook very good spicy mulana burger so big and juicy i will go again
Moulana burger is amazing!!
Sadly this placed has closed down.
it is close!

Huge potions. Big menu. It will take time to read it and order. Best crab rangoon. Friendly staff. Street parking. Wheel chair entrance available. Perfect price for what you get. Very popular among students. Restrooms available. Best sizzling chicken.

Ordered Lo mein on a Sunday night extra spicy veggies only no meat. The dish virtually had no flavor was pretty dry so not nearly enough sauce. It wasn’t spicy AT ALL just had an extra amount of dried chili peppers. Would not recommend.

The food here is always fresh and tasty. Huge serving size so the price is worth it. However they have a horrible atmosphere, they are so stoic its borderline rude. Ive eaten in once at this location, now I get my food and go. Honestly they don't seem to like "other or different" people. Everyone had different experience so if you like their menu I would suggest at least one try. Or a different location.

Chinese fusion restaurant your wife would like to spend money for. Not just “no cooking time” but also “it’s quite good!” However, if you think about paying $60 for the food(picture attached), I would invest the same amount of money to an authentic steak house. (Oops!) Long story short, your wife will love the food so you will be anyway fine. Enjoy Joy Yee tonight, my friends.

This place might be an overrated restaurant that serves tapioca milk tea and too bad noodle soup. I think the problem is they have too many items on the menu. Why would I come to a Chinese place to get myself Pho, Ramen, or any Korean or Thai cuisine? They may have some excellent chefs who can cook everything here but believe me, no one makes sushi better than a Japanese sushi chef. Quality is always over quantity. First of all, the bubble milk tea was over average as the Oolong and the green tea they were using are high quality, I think. However, the tapioca pearl itself was disappointing as it is tough, and not sweet. The Matcha drink and Avocado Custard Pudding Freeze were tasteless and terrible, respectively. There must be some other places in Chicago serving better tapioca milk tea. Second of all, the cane shrimp turned out pretty delicious. It was not too sweet as I was worried but tasty. The food was served five to eight minutes after ordering. Third of all, the noodle soup here was horrible. I have always kept in mind that the Chinese have great noodle soup. Thus, we ordered Free Range Chicken Noodle and Fishball Egg Noodle Soup. The broth is literally, definitely poor, bland, or no taste at all. No savory, no salty, no sweet, nothing, plain just like the boiling water of everything existing in the bowl. I was sure that the egg noodle is the noodle that is made with egg and wheat, yet the one we got was confusingly white and clear just like the white rice noodle. The price I paid for two bowls of hot noodle boiling water plus a dish of sugar cane shrimp was $38, not reasonable whatsoever. Probably, the food was better in the past as many of its customers said, though, the food quality of this very moment is destitute.

Eduardo's has a wonderful atmosphere, very warm and welcoming. The aesthetics are fantastic, it's a great place to enjoy a meal. Service was terrific, the staff was super nice and friendly. They gave me a great wine recommendation.
I ordered the Lemon poppy bucatini, it was good but not great. From the description, it sounded really good and it just wasn't what I expected. I enjoyed my meal and had a great experience nonetheless. I will definitely be back and try the pizza next time.

Fun people watching walking by outdoor dining to Gold Coast and from Rush Street. Patio is nice and dog friendly. One of few places open on Monday w 25% off wine bottles.  Salad of asparagus, snap pee and mint yogurt was excellent. Pizza was fine. Service could be more helpful.
Very decent place. I used to go Marios table(opposite from the street) a lot, but now I prefer coming here. Pizza options are sufficient. Appetizers are refreshing and tasty.

We were really disappointed. I've been to Eduardo's in the past and have always ordered takeout, but this past Friday night was enough to make me not want to come back. Homemade pasta is amazing and you can't beat their bolognese, but its not worth the absolute annoyingly horrible service we received during our last visit. After being sat and clearly waiting rest of my guests I was not offered anything to drink aside from water that was already on the table. I had to get up and ask the manager for wine. After that, my server was constantly bothering me for updates - clearly no understanding of social queues. Once my friends and I were all enjoying wine we were told we only had an hour left at the table (mind you, the restaurant was empty aside from us). But we get it, Friday night and a small restaurant so we ordered quickly. Once complete, they rushed the check and wouldn't even let us split evenly three ways (annoying). THEN, with maybe a few sips left in our wine glasses our server said we had to get up and the next party was there to sit down. It was a SHOCK when we saw only one of the next fourtop was there and could have easily waited another three minutes for us to enjoy our last sips - the restaurant was only about half full too. Our group frequents local Gold Coast restaurants monthly and this one is coming off the rotation. I'd rather go to Mario's where they treat people more like guests than a table to turn.

The manager was the BEST(I realized I never got her name). BUT She was so sweet and welcoming while giving us all of the best recommendations. It was our second time there, and will certainly not be our last! They surprised us with some strawberry gelato for our 2 year anniversary (which was absolutely delicious). Great pizza, great environment, amazing people! So happy with with our experience
Reasonably priced, wait times are ok during the day and if called in but the chicken is the best part- freshly cooked and seasoned very well no matter what time of day. Pleasantly surprised!

I just opened my order to eat and discovered that the shrimp was raw uncooked and taste bad. That’s the first shrimp i ate that call my attention to check and everything was raw. The lady are always good and I gave them good tip sometimes but this time the food was raw.

The cashier was pleasant, but my shrimp were terrible, the breading was falling off & they were not large as I ordered + they  chicken wings were very small & they were only 5. For what I was charged for the dinner I would think because of the small size your store would've at least given at least six. 🧐 I was once a loyal customer before the pandemic the food & device were Great, but not on my last visit😑 I will not be doing business at that location in the future☹️

I started going here when they first opened many years ago.  Over time they have really gone down hill.  I ordered the (two) 3 piece specials and the cashier rang it up as a 2 piece. She did apologize and said if I wanted the 3 piece it would  be $2 extra. Np.  Paid the extra $2.... Got home and both order was missing the 3rd piece. Called to notify them and was told to come back to pick up pieces that were missing. Went back to restaurant and the cook or whoever he was argued and said he included the pieces. After adamantly, telling him that they were missing, they finally gave it to me.  Long story short, order at your own risk and check your purchase before you leave. As for me, I'm never going back.  BTW, I should have listened to the customer who was leaving before I ordered when she said I'm never coming back here.

I was a hungry after work. The grill was down, but the lady waiting on me took care of me. I ordered the two fish sandwiches. She made them for me. Sandwiches were great. Nice pieces of fish, tender! Mine you, this was 7am!!

Food is absolutely delicious. Great combos. Miso soup (spicy) is a hit. Make a reservation to be sure to get seated but if you go early enough you should be fine and able to be seated at the sushi bar.

The only reason I took one star away is because we ordered the jumbo rolls but they didn’t seem wrapped tight enough and most times came apart at first grab. This, of course, did not affect the taste, but made it a bit more work.

Enjoy!

My husband and I came here to celebrate my birthday. The service was great and the  rolls that we ordered were delicious. The Boy Meets World jumbo roll was in fact a jumbo roll. It had pieces of mango, along with tuna, in it that gave the roll a perfect taste. We also ordered the La Vie in Rose - a sweet potato roll with avocado, cream cheese, and spicy mayo…AMAZING!

Came here on a date and really enjoyed the experience! Surprisingly the sushi tastes (almost) as good as it looks. Also loved the spicy miso soup, octopus balls, and dumplings. Only wish they had more alcoholic drinks and better lighting for pics :)
A super unique (and tasty) sushi option in Chicago! Is it the freshest sushi in town? Probably not, but it has to be some of the most photogenic. Would recommend!

Yuzu surprised me because I really thought the food would knock me off my feet...unfortunately it did not. I've had better sushi in the city. The display is obviously a huge attracting factor to this restaurant and rightfully so. The sushi looks like artwork. I think also Instagram definitely made Yuzu Chicago famous.
